Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for Price”
Reviews.Author: aeneener
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere with friends for my 21st Birthday. We checked in and from reviews I thought it would be run down. It was really nice. It was clean and the casino was nice. So was the bar. The Back Ally, and the bartender there was AWESOME! He was a lot of fun. And remembered us the 2nd and 3rd time we came in. They gave me tickets for free drinks at the pool, except the pool wasn't open the entire time we were there, which sucked. It wasnt extremely warm but it would have been nice to have the option of a pool. The rooms were nice, a little small but for the price I guess thats what you get. Room service was good and every one was nice. THE BIGGEST THING is how far from the strip it is, which i knew was going to be an issue anyways. The deuce is alright and kind of cheap but it takes forever. All in all it was a nice hotel but if you plan on drinking a lot and going on the strip stay in a hotel closer, that is what I am going to do next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sratosphere, a bit tired and in need of update.”
Reviews.Author: tavellingzebra
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere Hotel is a little way "out of it" compared to the others on the strip. All the Hotels are much the same inside with Casino, Bars, shops and restaurants, but this one is lacking a little and is tired and in need of TLC. It was the 2nd cheapest on the strip, out of the well known Hotels (circus circus was the cheapest). If I visit again I would choose a Hotel more centrally located, but having said that, the room was clean, air con, spacious, clean and modern bathroom, shower over bath. Venetain and Ceasars were much more opulent and classy, but this one is good if its a cheap break you are after.

Reviews.Title: “First time.....A Charm”
Reviews.Author: Christopher L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect choice for your first trip to Las Vegas, NV. It is centrally located at the north end of "the strip", but I say "centrally", because even north of that is the Original Las Vegas (downtown). The Deuce is a saviour as it stops right in front of the hotel and is available every 8 minutes or so, going in either direction. The service is not indicative of the immense size of these Vegas hotels. It is warm and personable. The only drawback was that the closing time for the pool is 6:00pm. Otherwise, the property was immaculate, and our trip through Southwest Airline Vacations went off without a hitch.

Reviews.Title: “review of stratosphere select room”
Reviews.Author: lucapi
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights last week in one of their renovated select rooms. you can immediately feel the difference from the other "older" rooms in terms of corridors style (carpet, wall, lighting), interior elegance and bed quality. the rooms have been obviously renovated with a dose of style, but i found unbelievable that they have done absolutely nothing in protecting their clients from unwanted noises coming from the other rooms or from the corridors. the insulation between the rooms is poor and you can hear the other people doing their activities both in the bathrooms and in the room; the insulation of the door is also poor and noises of all type come inside. also, there is no refrigerator inside the room: this is a pity since you are in a big, hot, dry city and maybe would like to drink something while in the room. the bathroom is ok but i suggest to pay more attention in the deep cleaning of the sink. the bed is super comfortable, really good with a lot of pillows. the morning sun will not disturb you a lot; you get a good protection from the curtains. the internet access is paid @ 12USD a day but quite fast and reliable. the elevators are a big number of 8; this will prevent you from waiting more than 30 seconds to get one. the hotel registration desks are far from the elevators and you need to be prepared to handle a big queue at all the hours. also, the walk parking-registration-elevators-room can take about 10 minutes (but the park is free!) the position of the hotel does not pose a threat if you have a car of are prepared to spend a quite on taxis... walking around to the strip center zone can be long but not dangerous if you are aware of your surroundings and act wisely. there are some people begging around the area but simply ignore them and continue straight on your way. the guest of the hotel get free access to the tower which is a nice gift since paid access would cost more than 10USD. from the tower you have access to a big panorama so please bring your camera. also, here, be prepared to handle about 30 minutes to get to the top because of the queue. at the end of all, the hotel is a big bargain, especially during busy vegas times such as trade shows. i would reccomend to anyone, if you bring ear plugs to sleep well during the night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eplpaho
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel. Nice pool area on the 25th floor. The tower was quite amazing. A drawback that you have to pay for internet. Since I'm no gambler I would recommend non-gamblers to not spend more than one night in Vegas. This is what you need to see Ceasers Palace, Venetian etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of timeshare reps at info desk”
Reviews.Author: stevey55
Reviews.Content: I was approached by a timeshare rep for diamond resorts at the front info desk, complete waste of 4 hours, walk away from them and use your time doing something else. The staff at the restaurants are rude, the rooms are old, dirty, and have terrible bathrooms. Beware of the timeshare reps trying to sell you hard on buying into their scam!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - best price for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Angelique B
Reviews.Content: My partner and i travlled from Sydney to Vegas for our anniversary last year and we got one of the top suites for only $100AUD a night! it was amazing the room had a spa and a very comfortable bed - the pool was great but had a few kids in it for Vegas. I know its a little bit further out but you can walk down in the day or catch the shuttle a taxi is only $5! The food is also really nice i would definately stay there again - get the suite with the spa its fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: westlawnpaul
Reviews.Content: From the get-go I knew this hotel was something different. It's sandwiched between the strip and downtown. Perfect location for those who plan to take in ALL Vegas has to offer. On site, this hotel has everything to make your stay fun and comfortable. Fitness center. 8th floor pool. Mcdonalds. Starbucks. General store. There's a diner called Roxy's that's open 24 hours and has something for everyone. Me and my girlfriend filled up on the extreme grilled cheese and footlong hotdogs for twenty bucks. Not too shabby for good eats in Vegas, at your hotel no less. Oh, and the waiters and waitresses sing to classic tunes as theyre serving you. Not to mention, I was insanely impressed with how in tune the waitstaff, hosts, bussers, servers were. Never missed a beat, everyone was hustling as it was ten on a Saturday night. Ike, our waiter took our order, committed it to memory, and rocked the place. He wouldn't be out of place on American Idol. The casino is on par with other Casinos in the area. I don't really gamble all that much, but some of the slots seemed a little loose. For the discerning gambler, that's a good thing. The tower is ridiculous. Really, really awesome. If you stay at the hotel, admission is free. (you pay a resort fee of $7.50 per day, which gets you unlimited tower admission, pool access, and fitness center access. Most hotels in Vegas charge upwards of $20 for the resort fee and you don't get the Stratosphere tower anywhere else) The general public pays fifteen bones for that privilege. The view from the top is out of this world. 360 degree view. All of Vegas. Outstanding. Have a drink with New York Tom (even though he's a Yankees fan) at the Skybar on the 107th floor. Great, friendly bartender who gives the type of service you don't see too often nowadays. Extreme rides on the roof. Yep. Three rides that need to be YOU TUBE viewed to be believed. $25 bucks and you can ride all day. Oh, and they're open 10am-1am, so it's really ALL DAY. If you've got the guts, the Skyjump (a nearly 900 foot freefall off the side of the tower. YOU TUBE this also) is well worth the $110 it costs. One of the best and most insanely fun things I've ever done in my entire life. The rooms are all recently renovated. In hotel years that means they've all been done in the past five years.. The bed is perfect. Bedding, fantastic. The bathroom, ample. Room was sparkling when we entered. Theres no fridge, but you don't need one anyways. Seriously, when did people start thinking that all hotel rooms should have a mini fridge? Make a Southside cooler. That is, fill your sink with ice. Or go downstairs and buy some grub at one of the bazillion places. Ihop is a block away. It's all good. The most insane thing was the service. Two of the five days we were there we spent most of the time at the hotel. At all the bars. In the casino. In Roxy's. At the pool. In the gym. Top of the tower. Skyjump. Riding the rides. Everyone was so friendly. Tom at the Skybar. Dave at the Race and Sports bar. Buchizya and Robert and the whole team at Skyjump. Even the housekeeping/janitorial staff would say hello to us. Everyone seemed like they were having fun. Very rare too see nowadays amongst the corporate landscape. Give them all raises, Stratosphere, cause there is no doubt that I will be staying at your hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: DandKtravel
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Startosphere and did not regret it, We were worried about the location being to far away from the center of the strip as we generally stay around the monte carlo area. But taking the deuce bus did not make it a problem, it was no more than a 10 min bus drive. Also since we were down the far end of the strip there is a 7-11 in behind the Stratosphere that sells alcohol quite a bit cheaper than the rest of the stores on the strip, CAUTION, I would not go there at night again it is really sketchy and creepy. The buffet is an excellent deal with the deal you get with your ace play card and quite a large selection, I loved the omelet chef, delicious!!! The other restaurants were a good price too. The room was one of the new remodeled Select rooms, the bed and pillows were soo comfy I could have stayed there all day (but had other things to do :)). The pool is quite large and lots of chairs The only downsides are the internet fee and the drink service.There were not many waitresses and may have only got a few drinks, they waitresses were mostly at the tables so we went to Mermaids most nights, they come around for your second drink before you are even done your first done. The $12 fee for internet which we did not pay, but really for the great deal we got on Expedia for flight and hotel combo we really could not complain. Check out was fast and easy, stored our luggage with the bell boy while we did some great outlet shopping

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied!!! You spend cheap, you get cheap!”
Reviews.Author: travelerEastStLouis
Reviews.Content: My stay was disappointing but the staff was ok. The rooms were not what I expected. Some of the outlets didn't work and the remote only worked when the switch on the wall was in the on position. I went through 2 remotes before the maintenance crew told me that. No microwave, coffee pot or refrigerator in the rooms. Too far from the other attractions on the strip. And there was a charge for the internet. Glad I brought my own. Then after all that the housekeeper damaged my laptop. They refuse to be liable for the situation.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: vonnyDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the Stratosphere recently and enjoyed every moment . The rooms were quite large and the beds were extreamly comfortable. The room we were in was only newly decorated and everything was pretty new. I enjoyed breakfast in Roxy's Diner every morning and we ate in Fellinis Italian Restaurant on one of the nights. The food and service was excellent. All in all I couldn't fault the hotel. The only drawback was it was a bit removed location wise from the strip itself. Would definately recommend if you didn't want to be in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Totaly renewed! The price is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: rodjuca
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because it was one of the less expensive on the strip and we loved! The rooms are very clean and new. No need to stay in any other hotel in Vegas. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Top class stay in LV”
Reviews.Author: Thijs107
Reviews.Content: At the end of the Strip, but great views, wonderful service and excellent beds! Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but they Charge $12 for Internet”
Reviews.Author: A T
Reviews.Content: My advice: Instead of paying 12 dollars for internet, stay at a better hotel with free internet. Also, it took 45 minutes to check in. All of the people in line watched people finish checking and the people working the register end their shift or take breaks with no one covering for them. That seems pretty annoying but I can understand that attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Get the room with a strip view!”
Reviews.Author: MIssJennCA
Reviews.Content: The hotel was VERY basic. Beds were comfy and we got to see people doing the sky jump out the window which was cool. Also had a nice view of the strip. The main perk of staying here is the tower access and discount on rides at the top. The view up there is absolutely amazing!!! Level 107 lounge was a perfect spot to have a martini and a great time. When you stay here you end up taking a taxi to most places or it is a very long walk.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice before wouldnt go again”
Reviews.Author: tracematty
Reviews.Content: Think the hotel is quite dated and a bit tired.The location of the hotel is now run down and quite deserted. i missed Luckys restaurant, Roxys really didnt do it for me...

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer41-43
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Stratosphere on 3 occasions, each time for 14 nights. The rooms are large and comfortable, and we always get a good nights sleep; ready to hit the Strip in the morning after a good breakfast in the dining room. Very friendly, helpful staff;always ready with a cheerful greeting and excellent service. The trip to the top of the Tower always worth it, with fantastic views of Vegas and great thrill rides....if you dare. For eating, there are several restaurants, as well as the Buffet, always worth a visit. We would always book this hotel as we have never had any complaints. Look forward to the next time, when we hope to celebrate our Golden Wedding anniversary September 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Road Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights, great deal for the price, couldnt ask for more to be honest. The location is the only drawback with this place as its quite a steady stumble back from the main strip area at night. For the price of a taxi you could just stay nearer the centre. But the casino area is good, well layed out, not outrageously priced games, had the buffet here which was awesome value. Free access to the sky bar area is a bonus and a must see! Probably wouldnt stay here again if returning to Vegas purely for the location, but a great resort none the less at a price which was too good to refuse

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lmr1121
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Strat in February of 2011. The hotel was clean, check in and out were efficient and relatively painless and the view from the top fantastic. The location was walking distance to the main strip area or an easy car ride. The bus (we took the bus several times) was easy to pick up. I found the price to be reasonable. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A quick trip to Vegas but a long walk to anything good”
Reviews.Author: Flair4GoldBranin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Stratosphere before, about two years ago. Things have changed. First, the Stratosphere is about the only thing remaining on the north strip. The Sahara has been closed, a large scale resort/casino has stopped construction and there are two large empty lots between the Stratosphere and Circus Circus. Therefore, it is a very long walk to any other decent casino. While in Vegas, the news was saying that the north strip is dying, and I couldn't agree more. Although the Stratosphere has nice rooms, comfortable beds, etc . . the distance and walking makes it a problem for those who want to explore other casinos without having to take $20 taxis everytime or randomly and full buses.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean with good price”
Reviews.Author: thekellys5
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Stratosphere late on a Thursday for one night. Check-in was quick and easy and staff was very pleasant. Our room was on the 20th floor and had a decent view of the Strip. It was very clean, the beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was a nice size. We missed going to the Tower unfortunately due to arriving so late and everyone was so tired and then they didn't open until about 2 hrs after we were checking out to drive to Zion NP. We got a good deal on the rate thru Expedia for 2 adults and 2 children. Would recommend for a nice, slightly above basic hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Hotel - Go for the Rides Not the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scsherie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stratosphere in the past and it was a lot nicer. While the rooms have been remodeled and are nice, the place itself has really changed. The staff was rude from the minute we checked in to the minute we checked out. You can get a very good deal at this property on rooms but I would not stay again. There did not seem to be much in the way of security this time. The parking garage was a bit daunting. The hallways in the hotel reeked of marijuana and it was loud. You can hear everything in the rooms next to yours. They have a resuaurant there called Roxy's Diner which is actually pretty good. The waiters sing and it is 50s themed. This is the only hotel/casino where everytime I am there, there are people off the street trying to sell you things, like club passes, etc. Very shady. This time when we went one of the pools was closed for remodeling. It didn't look like any remodeling was going on. The kids liked the rides at the top of the tower. There is a roller coaster and a couple other rides as well as bungee jumping. There is a mall in this hotel that is rather large which was nice. There are several shops from vegas souvenirs, an oxygen bar, pizza place, an arcade, clothing and shoe stores, little markets, etc. It is a good deal for what you get. This hotel is a bit off the strip, but not too far. I wouldn't recommend walking in this area as the surrounding area is a bit shady.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler5388
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Stratosphe on Tuesday April 17, 2012. Wednesday while at he convention center all day, I returned to find my makeup bag had several missing items (eye shadow, powder etc). Friday April 20, 2012 I returned to my room to find 3/4 of a bottle of vodka gone. It was a new bottle. For some reason I had to have security unlock my safe on Friday, as the our digit code I had been using was no longer working. The safes are VERY small, so if ou have anything larger than an iPad, it probably will not it in the safe. Disappointing as this is, to top it off, I had left a tip for the housekeeping staff as well. So whom ever took the items from my room also drank the vodka and got tipped for it.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TinManor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel in Las Vegas for one night and found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable and was probably the best nights sleep we had on our entire holiday. The tower was a great experience too and overall this was a lovely hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise for the price”
Reviews.Author: Alisontheroad
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for the price and clientele was pretty normal by Vegas standards. The bar on the 107th floor is definitely worth a visit. For some it might be a little far from the action but it was around $10-$20 taxi fare depending on traffic and destination to downtown action. Being tourist from Oz we were happy to walk the length home from down town strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Casino at the quieter end of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: S7evieboy
Reviews.Content: If you want a slightly quieter Casino, on the strip, with an awesome restaraunt on top of the world- you've found it. Clean, less expensive tables compared to some other big casino's. The bar and restaraunt at the top of the tower give some spectacular views of nighttime Vegas. Meal superb. Downside a bit isolated from the strip with Sahara and the hotel next to it closed, but take the 24 hr bus pass $7 and go up and down the strip as much as you want. Avoid the Internet cafe opposite as I used them to print my boarding passes and felt ripped off. Roxy's Diner is cool, with staff bursting into song every so often, good standard too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Alina C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas just for one night, and Stratoshpere proved to be the best choice for that price, not to consider also the free entrance to the tower, that is absolutely fantastic. The basic rooms are large and comfortable, equiped with all the necessary things, but the bathroom is a bit too small.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: bhameagle
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the end of trip. Did not really check out much of the hotel. Wanted to use the free trip to the top but it closed before we got back to it. The room was large but very basic. The toilet sounded like it was ready for lift off it had so much pressure on it. Anyway for a in late & out early stay it was very well worth the $40.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Vegas tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: T-birdRick
Reviews.Content: stayed on the 15th floor for 3 nights, Room was very clean, spacious and inviting. flat screen TV but limited channels, good water pressure and plenty of hot h2o. Excellent location if you have driven to Vegas. The parking garage is tight but easy to navigate and is a short walk if you use the elevator. Good central location with easy access to the city without getting trapped in the strip traffic of Las Vegas Blvd which is horrendous. My complaints are that the walls are thin so elevator noise is a concern as my room was next to them and one morning the next door guests were hard at it. I tried twice to go up to the tower to enjoy what I have been told is an awesome view but its like going to an airport security check with even longer lines. give yourself an hour just to get to the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Nottingham_tourist
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights in a suite at the Stratosphere. We (a family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers) all liked the Strat. Our suite was very pleasant, the pool was better than we'd expected, the eating choices were wide ranging and good value, and the view from the top of the tower was awesome. However, as others have said the Strat is quite a way away from the centre of gravity on the strip. We had a rental car, but I guess for those without a car it wouldn't have been the best choice. For what we paid for our suite (less than £100 for 4 people) I think the Strat is a bargain and we'll probably stay there again the next time we go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Original experience :)”
Reviews.Author: Topolinco
Reviews.Content: Spending a night at the highest tower of Vegas – why not ? :) The price is good and it is also one of very original option to stay at acceptable price The guests can go on the top free of charge and the view is really amazing and the elevetor very fast :) You can even try bungy jumping form the top or taking a trill ride at the top pf the tower it is only for the people with extremely good nerves I was trembling only by watching people doing that staff :) Nice hotel, a bit far away from the Strip- it is actually the last one so if you want to see the most famous once you will have to take your car

Reviews.Title: “No bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: marine1967
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Stratoshpere Hotel, Casino and Tower the last two times we travelled to Las Vegas and find it comfotable. It is lacking in all the high priced bells and whistles the "luxury" casino resorts may have, but the rooms are comfortable, the food is excellent and the gaming (though we are not whales by any means) is fair. Like other casinos, the drinks on the gaming floor are fairly watered down, but you can request a stronger one. The "shows" this year left a lot to be desired, Some may like them, but they were not something my wife and I were interested in. The last time we were at the Stratosphere, the show was excellent so I am assuming it is just when you go. However, if you are into thrill seeking, the Stratospher is the place. Having the roller coaster and other rides at the top of, and extending over the side of, the tower there is plenty of thrill for anyone. You can also, if you wish, jump off the top of the tower. The rooms, as I said above, are clean and comfortable and fairly priced. For as little time we spend in the room, the cost and the room were awesome. The staff is always courteous and friendly. If you are not looking for high priced amenities, but instead a fairly priced and very nice place to stay in Las Vegas, I recommend the Stratosphere.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Natal, Rio Grande do Norte, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Luiz C
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but a little far from the main part of the strip (15 usd cab). It's located in the middle of downtown and new strip, good if you visit both. Fair cassino, cheap blackjack tables, cheap bar (comparing to other Hotel Casinos), nice and clean rooms, nice water pressure, fast checkin and checkout. I enjoyed it, but would have prefered other Hotel Casinos due to proximity. Free access to the tower presenting hotel keycard is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresentation : Don't Stay . Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: onelegkick
Reviews.Content: Let me be crisp : If there was rating below Terrible, I would have rated it. I was organizing the family vacation. So had a week stay in Vegas and searched for the best value hotel for 4 rooms. And decided on the Stratosphere in Vegas after seeing it on the web and also booking through a hotel booking website. I purchased 4 rooms supposedly as the acknowledgement said : TOWER DELUXE ROOM Let me list why I said to not recommend the Stratosphere a. Tower Deluxe Rooms? You gotta be kidding me. All our rooms were on low floor b. Rooms paid and confirmed were small for a supposed DELUXE ROOM. More like a size of a MOTEL ROOM c. The room was so small, the size of the window was only 2 standard glass panel. d. The Windows opened up to a some internal airwell. (TOWER Deluxe Room? ) Maybe I am not a native english speaker - but we all use the same English Dictionary? TOWER? Deluxe? e. Had to pay the Unavoidable resort fee. BUT you get NO common courtesy items in the room like a coffee pot or a hotwater kettle. The room was BASIC. Queen Size bed. A small bathroom. No FRIDGE, no wireless access. You have to pay for that. Other negatives : Far end of the strip. Its really the LAST hotel on the strip FAR FAR AWAY. Playing the casino games - one would think service will be good with waiters coming by to ask and serve you drinks... No. you have to wave at them and you should sooooo lucky if they spot you waving. I think my odds to get blackjack was higher than having a waitress see you. Then you had to TIP the waitress whom YOU ACTUALLY HAD TO WAVE TO, to get their attention for drinks. Unbelievable. My suggestion- for the same price range, stay at the Circus Circus. We drove there, found out how lively it was. Despite what people say its crowded, at least, its well maintained have good service. And best of all, it has a counter that sells discounted show tickets. Stay way from the Stratosphere and oh... the Tower Access to the top? OVER HYPED !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: OldSchooler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Thursday night before the Holiday. Check in was a bit slow. Had two strip view rooms. Really not worth the extra money, but could see the people jumping off on the free fall. nice TV and bathroom was adequate. Only negative was elevators got crowded. Free access to tower was a factor in staying here, the view from the observation deck is beautiful in the evening. Gaming downstairs was pretty good with 5 dollar single deck blackjack. Decent onsite shopping with some good cut rate bargains. Also decent was food and drink in the same area as the shops. Kids had a good time at the arcade. Just don't go exploring outside if you are not used to the big city, the area surrounding the Strat is still ghetto. Had a cool taco shop a couple of blocks north if you want to take the risk ! I can easily recommend this place for a day or two if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Misreprestation a very poor experience”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a long weekend so that I could watch the Masters and my wife could use the pool we could then take in a show in the evening and generally have a good time. The price looked good at first until they added resort fees etc and then wanted extra for a fridge, internet (per device) etc etc. The TV was not Hd and the picture was unwatchable, we were told at check inb that the pool was closed !!! But that there was a second pool on the 25th floor which was the same size so we stayed. When we checked out the pool the next morning we were horrified, it was the size of a backyard pool and was completely packed, it was unusuable. There was nowhere to sit even if you wanted to. We had been totally misled and immediately checked out and asked for a refund (which was not given)

Reviews.Title: “Decent room. The rest was....”
Reviews.Author: Dubbelsac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here St. Patrick's Day weekend, rooms everywhere were pretty pricey and availability was an issue, so we stayed in one of the newly renovated strip-view rooms. The room was decent, although the entire hotel/casino is poorly ventilated. The casinos all have smoking, but you can walk through the Wynn or Venetian and not tell unless you're next to smokers, the smoke just sits over the room here. The location was awful. The service was sub-par, especially at the front desk. Even the cab drivers said that the place was sketchy! Two separate cab drivers told us horror stories of people they or their co-workers have picked up, and given rides to, who have robbed them! Perhaps because of its location, it tends to attract some of these less than desirable folks, I don't know! Tower was fun, great view, fun spot to drink. There are MUCH better spots than this, and what you save on the room, you'll spend in cab fares.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Suite, quiet with very nice bedding and large bath.”
Reviews.Author: atarnove
Reviews.Content: Very quick check in with friendly helpful staff. We booked the room with a third party and got a great rate plus we were upgraded to a suite. Many rooms have been updated and I think this is well worth the small upgrade. The casino was fun with a very good live band on Saturday night. This hotel is near the end of the strip but very good for a little fun and a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: helb167
Reviews.Content: stayed here in 2009 as part of a tour group. the room was huge, 2 double beds, nice clean bathroom with bath and shower over. the sink was just outside the bathroom door but this didn't bother me. i had a room at the back of the hotel overlooking the car park but you could see mountains as a backdrop. the casino was fun, used some of the fruit machines and won the grand total of $2!! had some drinks from the bar which were reasonably priced. ate breakfast in the all you can eat buffet restaurant. there was loads to choose from, even mash potato!! what i had was delicious and well cooked. also ate in the diner looking restaurant, this was lovely, well cooked and lots to choose from. every now and again the waiters and waitresses would stop what they were doing and sing!! great fun and great food. the hotel itself is set at the far end of the strip but its easily accessible. it wasn't the best area to walk around in the dark, especially on your own. as a tour group though this didnt matter to us. the tower that is part of the hotel is good, great views of the strip and beyond. i went to the tribute show in the hotels theatre, this was really good and had some good acts. the shopping area in the hotel had a variety of shops. i would stay here again but i think maybe somewhere nearer to the strip would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously? This is as what I get for a renovated room?”
Reviews.Author: Echo924
Reviews.Content: You do get what you pay for and you will end up paying more. Location: Bad. At the end of the strip and it's not near the other hotels. It is on the strip because it shares the same road. BUT it is NOT on the strip as you would imagine it-- i.e. you think it's just at the end of a chain of hotels and casinos- again it is NOT. Add in the cost for a cab or the bus, plus the time you have to spend waiting for the bus back and forth to your hotel. Room: Disappointing. I opted for a renovated room they call the 'select'. To my horror, the room faces a parking lot! So, okay not all rooms are created equal, so I asked if I can be moved to a room NOT facing a parking lot. Sure enough, it costs another $20 per day to change to a room NOT facing the parking lot. Bathroom: Disappointing. They said it was renovated, yes the sink is renovated, the toilet seat for sure looks old. The shower, looks old as well, the bathroom is barely lighted. The renovated room itself looks good, don't get me wrong. But the bathroom, not thrilled, the location terrible, and rooms with parking views?

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller0636
Reviews.Content: For what we paid this hotel was really worth it. The swimming pool area was nice although a 5 minute walk from our room so ask for one nearer if you intend to use it. The walls were on the thin side but we didn't have noisy neighbours so it wasn't a problem. We stayed in the cheapest room available and the window was on the small side but we didn't spend much time in our room anyway. The room was a good size and cleanliness and facilities were absolutely fine. If we went to Vegas again we would definitely stay here again if the price was as good as it was this time.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tsericso
Reviews.Content: We had a great time everyone from the front desk to the bell hops were helpfully and great to deal with. We stayed in a oasis suite that was nice large spa bathroom it was hard to get my wife out of the bath tub. Also the Bellman Songhai was awesome he brought our bags to our room the spent about 15-20 minutes explaining every amenity the hotel had to offer and what hot spots we should check out. Thanks fro a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: magedmonton
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere offers excellent food. We had the pleasure of eating in the Top of The World, absolutely fabulous view and food. The Italian restuarunt also was an excellent feast, but make sure you are hungry as the servings were very generous. The buffy was also excellent. The room was spacious and very clean. The room was amazingly quiet considering we were there during spring break and the halls and casino were full of drunk young people.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jenny J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several trips. I find the staff pleasant, courteous and helpful. The rooms are clean and well kept. The Roxy Restaurant is a fun and reasonable place to eat. While the hotel is at the north end of the strip, the Monorail is just a short walk and is reasonably priced to use.

Reviews.Title: “a little dated”
Reviews.Author: TeessideViewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 21st floor of the Stratosphere in March 12 for 7 nights. The room was dated and backed on to large air con units which went off and on all night. Although the hotel is on las vegas boulevard its away from hustle and bustle of the strip. If you shop around you can this hotel at a good price. A must do is a meal in the Top of World tower restaurant, it will cost you but its a once in alife time experience. We were in a party of 4 so it was cheaper to get a taxi to the strip than walk to the mono rail. Parking in garage is free which was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: lostinatlanta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 3 nights primarily because of a great deal I found (3 nights for $120 - total). The room itself was clean and the bed was comfortable but dated and could use some updating. The hotel itself really does need to get updated. Whereas the hotels on the strip have a promenade filled with high end stores, the Stratosphere had one filled with no-name stores and had a feeling like a low end community mall. The casino seemed subjectively to me much more smokey than other casinos which make me think that they need to upgrade their ventilation system. The only benefit for staying at the Stratosphere is that you get free entry to the observation deck which saves you $16 per person. If I had to do it all over again, I would have rather stayed on the strip and spent a little more money for the convenience of being in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: bigtripper06
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere has the best comps in Vegas hands down. I've been here for 10 nights for free. Half the hotel has been renovated and I'm on the renovated side. I've stayed on the unrenovated side and those rooms are dowdy. The staff is great. The location is at the end of the strip, but if you know your way around vegas and how to use the Duece, it comes right outside, you won't have any problems getting where you want to go. Last year I spent a week at Mandalay bay, the opposite side of the strip and felt ripped off. The room rate was high and you were stuck basically eating there, unless you wanted to walk 10 miles. My favorite part of the stratospher (aside from the comps) is that there is a McDonalds on site. It's not for everyone, but when all you want is a snack - it works! When you come in comped (and it doesn't take a ton of play to get comped here) you are checked in as a VIP at a special front desk. You are assigned a host (ours is Ron) and when we checked in there was a huge box of chocolates left in our room. I'm not a high roller by any stretch, but the fact that they treat even their yearly regulars so well will keep me coming back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel, bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: KSud
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 double rooms through booking.com for an incredibly cheap price! On arrival, we were told that they only had smoking rooms left for the standard of room we'd booked, but that if we upgraded, we could have non smoking... At first, I thought this might just be a way to scam us into paying more, and perhaps it was, but either way, we upgraded (only an extra $15 I think), and our rooms were fantastic and still great value. We were in the Select rooms, with a view of downtown, but not the strip. Each room had a king size bed, TV (strange selection of free channels though), wardrobes etc and en suite bathroom with jacuzzi tub. Everything was immaculately clean and tidy, though one room had quite a weak shower head. The hotel offers a great cocktail hour in their tower bar with views of the strip - but it gets very busy, so beware to get there early or you may not get served in time. The downsides to this hotel were that the wifi was extremely expensive for just 24 hour use (we just didn't bother using it - there is free wifi at some of the other casinos if you need to check email or anything) and that it's quite far from the main action of the strip even though it is on the strip technically! We decided to walk to the main part of the strip one night and it took over an hour! There is a good bus service which is better value than taxis, but can get very crowded and slow. Overall, this hotel is great due to the clean rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Twenty one years on Daddy's nickel.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtex
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the strat. We got suites and they were large with great bathrooms. The jacuzzi tub was a one person deal. Went up in the tower and the view was amazing. The 8th floor pool was good for naps and reading in the afternoon. Good split between downtown and the strip. Bus service was slow especially late at night with a 1 hour wait and went with taxis after that. $12 will get you anywhere. Make them drive on the strip it is cheaper. Overall a good 4 nite stay.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: keith o
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the stratosphere 4 days and 3 nights, their "select" room, although it didn't face the STRIP, was well appointed, clean and roomy. The beds were good, the bathroom was above average in size and overall, the room was very nice and comfortable. Having read reviews previous to our visit, we were a bit hesitant to book there, but I think they've got it right, now. There's lots to do there, nice clean restaurants/shops/pool areas, even the casino was well kept. Would definitely stay there again. Staff was courteous and attentive. Id give it 5 stars if the location was closer to everything else on the strip. Not a bad price for the rooms, either.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas in March”
Reviews.Author: Connie D
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very clean and the rooms to be nice size. We would not, however, eat at Roxy's Diner again. The hotel staff was very helpful and knowledge about attractions. We used the valet service and found all of the valets to be personable. Each time we picked up the rental vehicle, we were asked if directions were needed.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great stay here!”
Reviews.Author: scotsman2011
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Las Vegas and we have stayed in the Stratosphere every time, we really like it here. The 'select' rooms are wonderful, really comfortable, spotlessly clean and at under $40 a night Including resort fee, is well worth the money. Cassandra Blackwell who is a hotel supervisor is wonderful. I have contacted her numerous times with questions and she always writes back to you quick, thanks for all your help Cassandra! Also at check in we were dealt with by Lisbertha, what a really nice person, thank you! We ate in Roxys and at the buffet in the hotel, really enjoyed both as usual !! Location is not an issue for us, after an evening down the really busy strip, people everywhere and getting pestered by people trying to force these cards in your hand we find it so relaxing to get out of that environment back to a nice relaxing atmosphere and comfortable hotel. Cant wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, could do better.”
Reviews.Author: WideEyedLondon
Reviews.Content: First impression when you walk in is that it looks dingy, the casino area is just too dark. They could help themselves a lot by brightening it up a bit. At registration they speak 100 miles per hour and subsequently you spend longer going back over what they said. The room on 8th floor - a newly refurbished select room - was comfortable, clean and spacious. The view from this floor is a blank beige wall which was disappointing, apart from sleeping we were not often in the room but a view of any kind would be nice. Everyone we dealt with were friendly and helpful. You can get the Deuce bus down to the main part fo the strip but it stops very frequently and it is only a 30 minute stroll down to the Mirage (half way to the other end of the strip) - taxi cost $10. Views from the tower are great and it was woth going up just to see the rides and people jumping. The meal at the revolving restaurant (Top of the World) was ok but overpriced on quality but it was a nice experience, although you can easily walk around the tower on the floor above. Nice to have access to the tower included in the cost of the hotel room. A big redeeming feature of the hotel is the cost - very cheap. The hotel experience overall was ok, but they could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent”
Reviews.Author: macdragin
Reviews.Content: Remodled rooms were very nice. The 2 for 1 in the lounge 107 was not limited to bottem shelf liquor. We drank top shelf. Yea Ha. The casino for us was same as any other casino. We are not gamblers. Con's 1. Doors for rooms close very loud in hall. Could hear people coming and going all night 2. Wall were paper thin, could hear the people in next room word for word! If you wife is a squeller have something to shove in her mouth ;) LOL

Reviews.Title: “good room very clean”
Reviews.Author: lionelbjornson
Reviews.Content: we stayed here only once but had an excellent time here.good variety of restaurants .good sevice from the people on the floor but the negative is that its at the end of the strip and you need to take a bus when ever you go out to the main part of the strip

Reviews.Title: “ECONOMIC AND RIGHT ON THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: metalcuban
Reviews.Content: Is a cheaper hotel but excellent position in the north end of las vegas strip..Nice Chinese rest inside but the top is the rotatory rest in the tower,,U can see all Las Vegas from the tower... I complaint about the shower and they send the chief eng to help me,,,It was nothing wrong with the shower just that I couldnt figure out how to turn in on Beautiful Wynn hotel across the street...Be advised U r on the north ends on the strip..

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3trvlrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in March 2012 on the 15th floor. The room was clean, beds great, bathroom was nice. We arrived a couple hours before check in time and they were very nice about letting us check in early. There were no luggage carts to assist with bring luggage in or out; no micro, coffee maker or fridge in the room; and the thermostat could not be set lower than 68. Although 68 sounds cool enough, it was a very warm 68 even for March. This hotel is at the far north end of Las Vegas Blvd. and not within walking distance to the other hotels on the strip. Overall, I would say it is average but not worth staying at unless you are wanting free admission to the tower. The pool looked nice although it was closed when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Valerie D
Reviews.Content: Took my Mother for her birthday. The rotating resturant is a bit overpriced for luke warm food. Everything is ala carte so beware a diner for two can cost you over 100.00 w/o drinks:(

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sidyngreenstreet
Reviews.Content: Recently I traveled to LV for a relaxing break. I pre-booked the Stratosphere Hotel and discovered several disappointments with the service, rooms and overall experience. Firstly the service - I booked a deluxe room with a king bed and was given 2 queen beds. I asked for refrigerator and discovered that would be an additional charge. The room smelled of smoke butt asked for a non-smoking room, another disappointment. I was given a room on the 24 th floor and the noise level was not acceptable.(doors slamming, loud voices(ladies of night) and even barking! Overall experience - Sitting at the bar I was approached by several ladies of the night. I went to the security kiosk and stated my claim. The security station was not interested. He stated that its a normal situation. I would not recommend this hotel for any family or business person. Next time I would book a classy hotel outside of the Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Only visited the tower...did not stay at the hotel, eat or visit casino.”
Reviews.Author: MomOf2OKC
Reviews.Content: The tower has awesome views! We went on our last night of our Anniversary trip. Pictures were kind of hard even with a Canon DSLR, unless you have a very expensive camera. I got some good ones but not a lot. The bars that keep people from leaping are in the way and they will not let you take a tripod up so don't carry it with you. I was a little upset because we didn't buy our photos they took of us, I gave the lady our email address and she said we would be able to online when we got home....which was not the truth. I called and they dont' even do that, so we didn't get the fun pictures they took of us before we went up on the tower. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great, casino very smokey”
Reviews.Author: JeanBP
Reviews.Content: We was on the 20th floor, great view of the strip, nice clean room, smelt good. Casino was very smokey, made my eyes burn.

Reviews.Title: “Long walk down the strip and lots of smoking”
Reviews.Author: timdoody
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend. The hotel itself is very good, rooms are big and clean and we had a view of the strip and the tower. The location on the other hand is terrible. Its a long way down the strip from the main action and the walk is dodgy especially at night. A taxi down to the Venetian area costs about $12 which is a bit pricey. My other complaint would be the level of smoking in the hotel. I myself smoke but never indoors as I'm from a country with an extensive smoking ban. The air in the casino was almost impossible to breathe but this applies to pretty much all the casinos. We were staying on a non-smoking floor but there were people smoking in the corridors and by the lift. I think this is unacceptable and management should have a tougher enforcement policy.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable place to loose money”
Reviews.Author: Carrie M
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is basic as far as Vegas hotels go, that being said it frees up more money to play! The pool is nice and the view from the tower at night is awesome. I would recommend this hotel for people who want minimal frills with their hotel and are coming to Vegas to have a great time not pamper themselves. The pool bar makes a yummy strawberry cucumber mojito that I'll be craving all summer long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: LiamGo
Reviews.Content: The best value for money i've ever had with a hotel. great service, restaurants, rides and rooms. I am not saying this is the best hotel in Vegas, but you will not find a better mix of service and affordability. It's at the end of the strip, but buses run from outside every 15 minutes. they run 24 hours a day, going solely up and down the strip and it costs about $6 for an all day ticket. I would stay here next time I visit vegas, which really is the biggest compliment you can give.

Reviews.Title: “clasical and modest”
Reviews.Author: tevel
Reviews.Content: worm and clasical by the and of the strip but close to all the attractions. not expensive but very good food and worm and clean room// good service

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Location!”
Reviews.Author: DodgersMom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Stratosphere before, but have noticed that it's going downhill as of late. With the closing of the Sahara, it's become very isolated from the rest of the Strip. It's unsafe and impossible to walk anywhere at night because of the unsavory people that hang out outside- and now inside of the casino. In all of my trips to Vegas, I have never been approached by a panhandler on the casino floor before. The same man that approached me also approached my husband and would not leave him alone. Casino security was nowhere to be found. Our room at the hotel was OK. There was not a stand to put our suitcase on. Only 2 towels in the bathroom. Stale smoke in the hallways on a nonsmoking floor. The bed was hard, but the pillows were OK. It's definitely a no frills establishment, but the price was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie M
Reviews.Content: Huge Hotel with everything under the sun!!!! There is a roller coaster on the roof top. Staff are friendly and pleasant

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ShariR
Reviews.Content: Our room was average. The one good thing about the room was it was on the 22nd floor and we could see the strip and people jumping off the tower from the sky ride. If you want to upgrade to a jet tub you can not smoke in your room. Thats a big deal to me because i smoke and at Bally's you can have a jet tub room and smoke in it. I got a horrible rash All OVER MY BODY!! I have stayed in Vegas before and never got a rash, I stayed in Cuba and never got a rash, i stayed in Freeport, Bahamas and never got a rash. They advertise unlimited to go to the tower. I guess i didn't read the fine print. I thought that meant unlimited rides up there. Of course they aren't included. For the first 7 days there we would go to the bar to get a tea and a water. The charge was $2.50. Then on the 7th or 8 th day. The bar charged me $5.00 for a tea and a half bottle of water. My husband told the bar tender the water is free. He said you HAVE TO BE AT THE SLOTS FOR IT TO BE FREE. WHILE WHY IS THAT NOW? HE HAD NO ANSWER AND so we went to put in a compliant. We went to the front desk.The manger of the front desk was really nice and GAVE US 2 WATER'S FOR FREE and sent the food manger to us. He was like YA, THEY CAN GET FIRED FOR GIVING YOU FREE WATER. YOU COULD BE A PERSON OFF THE STREET. WE HAD SHOWEN THE BARTENDER AND NOW THE MANGER OUR TICKET FROM GABLING AND ALSO WE HAD BEEN PLAYING ON THE SLOTS FOR HOURS AND NOT ONE WAITRESS HAD COME AROUND. THE FOOD MANGER WAS LIKE OH, WELL, SUCKS TO BE YOU! AND SO, I SAID I WILL BE PUTTING THIS ON THE NET. WHEN WE WERE WALKING AWAY.. HE WAS LAUGHING AT US. It's not the money, its the point either the water is free or not. I GUESS THE MANGER AT THE FRONT DESK SHOULD BE FIRED TOO CAUSE SHE GAVE US FREE WATER!! So, the next day i phone the manger of the hotel to tell him what went on with the water and the food manger laughing at us. I told him how i have this RASH ALL OVER. I was pretty sure they advertise that they have a doctor on the place. I asked him if they have a doctor and HOW MUCH WOULD THAT COST? His repley DO YOU WANT AN ABULANCE TO COME SEE YOU? SO, THERE IS NO DOCTOR BUT THEY CAN CALL 911 FOR YOU!! How rediculious!! Ya, i want an abulance attentent to look at my rash!!! Very poor customer service!! I would never stay there again! I DON'T RECOMMEND STAYING THERE! IT WAS VERY DISAPPOINTING!

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary & THEFT”
Reviews.Author: Drose88
Reviews.Content: I'll just start off by saying how angry I am! Avid NASCAR fan, drove 15 hours from Washington to stay @ the Stratosphere. I booked my deal via Orbitz a month in advance. Two rooms, one deluxe & we paid $60 to upgrade one room to the new & improved "Strat Select" newly renovated? yea right!! Checking the record, their most recent renovation was in 2006! So right off the bat thats fraudulent advertising. Specifically noting that I wanted a King smoking room... I called two times just to confirm my king bed & smoking room. I was told not to worry, it was set in stone. I check in @ 3am, exhausted, only to get charged an additional "resort fee" of $40 and I get sent up to my room that had 2 queen beds opposed to the King I booked, no ashtrays, it was also a non smoking room. Keep in mind, I upgraded this room because I wanted a view, I got one all right! A view of the parking garage! I slept it off for the night and confronted the front desk the next morning, only to be told " we don't reserve king beds".ok, whatever, just give me a smoking room! I get the smoking room & it's equipped w a king bed, go figure, the original room I booked. I get to my new room, unload my belongings & set out to the parking garage to realize I left my phone in my previous room on the night stand. Frantically, both my boyfriend & I ran up there to try and get in to our old room. Housekeeping was cleaning the adjacent room at the time, barely speaking English she told me she could not open the door because I had to key, understandable, I run to the front desk, at this point I'm missing my race that I drive 15 hours to see, so I am far from happy! Front desk gives me a key, I go up to get my phone & it's not there! We spent 2 hours searching and tearing the room apart. Double checked all out things just to be certain before accusations were made. Taking this issue to security & being very firm, they sent a crew up to investigate before a claim could be filed. The lady who did the search found not only an un sat room, but a bra under our bed!!! Surely it was not mine! She ordered the room to be pulled due to lack of their health codes. Now my $600 iphone4s with all my photos from my stay was hot in the housekeepers hands & the room I just spent 2 nights in was deemed un healthy! Upon checkout, I spoke with their hotel lead and he assured me I would be reimbursed for those 2 nights... I guess we will see beings I just checked out today. As for the phone & my sentimental value... It's at Risk management level & after reading all these bad reviews, I'm concerned I will see no resolution. ={ Hate Stratosphere!!! New update; Sent a claim to the LAS VEGAS poilice dept. Risck management was a joke. They tell you they are here to help you and will do their best to resolve the issue, yet the wait for you to leave to tell you, their investigation was closed... I was informed that there is a Nevada state law protecting hotels & their employess from being held responsible for theft in your room. Housekeeping was seen on film going into my room IMMEDIATLY after I asked her to let me in, yet she cleaned nothing!!! riddle me that batman! Case is NOT closed on my behalf, I will find justice one way or another. If your thought process was like mine, and your looking to book a "cheap" hotel, pay the extra $ and go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis Suite at the Strat!”
Reviews.Author: tickerlock
Reviews.Content: Pictures are worth a 1000 words right? I have plenty to show. There's most good in this review, but there ARE some, eh... not so good. We'll start with the bad. Cable TV, Sure, if you want to watch the news or sports all the time. No Nickelodeon, No spike, no disney, there is live feed of the Sky Jump, but, really? maybe 20 channels with only TBS and USA to rely on for late night tv. Internet is, "Only 11.99 for 24 hours" HOLY CRAP! At that rate, its 359.70 A MONTH! OUCH! Facebook can wait! There is a $7 a day per person "resort" fee, But that gets you unlimited tower rides, unlimited use of the exercise facility and pool. Uhhh, for that price it SHOULD include internet! (its included at the Riviera) There was some "strange" hairs on the pillow cases, and whats a nice way of saying this...... A "curly" hair on the front side of the hot tub, a more of a "private" hair that SHOULD NOT have been there since it was just cleaned before we checked in??) There is no microwave in the Oasis Suites. Beds are king size and plenty of pillows. GOOD water pressure in the shower. Low flow toilets concerned me at first, but, it all went down ok.. lol.. in room safe is pretty easy to use, once you read the directions. The pool was NOT heated. Plenty of lawn chairs on the 8th floor outdoor pool to tan on, life guard on duty. Pool is open from 9a - 6p. Room service IS available, but.... its SPENDY! Couch, micro-fridge, two flat screen tv's in the Oasis Suites. The suites are worth the money during the week only, but weekend, like everywhere else its more. The Oasis Suites remind me of... The Hyatt. But that is ONLY speaking from experience of the Oasis Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Another great week!”
Reviews.Author: 4chrome
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Stratosphere during Nascar week for 2 years in a row now. This year we upgraded and we were on the 23rd floor with an AMAZING view of the strip! One of the best things about this hotel is it's size. Distance to the parking garage, check in, elevators, and street entrance are all very close compared to other hotels. And the bus stops right in front of the hotel...in both directions on the strip...very convenient. We ate at Roxy's and the buffet (improved over last year). We took a short cab ride to the Boulevard Mall (less than $14.00). Rented a car for a couple of days at the Budget desk at the hotel, also very convenient. All out encounters with any hotel staff were very helpful and courteous. Tip for everyone: Upgrade to a higher floor with strip view. And: You get what you give...be polite and courteous and you will have a great time at the Stratosphere. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Last Good Deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MarcosF123
Reviews.Content: The STRATOSPHERE Hotel still one of few that still offering Good Rooms for a Reasonable Old Vegas Price , you can find a Room for U$ 40s & U$ 50s , ATTENTION : ask for those : REMODELED Select Rooms . The Hotel is Locatesd only 2,5 miles from Caesars Hotel & Bellagio Hotel , at the same Las Vegas Blvd. . So , if you have a Car , why NOT save some Hundreds Dollares for Shows , Drinking , Night Live ,etc.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way, but a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: KelownaDiver
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere has gone through an extensive upgrade, and all the room's and casino look great. Great service from everyone in the hotel. The "c' bar has a great special from 5-9 at the bar. Pay 20 dollars, and enjoy all the beer, margaritas, and martinis you can handle!. The buffet was one of the best i have enjoyed in vegas. Easy to catch the bus up the strip, or to freemont downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice visit to the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: paulobster
Reviews.Content: Yes- we know that the Stratosphere is not luxurious end of the strip but we think the service, ammenities and value easily make up for its location. We find the rooms very comfortable, the staff accomodating and a good mix of dining and gaming choices. Here is one example of their service from our last trip. We were looking forward to a burger at Roxys Dinner after our long flight in and got ourselves seated quickly. After putting in our order, an alarm started sounding. It went on and on although no staff members seemed unduly concerned. After a while, the manager came to our table and said whatever was causing the alarm had slowed down his kitchen, and he did not want us to have to wait. He then led our large part of eight to the buffet and comped the bill. I didn't get my burger but I did enjoy a nice dinner at a great price (free!) This is an example of the customer service we enjoy at the Stratosphere and something unfortunately getting more difficult to find in the mega resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, closer to the older Fremont street”
Reviews.Author: 50opd2j
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for a few nights, the service was pretty average and getting to our room wasn't explained to us very well. The rooms are actually in the building beside it not the actual tower. The rooms where very basic and old, it appeared as some rooms had been renovated but not the one we got. The pool is a small size compared to the amount of rooms, the tower entry came free with the room. OK if your on a budget and get a really good price

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service A+!!”
Reviews.Author: IM10-32
Reviews.Content: We traveled from 3/4-3/8/12... Lori checked us in, and was very polite, and informative. We didnt take the upgrade, but got a decent view. (22nd floor/north tower) Weather was high 60's low 70's and one day it was so windy, rides were shut down on the tower, stoplights were blown out, alot of accidents!!..crazy!!... this was my 3rd visit to Vegas in 2yrs (1st time at Strato)... and again i wasnt dissapointed. We are very simple people, as long as the room is clean, bed comfy, were good... your not in your room much anyway. Every hotel employee we came in contact with was polite, not rude at all... I was even impressed on how nice the gentleman was who emptied the ashtrays around the slots. The shoeshine guys even teased us... we liked the customer service there. I found an Iphone by the slot machines, and turned it in to the check in counter, and the lady thanked me, and was on the phone with security (to advise them) b4 i walked away. (i hope the owner got it back!).. I did however observe several rude and demanding guests, and wondered where some peoples manners are. Maybe i didnt have any problems because in my line of work, i know how to talk to people..??? Please and thank you can get you further, these people are working to provide for there families, there not ur slaves, so lighten up. One of the tvs in my room wasnt working right, so i advised the lady at the check in counter. We forgot to take the 'do not disturb' sign off our door (we clean our own room, just change out towels) so the tv didnt get fixed, which was no biggie, we had the other one.. it was our fault, not hotel, cuz they did leave messages. This isnt a 5star hotel, nor do they claim to be... it is older, but ive been in other casinos on the strip, and i had to make sure i got my own beverage b4 sitting down to gamble, because I NEVER got served anywhere!! The cocktail waitresses here were on top of it. Made a lil small talk with em, and they kept me hydrated with plenty of barley n hops..lol.. We actually had more fun in the Strato casino than anything!!..Im there to have sum beer and gamble (spend $$), n relax.. not a shopper, i can do that at home. So to us, it was fine. Im from the midwest, where the type of clothing you wear, or the car you drive, or how deep your pockets are, doesnt make your status of who you are, your in Vegas people.. if your not a celebrity, no 1 cares who u r.. LOL... How you treat people, is who you are. So if your expecting the Ritz-Carlton, dont go here... go pay big bucks down the street. The neighborhood isnt the greatest, but no1 bothers ya.. i had more beggars in the bigger casinos than here.. kinda shocked me. Dont get cabs, take the bus.. its cheaper. This time we did rent a car, used it a few times, besides the bus.. We like Freemont Street, so this was closer for the bus, and I dont drink n drive (I'll lose my job), so very convienent takin the 10min bus ride to Freemont. We even got a free bus ride to Freemont St, cuz the machine in the bus wasnt working to get us a bus pass!! We even joked with the bus drivers. Roxys Diner has a bfast special ($6.99) from 2a-8a, ham/eggs/hash browns/toast... very filling n good. The wait staff there was exceptional.. We didnt eat at the top of the world restaurant, not into food that cost an arm n a leg... i like good food at a decent price.. (Toby Keiths in Harrahs)...We ate at the buffet in Strato, it was ok... not bad. Mcds is in the Strato, so thats what was for bfast in the mornings..lol.. Nutn like a coke from there.. YUM! ... Brad from the bar near the entrance of the casino here was great. He was funny, and very attentative to us. (btw, $20 all happy hour 6-9p, martinis/margarita rocks/draft beer) We only came across one grumpy security guy who searched us b4 going up to the observation deck, we had to chuckle at the poor ole fella!! I believe he was irritated at the wana be princesses in front of us in line..lol!!! This is only from my experience here... I was concerned with all the bad reviews, but it really wasnt that bad. If you are a mind your manners, and respect others n have a drink n a good time, than you will def have fun here... we did ;)

Reviews.Title: “Less than Stratospheric”
Reviews.Author: desertstella
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the uptown area of Vegas, but my family members selected the Stratosphere, which is the last big casino hotel before you get into the older, downtown area. The area around it is kind of economically depressed. Currently, they are in the process of remodeling all their rooms, so when I booked, I had to select "Remodeled" to ensure I got a room that had actually been remodeled, as opposed to one that had merely been "refreshed". I booked through Orbitz, but on the day of arrival, I realized my itinerary said that I booked a deluxe room. I spoke with a representative at Orbitz, and when we arrived, the front desk clerk was helpful in getting us into a remodeled room. She neglected to mention that it would no longer be a King bed, but 2 queens. The hotel was full up for a racing event, so we didn't even bother to try to change it. The A/C would only go down to 68. Most people sleep best at around 65 degrees. Although we had the fan set to blow continuously, we would wake up sweating in the middle of the night. Mind you, this is during a season she overnight temperatures drop into the 40s. Our relatives were in a refreshed room that had the old-style in-wall A/C, and said they were comfortable. Probably because those blow air into the room, whereas the new A/C had one vent blowing straight across the windows. We could hear everyone in the rooms around us. Even walking down the halls, we could hear snippets of conversations (and other things) going from the closed doors. The casino itself is very smoky in comparison to most uptown places, and forget about finding a server to bring you drinks! It was at least a half an hour to hour wait every time. Compare that to the Luxor, where the server came by every 10 minutes, and always had a refill without our having to ask! But, on the second night, we started hearing scrabbling in the walls, and the sounds of claws getting caught in the carpet. We were in the last room on the end, and it came from the wall opposite our neighbor, so, unless the ice maker was trying to make a run for it, there was at least one rodent in the walls. I would call this a dive after my experience there. The only plus was the Mexican restaurant on the restaurant floor - realy authentic and delicious food!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FedericaRoma_Italy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Stratosphere Hotel for 7 nights in February 2012. It was not my first time in Las Vegas and I decided to stay here because they offer very cheap daily rate ! We decided to stay in th selected room (renovated) and all the furnitures are modern and new. In the hotel rate was also included unlimited access to th Top of the Tower. But in the Hotel there is not free wi-fi! We arrived from Italy and it means two long flights (1° flight: 9 horus and 2° flights: 5 hours) and jet lag (9 hours) and so it is easy to understand that we were tired and we might have appreciate a friendly welcome at the front desk. We booked and pre-paid to selected rooms and the lady at the front desk said " we didn't have selected rooms available for tonight". When I said that we don't have only a reservation but we had paid for the rooms and that we were tired (I was not friendly, honestly), they gave us two selected rooms. When we walked in, one of the two rooms was not clean! They forgot to remove from the room all traces of the last occupant and put it in order for us, with the bed freshly mad up with clean blankets, lines, etc. Then I need to came back to front desk and ask for a new selected room ! They had another selected room maid up ... but the lady at the check in said ... not selected room available for tonight... uhm?????? Management and staff at the front desk is unfriendly to any complaints. Anytime I called the front desk or go down, they didn't care about my complaints or try to resolve it. In the next days our complain was always the same "please, don't forget to maid up the room". Housekeeping need to understand how they need to work! They clean our room bery quickly and everyday we need to go to the front desk or call down to have extra clean, fresh towels and ... Also the carpet leading to the rooms was dirty all the week. One day I asked to the housekeeping manager to came to the room and I showd her that it was really dirty and I was not crazy! I suppose that the problem was that the comunication amongst the staff wasn't existant because my complain was the same all the time!!!!!!!!!! The buffet breakfast for dinner and breakfast was ok, at a reasonable price with a good choice of food. We used the hotel buffet only 2 times because we prefered to have dinner in other restaurants. The hotel is at the end of the strip and every time we used the car to go to the other Hotels and Casinò (Parking is free in all Las Vegas Hotels) and this was not a problem because we rent a car for all week infact we drove to Death Valley and Grand Canyon. But if you decide to not rent a car, hotel location is not good because you need to spend a lot of money for cab! It is important to remark that in this hotel is possible to smoke everywhere and if you don't like ... stay away from this hotel! We stayed in a non smoking room but the smell of smoke in hallways and casinò was terrible! I choose this hotel for the price even if I found mamy terrible reviews because I saw hotel photos and they looked nice but I will pick up better place next time! Sorry if my english is not perfect, but I am not english mother tongue.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Motal not a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bafi009
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the strip at discount prices this might be a good choice. BUT do not expect any type of glitz or high-level hospitality. Think of a well functioning motel. No more. NO less. This hotel is mediocre at best. Though clean and functional it is really basic. The price was good. However the rooms were so basic that we asked for an upgrade to the 'new' wing. So we ended up paying more that we planned to. The staff is OK but for the most part looks board and tiered of serving guests. The food is also mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - especially with the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Hels
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, and great rooms (if you get the upgrade) as they have a little extra room. Service was great, and the views from the top just spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Two miles from centre of the Strip, but not bad value”
Reviews.Author: Xoltan
Reviews.Content: The gym is excellent, outdoor pool good (but cold in February). Rooms are OK, but fan heater/air-conditioners noisy. There is free WiFi at Burger King and Denny's 50 metres from hotel or McDonalds ten minutes walk away. Deuce and SDX buses stop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: AyLeeC
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, housekeeping however needs some work. The floor wasn't clean, we had to ask for someone to come vacuum within the first ten minutes in the room. We stayed 5 days there. We kept our room clean but we still wanted fresh towels and sheets at least every other day. We'd have to go out to the housekeepers in the hallway to ask for things, or call down to the front desk, because they would skip our room even with the 'please clean room' sign up. One housekeeper said she'd do it while we were out having dinner and it'd be done in less than an hour but two hours later we came back and nothing had been done. Other than that the place was great. We explored the shopping center and the restaurants. Food was great, people were friendly. The lounge view from the top was amazing. It's at the very end of the strip so if you want to feel relaxed in Vegas but still be kinda near things this would probably be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: mariaguerra
Reviews.Content: Went to dinner at the top Basically, never told $100.00 minimum per guest,and we stayed there. one person one check one steak one drink $122.00 you decide

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: sage97
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, close to old Las Vegas and on the main strip with all the casinos. We had a view of the strip. The room was clean and ample in size. No fridge or microwave was available. The mall is good shopping located in the hotel. Comedy show is included in the price of the hotel (located in the hotel). Also, included in the price is an elevator ride to the top of the hotel. Where you can see all of Vegas. Breakfast buffet for a reasonable price. I dont gamble; but, the casino seemed okay. For the adventurous the top deck host amusement rides. If you havent gone to the Grand Canyon, take one of the day tours. In our tour breakfast (continental) and lunch at a local resturant was included in the price. Admission into the canyon with a tour guide. Also included was a stop at Hoover Dam and Lake Meade. Wear good walking shoes. You are picked up from your hotel around 7am and return around 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere staff were excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MaraWaern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Straosphere for my daughter's wedding in Vegas. The staff and the concierge were fantastic - From allowing the flowers to be delivered to the hotel to the marvelous relaxing evening at the bar at level 107 in the Stratosphere everything fell into place. I had never used the "Deuce" tourist transit system - it allowed us to shuttle to and return from the strip easily. An awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: SoshSosh
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this site about the hotel, I did arrive worried about what horrors I might find. However I have just returned from my trip and can truely say I can not find one fault. Even not having tea and coffee facilities, as you have a yummy starbucks at the bottom of your lift. I do have to mention that we had booked a select room which is part of the remodeled section of the hotel. The casino itself was even my favorite, it is old skool vegas and I like that. We ate at the buffet for a few breakfasts, also the local denny and ihop. We also had a few dinner buffets there. There was nothing missing. The hotel was so close to downtown (freemont street) and the outlet mall (best place ever!) We walked to town and if we wanted to get the bus back we would as it stops outside the hotel - the best bus was the express as it didnt stop at every hotel. As the bus ticket was for 24 hrs we could use it the next day too. The view we had from our room was so lovely it was of down town and the mountains - you could see the golden nugget in the distance, we ended up sleeping with the curtains open to see the lights as a view at night and then to wake up to a beautiful view. We spent a day by the pool drinking cocktails, we used the tower a few times for beautiful views. I loved this hotel and I loved Vegas!! I will 100% be staying at the strat next time.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
