Reviews.Content: i stayed at the stratosphere April 2011 with mum in the new select rooms and they were amazing and im not just saying that coz of the cheap price we got it at. The rooms were beautiful, clean and spacious. The beds were comfy and the bathrooms were nice and clean as well. The distance from the main part of the strip is not that bad at all and we walked it nearly everyday and night and did not feel uncomfortable one bit. The deuce bus stop is right by the side of the building so again no problems with transport.. We had pre paid our trip through Expedia so we didn't have to worry about hidden charges like other people are complaining about.. Only disappointment was no free WiFi in the room however i didn't have a problem walking down the road to McDonald's and using their free WiFi.. All in all i had a great hotel experience and would definitely stay in the select rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “Descent hotel with good view”
Reviews.Author: Mourina d
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny as its damn cheap. Views are unmatched from the higher floors. And yes there are a lot of good food joints

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Billy O
Reviews.Content: Happy Hour on the 107th floor as the sun sets is still one of the city's best kept secrets. Had a suite with a strip view, which was fantastic, roomy and quiet. an easy cab ride down the strip to the other casinos. Tremendous value and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ok- but beware of resort fees”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveller277
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere has improved in some areas under the new ownership, which has up graded and remodeled some rooms and areas of the Hotel. However after a recent stay there we found the Bite show has been down graded from what it use to be with a lot of the main performers no longer in the show. There is only one singer now and mostly it is just a dance show and no longer a musical production show like it was the last time we saw it a couple of years ago- We found the show to no longer be worth the price. The Hotel is clean and well keep for the most part if you get one of the remodeled rooms- The rides are great and the view from the top is still the best reason to stay there- The do hide part of the cost of a stay by charging the infamous"resort fee" a lot Vegas hotels use to hide the actual rate cost- which adds a $7.70 a night cost to the advertised rate. Wish all Hotels would stop doing this as you don't really know what the per night charge is until you get to the front desk. A good thing here is that the Stratosphere is on the main bus line and easy to get out to Fremont St or up the strip with out paying expense taxi cab rides- The bus is definitely the way to go in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but there's so much better choices”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price, but for being a Las Vegas hotel, I was not impressed at all by the basic room! There wasn't even a darn coffee pot!! It's far from the south strip (the main sites). It's a short easy walk to Freemont Street though. It's a great hotel if you do a lot of the tower rides/attractions for general discounts. But that's it. The casino is small and very smoke filled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodTraveler11
Reviews.Content: Took my teenage son out to Vegas for a quick trip to do some exploring at the nearby parks and we stayed at the Stratosphere. Overall, our experience was positive. I couldn't ask for more for what we paid. We got a great deal. Our room was newly renovated and we had a great view. Beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet at night. I slept great. This hotel is a bit farther from most of the action on the strip but it's not terrible. We could have walked it if we had to. We had a rental car which I would highly recommend anyway for Vegas. The strip is long even though it doesn't appear to be when looking at it. The only bummer was our experience at the diner in our hotel. I wasn't expecting much anyways but we were too tired from our long trip to find something elsewhere so we gave it a shot. The food wasn't great. There was a lipstick stain on my glass which I only noticed half way through my meal. Gross. It was too loud and my food was cold. It could have been an off night being late on a Sunday. There were plenty of other places in the hotel to grab a quick bite or late night snack. We ate on the strip at some great restaurants. The tower at the hotel was amazing for the views but we didn't get to try the restaurant. All in all, this place was great. Check in and check out were both quick and seamless. No problems at all. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: dave195499
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel and i can recommend it, the reception was very good and rooms big, clean and bright, with a lovely view.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience blown at the last minute”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea R
Reviews.Content: We were married at the top of the Stratosphere tower last week, which was beautiful. Everything went seamlessly with the wedding, and the rides were great fun. We stayed at the Stratosphere for 4 days and the first 3 were flawless. Check in was a breeze, our room(the Oasis suite) was fantastic, and everyone was extremely helpful and nice. Yes, there are smokey smells in the hallways, but its Las Vegas and that's just life. We had no problem with our linens, which I was worried about after reading reviews here about people getting rashes. Everything was clean, and service was timely. Even the administration on the casino floor who had to card me every time I was down there(I look very young) was so nice. Our problem came on the last day of our trip. A few weeks prior to leaving I had changed our flights to a later time. I called the Stratosphere and asked to arrange a late check out. They assured me that it wasn't a problem, and I didn't think of it again. Then, on our last day, my husband and I were sitting in our room, ordering a movie and some room service while we packed up. While we were waiting for our food, we heard a knock at the door. An EXTREMELY curt woman named Joanna informed us that we did not have a late check out, and that we needed to leave right then because they were waiting on the room. She made us put all of our food in to go containers (where were we supposed to eat it???) and leave immediately. I wouldn't have even gotten worked up except she was so rude! We decided not to argue with her(we didn't want to deal with her any more than we had to, we had just gotten married and just trying to stay positive!) and just checked out and then found we had a $50 charge for the late check out. The lady at the front desk(much nicer) at least got it lowered to $20, but we still had the charge for the movie we didn't get to watch and the food we didn't get to eat. By this time, we really did need to go, so we just stopped arguing and left. It's a shame that the trip was ruined at the last minute. We were planning on going back next year to renew our vows with some friends and family, but I don't think we'll be doing so now. Other than one rude employee and a slew of charges that we didn't get to enjoy, the trip was great but CONFIRM if you have to change to a late check-out!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: Went there over Christmas 2011. Booked last minute ( about 8 days before departure) and got 7 days hotel and airfare on United for $635 pp based on double occupency originating out of Edmonton, Canada. The hotel is on the strip, about a one hour walk from the more popular hotels and attractions. The Duce bus runs right in front of the hotel, but unfortunately the Duce is abit slow...sometimes it takes 45 minutes to get from our hotel to Planet Hollywood. The buffet is good, only about $15 for supper with the loyalty card which the casino offers for free. I believe it's even cheaper when not during the holidays. The people in the restarants were nice. The rooms were clean and smoke free, the beds were comforable, but overall the rooms were quite basic...no free coffee and basic cheap toiletries. There is a viewing platform on top of the Stratosphere tower which has thrill rides,..the room key allows one to go to the viewing platform for free. Very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Anujbhargava
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average. Comfortable, not luxurious. Its pretty old too, cause design and furniture was old and in some places even damaged. The good part was free access to the tower from where the view was absolutely splendid. They allow even outside folks to go up the tower, so some small fee. Their casino is also fine. Staff was decent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over a Super weekend!”
Reviews.Author: emmalin03
Reviews.Content: I'm not a gambler in the least but came with my parents. We were down for the Superbowl weekend and I must say the Superbowl Party hosted by the Strat was phenomenal! I'd go back just for that. The room was nice, bed was comfortable, and there was plenty of space for the three of us. As a personal preference I would have rather been closer to the other end or middle of the strip, but that's just because I can't spend hours in a casino. Lots of the shops inside the Strat were closed, which was disappointing but not a deal breaker. The pool area was open which I was very happy about since it was January.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay in an average room, in an average hotel = very average”
Reviews.Author: travelforsnow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the very northern end of the strip. Booked a premium King room with a view. On arrival was allocated a room with a view no view to speak of- we looked straight out on the pillar of the tower. Made a request to be moved to another room as we were right outside the noisy lifts with an 18 month lod child - but was met with a rude response. No fridge or coffee making facilities. The bath towels were not big enough to even wrap around yourself. Overall the stay was very average This hotel would suit someone who is just looking for a bed to sleep in and nothing more. the gambling floor was average, and it seemed that all the tables and waiters had to be busting out of thier tops to get a job there. shopping was OK

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain”
Reviews.Author: MrCabbage
Reviews.Content: Got a great price and got a good room. But the third bed didn't really fit in it which was a pity. I'm a bit cynical about the whole Vegas thing and this was just a one-night stop on our tour of the West. I'm afraid I left still cynical. But the hotel is ok, has good facilities, cheap rooms, free parking, free entry to the tower. Really can't complain too much. Tower was the best thing about Vegas in my view so well worth sitting up there with a drink. Location not perfect but it's not difficult to get to the main strip. Had to queue for check-in and check-out which I found very frustrating. Only place on our tour that didn't do free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful..”
Reviews.Author: JPNK
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel... The rooms are very nice. Service is OK.. but the rides are the best bit. DO not miss the three rides at 1000+ fts.. The view of the city and surrounding hills is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay in the sky!”
Reviews.Author: Deb G
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean rooms, free access to tower (did not have to pay the $16 adult price), IHOP restaurant - south 1/2 block excellent breakfast, has non-smoking floors. Cons: no free internet ($12 per 24 hour period per device), no fridge, no coffee maker, pool OK (only open 9-5 pm even though weather 23 C but off season). Off the strip, OK as you could take the Deuce or Express from the hotel stop. Would we stay here again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, pretty, pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMarley
Reviews.Content: Our room was booked ahead of time in the redone tower when we arrive the front desk asked if we wanted to upgrade to the strip view for a small fee (instead of facing the highway). We decided to up grade and out room faced the skyjump, so we got to see the jumpers. This hotel has a lot to do in it, but it is far away from the rest of the strip. I would suggest that first timers stay on the other end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value -but won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: writemeariver
Reviews.Content: Booked a Stratosphere Select room for 4 nights because the sale was so good. The uplifted room wasn't bad - pretty standard. No bar fridge to keep anything cold in the room. Paper thin walls. We were woken up at 4 am a few times by raised voices in rooms near ours, loud sex from the floor above, and many smokers walking by or smoking in their rooms on a floor that is labelled "non-smoking". We didn't mind the location - we were able to walk from there to the Mirage and Venetian in 20 minutes. No great room views but for as much as you are in the room, the view is irrelevant. The sound, smoke, lack of privacy were more of an issue for us. It was just ok - stay here if you get a screaming' deal - and use the Deuce bus to get down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it! Far from strip, poor service, and ghetto area.”
Reviews.Author: Keiko_me
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I've been too! Stayed in a deluxe with two queen beds. Poor customer service. They had no wifi included, a charge of 12/day/device! Registration was difficult to locate. Concierge was not helpful or friendly. The room had a view of a wall, garbage from other stays were still present, plates from room service outside our doors were not picked up for 2-3 days! Had the option to upgrade but for 20/day so did not. Was a ripoff. Really far from the strip (about 30-40 mins walk), walked a long way but the area is ghetto and dangerous. Saw two fights in the open, panhandlers asking us for change-even within the hotel casino!!Take the Deuce bus $7 for 24hrs ride all day.Only benefit was cheap room service, can get something as low as $8. Overall, I'd say either pay more for the Vegas experience and be closer to the strip or go cheaper to a small hotel like a travel lodge close to the strip with free wifi, if on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: IMJetlagged
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vegas to party and you don't care what the room is like, because all you need is a bed to crash in and a way to wash away the sin through glazed eyes the next morning; then this hotel will do ... except that it's a good half hour walk to the actual strip and you are NOT in a good area to be walking around at night anyway. From experience (15 years ago & pre-bankruptcy) we thought that this hotel was a really nice place to stay! As avid travelers, we should have known better and were seriously disappointed with our choice! After paying extra for a so-called upgraded room it would be frightening to see what a standard room is like! We did however get a great view of Las Vegas mountains if we stood right in front of the window - but they may as well have been portholes on a cruise ship. About 3 feet wide (air conditioner width) it made NO SENSE someone would design a hotel with tiny windows when you have these awesome views beyond! The photos they use in all of their literature to sell you a room is NOT the room they give you. We joked that it's not even the same hotel as the windows are much bigger in the advertisements. The place smells old and funky and the bathroom is ridiculously small. You have less than the basics not even a coffee maker. We found the customer service fairly rude and exceptionally unhelpful from front desk and the lines for checking in and out are loooong, expect up to 40 minutes plus waiting in line ... oh, and then you have to pay a FEE for that experience as well!!! (read on) We heard EVERYTHING in the hallways and neighboring rooms ... the shower; the toilet 'operations', the tv; telephone conversations ... etc. The air conditioner was stuck (broken) on high, but it felt like 74 degrees the whole time. Well, at least our sheets were clean and the bed was comfortable. They have a budget rental car office on the second floor but if you don't speak Spanish, good luck renting from them. And FYI, the Starbucks in the casino charges exorbitantly. Like .95 cents for an extra caramel syrup in a caramel frappe! Welcome to Vegas, right? That said, upon check out, this is what our bill looked like : Room charge + room upgrade + 21% taxes + $9.99 mandatory cleaning fee + $2.75 check-in fee + $16 check-out fee + $23 resort fee ... per person + a $50 convenience fee <-- Huh?!! (We called and had that one removed as they couldn't tell us what the "convenience fee" exactly was - *cough* *shady* * cough*!) + $12/day for internet + $19 to go up into Stratosphere Tower ... and I am sure I am forgetting other fees, we were completely bewildered! Then, we also found out that a buffet for two was included in all these fees we did not know about but of course front desk refused to remove the charge they added and yet failed to mention telling us that "we should have known what we were paying for when we bought the package" ... unbelievable! We obviously had the worst of the worst experiences and maybe we just bummed out on everything, like the worst room in the worst location with the broken air conditioner and the tiniest bathroom and they forgot the coffee machine and the closet doors and to spray air freshner and clean the shower head and they ran out of normal sized windows 15+ years ago; but when we tried to change rooms it was obvious that the hotel management just REALLY didn't care. This was a double slap in the face when we received the bill. In summary, this hotel on all levels of accommodation and service was just AWFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel--not really on the strip but that was OK for us”
Reviews.Author: phall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Vegas yearly in the fall. This year we stayed for the first time at the Stratosphere from Dec. 5-8. It had a very good price of $59 per night. We had a great time and liked the hotel very much. We stayed in the premier rooms that had been recently updated. The room was nice and had a king bed, flat screen television, huge bathtub and was spacious. The hotel is not really on the strip anymore as most of the hotels are located further down the strip espcially since the Sarah is now closed. However, the hotel is pretty close to downtown--probably 45 minutes to walk and 10 minute bus ride. We did go downtown for one of our days there and took the bus from right in front of the hotel. Food--the buffet is very good for both dinner and breakfast. Breakfast has everything as well as eggs cooked to order. The price was not bad--about as much as the IHOP across the street once you factor in beverages (IHOP prices $4 for coffee.) Gambling--we played slots and found this hotel to pay off better than downtown as well as on the strip. We played one day downtown, one day on the strip and one day in our casino. Shows--We bought The Mentalist tickets through travelzoo.com and got a very good price. He has an amazing show. The last night we were at our hotel, the offered guests staying at the Stratosphere free tickets to Frankie Moreno in the main showroom. Tickets were completely free or you could opt for front row seating for $20 per couple. We did this. What a show, Frankie and his band are OUTSTANDING...He is like a young Jerry Lee Lewis. We had a great time. Also if you stay at the hotel, you get free unlimited trips up the tower. That was a cool freebie. Service--Casino bar service was pretty good. The waitstaff came around all hours of the day and offered drinks including water. Overall, I would say we had a nice time in Vegas. We would be willing to stay at this hotel again and did not mind being off strip. We have stayed at the following other hotels: Rio (several times), Harrah's (several times), Gold Coast (not again), as well as Freemont and one other associated with Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from Strip”
Reviews.Author: vegascupcakes777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year. It looked beautiful and I was excited. We're not your typical twenty somethings though. We don't stay out all night partying, so a hotel room was important. First, it's too far fromt he main part of the strip. To get to the main part, it took a good 20 minutes or longer, depending on when the Deuce stopped and walking was about that long. The hotel itself looks nice, but it isn't all it's cracked up to be. The AC didn't work. We tried to change rooms, but they couldn't switch us. It was HOT and miserable to sleep at night. The fan run on the AC but no air came out. The rides were GREAT! It's a bonus that it's free to go up since you're staying there. We took advantage of that. I The casino was okay and the little diner was okay for breakfast. We usually walked towards the other end of the strip to Denny's to eat. CVS is close, so we went and bought alcohol, pop, and water from there to keep in the hotel room. Overall, I wouldn't stay again. It wasn't very clean either.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Stat Feb 05/12”
Reviews.Author: kerrysean1
Reviews.Content: We recently went on a family vacation to the stratosphere in Vegas.We booked our trip online at Allegiant Air. The room was a lot smaller than we thought it would be. There were some housekeeping issues that were bad. We found the food in Roxy's diner excellent, the service was also top notch. We also had a meal in the restaurant in the tower that was absolutely the best meal and service I've ever had. Staff was very helpful and courteous. If you can upgrade your room, I would highly recommend the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: SL611
Reviews.Content: Where to start... Long long long line to check in. Booked over phone and was told I was in a newly renovated room on a high floor. At check in, was told I did not have a renovated room and would be extra $15 per night. No AC in room. Shower didn't drain. Air quality was horrible, seems to have no air circluation in hotel.Felt like I was in a ghetto hotel. While walking down the hall I could touch the ceiling and I am 5'5". This should be a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, it was decent and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: gummyroach
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 2/17/12 through 2/20/12 I wanted to get out of Salt Lake City for the Predident's Day weekend, and a trip to Las Vegas seemed like it would be fun. From Salt Lake to Vegas, it's about a 6 or 7 hour drive. I took the scenic route through Tooele, on south through Delta, and met up with the I-15 freeway in Cedar City and on to Las Vegas. This particular route is perfect, because there is virtually no traffic out that way except for an occassional truck. I set the cruise control, turned on some tunes, sang to my heart's content, and enjoyed the open countryside. Now if you're traveling with kids and decide to take this particular route, be warned that there is absolutely NOTHING out that way! Trust me, they will be bored, because there will be miles and miles of NOTHING! But this is the ideal route if you hate traffic, and are not in any big hurry. About the time I got to St. George was when I started running into traffic, but it wasn't bad. It was pretty smooth sailing all the way to North Las Vegas, then it turned into bumper-to-bumper traffic. I got off the I-15 freeway at Charleston Blvd and turned left, heading over to Las Vegas Blvd. From there, it was only a few blocks until I reached the Stratosphere hotel. Go past the hotel and make a right turn at the traffic light. There will be a large parking garage on the right, which is free. I walked in and headed over to the front desk. The casino floor is enormous; but seemed fairly clean. While the place did smell a bit like a chimney, it wasn't overwhelming. (That came later, when I visited another hotel further down the strip!) There was a big line at the check-in counter, but the line moved quickly. THE ROOM: I had initially booked a "Select" room, after reading reviews that these rooms had supposedly been upgraded, and were much nicer than the non-select rooms. Ha! Well, I got to my room, and it was no big thing. In fact, it was VERY bare bones. About the only "upgrade" that was noticeable was the flatscreen tv. Everything else was very basic, hotel standard. The room didn't even have a coffee maker. The bed was comfortable, the decor was decent, but there was absolutely nothing about this room that stood out as "WOW!". The view was mehhhh. Couldn't really see much of the strip. It was decent, but nothing to write home about. On a few websites that described these "select" rooms, they mentioned that ALL of the select rooms had jetted tubs in the bathrooms. Turns out this is FALSE! They do NOT! I asked the folks at the front desk about this and they said that only the spa suites had those. They didn't have one of those rooms available for Friday, but they did move me (at an extra charge, of course) on Saturday. The spa room was SOOOOOO much nicer!!! This room had a small fridge, a counter with a sink (called a wet bar), a large sitting area, a dining room table, large walk-in closet with an enormous safe. In the bathroom was a glass-enclosed shower, and the large, coveted jetted tub. Now THAT'S more like it! Well worth the extra $$, I felt. This room was on the 20th floor. The view was better, but still nothing to write home about. Good view of the tower though, and I could see people doing the Sky Jump off the tower. (The sky jump is one of a few attractions at the top of the Stratosphere tower.) THE BUFFET: If you book this hotel, be sure and stop by the Players Club counter and get a Player's card, even if you don't gamble. Without this card, the buffet will run about $21 a person. With the card, it's about $16 a person. The buffet was decent enough, but I wouldn't call it great. While they had prime rib, mashed potatoes, etc, they were missing certain food items found at most buffets. For example, I didn't see any potato salad, no lasagna, and no assortments of vanilla or chocolate moose. The place was comfortable, not very crowded. There is a hostess who will stand around and stare at you while you eat. THE POOL: I asked the folks at the front desk if the pool was open. The clerk gave me a cheesy grin and said, "Why yes! It sure is!". I changed into my board shorts and headed to the 8th floor, where the pool was. There were maybe 5 or 6 people lounging around in chairs on the pool deck, and maybe 3 people in the jacuzzi, but nobody was in the pool. Hmmm. I soon found out WHY nobody was in the pool! I jumped in, and about FROZE! It was FREEZING!!!!! Of course everybody else just pointed and laughed! "Cold, aint it??!!" Niiiice! So much for trying to use the pool. FRANKIE MORENO: If you book this hotel, you'll definitely want to see and hear Frankie Moreno and his 10-piece band perform. They put on an AMAZING show! The guy sounds a lot like Elvis! Many of the songs he performs were actually written by his brother and himself. The sound system in that theater is top-notch. Not sure what happened during the last part of his performance, but there was a partial power-outtage, and the stage lights went out. The sound system did not, however, and he completed the remainder of the show in the dark. The casino still had power, so most guests were oblivious that there was a problem. My room had no power. (The lights finally came back on about 2 am, shortly after I had gone to bed. Terrific.) SURROUNDING AREA: The Stratosphere is one of the few large, mainstream hotels/casinos on the strip that is actually located within the Las Vegas city limits. (Did you know that most of the big places on the strip are in a town called Paradise, and not Las Vegas?) The Stratosphere is at the north end of the strip. The surrounding neighborhood is VERY GHETTO/SEEDY. This is definitely NOT the place to be walking around on the streets at night, by yourself! It's hard to imagine a city such as Vegas being on the verge of bankruptcy. The truth is, there are a lot of places in this area where old hotels/casinos had been torn down to make way for new, elaborate high-rise complexes, only to have construction halt midway through the project due to lack of money. This area looks like a war zone! To get to the main areas of the strip, it's best to drive, or take a bus. About 200 yards north of the hotel is a Denny's 24 hr diner. I thought I'd give it a try. Oh my goodness, what a scary place that was! The prices weren't much cheaper than what could be found at the hotel. My advice is to go to one of the fast food places on the "R" (Mall) level of the hotel, instead, if you're looking for a cheap meal. THE TOWER: Admission to the tower is free for hotel guests. There's a security checkpoint with a metal detector you must go through in oder to access the tower. From the ground, the observation area didn't appear to be that large, and I wondered just how many people they could comfortably cram into that place. When I got to the top of the tower, I was pleasantly surprised. It's actually quite a large place! There's a high-class restaurant, a large observation area, a bar, a few gift shops, and... a couple of thrill rides. It didn't seem crowded at all. And the view of the city from up there was incredible! THINGS TO DO: While in Vegas, I decided to catch the Icons Of Comedy show at the Starlight Theater at the Rivera Hotel. Hal Sparks was the featured performer. Now THAT place was an absolute DUMP! Hard to imagine that back in the day, the Riviera was considered a very high class establishment. What happened??!! Yikes! Walking into the place was like walking into a giant ashtray. The place wreaked. It was pretty disgusting. The show, however, was hilarious, and reasonably priced. I also decided to take a tour of the Hoover Dam, as I've never been there before. Excellent choice! It was an all-day thing, and included a 2-hour cruise on a large paddle boat on Lake Mead. This was a nice, relaxing alternative to the hustle and bustle of the strip, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I rode the double-decker bus up to Freemont Street. This is a must see, if you've never been to Vegas before. It's maybe a 15-minute bus ride from the hotel. Check-out was quick and easy, via the menu options on the tv in the hotel room. The stratosphere is by no means glamorous, but it's decent enough, the beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean. If you stay here, you'll definitely want a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not for Families”
Reviews.Author: kevshan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere August 2010 as part of a 26 strong group attending a family wedding. Rooms OK, but if you want a view I suggest you upgrade. Had problems with security staff, just stop for a brief conversation with kids in tow and theyr'e down on you like a ton o' bricks to keep moving if your in the Casino area. We were told before booking this was a family orientated hotel - BULL!! Ther are far better hotels in Vegas for what you pay at this excuse for an Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only average”
Reviews.Author: Marek N
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 nights an Stratosphere I would summarize my review as follows. Pros: * We stayed in the new "Select" room, which was nice, spacious, had (as advertised) big plasma flat screen, was clean, quite comfortable, with a king bed. The AC/heater was not silent but worked very fast, so that it was able to heat up the room in a few minutes and most of the time it was silent. * Very good value: probably because of the location far from the center of the Strip, Stratosphere offers quite cheap rooms, even during holiday weekend... Cons: * Paper-thin walls: despite we were on 21st floor, far from street noise, the sleep-destroyer was the noise coming from the hallway and neighboring rooms. We literally heard the discussion of two house-keeping maids in the neighboring room as they were standing in our room. * Smoke everywhere: it's obvious that Stratosphere management will NOT ban smoking from the hotel, but they also don't do much about arrogant, rude smokers smoking also in areas explicitly designated for non-smokers. So if you mind smoking, try to choose hotels without casinos. * Stratosphere advertises that with booking their room you will have unlimited access to the Tower, but they tactically don't mention that you WON'T be allowed to take a tripod there. Reason: unknown...

Reviews.Title: “good price for basic room”
Reviews.Author: paulszedshed
Reviews.Content: We went to vegas for a wedding. We got our flight and hotel through expedia, which was a good experience. First time using their sevices. Although we were expecting a preimer room, i don't feel that is what we got. The room was very basic, but the bed was very comfortable so it kind of made up for not getting the room we expected. The room was quiet and clean. The hotel is an attraction in itself, but is a ways away from the hub-bub of the strip. It is central to the strip and fairmont street. It is a few blocks away from the Gold and Silver Pawn Shop (Pawn Stars).

Reviews.Title: “The Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: KhanArt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Stratosphere Presidents Day weekend 2012. We had a very good time and enjoyed our stay. The service was very good and staff was friendly. Even if you do not stay at this hotel I suggest you come to go on the tower to see the beautiful view and try some of the rides. The tower has 3 rides which are about $10-12 each and a sky jump which is just over $100 I believe. I recommend the rides as long as you aren't afraid of heights. We did not use the fitness center or the pool but did go out to see how the pool looked. The pool seems nice and the view is beautiful. The room is average size and it comes with a flat screen tv. The room did not come with a fridge, microwave, or coffee machine. The room was decent but I didn't expect more for the price we paid. We basically used the hotel just for showering and sleeping. We did not eat inside the hotel. I would suggest that if you stayed at this hotel that you should do the same, besides for the tower I would go out to the strip to eat and enjoy your time. My biggest complaint would be that internet is not free so I didn't even bother taking my laptop, I just used my phone. The other biggest complaint is that it is all the way on the other end of the strip so it is a long walk to the middle and other end of the strip. I would not recommend to walk that far. Use public transportation or a tax or best of all rent a car. That is what we did, I rented a car for the whole time I was there and it made life and the trip so much better. Parking was free every where so this cut down on the walking for us. We saw a few shows, went to all the big hotels, casinos, and malls. Went to Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, and Grand Canyon west rim. We had a great time and even though we did not spend much time at this hotel we would suggest it besides the few complaints we had. If you can find a better or similar hotel for the same price which is closer to the middle of the strip I would go with that... it would save you walking and transportation costs.

Reviews.Title: “For Aussies travelling to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SerenaPerthWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the great price of $305US for 5 nights. It was cheaper booking with the hotel directly (on the internet) than with Expedia. The hotel room comes with flat screen TV, but you have to pay for internet and if you want a fridge in the room it was about $15 per night. The room I booked had two queen beds and there was no option to get a queen and two singles. We could get a roll away bed for and extra $20 per night. We didn't bother and made the kids share a bed. You can get ice from various locations on each floor. The Italian resturant at this hotel was reasonably priced and the meal sizes were big. If you try and go for the early morning breakfast meal (about $6) and share then they charge you an extra $2. (I thought this was a rip off so walked out and went to the breakfast deal at the little casino across the road). The view was fantastic and I recommend that you go up the viewing tower during the day and and night time as Las Vegas looks different when viewed at different times. Overall this hotel is a fair way up the strip to walk, but we had a car so it was no problem, we would drive down to another hotel/casino and park there, then drive back at the end of the day. You can also take the bus and it stops close to the hotel. The good thing about this hotel was that the you couldn't hear people in the room next to you. The bath was averaged size and the water was hot and had good pressure. I would recommend staying here if you don't mind walking, or if you are happy with public transport, or if you have a car. I thought the price was very good for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas and teenagers !”
Reviews.Author: leftandright5667
Reviews.Content: My sister , myself , and my 16 year old niece went to Vegas from 2/14 - 2/18 2012 and stayed at the Stratosphere. The staff was very pleasant and friendly but found it hard to know where my niece could be and not be. This was throughout Vegas not really just related to The Stratosphere alone. I know that Vegas is not all that friendly for kids but they do have families that ( and plenty of them ) go to Vegas as well that Vegas does have Circus Circus which was more friendly toward kiddos. The part that was hard is that some people ( employees ) that were darn rude about it !!!!!! Vegas expects us to see this imaginary line where she was allowed to stand and not to stand I guess. They really did not treat her like a human! There was plenty of things to do for us like the Dolphin's at the Mirage which was AWESOME!!!!! We would have went back twice but ran out of time :-)

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Las Vegas - for free if you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DixieLeeds
Reviews.Content: Hotel was average/good I felt, however was very good value. I can bit a bit picky and I was very happy here! The big bonus was that we had free access (normally 16 dollars per person each time) to the Stratosphere Tower and Lounge Bar which was totally amazing!! The view from the 108th floor over Vegas, especially at dusk as the sun was going down, has to be seen to be believed - I have never seen such an amazing sight - stunning!!! We spent 3 out of the 6 nights we had, sitting drinking half price Martinis (4pm-7pm) watching the sun go down and eating the very good (and large)( and 50% off!) appetizers. The restaurant itself is at the same level and over a 2 hour period, the tables revolve a full 360 degrees around the tower so you can take in all of vegas whilst enjoying a fantastic meal. Restaurant was pricey (£300 for 4 inc champagne) but worth every dime for the sheep experience - one that will not be forgotten! Location - situated at the bottom end of the 'Strip' which put me off a little before we booked but I need not have worried at all. Location was good and the buses are great - only £20 for a 3 day pass and they are clean and very frequent (from outside the hotel door). We also took the bus to 'downtown Vegas' and the Freemont Experience.... look it up... the largest outdoor cinema screen in the world - an amazing sight on the hour every evening and only about 15 mins on the bus from the hotel. Food - we had the dinner buffet in the hotel which was nice, but if you go to Vegas you must try the lunchtime buffet in the Bellagio Hotel (cheaper than you might think - we paid 15 dollars each) and also the burgers at Serendipity (next to Caesers Palace) - fantastic.!! Can you tell I am excited about this place?! Awesome does not come close!!

Reviews.Title: “Bit more relaxing”
Reviews.Author: marymobsby
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week here in jan this year and really could not fault it. The rooms were spotless as was the laundry.Vegas is a mega busy place so it was nice to get off the strip in the later evening and return to the hotel.The buffet was amazing and if you obtain a play card you get 25% discount which is worth it even if you dont gamble. There is Starbucks in the lobby which is run very well ,never have to wait long in the queue unlike here.Upstairs is some more shops inc mcdonalds and a mexican,both of which we found faultless.There is a sheepskin shop up there to which sells UGG boots for $120 (£85) saves you carrying them back from ceasers forum shops.We found the croupiers very polite and must give a special mention to PETER on the LUCKY 6 WHEEL.- a very simple casino game with not much appeal but PETER seems to draw people in with his personality.As The Stratosphere is a long way from the strip its a good idea to purchase a 24hr bus pass which costs $7 (£5) otherwise its around $20 in a taxi.The bus stops right outside the hotel. All in all i would stay here again after all you dont spend much time in your room and what you save on accomodation you can spend on something else.All the staff were very helpfull too.

Reviews.Title: “On top of the world”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: Loved every second and the views from the top were stupendous, room clean and tidy staff excellent, and location first class in between the old and the new,we are going back 2013 for my partners 60th.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on the North Strip”
Reviews.Author: timmyf16
Reviews.Content: Online check-in was painless. Arrived Friday evening at 6:30 pm...which is exactly when they reduce staff at the front desk; however wait was less than five minutes. Check-in was easy, with a friendly and helpful receptionist. Ample parking in the garage on the west side of the hotel. Strat still has the fastest elevators on the Strip. Rooms are advertised as "re-imagined", and they have been updated. Our room had two queen beds with new mattresses and "pillow-top" bedding...very comfortable. Flat-screen TV, phone, clock radio, iron, and ironing board rounded out the amenities. There is Wi-Fi, but it's about $12.00 per day, and if you have kids who "must have" a cartoon channel then you'll be disappointed at the dozen or so channels offered via cable. There are movie channels (about $11.00 per movie). Room was clean, and service staff was courteous and efficient. Elevators to the top of the tower take less than 40 seconds to climb/descend 108 floors. View is remarkable, and guests have unlimited access to the tower (you don't need a ticket but everyone goes through a metal detector before joining the queue for the elevators. There are ample food venues available inside the Strat, along with a 24/7 fitness center that actually has free weights in addition to the standard treadmills and varous type of cycles. For the adventurous there are four thrill rides on the roof of the tower. If you're looking to gamble "old school" on the north end of the Strip, looking to get away from the glitz of the mega-casinos, or simply need a comfortable, clean place to spend your time in Vegas, the Strat is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Look someplace else!!”
Reviews.Author: Ed L
Reviews.Content: Not "top of the world" service. In this day and age you would think that a place like this would provide good service. I found the food and beverage management staff rude and argumentative it truly ruined my stay. There is nothing worse that saying the same thing over and over about the service and they hear what they want. We work hard for our money and I only want to spend it in a place that values the customer. They nickel and dime you, they treat the customer like a thief in the night. If you have a complaint, your only doing it to get something for free. They can keep their show tickets, their crude executive chef, terrible coffee, and horrible room service manager. I took every dime I planned to spend here to "Alize" at the Palms. Were the service was great and everyone enjoyed the experience. It was worth every penny!! I don't mind spending the money but no one likes to taken for granted and treated poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you have transportation to get around the strip.”
Reviews.Author: jpatter471
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. Hotel elevators were some of the fastest I have been on in Vegas. We never had to wait long for an elevator, even on a busy weekend night. Valet was super fast and always asked us if we needed directions when we picked up our car. The buffet was good and discounted if you had their player's card. There is a resort fee of $7.50 but it included admission to the tower which was worth it for us. I would definetly stay here again. The only people I wouldn't recommend this hotel to would be if you are not very familiar with the area and do not have a car or know how to use the bus system.

Reviews.Title: “Impressing tower-location!”
Reviews.Author: MariFax
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap (we chose a week day) but nothing more than we expected. We chose to dine in the tower restaurant which had a great view over the city but the food was WAY TOO expensive for the quality. We had read reports of bed bugs in the hotel prior to our visit (but after our reservation) but the room was fine and we had two good nights of sleep with no guests. :) The hotel is located in the end of the Strip with a long way to walk to the center, but wear good shoes and take the walk anyway! In this end of the Strip you also get to see the wedding chapels. Breakfast would have been convenient but there was an IHOP close to the hotel so that worked well. Free parking and wi-fire worked well. I would recommend it for a cheap stay, it you don't care that much about location.

Reviews.Title: “las marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Limeri
Reviews.Content: clean friendly pleasant hotel , pleasant staff well insulated from all the racket in your room which was clean pleasant and serviced regularly , conveniently l;ocated at the end of the strip ,excellent pool on the rooftop , buffet breakfast was a corker , there are more glam hotels in vegas but this leaves you wanting for nothing !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWalker1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago and I really enjoyed my stay. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and spacious. The hotel had lots to do. I know some people complained because it is at the very north end of the strip, but that was not a problem for me since I was visiting with a relative who lives there and she was able to get us where we wanted to go without a problem. Also, most hotels have valet parking for cheap so you could park just about anywhere and walk. My only complaint is that there was no fridge, microwave, or coffe maker which should be pretty standard for this level of hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: VacationsAreSoFun
Reviews.Content: Recently we needed a place to house 12 of us for the night on a quick over nighter to vegas. Since it was just a place to sleep, we didn't have too many expectations for a property that we never stayed at before. It was a great choice for the cost! Pros: Clean - the rooms are clean and updated. Only the bathroom looked dated, but it was clean and the shower curtain had no mold or mildew. Easy in and out, parking, access, being at the end of the strip. Best prices - typically the lowest prices of the big hotels Tower activites - upgraded, more things to do, especially for thrill seekers Cons Smaller Casino Blah shows and events Had food elsewhere so can't rate the food. Otherwise, would stay here again for an overnighter.

Reviews.Title: “Great job on the remodel!”
Reviews.Author: Nightro
Reviews.Content: I find it aboslutely bizzare to see recent reviews calling this hotel tired and old. I arrived at the hotel on a friday night and was shocked about how much had changed from my last visit here a few years ago. I lined up with my dad to get him checked in and 15 minutes later we were heading through the newly remodeled casino toward our elevator. The elevator banks, to the hallways, to the rooms all looked brand new. New flat screen TV's, tripple sheeting, granite counter tops......definety not worn or run down. Really pleased with the changes they made. They cant do anything about the location, but the trade off in value makes this hotel worth it in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the bustle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: bizarrebeings
Reviews.Content: Situated at the end of the Strip, it was very convenient to drive to the other main hotels and self-park. Also very near to Fremont Street and convenience and souvenir stores. The hotel was okay, rooms were spacious, beds and pillows were just nice. Bathroom was a tad small though. Rooms were cleaned daily and the property was generally well-kept. Casino offered a range of table games and slot machines, however I couldn't find a Baccarat table! Hung out at the 24hr diner there too for late night supper cravings. Hotel has a small Starbucks as well. Went up to the viewing deck, and watched some people taking the thrilling rides, looked fun but couldn't muster enough courage ... Only drawback was there wasn't any free Wi-Fi, even at Starbucks. There was a Mcdonald's nearby, and that's where we went for our internet. Also, for Asian craving, a Thai restaurant is located just 100m away from the main entrance to the hotel. It was a pleasant stay of 5 nights, can't really complain much!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Old”
Reviews.Author: Bigdave2359
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an 8 day stay at the Stratosphere Hotel in Las Vegas. I went there for a furniture convention. I choose this hotel because it was close to the convention. When I arrived I met with a friend that had checked in a day before. As I checked in my friend mentioned to me to try to get a higher floor because the view from the 8th floor were he was was not good. When I asked the girl that was checking me in about moving to a different floor, she started to look in the computer, but another lady standing right behind her, maybe a manager, told her there was nothing else. she was talking to her as if I wasn't there, how rude. The carpet leading to the room was dirty. Now for the room. The room was old and rundown. The dresser/TV table was full of holes and stains. This room was just old. By the way, the casino also looked run downed and old. I had the chance to visit a few other casinos that were much nicer. Also this place is pretty far from the other hotels and in a pretty run downed part of the city. All in all I would avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “A surprising improvement!!”
Reviews.Author: RichMill27502
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 9 & 10, 2012 and was very pleasantly surprised at the refurbished rooms in the Select Tower. They were new, pleasant and had nice, firm beds. The food at Roxy's was great, and the staff there very accommodating. The staff handled a huge volume of guests checking in and out with wit and patience, and the table games dealers were more personable than most you will experience at all but the most high-end casino. No, this is not Wynn or Encore, but it is a great value and a well-priced entry for those on a budget who want to enjoy a Strip casino at a Freemont Street price!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: claire5439
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were very good size and clean. Loved the stay, a little bit away from the main part of the strip, but buses are very good.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: MidiChennai
Reviews.Content: This was part of a tour and we found it very comfortable. The beds, bathroom, view, all fine. As it was at the end of the strip a walk or bus ride right down and one could see the lot. Shops were nearby so we could buy what we wanted. The casino style decor of the foyer was rather monotonous and compared unfavorably with the Bellagio. Vegetarians could be offered a special deal - they miss most of the attractions at the buffet either lower prices or more options. The hop-on-hop-off bus was really convenient and an excellent way to see the place. We enjoyed the hotel frontages, the garish decor, the crazy shows out front, the musical fountain, the lights. As we don't gamble some of the place was lost on us but on the other hand we could relax and just enjoy the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality vs price option”
Reviews.Author: ricjoa
Reviews.Content: Although it is not situated on The Strip, the price for a double room is very convenient and the quality of the room is excellent. and you get free tickets to visit the tower (I advice by sunset). It isn't nor the Venetion or the Bellaggio luxuary, but if you have a 20-day trip visiting the USA, the budget is an important issue and for the quality it is worth satying there. The location is quite ok if you have rented a car (who doesn't have a car in Las Vegas?) and you can even stop by the kitch wedding chappels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: mzqueenz
Reviews.Content: The hotel could have been a good idea if they were more accomodating. First, my guest had to pay for their room in total upon check in. I have never heard of such a thing and I was not made aware of this when I had my rooms blocked off. Upon admission, my guests were scattered throughout the hotel. A non smoking room smelled of ciggarettes. One of my guest was upgraded however was not made aware that the room they upgraded her to would be an additional charge per night. The communication amongst the staff was non existant. The rooms are in need of make overs. While most hotels have flat screen tv's and cordless phone, my suite had 1 out of 2 flat screens. There were no drawers in the suit, I was left to leave my clothes in my suit case. The choices of good food at the diner roxy's was very limited. The buffet was ok. Internet is 11.99 per day per device. Most couples each have their own computer and yet have to pay individually for internet access. The hotel offers no incentive for you to book large parties there. Especially knowing how far they are from the main strip knowing that their guest will have to be taking cabs all the time which does become quite costly.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Repligator
Reviews.Content: Although the location is not the greatest- end of the strip, the hotel was very nice. There are no fancy amenities like minibar or coffeemaker but the hotel room was lovely with a great view. Recent renovations of carpet and furniture, Flatscreen TV with very litttle choice of programming but who goes there to watch TV? The bathrooms not renovated but very clean and neat. Dining options were very varied and great food for the price. The most expensive- Top of the World was a great experience and the food excellent. The idea of using the monorail is out of the question. Yes, it leaves you in the rear of the casinos but you wlak approx a half a mile to get to the street area. This is LV's way of separating you from as much of your money as they can. I would recoment the bus for $7/day or the hop-on/hop-off bus. There are plenty of show to choose from and you are asked every 10 steps where you are from and do you want to see a show? A little annoying. I felt that I was constantly on a sales vacation. They should let up a little. Also a lot of approches to buy into time shares. This really puts you in a frustrated mood that you can not go into a store or walk on the street without the constant sales pitching. I have always wanted to see Vegas- now I have and I really do not think it is a place i am yearning to return to again. The people are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Stratos”
Reviews.Author: adrian g
Reviews.Content: Our family went to Vegas on Superbowl weekend. There was a total of 20 families. Fredi Martinez at the front desk helped us get our rooms all on the same floor. Fredi diligently worked with us and provideda great service with a smile! We appreciate the friendly staff and our rooms were nice. We will definitely be back! Thanks for the great customer service - which is sometimes hard to find ......

Reviews.Title: “Great memories”
Reviews.Author: Mizwrx
Reviews.Content: First night we got stuck with a smoking room but they were able to quickly change us to a non smoking level the next night (thank goodness otherwise this review may have turned out quite differently) on the north end of the strip in the south end of Vegas (don't get that mixed up when trying to catch the bus up to the Vegas sign ;) didn't get a nice view of the strip but it was cleaned daily, no noise, great fun to have go on the rides. The sky jump doesn't seem that much value at $120AUD when you get get a 15min helicopter ride for the same price. It's great whenever you catch a glimpse of the Vegas strip in a poster or movie to see the stratosphere in the skyline....you've stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a cheap weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: StarliteAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, room clean and tidy. 2 for one cocktails at the Air bar were delicious. Good Price includes free parking. Easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ders73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We had a remodeled room on the 21st floor. Nice views, clean room, fast elevators. Parking was easy (we rented a car) and we were able to get places fast. The casino was fun and there were plenty of tables and machines to play. The diner was a good late night meal after being out on the strip and the buffet (breakfast) was good with many choices. The best part of staying here is the free access to the tower. We went up many times, morning, afternoon, happy hour, night, for dinner...something we couldn't do if we were just visiting. For the price and what we were able to do it was perfect for this trip. Without a car, I can see why someone would want to be center strip. With a car, I don't see why you would pay more for center strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: klong831
Reviews.Content: Clean room and they were willing to give us a bit of a late check out as we had a red eye that night; would stay there again, fun at blackjack however slots could be updated a bit and maybe a bit looser :o)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a bit far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: poliquinp
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Stratosphere Hotel and we had a good time. The Casino is good, but it's not the best. The free access to the tower is actually pretty awsome.. One thing, you can't bring your tripod to take night shots :/ The room was clean and the views was O.K We mostly traveled by foots, so it was a bit long to go to the Strip every days.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisngly comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: kathryn031
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while attending the World Furniture Market. Great price, clean room. Access to the tower was included in our room price. The Top of The World revolving restaurant serves delicious food (be sure to allow 1.5 hours for your meal to be able to travel all the way around!) and the Air Bar is a nice place to have a glass of wine. You can walk down Las Vegas Blvd. to catch more of the Strip action, but the bus or a taxi is recommended. It's a long walk! Our room was not cleaned by the time we returned from the market one of the days we were here. We went out to dinner and by the time we got back the room was freshly done up. Apparently they'd forgotten us. It all worked out fine, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay..”
Reviews.Author: lehhen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing in every way, our room was clean A+, the Bite show was great for both men and women. We would definitly stay again. The only drawback was that we ran into one of the younger guys running the skyjump and he asked us if we wanted to jump our group politely stated no thanks and he replyed "how bout I let you jump without a rope for free", my initial thought was what a jerk, but we never let it ruin out trip..

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: beachseeker14
Reviews.Content: At the end of the strip, this place has great prices and a good selection of dining. Free parking. A bit of a line-up at the reception, but they managed to process customers fairly fast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: aks120LasVegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as we were having our work Christas function and got a room for $35! This was for one of their newly remodled rooms and i must say it was great. It had everything you would want, the bathroom was good and the bed comfy. I also thought the casino itself seemed clean and inviting - for some reason I thought it would appear old but that was not the case at all. I would definately stay here again - and the view from the bar was spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “out of this world,”
Reviews.Author: morgyn
Reviews.Content: this is a fantastic hotel, the revolving restaurant has to be experienced, the food was great , service top class, rooms are very comfortable and clean, all the services you would expect in a vegas hotel are here, iconic building, great to say to friends thats where i stayed in vegas, as its always on tv. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “An attraction on its own”
Reviews.Author: Thiago_Rio
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere Hotel is really a great choice. I loved having unlimited access to the tower, one of the best places to view the city. And what a view! It really is breathtaking. Not to mention, of course, those crazy rides up there. I rode them all, and it was beautifully insane. The only one left out was Sky Jump, not because I wouldn't jump off a 109-story building, but because I found it expensive, considering it lasts for about 15 seconds. The room itself was clean and comfortable. Downsiders are location (not that it's that far from the other boulevard hotels, but it definitely isn't within walking distance; you can take the monorail or a bus), and also, the fact that i had to drag the luggage up to the rooms was really not cool, considering its a long way from the entrance to registration, and from registration to the central elevators - all in carpeting, which makes it that much more difficult. Overall, though, it was a good choice especially considering the room rates. Great value hotel/attraction.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: daisysgotitgood
Reviews.Content: Came down here with my bf for a 2 week work trio, unfortunately im still stuck here and counting the days. Rooms are gross, not throughly clean. service is horrible they put sheets in our room to make our own bed! The floor manager also literally harassed me out of the casino because i left my id up at the room but i wasnt even gambling, i was getting my key from my bf! found mold on shower hose, asked for a new room, and the other room was still dirty. I Call front desk about a new problem everday! They dont do anything. i also just got out of taking a 2 min shower because they shut off my water without even a warning!! Never again

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lilypr
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Las Vegas on a whim on Christmas eve and stayed at the Stratosphere primarily because my daughter wanted to go on the rides at the top of the hotel. We received a great deal but when we checked in the room was not ready but they offered an upgrade for $20 and didn't have to wait for it so we did that. The service is great and having unlimited visits to the viewing tour is a plus. Otherwise, I wouldn't have paid $16 to go to the tower. The stores in their retail section need a little boost as not too many people visit them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, just know some things before going...”
Reviews.Author: dentalhy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for two nights. Glad to know about the people that stop you on your way to register, avoid them at all costs. Registration was quick and friendly. We were on the 23rd floor. As the doors opened, there were two women right there by the ashtrays next to the elevator doors, smoking. Yuck. Our room was simple, yet clean. Comfortable beds and fresh smelling linens, however, smoke seemed to permeate the room. We asked at the desk, and she told us all floors are non-smoking. Really? I asked why there were ashtrays then. She responded so people don't smoke on the elevators! After searching, she offered us a room on the 8th floor, no view she said. In retrospect, we should have grabbed it. The rest of the stay was uneventful, except for people congregating at the elevator door to enjoy their smokes. Which seeped right under our door, right opposite the elevator doors. And of course, the noise level at that location is loud. We had friends in rooms further down the hall with no issues like ours. Luckily you don't stay in the room much. The Italian restaurant downstairs was delicious for a fast, but yummy meal. Watch when they say they will bring you garlic cheese bread, it is not included. Simple bread basket would have been fine, and not extra charge. The Stratosphere is quite a ways down the strip. We did buy the daily bus pass to make it easier. The casino was smokier than the newer ones. The drinks were far and few between, and not very good. The view at the top is amazing, night and day. Free when you show your room card. All and all for the amount we paid, less than $40 a night, it was okay. Just watch where your room is!

Reviews.Title: “Irritating SKIN RASH”
Reviews.Author: Pearson L
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Stratosphere for about 5 days. Had a great room with a strip view that was recently remolded and upgraded. All was ok until I developed a FULL BODY SKIN RASH, by day 3! I'm talking literally from head to toe! Turns out I am allergic to the detergent they use (according to the the desk clerk....I'm not known to have sensitive skin, however, I completely broke out!!! My husband had some itching as well. Also, we requested for our room to be cleaned twice on the 4th day and no one showed up! Probably won't stay here again. Oh, and if you have sensitive skin, think again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, will be returning soon”
Reviews.Author: Vince-b-ca
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding. The tower select rooms are great. There is so much to do and enjoy at the stratosphere I would recommend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mandy W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Stratosphere on a last minute trip to Vegas and it exceeded our expectations. The room was very clean and we were able to check in early. The buffet was excellent and there were many other dining options right there.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: It_must_be_clean
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute and got a great price. At the desk we were upgraded to one of the new Select rooms. The view on our upgrade was awful - LOL!! It was of the wall by the pool, but since it was a free upgrade to a nicer room - who cares! The room was gorgeous! Everything was brand new and clean. The best was the elevator service. It let us off on the Retail floor and was very convenient. (Inthe past we have had to take elevators clear across the hotel, this time it was right there and easy!). Love the free tower access, the shops and of course Roxy's!! Thank you Strat!! PS It is sad to see the Sahara close. I fear that "end" of the strip is slowly dying. I hope the Strat sticks around! We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel like the Plague”
Reviews.Author: AnjKumar
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel only for the price, the price was an avg. $75 per night on a weekend. having stayed there i realize i would have been better off paying an additional $20-30 elsewhere. i found the hotel to be very below average in all respects. the gentry is very lower mediocre. the entire hotel is shabby, except the rooms are clean. The casino is sad so are the eateries in the hotel. The tower is not even worth going to just a waste of time. i was depressed staying in this hotel, is costs $20-25 one way to go to the middle of the strip by taxi, the deuce bus takes 35-40 minutes to do the same. waiting for the bus outside the hotel only one though comes to mind "when would i be mugged."

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: silvalife
Reviews.Content: Whats not to like! Its priced decently and its a fun place to play. Plus you get free admission to the tower.... We had a room overlooking the strip and it was awesome to see the people jumping off the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option”
Reviews.Author: dipayanb
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good and spacious and the casino is lively. It is located at the far end of the Strip, but the advantage is that you are going to us the Duece, you will get the bus before it gets crowded. The views are good and the revolving restaurant on top, though pricey is worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “not our best visit to strato”
Reviews.Author: rogica
Reviews.Content: we like the strato, 8 visits now, spoiled this time by check in clerk, who was disinterested wouldn.t recognise our upgrade booking. we were in the north elevator. tiny bathroom tiny window. a shame that a check-in clerk can spoil things needlessly ? We have never had a problem checking in on our previous visits, and so were disappointed this time. All the rest was great as usual, especially the plates buffet staff.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired... but good value”
Reviews.Author: Diane78
Reviews.Content: Got a very large suite, at a very good price. No view to speak of. Room smelled very strongly of smoke even though it was on a non smoking floor ! I asked to be changed and they could not accomodate me. I guess it should be expected.... all of Vegas smells like an ashtray. The Stratosphere is looking a little tired and dated, but very clean. Check in was quite quick, quite organized considering there was 6 of us in 5 rooms. Elevators well situated, and never had to wait. Parking was complimentary, and pretty close. The hotel is at the very north end of 'The Strip', so bring your walking shoes. Lots of taxis and limos out front, and doormen very helpful to negotiate a good deal with a driver for you. We traveled by stretch Hummer for cheaper than 2 taxis. Starbucks at the base of the elevator a welcome sight every morning. The gym is like the rest of the hotel, a little dated, but all the machines worked and it was open 24 hrs a day and was free. Didn't really gamble much, so can't really comment on the casino. Internet was $12 a day, quite fast; why can't they just include this ..... it is 2012 ! Check out was quick on the TV in the room. Ate at Roxy's Diner for breakfast ... pretty good ... kind of like a Dennys. Ate one supper at Fellini's Restaurant...just OK .... kind of the same quality of an Olive Garden. One thing I found was a little cheezy .... there was no 'business centre' available to print off a boarding pass. When I asked at the condierge desk, I as told they could do it for me for $5 ..... c'mon .... it just cheapens the whole experience. Overall a good stay. The next time I will spend more money and stay closer to the centre of the Strip, but this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: kknac
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the new part of hotel so my room was spotless. The only thing is that it is way at the end of strip so everything is a long walk away. I did like, some people may not, that you could hear people screaming on their way down on the freefall jump off the top of the building. Slots are nothing to write home about; table games are nice with $5 and up minimums and the poker room is small but did offer tournaments. Bars in the hotel are nice with great views [the 107 bar]. Also their live entertainment, Frankie Moreno, is worth the $30 hands down a must see!

Reviews.Title: “Standout employee”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: Well run outfit with the usual amenities. A Vegas casino-hotel is in the business of providing lots of reasonably priced mid-level rooms to house the cannon-fodder for the casino and this joint does just that and does it pretty well. Blindingly fast elevators whisk you up and down, the top of the tower affords a breathtaking night view of the city and surrounding mountains. Standout employee was a Ms. Beasley at the check-in counter. Bright, informed, courteous,patient and attentive, it was a promising way to be introduced to the hotel. I make particular note of my experience with this employee as hers is a job that is too often handled by someone harried or impersonal - she was neither. Ventilation could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kerrie g
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic bargain. We stayed here just before Christmas, originally booked for 3 nights and extended stay by another 2 nights. I would recomend this hotel, very clean comfortable rooms. It was a little further from the Strip, but we paid only $247 for 5 nights for 2 adults and 2 teenage sons, a fantastic bargain for such comfort and a bit of luxury after staying in some reasonably comfortable inns. Will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lop24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is away of th emain street action, but is well worth a stay to enjoy its attraction, mostly Top of the World restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: Sean O
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times now. The casino and sportsbook are subpar when compared to the other hotels on the strip (especially the sportsbook). The rooms are good for the price. Nothing that would rate as "great", but we've also never had an issue with anything except some overzealous housekeepers entering the room while we were still asleep, though I'd assume that was due to some drunk kid flipping out "Do Not Disturb" card around. I would avoid the food in the 2nd floor mall area. I got a hotdog that literally made me vomit a half-hour later (I was probably asking for it getting a hotdog, though). Overall a good place for the price, but nothing special about it. Also, since the Sahara closed, it is far from the other hotels on the strip. We were feeling good and decided to walk down to the other hotels one afternoon and it took forever. One good note is that the drinks here aren't as overpriced as Bellagio, Mirage, etc.

Reviews.Title: “stratosphere hotel,las vegas”
Reviews.Author: krissafe
Reviews.Content: I and my wife visited las vegas in september 2012.We stayed in stratosphere hotel for 2 nites.The hotel was at a good location and had a fantastic view of las vegas.The rooms were clean and spacious.The bed was big for a couple.We visited several casinos,including the casino in the hotel itself.We had good chinese food near our hotel,.One of the tourist attraction was the peak of the hotel visitors can see the dazzling lights and view of las vegas.Hotel guest can enter the sky view free of charge while other visitors need to pay an entrance fees.The hotel also has several food outlets.

Reviews.Title: “2nd and better stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheShocker2012
Reviews.Content: We called on the courtesy phone a few feet from the ACE/PLAY desk and they applied the promo code to the MOST expensive night of our week-long stay! Super Awesome! This kind of "little thing" means the world to folks like us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms at cheap price”
Reviews.Author: nitishgupta
Reviews.Content: The search result will show Stratosphere among the cheapest hotel on the strip. Rooms are pretty good compared to the price. Rides and the view from the top of the tower is just amazing specially during night time. Few drawbacks, this the end point of the strip, all the major hotels are very far. There is no internet in the room, the shows and casino in the hotel is not that great. If you are not planning to drive to the main street every night, it would be a better idea to take hotel like Luxor which is not that expensive and has train connectivity to the part of the street.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stunna S
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere was the best hotel I have been to. The room was gorgeous, clean and spacious! the bed was extremely comfortable and huge! I've never felt anything like it. When you order room service they come quick!! It was nice and quite! The staff were great! I cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price Great Rooms Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: YHinshaw
Reviews.Content: My good friend and I visited Las Vegas in May of 2011 and stayed at the Strat. We were able to book 4 nights and 2 plane tickets for $600 bucks. We were in a regular room (I acutally think they are called Deluxe on the website) and it was a great room. The only issue we had with the room was the lack of a view. However, that was not a big deal because we were able to go up into the tower for free so we got an incredible view anyway! I have just booked another trip to Las Vegas (this time with my sister) and we will be staying in the Strat again. This time we booked through cheaptickets.com and will be staying four nights in a Newly remodeled Strat Select room. The cost for two tickets and four nights at the Strat in one of their nicer rooms? $517. That is an incredible value. The only bad thing is the flight times leaving Vegas but it is still well worth the value. For those of you concerned about the distance from the rest of the strip, believe me when I say it is not a big deal. There is a bus station literally right outside the front doors of the Strat. Take my advice, buy a 3 day bus pass and take the bus everywhere. This hotel is definitely worth the price. Also, the hotel is fairly close to Downtown and Freemont street which should definitely be on your list of places to visit while in Las Vegas. The buffett is good especially if you become a players club member (do this even if you don't gamble) you will get a discount on the buffett. The gambling at the Strat wasn't bad. I personally am not a huge gambler but there were some really fun dealers at the black jack tables and the Strat definitely has some of the cheapest tables on the strip. The tower is a great experience and the fact that you get in free as a guest of the hotel makes it even greater. The rides on top of the tower aren't free once you get up there but if you've got any inkling of a dare devil in you, you should definitley go on one of the rides! The diner in the Strat is a great little place that I ate at several times in the middle of the night. They have great food and great service. Overall the Strat is an amazing value, with great rooms, great staff, and a great atmosphere. The fact that it is at the end of the strip should not hinder you from staying here considering that the bus system is so easy to use in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LAtoEverywhere
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas every few years and we always stay at the Stratosphere. We have a car always, being from LA, so it works for us. Their garage is easy to park in and there isn't a lot of traffic in and out. The prices are usually the best in Vegas. We get their emails and recently took advantage of a special rate offered, which was a bargain for a very nice room with a view of downtown. We went to the tower during the day and at night, which we enjoyed. We ate at the buffet, which was fine and you get 25% off by showing your slot club card.
