There is a Burger King just around the corner, and a Carls Junior, and an IHOP right outside. There is a McDonalds in the hotel. And of course, all the other restaurants there are nice and you get a discount with your club card. The Starbucks seemed to be a favorite of the other patrons. I am surprised that many other people had concerns about the Stratosphere. What I can say is that things can happen. It is a huge hotel and there are all kinds of patrons in an dout. Don't sweat it or take it personally if your room is not perfect. Don't let it frustrate you or ruin your vacation. If your room has a big problem, ask for another one. If your room has a little problem, ask that it be corrected. When we first got in, I noticed the sink didn't drain well. I didn't want to deal with it like that for five days, so I called Maintenance. They came in less than 5 minutes, plunged it, and said goodbye in just a few minutes. It was perfect for the rest of the time. Some people don't say anything and then complain. If it bothers you, ask that it be corrected. If it does not bother you, then don't complain later. The towels were very nice, the linens were nice, the carpet was clean, the shower had power, the drapes were DARK and what more can you ask for! It is a reasonable walk from the parking lot. If you have trouble, use the valet service. If not, think of it as your exercise for the day and eat a little extra guilt free!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bruce F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the newly remodeled room and it was very nice. I did not have any problems with noisy neighbors. I ate dinner at the buffet one night. It was way overpriced for average buffet food. I would avoid it. They wanted $12 a day for wireless internet connection. I think not.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: dentongal3261
Reviews.Content: the plumbing is going out.. Also the distance now from the strip is very obvious with Sahara gone, The gambling was poor, iddn't see anyone win, like they are tyring to make up for the lower rate of staying there. Restuarant Ok Not easy to get anywhere else,, cab is esasiet, monorail a walk to get to thru not so nice area

Reviews.Title: “Good if you watch what you are buying.”
Reviews.Author: Anna P
Reviews.Content: The pictures of these rooms drew me in. When we checked in they were not as I had expected at all. We had an early 1990's room with a not-quite-functioning bathtub, very thin walls and simply NOT what was in the picture. We stayed in this room 3 nights and could hear our neighbor snoring and our other neighbor's conversations talking at regular volume. We came back 3 days later after looking more closely at the room reservations and chose the "delux" room (they have a different name at the front desk) and I was tickled to find a room better than the one in the picture. Upgraded sink and counter, new tub and tile, new flooring, new curtians, new lamps and furniture. This night ended up being our least expensive night to boot (because the first few days were during a confrence they said.) I was impressed with their towels in both rooms, very soft and thick, only two but they'll bring you more if you ask. Roxy's diner is what they serve 24x7 for room service and everything we ate there was awesome especially the grilled cheese/turkey sandwitch (HUGE and they give you two), hamburgur, omlette (so good!). But avoid their coffee (yes, terrible) and coleslaw!!! Fries were just ok. Frank Murino's show was very fun but way too loud the night we went, I plugged my ears the whole time, so that was a real bummer. Avoid the "Information desk" when you first walk in (if you park your own car and come in from the garage), they are fake employees and want to sell you time shares. Reception is all the way through on the other side, gotta walk through all the slot machines. Had a blast playing penny slots, the waitresses were timely at bringing our free drinks and we were able to spend about $10 each night and have MANY free drinks in the process. Over all we had a ton of fun and would come back now that we know our way around and know what rooms to get (still about the cheapest in town). They are farther away from the main strip but if you rent a car like we did you can park free in all the casinos on the strip. Or walk over 2 or 3 blocks to the monirail to go downtown. Oh and no bedbugs in both rooms, we checked, you should check any place though before you sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Itsciencefreak
Reviews.Content: We knew before we arrived that the hotel's location was not optimal if we were going to spend the majority of our time on the strip; just be aware that nothing in Vegas is as close as it looks, so it's a long, long walk to get to the core of the strip. Of course, you can always take the Deuce, which can be slow, but it'll get you where you want to go. The hotel itself is less than glamorous, but of course we didn't pay top dollar so we didn't expect to be treated to the lap of luxury. However, the first room that we were assigned was pretty dreadful with mold on the shower curtain and a very heavy smell of smoke. We complained in the morning and the staff very courteously assigned us to a new room on a non-smoking floor which was a vast improvement. The smell of smoke was still present, but it was not nearly as strong and the room was much cleaner. We tried the buffet restaurant on our first night and the food was not extraordinary, but it was quite passable. Keeping that positive experience in mind, we tried the hotel's 50's diner for breakfast later in our stay and it was disappointing. The service was slow, elements were missing from our dishes, our eggs weren't cooked properly and we were never offered coffee refills. Our recommendation here is go for the buffet, skip Roxie's. One big complaint is that the hotel charges $12/day for wifi access. Considering that you can go into a McDonald's in many towns and get free wireless, it seems archaic that the Stratosphere is still holding to this practice. Overall, the hotel staff were very pleasant, but the hotel is average at best.

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine”
Reviews.Author: FreeSpirit86
Reviews.Content: I guess with this hotel you have to know what you are looking for. I was looking for a hotel with a good deal, that I could feel safe in, that had a buffet, and also had slots. This hotel had all and then some. I stayed at the Stratosphere in August of 2011 upon my return from Afghanistan. It was me and another one of my female friends. I just wanted to come back and do a quick review of this hotel. It is at the end of the Strip I guess its considered hte old part of the strip, but there is a bus thats comes and you can buy 24 hr tickets. The hotel itself is dated but it was fine for us. The beds were big and comfortable. You could pay for the buffet breakfast and dinners they had there. there also were two restaurants in the hotel. plus a mcdonalds, starbuck, and like a wet willies place. there was a gym and souvinoir shops. as a treat to ourselves we aplurged a bit on the restaurant at the spinning restaurant at the top of the stratosphere it was really nice. In just being honest. I think for a first time visit. the stratosphere is a fine hotel. It was not full of the hustle and bustle as all the other hotels down on the busy part of the vegas strips. it was more homely. so after a long night of partying, i was actually really glad to come back to our hotel. you really will not be in your room that much at all, i really can't explain that enough. if you want to go to vegas to just be seen at one of the better hotels then this is not the place for you. if you want to save money on a hotel and have money to spend elsewhere, this is the perfect place. i honestly would happily book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve at the Strat”
Reviews.Author: Brendan B
Reviews.Content: I got a great offer for two nights (New Years Eve and New Years night) with my girlfriend, so we flew out and really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel was nice, the location was good for New Years Eve, and the views are 2nd to none. We started off at the top of the tower for drinks, and partied for New Years eve mostly at the main bar area after walking to the strip. I'm normally a Hard Rock guy, and I can say for the winter months, the Strat is hard to beat. It's very close to the downtown area too which is a huge plus. Good customer service all the way around. One lull in drink service, but other than that I'm a big fan. -Brendan- East Coast

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting bathroom”
Reviews.Author: HKDavis
Reviews.Content: Our bedroom was not as advertised, but it would have been fine if it wasn't for the bathroom. The bathroom was falling apart. The shower head was coming out of the wall, the towel bar was falling off the wall, the toilet paper bar was broken. And the worst part was that the bathtub was covered in mold.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice but the location is not.”
Reviews.Author: Fjola Dis M
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for 4 nights last November. The staff was nice and the diner (Roxy's Diner) is really cool. The rooms are pretty old but not too bad. The casino isn't huge but it has pretty much everything you'd want in a casino. The tower is really cool. We didn't like the location - the hotel is located on the north end of the Strip and we had to take the bus to get everywhere. The bus stops right in front of the hotel though but it would've been nice to be able to walk. The hotel is very affordable and you definitely get your money's worth. If you don't mind spending a little time and money on the bus/cabs then this hotel might be ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, but expect to not be around anything”
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: The room itself was one of the upgraded new rooms, and was quite nice. But it certainly needed to be for the additional premium per night. I had specifically requested a smoking room, but was given a non-smoking room, next to the noisy ice machine. The Casino was great, but there is not nearly enough to do in that Hotel, and the surrounding area is horrible. Not the best part of Las Vegas by a long shot. The staff though was quite friendly and helpful! My only real complaint was that we had specifically asked for a smoking room and were given a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age. Far away from most things you want to do.”
Reviews.Author: Sobby66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably nice in the 80's, but it's age is showing. The rooms are cramped, the stucco on the walls and ceilings are stained. We stayed on a Non-smoking floor, but it still smelled of smoke in both the hallways and the room. The A/C unit in our room never got the room cool enough (even though we were there in January). I realize we were in the desert, but you would think the hotel would have a humidification system in place. Both my wife and I had terribly dry skin, dry throats and near nose-bleeds from the extremely dry air. Finally, if the fact that they had hundreds of slot machines in the casino, the hotel STILL charges for wireless Internet access. In this day of being able to find wi-fi for free in the most remote towns, they still want to drain that last little bit of money from you. The only good thing I can say is that their slot payouts, while not huge, were enough to make $20 last an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing exciting”
Reviews.Author: CerbyLv
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing exciting, apart from the tall tower which allows you to see all of vegas. We got a room which was ok, but the bathroom was really horrible, it felt like entering in a very bad motel bathroom (they also put only 2 towels!!!). I mean, is it a 4 stars hotel?!? it was ok, nothing exciting, it is ok if you find a good, cheap rate, otherwise it is not worth it. The concierge, though, i think he was called Todd, was very nice and helpfull, he got us good tickets for a show, and in general he seemed sincerely enthusiastic and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fine bargain”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: This is often the cheapest of the megaresorts, and therefore is usually my choice in Las Vegas. Nothing's amazing, but everything is between average and great. The rooms are comfortable, quiet, and clean. As a coffee addict, I appreciate having a Starbucks in the casino, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & definitely value for money”
Reviews.Author: georgeon
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is at the far north end of the strip about 15 minute walk from the Riveria and Circus Circus hotels, beyond that it is another 40 minutes walk to the centre of the strip. So as you can see if you are planing to walk everywhere the the Stratosphere is not ideal. The good thing is that the Deuce bus stop was right outside the hotel and the buses were extremely frequent running all day and all night. The cost of a 3 day bus ticket was around $20 per person which I thought was good value as we were constantly getting off and on the bus. The immediate area around the hotel is not as nice as the rest of the strip but don't be too put off by what some reviewers are saying about the area it is safe enough. It seems that Vegas is going through a bad time with some of the original hotels going out of business, the Sahara which is nearest hotel to the Strat is closed and their appears to be signs that the Riveria might be next. The hotel it self was great, we were staying in one of the select rooms which apparently were recently renovated compared to the rooms in the other parts of the hotel. There were plenty of places to eat within the hotel but the main restaurant that stood out was the top of the world restaurant which was right at the top of the hotel viewing tower. The casino itself was as impressive as the others we went to as it is not as big and did not have a great selection of tables and video gambling machines. Personally I thought the casinos at the Pallazo, Venetian and Baily's were great (probable because I won money in them)! The pool at the hotel was very busy and lively, the problem is there are only around 5 sun umbrellas so if you arrived late to the pool your more than likely to be staying in the sun all day which is not good when you there in the summer. I would just like to say that the bar at the pool was great, they served amazing cocktails and food was great. The main feature of the hotel is the massive 300ft tower, one word “wow its big”! As guests you can travel to the top for free, we went at night and the view of Vegas and the bright lights was amazing. What else can I say about the holiday apart from excellent, I will definitely visit Vegas again but maybe next time I will pay a little more and upgrade the hotel to one that is more central.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent experience..”
Reviews.Author: kelly c
Reviews.Content: had an awesome time, the hotel is great and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid while you can”
Reviews.Author: MezMez
Reviews.Content: It is the place not to be in Vegas, room noise, wardrobe are small and terrible, not friendly staff at the front desk. When your in Vegas pick a better place and enjoy your stay but defenetly not this one

Reviews.Title: “Go to the top of the world”
Reviews.Author: cascatzBasildon
Reviews.Content: Vegas is everything you ever dreamed about and more, there you will find expensive and cheap from accommodation to food, one doesn't go with the other though and in Vegas you can eat, drink, shop and gamble where you want, I have stayed at the Stratosphere three times now, because all the hotel rooms are the same wherever you stay, unless it's a very expensive hotel. The Strat as everyone calls it, is a lovely hotel, for the ordinary person, with ordinary shops and ordinary food, but don't read ordinary as dull or tasteless, everywhere I have eaten in the Strat was excellent, the coffee shops are good and the hotel is easy to get around, unlike some of them where you can get lost for a month and never see daylight for at least 30 days of that month. The rooms are standard and clean, the bathrooms are the same and very clean and tidy and you hardly ever see anyone cleaning. There are rides at the top of the Strat and a lot of people visit these rides, but you very rarely see crowds of people, although the younger set are more evident here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nicola e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere in Dec 2011. The Stratosphere is a lively hotel with lots to offer. The tower restaurant has amazing views of the strip, we had lunch on our wedding day which was roughly $100 for both of us which is a bit pricier than other restaurants but that was with champagne and starter included. They have many attractions including, sky dive which we did and was amazing, the rides which were scary but fun and has several bars, shows and restaurants in. We found the staff competent and helpful at all times and the housekeeping was fantastic. Overall the hotel is further down the strip so is away from all the hustle and bustle ! We had a throughly enjoyable stay here !

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable hotel, but too far from other things”
Reviews.Author: Osakasenba
Reviews.Content: Reception staff was nice. Room big, albeit a bit shabby. Bathroom OK, but not very clean. 11th floor was quiet. WiFi chargable, about 12 USD. If you wanna see other hotels and casinos, this one is too far away. Surrounding area was not nice. It felt deserted, with a couple of suspicious types hanging around. There are in-house McDon., Mexican and Italian restaraunts and a diner. Ground-floor bar is OK too. For the money we paid (week-day) the hotel was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “You do get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Jayda L
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 5 friends for 3 nights. This hotel is at the north end of the strip and is probably the last major hotel on the strip, even futher up than circus circus. We had a twin room connecting to a corner suite, the room decor was a little bit dated , but other than that the room was clean. This hotel is a bit out of the way and to get to the action of the strip is about a 30 - 40 minute walk or you can get a taxi there in 10 minutes. The best feature is you can go to the top of the tower and look down the strip. For the price we paid this was a great hotel to party with friends and would return if on a budget again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for slots”
Reviews.Author: thenewval
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Select room, due to the decent price for a Friday and Saturday night (compared to other places on the strip). Room was a good size, but the bathroom was not too clean - the shower had multiple hairs in it, and the counter had a large smudge. However it's a great place for slots - I found them to be some of the loosest on the strip. As others have mentioned, it's not the classiest part of the strip. Nothing too scary if you've ever lived in a big city, but ladies please be cautious if walking alone at night - there were some shady characters out and about that made me feel uncomfortable when walking back to the hotel from the monorail station (less than a 10 minute walk) at 1 am.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!! Too far and you have to pay for wifi and rooms were not as described.”
Reviews.Author: estelle e
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too far from all other amenities on the strip. The hotel staff were rude to my sister and I upon arrival. The only good thing about this hotel is downstairs there are some nice restaurants to eat and there is of course a casino. I didn't like it how they said free wifi and when we arrived we had to pay 11 dollars for 24 hours per device ? In future, when I visit Vegas, never will I stay at this hotel again. It also took so long to get to your room. My sister tried to arrange a Grand Canyon day trip with the downstairs concierge and they were try helpful and hanged up on her. Despite all of the above, our trip to Las Vegas was amazing! We payed 180 a night and I have received better service in a hostel and 2 stay hotel than here... Think twice before you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: roxyrocks84
Reviews.Content: We did not stay here for the hotel. We went for New Year's Eve. At the Top of the World Restaurant they have a 5 course meal for $300 a person. At the 107 lounge they have hors d'oeuvres and a quiet atmosphere for $200 a person. They turn the observation deck (level 108) into a club. They put up chairs, a dj, and girls dancing. For $200 a person you get open bar from 9-12pm. The party ends at 1pm. The catch is that everyone has to go up the elevator to get there so you might have to wait about 30 minutes in line before getting there. Make sure to move right in front of the strip about 1 hr 1/2 before midnight. The fireworks are awesome. You see all 6 fireworks from other hotels and at the same time the Stratosphere is popping fireworks so they are coming down. The drinks are good, and we ate before getting there but there are so many hors d'oeuvres that you really do not have to. We stayed at the Bellagio and everyone said it would be a pain to get a taxi from the strip into the Stratosphere but it only took 15 minutes tops and it was regular price $12-$15. This was the best deal we could find for New Year's Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel a bit of a trek down the strip”
Reviews.Author: jack-is-back
Reviews.Content: Realy enjoyed our trip at this hotel. Pool area on the 8th floor very nice but the pool cafe etc was closed as we visited at New Year. The observation deck at the toer is really awesome and a freat place to chill especially with the free entry to hotel guests. We were upgraded on arrival and very happy with our room which had 2 flat screen tv's and a sep living area complete with sofa and chair. Housekeeping cleaned room every day and replenished toilettries etc. Quite good restaurant choice and a couple of eateries open 24 hours a day. Big parking lot with lot's of free parking. Staff all very nice. We also enjoyed the rides at the top of the tower. The only let down is the location as this end of the strip is quite run down now especially with the closure of the Sahara acroos the street. It is also a good 30 - 40 minute walk to the mid strip for the main hotels that you would want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time.. Extra CLEAN!!”
Reviews.Author: eastkentuckycat
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay and have to say it was amazing!! Stay away from Taxis they are OUTRAGEOUS!! We rode the Deuce everywhere.. It's honestly the best way to go!! Comfy beds, quiet.. An the best view in Las Vegas!! Walking distance to souvenir store, and ihop!! Loved the fact McDonalds was inside the hotel, an Fat Tuesday!! I totally recommend this hotel for a great all around value :) Definitely will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap cost...NOT near main strip”
Reviews.Author: needa b
Reviews.Content: Online it appears to be near the strip, but its not. There is a shuttle and bus that you can catch directly from the hotel. Both are relatively cheap. The tower is in a separate bldg....connected to hotel. Plenty of restaraunts, gift shops and of course gaming on site. Rooms were ok. But...you probably wont be in your room for long anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, no frills, but top of the world.”
Reviews.Author: CeeElEff
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate. No frills with a basic bed, bathroom and table. I was facing toward the parking lots which meant easier access to my car. It isn't as noisy as it may seem but it's pretty far to the back of the hotel from the entrance. Paid US$25 per night but it was fantastic value because I get to visit the top of the Stratosphere Tower for free, with a complimentary drink. Location was good because it was in the middle, which meant I could travel up north or down south. Bus stops are nearby so I could travel around easily within the Strip with a bus pass.

Reviews.Title: “Why spend a fortune on a room you won't be in!”
Reviews.Author: Carolinelomeli
Reviews.Content: I recently did a two day trip out to Vegas and just needed a place to crash for the night. The Stratosphere had one of the cheapest rates so I figured why not? The hotel is on the end of the new strip so you should definitely have a car or you will need a taxi to get to the action. I paid $38 for two queens and that included all fees and taxes. Keep in mind, this was a Wednesday night. This was also for the original rooms, not the recently remodeled ones which I have also stayed in. The older rooms are actually a little bigger which was a plus traveling with teenagers. The downside was the $11.99 charge for internet service per device. This was for a 24 hour period. Thought that was a rip off. The staf was friendly and helpful as well. A big plus to staying here was saving $16 per adult and $10 per child to go up to the 109th floor observation deck. It's included with your stay. HUGE plus! The view is amazing on a clear night and if you are not faint at heart, you can try one of the several rides up there. Our room was relatively easy to get to. No huge labrynth to traverse as in some of the mega resorts. Since we only slept there and were out 90% of the day, it didn't matter that we were not at a mega resort. Beds were actually comfortable too. I've stayed in five star and I can honestly say I slept just as good. So if you are just looking for something comfortable and accessible, this is the place. Don't expect too much glitz or glamor. You can get that at City Center. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Usually a great deal; good extras”
Reviews.Author: NewPlaceFan
Reviews.Content: We've stared here twice. It's at the very north end of the strip, so not ideal. The rooms are clean, tho, and the prices are usually about the lowest on the strip. The nicest part is that you get complimentary entrance to the tower, so if you haven't been up there or you have kids, it's a good choice. The restaurant in the tower is pricy, but it's a good experience to do once. If you do stay here and don't want to drive to visit things, you can "ride the Deuce" (a double decker bus) either down the strip or to nearby Fremont street.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: jenreyes02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our family. This hotel is a bit older and about a 15 min drive from the Strip. Like most Vegas hotels the smell of smoke is unavoidable. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Wi-fi will cost you $14 a day to use. there is a little food court on site with McDonalds, Mexican and a pizza place. We were part of a tour group so this hotel was part of the package. Would i stay here if it wasnt part of the tour? Maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “a kind of gud hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Shri0555
Reviews.Content: On reading Reviews and on hearing from friends we estimated that Stratosphere is sooo far from the strips.. but actually it is not if you have rental car with you. IF your local travel option is bus then u need to think twice to opt this place. For Christmas holidays we were at LV. Found a better deal a month before at stratosphere.. We asked for non smoking room and we got it. Room is kind of clean only and we cannot expect more for $40. Resort fee is there, but most of the hotels in LV charging that. The tower access is allowed till 2AM, its a added advantage. This hotel well suits for those who don't want to spend much money, and just want safe and clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, worth trying.”
Reviews.Author: diazt
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I are from Singapore and we went Vegas to get married in 2011 Nov. We stayed in Stratosphere Select rooms then. Location is kind of neither here nor there as it is a distance away from the bustling areas. It requires a trip of a few monarail stations to get to Strip and a few bus-stops to Fremont. Rates are reasonable, rooms are of decent cleanliness snd staff are quite friendly. There is a fee to enter the rides towers, however hotel guests are privileged to enter the rides tower free during their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Front Of House Staff Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Omeara06
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Las Vegas for New Years Eve and a week in Vegas. We booked the Strat because of the location and the tower. We spent the extra money to get a room with a view. But I have to say we were sorely dissappointed with our experience at the Strat. It began with checking in late on the 29th, were we were told we would be getting a room 'upgrade'. Great you would think. But after 18 hours of travelling I did not think to ask to see the room before we took it. What a mistake. Our room upgrade was on the 10th floor looking out on the air conditioning units that run 24 hours a day and the parking garage. We had paid extra for a room above the 14th floor. The air conditioning units run 24 hours a day and if you are a light sleeper you can hear them constantly. After two nights of not sleeping I went to the front desk to explain that I had booked a room on one of the higher floors. I was greeted by a man who's attitude was less than polite and he could only be less interested in our problem. He told me that because we had not booked directly with the hotel there was nothing he could do because we had already gotten a room 'upgrade'. He than was able to 'find' a room on a higher floor but could not move us because there was a block on moving rooms being new years and we would have to come back in 15 minutes to see the manager. We came back in 15 minutes and waited another 10 min and gave up and went for breakfast. Came back waited another 10 minutes to be told yes they could move us. But the room was occupied and that it would be after 2pm and to check back. We headed off for the day and came back at 4pm. This is when we got to meet Ashley Dion. She gives a new meaning to the word rude. We waited in line for about 10 minutes before we had the chance to meet Ashley. Upon meeting her I told her of our problem. Trying to be positive about everything. I had said that I did not consider the room an upgrade. She kept telling me it was an upgraded room. Were is it an upgrade if you pay extra for a view on a higher floor and then are put on a lower floor with the view of a parking garage considered an upgrade?? When I told her I wanted to see the room before we took it, is when her bad attitude got even worse! I felt as if I was doing the wrong thing to ask to see the room. When I came back down from seeing the room she was in the room behind the reception desk. I looked directly at her and made eye contact for about 3 seconds, she turned and went back into the back room where I stood and waited another 5 minutes for her to come out. When she came out she walked right past me and told me I would have to wait. When I called her attention that this had been going on all day and I just wanted our keys so we could get our luggage moved. It was slapped down on the counter like we were just getting in her way. Then it gets better. We packed up all our stuff and moved to the higher floor. Only to find out that the keys did not work! Back down to reception, where I told her the keys did not work. She looked at the key holder where she had written the wrong room number down. And said she had written the wrong number down, but I should have known it was the wrong number because I had been up to look at the room already. Keep in mind it is now after 5:30pm and we started this at 4pm! I had pointed this out to her and that I thought she had a very bad attitude. And this is my response I got from her. "YOU ARE JUST LOOKING FOR FREE COMPS! If you have a problem with my attitude talk to my supervisor and he will get you free comps!" At this point in time I just walked away because it was not free comps that I wanted. It was the room that I had paid extra for. When are hotels going to learn that their front of house staff is very important to how the guests feel about the hotel. All I can say is we did not let these very rude people ruin our holiday, but we made a choice not to gamble or spend anymore money in the hotel. We travel to Vegas every year or two for at least a week to ten days and we will not be spending our money at the Strat!!!!!!! I will be posting the view from our upgraded room shortly. We still have a few more days left here. But will be avoiding the front of house staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a bit far from center Strip”
Reviews.Author: Jean J
Reviews.Content: The room price, especially during "peak" time, are always very competitive at the Stratosphere. The renovated "select" rooms are much nicer then many older center strip casinos. The view from the tower is great and included with the modest resort fee. While quite big, I find the hotel did not feel "oversize" as several other mega resorts. Staff was extremely friendly. My two cons. The location. It is fairly far from the center of the strip. Walking to there is not very pleasant: the north of the strip has either closed hotels or unfinished (and probably never will be) constructions. There is a fee for Internet access, but at least it is optional, not mandatory in the resort fee !). Unfortunately, that fee covers only one device (fairly common when Internet is not "included" in some resort fee though).

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Sw02jco
Reviews.Content: Third time staying here. Really like it although a bit isolated now from everything but bus stops outside. Suite was very nice, and comped! Not cleanest but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price, best if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: kredenza
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on an Oasis Suite- it was very comfortable and clean. It was a very short walk from the parking garage to the hotel, and I loved that the elevators to the rooms were conveniently located- we didn't have to walk all the way through the casino to get where we wanted to go. The Stratosphere is definitely isolated from the other major hotels- I would not want to walk here. We had a rental car so it was no problem getting around. I think the only restaurant we tried was the buffet- they had a wide variety, but nothing had any taste. We would definitely stay here again if we had a car, but skip the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the "savings"”
Reviews.Author: Breana Z
Reviews.Content: We had our first Las Vegas experience with the Stratosphere Hotel. Our room was nice, going up in the tower was awesome, and the restaurant Top of the World was amazing. These three things are the only positives I have to say about the Stratosphere. The other couple we went with had a terrible room we weren't even in the same part of the hotel, nothing stayed pluged into their outlets, and their tv didn't work, none of the rooms have coffee makers (they would rather you spend money at the Starbucks located in the casino). The Stratosphere is in a terrible location, it pretty much ruined our trip. It's to far to walk to anything, even if you wanted to try to walk, I wouldn't if I was you, lots of homeless people and drug dealers in the area. Every cab driver we talked to said they recommend not walking around that area at night. So needless to say, to get to the actual strip where the other hotels are is about a $20 (one way) cab ride! To get here from the airport is about a $30 (one way) dollar cab ride. The money we spent on cab rides defiently outweighed the savings we thought we were getting by staying here. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, sorry Stratosphere. If it was in a different location I would be saying the opposite, it is just to far away from everything we weren't expecting to be taking cabs everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room was good. But....”
Reviews.Author: Mreiman2
Reviews.Content: There is nothing here. The location is in the "darker" side of town meaning not a spot you want to walk around in. The hotel smells from smoke and if youre on the 21st floor of the central elevator e smell is HORRIBLE. The staff here was helpful the choice of places to eat don't compare to any of the other casinos. My upgraded room was nice but I just wouldn't stay here again....ZERO nightlife in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is an average hotel. It's clean, it's big, the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are big and well equiped - and it works for staying a few nights at a cheap price in Las Vegas. The only "bad" thing I have to say about the hotel is the location. Although it is in walking distance of other hotels of Vegas (like Treasure Island, Venetian and Ceasars) it's not centrical, so to go to the Luxor you will have to take the monorail (that is free). So, in result, I would say that this hotel just makes a good work for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view , food average !!”
Reviews.Author: SnakeyandMarmie
Reviews.Content: I did not stay here but had a meal in the spinning restaurant . View is out of this world but food is average and overpriced . We have eaten there twice and will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hour at Lounge 107: Yes.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFlyerGuy
Reviews.Content: Here's the bad: I couldn't see myself staying at the hotel here and the casino is dated. That's my take from my walk through it to get to the tower, which was the reason I came. I wanted the view and that's what you get here. It's a tremendous view and at dusk it's beautiful. There's nothing like it in Vegas, and that's why this place is still in business. ...BUT, not everyone gets a good deal coming here. When you walk in, you're immediately presented a place to buy tickets to go up, but the trick to the stratosphere is that you can go up for free with a two drink minimum if you go to the Lounge 107, which is just above the top of the world restaurant. Throw in 2 for 1 martinis and half price appetizers for happy hour and I'll let you do the math: Single admission to the observation deck on 108: $16 Free admission, plus two martinis in Lounge 107 during happy hour followed by a few steps to the observation deck: $12 + Tip. That's a killer deal and the views are great (although not *quite* as good as in the restaurant), and it doesn't cost you an arm and a leg like it normally would to get up there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience..”
Reviews.Author: 2010new_traveller
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas in December 2011 and stayed at this place. It was a reasonably priced place with standard amenities. The room that we stayed in were "Deluxe" so strictly no frills. But worth the price so we dint mind. The tower has definitely good view of the city and the rdes are amazing. though we could not do all of them. The air bar was a nice place to sit and have a drink with your loved ones looking at whole of vegas. just amazing !! The casino has all the games available and so you actually dont need to go out for anything. Overall definitely recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: dond0528
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Dec 18-22 2011 I was not sure what to expect I only booked here because my wifes son and family were staying here. We reserved a tower room that has been remodeled. The room was nice, not very large verses the other hotels I have stayed at in Las Vegas but it was clean, modern and had a decent view of a dying end of the strip, I you are on a budget this is a great place but it is a little far from the action of the strip. It is nice that the traffic is not so bad in this area. Buffet restaurant was very good for the price $19.95 25% off with your players card also you get a free buffet for 400 points in a day and that did not seem to hard to get too. We also eat at Top of the World which is very over priced with a $50 min the view is great but not worth the price to me.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: the-green-eyed-kri
Reviews.Content: I would give Stratosphere 3 1/2 stars. We picked this place for the second portion of our Vegas trip (we stayed near the Grand Canyon in between) mainly because I knew I wanted to ride some of the rides on top and I though it looked interesting. I was aware ahead of time that it was not really on the strip, so that wasn't a concern. Getting to check in from parking was a bit of a pain as we found we had to walk through the entire casino first. The line to check in was long, but we most likely happened to get there at a very popular check in time. We got our keys and were on our way to the North tower, 20th floor. It seems they only had a few elevators that run to the North tower and there had to be about 100 people waiting around for their turn to get on them (and that estimate is conservative). The elevators were very small and therefore, few people could fit inside one with their luggage. I think we managed 5 in the one we finally got into (and it was a tight fit). We got up to our floor and to the room and when we walked in, I have to say I was very disappointed. This was certainly NOT the picture of the room I booked. Everything was very old and very worn. The bathroom was dirty, the tub had a layer of dirt all over the bottom and the paint was chipping in the shower. I was upset but also very tired so I wasn't going to do anything. My boyfriend, knowing he would have to hear about my dislike for the room the entire trip, called down to the front desk to talk to them. After about 10 minutes on the phone they said they would move us (and I have to admit my boyfriend DID mention that we would be posting a review on TA), apologized, and sent someone to show us to our new room. The guy who came was very nice. He informed us that the North tower was the only part of the hotel that had not been renovated and that the people who worked there refer to it as "the ghetto". He was very nice and talkative and we enjoyed our conversation with him. He assured us that our new room would be much nice and it certainly was. He showed us how to work the t.v., the channel that shows the people doing the free fall from the tower (live) and grabbed a map to showed us various places in the hotel to go. He also gave us some free ceviche for one of the restaurants upstairs (which we did not end up using). We were very happy in our new room, and my boyfriend was happy that he wouldn't have to hear me complain about being afraid to use the shower. The hotel, although out of the way, is very nicely situated. Infact, there is no reason to really leave it as it has everything right there. So if you're okay with not leaving it, then this place is great. We ventured out to the strip but I really don't think it would be walkable. We did however, find ourselves missing Tropicana (which we stayed in on our first leg of the trip). I think I just liked the ambiance better I guess. I loved going on the rides upstairs and was surprised at how late they stayed open. The view from the tower is spectacular (and included in room price). Although I would not go back to the hotel myself, I wouldn't dissuade others from trying it out. It is nice, but some places just suit people better-so its more a personal preference type thing. Costumer service came through for us, and anything other than the North tower is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: adammacd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of October/Early November for 7 nights. Let's get the small negative out of the way first. Because of where the hotel is situated you do get some drunks/homeless guys outside asking for money but coming from London it's not really a big deal they seem pretty harmless though. Could intimidate others perhaps. But I found it not to be such a big worry as some reviews may have suggested. Positives, I liked that it's at the top of the Strip. Whilst it means it's a bit away from the main part of the strip I found it a nice break from the hustle and bustle down near the Bellagio. It was nice at the end of the evening to have a break from that but still gamble in the casino. I had one of the Select rooms. It was nice and clean. The only negative is I had no view but I would upgrade to a higher floor next time. I was on the 7th floor. Rooms were quiet and I stayed there from Monday to Monday. Staying there the whole week gave a good insight on to how the casino changes atmosphere over the week. Having the shopping centre in the hotel is a big plus too. McDonalds inside, a hotdog place, and a pizza place, Also Dennys and Ihop are only a few minutes walk away. Short walk to the Monorail and the Duece stops right outside the stratosphere heading north and the stop to go south is just across the street. All in all loved it there. Loved that you are right in the middle of Downtown and the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: nscott6
Reviews.Content: Well not a bad hotel but could use some much needed updates. The bathroom was small and needed some fixtures that were either falling off or needed to be replaced. Bed was fine and TV was regular size. Pool was nice and hot tub was hot and in a very unique area on the 8th floor. Room was clean and maids came in to make the room up daily. A cool feature was all guests were able to ride to the top of the stratosphere for free(with your room key) but just be aware that weekends there are big lineups and you still have to wait. No free internet even in the lobby. Room AC still brought faint smells of cigarettes into the room. Alright, now to why I gave it a 3...it is a fair ways away from the strip but I knew that before staying here so we were well aware it was going to take a taxi ride to get to the strip...or even better the monorail was right behind the Sahara(within walking distance) and you could buy day or multi day passes for cheap. The room was cheap enough but as most traveler's, we had a late flight out of Vegas so we asked if we could get a later check out so we could still go see the sites but also come back to relax. They said late check out was 12, fair enough, but in order to stay longer, they required a fee($30) to stay until 3pm. A quick look online, I found another resort hotel, closer to the airport, and closer to the strip, for $16 a night. The entire night! So, off we went to the other hotel, which was much nicer, our own resort room, more square feet and an entire kitchen. Front desk at the Tuscanny gave us 2 for 1 dinner coupons and comp drinks.Smoke-free restaurants which is a huge PLUS for a non-smoker! A far better deal. Wish we had stayed here to begin with. ANd free interent in the lobby! The Stratosphere is ok, but there are better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Suzy B
Reviews.Content: We were given newly renovated rooms that were great. The bus was just outside the door to take us into the heart of Vegas. the veiwing area at the top of the tower was included in the room price and well worth the look. (even if you have to pay) The pool are was a bit basic, all concrete - but guess thats what you get on a rooftop. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mrzenned
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with our 3 night stay at Stratosphere, especially for the price compared to all the other hotels on the strip. The rooms are large, clean, have comfortable beds, and has all the needed amenities. The hotel/casino is about a 8-10 walk from the action but still on the strip and easy to stroll down or catch one of the regular buses. I used the gym each morning which was great, although we didn't get around to using the pool, time just flew past. The staff were all helpful and when I checked out I explained that I had problems with the wifi (connectivity was sometimes very slow), so was given the wifi I had used free of charge. Would happily stay here again if I visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay and found a awesome deal...”
Reviews.Author: Amit V
Reviews.Content: Had been here for 2 nights and 3 days - enjoyed the luxury of the hotel. Good rooms and has a Casino at the ground floor and some shopping options too. The best part was the rides on the top floor of the hotel and hence the name "Stratosphere"... Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielrams07
Reviews.Content: Actually, before I went to Vegas, I read reviews on what hotel to stay. I decided on Stratosphere. It is a very nice hotel. The room was very clean and the maids cleaned the room everyday. The only problem is that you are maybe an hour from the center of the strip, which means you will have to walk alot. Also, it is near a bad neighborhood so homeless people will come up to you and ask you for money. I also got my phone stolen. I was pretty pissed because it was an Iphone but it comes with the territory in Vegas. Very nice hotel. I had a big bed and 2 plasma screens in my room, which came in handy Sunday. They charged $7.50 per day to use the internet but if you have a smart phone you can go down to the casino area and get wifi. (smart) I would recommend staying at this hotel and just walking to the center of the strip. It isn't very dangerous. Be smart! Pay little for your flight and hotel then have fun while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, but the online deal was deceiving; watch out private party on the Tower”
Reviews.Author: camrybkk
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and quiet. We had a pleasant night sleep. If you consider this hotel, please watch out the following: 1. Dinner buffet package meant 2-for-1. We reserved a room for 2 persons with dinner buffet package. However, we were told that the package meant 2-for-1. If you go only one person, it meant you would have to pay full price plus an extra cost for the package itself. I confirmed this with three hotel staff and one just nodded and acknowledge this deceiving deal. 2. Don't bring a tripod up to the Tower even though you do not plan to use it. We were okay not to use it. We were told to return to our room and keep the tripod there first. We asked four hotel staff and no one accepted to hold the tripod for us, so we ended up walking back to our room. 3. Watch out a private party. The view was just okay. There was no 360 view because there was a private party. Of course, they did not tell you that. I guess the nice view was block for this private party. You may like to ask before you spend money going up. If you already pay for a resort fee, just go up anyway because it is included. Overall this hotel was okay, but we do not plan to return due to its deceiving deal.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Customer Service at Stratosphere Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kay D
Reviews.Content: I was completely surprised that the larger properties in Las Vegas (MGM, Ceasars Palace etc.) could not compete with the customer service found at the Stratosphere Hotel. The staff at the Stratosphere make you feel like family from the minute you arrive. They actually are quick in taking care of your needs, unlike any other hotel I visited during my stay in Las Vegas. The Stratosphere must treat their employees extremely well for them to be so pleasant to all their customers. I was extremely impressed. I do wish they would put coffee makers in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The best view from the tower!”
Reviews.Author: TheITGirlMK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very big. We were in the north part of the hotel and it took us 10 min to arrive to the front entrance. The room was nice and clean although we didn't stay inside much. It's Vegas after all. The hotel is somewhere in between downtown and the strip. The strip seems close but if you try to walk it will take you about 45 min. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel but the bus stops in front of every hotel and in the night hours it can take up to 35 min to the middle of the strip. There is a shopping center in the hotel but the choice of shops is poor. Probably the best thing is the free entrance to the tower which has the most amazing view of Las Vegas especially at night. Anyway the price is affordable and it matches the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EvaIosep
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we chose this hotel for our stay in Vegas. It is situated at the end of the strip, that's great as you are both near all the action and far from the big crowd. We took a select room which was great, very spacious, king size bed (very confortable), big bathroom... we did not choose the one with the strip views as for us it was pointless to pay 20$ more per night just for the views. Plus you have free entrance to the tower, where you can enjoy a great view of the city and a bit of risky fun if you like it. The pool is also nice to join. About the buffet I heard it's not the best in Vegas but it's still good enough, even more if you love mexican food! Another good point is having Denny's so close! where you can have an absolutely stunning breakfast! You won't regret your stay at Stratosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pillows”
Reviews.Author: caasiBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere was not that bad. The pillows are great but the shower heads need replacing. As a place to go to sleep at night it was fine but it is a long way down the end of the strip. This would be its greatest drawback. Our children love the rides at the top of the tower and the view from here would have to be the best in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: sisphoenix76
Reviews.Content: I always like staying here, It is clean and comfortable, and an affordable place on the Strip. Rent a car or prepare for cab rides, since it is on the North end and not near many of the other strip hotels and restaurants. Also we paid a little more for an upgraded room. Totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The best rides and entertainment, Frankie Moreno Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Tfenn6
Reviews.Content: We had a blast here! The rides are the best!! Nothing matches up to the adrealine rush!The food was great!! Frankie Moreno's show is worth watching at least all three nights a week, all 3 nights that he performs!! The Tower is Vegas size and memory making! You'll be ableto leave and be able to say you "partied like a rock star"!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What you Pay for and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Faytalm
Reviews.Content: My four day stay was very affordable, so I'd recommend it for those like me, who don't have a whole lot of money for the fancy, more extravagant hotels. But if I could have afforded better, I definitely would have. The rooms are okay and comfortable, but for a Las Vegas hotel to not have coffee makers, microwaves or small fridges in the room is post 21st Century, even most cheap hotels have that these days. Room service food was outstanding, affordable, and plentiful. Although the parking garage is free, there is no dedicated guest parking, so you're not guaranteed to park anywhere near the entrance to the hotel, as hotel guest, casino patrons, restaurant customers, etc... all use the same parking lot, we frequently had to park very far away from hotel entrance. As I said, I'd recommend it for lower or middle class, but if you can do better, I'd recommend you do that, do better than Stratosphere. And it is at the very end of the strip, so getting to the other hotels, casinos, restaurants, events, means either a very long walk, or you definitely need a car/taxi to get to other places.

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: Whimsical08
Reviews.Content: Great place for a quick stay in an iconic hotel AND the price was right ($36/night). Hotel was a little dated but the room was comfy and we had a stellar view of the strip. Room was nice and clean. i had no complaints for the price. Downside, locals tell you not to go wondering around after dark due to it being a bad area at night and it's pricey to get a cab to "new" Vegas if you don't want to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot, a little away from the hustle of the strip...”
Reviews.Author: AusiTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, and was very happy with the whole deal. Room price was cheap for 4 star property - the hotel has just had a re-vamp so room was good. Plenty of options for eating, with entertainment upstairs for teenagers (rides & bungi). The casino is small-ish but fine, given you can walk to others, and bus to the strip proper. That is the only issue, this at the top end of the strip, but 3 day bus pass for arount $20 gets you there and back as you require without much fuss. One point worth noting is there all manner or promises of discounts to do with the buffees & bars most of which don't work when you want to use them. Otherwise top spot if you want a haven from the bustle, but not for you if you want to be in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Probably wont use this hotel/casino again”
Reviews.Author: tonystewart14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the value. That value/price was the best part of the stay. And the singer in the restaurant was a crowd pleaser. Never received the microwave we upgraded to. And the fridge was only brought up after we asked for it(was also included in the upgrade). The rest of the room wasn't too bad, except for the hole in the sheet. Room service was satisfactory. Not really a great view of the strip as we were expecting from the 15h floor. Seeing the tower jumpers was a highlight. Restaurants weren't bad at all. Its a long way from the main casinos on the strip and the airport. But close to the downtown casinos. One of the greeters by the main elevator entrance mentioned she hadn't seen a jackpot hit there in years! Didn't gamble much there after that. And for some strange reason, the fire alarm kept going off. Employees didn't know why. Front desk had no explanation or direction. Called the 800# and got the same blank information. Pretty good view from the top of the tower of the surrounding areas. Top of the world restaurant was good but expensive. Over $110 for 2.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Stratosphere Hotel,Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jandm67
Reviews.Content: I'v stayed at the Stratoshere the last three times I have been to Las Vegas. I highly recommend it. The hotel offers a varity of activies,and is a very pleasant place to stay. They offer great coustomer service,and the rooms are spectacular. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning to visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “For the money-perhaps not bad-but you can do better if you care about room quality”
Reviews.Author: Williwillinui
Reviews.Content: It's far from other strip attractions, overpowered by smoke, could use some renovations, rooms are "motel-esque" and very out-dated, and the buffet is overpriced. The hotel is consistently cheap, though...so many people (especially families apparently) stay here. The casino was a good time-beware that the ATM will charge you 16.99 if you use a credit card. The debit card charge is bad as well, but not quite so atrocious. The shows at the hotel are pretty good though, the rides are popular (even too watch), the bars were fine, and the view from the tower is phenomenal. If you weren't staying here, it would cost money to go up to the top of the Stratosphere, but guests can go for free. Parking is easy and free. The check-in experience was good: quick, no line, no problems. The buffet was alright albeit overpriced. I don't think I'll be going back because it's so far from the rest of the strip, and taxis are too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: The_Froggy
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time my wife and I have stayed here, ideally situated on the strip there is a Duece bus stop right outside the hotel if you want to go to either Fremont St or the hotels at the other end of the strip, $7.00 for 24 hours travel, the hotel staff are all polite and friendly, the rooms are a good size and cleaned daily, staying here gives you unlimited free access to the tower saving $16 a time, and the views are amazing, my only reservation is they charge for WiFi, other than that I can't fault the place.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: foleyartist
Reviews.Content: The rates for a thursday through saturday stay were very good at the time of booking but what we didnt know is that there was a boxing match on at the MGM which bumped up prices considerably on the other end of the strip. The room was fairly clean apart from the shower head which was so mouldy the water would come out in different directions...you couldn't swing a rat, let alone a cat in the bathroom which was ridiculously small. Tried the 20 dollar trick for an upgrade at check-in but was told nothing was available. An OK place to stay if you are just going to use it as a base to sleep in. There is nothing around this area and it is not a very nice place to be in at night. One good thing is that the cocktail waitresses in the casino are very attentive, which is the opposite of our experiences at the other end of the strip. Also a trip to the tower which is included gave nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon dream”
Reviews.Author: Danny G
Reviews.Content: Hey there, My wife and I got married on may 21st, decided to spend our honeymoon in Vegas! neither one of us have been there before so why not? We were kinda on a budget since our wedding was expensive but could afford staying at The Stratosphere, almost at the end of Las Vegas Boulevard where everything is going on at all times so it was perfect if you wanted to get some rest from all that after a long day of walking and gambling. they have a casino downstairs, The attention was superb, the maids were humble and really nice, i tipped them well 'cause they deserved it, they work really hard (I worked at Hotels before so I can relate to their job) The room we got was incredible, really big but cozy, our view was not to the strip but the the Mountains which was better for us (We are nature freaks haha) the staff was always on top of everything. In all, i'd recommend you stay here if you cannot afford to stay in the middle of the Strip where The Caesars, Wynn, etc are located.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay - wouldn't mind staying again”
Reviews.Author: Natalie_S1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated not too far from Las Vega's main area. Had a 3 night stay NOT GOOD: I don't have much bad to say there was a bit of a smell in the corridoors. We encountered a late night fight/argument occur in the corridoors, disturbed one nights sleep. The rides at the stratophere were over-priced considering the ride only lasted seconds. The restaraunt is VERY expensive and the food quality /flavours were not that appetising considering the cost. Internet costs. GOOD The view was amazing It was free to go to the top of the stratosphere whilst staying at the hotel. The rides were unique and exhilirating. Great location Breakfast had many options available and was value for money considering the numerous options and level of service available. Was nice and clean Bathroom was nice and clean Rooms were comfortable as we were sharing and spacious. The restaraunt rotated which was a unique experience. The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to try and help. Definately value for money. Generally I would recommend this hotel especially if you are on a tight budget. Thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hour at the Top of The Tower”
Reviews.Author: Craig C
Reviews.Content: We went on a whim since we live here we only go to the Strip when company comes into town..... 2 fers..... Martinis and appetizers. Happy Hour. Order the drink at the regular price and get the second free....kinda. Order an appetizer they'll bring 2. The view is always worth the effort and the food was just a cut above.....If you don't go for happy hour then expect to pay for the ride up. We haven't been to the Stratosphere in years, it used to be ratty and run down. We were impressed. They have redone the property nicely. As for the drinks and appetizers..... we thought it was a pretty good deal with a great view. And as an added bonus people kept jumping off the top!! Right in front of us.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: SAT1234
Reviews.Content: It was my 2nd visit to LV and 2nd stay at the stratosphere and this experience was worst than the 1st one. To mention few:- 1) Room looks dull, unattractive and feature less (e.g. no coffee machine). 2) Cleaniness was a major concern, bathroom was showing signs of ageing, was small etc. 3) It was a non smoking room but was smelling terrible. Not staying for the 3rd time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: colinottawa
Reviews.Content: I visited Las Vegas over the American thanksgiving weekend to attend a wedding of a friend. I searched the internet and all the hotel sites about 6 months in advance and could not find a better deal for my 3 night stay. I got a 40% discount off the regular rate on their in house website. Averaged $78.00 per night. I stayed in the select tower of the hotel in the recently re-modeled rooms. The room was clean and comfortable and are built well so you don't hear much hallway noise at all. The check in process was reasonable considering the amount of people that were checking in at the same time. (approx. 15 mins) The valet service was very fast never waited more than a few minutes to get my rental car brought up tp me. The casino and the sports book staff were very nice and helpful. The views from the tower are impressive and it is free for the guests of the hotel. Another thing I like about the casino at the Stratosphere is they have blackjack tables that have a $5.00 minimum bet so you can have fun and enjoy playing without breaking the bank. The hotel is located a little north of the "strip" but I enjoyed not being constantly in the very large crowds on the street. It is not as flashy in that area but I never felt unsafe in or near the hotel. In fact there were quite a few families with kids staying at the hotel. I can't comment on the food in the hotel as I did not end up eating there during my stay. The location is pretty much right in between Downtown "Old Vegas" and the Strip so you have easy access to either area. I enjoy gambling in old Vegas because the casinos there have lower minimum bet tables and games.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: rgredfern
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I would like to thank Daniel E (GSR) for his amazing customer service at check-in. He was kind, sincere, and professional. If all guest service reps were like him, the traveling would be far more enjoyable. We've heard bad things about the location of this hotel, but we couldn't resist the price. The Stratosphere is located at the north end of the strip, which is a little run down and there are homeless people milling around, but if you can tolerate that, the hotel is definitely worth the money. It is a little far from the main strip, but you can get a 24-hr unlimited pass on the Deuce(double-decker bus) for about $8( http://www.rtcsouthernnevada.com/transit/route/). Rooms were updated fairly recently, and were nicer than expected. Like all casinos on the strip, they charge for internet usage. The fee is per device per day, so I would recommend leaving the laptop at home...you're in Vegas, you don't need it. If you need anything, the concierge can help you. Overall, the Stratosphere was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for $17 a night!”
Reviews.Author: han-pan89
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here when we were travelling around America, we got the room for $17 so we weren't expecting that much, the room was nice and big, 2 doubles, bathroom and tv. A really comfy room, we had a view of Freemont Street which was good! I liked how you got coupons for the tower attractions and discount off the buffet- very enjoyable! I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_in_the_city
Reviews.Content: Located at the north end of the strip, area was a little dodgy. Checked in late due to traffic and we were told that due to the late arrival, the non smoking room we had booked and received confirmation for 2 months in advance, was not available. We were told that only smoking rooms were available. Too bad if you're an asthmatic or have any other objections. The room was on the smaller/older side, and bathroom so small it only allowed for a half-size bath and toilet. The door barely had room to swing open and due to the tiny size, the sink is located outside pretty much next to your bed. I wouldn't t say the room was clean. Strange brown stain on the bathroom floor, cigarette burn mark on the toilet. We turned on the aircon due to the suffocating old cigarette smoke smell in the room, it sounded like the engines of a Boeing, so we couldnt sleep. Decor was tired, amenities decent, towels rough, no free wi-fi.. It is not included in the resort fee. At 9am the next morning, room service knocked on our door asking to clean the room even though we were due to check out at 11am. I felt this was very unprofessional. I really am trying to find something nice to say but the only thing I can think of is that it was cheap. A good example of getting what you paid for. Would rather pay a bit extra and stay at a place that isn't so cheap and nasty

Reviews.Title: “Free admission to the Top of the World makes worth while”
Reviews.Author: UtmostCreativeMind
Reviews.Content: When you check in, you would notice that even the cocktail bar is not as pleasant as the ones at other hotels. Too dim and not inviting at all. However, we checked in late and didn't have time in the morning to go up to the Top of the World to enjoy the view. Since the purpose of the trip was business and pleasure combined, we had to take care of the business part first, followed by the prompt 'check-out.' Later around the magic hour, we wanted to go up to the top. And we told them at the ticket desk that we already checked out but wanted to check out the top. And they granted our wish, which saved us $64 for four of us. Nice. Also, on the side note, when we checked in late, they encouraged us to upgrade to the rooms that are filled with 'new' of everything, furniture, TV and such, in spite of the fact that part of us, men, didn't notice a thing, but female co-workers complimented the condition with the 'new' stuff next morning. When we checked out, we learned that the upgrade wasn't charged with extra, which definitely makes me want to go back there again on the next visit. Yes, Stratosphere is a bit away from the center of the Vegas Strip, but if you don't mind driving the strip up and down a little, the whole view makes it worth while!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Safest Place.”
Reviews.Author: Pike57
Reviews.Content: The rooms and food were fair, however, I had two bad experiences during my 4 night stay. The first was in the front of the hotel around mid-day. I was verbally assaulted by a vagrant when I declined to give him a dollar. Not just a curse word, but he followed me into the valet area shouting obscenities at me. No staff in the valet area assisted me. The second, and the most troubling, was at the main casino bar around dinner time. A panhandler came up behind my seat and asked for a dollar, as he placed his hand on my shoulder. I gave him the buck, since my cash was on the bar. He then strolled around the bar and exited the building through the valet area. This lack of security will keep me from returning and from recommending the Stratoshere.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet reviews”
Reviews.Author: darren g
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews, decided to try the hotel for the price. Check in went fast, no complaints. Got up to the room, it was small, toilet sounded like a spaceship when you flush. Heard noise in the hall thru out the night. Not impressed to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay at the End of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: arvalera
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two during a coach tour of Las Vegas out of Los Angeles. The room was a little small considering there were two queen beds. Beds were comfortable and room was quiet for a restful sleep. Bathroom was spacious and clean. With the room card you get a free access to the tower for a magnificent view of Vegas and the Strip. The hotel was at the extreme end of the Strip which required transportation to the action. On the other hand, the hotel was free from the hassle and confusion of the Strip. The hotel has several restaurants and a Starbucks restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RecaLondon
Reviews.Content: Everything great here. Basic rooms were fine. Beds very comfortable. Rooms quiet and able to get a good night's sleep. Was not the most modern hotel, but that did not matter as it has a good atmosphere. Staff were polite and can definitely recommend the Sunday Champagne Buffet! Eateries in the hotel were fine and there was also a Strabucks, so could get my fix of Blueberry muffins and hot chocolate! No real criticisms. Agree with other contributors that it is right at the end of the strip, but the Deuce bus is fine and runs a frequent service up and down the strip. I just loved Las Vegas and if I went back would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mfb77hd
Reviews.Content: Only drawback of staying at the Strat is the location, have to bus or cab down the strip, but the cost was great and having access to the tower was awesome, so made up for it in my eyes. Remodeling was going on in several areas, but overall, facility is in great shape and everyone in our party enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights on honeymoon-the rooms & beds themselves are spacious and comfortable although the bathroom could have been a little cleaner..one flannel was stained with makeup & there were hairs wrapped around the plug....hmm. As other reviews have mentioned this one is a little out of the way-definitely not walking distance on a hot day no matter how fit you are! The deuce bus does stop right outside though-a day pass is around $7 and the bus runs 24 hours,a taxi to the Luxor end of the strip will cost you about $15. The rest of the casino is fine,clean and well lit & definitely not as smoke filled as some reviews would have you believe,with plenty of places to eat & shop.The area around can be a little shady at night much like any big city,i was wary about the entrance as some reviews have mentioned shifty characters lurking around the doors,but we didn't see or get bothered by anyone unsavoury,in fact we found there was more of this at the 'nice' end of the strip than downtown! All in all a reasonable place to stay if you're not planning to spend a huge amount of time inside your hotel,but at the end of the day if you're in Vegas & spending all your time shut up in your room,you're doing something wrong.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: CJTorres
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere Las Vegas over the weekend of Veteran's day. I was a hectic and crazy week because there was a city wide convention and a professional fight happening however thes staff never lost the welcoming smiles and professionalism. Great job! I would stay there again after their renovation is complete. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Decent and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: freshmonkey
Reviews.Content: Our friends were staying here, so we joined them. We stayed in a newly renovated room, so I haven't seen the older rooms in the hotel, but this one was nice and clean. Our view was pretty terrible (parking lot) so we asked for another room but the place was fully booked. Our room was far from the entrance and the restaurants weren't great, but it's tough to complain when the rates are so reasonable! We dined in the revolving restaurant upstairs (worth it for the view and the "bungee" jumpers flying off the side!) which was our best dining experience at The Stratosphere. Overall I'd recommend it if you're in Vegas on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Affordable with Extras”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoddessofAAA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strat for four nights in October. There were three of us and the room - while not extra roomy - was perfectly satisfactory. The beds were comfortable and we had enough space to put our three suitcases. I would have liked to see a bit larger bathroom. The sink was outside which was helpful, but the tub and toliet were very tight. And for some reason the tub was extra high and you really had to make a hurdle move to get in and out! They do have newly renovated and upgraded rooms available. But it is Vegas and how much time do you really spend in the room? Probably the biggest obstacle - as with all Vegas resorts - is how far you have to hike from the parking garage to your room! We were at the far end of the wing away from the parking. We figured out the best way to get to our room without going thru the casino and all the smoke - I know, it's a casino but I just can't stand the smoke! You park on whatever level of the garge, but near the elevator and go to the skywalk or ground floor entrance, take the first set of elevators up to your floor and then walk the half mile hallway to your room! Staying at the Stratosphere gets you up the tower for no charge. Great views, fun bar and scary scary rides - those you have to pay for. The location of the resort is at the far north of the true strip, but if you have a car - it is easy to drive the strip - or Frank Sinatra drive just parallel - and park at the any of the resorts - which is free for self park and just a few dollars for valet. Our favorite parking garage was at the Bellagio. Not only was it mid-strip and easy access, it had a water fountain on level two! This is a major thing in the land of Vegas. If you don't have a car, the bus is just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms and too far from strip if you dont have a car”
Reviews.Author: EagerTravler
Reviews.Content: This hotel boasts new updated rooms - We didnt get one. The decor was tired and very 1980's. Towels were threadbare and TV remote did not work - even when we had new batteries put into it. We were on the 20th floor in the North Tower. We had a view of the carpark from a small window and nothing more. Most of the night you heard the trains passing through. However as a cheap place to lay your head, go for it. If you are looking for something special - I would look elsewhere. You can get WIFI, but you have to pay extra for it. This is free in other hotels so I used to wait till I got to the Venetian or MGM before I checked emails. We never stopped to play or eat in this hotel. As parking is free in LV at all the casinos we always went out for that with the car. Next time we will probably just book in the main strip where the extras are included. Yes you pay a bit more, but at the end of the day it probably evens out, and the rooms are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room priced right”
Reviews.Author: FurryMiker13
Reviews.Content: Was priced right. Check in was easy. Room clean. We went every night up to top to see lights. Chicked out on the rides but they all look pretty cool. Drinks up top a little pricey but hey the view is great. We walked lots and used tram and bus. Vegas was great never a negative vibe for the 5 days we where there. Hotel was excellent deal when packaged with air.

Reviews.Title: “would stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: boat07
