Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with this place. The room they gave us had personal items from a previous guest in it. They did give us an upgrade when we told them about it after we asked for one. The halls were extremely noisy when we were trying to sleep. They did have some interesting attractions at the top of the building and the view was amazing. One time here was enough though, not a place we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of The Strip from Observation Deck!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_addict_girl1
Reviews.Content: I traveled MARCH 2010! This hotel is situated towards old town Las Vegas. Some would say it's a badder part of town. For me as a single female traveler, it wasn't so bad. Like any place in LV, you will get the odd stare and it might not always feel safe, but it is a great place to sleep. It was quiet, and the the room was very spacious. The bus stop is literally just outside the hotel on the street and I wish I knew that earlier. It's great to walk down The Strip and look back at the hotel. If you stay in the hotel, the ride to the observation deck is included in your room charge. The ride up was terrifying, as I'm scared of heights. But being on top, seeing the whole of Las Vegas lying in the desert, and seeing the famous lights is an absolute must! For all you crazies out there, I definitely suggest to do the rides on top of the tower... It is hell terrifying! Be careful when on the bus and going out of the mainstream tourist area... I wan't to go see some lights graveyard, I'm not sure of the name now and got a little lost. Had to wait a little while for the bus to get back and there was this hell of a dodge guy that came walking up to me in his maroon velvet suit and started talking to me... only in Vegas! When you are a single female, ALWAYS pretend like your husband is waiting for you somewhere. It can get you out of pretty sticky situations. Overall great experience in the hotel. Reception and Concierge were very friendly and helpful and I loved the American Superstars show. Elvis was so handsome, smiling and winking at me! :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Stratosphere Hotel (The Strat)”
Reviews.Author: Citygirl1218
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that is not close to the busy strip, than pick the Stratosphere. It is located at the end of new Vegas and the beginning of old Vegas. You can get on a bus right outside the hotel entrance to get to the main strip. There is plenty of things to do at the Strat. There is a large shopping area on the second floor. The tower has the best view of Vegas from 108 stories above the strip. There are 3 rides located at the top of the tower that are for the daring at heart. There is a large casino area in the main lobby and some great restaurants. It would have been nicer to be closer to the action of the strip so I would had been able to people watch from my room but instead I was able to watch sky jumpers leaping from the 108th floor of the tower. The only downfall of the Strat is that when someone would leave their room, the doors would slam very loudly. It was wonderful to wake in the morning and see the mountains outside my window instead of another hotel. I would certainly return to the Stratosphere because I had a great experience with the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rugby_Park_Bird
Reviews.Content: One of our rooms was lovely, spacious, clean and very comfortable. The second room (a twin) was much smaller and the bathroom was tiny and the air con unit was ancient and very noisy. We paid to move to a better standard of room, it wasn't much bigger but the bathroom was bigger and the room had been recently refurbed. It was a real hassle getting the room move though. The reception staff insisted that my mother had to be present at reception, they wouldn't let me pay and sign (even though the booking was in my name). They insisted on seeing her passport (even thought she had presented it when we checked in orginally). Then to top all that off, the receptionist sent us off to the 'select elevator', only for us to carry our bags there and discover it was out of order. We've since found out that work colleagues had phoned the Stratosphere to try and arrange for a bottle of champagne to be sent to our room (it was my friend's 60th birthday) but they wouldn't do it without having the room number (too much trouble to look her name up). The breakfast buffet was fine and if you sign up for the Casino's loyalty card you get 25% off. The hotel's at the far north end of the strip and it's a bit seedy at that end but the deuce bus and express bus are just outside the hotel so getting down the strip or to Freemont is easy (if quite slow because of the constant traffic and slowest traffic lights ever).

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Rati83
Reviews.Content: The room was little small but they were clean and nice.but the restaurant at 108th floor was awesome...u can see the entire vegas strip..excellent cafe available 24 hrs a day .its little far off from main strip but the bus service is very convienient...if uou don't wanna eat in rest then local food joints are available in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: sweethearttx
Reviews.Content: I went for a group trip, we are all in our 30's. We were upgraded to a remodeled room due to them not having our rooms that we reserved. There was no view to write home about but the room seemed clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were not spotless but they weren't dirty either. It was reasonably quiet, and noise controls were enforced late at night so that guests could sleep. We ate at Roxy's Diner in the casino every day and very much enjoyed the food! Yes, it's a bit north of the main strip. But we were able to walk to the strip just fine within about 20 minutes or so the first day. After that we took cabs or the bus. There is a bus stop nearby and you are also within quick walking distance of the rail. The tower is awesome and you get unlimited trips up when you are staying at the hotel. This was nice because we got to see the city at night and during the day. I'd recommend staying here! But if you want to be in the heart of the strip, you might pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (sometimes)”
Reviews.Author: R J
Reviews.Content: Rooms (particularly "bargain" accommodations) offer no "view" at all. Furnishings are sparse. The Stratosphere is poorly located; too far north/east of the main "strip" and too far south of "Downtown" Las Vegas (vic. Freemont Street). Sadly, Las Vegas seems to feel visitors should make up for the financial deficiencies of the area, even though a primary source of revenue has always been those same visitors. While seniors are offered half-fare bus transportation (just show your Medicare card), that no longer applies on buses traveling the "Strip" where fares now exceed $3 one-way. Further, fares for using the monorail's limited service have increased substantially (currently $5 one-way). The closest monorail station (Sahara Station) is a healthy walk from the Stratosphere. In times past, you walked through the Sahara to reach the station, out of the weather. Now, the Sahara is closed. As a regular visitor to Las Vegas, I recommend choosing any of the "major" hotels on the "Strip" or, if you have your own transportation or can afford repeated taxi fares, considering hotel/casinos along or near Freemont Street where you can enjoy five or six free showings (each hourly "show" is different) of "The Freemont Street Experience."

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: AArtster
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our recent 3day/2night experience at the Stratosphere! Valet "Tommy" was very personable. The Top of the World Restaurant was simply Fabulous! The Portabello Mushroom/Buffalo Mozzeralla/Red Pepper appetizer was excellent and so was the Lobster Bisque as well as the NY Strip. Our waiter Jorge, and Manager Robert, went out of their way to us feel special. The Oasis Suite was clean, and extremely comfortable! Received a great discount on our show tickets, and were expecting nose bleed seats, then ended up in the center orchestra section. Overall we could not have been more pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for the day”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaConcierge
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Stratosphere for yesterday since my hotel could not accommodate late check out. I was able to reserve a very inexpensive room to use as a jumping off point for my last day in Vegas. The Casino and registration area was very nice and well appointed. The room I got was a standard two queen 10th floor with a parking lot view which was just fine considering it was under $50.00 We had a blast in the 107 lounge and the observation deck and rides were not to miss!

Reviews.Title: “Low price not worth the misery I feel right now!”
Reviews.Author: Wallaan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere last week for 4 nights. The checkin was very fast and service good. That's where the good experience stopped. The room is just okay (and we stayed in an upgraded room). After the second day I noticed a couple of bumps on me but didn't think too much about it. By the last day I noticed and felt these horrible, itchy bumps all over my arms, hands, back and even on my head! I've traveled and stayed at all different levels of hotels, but NEVER have I gotten bed bugs before! I may have saved a penny or two, but it wasn't worth it. I'll never stay at Stratosphere again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price....NOT ON "THE STRIP"”
Reviews.Author: therodgerses
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Stratosphere this past weekend - there were a couple large conferences, so our property choices were limited. For the price, it was fine - nothing special in the room, but our intent was only to sleep there. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean, the lack of a safe was a bit of a pain, but we dealt with it. We had 4 girls staying in the room, and had no trouble getting extra towels and toiletries. The beds were comfortable, and again, you don't go to Vegas to hang out in your hotel room. The C Lounge on the main floor had great service (and all you can drink martinis from 5 - 9 pm....danger danger). The Sky lounge provided a breathtaking view of the city and strip, and happy hour with live easy listening music from 4 - 7 (2 for 1 martinis and half price appies) The people at the information desk were amazing. The staff on check in were average - perfectly average; neither helpful nor rude, but efficient. Yes, as some people have mentioned, the stratosphere has that lingering smell of smoke, which you don't get in the newer casinoes, but it wasn't like it knocked you over or anything. I did find the casino to be quite dark though, again, in comparison to some of the larger properties. If you're looking for a reasonable place to stay, you'll find it at the Stratosphere, but be prepared to take cabs to the real action.

Reviews.Title: “Win ! Win !”
Reviews.Author: katyfrom
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Stratosphere was once again relaxing,full of entertainment and good food.Very affordable and the hotel staff was there for anything we needed.Located further down the strip is what makes this hotel a little more relaxing.but still close enough to indulge in all vegas has to offer.The rooms have been renovated recently and are very comfortable.I really wish the pool/hottub area would stay open longer as it closes at six..resort fees are 7.50 a day but you never have enough time to enjoy what you are paying for therefore I do feel that they are grabbing your money and not giving much back in return in regards to these fees.All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great price. Ok location”
Reviews.Author: MonikaFabianska
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the stratosphere with two friends because we found a great deal on Expedia for flight and hotel. The room was clean and nice. Sufficient if you aren't going to be in the room much. The location was on the end of the strip but easy access to a bus if you want to get to the center of the strip and don't want to walk a mile to get to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Michael999719
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this property because of reviews I had read but I was extremely pleased with the quality of the room for the price I paid to weekend nights for $123. The room was clean the beds were comfortable had a good view. The entire casino was clean and well kept. We ate at two restaurants the food was good but overpriced. The view from the top of the tower is outstanding. I do not recommend the show Bite! It bit.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING TIME”
Reviews.Author: ross_j186338
Reviews.Content: just got back from the start on a stag do (we were the only stag do there) and had a blast, good food, efficient friendly service and hot girls in the double down pit who were really nice too and grant on the bar offered great advice and was a cool guy. everything catered for and would recommend to anyone, we were a group of 10 lads from wales and are thinking of going back to vegas to watch the mayweather pacqiou fight (if it ever happens) in may and will be booking stratosphere

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location for SEMA & pool redone nicely”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: Last year I was really upset that we were made to pay a resort fee but the pool was closed for renovations. This year I was happy to see the pool was actually open from about 9am until 4:30pm daily even in November and it was a very nice pool area. One complaint about the pool is they take their time opening a few minutes after 9am in the morning but try to kick you out at 4:30pm when it says the pool hours are until 5pm clearly posted and confirmed by the front desk. If you want to close the pool at 4:30pm, then clearly change the hours instead of turning off the music every day at 4:30pm and walking up to people and telling them the pool is closed! The rooms were redone and my only complaint vs. last year is now the fridge in the room was missing and that was nice to have last year. Otherwise the redone rooms are nice. The rate is hard to beat for SEMA and it isn't even that far of a walk if you miss the mid-day lack of free shuttle service to/from SEMA and Stratosphere. The internet service I was not happy with having to pay $11.99 for 1 24 hour period and then have it completely unusable for 2 prime hours (4pm until 6pm) on November 3rd, 2011. I had asked for a partial refund for the huge inconvenience and I didn't even bother to get back online after that but I have yet to see any credit come through. That is my one complaint and warning about the internet fee and it's actual usability. Thankfully internet was FREE at SEMA thoughout the week instead.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: SVL_2011
Reviews.Content: Booked my room through vegas.com for 2011 sema show. Thinking I got a deal! I did not like the surprise daily resort fee that I had to pay when I checked in. There should be FREE Internet WIFI All the upgraded rooms like the one I had should have a mini fridge My room had no luggage tray There should be a TV guide for all the channels on screen or paperback. Could not locate either one. I did like that my room had a safe and big enough for my laptop; I think all rooms should have that. The AC was ok but could be colder; I had it at the lowest temp but just not cold enough. Extreme smoker’s odor in the casino area, I could barely breathe in some areas, might want to improve on the air quality system in the casino. The initial room reservation I got on the 5th floor was not that great!, just a view of a wall on the roof of the casino area, I got offered a upgraded room on the 17th floor with a view of the tower and city for 15 dollars more per night, Could of given me a better deal than that but the main reason I took it was because it had a safe and was able to place my laptop and digital camera in it, and it was non-smoking. The Classic Roxy's diner was ok! Ate there one night, could be cheaper though. Everything else was ok! I enjoyed going up in the tower, it would be nice for new years eve Im sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates with Southwest Air Combo”
Reviews.Author: bdagley
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about staying this far away from the big casinos on the Strip, but this place has a lot to offer. And thanks to Tripadvisor, we bought bus passes and were able to get around to the Strip and Convention Center just fine. We upgraded to a suite upon arrival and were very please with the price, room size, cleanliness and amenities. The 24 hour room service came in handy as well. The entire staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. And did I mention the combo deal with Southwest Air was killer? Unless you must stay at the Wynn or Bellagio or one of the other "5 star" resorts, the Statosphere is worth your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “great views but u could get a better deal”
Reviews.Author: shishirsukant
Reviews.Content: we had booked a non smoking room but on arrival we were informed that non smoking rooms were not available and were forced to pay extra. Finally the room we had was really nice with a lovely view of the strip. the buffet was a good value for money the casino too was nice . but u are almost out of the strip and the room is not much use as u r not in Vegas to stay in your room . So when we made a trip to the rest of the hotels on the strip we realised we sure could have got into a better hotle for similar prices .

Reviews.Title: “Smoky and extra fees”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: First, we were dinged with a resort fee which was not shown on our booking or when we compared rates. This should be illegal. Second, when we arrived they did not have the two non-smoking rooms that we had booked. Why did they take our reservation if they weren't going to reserve the rooms? They said that they were giving us upgraded rooms on a smoking floor (22 I believe) but they had just been redone. They did not look like they had just been redone. The bathroom vanity in both rooms had scratches and chips and the rooms smelled of smoke. The next day they moved us to non-smoking rooms that were exactly the same, but on the 18th floor. Never been to a hotel that didn't offer an in-room coffee maker. The casino air was smokey and made our eyes water. Strange that the more crowded casinos further down the strip (Caesar's Palace and The Flamingo) had cleaner air. They need to either crack down on smokers or upgrade the air cleaning system. Why do they charge a resort fee and not build it into the price quoted? We arrived and find that our trip costs more than we were quoted. This is shameful and should not be allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: andybCardiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the strat for two weeks from the 02nd of October and had a great time.the hotel is a bit further up the strip than most things but that means it's closer to freemont st!the casino is bright and spacious and the buffet was well worth the money with plenty of choices.we upgraded to the select rooms and were well impressed.the rooms were really large,well decorated and also had a spa bath big enough for two :-) the only negative with this hotel is it's away from the majority of hotels shops ect so less of a police presence which means you do get ropey men and women asking you for a couple of dollars.I'm a big skinhead lump so they didn't bother us but they will bother smaller couples and also even women on there own which is a bit intimadting but they do take no for an answer.it's not a huge issue but If they cleaned up the area a bit more they could charge a lot more.I would recommend it to anyone we had a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, not so much to eat at; great first night.”
Reviews.Author: beachjunkie1980
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Las Vegas, we went for the sema show (which was awesome) we arrived on Halloween. We booked 2 rooms 4 adults one of the rooms was available at around noon when we arrived, the second room wasn't ready yet. Not a big deal we just left our luggage in our other room. They were put on the 9th floor in the north wing and had a view of a/c units and a parking garage. We were told our room would be available before 3. We went to eat the lunch buffet ($70.00 for 4 ad.) They had a good variety of food, kinda bland but hey, I am from Texas. About 2:15 I went to check on the room it was ready we were on the 22nd floor and it had a great view. That night we ordered room service a Turkey pita with garlic parmesan fries, I was a little tipsy from the awesome time at Freemont st. after a few bites of it I started to feel nauseous. Not knowing weather it was the alcohol or the food, I decided to just sleep it off. I woke up feeling woozy long story short. My husband and I got sick off the Turkey pita. The 3rd night we went to eat at Roxy's diner and realized it was were that pita came from and needless to say we bolted. We went to the pizza and ice cream shop on the second floor near the tower entrance, we ordered a calzone and it was perfect for our sour stomachs. A+ The daily cleaning service was pretty good exept they threw away the $22 cups I wanted to keep from the luxor show (criss angel) which wasn't worth the $102 6th row tickets we purchased but the $64 tickets would have been more like it. An added benefit was the store at the casino level was open 24 hours. The gift shops were reasonable priced, we broke even in the casino. We booked an awesome deal through travelocity. I wouldn't recommend using their bell shuttle transportation services because they will leave you stranded. We had to pay $40 for a taxi after the shuttle left us without a ride in which we had to call 24 hours ahead of time to make reservations for the shuttle. BELL transportation offered me a refund for there fees only. I'm willing to try other shuttles services, but man it's hard to run with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Remodel/ Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: selrahc1967
Reviews.Content: I stayed September 2011 for 6 Days. The hotel has recently gone under a remodel and it shows, the rooms are nicely appointed with flat panel tv's and new decor/bedding. The Hallways & Lobby have been redone as well. The rooms were very clean and everything worked great. The beds were comfy and it had everything I needed to enjoy a nice stay. I had VIP check-in which is a very nice private room. I had 2 rooms reserved, when I first got there the check-in person was very nice and handled everything great. I was allowed to check-in very early to one room (11:40am) and was told the other one would be ready later. The check-in person asked me if I wanted to put a CC on file, she advised I did not have to being VIP and they would just turn off amenities ( I chose not too because I stayed there for a week a couple years before and they charged a hold of $50.00 a day to my card which was a pain and held up about 20% of our vacation budget). When I came back to get the other room about 4:00pm it was a new person and they refused to allow me to check-in to the 2nd room without a credit card. I explained to him the previous gave me an option and I just want the amenities turned off. He was very rude and just said no. no no. After going back and forth he threatened to call Security on me. This all happening in the VIP lounge with me as a VIP. After all was said and done he was wrong, not seeing my reservation was pre-paid he was wanting a card to attempt to charge me again. He eventually just gave me the room key. Keep your doors bolted, The maid service walked in twice on us!!!! They knock once and immediately open the door. I brought this up to the front desk and they didn't care, they were just like "Oh Sorry". The maid service also did this on my 2nd room that friends were staying in. If you do not have a car this stratosphere may not be good for you, it is not walkable to the strip and the bus that runs down can get crowded and take 30-40 minutes to go down on a crowded night. We had a rental car so jumping in and going down to the strip is easy, all the hotels have free parking so we just parked at Imperial Palace at walked (Imperial Parking Garage is kind of odd but it's the closest walk out to Las Vegas Blvd, most of the newer hotels you have to walk 1/2 a mile to just get from the garage to the street)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, nice the tower access”
Reviews.Author: mandma
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel nothing special, probably a little too expensive. The location is far from the strip (you will not go walking from there). Our room was pretty old and with no view of the sky at all (windows opening in front of a wall), the personnel was not much friendly at the reception and swimming pool either. The access to the tower is anyway something very nice, to do at night and daylight; unfortunately the restaurant on the top closes quite early, so you have to go to the ground floor, where bars casinos and many other stuff lies together in dark and freezing ar conditioned halls. The swimming pool is a much better place to relax (listening to loud music).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, rest was only 'okay'.”
Reviews.Author: Coopergreg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as part of a trip to where we also stayed at New York New York and the Monte Carlo. The main reason for staying here was to get free access to the tower so we could go up in the day and at night. I stayed here previously in 2004, but it does seem to have gone downhill a bit. The staff were great, but it definitely seemed to be a budget bus tour hotel. It is a bit out of the way of the main strip, with a number of unfinished hotel/casino's inbetween. We stayed in a Stratosphere Select room which was recently refurbished very tastefully and to a high quality. There are limited restaurant choices - a 50's style diner that served mostly burger type food, and an italian that was fairly expensive. There are plenty of fast food outlets, so first night we grabbed a pizza and ate in our room, and the second we got a taxi down to the main lively area of the strip ($15). The room prices make the place attractive, but we'd recommend paying a few dollars more and staying further down the strip (i.e. Mandalay Bay to Treasure Island area).

Reviews.Title: “Good price, nice rooms, average location, slow check in/out”
Reviews.Author: Gus L
Reviews.Content: First location: Is not in the middle of the strip so you need to walk a lot to reach the heart of the strip but we had a car so for us was not an issue (most hotels have free parking in the strip so you can move freely around the strip without worrying about parking fees). Price: Was very good with a promotion we received by mail. Checking: Long lines, slooow check in and staff not that friendly. Rooms: We get a free upgrade of our room for 3 nights and was very clean and beautiful. No issues here. We left our digital camera in the room, noticing this just after the check out... took about 2 hours of waiting between the manteinance staff and security to get our camera back. If they speed up the check in/out process and the staff complete some customer service training to be friendly then I can say this will be my choice to stay every time I go to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy R
Reviews.Content: My family had gone up to Las Vegas and stayed 14 nights at the Stratosphere, and we enoyed our stay. The location is pretty close to the strip, very much so within walking distance. We enjoyed the service, everyone we had passed by was very friendly and helpful. I also enjoyed the fact that they had a mix of dining options. We had enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “cost-benefit”
Reviews.Author: Alfccs
Reviews.Content: I agree with profile 'hope1979' "The problem is that, in a city like Las Vegas, it no doubt pales in comparison to the many other lavish hotels. You get what you pay for here...". Unlimited tower admission (see the view from the top of the tower, sunset is amazing) and all rides there.The room was clean and quiet. Staff is friendly and always helpful. There is a 24h coffee shop downstairs and iHop (crossing the street).

Reviews.Title: “Little Issues Kept Haunting This Stay”
Reviews.Author: plat123
Reviews.Content: We knew this hotel was a good price, at the end of the strip and weren't expecting a 5 star hotel. The facilty is adequate but it really was the service level we recevied that turned us off. One exception to this was the bell staff who were teriffic. After a long wait at check in, I had to get back in line as my husband was parking the car and the room was in his name. I understand this policy so we looked past that. When we got to our room it was next to the elevator and we litterally thought a helicopter was going by but it was the elevator. When the bellman brought our bags he told us we should get another room as most people don't stay in the room due to the noise. We could not understand why this room is rented without a disclaimer as you would need to be very hard of hearing to stay in this room. We called the desk and they indicated there were no more King Rooms left and we would need to pay an upgrade to a Jacuzzi King Room. We agreed to the $15 a day charge as we couldn't stay in the room. My husband had to go back down and make the switch and paid with a credit card they had us put on the room for any charges. When a different bellman came to do our room switch he also indicated he didn't understand why they rented that room. The new room was much quiter. We left for the evening and had a great dinner off site. Upon our return we went to the top of the tower to have a drink. We didn't realize to get a drink would require going through security and waiting about 20 minutes..but we understood. However when they wanted to take my picture to sell me afterwords I had to refuse. Once at the top we enjoyed the view and atmosphere, however the drink quality wasn't up to our standard. When we got back to our room we had a message from the bar that we didin't have a credit card on our room and they couldn't charge our drinks. I had to call the bar and then the front desk to straighten it out. This was better than their suggestion of me going back to the bar...through security to pay for the drinks. Then my husband found in the bathroom urine stains by the toilet that had not been cleaned, the TV remote batteries didn't work and there was a hole in the sheets. Again all these little things just kept adding up. My husband called the desk to complain and they indicated they would send someone up with batteries but they didin't. In the morning before we left we called housekeeping to ask them to check the batteries, area in the bathroom and sheets. We even cleaned a spot in the bathroom to make sure it wasn't just a stain..and it was not. Upon our return non of this had been addressed. We called the desk and spoke with the same manager as the previous night and he then sent someone up with batteries and someone to clean the bathroom and change the sheet. THey did take the upgrade charge off at this point. The sad thing is all of these things could have been avoid with the proper management processes so becasue of this I would not recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Average price, average room”
Reviews.Author: SJDK21
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for with this hotel, the rooms aren't great, and the bathroom was dirty when we first arrived but having only paid £35 a night for the newly refurbished rooms you wouldn't expect much more. The location isn't great at the end of the strip, however it is only a short walk to the monorail. One of the main problems was that we were on the top floor, which at first sounded great, however we had very high ceilings which made the room seem cold and unwelcoming. Overall it was a standard inexpensive hotel room which served its purpose to allow us to see Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: sblackmon
Reviews.Content: Third time staying at the Stratosphere, and we will continue to go back. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The casino is the right size so that i don't loose my husband in the crowd. The buffet has very healthy choices and the food is always good. Become a VIP with the Stratosphere and get treated very special. The Stratosphere is on the far end of the strip but there is the Deuce bus for $3 a day that runs back and forth every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: hope1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't a run-down shanty house like many other reviewers make it out to be. The problem is that, in a city like Las Vegas, it no doubt pales in comparison to the many other lavish hotels. You get what you pay for here, and I know for a fact that the deal on Priceline is ridiculously low. It's at a somewhat isolated end of the strip, the casino is a bit tacky and the whole downstairs of course reeks of smoke. The rooms aren't terrible, they are quite average, and the meal we had at the diner was fine. Nothing was remarkably out of place, and nothing was remarkably great either. I wasn't surprised nor disappointed considering the price. It's good value for money -- and if all you want to do is gamble and have a good time and lay your head in a reasonably clean room for the night, it's a great bet. The service and attitude of the employees were generally good and I have no complaints. Overall for us, though, it wasn't our style, but I can see how it may be a good choice for some.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little far from the action”
Reviews.Author: alexandramir
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean, not new but well kept. The room and bed was very comfortable. Good value for money. You really have to go to the top floor. AMAZING view. The only less positive aspect is a bit far from the center of the strip (if you are walking). Average swiming pool, but water whith to mutch chlorine.

Reviews.Title: “Never had service like this before”
Reviews.Author: SamScream
Reviews.Content: My best friend was in an horrific car accident near St George Utah. He was life-flighted to Las Vegas (UMC) and I immediately drove from Salt Lake to be with him and offer support. Of course I had no reservations. I had stayed at the Stratosphere before and it was great so I stopped in again. RON LOPEZ at the reservations desk was amazing! It was a Friday and they were "sold out", but he worked with me and hotel management until he found a room and worked his best to get the room cost to something I could handle. I have NEVER had the kind of caring and support like I experienced from Ron and the Stratosphere staff. My friend is still in ICU and I am headed down again this Saturday. Guess where I'm going to stay. Thanks to Ron and the Stratosphere staff for going out of your way in a very tough time for my friend and me. Unbelievable service and I thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Xilocyde
Reviews.Content: My friends told me that this hotel was nice so i tried it..the strip view was horrible the only view that u can see is the bottom rooftop..the room was horrible no fridge at all, most motels have fridge in the room but this hotel doesnt have any in there regular rooms..the bathroom was the worst the bathtub holy cow the floor is really dirty..the worst part when i called them to book a room they told me that i need to pay this,the total is this uou need to deposit this..so i did..when i went there to pay the rest they charge me more than double..i didnt even use te internet or watch some movies..i just need the room to rest and to sleep..worst hotel i dont wanna go there anymore

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: arnie321
Reviews.Content: So me and my wife stayed for 10 nights at the Strat and enjoyed our stay.. So much so we have booked 14 nights next March. The biggest moan most folks have is it's location, it's not that far from the main centre strip we enjoyed the walk after breakfast each morning, most location complaints come from the exercise shy overweight people. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel and your closer to freemont etc

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mariele S
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel for the price! The room was nice, clean and quiet. Only wifi isn't free in the hotel :-( Otherwise we had a great stay and i can recommend the hotel! With the Shuttle Bus it is only a few minutes to the other hotels (one advise: use the express bus at peak times!) and also to Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian54
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best part of the Stratosphere was the pool area, pretty live action just about all day. Otherwise the hotel is very average. It is on the north end of south, actually not a very nice neighborhood so we did not really walk outside. Getting to the strip you need a car or transportation, too far to walk. Getting to see Vegas from the tower is a very good experience. We did not like the restaurants on the hotel and tower, overpriced for our taste. It is a very large hotel, we got our room on the opposite side from the poolarea and parking carage, so we had to walk daily a lot just to get to the car or the pool, Rooms are good size and well kept and clean. No special in the hotel, but enjoyed our stay there mainly because of the nice pool area there.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time At Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: RhondaV
Reviews.Content: This was my and my husband's 5th trip to Vegas and our third stay at the Stratosphere. We chose to stay here again because it has always been a nice hotel for a great price. When we arrived to check in we did not have to wait very long and were checked in with no problem by a friendly person and got the type of room that we requested. Upon setteling into the room, I notice a big HOLE in the wall between the main part of the room where the bed was and the bathroom. It looked as if someone had punched a hole in it or something. I could not believe we had a room with a hole in the wall! I called the front desk to report is as I did not want them to think we had put the hole in the wall. They were unaware of the problem and noted on my account that I had reported it. The person who I spoke to thanked me for reporting it but that was it, no offer to change rooms or anything. It was not that big of a deal I guess, it's not like you could see through to the bathroom or anything. Other than that the room was great. Lots of space, nice view of the mountains, comfy bed, and great housekeeping service. We went to the pool and spent one day out there. I was lucky and got the use of an umbrella. The bartenders were super friendly and fun, great drinks! The only restaurant we ate at in the hotel was Roxy's Diner. No complaints. I also went to Starbucks a couple of times. Usual Starbucks, always good. Overall It was a good experience, the hole bothered me a little but I got over it. I would for sure stay at the Strat again.

Reviews.Title: “OK place, but not what expected.”
Reviews.Author: ralebe
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip sort of last minute and was able to get a pretty decent package deal by combining the flight, hotel and car together, so the Stratosphere had about the best price. Let me just say that I'm not a gambler, nor do I smoke or drink, so my review may not be as fair as some others. The hotel was just ok, my room had been remodeled a few years ago and looked clean, but the bathroom didn't look like it had been refurbished, it still had linoleum and what looked like the same old countertop and tub. I hate smelling cigarette smoke, so just walking through the lobby and casino is horrible, but I expected that and dealt with it. The Stratosphere tower is great with an awesome view, the Italian restaurant was good, valet parking was convenient and fast. Other than that, it's nothing fancy, but reading other reviews, I didn't expect it to be and if you like to drink, gamble or smoke, you may like the place and not really care about the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: jodcha
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, it was an ok hotel. But some improvements needed. the phone did not work when i called another room and i cannot receive calls from another room as well. Hotel was clean, the shower was not strong enough, but my room smelled like a smoking room. Only booked for one night so didn't plan to ask for a new room. Dont think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dippy69
Reviews.Content: Lovely room all the staff were very helpful and polite Johnney Rocket's Diner was fantastic brilliant holiday

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay In Vegas !!!”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Me and couple of my friends stayed in this hotel. We had a pleasant stay at the hotel. Front desk staff, housekeeping staff were very good and helpful. They also have a tower to go on the top and see the view from the top of the tower. If you are a guest of the hotel. You do not have to pay to visit the tower. So everything was very good. If I go back to Vegas. I sure will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but smoky casino and far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: HiddenHelper
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel from 10/11/11-10/14/11 for a conference. It was my first trip to Las Vegas. My room was on the 15th floor and was very nice. The ironing board is a little awkward with the iron leashed to it, but it worked. The bed and the room temperature were comfortable. Housekeeping was good too. On one day of our conference, up on the 24th floor, they turned the water off so you couldn't use the water or bathrooms. They didn't give us advance notice either. That was a pain! Plus, if you're not a smoker, the smell of smoke in the casino is much stronger than other hotel casinos I visited on the strip. There is a decent selection of restaurants at the hotel and a Starbucks. I ate in the diner one a couple times (good for soups, sandwiches, light meals), the buffet once (not bad for a buffet--lots of selection and not real expensive) and at the Italian restaurant once (a bit pricey, but the lobster pasta with asparagus was delicious!). If you have one of their casino player cards, you're entitled to a discount at some of the restaurants. If you want to get to the strip, you're looking at about a $20 cab ride, depending on traffic. If I returned to Vegas, I wouldn't stay here. It was fine for a conference, but if you are there for the nightlife, try a nicer hotel on the strip. The view from the tower at night was awesome. If you go, don't miss that!

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDy352
Reviews.Content: I love the staying at this hotel. The staff is very friendly and always helpful. This hotel is most fun with the thrill rides at the top, from our room you could see the sky jumpers it was awesome. The bars are great the C bar was hoppin playing the best music and the Air Bar was spectacular with the best views and a great DJ our group had a blast at both bars. The buffet was great also but the place I like to eat the most was Roxy's diner, the staff is great and the food is wonderful very fun atmosphere. We also went to see BITE which was very interesting and thrilling it is a great show. The room was very clean the beds were comfortable extra pillows in the closet.. :) great! This is the hotel I will stay at when I go to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “An "Ok" Property”
Reviews.Author: maple1
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere marks the end of the North end of the strip. The surrounding neighborhood has suffered from casino closings, lots of empty buildings. The hotel is nice, modern and clean. The hundred story tower is the big draw. My major issue with the hotel is the stench of smoke. I could not figure out if the vent system is bad or there is just a lot of smokers. The updated rooms are nice, place is clean. Buffet was good, food was hot. I will warn you of the "resort" fee of $15 per night. I had business to conduct and was shocked to find a wireless fee of $11 per day !!! There is a Starbucks down the street with free WiFi. If you self park look for a long walk with your luggage. I can really see nothing that stands out with this property....it is just average. I am worried the surrounding neighborhoods will get worse as time goes on. The Sahara just closed and I can see the businesses suffering. You better have a car or rent one....this hotel is not near anything. There a lots of properties in Vegas with better resorts, better food and better locations, unless you get a great deal or comps I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “All wasn't lost”
Reviews.Author: Theodore P
Reviews.Content: Initially I was booked at the Howard Johnsons down the street (see review). I quickly booked the stratasphere on priceline for a great deal. For the price (less then HoJo) this hotel was an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price--Far from Main Strip”
Reviews.Author: ladykat81
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the very good price from Travelocity. The hotel is nice. The Staff is very helpful in person and on the phone. Everything within the hotel is nice. But the area where it is located is sketchy, day and night. The homeless people come at you full force. It is far from the strip. If you are an avid walker and walking to the Strip is no big deal, then this is the hotel for you. My first few days there, I was done walking. My fiance was okay with it. He noticed that I was over the walking and decided for us to get a cab the last few days there. The cab fare is $10 to the strip and $10 back. This is the type of hotel meant for those who just want to sleep; not for those who want bring the party back to the hotel and party all night. The hotel also has Starbucks on-site for the coffee drinkers. There is a McDonald's upstairs - a big plus if you are hankering for a quick bite. Also, remember to go up to the tower and see the city from up there. The view is amazing espcially at night. It is an experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Flawless for the Price - Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: Got a killer package deal on Travelocity, so we thought we'd give it a try. Was very, very pleased with the experience at the Stratosphere. Got one of the recently renovated rooms on an upper floor, and it was awesome - it actually looked just like the pictures posted on their site. Room was clean, functional, nicely decorated, and aired out. The bed was fantastic - big cushy new mattress with high quality bedding and lots of pillows. And maybe I just got lucky, but the hotel seemed quiet for all four nights I was there - no amatuer young drinkers stumbling and "woo-ing" up and down the halls, and no objectionable noise to speak of from the street. Elevators were fast and kept spotless. The casino was a lot of fun, and seemed to have a wide variety of patrons (everything from Jersey Shore candidates to Midwestern types). I wouldn't say the slots were loose per se, but the money seemed to last a bit longer here than on other places on the Strip. Drink service was good - the drinks were weak as water, but they kept them coming quickly and were very friendly. Actually, all the staff I encountered, from the cleaning crew to the conscierge, were very friendly and efficient. And while I think the $8 per night or whatever they charge for a "resort fee" is lame, it does include unlimited passes to the tower observation deck, which provides a surreal view, night or day. As for the location... yes, it is kind of isolated. But if you plan well and are prepared to shell out a bit for the bus, monorail, or taxi, you'll be fine. It's probably too far to walk to the "good" stuff on the Strip, and I wouldn't advise walking to downtown under any circumstances, unless you're with a large posse of sober ninjas that could take on all the toothless and tweaking street people swarming that particular stretch. The Strat is somewhat of a self-contained city, anyway (with tons of onsite shops and conveniences), and you can probably take care of the majority of your wants and needs within the confines of the property. Roxy's Diner had great food, and the little Mexican place upstairs was pretty good, too. There's also a McDonald's and Starbucks onsite if you just need something fast. I can honestly only find one fault with the Stratosphere, and that's the bar soap they provide. The lotion, shampoo, shower gel and conditioner are fine, but that bar soap was useless and vile. Seriously - that's my only gripe about the place. Will absoutely be back to stay and play here. I hope everyone else has the same good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but nowhere near the main 'strip'”
Reviews.Author: PAUL7331
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good rooms, free wi-fi. Just a shame about the location!

Reviews.Title: “It is okay if you have a deal”
Reviews.Author: TTL802
Reviews.Content: We had a package deal andWe paid approx $60 per night if you filtered out the airfare. We were put on the 4th floor which later we found out that's the floor where the pool locate. No need to say much, the traffic is busy and sometimes noisy. We visited the pool out of curiosity, it is nothing spectacular. There is a mandatory resort fee charge. I guess this is now a standard for most of strip hotels. The charge includes free access to the oberservation deck which we won't go without that. The room is okay and it was facing the garage. There is no ice machine on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a bad part of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Patrick C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just took our first trip to Vegas and chose the Stratosphere because it had a pretty good rating and the rooms were not too pricey. The trip from the airport via cab was just shy of 30 bucks including tip. The hotel is at the far North end of "the Strip". Freemont Street and "Old Vegas" is about a mile and a half North on Las Vegas Blvd so from a location standpoint, The Stratosphere is centrally located although you'll have to take a cab or transit bus to get around. The transit bus called "The Deuce" stops right beside the hotel and day passes can be purchased at the Kiosk next to the bus stop. The buses are typically standing room only, jammed packed, and hot. But for 7 bucks for 24 hours it's cheap. If you walk, be advised that as soon as you step off Stratosphere property there's a good chance you'll encounter people begging for money, drug dealers, and prostitutes. we certainly encountered all of the above. We did not feel safe on foot at night unless on the main Strip or in the heart of the Freemont street experience. Check in at the Hotel was pretty quick and uneventful. We were' surprised that in order to get a mini-fridge and microwave we had to pay an extra 10 dollars per night each. The standard room was okay. It was not quite as well appointed as the average Business traveler "Express" hotel's that I stay at but was okay for the money. The room's have a "energy saving" thermostat system that uses an infrared sensor that only cycles the AC when you're in the room. It also only allows you to turn it down to 68 degrees which I'm certain we never achieved. It was uncomfortably warm most of the time. The pool was nice although it closed at 7pm each night. It also has a permanent sign posted by the hot-tub that says the jets are temporarily inoperable. The view of the main Tower from the pool was very nice and there were several cabana's that could be rented for an extra charge. The European or topless pool on top of the 24th floor is closed for remodeling, Nobody knew when it would reopen when I inquired. The buffet was very good and by signing up for an ACE card for the casino you get a discount. The show "BITE" was a fun 1 1/2 hours. The cast was hot, topless, and the show put to a classic rock/vampire theme. Kinda strange, but fun. As far as Vegas shows go, it was less expensive as well. We paid extra for VIP seating in a booth and were surprised to be seated with another couple. I don't know if this is customary or not. Wifi is not free but can be purchased. The view from the top of the tower is awesome and the thrill rides are discounted for hotel guests. There's a nice restaurant with probably the best view in Vegas. There are multiple shops and places to eat on premises. All the food is a little pricey. There are cheap eats on the strip, you just have to hunt for them and there's a IHOP, Denny's and Carl Jr's within walking distance of the hotel. Room service as expected was expensive but the portion sizes were fairly generous and service was quick for a 2400 room Hotel. There is no coin op or self service laundry facility but there was a laundry bag and price list in the room. This extra service, you guessed it is very expensive. i.e. 4.50 for EACH pair of shorts, 1.75 for each pair socks, each underwear. Jeans, and formal/business items even more. The casino was expansive and comfortable. smoke was minimal compared to other properties. I played craps and the only tables I saw were "Crapless Craps". A variation of Craps that I don't much care for. All in all, the casino is very nice. In conclusion, the Stratosphere is a nice property in a not so great area of Las Vegas. It's location between the Strip and Freemont Street make it a decent "home base" for a budget minded traveler that doesn't mind riding a bus or taking a cab to reach other attractions. I'd rate my stay a solid "B".

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a quieter area of "the strip"”
Reviews.Author: TortMad
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Stratosphere for a 3 night stay, at the start of our Las Vegas to San Francisco road trip. Overall the hotel offers everything that is needed, the rooms are of a decent size and are very clean. However the rooms do not have tea or coffee making facilities. There is a 24hour coffee shop downstairs in the casino, but I brought my own kettle with me. There is also no free WIFI, internet access is charged extra to the room. The hotel is located right at the bottom of the famous Las Vegas strip, which means it is very quiet and allows you to take a break from the whole madness that is Las Vegas. However that also means it is a LONG walk to the nearest hotel, which is Circus Circus, now the Sahara has closed. There is a stop for the Deuce bus right outside the hotel, which will take you right down to the main area of the strip or down to Freemont street area. The buses are regular and are value for money. On my last trip to LV I used to travel to this area of the strip via the monorail, but sadly the closest station is at the Sahara, which is now closed, which means the Deuce is now the only way to travel to the better end of the strip. The hotel does offer unlimited access to the tower and is complimentry to guests, which is the main draw to this hotel. The tower offers some of the most amazing views of the Las Vegas strip (day and night), there is also several hair raising rides at the top of the tower. The casino is small in comparision to the bigger hotel and casino's further up the strip, but has everything you need. It also has a small shopping area, which also sells some fast food and in the main area has a buffet restaurant and a nice Italian restaurant. There is a Denny's, Carl's Jr and Ihop just across the street, however the Stratosphere is located in a slightly dodgier area of the strip and I found you do get hounded a fair bit by beggars walking between the hotel and Ihop.

Reviews.Title: “Another Pleasant surprise for the price!”
Reviews.Author: kimsw
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what we were getting ourselves into when we booked into the Stratosphere for a 5 day visit to Vegas. The Hotel room was very clean and nicely appointed. The pool and fitness room were also a very nice, although the music was a tad loud. We received unlimited access to the Tower, which afforded breathtaking night time vistas, included in the price of our room. What a nice treat. We didn't do any of the rides, but enjoyed watching all the thrill-seekers shoot off the top of the Tower. The food in Roxy's Grill was also really good. The Hotel is located on the Strip, between Freemont Street(Laser Light Show) and the busy part of the Strip,kitty corner from the now closed, Sahara. Bus Routes are great. We took busses to and from the Strip and out to the Outlet Mall to the North. Easy Peazy! Important note. When you fly into the Las Vegas Airport, ask the driver to take you to your hotel VIA Paradise Dr....it is WAY cheaper than taking the freeway to almost any hotel on the strip. We paid $38.00 to the Hotel,via the freeway, and $17.00 from the Hotel to the airport VIA Paradise!!!!! Tell the Cabbie you INSIST on Paradise...you can thank me later!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: COLO_USA
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fairly nice, as is the casino. The location is a bit far from other casinos. The bar at the top us amazing but cocktails are very expensive. The view of Vegas is beautiful. Thier buffet is very basic but reasonable. Friendly bar staff. If your on a budget, this hotel us fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Trisha N
Reviews.Content: My sister and I live in different states and we decided to meet in Las Vegas for a weekend of fun. Having stayed in other Vegas hotels we never question where we are going to stay when in Vegas - the Stratosphere!! The fine folks at the Strat are always friendly and eager to accommodate any needs. The rooms have recently been renovated and are fresh and clean. The slots are well maintained, kept free of debris, and operational. There are several table games to choose from - and dealers are very patient and helpful if you are learning a new game. There is a Starbucks right off of the elevator. The buffet is good. Roxy's Diner is so so. Nothing spectacular and not the finest food. However, up the tower at the 107 Lounge you will find great appetizers. For fine dining the Top Of The World restaurant is available - yet pricey - but it's dining at its' best. We enjoy a lot of the other casinos but we feel 'at home' at the Strat. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed......”
Reviews.Author: Lori1964CantonOhio
Reviews.Content: I never book a room without first reading the reviews on tripadvisor. Having stayed at the Stratosphere Casino during our very first trip to Vegas in 2001, I had an overall idea of what to expect. But is it is still nice to hear what recent visitors have to say. To be fair, I do feel that the Stratosphere has recieved some unfair reviews. The Stratosphere is a nice choice when staying in Las Vegas. The casino/rooms were extremely clean, and I stress EXTREMELY clean. You never had to wait on an elevator...and their speed is second to none. We were greeted with smiles from the casino staff, housekeeping, as well as their customer service reps. And "Jerald" made our check-out speedy, as well as pleasant. He is truely an asset to the Stratosphere! So you must be wondering why I was disappointed during our stay? Well, our recent stay was to celebrate our Anniversary and my husband's Birthday. After many hours of searching the web, I secured the best deal available thru the Stratosphere website under the "wallet friendly" promo. At that time, they were offering the SAME PRICE for their recently remodeled select rooms as they were for a strip view rooms. Not being sure which one would be the better choice, I called the Stratosphere directly and spoke with a booking agent. She instructed me to book the remodeled select room as many of them were strip view. That way, I could secure the nicest room available with a strip view. Before making our final reservation, I called the resort a second time to verify that this was the best booking option for me. I was again instructed by a second booking agent, that my best option was to book the remodeled select. However, she added to be sure to put my strip view request in the comments area so I could secure the strip view room....so I did. At check-in, we were informed that this was not possible, nor the best booking option. Our Check-in rep. told us that: 1.) The remodeled select and the strip view rooms are two different selections. 2.) It would have been much WISER to have reserved the strip view room as there are actually less of them available. (we had to spend our first night in a non strip view as there were no longer any availabe) AND 3rd, THAT IT WOULD COST US EXTRA TO BE UPGRADED TO THE STRIP VIEW ROOM. Unbelievable! When it was all said and done, I paid an additional $50 for a room I could have gotten cheaper during the original booking process!!! I might be made to believe that I misunderstood the conversation with the booking agents had I not called them directly on TWO DIFFERENT occasions and was told the exact same thing by each agent. It seemed that we were constantly being asked to pay additional fees. If you wanted/needed to use their WiFi, there was a fee if $12 per day, PER DEVICE. We asked if there was an area where we could check-in online and print our boarding passes, AGAIN, there was an additional charge imposed for that. After paying all of these fees, we had LESS MONEY to spend in their casino, restaurants, and gift shops. Finally, I was asked when I secured our reservation if we would be celebrating any special occasions during our stay. Which we were. I am well aware that they service thousands of customers each day, however, not once did any customer service rep acknowledge that we had chosen them to celebrate our milestone occasions. We try to visit Las Vegas every October to celebrate these dates, and in the past, at other resorts, we have been made to feel very special, like they appreciated us and our business. Overall, l would say that we were very disapponinted that we were made to feel like we were being nickel and dimed to death. Seriously, why would anyone intentionally make a reservation that would ultimately cost an extra $50 at check in? As I said, this is a nice casino, however, their need to charge a fee for everything makes some of the other "more expensive resorts" not quite so expensive after all. As nice as the resort was, I don't believe we would choose it again. Money is hard to earn, so why not spend it where there are less fees to paid. We come to gamble and celebrate, not window shop.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for those on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: JamesHacon
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay in a Select Room, one of the recently refurbished rooms. The room was basic, but fresh and comfortable - not sure I'd want to risk staying in a normal room. Nice add ons included in rate price including free passes to visit the Tower. A little bit far from the real action, particularly now that Sahara is closed. Would recommend the free signup to the casino club, as it gives you 25% off restaurant bills. If staying at this end of town definitely take the Duece (bus) a few blocks to Downtown LV and the Fremont Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Krunal M
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, they said we booked a King size bed instead of what we requested which is 2 Queen beds. The receptionist could care less and said she will "reserve a room" for us. She doesn't want to be there and it's written all over her face. After a huge fuss, when we get up to the room, we realized that it's a 2 queen size beds. Basically the receptionist and her computer system is not even accurate. The view up on the tower is amazing, day time and night. It's free for hotel guests and the rides are so much fun. For the price of staying in this hotel it's so worth it. Rooms are decent, clean and just a place to sleep. If you want to party hard inside the room instead of just crashing and showering this is not for you. The swimming pool is awesome! Only thing that's kind of annoying is that though it's on the stripe, you can't walk to the main part of the stripe AT ALL. You must take a taxi. Fare to MGM (which is end of the stripe) is around $20. You do the math.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: ben807
Reviews.Content: Just had a disappointing stay at Stratosphere. Had booked on Priceline; price was supposed to be all inclusive but was charged add'l $7.50 mandatory "resort" fee. Was also relegated to the "Tour" Tower: room was narrow and tight; they put in a new flatscreen tv that didn't fit in the tv armoire and, as a result, was on the desk (not central in front of the beds), bathroom was small, toilet seat was broken and wouldn't stay up. I'm sure there are different experiences depending on which tower you stay in (I think there are 4 or 5)- I'm sure the "luxury" ones are probably much nicer but the Tour Tower was a bit dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Too much smoke”
Reviews.Author: Assedo1
Reviews.Content: As you walk into the hotel, you will smell stale tobacco smoke and the smoke will follow you during our entire visit. The smoke can be tasted in the food and beverages purchased on the first floor of the hotel. I went with three other women, two came down with bronchitis due to heavy smoke exposure (they are none smokers). Absolutely no ventilation. The hotel is not near the action, too far off the strip to enjoy the Vegas experience. If you leave the hotel, you must take a cab or walk through a rough area of town. One can walking to the Monorail a few blocks away -so that is an option. Do not take the bus!! The buses fill up quickly, the drivers are rude and you must have the exact change to board or buy a ticket. Plus, the bus will kill part of your day, getting to your location. Claustrophobia doesn't begin to express the bus ride, its also dirty. There is not a microwave or coffee pot in the room. Actually, I did not find the hotel had anything to offer that I couldn't find at a hotel at the strip. By the time we paid for a taxi cab to take up to shows and leave a tip, we could have paid for a room on the strip, and had greater access to events. I will not return to the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great value - off the strip but tower makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: DHCDB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night because the price was very good and the room rate included tower admission. Checked in close to 1am after a late flight from Hawaii. Unfortunately missed tower admission for the night time view through no fault of the hotel staff who checked us in very fast. Rooms were good for price - had 2 double beds which was not that helpful for man and wife but each was big and comfy. View from room was non-existant really but a plus is that they have recently upgraded the hotels so it looks nice and fresh. This hotel is quite a way from the strip so is best served for staying to go up the tower or to be close to Glitter Gulch or just for a nice affordable stay in a decent hotel with all the amenities of the strip hotels. Great value for money is the key selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Too far off up the strip for us”
Reviews.Author: klmofo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 2011 very good price not a bad hotel for the money Quite a long walk to the strip taxi ride is ok and only cost $25 so well worth it Had two double rooms as we travelled with our teenage sons (17&19) Both rooms were of an ok standard but nothing to shout about but you are not in the long enough to worry You must pay a visit to the top floor fantastic is the word to describe it Even the lift is some thing else Would consider a stay here again if the price was right as you are away from the madness of Vegas and what a view of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ShyC
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere had excellent service the rooms were exquisite in the select tower. I had lunch at Roxy's diner which was wonderful and then I made reservations for dinner at the top of the world resturant which was great it was worth everything penny.The staff at the front desk was extremely helpful at recommending activities in the surrounding area.The valet and the bell-man were very courteous and professional.Staying at the stratosphere made my stay in Las Vegas pleasant and easy which I will continue to stay there everytime I return to Las Vegas and I will recommend it to all my business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Great/Clean Room; $5 Min. Bets; Spectacular View from the Tower”
Reviews.Author: js945
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere for 2 nights. The girl at the desk, Eliza, was very cheerful and helpful when I checked in. I found my way across the casino and to the elevators. I was in a Deluxe Non Smoking Room with a King Bed and a Wide Screen TV (I think there are about 20 channels, but unless you have kids, who cares, it's Vegas!). The room was immaculate. Didn't find a spoof dirt/dust anywhere. The bed was very comfortable and had 5 soft pillows. The bathroom was small, but very clean. *The water did drain just a bit slow.* My window faced the North, so the view was eh. The one thing that did bother me is that there seemed to be very little sound isolation between the door and the hallway. And on my second night, a security officer was knocking on the doors next to my room at 3:30 in the morning. Room rating: 4/5. Guests are allowed to ride the elevator to the top of the tower for free. The view is spectacular day and night! You can see for miles! The rides at the top are pretty expensive, especially the Sky Jump ($109.99). But they look thrilling considering you are over 1000 feet off the ground. Tower rating: 5/5. The casino was average. Nothing special, but no complaints. It prrovides your typical slot machines, sports books, card tables. I wanted to play craps and found a table with a $5 minimum bet. I noticed some of the blackjack, roulette, and poker tables also had $5 minimums. *Play at any of the higher end casinos, such as the Bellagio, you won't find anything lower than $10 min.* I will say that if you register for the ACE Playing card, you get a 25% discount at the buffet and a 10% discount at Roxie's (they have good food btw). Casino rating: 4/5 The location isn't in the best part of the strip. The closest big name casino is Circus Circus (which looks like a dump). Other than that, it takes about 5 minutes each way to drive to the others. Location rating: 3.5/5 (If I didn't have my rental car, the location rating would be much lower). Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at the Stratosphere. I would most definitely stay here again. Overall rating: 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Grand Suite”
Reviews.Author: contactjb
Reviews.Content: What a Great Deal on Las Vegas Blvd. The Luxury Grand Suite was a great for the price, and location to the Las Vegas bus lines (108 - Airport/Downtown Area, Deuce, and Strip/Downtown Express). The modern room had a very large sitting area, with a fold out couch and a wet bar type area with a mini fridge. The bedroom was a very good size, with a comfy bed. The bath was typical of a 3+ star hotel with marble and tile.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, but Stratospheric distance to Strip!”
Reviews.Author: BollardBandit
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in the Stratosphere with my wife and another couple, and all in all, our stay in the hotel was mainly excellent. Have listed below plus and minus points to keep it simple... Plus - Very clean and modern rooms, with exceptionally comfortable beds. Loads of storage room, massive beds, dozens of TV channels and excellent room service. Staff at reception seemed friendly and helpful, and cleaning staff did a top class job every day. - View from top of viewing tower is spectacular. Revolving restaurant up there is pricy, but very good. Rides at the top look like great fun if that's your thing. - The buffet is incredible!! So much choice, real quality too at a great price (about 15 bucks). They seem to change what's on offer every hour, so if you're there for any long amount of time, the choice will just grow and grow. Really impressive set up, fair play to them. - The pool isn't bad, a bit dated looking in parts, but does the job. Has a bar on site, so great for unwinding after a day's walking in prep for the night ahead. Minus - Absolutely miles away from the main section of the strip, you would not walk this if it's anyway hot - we tried the first day in 45 degrees, and felt like disheveled castaways by the time we reached the first of the 'big' casinos, so taxi's are a must! The money we spent on taxis for the 4/5 days, probably would have been better spent staying somewhere closer to the main part of the strip, but if you don't mind the bit of distance, the Stratosphere is exceptional value. - The Stratosphere's casino is just awful. It's a dingy, dark, smelly, 70's-feeling, dour kip!! Made 100 times worse when you experience the flashier, wealthier casino's further up the strip. The place always seems dead of atmosphere too, no craic or banter around whatsoever. The staff working at the tables were rude, dis-interested and had no personality. It's almost impossible to get a drink of the table servers - and again, when you experience the service and buzz available in the bigger, better casinos, there is simply NO reason to stay here and spend money. - Bar the buffet, there is an average choice of food options, and what there is (Roxy's 50's diner, Italian, sub-sandwich deli, etc.) is very greasy, cheap and sickening. Ate in Roxy's twice, and felt like I would vomit after eating both times, while doing unmentionable things to my stomach for days after. - DO NOT GET THE MONORAIL BACK FROM THE STRIP!!!! It's probably about two miles from the hotel, but is advertised as leaving you right beside. Even getting to the station from the strip is a con - you have to walk through an entire casino/hotel, and then some!! The it leaves you at a casino that is now closed down, so you have to take a back entrance that leads into the 'bum town' of Vegas, where all the brothels and 'massage parlors' are, felt very unsafe in this area. So in review, great value for a clean hotel that offers a super buffet. But be warned, the strip is miles away and the casino is probably the worst in Vegas. Depending on your budget, if you're looking to save a few quid, I'd recommend the Stratosphere (even though the taxi bill will add up!) but if you have the cash, book closer to the likes of New York New York, Planet Hollywood, MGM, Ceasers, etc.). If you've booked a package or a holiday deal with no choice in the matter, and you're reading this to see what's in store - relax, the hotel is generally great! Sure, it's quite far from the action and the casino is dire, but none of these points will stop you having a great time - it's not good enough to highly recommend, but it's certainly not bad enough to avoid! I'm probably being over harsh as I'm comparing most things to the bigger, more expensive hotels/casino's up the road, so enjoy your stay and take note of the few points above and you won't go wrong, Vegas is DEADLY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Thea2
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a package to Las Vegas with 6 nights at this hotel. He chose the deluxe room which means it is above the 14th floor and either looks out on the strip or the mountains. We had a mountain (north) view. The pool was very nice and never crowded. We went up to the tower 3 times, twice to see the view and the crazy people jumping over the top of the building and once to have Happy Hour at the 107 lounge. The employees were friendly and helpful. We had a rental car and so we could get to the south end of the strip easily. I would not recommend walking at night around the hotel as the neighborhood is pretty run-down. However, one can always get a cab and the bus stop is right across the street. Beware the Internet kiosks--we printed out our boarding passes and they charged 75 cents/minute and $1.50 per printed page.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction is what you get at the Stratosphere Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Gail H
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Stratosphere Hotel and I enjoy myself each time I go. I went on a solo vacation in mid September. Each and every employee I encountered was friendly and very helpful. I'll tell you about one of my experiences, my 2 year old grandson lives is Las Vegas and he came to visit me while I was at the Stratosphere, We went shopping and I bought him a toy from one of the shop's. It required batteries so I purchased the batteries not thinking anything about how I was going to install them, when we returned to the room this is when I realized I had no tools to install the batteries, so I called the front desk and explained my situation and they sent a maintenance man to my room and he installed the batteries to my grandson's new toy. This made him sooooooo happy and it made me happy to. How many hotel's would go out of their way to make a 2 year old happy? Not many, I bet, but the Stratosphere did, and for making my grandson's day, I say THANK YOU. I love everything about the Stratosphere, the hotel rooms, the employees, the restaraunts, and most of all the gambling. You must give them a try. I give them a At.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding reception thrill”
Reviews.Author: mj_reynolds058
Reviews.Content: I chose this venue as it was something different and it didnt lt me down, the venue was great, the food was great and my guests loved the rides. I arranged this booking via email which was a bit slow but eventually it was done and I prayed that the day would run without a hitch. On the day it was great, all of my guests loved the views and they really enjoyed the meal. I dont have a bad word to say I was really impressed with how great the staff were and the free entrance into the observation deck. I dont think myself or my guests will forget my wedding reception and for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Onnie61
Reviews.Content: Just home after spending 7 nights in the Stratosphere and it was wonderful. We stayed in a 'Select' room and it was lovely. Comfortable king bed, flat screen tv and super air con, which was needed as temperatures last week were 38c! Both room and en-suite spotless, shower was powerful and room cleaned daily. The pool area was great and all guests were handed free towels for pool use. We dined one night at The Top of the World restaurant, and it was wonderful, food, service and of course the views. We also had the hotel buffet dinner on our last night, and it was so good, we were sorry we didnt try it out earlier in our stay. Although the hotel is located at the end of the strip, the Deuce bus stop is just outside and runs 24/7, going all the way along the strip and down to Freemount St and the Outlet Mall. We also did the 2 day hop on/off bus tour, and it stops in the hotel car park! The Strabucks off the casino was great for morning coffee. Overall our experience was excellent, no complaints and would definately stay at the Stratosphere again. Onnie, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: HankinNC
Reviews.Content: Trying to find somewhere different to go on vacation and stumbled across terrific deals with the Stratosphere in Vegas!
