Everyone kept saying why stay at the Stratosphere, it's off the main strip, the reviews were saying as much as well. Well we found this to be a great benefit! Down in the heart of the strip there were so many people, lots of fun and action, but it was nice to get away from all this when time to go back to your hotel! The Ace Gold bus made it easy with great deals on 3 day passes, and they made minimal stops down the strip, so you could quickly get where you needed to go. Being at the top of the strip, the Stratoshere was a great middle place between the strip and Fremont street, (old vegas). Being able to go up to the top of the tower and see all of vegas and the beautiful desert beyond was great. We were a bit disappointed that the roller coaster had been taken off the top, but there were new rides up there. They have a new thrill where you can jump off the top!! We didn't do it this time, but maybe next?!! The rooms were renovated and were nice. This is a good hotel and casino. The penny slots were lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not care about customers!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingheidi
Reviews.Content: Our experience in this hotel was a complete disappointment, especially if compared with the one we had in an another Las Vegas hotel last year. We booked a non-smoking room and payed an extra to have a room with the view...we were given a smoking room with the view on the parking and they were not able to change the room till the day after so we had to sleep there for one night and they even refused to give us back the extra money we paid for the view for the first night. The personnel at the reception were not helpful and treated us as fools. Apart from this rooms are clean and price not high but the hotel is far from the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, excellent buffet ...”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed an excellent room, clean and comfortable. Fun going to the top of the tower to see the bungee jumpers and roller coaster. Very professional. The room service and buffet were outstanding: Prime Rib perfectly cooked, excellent breakfast with fast service for getting seated and having the first cup of joe. Bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. There was folks to help you with navigating the hotel, bell men were friendly, and the 24 fitness room was spacious, clean, and had a lot of equipment. The elevator to the top of the tower gives probably the best view of Vegas. Especially nice as night to see the lights of the Vegas county. Enjoyed a 4 day stay very much, will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Suffocation in the room”
Reviews.Author: yashmi
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with the view of strip by paying extra. First they gave a room without view and when told them then they changed the room. Anyways, room was clean and beautiful. Room was so suffocating. We had booked 2 queen bed. We were 4 people in the room... All of us felt the need of fresh air inside. Location is far away from strip... Need to walk a lot to get into the middle. Rides were good... i enjoyed them... Their adult show vampire something... dnt even rem the name... was boring that we left it midway.. dnt waste your money on that boring show... You will get better options in midway of strip! Dont book unless you really get a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: wesoc
Reviews.Content: This place was a problem from start to finish. From very rude front desk staff to no one in the entire facility knowing where a particular entrance was. I spent more time walking back in forth through that smoked filled dungeon and it just never materialized. The room was just that a room, with a bed no place for your stuff and cramped. I was told not to stay here in respect to being at the end of the strip, and now I can see why. The only cool things i can remember were definateley the free falling from the roof WOW, that looked cool- the observation area was also really nice as well. O and the diner down stairs was pretty good and had some fun staff that would sing old tunes while you ate. I only recommend you stop here to see the rides don't waste your $$ on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The gem of the north strip”
Reviews.Author: LeelaKed
Reviews.Content: I love the Stratosphere hotel, I stayed there from 12th - 22nd September which was my 5th stay since 2005. We had room 22007 in the Select Tower with great views of the pool and quite a few of the hotels as well as that gorgeous mountain backdrop. This hotel is very reasonably priced, in fact it was a complete bargain in comparison with the giants on the main strip. It may not be situated in the best of areas as the north of the strip appears to be dying out but this hotel holds its own. Despite location, there are many ways to get around; taxis, the deuce, monorail, by foot etc. It's a five minute car ride to the north outlets and 10 minutes to Fremont so it has its perks. Also one good thing about this hotel is that although it is bustling with visitors, it is also quite quiet and peaceful so perfect for getting away from the fast paced scene. The new renovations have given Stratosphere a new lease of life; the rooms are immaculate and the casino floor looks great too. The staff in this hotel are so friendly and helpful. I never went by any members of staff without a pleasant 'good morning' or 'hello'. This may be minor to some people but it's nice to make an effort. My in-laws had joined us on this trip for their first stay and they were overwhelmed by the courteousness of the staff and even when a slip up was made in regards to their room, it was resolved very quickly and efficiently. This is what makes the Stratosphere stand out for me. The pool area is clean and tidy. One bonus of this pool is that it is never so busy that you cannot get a sunbed and the pool wasn't over populated either. The music was an ecclectic range or modern and historic songs that suited all ages. We used Roxy's diner, the Pizzeria and McDonalds during out stay and again were very happy with the service. I have previously eaten at the Italian restaurant and Top of the World as well, both i'd definately recommend. I do think the hotel would benefit from another eaterie; maybe something with healthier options or even some Asian foods. I would also like to say the buffet was fantastic. I had the most amazing breakfasts in there. I would definately recommend this hotel for all ages. The tower has amazing views but best of all, if you are a fan of rides they have some great ones there .... not that i'd be brave enough but it was really good fun watching people going on them. You can also witness the Sky Jumpers or take part if you fancy jumping from great heights. All in all, I cannot fault this hotel. We got so many discounts using our Ace Play cards and I had some comps for last minute gifts before leaving. I would just like to say that the location may put some off but it shouldn't as the benefits outweigh this. Thank you very much for another amazing trip Stratosphere, it was one of our favourites yet.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelingplaces
Reviews.Content: traveled to Vegas in September really loved this hotel--rooms clean and comfy--great strip view,saw the bungie jumpers from the room window-was pretty neat we were able to get a fridge in our room brought in for a nominal charge check in staff were great--casino was very nice-- my advice for check in--from the parking garage don't take luggage in to check in since the garage and elevators to the rooms are close together and not by the check-in desk--maybe this is normal--but thought i would pass on the info overall experience was wonderful--was great to go to the top of the sphere and see the city and the revolving restaurant and the different rides they have up there transportation--the monrail goes about a block from the hotel--so there is no problem getting anywhere you want to go to and from this hotel and for a cheap price hope to be in the vegas area again next year and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Level 107 Lounge Happy Hour Is a Must”
Reviews.Author: SHoslerFoodie4Me
Reviews.Content: The Towers Level 107 happy hour was great we had a nice view for sunset, live entertainment, alright food and 2-for-1 martinis. The only downside was you had the martinis brought to you 2 at a time, so by the time we got to the 2nd one it was warm, ew! We went to the 108 Bar and the drinks were waay overpriced and it was very dead in there for a Sat night! The only upside was the view. The pool was a nice size, but the pool waitresses were hard to find! You got better service walking up to the bar. The hotel this time around, as far as the room went, was not that great. I really missed the mini fridge they lost with the updates, also the bathroom was not so clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great stay had by all”
Reviews.Author: LauraLiP
Reviews.Content: Found check in/concierge really helpful , room was nice (and clean!!) , beds were v comfy although only thing missing was a fridge which would have been handy. But apart from that great hotel considering price we paid for our 5 night stay. Please dont worry about other reviews saying this hotel is not in a good spot on the strip, it is a fair way down from the major attraction hotels however right outside the hotel there is a Bus stop where the very new and clean buses (the 'duece' service which goes in a loop up and down the strip) stop very regularly and its really cheap to use i highly recomment using it. It is walkable but in the heat the air conditioned buses are the better option!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, poor room”
Reviews.Author: christinamcp
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine - a little out of the way though. We knew this coming in, so my opinion on the location isn't really being reflected on in my review. The casino isn't very upscale like some of the others on the main part of the strip, but it is very large with tons of games. The shops and restaurants in the casino were ok, too. Not very boutique-y, if that's what you're looking for. There is a diner and a McDonald's - which came in handy for breakfast when we were in a hurry. The tower was fantastic. The view is truely amazing. You can see all of Vegas and the surrounding area. And it is nice that the trip to the top is free if you are a guest of the hotel. My only real complaint was our room. DO NOT assume that your room will have the updated appearance of the pictures on the website. Our room looked nothing like that. The lighting was dingy and the room just looked old. Even worse that the room was the bathroom. It was so sad. A big, tall, plastic bathtub, an old toilet and sad lighting, all the same sad tan color. It was more like you were in a bad dressing room at a mall (with a toilet and bathtub) than in a bathroom inside a supposedly luxury hotel in Vegas. Also, you only get one bar of soap. The sink is outside the room with the shower, so where to store the soap becomes a question. They do give shower gel, but as someone who prefers soap to shower gel, it wasn't enough. We only stayed 2 nights, but if we had stayed longer than that I probably would have been upset by the apparent fake-out it seemed we received. All in all, I'll say that I don't think I would stay here again. I would visit for the tower view - it's amazing. I've heard that the restaurant int he tower is fantastic, and would like to try that sometime. It would be more of a day trip than an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Buffet Ever”
Reviews.Author: GloeyBolingbrook_IL
Reviews.Content: We went there only because we had a coupon for a free buffet and it wasn't even worth the "free." Worst food ever. I tried a couple of things and then filled up on salad. Hubby had a piece of prime rib that was inedible and so was his banana cream pie. If I could give it a "zero" I would. Don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - a lot of Hidden Fee”
Reviews.Author: Disha R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our first trip to Vegas. It is further down the strip than I expected and it was between $12-14 one way in a cab to the main part of the strip. The neighborhood in which the casino is located is awful. I had booked the room via expedia and wasnt aware of any additional fee however when i checked in an additional $15 fee was added on to my rate, as a "Resort fee". Additionaly they charge $25 fee for use of the hotel wi-fi and internet services. This fee is per device (learnt it the hard way :(, connected all my deviced - 2 Iphones and a laptop and had to pay $75...no one informed us about this when we checked in). All in all i will never recommend this hotel for people to stay. Its good for visting for the rides and views it presents but staying here means you are cut off from rest of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the high sky of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Allen A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel, Casino. The service was amazing. The hotel staff took great care of us. The room was perfect. I am picky and this was a great room. I must admit I am better at complaining than I am saying the positive stuff. However, when I have great service, I feel the need to say something. I really can't say enough about the service of the hotel and the casino. Both made sure all our needs were met and met quickly. Not to mention the price was affordable. We were going to stay here cheap and then go to other hotels. We changed our minds and didn't leave the hotel until time to leave. We had a lot of fun just staying in the hotel and casino. Avoid the Top of the World restaurant though, expensive and the food was not good at all. Service was not great at this restaurant either. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “underrated.”
Reviews.Author: florane65
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here many times,including this past spring.nice clean rooms,at reasonable prices,especailly for ace club members.sunday brunch best deal in town,with crab legs,champane and more for low price.good gaming odds,restraunts,and gaming.not in center of strip,but public transportation readily available right outside to strip,or downtown.the best kept secret in vegas by my opnion,especailly on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and low price”
Reviews.Author: daontravel
Reviews.Content: Large, clean and nice room, for which we paid very little. No noise disturbance at all, so we slept very well. At check-in we fell for their up-grade offer that we for "just 20 dollars per night" could upgrade to a room with jacuzzi, in retrospect not worth the money just for the jacuzzi. The hotel has a nice pool area, and when staying at the hotel you can go up in the tower for free. A tip is to take the elevator to the lounge on level 107 and then continue to the viewing platforms instead to stay in line to go directly to the viewing platforms. The location is at the end of the strip, but there are plenty of taxis to take you around to other places. There is free parking in a garage connected to the hotel, or valet parking for a cost, which is probably not worth it since it looked like there was quite a wait to get the car from the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “good view, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: tomnaples
Reviews.Content: I was at the Stratosphere Hotel in Feb 2011. I really enjoyed the view, especially from the top. The big drawback I saw was its location. Its not close to the other hotels on the strip without getting a cab. The rooms were clean and the housekeepin gwas very good as well. Its too bad its so far away from the bright lights and action of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more $ and stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: tricia95
Reviews.Content: We extended our stay in las vegas and booked here to get a good deal. We were thinking how bad could it be. This is a very old hotel. Its a distance from the strip, like a $20 cab ride. The rooms were horrible! Very old and smelled. I wished they would have asked us it we wanted a upgrade. The best thing about the hotel is the free pass to the Top of the Tower. But I would not suggest anyone stay here if you can help it. The whole time we were there our hallway smelled like WEED. We left very early one day and left a dont enter sign on our door and the maid still entered to clean the room. Mgt said someone must have taken the sign!

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: KenCharb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Stratosphere 3 times now in the past couple years and have had good and bad luck. Depending on which floor and tower will determine what you will get. We once had a suite and it had a good view, spacious and comfortable. Then the next time we had what I would call your typical plain hotel/motel room. The lasttime we got what I would class as a Super 8 style room. The only good thing is you can get some good deals on room rates. The overall hotel needs some updating and has seen some of its better days. The buffet is nothing special and a lot of repeat foods. Compared to other buffets around the strip this is at the lower end but the cost is also less. So you get what you pay for. Gambling, lots of machines and tables. I have always done better here then many other casinos. But I have heard the opposite from many others. Shows, they are not very expensive and generally speaking are fun and entertaining. It is kinda like a off broadway play kinda thing. The location of the hotel is at one end of the strip which is a pain if you want to roam the strip. It is a little bit of a run down portion of the strip and is being developed. I guess it is what it is for the price and it Vegas so gamble and see what kind of room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FranGalan
Reviews.Content: The whole experience WAS GOOD ENOUGH, the room was pretty big as we booked the oasis suit with Jacuzzi, however the room was smoky and the aircon as a set temp, and at 5 in the morning we hada party next room with people screaming and banging things ! The tower experience was interesting..... up and down from elevator to elevator, and the open deck was closed due to an electric storm... The casino was a bit small and not very flashy or classy... so we went to an other casino... If you can afford it, stay somewhere else to enhance your experience in las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Ambidextrous
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my second trip to Las Vegas, staying at the Stratosphere. Our room was very large, but the bathroom was so small that the wash basin was in the bedroom. The hotel looks very dated and tired compared to hotels further along the Strip and it is a long way to the main area of Las Vegas. However, the Deuce bus runs all along the strip regularly and costs $7 for 24 hours. We were on a tour, so had no choice of hotels. However, if I travel to Las Vegas independently, I certainly would not use the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “north room was averge. pay a bit more for select”
Reviews.Author: redeyeblues
Reviews.Content: the room was I got was in the north tower. it's roomy and quiet except for the humming of the aircon. at 3 am there was no hot water in the shower but other times it was fine. weekday rates were pretty reasonable. my friends paid $10 more to stay in the select tower and their room's much newer and more modern-looking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but expect sore feet walking up the strip”
Reviews.Author: Rogk79
Reviews.Content: As my title suggest this hotel is at the bottom of the strip and it is a very long walk up to the other end especially when drunk but this really is my only gripe about the place. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who checked us in and gave us all the information we needed. Our room was on the 21st floor in one of the renovated rooms and it was brill we even got a good view of the folk jumping of the tower ;-). As part of the hotel package you get to go up the tower for free which we made use of and you certainly do get a great view over Vegas, i didn't have the guts to try any of the rides although watching others doing it certainly made me laugh. The hotel, staff, casino was all excellent I would seriously consider staying here again for the price we paid it was excellent. There is a monorail that can take you up and down the strip for $5 each way, they also have a few other deals.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Renato_Santoro
Reviews.Content: I booked Stratosphere Hotel using a famous website. I was alone and the room was very good for me. It was clean, the beds were big. In the 1st floor (the casino), you could smell smoke. The staff was very polite. Good prices. It's a good hotel, but it is far away from the main Las Vegas attractions.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our time at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: randn94
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time in Las Vegas and the first time for my partner. Mostly we had a wonderful holiday at the Stratosphere. We stayed for 7 nights. Likes:- Registration was easy and quick. Staff were welcoming and polite. We upgraded to a suite which was both very spacious and good value. Comfortable sofa, large jacuzzi, and similarly large walk in shower. Public transportation is excellent and frequent with good access up the Strip and Downtown. The Deuce bus is slower than the SDX but the journey in both is easy.We had fun spotting passengers who clearly had never been on a double decker bus before and were also clearly anxious! We recommend English people to sit upstairs for a real laugh. Free access to the Tower was a real bonus. The buffet has a good atmosphere and the food was excellent. Gripes:- There was some misunderstanding about the actual cost of the upgrade, which grated, but the suite was still good value. The plumbing in our suite, right behind the bed, was exceptionally noisy leading us to change rooms. A little more luxury in the suite would have been appropriate, eg bathrobes and slippers. Channels available on the TV were unusually limited for the USA. The pool was one of the worst I have experienced; surfaced like a parking lot and with inadequate decoration or little greenery to soften the place. Very few parasols. Dont spend a fortune on upscale hotels. Go to places like the Stratosphere and upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay yet again.”
Reviews.Author: thexironers
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 12 nights from the 4th to the 16th of sept.we have stayed here on many previous trips to las vegas and were not let down at all.check in was swift and straight forward. the room had been updated since our last visit and was great, including room safe which was a great advantage. the room was serviced every day including towels and toileteries. all staff were helpful and friendly. starbucks is open from 5am everyday and suited us fine as we are early risers. restaurants on site cover all needs including a good buffet ,roxy's diner an italian and even a mcdonalds. there are also a mall of shops on site. just outside the hotel are two bus stops one for the deuce bus and one for the express bus which both serve the strip at $7 for 24hrs the deuce is a 24 hr a day service. these are a great link as the hotel is a mile from the main hotels on the strip. this suited us as we were away from the hustle and bustle.the views from the top of the tower are amazing both by day and night and are free to hotel guests. the revolving restaurant on floor 107 is amazing for a lunch or dinner. the rides are a must and the sky jump is crazy.this hotel is a great base and excellent value for money. will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We had a satisfactory stay ! Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kittinameow
Reviews.Content: Well, i've never stayed here before and was lured here by their great prices on rooms. I see other reviews, and i won't discredit them, everyone has a different experience right ? This hotel has been here forever however, the rooms were fine, didn't show signs of wear and tear. The room was just fine, had a clean and comfy bed, lots of pillows, flat screen tv, the rest room was clean, everything worked fine and toiletries/ TP were stocked well - no in-room fridge/microwave/coffee maker , but includes an ice bucket and disposable cups. . We did not get a strip view room but seeing as we only came to the room to sleep and watch tv..etc, it was no big deal, just close the curtains. We did not even smell smoke in our non-smoking room. We did not hear the next door couple, um " doing it " . Ice machines were near by and functioning. Check-in was a breeze. At this hotel , everything was close by, we liked that !

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere is a mediocre casino hotel with poor rewards program.”
Reviews.Author: struct84
Reviews.Content: I have stayed and played at the Stratosphere many times and just recently returned from another trip. I won't be going back. The rooms are now 3-4 years old and showing their age. To get a renovated room it's another $15-20 per night. The last times I have been at the Stratosphere, I was considered in the highest level of VIP status in their rewards program. Despite my past spending and status, I was told that because I had not been recently, that I no longer had any member perks, rewards, or even a free buffet. It's the rewards program that always took me back to the Stratosphere. With this expiration of member benefits, I'd just as soon choose a nicer hotel located closer to the center of the strip. To have been treated so personably before because of my VIP status, and the money I"ve spent at this hotel and casino, I was really offended with their 'you're a nobody now' attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome last-minute trip!”
Reviews.Author: megg210
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a quick Vegas trip at the very last minute so all of the places we'd normally stay on the Strip were really expensive. We used Hotwire's "secret hotel" feature (although I had figured out the deal was for the Stratosphere) and saved a lot of money. Wasn't sure what we were going to get, but our king non-smoking room was comfortable and clean - basic plus, I'd say. Bed was super comfy and the bathtub was nice and deep. Room was quiet and, while I could faintly smell smoke in the hallway, I couldn't smell any in the room. Resort fee was cheap - $7.50 per day, I think. And we were able to check out in our room, which saved a lot of time on the way out. Pool was basic but nice with a decent view, and I liked the brunch buffet - decent price, decent quality. Trip up to the top of the Stratosphere Tower was included in the room price and we loved it! The lights at night were fantastic and the bar up there is nice. And MAJOR plus - there's a Fat Tuesday in the Stratosphere shops! :o) Only downside for me was the location. It would have been nice to be in a more central location on the strip, but it was only about a 15-minute walk to the Sahara Monorail station. I was a teensy bit nervous about walking back late at night, but no problems and there always seemed to be plenty of people around. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I needed an inexpensive, basic place to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Facilities”
Reviews.Author: maddhobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay here. During our stay we enjoyed the pool, ate at the Top Of The World revolving restaurant, shopped in the stores, ate in the restaurants on the ground floor and played in the casino. We did venture into the main strip area one day and took a taxi in (around $15) and had a leisurely walk back (about 45 minutes). Spent most of our time here as the hotel had all the facilities we wanted and my wife even did the Skyjump, although I quite sensibly took the elevator down! Overall we had a very good stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not best in terms of location and not close to all attractions places”
Reviews.Author: chiragaanal
Reviews.Content: We went to Las vega for 3 days holiday...and stayed in stratosphere hotel... Good has good rooms which is very neat n clean..and with comfortable bed.... Bad part of hotel is - 1. Location wise its at the end of Las Vegas Nevada strip...and very far from all the good attractions...so if u think to go every day by walk it will take almost 30 min to reach to all attraction place... 2. Bus are running but every half n hour or 45 min so we dint opted that option... 3. Late night if u think of walking down to street toward hotel u will be bit scared because of less people on the street... 4. If u have taken a room for viewing Vegas street then u might not enjoy because of far distance from all attraction.. Overall Conclusion - Good hotel to stay...but if u wanted to enjoy experience vegas strip get it close to all attractions...

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: phillyshopgirl
Reviews.Content: Ok, let's start by saying that the hotel is not in "prime" strip area. It is a great downtown hotel, even though it is about a mile from Fremont St. Smoking is allowed in the hotel/casino and you can tell. It smells of smoke. Please be careful walking around the back of the hotel! I walked to 7-11 and was approached by many homeless and "johns".My husband and I stayed here for 1 night then went onto Mandalay Bay for 3 days ( hotel was booked the prior night). I wouldn't stay here again. I'd probably pay the extra $ and stay more south on strip. The good; the rooms were descent, view was great! The top of the world restaurant was beautiful and the observation deck was AMAZING! They do charge a low resort fee $9, but will charge you $11.99 per day for internet! When did ALL the Vegas hotels start charging resort fees?

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sashokchat
Reviews.Content: The rooms in Stratosphere are very big with huge beds. The room looks like a four star hotel room. Great service and very clean. Great attractions inside hotel

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: terri3089
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels i've stayed in in the USA. The room we got given was small and dirty. Right outside our window was the multi-story parking lot. The bathroom was tiny, filthy, whenever anybody in neighbouring rooms used their shower or sink all their waste water would come up the bath plug and fill our bath with dirty water. There were constant loud noises all around our room all night! Got one of the worst nights sleep the 1 night i stayed here. The location...it is far off the main bit of the strip, you walk through an area which I didn't feel safe walking down in the day let alone at night. Never again is all I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: vicenters
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel experience. The room was very clean and comfortable. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kennetho9322
Reviews.Content: Well, I paid $200 for a night of fun in the Tower on New Years 2010/11. What a disappointment: the Skydeck was closed to the public which meant shooting photos through glass only, the line up for drinks was 1/2hr (no joke) and the "food stations" were empty by 10:pm. A very drunken patron spilled his drink on me (and my very expensive Armani suit) while Security seemed to be nowhere. Don't get me wrong... I LOVE Vegas but save your cash and party on LVBLVD like everybody else!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Strato!”
Reviews.Author: skykingd18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with our 6 kids, and numerous friends, just returned from vegas, I am not a gambler, but love the vegas environment. I started my day at 6am with a 53 cent senior coffee at the mcDonalds inside the stratosphere casino. My early walk from the strato to the other end of the strip to Caesers took about 1 hr each way. Lots of joggers beating the crowds and heat, I enjoy people watching, and take in a few shows when budget permits. Rooms were clean and affordable, lots of free parking, The buffet was VERY GOOD, crab legs, prime rib to die for..., thanks eric for accomodating all of us. We had a great time in the pristine pool, enjoying the music, playing volleyball, and meeting interesting people from all over the world staying at the strato! Also took the tour of the tower, watching the jumpers and the winch in operation..., what an incredible view of the strip. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Good Location - Concierge desk needs better training”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: Room: Clean and Nice Location: between the old Vegas strip and the new larger Hotels (loved the location) View: The best view of Vegas is in the Tower, guests of the Hotel have free unlimited entry. For those that don’t it’s worth it to pay to see the spectacular view of the City. Transportation: highly recommend the Vegas transit system – bus takes you to and from all locations for a low daily rate and the pick-up is just outside the front entrance of the Stratosphere. Our one and only problem: Concierge desk really needs more training prior to assisting Hotel guests, we were miss-informed on a few things the most crucial one was the shuttles to and from the airport fortunately we checked with the shuttle service in advance and allowed enough time for taxi service should we need it, however if would have listened to the Concierge desk we could have missed our flight.…..

Reviews.Title: “Not 'ON' the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: 7bharats
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere gives you the best view of the Strip in Las Vegas. Period. The caveat to that is that it's NOT exactly located ON the Strip; you can argue that it's at the northern end of the Strip, after you have passed all the other major hotels/casinos. The traffic in Las Vegas Blvd (the Strip!) can be pretty bad between Stratosphere and the other casinos towards the south, especially on weekend evenings. But otherwise, the hotel is really good. the rooms are pretty good. Enough parking space (if you have a rental car!), you just have to find the empty spot though! ;) Free entry into the Tower for guests is pretty good. Would definitely recommend if you're not willing to spend too much to stay in any of the bigger hotels!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas!!! Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler1090
Reviews.Content: Our trip began as a two day trip and ended up being a week long trip!!! This hotel is a great value the rooms were very reasonable and there was a lot of things on site to do. The roller coaster rides are a must even though I think they are a little pricy. If you like taking risks the SKY JUMP is a MUST. FYI the sky jump costs around $100-$120. The Top of the World restaurant has the best view of Vegas and the food is great. The shops on site have everything you would want from clothes to drinks and more food and some specialty stuff like a candy store and a spa. We are not much for gambling but after we learned craps and roulette from a good and patient dealer we got hooked for a little while. The concierge was very helpful in getting us information and tickets on shows. I highly recommend the ULTIMATE VARIETY SHOW. It is a great hotel and the room prices are very, very well priced especially for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “It's fine, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MNTwinsFan333
Reviews.Content: While the rate was reasonable, once you pay for a room upgrade (to the newly-remodeled rooms) and the resort fee, you could have stayed someplace closer to the main part of the Strip..it's a long walk to the Bellagio area. The food at Fellini's was very good, the staff members we talked with were helpful and friendly and the room was clean. We had no real complaints about the place, but it wasn't anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JosephineGia
Reviews.Content: I'm not a particularly picky traveler, but Stratosphere was a little too dirty for my taste. The casino area and even the hallways looked promising enough. When we opened the door to the room though, I could immediately see a ton of dust in all the corners and a really tired air to the whole room. The sheets were clean, at least! But the light switch on the bedstand felt sticky... Eek! There were actual cobwebs on one of the hanging lamp switches. I've never seen that before. There were green mold spots in the shower, and rust spots on the tissue container. I don't know, other people seemed to have had a cleaner experience so maybe they just had better rooms (for the record, we stayed in 5046 I think?). Maybe it's a hit or miss, but I wouldn't risk it, not when you have so many other options on the strip! I talked to a few of my friends who have stayed at the Stratosphere and their sentiment echoed mine, "Once, but never again." I stayed at the Riveria, right down the street, last time and the rooms were really clean and comfortable. I was impressed, since it was a smaller casino, and we got a great price for it (something like $60/night). I wish I'd stayed there again instead of the Stratosphere. It's just too far down the strip to be worth it, also. Also, while the workers at Roxie's diner were nice, they had some kitchen scheduling issues because my to-go omelette and hash browns spent more than 20 minutes under the heat lamp while they cooked my pancakes... so it was pretty cardboardy and nasty by the time I ate it. How do you mess up breakfast food??

Reviews.Title: “Squeezing every penny out of your pocket”
Reviews.Author: Jere_O_comptoir
Reviews.Content: Despite the attractive pricing on their website (access to the tower included ..), this hotel is not a good value and here is why: 1) no beakfast included 2) no coffee machine in the room 3) no free wifi , paying wifi for 7$ per hour or 11$ per 24h, yes you read correctly! Only one device can be connected per session... 4) considered a downtown hotel and not on the strip thus higher taxi / shuttle prices. 5) customer service is bad (euphemisim) you will be treated like a head in a cattle of tourists .. But isn't what las Vegas is about ? 6) whan toilet flushes you will have a taste of the bellagio fointain, without the scenery !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend”
Reviews.Author: EECV217
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. The casino had a variety of tables and slot machines. You receive an ACE card which entitles you to discounts at the restaurants and shows within the hotel. I felt very safe and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel, the price was perfect. The Las Vegas strip view from the top floors was amazing. You must do the rides and have dinner on top of the world (you have to make reservations) . The restaurants spins around giving you a complete view of Las Vegas absolutely, breath taking - you also see people bungie jumping on the side of the building. It's at the end of the strip, it's about 3 long blocks to where all of the casinos are but, I didn't mind the walk. It was a fun stroll for my husband and I. We took pictures and stopped at the souvenir shops along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mon-ai-martin-salao
Reviews.Content: Very close to both ends of Las Vegas from Old Strip to New Stripe. A fews steps from the Bus Stop. Very nice service, nice view of LAs Vegas. Request for mountain view. wonderful sunrise and sky line

Reviews.Title: “On the STRIP and with VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: TXBACKYARDCOOK
Reviews.Content: The first thing we though of was WOW, what a great stay a "A GREAT PRICE ON THE STRIP"! If you are traveling with kids I HIGHLY recommend this sopt for a GREAT STAY; big rooms with lots to do for the family. The tower was awesome and the pool was top notch, but the best part was the stay was only $26 per night for a family of 4, you can't beat that with a stick. I got my great rate from www.i4vegas.com which I found to post the best room rates in Vegas for Vegas. The best part is this hotel is on the strip but not the heart of the strip; the hotel is more at the end of the strip away from the drunk and partying action. Please check this GEM of a hotel out if your headed to Lost Wages,NV!

Reviews.Title: “a bit out of the way, but fine”
Reviews.Author: RocketQueen101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for 15 nights last month and had a great time.No problems at all. This was our second stay and will be staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “High in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bjbrall4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and the casino has a variety of table and slot games at various price points. I had three buffet meals "comped" on very little gambling by using the affinity card. I also got a certificate for the gift shop. Don't bring the kids; there's really nothing for them to do (which is true of most of Las Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “good value always at the "strato"”
Reviews.Author: rogica
Reviews.Content: Consistantly clean spacious rooms. 7 stays so far, next visit in 2 weeks time, can't wait.We pay for an upgrade for a remodelled room with high floor, and even then it's so reasonably priced. We love the buffet Plates, the staff are so well groomed in their plates uniform, and very obliging,and it's great value especially with comps discount. The Strato is at the far end of the strip, but the deuce strip bus is very useful, to get around on and some of the drivers are really quite funny with their little quips..

Reviews.Title: “Correct hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: darius77
Reviews.Content: The select rooms (recently renovated) are very clean, not so big but nicely renovated. There is no coffeemaker or refrigerator in the room, A/C is a little bit noisy. The amenities inside the casino are somehow light and cannot compete with other big Casinos on the strip (but the price is lower so...). Few restaurants are available inside (a bit expensive). Good pool. The Stratosphere is located at the end of the Strip, a little bit far away from everything when walking (around 45min from the Bellagio). But it is ok by car. The tower associated to the hotel is a nice attraction (complimentary for hotel guest), the view from the top is very nice. Two attractions are also available at the top (thrill ride). A nice bar is located on the 107th floor. Bad point: a resort fee of around $7 is added on the room price, but it does not include the internet access !! (§11 more to have it...)

Reviews.Title: “rooms small - no view but they did give you lots of drinks”
Reviews.Author: joe_testa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and were disappointed with the room. you had to get out of bed walk across the room and look around a column to look out the small window. We went up to the roof and had to walk around garbage cans which were being used to catch the rain water leaking through the roof. On the plus side, the casino did come around with drink very often and the buffet was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Honeymoon stay at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: mrsSmithAli
Reviews.Content: My now Husband && I traveled to Las Vegas to be married and chose to stay at the Stratosphere Hotel. I first chose this hotel because I did not plan on visiting the "Strip", i found very reasonable rates and there were no exorbitant holds for incidentals or resort fees for unnecessary amenities. We stayed Monday night (September 5th, 2011) in a SELECT ROOM. I booked through TripRes.com and got the room along with TWO UNLIMITED TOWER RIDE PASSES for $90. Unlimited Ride Passes are $34 each regularly so this was a great deal. The room itself was great especially for the price paid. It looked exactly as pictured and was clean. We were on the 9th floor, Room 022 and I did not request a view. The second night after getting married we stayed in the Oasis Suite. They allowed us to check in early around 11am. When I walked in I was floored. Let me throw in that it is suppose to be a non-smoking suite but it smelled like smoke upon entry. Other than that the room was all we wanted and more. There were so few pictures available for preview so I wasn't exactly sure what I was getting myself into but I was pleasantly shocked. It was a very romantic room. Comfortable King Bed that we did not want to get out of. Two flat screens, one in front of the bed and the other in front of the Sleeper Sofa. Small table for two to dine romantically. The Jacuzzi was accessible from the room as well as the bathroom and it was huge and very relaxing. The bathroom altogether was huge and elegant. I've included plenty of pictures so you can see for yourself. We did not utilize any of the restaurants but made frequent trips to McDonald's which is located on the 2nd floor. Regular McDonald rates, Dollar Menu included and they stay open all night. The morning in the Oasis Suite we ordered BREAKFAST IN BED FOR TWO which came to only $39 with all taxes, charges and gratuities included !!! Now I think that's great. The food was upstairs quickly and EVERYTHING was delicious. We ordered French Toast, Cheese Eggs, side of Fresh Strawberries and 2 Orange Juices. The previous morning we ate at Denny's which is less than a 5 minute walk from the Hotel. We had breakfast for two there for only $17. All in all for what we went for the Hotel was great. I will add that we had no problems getting to and from the airport as we paid for Round Trip Shuttle Transportation upon arrival in Las Vegas. We rode with Ritz Transportation however there are various shuttles all lined up at the Baggage claim for your choosing. It was $32 ROUND TRIP for the two of us to be transported to Stratosphere. On the morning of departure they were there on time and yes they do pick you up 3hours before your flight's departure as it is a shared ride and most airlines have a check in time limit. There is a store on the 2nd floor that sells alcohol at a reasonable price along with other snacks, beverages and inexpensive souvenirs. Also a 24 hour Gym on the 2nd floor as well. The only negatives that I will state about the Hotel is that we felt that the pool didn't stay open long enough. It closed at 8pm and we NEVER had the time to visit. There were no Microwaves in either room. The Oasis Suite had a refrigerator but a Microwave would have been nice. Lastly this hotel has no business center which presented a huge inconvenience for us because we had no way to print our TripRes.com itinerary in order to claim our ride passes. They have a couple of computers on site however there is a minimum of $5 charge and they also place a $25 hold on your credit card. I will add that the staff at the Ticketing counter was helpful in resolving this problem. All in all it was a great, comfortable and romantic stay and we would surely stay again especially in the Oasis Suite.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Travelcat420
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Vegas at least once or twice a year and almost always stay at the Strat. True, it is not on the sparkly strip and yes, it is less fancy than those higher priced hotels, but we prefer to spend our money on entertainment in Vegas, and not sinking it into a hotel room we don't spend that much time in. That being said, it is not as if the rooms aren't nice; they actually are very good accommodations. Because the value is tremendous at the Strat, we stopped getting regular standard rooms when we stay and always request a suite. There are various suites available, but we like the standard "Star" suite which is an over-sized room with a comfy king bed, sofa, dining table, bar w/refrigerator, and large bathroom with big glass shower, jacuzzi tub, dual sinks & private toilet room. Around $100, depending on what night(s) you're staying. We also like being above the 14th floor, which gives us a good view of the east end of the Strip. The staff is always very nice & accommodating, the room has always been very clean, and we enjoy the good-sized casino downstairs. It is also close to the Downtown/Fremont Street area, which we prefer to the overpriced, trendy, crowded casinos on the main Strip. Wish they had more restaurants on premises, but there are several places to eat nearby. Do not waste your money at the Top of the World restaurant, however. Grossly over-priced for mediocre food & so-so service. Lots of great shopping can be done on their top floors, and the 360 view from the tower is AMAZING, don't miss it! All in all, a good value for time spent in Vegas. Not as inexpensive as Fremont Street hotels, but much easier on the wallet than the Strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience - we're never staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: SmartCookie123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked The Oasis Suite online in July. When I arrived on Aug. 31 to check-in I found out about the hidden fine print of a $50.00/night deposit which was NOT mentioned anywhere on your website during the reservation process. My husband and I were looking forward to spending our Vegas honeymoon in a lush suite...instead we spent it in a room that was very small, had terrible pillows (I'm still working through the chronic neck pain those gave me), and lacked a refrigerator so whatever leftovers we wanted to save went to waste. We felt especially alienated during our stay because we (fortunately) do not carry credit cards....this prevented us from, well, everything. We wanted to get in-room wi-fi internet access....but alas, a $150.00 deposit ($50/night) was needed since we didn't have a credit card. We wanted to rent a movie for in-room viewing...again, another silly deposit of $150 ($50/night). We offered to pay cash upfront....alas, a deposit of $100/night was required for cash. Ridiculous! These silly policies made us feel unwelcome at the Stratosphere; we felt like our personal well being wasn't important, only our money was what mattered. In addition to all this, the most annoying thing about our stay was consistently being harassed by people on the casino floor by the Select elevators trying to get us to sign up for promotions and sell us things we had absolutely no interest in. They had a hard time taking a polite "No thank you" for an answer. All of this guaranteed that when we return to Vegas we will NOT be staying at the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “''Three Days is Enough in Vegas''”
Reviews.Author: 19Viajera77
Reviews.Content: We arrived near midnight at Las Vegas and we took a Taxi from the Airport to our Hotel. Prepare to pay $30 for a taxi. Maybe renting a car will be a nice option for next time. Checking-in was fast and they gave us the 18th floor. Room was nice, clean and big. Bathrooms could need renovations. Shower curtains weren't good, so expect some leaks. Beds were comfortable and clean.. This hotel was a good deal; for 3 days and 2 nights we paid less than $150.00 They had a buffet after midnight for less than $10.00 for those hungry hubbies.. The next day, we enjoyed breakast at I-Hop next door from the hotel, then walked the strip. However, the dry heat is so intense and the sun burns your skin very quickly, so remember to bring sunscreen if you don't want to end up with red patches in your face and neck. In the afternoon, we enjoyed swimming at the pool. Stratosphere offers a special for half prize drinks and appetizers from 1-4 p.m. Unfortunately, we went a little after 4, so we miseed it. So we paid $9.00 for a frozen slush strwaberry margarita. From the pool area, you could also watch some of the action happening at the tower where jumpers risk their lives for $100.00. (Bungy Jumping that is..) Our last day, we wanted to inquire some information about getting to the Airport , so we called the Concierge, but she wasn't very helpful. She claimed there was a Shuttle that wasn't part of the Hotel that will drive us to the Airport, but that we have to be 3 hours prior at some specific spots and that we were already late to take it. So, there wasn't anything else she could of help us with... She seemed very young to be a Concierge and we didn't feel she was willing to help us. At the end, we didn't want to spend another $30.00 for taxi again, so we used our GPS Iphone and look for directions. Thankfully, we ride for free to the Airport with a 24hrs pass we purchased the day before when touring the strip. It was a plus that we only had carry-on bags, so we were able to a walk couple of blocks from the hotel to the bus stop. It's amazing how much help you could get from an Smartphone and not from a human being. Regardless what happened, we liked our stay at The Stratosphere. But I'll be more interested to look for other good deals and closer hotels to the strip. Viva Las Vegas ;)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: JerBear059
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel! We are in the tower once while there, though a little pricey, the view was amazing. We also ate at the Roxy's (the 50's diner), which was a great time. There are several other places to eat just outside of the hotel (including IHOP and Carl's Jr.). As for transportation, we generally rode The Deuce (for $7 per day and unlimited rides, it was a great deal). This allowed us to check out some great casinos all along the strip and in the downtown area. The Deuce picks up right in front of the hotel, so that was very convenient. We did find out that several employees in there area also ride the deuce, so riding in the morning (7:30a-10a) and in the late afternoon (4:30p-6p) were not great choices. We also liked that there weren't any people in the hotel trying to get us to look at timeshares or other properties - some of the other casinos tried to pressure us into viewing other properties which got rather annoying. All in all we had a great time at the Stratosphere and look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “its alrite”
Reviews.Author: erikak99
Reviews.Content: its an ok hotel.. clean'.. the pool area nice...the ac worked great... customer service was great and helpful...its nice for being an older hotel...its pretty far from the strip tho...at the casino the waitress do take a long time to bring u ur drinks.... for the price its a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a bad location.”
Reviews.Author: thunderguppy
Reviews.Content: Room and casino are comparable to most of the other nicer casinos along the strip. Room was clean and adequate and the Casino was a typical Vegas casino. What made it stand out was the Tower and the low price. Free Tower trips came with room which would have almost cost more than the room itself. Tower lounge bartender was great and the view was awesome. The buffet wasn't nothing to brag about and other food choises were limited. The worst thing was it's location in a seedy part of Vegas on the end of the strip. NOT in walking distance of te rest of the strip. Still a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: PeanutbutterUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights as the last stop on an organised tour. Hotel was absolutely fine. Yes it is a bit of a way from the main part of the strip, but this was no problem for us. When we weren't on the tour bus we just used the Deuce ($7 for a day) or taxi ($20) to get to the heart of the action. Room was quite large, clean and luckily in a quiet part of the hotel. Wasn't in it much though as there to experience Vegas! Buffet breakfast was good value (and the variety was an eye opener!) and ate in Fellini's 2 out of the 3 nights - lovely! Free access to the top of the tower was a bonus, view was spectacular & worth going to the Top of the World bar for 2 for 1 vodka martini's in happy hour (think it's 5pm - 7pm). Casino not as big or as well laid out as that in the main hotels, but fine for an amateur gambler. Agree with a previous reveiwer who said there was a strange smell by the central elevators - smelt like bad eggs! Overall this is a fine hotel to base yourself while exploring Las Vegas, although if I visit again independently I would choose to stay nearer the main part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay to have a quick look of what it is Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Crustiviajero
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as it was one if the cheapest hotel in LAS and with FREE access to the Tower. We're on the way from Bryce Canyon & Zion NP to Los Angeles and we just wanted to have a quick look of what is Las Vegas at night. 34USD/night The hotel is a little bit far away from the Strip but is a good option if you don't want to stress with lots of people. The room we had was recently remodelated with flat TV screen, nice view to LAS and a very comfy bed. The bathroom was also OK. Check-in was smooth (I guss because it was not a week-end) and speaking spanish which we appreciate it :) Valet parking is complimentary but not the internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Price, but Location is Far from Center Strip”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller034
Reviews.Content: If you have a car, this is a good choice hotel for price and accommodations. Without a car, you will have to hassle a 2 mile commute to the center of the Strip, and 4 miles to the far end of the Strip. Pros: Price, nice clean room, OK buffet for the price Cons: You must pay for Internet (annoying that they gouge $11.99 a day for this, but this seems all too common in Vegas) Air conditioners do not have adjustable air flow blades, so air blows directly on the nearest bed in a twin bedded room. I had to rig a chair and a suitcase to keep from getting a cold. Only one small round bar of soap given daily. Glad I brought my own soap because amenities in the gift shops are outrageously overpriced (example: $1.75 for a teeny bottle of ginger ale, the size used for one cocktail). Tub would not drain completely for several minutes after shower (we were on 17th floor). Hair dryer was broken, but fairly quickly replaced after a call to front desk. Shared lamp between beds - no way to read in bed without bothering the person in the other bed. Other than the above, the hotel was average on the whole, with the usual disgusting cigarette smoke in the casino (when oh when will Las Vegas hotels bite the bullet and require non-smoking in ALL casinos?).

Reviews.Title: “Short and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: shortcakeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night as we were arriving late to Vegas and wanted to go up to the tower for the night view. Paid $40 for room with Tower access which was the whole purpose of staying at The Stratosphere. Room itself was fine and clean. View was of a concrete wall but for the price I paid, I have nothing to complain about. Didnt see the pool area as the stay was to brief but did enjoy the casino which was tons of fun. Well worth staying just to see the view from the tower. Ate at the diner late that night which was also fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2thesun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere in May. It was a great deal, so we were able to stay longer than expected. They have some really scary rides on the top of the tower, and a very cool observation deck that you can see the whole valley floor from. The rooms were very nice, and the staff friendly. It was a short walk to the rest of the strip, but if you don't like to walk, take the bus. The buses do 24 hour, or 3 day rates, and are very economical. It is also a short bus ride to Freemont Street which you should not miss. All in all we will be back to the Stratosphere the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't prepared for the smokiness!”
Reviews.Author: Mommacat41
Reviews.Content: We started our spring break vacation at this hotel and traveled from there to Utah & Arizona. We agreed as a family that the Las Vegas portion of our trip was the weakest part - too many people, too much smoke and way too many ugly tattoos! Our room was big enough but the smoky smell was everywhere. I guess we are just used to the non-smoking atmosphere of New York state restaurants and hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Why did you change Stratosphere...?”
Reviews.Author: JackSpade_79
Reviews.Content: I use to be a real fan of the Stratosphere. It was the hotel I stayed at during my first ever trip to Vegas in 2002 and I had good memories of the nice, spacious room as well as the big, bright and fun casino atmosphere - all for a great price which made it a terrific option when compared to the other expensive Strip hotels. I walked in this time to see the renovated Strat which was so dark I thought I'd been exiled to Hades. Gone is the vibrant and bright feel of the old Strat. It's been replaced by the dark and pretentious interior of the expensive, "fleece-you-charge-you-$5-for-a-coke" Strip hotels. It's trying to look like the Venetian or M and I guess that some people may like that depending on preference but I really miss the old Strat. Way too dark and I kept feeling nostalgiac wishing I'd go down the elevator and find the old Strat casino waiting for me...but no. So so dark. Truthfully, the Strat remodel is just part of an irreversible trend in Vegas.....the end of the customer-oriented value and fun of days gone by.....replaced by the endless proliferation of Louis Vuitton boutique shops, high-end dining where you can sit on a nice terrace and pay $37 for a tiny buttered salmon dinner, encounter an endless barrage of bad customer service be it by stonefaced dealers or grumpy bartenders, and get longhauled by cabbies for $20 on what should be a $7 ride. I miss the days when you lost all your money on your own at the tables! At least that was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: spencer855
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Vegas, This was a fantastic hotel, Everything you need in one spot. We came to see my daughter shoot pool in the APA national pool championship. We enjoyed going up to the tower and observering all the rides and the view was outstanding could not have been no better. I do wish it would have been a little closer to the strip. It was a very long walk in the heat. Spent a lot of money on cabs. I would stay here again when I come back to Vegas..I would do differently on my mode of Transportation.

Reviews.Title: “All in all a good hotel and for the money you cant grumble”
Reviews.Author: Tractorfactor
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at the stratos before so new what to expect, they upgraded us to the central tower which seemed to have better or newer rooms. The stratos is ok and I wouldnt slate it really , the area around their is a bit grotty as its away from the main strip but its nothing major really and i wouldnt let it deter you. anyway the rooms were clean, maid everyday, air con great , room service and front desk etc very friendly and nice You have loads of shops upstairs to look at and a mcdonalds and pizza and hot dog place if you get hungry, also roxy's which is a 50's diner which was good AS for transportation you are handy for the duece but i would use the SDX the strip and downtown express as its quicker and comes up less packed you can use this to go to the north outlet malls and freemont street, the stop for this is just behind the denny's sign you cant miss it. The stop for going south (down the strip) is next to the fried chicken place (basically near denny's on the other side of the road. There is always the monorail but i prefered this bus its so much quicker than the duece, although doesnt stop at all stops (hence express!!!) 2 main bars in the hotel and you get free entry to the tower for the whole of your stay , having a cool beer up their was great, starbucks and internet also in the hotel and a couple of gift shops which also sell water/food/medicines etc etc I really liked it and its a bit less hustle and bustle than hotels down the strip and I also enjoyed that really Do see the grand canyon if you can and when you get picked up from the airport by cab, ask the driver to go paradise road not the FREEWAY, thats a con straight away !!!!!! Beleive me Ive stayed here twice and the Sahara once, CAB DOWN PARADISE ROAD NOT FREEWAY !!!! Overall i really enjoyed my stay, its not as pricey as other hotels but i thought the rooms were great nice and clean with 2 queen beds !!!! they also do offer a shuttlebus to airport if you wish Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Wedding, 7 Hotels in 14 days”
Reviews.Author: OzzieExplorer
Reviews.Content: After very reluctantly leaving Paris we took a cab to Stratosphere. We stayed here over the weekend when prices leap to triple the week rate in Las Vegas and we were on a budget so had to leave the 4 and 5 star places to a 3 star. Having read reviews on tripadvisor we tend to think that people are expecting a 4+ star place out of Stratosphere and are a bit mean and stingy with their reviews. Would I stay here again? Definitely. It is a distance for the rest of the strip action but it was a great value weekend stay. We got a strip view from the lovely checkin receptionist. Room was a similar size to Paris - not as opulent but definitely liveable. It was clean and a lot plainer than previous places. Casino: a bit dingy with stained carpet but these machines paid the best of all the casinos we hit in LV. Food: the Burger bar with the singing waiters was awesome! There is food available in the shopping centre but you must eat at the burger bar. Top of the World Restaurant was a good lunch - so good we returned for the Wedding Brunch here. Awesome views but you have to be a braver person than I to do the rides at the top. Shopping centre wasn't great. Hotels we stayed in were: MGM Grand Paris Stratosphere Bellagio Hilton on the Strip Luxor Venetian

Reviews.Title: “So NOT impressed with WHOLE experience”
Reviews.Author: XSsiveRedhead
Reviews.Content: I do not usually post negative negative reviews because I think there are quite enough of those but Stratoshere was so bad that I MUST post! The room did look as if it had an attempt at a renovation but poor results indeed. It took two different maintenance people to get the tv to work, Only was furnished with TWO bath (oversized hand towel...I am 100lbs and it wouldn't cover me!) that smelled horrible and was stiff! The pillows on the bed were tiny and course as if made out of corn husks. When I wanted to go to the pool to try to shake off this initial bad experience and the pool is horrible as well!! Try to find pics online of their pool, I dare you....won't find them....there is a reason for that! I have seen better pools at Motel 6 when I was in my 20's. Food was TERRIBLE....and the service even worse. I decided to check out a day early and when I went to have my car brought back around by the valet...THEY LOST MY CAR!! I had to describe my Audi A6 to them and after 45 minutes they brought me someone else NEW A4 Audi (paper tags still on them) and joked I would be trading up......REALLY??? Took them another hour to find my car and the entire time left me standing in 100 degree heat and treating me like it was my fault. If anyone mentions to you to stay here....DO NOT!

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected”
Reviews.Author: bronstmj
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a four day stay in one of the select rooms at the Stratosphere and were impressed with the room, the view and the service. For the price we paid we got more then we expected. People complaining about how far away it is from the strip should stop since this is a given. We rented a car and had no problem getting around. By using the valet service at the hotel we never had to wait more then 5 minutes to hand the car off or pick it up. Rental rates were so inexpensive that it was actually cheaper to rent a car to get around than using taxis or the buses. I would highly recommend renting. The only negative is that most of the parking spaces at the resorts on the Strip were quite far from Las Vegas Blvd, requiring a short walk. We spent most of our days and evenings either Downtown or on the Strip. When we were back at the hotel we had everything we needed. Unlimited access to the Tower was well worth staying at the Stratosphere. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with teenagers. They had more fun here than anywhere else on the Strip, although downtown was a blast with the people watching and the ziplines. Overall, there is nothing negative to stay about the Stratosphere considering its value relative to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: carmensita90
Reviews.Content: Being it was my first time in Vegas I have to say staying at the stratosphere was the greatest choice I could have done..loved the staff,the food,the pool,the slots everything was amazing ..and its not that far away from the main action on the strip simply take a bus or a cab and voilaaaa.....I would be most certainly be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place”
Reviews.Author: alpha03
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is a nice hotel. I had no problem checking in. Although I stayed in the old tower it was very clean and comfortable. It was a bit worn. It appeared that the fridge had leaked at some point and the carpet was stained in that area. However, the bed was wonderful and the bathroom spacious and well supplied. It is true that you are far down on the strip. Nonetheless, the duece can get you aroung very fast. It cost $7.00 for a 24 hour pass. The food at the buffet is very good. We felt very safe and found the staff to be helpful. The pool is also very nice with a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: snazzysnaps
Reviews.Content: It is what you would expect from a large LV hotel. Check in was quick efficient with minimal hotel information as they move quickly to erase the queue, pool area was good, clean and well staffed. Room size was amongst the smallest we experienced whilst touring the CA and NV areas (despite being a "select room". It was also the only hotel that lacked tea or coffee making facilities in the room (our room anyway, but there is a starbucks in the lobby). Yes it is at the end of the strip but with the transport links this is not a problem (fail to see why people moan about this after they book it, research before you go there is no excuse)

Reviews.Title: “Great place - poor location”
Reviews.Author: WyoBus
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out the staff at the Startosphere in all departments were very helpful and friendly. We had the refurbished rooms with strip view and were very pleased with them, especially as we had been upgrade to spa-tub rooms. Buffet was good and the diner particularly impressive with the "singing wait-staff" making the visit well worthwhile. Our only comment would be the location - and this can be good or bad. The good point is that its equi-distant from downtown and the main part of the "Strip" Thus as we had a night in Fremont Street and the next night at "Legends in Concert" at Harrahs it was a good place to be staying. The negative point about location is that, with the Sahara closing earlier this year, the Stratosphere is like an island on its own - a long walk or bus or taxi-ride to anywhere... However the hotel is offering some very good room rates so well worth checking their web-site!

Reviews.Title: “best desert view ?”
Reviews.Author: fernandez10
Reviews.Content: i live in Italy and i love Vegas and especially the desert arround :If one day i will go back The Stratosphere Tower is the best place to see the city until the desert just beautifull Fernando ciao

Reviews.Title: “Cheap to stay and you can see why!”
Reviews.Author: AZNA1
Reviews.Content: This was out first of 2 hotels that we would be staying in while in vegas! The room was clean but the horrible lay out and then it went down hill from there! After the first night we woke up and discovered that the toilet has been leaking all over the bathroom floor, after they sent a maintenance main up to look at it we were told it was unable to be fixed and we would not be moved to a new room! After much talk with then we finally got a new room! The main elevator lobby has avery strong smell of sewer and after a few days it was apparent they had a blockage and was doing nothing about it!!! The casino it self was quiet dirty and very tacky compared to a lot of others on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Peg5439
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 35th anniversary at the Stratosphere Hotel and Casino. Our room was gorgous and had a big jacuzzi tub with a nice seating area to accomedate our guests. The hotel looked new and remodelled and the staff and dealers were very friendly. We ate at the buffet and the breakfast we had was hot and delicious. Roxy's diner food was served hot and quickly and it too was great! Go see the show Bite, the music was a lot of greatest hits and you will love it with the talented dancers and acrobatics. Everything was so nice and we look forward to our next stay at the Stratosphere. We recommend you try this hotel if you haven't stayed there before.

Reviews.Title: “Big clean room with a big bed”
Reviews.Author: Ballyx
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel. The room was after an upgrade on the 26th floor. Not the best view, but the rooms where big and clean. The bed was good. Only Wi-fi for extra money. Casino was good. There is a buffet at the hotel. For 20 dollars all u can eat and drink. The choices could be better, but after 2 weeks of hamburgers anything else is good enough:) Location was not ideal. Where it all happens is too far away to go by foot, but if u go with the car its not a big problem. If u can stay at for example New york New york u can better stay there, but if this is one of the few options, u don't get disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas on the cheap....great stay”
Reviews.Author: JGJ55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Stratosphere from 1-6 August. Have been to Vegas before, at The Sahara in 2006. Returned for our 10th wedding anniversary. Even though hotel is at the very top of the strip, we actually liked being there, as we felt the strip was very busy. so it was nice to come & go. Hotel is basic, no frills in the Casino. Bar & Starbucks in the main area. Nice Italian restaurant Fellini's, where staff were so goo, and food also.Not keen on Roxy's diner, continental breakfast was too $$ & not enough. So we didn't go back. Upstairs you have a number of shops. Some tacky, some not. A few places to eat, ie. Mexican, where the meals are huge. My Hubby & I shared chicken fajitas, and it was just fine. Our anniversary dinner was at The Top Of The World restaurant at the top of the tower. The tower is a must, even if not eating there. We booked a table at 7.30, but went up early while it was still light. The views out to the mountains and the sunset was amazing. But the best is when all the lights of Vegas start to come on. Makes for a very special place. Our meal with drinks for 4 people was approx USD100 per person. But well worth it. The room we had was a strip view room on the 23rd floor. Not exactly a strip view, but you could see a few hotels. We booked via Zuji, but found when we got to hotel there was only a standard room booked, even though I had it in black & white what we had paid for. Reception did there best to find us a nice room, but we had to pay an extra $22 per night for a renovated strip view room. We were happy to at the time as we got a real cheap deal on accommodation. ( taking it up with Zuji to get money back. Watch this space!) Hubby went on Insanity ride...the name says it all. Did a Grand Canyon Tour...had a few issues with tour company, but Grand Canyon is a MUST!. Went to South rim Air/coach tour. Also highly recommend Scoot City Tours. You travel to Red Rock Canyon in tiny brightly coloured cars in a convoy. Once out into the wide open space and the Red Rock canyon the views are amazing. Many stops for photo opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, out of the way hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Talbottca
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Stratosphere with 7 other ladies for a bachelorette party. This hotel looks close to the strip on a map, but it is about a 2 mile walk... That seems SO much longer in 100+ heat. It is a smaller casino than most, but because it is so far from the strip, you can get to any table or machine without a wait. The pool area is nice with a great view of the tower. On top of the tower are 4 x-treme thrill rides... For those interested. The hotel wa clean and the staff were very nice. The rooms were modestly appointed with great counter space in the bathroom. The hotel was inexpensive to stay. This is a great hotel especially if you plan on renting a car in Vegas. Close to the strip and also to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: knight1431
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the 10th-16th, this hotel is comfortable and very affordable, you have a lot of choices in dining and gambling. The buffet is probably one of the best in Vegas and I've come to Vegas every year for the last 5 years and have stayed here twice. The only drawback I have is that in making my reservations, (Usually 3-5 months in advance) I always request a smoking with king size bed and I always run into some sort of a check in problem centering around availability but they have fixed the problem both times and deducted the resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with great price”
Reviews.Author: Blindbutterfly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere last May and found nice for the price I paid... it is a little away from the other luxurious hotels and main attractions( shows, clubs, restaurant) but the bus/hotel is rigth in front of the hotel.... it has a great pool..actually 2 pools one for everyone and one European style... the roof top restaurant was excellent.. very accomodating staff execllent for teh young party crowd with all the night life and trill rides rigth there in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel little bit too far of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Mehlsack
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. You need to get limousines or taxis to get to the happening of the strip. Staff was friendly and housekeeping staff was very efficient. Rooms clean and Concierge helpful. Had a really good time, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “good famliy hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldbenny
Reviews.Content: i was not to sure when we booked this hotel .as it is at the end of the strip , and quite a distance from the main area you will need a car or the bus to get to the best bits of the strip , the hotel was packed but the service was good and good helpful staff at the check in did not wait long only five min a good clean room that had just been updated a flat screen tv and good maid service , the only downside is they still allow smoking in the casino area , this is a common thing in this state , they have a good pool on the 8th floor great for kids with a lifeguard and staff on hand if needed not cheap but better than some we have stayed in they seem to cater for familys , the straospher tower is great and when you book in you get a free pass to the tower ...this saves alot would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing at this hotel is the Tower”
Reviews.Author: Galant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel on August 2011. The sun was shining and the sky is blue this time of the year. Temperature 110F. Great for photography. The room bathroom smell like sewer in the night, it was a strong odor. There is no ironing board and everything inside was expensive. There is a Butger King at 100 meters form the hotel Going north.
