I eated at Roxys and ended paying $20.00 for a sandwich. I booked a "remodeled" room, and had no WIFI. TV channels are only news and they charge you for any movies. I asked to use a computer, they sent me to the Starbuck cafe at the Hotel, they wanted to charge me $5 for 5 minutes, rip off. I went outside, and in front of the Hotel going south, there is Aztec Casino, at the corner of the boulevard, and for $5 you have 20 minutes of internet and with printer where you can print boarding pasess, nice deal. AHHHH, and Coke or pepsi cans, .99 cents! Here are other tips. 1) At airport take the Shuttle, they are located just outside baggage claim area exit doors. Grayline, CLS etc. One way trip to Strip Hotels is $7.00, round trip $12.00. Downtown hotels are two or three dollars more. Pay only the one way trip Airport- Hotel. The Shuttle from hotel to airport always arrive late at airport and you can have problems with your flight. Why? The shuttle go to different hotels to pick up other people, while you are sitting inn the shuttle, thinking vabout your flight. Taxi Strip Hotels-Airport is only $12-14.00. I would pay it to arrive on time at airport. 2) Transportation at the Strip- Take the Deuce. Is a double decker bus, with A/C, and new, you pay $7.00 to the driver for 24 hours transportation within the Strip. YTou need to have exact change enterring the bus, in front of the driver there is a machine. You enter the dollars, the system give you a ticket you can use in any Deuce Bus for a 24 hours period. You only have to slip the ticket next time, and wala! you got the deal.! Is a very clean bus. 3) Study the place before going, see videos at internet, you tube, see pictures at tripadvisor, read reviews, the more you learn the more you will save. 4) Food- There is a burger king about 100 meters to the north. You will se the sign as soon as you walk a few steps. The Bellagio Fountains a show you must see. The show runs every half and hour. Also, try to go up the Eifell Tower at Paris Hotel, is $15.00 per person and the view is beautiful, by day or night. Fremont Street is another place to go. The light show is amazing. And is a very safe and clean place. I found this place to be very expensive with little services to offer to the travellers. The only good thing it have is the Tower, you have to pay $16.00 to go up. But if you stay in the hotel, show your room key, and you can go as many times as you want. SKY JUMPER- Insanity Rides. As i said, nothing is free or cheap at this hotel. Sky Jump is $110.00 per person. Insanity rides price range from $13 to $15.00. I do not recommend this hotel for a budget traveller. It does not offer alternatives to traveler within this economy crisis. Look to stay in other place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Dan4life67
Reviews.Content: Me and my family got to Vegas this past week. We stayed at the Stratosphere because we believed it would be great for the kids, and it was. The hotel was recently renovated so the hotel was nice and clean and the same goes for the rooms. We did not have time to go up to the tower, which is free if you stay at the hotel, but heard its a great place to go if your a dare devil and want to experience some real thrill rides or just want a spectacular view of the Strip. The only negative that we had was one morning, around 11am, they had an alarm test for the whole hotel. It seemed like they could have done it at a later time but it was for a short period of time and that seemed to be the only flaw.

Reviews.Title: “Room were clean”
Reviews.Author: rosemary t
Reviews.Content: Room were clean. No smell of smoke. Got to go to the top and view the sights below since we were staying in the hotel. Would stay here again, even though it's far from the main action of the strip. Concierge staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely Loved our room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tdelvalle90
Reviews.Content: The room was awesome! Didn't like the back view on it but it was a great room nonetheless. We enjoyed our stay there it was great. Exactly what was on the picture when we booked it was the room that we got. Hotel and casino staff were very friendly and helpful. Will I stay here again? I more than likely will.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: EZ2Please
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Stratosphere was relatively inexpensive, as far as Vegas Strip hotels go - but that's partly because it's at the far end of the strip. We stayed in a renovated room, which overlooked the pool deck. The room itself wasn't bad, particularly for the price we paid. It included an in-room jacuzzi. On the downside, the casino is small. The restaurants did not serve particularly good food (even the expensive one at the top of the hotel). You'll find a better buffet at Old Country Buffet. Amenities were lacking; the only real attraction to this hotel besides the price is the tower itself, which you get unlimited access to for free if you're a hotel guest. For true players, this is not the place to stay. For the occasional Vegas visitor, who needs an inexpensive place to stay as a home base to travel to other places on the strip, I guess it'll do in a pinch. If price is a consideration, I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanicholls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. It is a long walk to the strip though. We opted for the premier room. it was a good size with two queen beds. Staying at the hotel you get unlimited entry to the tower. The view from the top of the tower is amazing,, best seen at night, we also went up in the day and it seemed completely different. We were staying there as part of a flydrive package I arranged. The car parking is free which is a bonus. It would have been nice to have a fridge and tea and coffeee making facilities but that seem the norm for any vegas hotel at this budget. The pool area is well stocked with sunbeds. We enjoyed our stay here but there are so many amazing hotels here I would probably try another one if i was to return as they all have something unique to offer

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic overall stay”
Reviews.Author: aakrystu
Reviews.Content: My two sons and myself stayed here on a weekend. Our special occasion was my youngest sons graduation from college so it was obvious we were going to be awake til wee hours of the night. When we checked in we were given an upgrade to the pool floor at no charge but what we were not told was that it is the busiest loudest floor because of the pool so we were up at 9a by a crowd but didnt let that bother us. In the morning we went Starbucks and Evita took good care of us. Went to the buffet and our server was Jose, he took care of us very well. The buffet has a wide selection of food to choose from. Highly reccomend it. Next stop was the tower which is free if you stay here. The view is one of a kind I must say. By the end of the day we were extremely tired and ready for bed. It was about 3a and someone knocked on our door but noone was there. After this happening about 3 times I went to registration and spoke to Audry a very nice young lady and told her I wanted a new room as far away from the pool as possible. She told me the hotel was sold out so a room change was probably not an option. I then spoke to her manager Vanessa who did everything possible to switch us. She made some phone calls and while she received an answer we had a long detailed conversation about fingernails until she gladly told us our new room on the 14th floor was ready. Since we moved to the 14th floor our stay was fantastic. I personally want to thank the Stratosphere staff for making our stay one of a kind especially Evita, Jose, Audry, Vanessa. Hope to see you all next time.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY!”
Reviews.Author: xoxo25
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Stratosphere during our trip in Vegas! Although it was many many blocks away from the main spot to be in Vegas we absolutely LOVED our hotel! After a very tiring night from the clubs/casinos, we decided to stay in our own hotel for the day. There was SO MUCH to do! Their was about 3-4 rides on the top of the tower, many shops on the top floor of the casinos and the best Mexican place to eat! i forgot the name but it was the ONLY real good food their besides the restaurant at the top of the restaurant. I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Alittle far down from the main strip, but still a nice time!”
Reviews.Author: PAngel143
Reviews.Content: This year, I had to go to a wedding in LA and thought we would take this opportunity to go to Las Vegas while we were visiting the West Coast. I decided to book a tour for a few days to Las Vegas, Hoover Dam and The Grand Canyon. We stayed at the Stratosphere in Vegas and had a wonderful time. This hotel is actually a little ways down from the main strip but it was ok because we rented a car and drove around that way. There's a rental car place right in the hotel so it was very convenient. It's at the floor level where all the casinos were. I'm sure we had such a great rate with the tour because the location was alittle further down. I had no complaints. We had a great window view from our room, it was a decent size room, everything was clean and nice. We had dinner at the gourmet buffet downstairs, and it was great! We went up to the 108th floor and saw the Vegas city view from above. On the way up, we were stopped to get our pictures taken, which we did purchase on the way back down since it turned out pretty good. :) Our elevator ride up to the top was escorted by an employee since this was over 100 levels and it went somewhat fast. When we got to the top, it was just a wall of clear glass of windows and 360 degree around. It was night time and the city lights were amazing. There was also a gift shop up there as well. This hotel overall may not be at the same level as to the other more expensive hotels there on the strip like The Wynn or Caesars Palace, but it was still pretty nice especially if you can get a good deal on the price of hotel. Overall, it was a nice time!

Reviews.Title: “An ok room at a good price”
Reviews.Author: HB7117
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 year old son, and I stayed at the Stratosphere for 2 nights. We were in a Select Tower 2 queen room on the 18th floor with a view of the top of a building and parking lot. It was reasonably clean and quiet; however, the sheets and shower curtain smelled "sour," as if they had been left in the washer too long. Also, the TV remote control did not work. We left a note for housekeeping to see if they could help with batteries for the remote, but apparently they didn't read the note. The observation tower was great, and the Big Shot thrill ride was fun but expensive for a 10 second ride. There is not a coffee pot in the room, but Starbucks is right down the elevator by the casino. Parking was difficult in the hotel's garage, because some of the areas were closed, so we had to drive around for about 15 minutes each time we returned to the hotel. We ate breakfast at the hotel's Starbucks, but we ate all other meals elsewhere. Carls Jr. is right across the street. Ka at MGM Grand was well worth the money; it was the best show ever. It was 105 degrees, so I would not recommend walking to the other end of the strip. Parking in the garage at Bill's Gamblin Hall was easier than the larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Raquels31
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was clean and everything one would expect from a hotel room. it's major drawbacks is it's strip location, since the Sahara is gone it's much grittier. The front desk lied about an upgrade cost citing the cost of the room/percentage of was much higher than actually was, why do they need to lie? The buffet was inexpensive and fantastic. Didn't win much in the casino either.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat what you get for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: wandererer26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3nights in the beginning of August. We checked in kind of late at around 1030 and were 2nd in line. The gentleman who checked us in was helpful and polite. After 9+hours of travel time I still smiled and was polite, and Lo and behold we were upgraded to a room on the 20th floor looking over the city with a distant backdrop of the mountains; awesome view at anytime of the day or night. The room was clean and did not smell of smoke or anything unpleasant, had 2flat screen tv's one in the bedroom portion and the 2nd in the sitting area. The bed was very comfortable and wish I could've taken it home. The staff was very pleasant and everyone encountered would always smile and say hello, and ask how our day was going. I've read reviews about the staff being rude and I did not find this to be true at all, then again we are pretty self sufficient and didnt require being waited on too much. Luxury is not the name of this place, more like family friendly or for people who are easy going and relaxed. The buffet was good, breakfast was the meal we ate here although a bit small. I found it odd they had taco bar and MAC and cheese and other lunch items at breakfast at 9am and it seemed as if they were filling space. The 2nd time we ate here was more out of conveinance, if able to drive 15mins to the red rock hotel and casino; there breakfast buffet was 1/2 the price and twice as good with probably 3x the selection. We only played penny slots and not to much at that but I was real happy with the return payout, and the cocktail service is hit or miss depending on the time I guess. We had barely sat down one time and had a waitress over for a drink, she came back within 10mins at that! The second night we sat down real late in the night and sat for about 20-30mins and didn't get approached once. The only complaint I have is about the waitress at the buffet. Our second time eating, which was sat am, we had plates piling up and drinks empty while she talked to the table next to us. Now she wasn't giving advice or directions, but they appeared to be socially chatting. When she did come over to collect plated she didn't bother to ask if we wanted refills on our clearly empty drinks. I hate to complain but she was clearly more interested in chatting than working. When she did ask if we wanted a refill we were already getting up to leave. Last thing is that the location is far but if your booking this hotel you should already know that. We had a car rental and were glad of it. We also left the hotel walking at about 2am, and didn't have any safety concerns. I being a small female would have done this same walk if I was alone, but there are "locals" that you'll encounter. However, we also noticed about a cop on every corner. While people have complained about feeling unsafe you have to remember this is Vegas where how many tourists visit annually, and the last thing the city wants is a tourist having a bad experience. This is the area that has a lot of tattoo shops and other little shops along the way that are not Cartier or Tiffanys like you'll find further down on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Dennis_66085
Reviews.Content: Recently in late May our family traveled to Las Vegas for a wedding that was be held at the Stratosphere Wedding Chapel. We stayed at the Stratosphere and the rooms were very nice. The wedding was a wonderful event and the Stratosphere did a wonderful job. I recommended staying a the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere was A-OK”
Reviews.Author: okgladmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a tower select room while attending our friend's wedding (also held at the Stratosphere which I'd give 5 stars). Our room was a remodeled one and I can't think of any negatives. The king bed was comfy, as were the sheets. The room temperature was nice and cool. We didn't use room service so I can't rate it. We stayed on the 15th floor and our view was not "strip view" but was a nice view of the mountains and the city. Check-in and check-out was simple. We had dinner at Fellini's after the wedding and it wasn't the most amazing meal ever, but was good enough and not terribly expensive. As previously mentioned, it is stinkin far to the strip. You can walk to the monorail station behind the closed Sahara and ride it to the strip. HOWEVER, keep in mind, this is certainly not the best part of town to be strolling around but it is considerably faster and cheaper than taking a taxi. If you are on a budget, the Strat is a good option for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Dubliner
Reviews.Content: We had booked a suite as we were travelling with kids, but found that the sleeper-sofa was actually a sofa. Room was changed without any fuss and we found check in staff to be very friendly. Breakfast buffet had a decent selection and as we were down to the buffet early, everything was very fresh. The drink/plate service was hit and miss depending on the individual worker. The interior of the hotel and the rooms are a bit dated but when you consider the low cost of the rooms, the overall experience is worth the money. I would probably not stay again unless I was on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, but too far away from everything!”
Reviews.Author: Evlstpmom
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying, that we checked in at 1:00 in the morning and there was a long line and only 2 agents. That was not so fun. By the time we reached the check-in desk we were exhausted. Melanie waited on us and she was super nice and friendly. She upgraded us to a Spa-King room without us even asking, what a nice surprise!! The room was nice but the bed was super hard and pillows were way too soft. The hotel charges $11.99 for 24 hour internet access, which is not cool. The buffet was not good at all! Don't waste your money, I've had better hospital cafeteria food. The hotel is way too far from the strip and we spent $150.00 just on taxis, bus fare and the monorail to get to and from the strip. That put a damper on things, to say the least. They should offer some kind of free shuttle service since it is the only hotel so far from the strip. The Bell Desk was friendly enough and they held our bags for us till we had to leave. The brochure in the room stated that there was laundry on the 6th floor, there wasn't. All in all, nice hotel, but we probably won't stay here again just based on the distance from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: bklynguy2686
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay in on the Vegas strip... My girlfriend and I stayed here in february of 2010. The receptionists were very nice and friendly. Our first night there, we were placed in a room with two twin beds. However, the receptionist made sure we had a room with a king size bed the following night. The room was also very clean. Hotel staff provided clean towels everyday as well. The only small complaint is that the room had a horrible view of the parking lot. Also, this hotel is at the end of the vegas strip, so if you want to site see and view the other hotels, you have to take a bus. The good news about that aspect is that the buses are cheap and run frequently 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: ozheares
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome, staff were great. Its a big place and its very busy but we didn't have to wait long most of the time, except maybe at the show booking counter. We loved the buffet the food was delicious. The room was beautiful. Newly rennovated. Beds were extremely comfortable. We only swam once as it was such a long way to go. The cleaning staff were fantastic and our room was well stocked and cleaned - they seemed to go that little bit extra. With a family of four (two teenage kids) it was a good place to stay. We found it was a little out of the way of the main drag but we just got the bus and it was fine. We walked around the area and didn't have any trouble. Totally recommended as a value for money place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it, loved it, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: tracy6964
Reviews.Content: awesome hotel, great staff, good food, fantastic view We had an awesome time can not wait to go back we only had three days this trip hoping for a week in the spring of 2012 only bummer was no FREE INTERNET had to pay for 24 hrs of service (think it was around $10)

Reviews.Title: “was an average stay”
Reviews.Author: straw71
Reviews.Content: hotel was ok, our room was clean, but we were right behind the elevator so of course we heard that alllll night long. the best part about the stratosphere, is the restaurant on top of the world, it is amazing and well worth the $$$$

Reviews.Title: “Great time in the money desert”
Reviews.Author: gordonmaximus
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed June 2010 but drop down does not allow this - This hotel is typical of the LV style, although not as expensive as those on the strip it is clean friendly bustling -the rooms are very good, clean and well presented, nothing is too much trouble for the staff-my son and daughter in law had a magnificent birthday present waiting for me and the staff were so canny as to let me check in then leave the room and sneak in and leave it for my return. A good place to stay and it is away from the strip just enough yet close enough to visit, it is equally close to Fremont Street where the gambling all began

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, iconic building, spectacular value”
Reviews.Author: DG55
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows the Stratosphere tower, one of the iconic wonders of Las Vegas. But that's not the reason I picked it. The Stratosphere hotel is cheap, very cheap. I can only assume there is fierce competition between the cheaper hotels in Las Vegas, cheap rates in high volumes. For the price, I really cannot complain. The location is not prime, but it is on the strip. A short taxi to the main area of the strip, but we found the long walks hopping between casino's to be fun. The rooms are not plush, but they are decent quality. We chose the 'premier rooms' which have been updated more recently and are on slightly higher floors - the price difference is negligible, so definitely upgrade at least one step. One bonus of staying here is the free access to the tower. It is however, just a tower, so not overly exciting although it is nice extra to be able to go up there without having to pay. Downstairs there is of course the casino, and a small shopping mall with restaurants, eateries, and stores. On one of the higher floors there is an outdoor swimming pool and sunbathing area. Overall, do not come here if you want glamour. But I do certainly recommend it for a short stay in Las Vegas for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled Rooms are 5 star”
Reviews.Author: curt1480
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here and it often works well since we have to get a room for the kids as well, now that they are getting older. When you have to pay for multiple rooms you start looking at the budget more and more, especially the way that we travel. Often gone for weeks at a time and traveling halfway across the country. We enjoy the Stratosphere for this reason. This time when we checked in we got the connecting rooms, but we were on the same floor as the pool. That became a problem because of the noise. We asked to move, but nothing was available. We then had to deal with the noise of construction going on and asked to move again. The manager moved us to the "Remodeled Rooms" and let me tell you they are worth every penny. Stratosphere if you remodel every room like this you can compete with any 5 star Hotel on the strip. However, as difficult as it maybe you will need to improve the customer service as not everyone on the staff is friendly and they let you know that right off the bat. Again the management is great and helpful and responsive to the needs of the guest. We went to see a free show as well with the stars and the kids loved it. A real surprise, I also love the buffet. They have lots of amusement for everyone, and the pool is huge and the kids spent a whole day just playing at the pool so get sun screen or listen to the screams the next day from sunburn. Don't forget they have a small theme park on the roof, if you have the nerve for it. This place is a new found gem, I just hope it continues, because at their hotel rate during the week I could afford to fly out here once a month.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, Awful location!”
Reviews.Author: Sabes1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for my sister-in-laws wedding. The hotel average: ok rooms, decent staff, pretty clean. I thought the casino was kinda small. Buffett was ok. There is a 50's restaurant on site. Great food, kinda expensive. There is a mall upstairs with a few fast food restaurants and shops. The mexican place is pretty good. Pool was awesome! The view from the top is breath taking. We didn't ride the rides. They were very expensive. My biggest complaint about the hotel is the location! You pretty much have to take a cab or a bus any where you go! (over $20 cab ride each way to the end of the strip, plus tip!)We stayed at the Riviera last time...we could walk any where we wanted. The stratosphere is so far away from the main strip. If you want to visit all of the other casinos or party at night, don't stay here! Food choices are limited as well as shopping and site seeing. Stay somewhere further up the strip. If you want to be away from the hustle of the strip, but don't want to be downtown, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay&Great Hotel !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Camaro29
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! I have hardly anything bad to say on my 4 nites ( July 25 to 29 th) stay here,our room on the 23 th floor was great,so what that we didnt have a strip view , I got my full free strip view from going up to the Tower everyday & nite for it was in included in our package, The Tower is a must to see both in day & nite time WOW!!! what a view & the rides are unreal but didnt have the guts to go on any.No you dont need a car if you stay at this hotel because the Deuce Bus is right outside &takes you right to strip, also many other buses run by as in the 108 which we took back & forth to airport for just 2 bucks, but we got a 3 day bus pass for 20 bucks so we when everywhere not just the strip, the buses ae so easy .We didnt play much on slots but the times we did the free drinks came along as your playing.Also many ppls reviews say bad neighbor hmmmm thats funny for so what if you see a few bums walking around they were harmless but in my 4 days I think I might have saw 1 & also always so many ppl around what could a harmless bum do .Just stay on front of hotel which is the strip & your fine, why would any one go to back of hotel for if it was bad, ppl who stay at the hotel sure are not going wondering to back of hotel, for we had no need to..Pool was good & great bar service from waitress who came around always,pool needs more shade & umbrellas for it was burning hot all 4 days & we had to hide in corner so not to burn to a crisp, also was not happy that pool closed at 8 pm that needs to change ASAP in so hot 42C summer months till at least 10 or 11 pm,It had food places up stairs but we only used Mcdonalds for a quick morning coffee & juice.I know that if I come to Vegas again I will be staying here again for knowing the Deuce Bus is right in front of hotel & lots buses on next str where you can go anywhere, why would I go to the noisy strip with such crowds & pay so much, I got the best deal from Expedia which included everything(flight,hotel,Tower view,discount of 25% with ace players card & resort fee,fridge ) all for 225.00 dollars,now how cheap is that for all we got.So see you again in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: kbhPella_IA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many places in Vegas, I would say this is the one I liked the least. The hotel was okay... but you have to spend a ton on a cab or take a bus to go anywhere! Now that the Sahara is closed there are no close walks to the monorail. Like I said, our room and stuff was fine but I would not stay here again due to location.

Reviews.Title: “if u can book it cheap + get a remodeled room it's a good deal =]”
Reviews.Author: im_in_miami_2010
Reviews.Content: stayed here on 2 separate occasions in July 2011. once for 2 nts and again for 5 nts. first time got newly remodeled room in select tower for a rate of less than $40 !!! room was nice and clean. modern. had mountain view which was fine. im not in the room that much so not partial to strip view always. only complaint is I was on non-smoking floor and it reeked of people smoking weed. yuk. second stay they told us they had a "nice room" for us. well it was an older not remodeled room and it was smoking. it smelled of 30 yr old permeated smoke and everyone on the floor must have been smoking weed because it was coming thru the vents. it was disgusting. I'm not a smoker and couldn't breathe the first nite. I went to front desk and got a non-smoking room the next morning. they switched it and we got a strip view but still an older room. it was ok. again we got very good rate of less than $45. cons: bad neighborhood. do not even think of walking around hotel except out front entrance. also they hold $50 per nite for incidentals and it takes dome time for it to go back on. rudest people I have ever experienced at any starbucks working at the starbucks inside hotel. ridiculous. if u can get it cheap stay here but don't even consider paying more than $75 - not a great pool and poor strip location. you need a car if u plan on staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Will be better prepared next time”
Reviews.Author: sheilafinlay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Stratosphere Hotel in Las Vegas. Make sure you ask for the updated Tower rooms, they are pleasant enough. We unfortunately had to stay in three different rooms, none of which the pullout sofa worked, so don't depend on it as an extra bed. As the hotel is far from the "Strip", I recommend getting a bus pass. The bus stops right outside of the hotel and if you take the express bus - runs every 15 minutes - you can be on the strip within minutes or Freemont Street - as opposed to trying to find parking or taking a taxi (very costly). Students get cheap rates for the bus. The pool is decent enough, nothing extraordinary. If you are booking this hotel, make sure to go online as they have sales of 20% or 15% off quite regularly but they only do it for a 12-hour period, so book it if you see the 20% off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel..poor location.”
Reviews.Author: ANB019
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere last year and the hotel had very comfortable beds, clean and the staff were friendly. The pool was located on the roof and was a bit small but had an outside bar which was a plus. Downside to this place is that it was located at the far end of the strip! Me and my friends had to take a bus to get to the hot spots close to the Bellagio or to the shops located near Planet Hollywood. If you are on a budget stay here. If you are looking for a luxury hotel near the center of the strip stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Happygolucky72
Reviews.Content: 2nd time to Vegas. stayed at the Paris last time, but wanted to try something different. My wife and I were aware of the location but didn't mind walking or taking the "DEUCE" to get around. Our check in was fast and courteous. We booked a strip view room through Expedia (which I highly recommend). The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was an UPDATED room. The room was a bit small, but it served its purpose. Besides, you don"t go to Vegas to spend a lot of time in your room! The staff over all is very friendly and helpful. One morning we left a tip for the cleaning staff and it was still sitting on the nightstand when we returned. PROS: TOWER view is awesome and guests have unlimited access. POOL is big with lots of room to sit and tan. (wanted to try the "adult pool" but it was closed. TOWER PIZZERIA on the 2nd floor has awesome CALZONE and STROMBOLI!! Good prices too. ROXIES DINER has good food. Breakfast is kinda expensive though. 2 for 1 tickets to "BITE". VERY GOOD SHOW!! those woman work their butts off. a lot of good dancing and acrobatics. Go to the Circle K a block away if you want a good price on beer. CONS: North end of strip, so do your research before you book. Not bad for those who like to exercise their legs. 107th lounge has 2 for 1 martinis, but it's deceiving. I ordered one for me hoping to get the other free for my wife. Instead, they brought us 4 drinks . Taking the DEUCE at night can be frustrating. It gets packed and it makes a lot of stops along the strip so give yourself enough time if you are going toward the S. end Overall, a good stay for the price. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Been here twice”
Reviews.Author: CC1906
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stratosphere twice. It is not an average 3star hotel. If compared to European hotels its a 4star. It is at one end of the strip and far from it all, but with the lovely weather in vegas i didnt mind walking or getting the bus a little further into the main strip. There are a few down and outs around, but I personally didnt find it affected me. I even headed out at 1:30am on my own one night and walked the strip as I couldnt sleep. The rooms are a good size, it is extremely clean. They all have a fridge and a tv. The casino is smaller than some hotels, but I loved it. Plenty of places to eat or get snacks and drinks. It has a MacDonalds and shops. Going up the Stratosphere tower is something you have to do. Go on the hair raising rides. They have two shows there also. It has two pools, a family one and an adults only (european) pool. Free for ladies and I think $10/20 for men. The pool staff are very helpful I have stayed at the Luxor and room for room they are the same. I would stay at the Stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for what you pay...”
Reviews.Author: kagaboo
Reviews.Content: We were able to reserve Stratosphere for 3 nights with our credit card points. Before we booked the hotel we read the reviews and knew this wasn't the top 4 star hotel and was expecting 3 star hotel. When we got to the hotel, the parking, entrance etc was great. It was far from the strip but we had a car so not so bad. We were able to check in pretty quickly. They offered for more $$ we could upgrade to their renovated rooms and we declined since the changes did not seem that much better. The elevators took some time to get up but I think this was a busy time when we went up to our room. When we got up to our room, we found it was a big room but realized it had a door to the next room. (disappointing). We decided to take a little nap before going out for the night but was unable to... realized I could hear the neighbor's whole conversation through the door that was connecting our rooms. Immediately went down and they gave us a new room without adjoining door. The second room we got was smaller but quieter. We did not hear the next door neighbors but realized the walls were still thin. Heard everytime someone closed their door and vibrated our room... Other than this the room was comfortable. You get what you pay for... As for the view from the top of the stratosphere, that was a great view. The line in the day was short but the line to go up at night was really really long. Its great they give the hotel guests unlimited pass to go up for the view and activities, but the line for the night is too long so if you plan on going, go earlier. This is a good hotel for what you pay for... but I think I have stayed at Courtyard Inn or other similar hotels that was better. I would probably try a different hotel when I go to Vegas next time...

Reviews.Title: “super suite time”
Reviews.Author: mofosho76
Reviews.Content: my friend and i went to check in to our super cheap room and was offered a honeymoon suite for $60 more. it was my birthday so we decided why not since i am so cheap i will never get to stay in a great room like that! my guy friend ended up sleeping on the couch paying $30 more instead of the cheap room with two beds(haha)! the king bed was big enough for both of us but since he is a silly man from the midwest he chose to do so! the hotel is great, have stayed there before and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Service - Will not recommend”
Reviews.Author: staarz10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my husbands birthday & our 'once in a lifetime' trip / stay in Las Vegas. Our stay at Stratosphere was memorable but for all the wrong reasons- We had specifically requested 'strip' views at booking time & paid for a 2 queen bed room - we were alloted the pokiest, dark, 1 queen bed room ! You couldn't swing a cat around in the ensuite ! On requesting a change of rooms we were 1st told they were sold out for 4th July & then 1 receptionist demanded an extra $ 25 per night while another said extra $ 35 p.n ! The customer service was rude & unhelpful. Same rude, unsmiling service at the Roxys Diner Restaurant in the Hotel too ! Will not recommend this Hotel if you want a good time, it is a bit further out from all the action of the strip too.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Crime Scene Investigation!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter6666
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere in September 2008 and had a good memory of it. It's extremely cheap for a hotel right on the Strip. It has a big pool area and offers its hotel guests free access to the tower. My stay in June 2011, however, was a total disaster. At check-in, the girl asked us (three guys) whether we wanted an extra bed. Considering that it was free, we agreed to it. The room was towards the very back of the hotel, it was old and full of grunge. The window we had was tiny and the bathroom was claustrophobic. We decided to go out for the day and got back to the hotel at 2 am. Guess what: the extra bed still hadn't arrived! So, we called the front desk if they could send an extra bed. We had to wait an extra 20 minutes for that bed to arrive. But the best is still to come: the next morning, at 10 am, we receive a phone-call. My friend answered and after a few times of saying "yes" and "aha", he hangs up and tells us that a woman was calling from security. She told him that we were to go to the front-desk immediately because of safety issues. So, we got dressed and hurried to the elevator. At the bottom, police units and hotel security were keeping people from going up but nobody wanted to tell us what was going on. We went to the front desk and asked them why they woke us up. They didn't have a clue what we were talking about and suggested we ask at security. We went to security and there they only told us that they would offer us a free breakfast. So, during breakfast, the head of security showed up and explained us that there had been a shooting in the room under us. That's why they had to evacuate our floor. After breakfast we wanted to go back to our room, but there was a security guy in front of the elevator, telling us that our floor was still under investigation and that he didn't know when it would be ok to go back. So, we looked around and saw dozens of police cars outside. After an hour we asked again and the security officer said it was safe to go up again. While you may only pay 30 to 50 USD for the night, it soon becomes clear why this hotel is so cheap. It is located at the outer end of the Strip and after dark, there are some shady characters hanging out in front of it. Obviously some hotel guests are also criminals and they even manage to turn the hotel into CSI Las Vegas. The center area of the strip is not in walking distance, which means that you have to take a taxi or the bus. I will never spend a night at the Stratosphere again. My top tip: if you're looking for a hotel in Vegas: go for another one!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: GregStone
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel..not Vegas´best and a lil off the strip but you can find a good deal at this place too..you can still have the Vegas experience without paying as much as most do. I think I prefer Caesars as this was not as close to some of the spots that I like to gamble at, but all and all the service was great and my friends and I had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing and magical honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Laura1984
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in sept 2009 but the dates on here didn't go back that far. We have had lots of holidays with relaxing beaches and beautiful resorts and going to vegas especially for our honeymoon was never something I wanted to do, but I guess marriages are about compramise and my husband really wanted to go, so a year after we got married we booked a 2 week stay in Vegas. People kept saying that we would be bored staying in Vegas for two weeks and how wrong were they.....Vegas is massive and an out of this world experience and if anything 2 weeks wasn't long enough. I have never been anywhere more exciting, fun, magical, massive, cheap, friendly, and every other word to describe the most incredible place on this planet. The stratosphere hotel is brilliant, very clean and staff are available 24 hrs a day, the rooms are huge as is the enormous bed, the swimming pool is stunning and the bars are electric, it has a shopping mall inside and several resturaunts, and quiet honestly enough there without going onto the strip, but you wouldn't go to vegas without going onto the strip. The Stratophere has all the rides, shows, big casino, but every hotel has something huge, most hotels has a shopping mall with all the amazing brands. People say what happens in vegas stays in vegas.....but that is not exactly true, my beautiful baby girl came back with us..lol. If you have any questions about this amazing place, please ask, this review would be far to big if I wrote about everything. Well worth it and we will return, 100%

Reviews.Title: “Has its pros and cons, but don't care for recent changes!”
Reviews.Author: Troutinator
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere Hotel/Casino is a great place to stay, if you want to take advantage of staying at a hotel with the tallest roller coasters in the world. We've been coming to the Stratosphere for the past several years and my wife and I have enjoyed the "Adult Pool" on the 25th floor. With no children crowding the pool and the ability to work on your tan without tan-lines, we found the adult pool relaxing. However, on our recent trip two weeks ago, we discovered the adult pool is no longer open. However, the family pool is still a great pool with plenty of room for everyone. Also, we had planned on taking my daughter and mother-in-law to the "American Superstars" show at the Stratosphere and found out that show is longer playing, after we arrived. For new travelers, the view from the top of the tower is definitely worth the price of admission and the revolving restaurant at the top is designed for that special occasion (my wife and I have enjoyed dinner up there on three times). A little pricey, so keep it for that special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap stay, excellent hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: dwilt1010
Reviews.Content: Scouted out lots of hotel deals before choosing the Stratosphere. Yes the Excalibur, Circus Circus and Luxor were cheaper but the reviews I read about them were not pleasant. Stratosphere was a little more expensive but was an excellent choice, and it included our ride to the top. Not the rides but hey, I wasn't going to ride any of them. The room was great, and it was even better to find a restaurant open at 3:00 a.m. when our bodies told us it was still 7 a.m. in Boston. Check out this hotel, it's worth the quietness too.

Reviews.Title: “Usual good service...”
Reviews.Author: roofingman
Reviews.Content: Good front desk...nice room.....expensive drinks...still great jazz upstairs and an awesome buffet....the place to be is 8th floor pool bar for a good laugh-sun-and great bartenders who love thier job...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: awdang_99
Reviews.Content: My family and I were here for the AAU basketball tournament this past weekend. My biggest issue with this hotel was that they couldn't find a room for me, my wife and four kids after we arrived at 4am (after 10hr drive). We had to wait until after 3pm before we were able to get into a room. Sleeping in a car for 5 hours is not fun! But, aside from that, we had a very nice stay at this hotel. We stayed in the tower where the pool was located. This is the older tower so the rooms aren't as upgraded as those in the Select tower. Staying on the same level as the pool made up for the wait for a room! Our room was very spacious. BUT, our bathroom was not the best. The shower/tub and toilet were located behind a closed door (tight space) while the sink was outside. My wife didn't care for that setup very much. Things to do in the hotel Although my older son thought the hotel didn't have enough action, it was good to me. The hotel is at the far north end of the strip. It's a good walk to the main part of the strip. We had a car so was able to drive to where we wanted to go. I heard taxi rides were like $20 which seems very high to me. Roxy's restaurant was delicious at a good value for a large family. The buffet was a little overpriced so we didn't eat there. The tower gives one a good view of the city. We went up in the evening...free admission for hotel guests. I am not daring enough to ride the rides they have atop the tower. I don't gamble and I really hate that these casinos force families through the gambling areas. All the casinos we visited had smoke everywhere. The Bellagio seemed to have the cleanest, breathable air as we walked through the casino area to get to the shops and garden. Everywhere else is a second-hand smoke fest. Anyway, the Statosphere is pretty busy but not as busy as those hotels closer to the strip. I personally like the quieter places. Also, this hotel didn't require a marathon walk to any one part of the hotel. We walked through the MGM, Ceasars, and Bellagio and felt like we'd walked a marathon. The pool was nice as well. The pool is located on the 8th floor. It's not as big as the pool at other casinos (i.e., Excalibur, MGM Grand), but it worked for us. We don't sunbath...there weren't very many shady areas on the 8th floor. So, we just had to stay in the water until we were ready to go back to our room. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The value was unbeatable. I will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, poor service, awful view”
Reviews.Author: 154914Traveller
Reviews.Content: Great overall value, we upgraded to the select room which was nice, but we were only on the 12 floor and had a view of the parkade and got to hear many car alarms echoing through the concrete structure repeatedly. Our room safe was locked and unuseable upon arrival, we asked that it be opened for us so we could lock our passports in it but no one ever did come to open it for us. These problems caused us to ask to be moved to a different room, this seemed to be a burden for the front desk staff but they did offer us a room across the hall. The view from this room was no better, this time we had a great view of the air conditioners and satellite dishes on the roof below our window! Lol This hotel is nice, kept very clean, and is a great value, but don't expect decent service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “No soul”
Reviews.Author: Tosca1962
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas before but hadn't stayed at the Stratosphere. Hotel came as part of the holiday package, so not my choice. Not the best location on the strip - unless you fancy a long walk, suggest you take the duece or a taxi ride to where the action is. Very bland interior and seemed rather dis-jointed on the ground floor. Staff seemed laid back to the point of not interested. The room itself had a good view of the tower but otherwise seemed to have an Austin Powers vibe going on. Would have liked an additional lock / safety chain on the door - unusual for an American hotel. On the plus side, there was a safe in the room. Tried to spend as little time as possible at the hotel. I'll go back to Vegas for sure, but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: Acc_Trav_Ind
Reviews.Content: We have been on business as well as for fun and we have made a very good decision to stay at the Stratosphere. All rooms that we got were Upgrades with the view on the Strip and free entry to the tower observatory. It is walking distance to the main attractions only if you have good shoes as it took us about 35 minutes to get to the real downtown. Casino is very nice, diner served very good food 24/7 and there is also a Starbucks right at the lobby level with good coffee to start your day. This is Vegas, so no free WiFi like in Europe, but still very good deal at roughly 40 EUR a day.... Definetly worth to visit and try!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Viktsjob01
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere Hotel and Casino is an amazing place to stay when visiting Las Vegas. The rooms are incredible and the view over the Strip is even more so. The rooms are very spacious, modern and clean. The beds are unbelievably comfortable and the breakfast buffet might be a bit expensive compared to other places, but still very price worthy. The staff was very helpful and they help on several occasions and for different reasons. The hotel also has everything… and I mean EVERYTHING. Their own casino, shows, a mall, a car rental service, their very famous tower, rides on top of the tower and so much more. The only downside was that it’s kind of far down on the strip. When looking down it looks as if everything is very close… but don’t be mistaken. The first day we walked everywhere, but eventually it just makes you tired. So, luckily enough the bus stop is right outside. It’s kind of expensive, but still worth it. Believe me when I say that it’s better to let other things get you tired besides walking everywhere. Next time coming to LV I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service, awesome value.”
Reviews.Author: hirunningman
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at the experience I had at this hotel. I have stayed at about a half dozen other hotels in Las Vegas over the past decade (inc. Luxor, Monte Carlo, Bally's and the Alexis Park) and The Stratosphere is by far the best. I booked an "Oasis Suite" for two nights while on my own (due to a mixed bag of travel plans between myself and my wife). The value for the room was excellent; I paid about what I would have paid for a standard room at many other mid-range hotels. The suite was huge, with a jacuzzi tub and aseperate shower in a bathroom that was close to the size of standard room on its own. A very comfortable experience for the price. The suite was clean, the bed comfortable, and it was well-appointed with two TVs, coffee maker, safe and refrigerator. The tower is hoot to visit and the view of Las Vegas from the top is stunning. I spent almost an hour at sunset mesmerized by the view. The best part is that you have free admission to the tower with your room. I dined both evenings at the Level 107 lounge in the tower, where 2 for 1 martinis and half priced appetizers were served (both the martinis and the appetizers were excellent as well). The Stratosphere staff was head and shoulders above the rest in Las Vegas. Most Las Vegas hotel staff I have dealt with provide indifferent service at best. I received OUTSTANDING, friendly, affable service, especially at the front desk (from "Haunani") and at the acePLAY desk (their slots card ID station, "Les" and "Annie" were both delightful people). I commend thier HR staff, too, because of the consistency of the service level through out the hotel; businesses do not enjoy this kind of consistency unless there is leadership driving it. I have no doubt that I will be staying here on my next visit to Las Vegas. None at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price”
Reviews.Author: loutequila
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was on a budget and they had very low prices, although is off the strip I didn't mind because I was driving. I was expecting not such a good experience cause the reviews were not very convincing. To my surprise the place was very good! From the moment we arrived we were pleased, easy to park, the check in was quick, the room was large, clean and comfortable. For the price it was a bargain! The drive to the strip was not bad at all, in only 10 to 15 minutes I was were I wanted to be. I will absolutely go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good combination for fun”
Reviews.Author: parkargentina
Reviews.Content: Well, when u reach Las Vegas Strip, its impossible to miss the hotel, since they have the most high tower in city, my room (i stayed in selected rooms floor 22) was good, with a great bathroom and excelent room service. The casino is ok, nice pool at floor 8, and the tower is just breathtaking. This hotel is located in the north edge of Las Vegas Strip, so its little far from the crowded south side.

Reviews.Title: “valentines 5 day sweet time.”
Reviews.Author: bdanej
Reviews.Content: my husband & myself really enjoyed ourselves on this vacation to break up Minnesota winter snow,blues!the hotel was so much fun.lots to do,nice choice of restaurants shops&gaming.the tower is so cool.rides&bar are really a trip if you like heights! it felt like we got to enjoy both new & old Vegas,as the hotel is in between the strip &downtown.if you stay at the stratosphere,at least get an outside strip view,its worth the extra few dollars!the near by neighborhood was a little scary,use good sense when venturing out! we had a rental car . i am glad i did not take any public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: wian555
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and paid $42US a night for 2 double beds. The rooms are new and very clean. Checking in was fast, although I have seen long lines if you check in on Friday afternoon. Internet was 12$ a day or 1$ a minute, which is a rip off in my opinion. There was no coffee machine in the rooms. That was very disappointing. Overall, a good experience with nothing wrong, and for the price paid, I can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but won't be back :(”
Reviews.Author: mcr195
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 different times from 2007 on. Sadly, each trip seems to get a little worse. I don't think I will return to this hotel any more, but I did enjoy it when it was cleaner and more customer friendly. PROS: 2+ shows running at all time, scary amusements at the top of the tower, yummy and fancier food at Top of the World restaurant, great views from the Tower, cheapest cab ride to Freemont from the strip, great for staying up late in the night gambling CONS: Resort fees are the pits! Also, it's a wasteland any more at the end of the strip. I hope they start rebuilding... but the economy needs to get better. THE CLOSEST CASINOS TO HERE ARE RIVERIA AND CIRCUS CIRCUS. If you haven't been to Stratosphere, consider the amount of walking you'll need to do to get anywhere. It's not as close as it looks on the map. Now that the Sahara is closed, monorail stations may be even further away once that station closes.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised, as I am hard to please! (Traveler from WI)”
Reviews.Author: JamieRNWI
Reviews.Content: ROOMS/CHECK-IN We were going out for a girls weekend, and had initally planned to stay anywhere on the strip. I did some research and learned A LOT about bed bugs, and EVERY hotel in Las Vegas has reports of having them. They are very destructive and hard to get rid of...needless to say I wanted to change our plans and stay with a friend in LV. However, my other friend had booked the hotel as a mystery deal and couldnt back out of it without forfeiting the entire sum of the room. SO, I went in VERY critical, expeciting to find a not so hott place. As we checked in, I was very blunt and told the check-in lady that I woud prefer a room without any reports of bed bugs, as I told her I know this hotel has had reports. She looked at us and took us very seriously, as I presumed to get out my list of rooms that have had reports.......She offered to upgrade us, but we declined. We took the initally offered room on the Central Floor, (10th) floor. The room was nice, simple, everything one needs. I completely took my bed apart all the way down the the frame.....and found a few dust bunnies, which is to be expected as im sure with 2000+ rooms they cant do a gut of the roms every day. Matressess appeared new, carpet was wore, but its Vegas who gives a crap...wear slippers...new flat screen TV. Our view was nice, over the foothills. All in all, I have no bites, and the room was clean! CASINO- Ive been to vegas once before to celebrate my 21st, and have done the partying, clubbing, walk-the-strip, etc, so this was a weekend to relax. I am a seasoned gambler. There are many machines to choose from. Lay out is easy and open. not cramped. Theres a great mix of machines with bets ranging from 10 cents to 20$+. There are old reels, and new video machines. I hit one prgressive during our two days on the Cleopatra for 330$, which helped. They werent tight, but not great, but they kept us playing, and my goodness, every time we turned there were great ladies offering us cocktails and drinks. Every day we earned our free buffett, so between food and drinks, we didnt come out so bad! All in all ok! Location: It is the last main hotel on the strip, with Riviera and Circus Circus being the closest. However, every one makes it seem that they are far far away...not really, i think the total walk is like a lil more than 4 miles to Mandalay Bay.....If your not afraid of walking, and if you get half way lucky and have great weather, I think the highest high was maybe 99, 100 with a great breeze, so it was comortable to walk! FOOD- They have like a little mall upstairs on the way to the tower with the rides, i think fat tuesdays, mickey D's, a hot dog place, Annies, and maybe a few more up there I cant remember. Downstairs they have Roxys, which is a 50s diner, which we never ate at beause we ate for free at the buffet. I believe "Plate," was the buffet at the Strat. VERY VERY resonable and AWESOME food! Fresh, appealing, and filling and best of all if you had to buy it wasnt that expensive, the champagne brunch on the weekend i believe was 24.99, everything else was less. I thought it was amazing, GREAT CRAB LEGS as my friends would tell you! Overall I was very hard on this hotel, and they made the grade. They met AND exceeded my expectations. Way to go Stratosphere, I will be back with my husband, and cant WAIT!!!! Downer was the pool~ I LOVE LOVE swimming, and was looking forward to the pool. Its not horrible, just would have expected a little more. Very teeny bopper, service was good though, and the view from the strat pool, AMAZING, youll never beat it at another hotel....the foothills all around, and if your tall enough, you can look over the ledge at the city, so the view made up for it. We didnt order drinks or anything up there, but it appeared the pool waitressess were very good, and the service appeared great, just wish there maybe would have been a second pool, a little more quietter, but really we only spent a couple of hours there total for only staying 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “The Tired Tower”
Reviews.Author: keithgoff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratospere because I wanted to go on the rides at the top of the Tower, just wish I had stayed somewhere else and then just paid for the rides separately. Nice room but cleaning left a lot to be desired even though we were in the 'newly refurbished Select Room' hate to image what the non-select rooms were like. Pool area very disappointing. The whole complex could do with closing down and a total refurb done. The best bit for me was dinner in Roxy's diner, had a really great prime rib dinner followed by White chocolate and raspberry cheesecake., amazing & cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: anaya92020
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stop over for one night on the way to Colorado from San Diego. This hotel was awesome and far exceeded my expectations. The room was comfortable the view was awesome, the pool was great not to warm, not to cold. The room includes free access to the tower where you can hang out and see the view of the strip.The only negative no free Wifi. All and all it was great and my kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ploeggie
Reviews.Content: Loved it ! Got a Grand Luxury room for 3 nights. Very spacious, deluxe only missed the contacteren tvs, now still the old big ones. Distance to the popular strip Hotel is too far, allways took the car to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Not So "Suite"”
Reviews.Author: SPARKLELasVegas
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our anniversary we upgraded to an Oasis Suite. We asked if any strip views were available as we had requested that when making reservations 4 months ago and offered to pay more for this benefit. Of course, no strip views were left on a non-holiday Monday night! The first room we were assigned was 8026-nice enough lay out but our view was the immediate roof with air conditioners and all the lights pointed towards the building. You would have thought after we had requested a strip view that at least we would have a room with a view of something else! My husband was very upset and we immediately went back to the check in and requested another room. We were told if we paid an additional $200 that they could give us the penthouse suite. We declined and received the key to room 1626 which was in the same place as the previous room but 8 floors up. At least we could see mountains so we settled in. The Oasis suite has a very nice layout with a large spa like bathroom, nice sitting area, a refrigerator and a coffee maker which is rare on the strip. Just before we went to bed, we noticed an unusual smell coming from the toilet. At first we each thought the other had a "problem" but once we talked about it and it didn't go away we realized it was coming from the plumbing itself. Have you ever smelled a sewer backed up? That was the smell. We closed off the bathroom as best we could and then went to bed since it was late. That's when we discovered the noise from the helicopters that constantly cruise the strip. Our neighbors came home around 1 AM and decided to fill their spa tub for about 20 minutes and then run the jets for another 30. It sounded like it was in our room. Surprisingly this was a non-smoking room with an obvious cigarette burn on the floor in the sitting area. We checked out at 6AM and plan to never return. Bad area of town-don't go walking anywhere. The tower is definitely something to see but we recommend coming for that and staying elsewhere. Even downtown would be an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BuzzDR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were moved here when the hotel we had reserved was overbooked. The room we were in had a distinct 'old hotel' feeling to it. The location is not great - the hotel is far from the main attractions. Our timing didn't allow us to go up to the observation deck, which probably would have improved our experience. If we were going back to Vegas, we'd pay slightly more to be closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Riverise61
Reviews.Content: Checked in at around 3.30 am due to a lengthy flight delay/diversion and were offered a free upgrade to a spa Suite because we were "so friendly" - try it everywhere people, it almost ALWAYS helps to be nice. The room was fabulous, check-in staff were a welcome relief to a long day and the hotel had everything you'd need - for a great price. Location was irrelevant if you have a car or some travel nouse. Free tower passes were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: kidsfriendly15
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the reviews I got very uneasy about staying at the Stratosphere with my 11yr old daughter. I even reserved another hotel for 2 nights. However since the minute I pulled the car to the valet, all the employees were kind, considerative and very helpful. The hotel was extremely busy, since we arrived on July 4th. At the check in all my requests were honored, and we were given a beautiful room with an amazing view. The hotel offers a variety of fast food restaurants, including mcdonalds, starbucks, pizza, etc. The only downside is the smell of smoke as you walk into the casino, both my daughter and I are allergic.Some of the restaurants are on the same floor of the casino and open to the smell. Obviously we did not eat there. However that happensall other hotels. Our room was clean, and as I said had an amazing view of the strip. The hotel is at the very end of the strip, what was not a problem for us, since I had a car and valet parking is free in any hotel in las Vegas. The fact that we were able to go to the observatory as part as the room rate was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “been here a few times, and would come back!”
Reviews.Author: kelbelle4
Reviews.Content: aside from the rather smoky smell (which is everywhere in the hotel), the rooms were decent, and although it was on the far end of the strip, it was still fun. didn't have a chance to go on the ride, but did eat at the restaurant (fairly pricey, but delicious nonetheless). only complaint is the smoky smell.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky smell would not go away”
Reviews.Author: Thunderchief
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Stratosphere hotel/casino/tower before and with good room rates booked on the internet, chose to stay again. Should we return to vegas some time in the future we'll go somewhere else. Being Vegas, there's not much reason to be in your room apart from to sleep (unless you call a number on cards provided to you by Mexican genteleman about halfway up the strip - if you've been you'll know what we mean). We stayed for 7 night and what struck us was that each time we went back to the room there was a strong cigarette smell. Where the hell was it coming from? We don;t smoke and were sure that the rooms were non-smoking. It certainly wasn't the cleaning staff having a quick smoke while they made the bed! We thought it might have been the a/c or the hallway and tried a towel under the room door but to no avail. We later discovered that it came from the adjacent room (non-smoking) and because of the common door we were subject to it as well. According to housekeeping the solution is an ozone machine which will clear the room, but requires you to be out of the room for an hour or more for it to be used. This is not helpful when you wake up choking at 1am. Once this was done (4th or 5th day of our stay) the smell wasn't so bad, but they didn;t offer to move us, and they didn't seem to take any action about the other room disregarding the no-smoking rule. Oh well, new hotel next time. Had this not been an issue the room would have been perfectly fine, bed and bathroom were comfortable and clean, though housekeeping didn't get to our room on one day. The price of the rooms is a bit less than most others on the strip due to the distance from most attractions. While it does not have as many shop or restaurants as most others in Vegas we do recommend Roxy's Diner and a visit to the tower for a view of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Average but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: edupolo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and the check in experience was a little bit disappointing. More like an airport where you queue. The receptionist were very nice, typical american hospitality, friendly, funny, helpful... we got to out room and it smelt like smoked and they gave us an upgrade, which was really nice and we appreciated the gesture. I guess it is very cheap to stay here so cannot ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on the Vegas strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlesSyd
Reviews.Content: Horrible service. Broken bathrooms. I had to fight to get a room change and then by the time I got back from my appt. after telling them I wouldn't be back until late, they gave the room away! Bums outside the hotel. Hookers. I could continue but my experience was terrible. Save your money, don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, for $$”
Reviews.Author: sstuna
Reviews.Content: We had strip view room, view was the same as the room pic on their website. For what we paid it was nice. TOok monorail everywhere, Sahara was open then. Either way always felt safe walking. Some homless, never bothered us. Took the 108 from airport & as return fast & cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service for your money.”
Reviews.Author: STL_Jeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Stratosphere July 2nd-6th, 2011. We got an upgraded remodeled room with a mountain view because it was a special occasion (thanks Cassandra B.) The prices were reasonable, room was new/clean, and staff was always friendly. We ate at the Top of the World restaurant 1000 feet above the strip, & I proposed to my girlfriend. Robert the manager ensured we had a great experience, & our waitress Dana was fabulous. We never waited in long lines anywhere in the hotel/casino. The Bite show was very entertaining for the money, and Roxy's diner was good as well. It was obvious to me that the Stratosphere is making a great effort to compete with the newer extravagant casinos with better customer service and prices. Everywhere we went we were asked if we needed anything or if there was anything they could improve upon. I think this place is a great value for the money. The tower views are amazing, there are several retail shops, restaurants, rides, etc. There really is a lot to do right there at the Stratosphere. You cannot walk conveniently to the heart of the strip, but we simply took a $15 cab ride down there. The only negative thing I can think of is I lost $3 in the soda machine, & upon calling the front desk it was promptly credited back to me with no questions asked. We will for sure stay here again, & if we do stay somewhere else in the future it will simply be for a change of scenery/location. I think the Strat is on the way back up! You guys are doing things right. I just hope your prices stay attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - no problems at all!”
Reviews.Author: klee_baker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Stratosphere for three nights in June 2011 as part of a 3 week tour of the USA. The hotel was great. When we first got there we pulled up to the valet parking which is offered free - you can use the valet parking or the self - park facilities at the hotel. The check in queue was quite long, but we were seen to quickly and offered an upgrade of the room. The room itself was spacious, clean, had a view towards the strip (although you could not see much of the strip, but you could see down to the pool area). I thought that the hotel was definitely good value for money, although I've not stayed in Vegas before to comment on the other hotels available. Yes the hotel is at the end of the strip, but we found that we could walk along the strip with ease to the other hotels & attractions. If you're not very active it may be best to drive or get the bus though as you can cover quite a lot of miles in the warm weather. We ate at the hotel buffet once which was average. Not in a bad way, but there was nothing spectacular about the buffer that made it stand out compared to others. The views from atop the hotel tower are great, and you get up there for free if you are staying at the hotel. Unfortunately for us though the rides were closed due to windy weather when we wanted to ride them!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: skmichigan
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Stratosphere. And you know ok yes...it's a bit North of the strip but not a big deal. The price is right, it's clean, nice pool, no complaints! We stayed in the new Select rooms and it was great. Comfortable, nice feature having a safe. The pool was never overly crowded. Other resorts there on the main strip where we have been before, the pool is so jammed packed you can't even get your legs inbetween lawn chairs! Although only one thing that the Stratosphere needs to address......nightlife!!! Previous times we stayed there we seen bands at night. There is no live music which they need to address that. We were there for 5 days and never seen any. We will return to the Stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “Stat is a Good Value Hotel on the Strip in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Helmbhe01
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Stratosphere over the 4th of July weekend. For what we paid we thought the hotel was a great value. The front desk service was excellent, we checked in and they automatically upgraded us. We've both been to Las Vegas before and stayed in various hotels on the strip but none were as friendly or accommodating as the Stratosphere. I strongly recommend getting a select room, these are newly renovated rooms and they are really nice. Check the pictures out online, they truly look like the pictures. We also went up the tower on the 107 and 108 floors, which showcases a beautiful view of the strip and downtown. The drinks are a little spendy, but it's Vegas, you can't expect anything less on the strip. The hotel has a great dining selection, you can go to the buffet and with your ace card get 35% off, the buffet is certainly not the Wynn buffet but it still has a really good selection of food for a cheaper price. They also have a restaurant in the tower, we didn't go there but we met up with some people who really enjoyed their dining experience there. Finally, they have a pizzeria, McDonalds, Roxy's diner type food, and an Italian restaurant so you really can't go wrong. Most times we did eat out, I would strongly suggest the Eiffel Tower at the Paris Hotel, we had a great view of the water fountains at the Bellagio and the dining experience was superb. As for the Stratosphere, the hotel is a little out of the way from other strip hotels. The strip is only approximately 4 miles long but between the Stratosphere and the mid-strip areas it feels A LOT longer. However, the bus is only $7 a day (or $15 for three days) so you can just ride that. The buses are really nice coach buses so it's truly not a big deal. The only complaint I had about the hotel is the poker table and other gambling table staff were not very friendly or helpful. We went to a few other casinos and they were much more friendly and helpful. There also is no microwave or fridge in room, but as this wasn't a big deal to us we weren't worried. Just mentioning it for people who might need this convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: dahusker87
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a Romance Suite......everything was great! While the location might not be ideal, the staff makes up for with how they treated their guests. Will definitely stay there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - Enjoy the thrills, Dine out and get your own internet”
Reviews.Author: S_Kumar_Dixit
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a decent value package for the whole family in Las Vegas and selected Stratosphere as the base to explore the area. We reached early and with the check-In @ 3 PM had to wait for a while. Pros - Thrill Rides - were awesome specially trying them out at night time. - Observation Deck with panoramic views - Hotel stay allows free access to the observation deck 3-4 times per day. just swipe and ride. Sky bar is decent but not great. - Hotel rooms were nice and well ordered Cons - Room service is slow and expensive. Better idea is to dine out or use the fast food outlets for quick snacks. - Location at End of strip - Best option is to rent a car and travel around. Unlike bellagio and others it is far off and you would need a taxi to get to the strip mall. - No Shows - No nice shows on offer especially the ones on offer at the other ones. - Rooms - Cable options are limited and room does not have any microwaves. Not all rooms are quiet especially the ones close to the pool and the rides as others have noted. Check with them in advance if you are affected with them. Good value package for vacations. Enjoy the rides !!

Reviews.Title: “lax security and altitude”
Reviews.Author: bonehead60763
Reviews.Content: i went for 8 days on june 16th i experienced a bad experience, anyway there is no free internet unless you use a wifi from the sky jump or a guest who has mi fi not secured which i did briefly the cost is 12 a day but warns of other chgs, not even a water cup in mcds or free 800 or local calls i dont think, i thought the resort fee includes this, italked to employees had heard of thefts before had my computer stolen after placing on floor in strat plastic bag, mistake not returning to room, still non custiomers are not scrutinized or no patrol in horse sports room, i went to circus and a guard even said to watch m,y lousy shopping bag,taklked to guards after the theft and they werent surprised, no followup due to not forcibly taken i still cant understand how non bettors and trublemakers arent ejected, other bettoer do not take guests things usuaallymaybe this is clean enough to post the other one was notanyproof of stay let me know i have a bill

Reviews.Title: “Really great value”
Reviews.Author: jennavecia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. For the price, it was great. Very clean except I got a blanket with a yellow stain. I loved the hotel. Checkin took a while though but overall it was fabulous and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: FItraveler2010
Reviews.Content: We "splurged" and spent $50 on one of their new Select rooms. Thank goodness! We left the Grand Canyon a day early and got in late so we just needed someplace for the night. For that purpose, this was fine. Room was small but updated nicely. Furnishings, lighting, beds, bathroom were all very nice. We had a view of the wall and roof but were there for less than 12 hours so it was fine. Admission to Stratosphere is included in room and that was nice. It's normally $14 pp so we would have paid more than the cost of our room for our family to go up and enjoy the view! It was our kids first time in Vegas and it was a great way for them to see the strip. There is definitely a different feel here than at Vegas's newer hotels. If you are looking for luxury, indulgence, sophistication, class,...... head farther down the strip. If you're just looking for a decent room at a great price, this is your place! Rooms are nice and clean, though small, but casino itself feels a little second class with lots of smoke, low ceilings, and less sophisticated crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tamster34
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick about 4:30pm on a Tuesday, no line. We had room 17012 in the Select Tower. It had a view of the sky jumpers which was cool. Room was comfortable & maid service was prompt. We ate twice at Roxy's. I wrote a separate review. Dinner service/food was OK. Breakfast service/food was much better. Wish we had know that the Retail level had lots of quick eating options but we didn't discover that til late on our 2nd/last day. Cocktail service was plentiful at the tables.
