Never had a problem getting on a $5 blackjack game. We also like to play Ultimate Texas Holdem. Wednesday (our last day), the table wasn't going to open til 7pm (!) so we went to the Orleans & spent most of the day there. Make sure when you sign up for the ACE card you get the scoop on all the amenities available to you. They hold me I had a few $ in comps that could be used at the restaurants or shops but it turns out they have to print a voucher. I didn't find that out til later. I thought I could just show my card. Hubby wanted to go to the top of the tower but the line was crazy long & they wouldn't let him take a tripod for his camera. We had an early flight & couldn't check out on the TV. Going down to the desk, there was only 1 person at the counter. Seemed like the customer at the counter was having some kind of long drawn out drama. Then some people that came up behind us cut in line when the drama person was finally done. But we found a kiosk where you could fill out a card & drop your room keys. This was really the only customer service issue I had. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around . . . great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jessecat_10
Reviews.Content: This was our second time around at the Stratosphere Hotel and Casino, and won't be our last! We had a rental car, so transportation wasn't an issue. It is a great place to stay, and if you have a car, being on the edge of the Las Vegas strip is fine. Our room was situated where the fearless jumped off of the tower. Our TV had the plunge in real time, and we were able to sync the TV to the actual jumper. It was fun to watch them. The shopping area was great, and we were able to get anything we needed. I think it is a great place to stay for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, Awful, Wonderful Bell Hop Guys, Awful”
Reviews.Author: ClackamasCognac
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we were not given any information about ammenitiesof the hotel. We checked in on Saturday, the electricity went out (Things happen) sat in the Roxy for 40 minutes before we were told they could not serve us. We walked to I-hop very scarey, shady area of Las Vegas. The staff at the Stratosphere were very rude other then the bell hop guys- SUPER friendly men. When you would ask Staff a question you would never get a straight answer, we were given 3 different prices for a limo (UGH). The pool was nice. We awoke to an emergency alarm to evacuate the hotel. NO STAIR WELL SIGNS. Just EXIT signs, which were closed for emergency.That could be a real hazard in a real case scenario. After going down 23 flights of stairs with scared , upset people in their PJ's we were told it was a false alarm and we were literally laughed at by Security.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a great place”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui00123
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. In fact it was so nice we are now planning another trip back next year and will definately will be staying here again. Rooms are beautiful, cleaned every day. Bus stops close by and you can walk down town if you are really keen. Staff were lovely. Will be recommending this place to friends travelling to Vegas in August.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: VSDM
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel were nice and clean and the pool area was relaxing but that is where anything good about this hotel stops.... The rudest staff we have ever encountered in all of our travels, we were woken up at 6:30am by a loud speaker blaring in our room that "There is an emergency in the hotel, get out immediately, do not take the elevators, use the stairs only". Everyone on our floor had to go down 23 flights of stairs, some people elderly and some panicked, only to find out that it was a false alarm. When we all walked over together and addressed security, they literally laughed in our faces. I could go on and on about little things that we dealt with, with the staff. Also the localtion of the Stratosphere is at the south end of the strip, in a seedy area and a good mile and half from the center of the activity. We loved are time in Vegas but would NEVER stay at the Stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “not as per expectation”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Dealfinder786
Reviews.Content: the hotel was ok....but it would charge for every thing for empty plates for dinner or lunch, to spoons, etc. Also the reception at the door is one of the worst i have come accross in recent times..............the best part of the hotel is the view and the aerial view of the city from the top...

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay!!”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Strat at the end of May after receiving a 1-night comped offer in the mail. The other 3-nights I stayed at the Flamingo (also comped!). I was very impressed with my "premium select" room, it was much nicer than the deluxe room I stayed in at the Flamingo. I also felt that the gambling was much better at the Strat, loose slots, great VP, and $5 BJ that paid 3/2. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food choices that I had, and every staff member that I came into contact with were excellent to deal with. CW service was great also. The rooms that I stay in while in Vegas are usually always comped, but I actually wouldn't have a problem paying to stay at the Strat.......though I am glad I was comped!! It was nice to actually gamble at the same place where I slept. Normally I gamble off-Strip & sleep at a comped room on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: WesterlyGale
Reviews.Content: Luckily we only booked for three nights but even so it was not a good experience. The first room we checked into reeked of marijuana. When we informed the reception we were met by a nonchalant shrug of the shoulders and were told "ahh it happens", but no apology. We were "upgraded" to the top of the hotel but the problems did not stop there. The fire alarms were being tested for our whole stay and reading others reviews this seems to have been an ongoing problem. The majority of the walls were stripped bare in the hallway with plaster board lying around on the floor. The buffet was well stocked and the lady on the cashier counter was very polite however the rudeness of the waiting staff left a foul taste in our mouths. When asking politely for a drink, extra cutlery they were rude. I understand that hotels find it difficult to deal with the ever present prostitutes hanging around waiting for clients however I was shocked at the obviousness of the ladies “working” in the casino. As a female, sometimes alone playing in the casino I was made to feel very uncomfortable by the men and also the prostitutes. The pool area is large and had enough sun lougers for all guests and the pool bar staff are very friendly. Although some staff did make us feel welcome the others and other fatctors has left us never wanting to visit the Stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Suite with added room attached!!”
Reviews.Author: Hemspilot10
Reviews.Content: The Grand Suite with the extra two bed attached room was So Awsome!! It was to good to be true! We loved it. This was my 5th time to Vegas. The location was Quik and easy to get to anything on and off the strip! I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise! Very Nice Hotel Accomodations just like picture shown on the internet!!”
Reviews.Author: SouthFloridaCoolmom
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am not a fan of Las Vegas but this hotel exceeded expectations. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom was nice and roomy....After being traveling for almost 2 weeks, it felt nice to have such a nice room to come to....Another perk was having unlimited access to the tower for free ($16 value) to admire the incredible view from the 109th floor and to see the people riding the rides, especially the ones doing Sky Jump. From our room window we were able to see the sky jumpers, also you could see the sky jumpers on TV, the Stratosphere channel. If I were to go to Las Vegas, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and updated, location not so good”
Reviews.Author: Gd88
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the stratosphere last week for two nights. After booking through priceline, I requested non smoking. When I arrived in my room, it smelled strongly of marijuana. This was at around 11pm. I called the front desk to complain, but all she could do was appologize and say they were full and could move us in the morning. The gal said I could have an ozone machine to rid the smell and I had to be out of the room fr two hours. After returning at 2 am the room still wreaked. I proceeded to the desk and kindly asked for a room move. A girl by the name of desha, was more than happy to assist us and spoke to her manager ( did not catch her name). Desha kindly moved us and was very accommodating. My other comment is the hotel is located too far from the major hotels on te strip. A complimentary shuttle would be great to the airport and strip hotels, even though the hotel is on Vegas blvd. Otherwise, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrbiglee77
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 10 night stay had a select room, it was just fantastic and clean check in was quick and easy and service was just fine had no problems there! Ok so the location may not be the best but you must know where it it's when booking so shouldn't really wine about it, there is a deuce stop rite outside and a strip & downtown express stop across the road, and a 3 day pass is $20. The casino is fine and not to smokey and seems to pay out more than the bigger places. Oh and the pool is pretty cool too! We won't be going back to Vegas for a while but when we do return we will be staying at the stratosphere!!

Reviews.Title: “fair for the price.”
Reviews.Author: dolphinboy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week, i noted that the management respond to comments which is always good to see. We had a room on the 22nd floor and with a strip view. the room was clean and basic and the bed was comfortable. The big minus for us was that there was no safe in the room. yes, you can get a deposit box from the casino cashiers office free of charge, but its a lot of messing about having to keep going back and forth with valubles ect. the staff were very friendly and proffesional We did find that the slots had "tightened, as was the case with many casinos on the strip, so be warned. did not play blackjack, mainly that "mug" 6/5 game, so went elsewhere for that. The buffet was good value and Roxys diner was great fun too Its a pity that some of the staff, who have such wonderful singing voices dont sing a little more often. One big problem the stratosphere does have, through no fault of its own, is, that its "out on its own" with the Sahara gone there is no casinos of size for several blocks and there is a lot of waste land between the strat and the main strip casinos. this will change in time, hopefully, when the money returns. some guys have put that they did not feel safe in the area at night, i never at any time felt unsafe, just a bit of common sense is all thats needed. Would i go back? yes, probably, but not until there were more casinos and attractions closer by.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: PopcoReviews
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks at the hotel, comp upgrade to the new select room. This hotel is great for the money, not the best location in Vegas but only a short taxi ride to the heart of the strip. Great location for LVCC.

Reviews.Title: “Good value ...recommend”
Reviews.Author: U2pies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Stratosphere in June. We got a room for about $45 night and it was a bargain! Room was nothing fancy, but clean, comfy bed and fine for a few nights. The pool was amazing and rides looked like fun even though we did not do them. The views from the tower were amazing. Location is fine ...on the bus route and not too far from main part of strip. We ate at several restaurants within the casino and they were good. Only down side was having to bpay for internet. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for our money even with a complaint.”
Reviews.Content: There is NO tea kettle/coffee pot and you can not get one unless you upgrade to a suite. We tried and tried. (There is an iron and an ironing board.) Also, no refrigerator and no safe. They are doing the fire alarm testing still and it is an annoyance. How long does that take? The room was standard hotel room with decent bed and pillows. Small bathtub. We were given a room with a nice view. Dinner in the revolving restaurant was expensive but very nice. The Italian restaurant was also very good. All the staff that we dealt with including valets for parking must have been to charm school. All of them were pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but a bit of a walk”
Reviews.Author: QueenBurnham
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Stratosphere 3 times now and have always had a great experience. The rooms are very clean, and the Select Tower (which I stayed in this time) has just been refurbished at an apparent cost of $20bn. The staff are particularly friendly, everyone says hello on their way past and go out of their way to help if you need anything. The croupiers and staff on the gaming tables are also friendly which I didn't find in every casino. The buffet has a huge selection of food although I only ever went there for breakfast (as there's a Denny's just behind the Strat). Get yourself a Stratosphere Players card (free) to get 25% off of the buffet price and make sure that you visit the tower (free with your room key), which is amazing at night; being able to see the lights on the strip. The only 2 reasons that I probably won't be back to stay at the Stratosphere are that a) I've stayed there 3 times now so would like to test out a different hotel and b) since the closure of the Sahara and the Stardust, the location of the Stratosphere feels a little out of the loop. It's really cheap to stay there but what I saved on accomodation - I spent on taxis. All in all, 10 out of 10 again.

Reviews.Title: “we always return, love it”
Reviews.Author: tjmacri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Strat approximately 10 times in the last 6 years. We love the easy access to the casino floor, the free valet parking and the American Superstars show!!! We have seen it ten times so far! The mall upstairs is great. Nice place to take a quick break from gambling, and reasonable prices. Budget car rental is right upstairs, quick and easy to rent and return. The staff is always great, friendly and polite. We will be returning year after year!!

Reviews.Title: “Unreal Value for Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Gstapes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stratosphere twice in the last two months, once for business and the other time for pleasure. The hotel is an unreal value for Las Vegas! The select rooms are remodeled like new, clean and modern. Bedding is great, all rooms have LCD TV's, and has a modern decor. The location is convienient to the Convention Center and both the main strip and downtown Las Vegas (Freemont Street). Parking was easy and with the attached garage, only steps away from my room and the casino. Most hotels you have to walk a mile to your car. I especially liked this for when I was traveling on business...that plus the starbucks at the bottom of the elevators!! The dining at the Stratosphere is great, and a pretty good value! I at in my room, and was very impressed with the quality of the food! I also ate in the Italian Restaurant, it was pretty good for not being in New York or Chicago and very resonable prices. The pool deck was nice.. the pool bar was even better! I also could not believe the shops that were in the hotel,,,I would have never guessed as they are in the second level out of the way, but they are very convienient for people who stay at the hotel. I had an important meeting and used the spa for a haircut. The people at the spa were great!! Very helpful and did great work. The fitness center is in the retail area just off the elevators, and is perfect for someone trying to get a work out while away. Most of the time the LV hotel fitness centers are intimidating and difficult to find and use. This one simply use your key for access as you would any hotel, and then hit the treadmill. No pushhy or intimidating staff to deal with. The only negative to this resort is the crazy vegas nightlife is a cab ride away (5 blocks), as there is not a nightclub here. However if you are saving 50-100 dollars a night, you can deal with the cabride....During the day, as long as you dont mind a nice walk, all is within walking distance. Since the closing of the Sahara, the closest other resorts are the Riviara and Circus Circus to the south on LVB about 4 blocks away. Wynn's Encore then the Wynn then TI and Veneitan.......a few more blocks... To me, the savings is well worth it for what you get in return! Bottom line is when you look at the price and what you get for the money, nothing else can come close for the value during your Vegas Get Away. I will stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “made to feel special”
Reviews.Author: kt2tk
Reviews.Content: we went there for our 40th wedding anniverery, when we booked in, the gut was really helpful, we got to our room, which was very nice, the view was not all that as it was the back of the hotel, but the room was comfy. We had dinner on Easter Sunday in the tower and it was really good, the service, the food, the view all fantastic, there is a bus stop just outside and the run very often, so no trouble getting onto the strip or freemont st. The swimming pool on the 8th floor was a bit of a hike from our room, but it was worth going to, clean pool area and towels provided when showing room card All in all, would go back to this hotel tomorrow if I could

Reviews.Title: “Hope for the updated tower and youll have a great time.”
Reviews.Author: Hnessy17
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at stratosphere, honestly i wasnt looking forward to it. The first time we stayed there we were given a room towards the back of the casio( the older tower ) and we just hated it. Dirty and out dated but i guess its true you get what you pay for. Using hotwire we reserved a room in the south strip not knowing it was stratosphere. We had no choice but to go since we already paid for it. This time around we were given a room in the side tower ( the new tower ) and honestly it was great. New hip carpeting, led tv, updated bathrooms. We only stayed one night but for the price it was a bargain. So travelers be nice to the person who checks you in and cross your fingers you get into the updated tower.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the Rate, Rides, and Tower Views, Not the Location”
Reviews.Author: NewMexBound
Reviews.Content: Paid < $40 including resort fee for one night in June. Room is big, clean, and comfortable, though nothing truly special. My room in the North Tower was a fairly long walk to the outdoor, 8th floor pool area. Pool area was active. There is little, if any, shaded areas. Can watch the sky divers jumping from the rides on the 110th floor. Was able to access the Tower for free with my room key (saves you about $14). Nice bars, restaraunts (1/2 price appetizers were good), indoor, and outdoor viewing areas at the top of the tower. There are 3 outrageous rides at the top of the tower. They're not cheap ($12/13 ea) but they definitely provide thrills. I was happy with my 1 night stay. Having been to Vegas before, I didn't plan to venture to The Strip nor Downtown. You'd need a car or cab to get to these. If those areas are your destinations, there are more convenient hotels to stay at in those areas. The Stratosphere is almost an island unto itself.

Reviews.Title: “Not At All What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Africanpridex3
Reviews.Content: Soo, I read the reviews online and it seemed like a pretty nice hotel to stay at. NOT. I didn't find this stay very pleasant. Not one I would go back to. As a teen I came with both my parents and my 14 year old brother. To start with, check-in took a long time. We had to sit and wait for my mom to finish for what seemed like centuries.. (well maybe thats because we were so excited to be in Vegas). Nonetheless, we asked for a room with a great view so they gave us Level 23 .. little did we know this level would be a nightmare for us later on. Level 23 (second to last highest level) was undergoing "Fire-Alarm Testing". On the first day, this ANNOYING automated announcer on the intercom kept speaking literally every 5 seconds for a good ONE AND A HALF HOUR. She kept repeating "THIS IS A FIRE ALARM TEST. WE APOLOGIZE FOR ANY INVCONVIENCE. THANKYOU" every 5 seconds until our heads exploded. We couldn't even watch TV or talk on the phone because it was SO loud on the intercom speakers. Speaking of TV's, they have a flat-screen television, but from then on it SUCKS. I don't know whats wrong with the remote, it won't flip the channels/adjust volume unless you REALLY press hard. Also, when you turn on the TV it's automatically set to this HIGH volume so it wakes everybody up. It's not like you can adjust it from the start because the remote won't even work. They also have very limited channels, but that wasn't a problem for us because in Vegas you're doing alot of other things-- but I warn the TV lovers. The shower. OH the shower. I don't know what was worst, the walls of the shower looking like they were about to tear off, or the SHOWER HEAD that had no water coming out of it. It was the worst shower head i've ever used. IT doesn't even have holes in it, it's this ONE huge water hole and it spreads out as it hits your body but when it does, there is barely any water touching you. Sucks. And our bad luck for taking Level 23 doesn't stop there. Some of the elevators wouldn't even take us to that level. We had to literally go to Level 22, and then CLIMB THE STAIRS to go to our room. We had to do this same routine for our entire stay there. It doesn't help when it's the last day, and you have LUGGAGE'S to carry and you're running up dirty looking stairs to get to your room to grab last minute things. We were gonna call the front desk and ask to move to another level, but the days were just so hectic that really- it was never done. ALSO, whenever we got to our level to get to our room, the walls of the hallways were literally tearing off. LITERALLY, FALLING OFF. I don't know if they were undergoing RECONSTRUCTION as well as the Fire-Alarm Test, but walls were coming down and white powder was covering part of the floors (some being vacuumed, the others not). The room by itself is nothing special-- at all. Unless you get the upgraded room (we didn't) it looks really bland and un-comforting. You have two beds, none of them have any color on the blankets, it's just white sheets. One flat screen TV (which fools you when you're trying to use the remote) a small coffee table in the back corner with a chair and a huge window with the view of the city (the only NICE part about the room). The pool is fine, lots of beach balls to throw around and play with. Jacuzzi is not hot at all, but who really cares about that. Lots of sunbeds surrounding the pool area but the deck isn't anything special, just white cement. Oh, and I hope you don't mind walking a good 5 minutes to get to the pool area, because it's not at a location where your elevator takes you and it's right in-front of you. You have to pass through numerous hallways, passing rooms to even get there. Casino looks like all the other hotels we went to. I can't really comment on that because i'm a teen and of-course didn't spend my time there. The Buffet there was pretty good, it was HUGE but I was told Vegas is the place for Buffets so perhaps that's how they all are, idk? It was delicious, lots of desserts. I recommend going there for brunch/dinner if you end up staying. It's cheaper if you have an ACE card because you get 25% off on the total charge. The retail-mall was okay. I thought it was the greatest thing coming from quiet ol' Colorado, and then we went to the Venetian to see their shopping area and was like OH WOW. Overall, my trip to Vegas as far as all the sight-seeing was amazing. I really loved the city, but this hotel we stayed at was not-so-great. It's definitely not a place we will be returning to. If you're a family visiting or anyone who is knit-picky (like myself ;p) I would NOT recommend coming here. It was nothing special, PLUS the disaster we had on Level 23 made matters way worse. I was going to say if you go, don't stay on Level 23 but a lady in the elevator said she was there last month and they had the SAME Fire-Alarm Testing on Level 8, and it was the second time this happened to her. So beware which level they put you on, so you don't get caught in the midst of the chaos. Peace.

Reviews.Title: “"BE WARNED"”
Reviews.Author: bigbillytheeejett
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of staying in this hotel for 8 days...on arrival the front desk did not have our requests...i.e to be on the same floor near my family...I suffer from Chronic Renal Dysfunction and I am exhausted most of my day so after a long journey you can guess how I am feeling...they allocated me a room on a different floor from my family but promised to get me near my family on the same floor the next day...we arrived at our first room to find it was occupied ! on informing the front desk of this they directed me to another room on a different floor and a porter would arrive with the key...nearly exhausted we made our way again to the second room..the porter arrived with the key and we entered the room,,,then a married couple arrived and asked what we where doing in their room...this was also OCCUPIED !!! at this point I collasped ...the porter ordered a wheelchair to be brought from the lobby as I could not walk I also requested this to be kept in my room which I could use as needed ...then we had to wait on this and for another room to be allocated eventually they got us another room on a different floor yet again...only this time I had to be taken in the wheelchair which was taken back and my request refused for its use and yes I am disabled ,,they gave us a free buffet and said that they would not charge for the first night as a good will gesture but on checking out they charged us ignoring what was promised ,,,,room had ,No fridge... No coffee maker ...no suitcase stands ...hotel eating was costly ...the casino was stinking with smoke every gambler appeared to be smoking ,, absolutely no chance of winning in the casino..actually nobody I met had won anything...everything is directed at taking the last dollar from you...a $7.50 amenity fee is charged each day for what ??? ...parking ? I did not have a car ! ...the pool ? this was closed most times I was at it ! and drink and food extortionate ...paying for secondary lung cancer from the smoke ?? the hotel is to large, to long and to commercial,,,it appears the shareholders are taking the icing of the cake and savaging your winning odds for their profits...bring back the mafia....location is well away from the strip...transport and taxi's are costly...hotel internet is the most costliest that I've used in any hotel anywhere in the world...everything is at a price...to get every last dollar from you pocket for the least possible service...drivers in the hotel multi car park are half drunk and their standard of driving is pathetic ''' watch out in there ''' as there appears to be no law enforcement and watch out for the timeshare agents who pester you every time you enter or leave the hotel...on checking out no one asked how my stay was...did I have any difficulties or complaints...just pay up and get out !! Yes I will remember this hotel for all the bad memories and being an idiot for booking it...I doubt if I will ever be back in Las Vegas and I will deter any of my family or friends from going it should be now known as Past Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but watch the hidden charges scams”
Reviews.Author: Flossy555
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean. The view was spectacular from the 107-109 floors. Be prepared because it is a long distance walk to the rest of the strip. Also beware of the hidden charges. Apparently you electronically sign for the resort fees when you check in and that automatically authorized the other fees you do not see but the desk clerk can see. Be careful when you say you don't want a room facing a wall because I guess that means you automatically want a more expensive room but they don't tell you that. In addition, they double charge room upgrade fees twice a day and if you don't say anything about it, neither do they. Thankfully that was reimbursed. But we had to eat the bogus upgrade charges that we did not find out about until check out.and the resort fee that was advertised as "No resort fee" when we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good food but.....”
Reviews.Author: Cora04
Reviews.Content: Roxy`s restaurant offered very good food with a good service. Less good was the room, initially being offered a smoker`s one (yuk ! ) & then another. I havn't seen washbasin etc in the sleeping area for a long time, but then the bathroom was minute. How do well proportioned Americans cope ? Otherwise, bland & noisy with nothing to recommend another stay. Also, too far down the strip to be a convenient location. Thus, visit Roxy`s but stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best view...but cheap”
Reviews.Author: LisbonMiguel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for 3 nights. I said I was on my honeymoon when I made the reservation. They gave us a room on the 8th floor, wich sadly was facing an automobile silo, and some air conditionig units. The view was terrible and there was always a noise on the backgroud coming from outside. You get a nice view from the city, on the top of the tower (free for hotel guests). The hotel is not within walking distance to the other major casinos (venetian, bellagio,etc). On the plus side it is not expensive. If I ever return to Vegas I think I will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bit off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mcdonaghpaula
Reviews.Content: stayed a week in this hotel in january 2011 with my boyfriend. was a nice hotel, clean, basic but a bit away from all the rest of the hotels on the strip. we got a shared bus to our hotel when we arrived and the driver was lovely and giving a guided tour onthe way from the airport, when we were near the stratosphere hotel, he said do not walk down this far once it gets datk ,,, then said he wouldnt say any more ... we guess he said this because there were a few homeless people around the streets this end of the strip. i wouldnt walk there alone at night and my boyfriend said the same thing ... we did walk home from the strip nearly every night but used the Deuce bus service which was very handy for the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Have you ever had a perfect vacation?”
Reviews.Author: CaroleCM
Reviews.Content: Let me introduce you to the Stratosphere in Las Vegas. From the moment of our super speedy and super pleasant check-in, to the exemplary daily maid service, to the drop-your-key-cards-in-a-box check out - it was perfection. We arrived at about 6:30 PM on May 17th and waited in line for … oh about 10 seconds, before we met with a friendly gentleman at the registration desk. A few questions and whoosh! we were on our way to our room. We stayed in the renovated section of the Stratosphere, but discovered to our delight that friends were also at the hotel at the same time. Their room was in the un-renovated section, however, except for a few differences, both rooms were excellent! Ours did have an outstanding view of the strip (and of those crazy bungee jumpers off the tower!) and if you can do it, get that view! A really nice little tidbit of service was the second wake up call in the morning! We actually did fall back asleep one morning after the first call and the second one was great. Maid service was phenomenal. No matter what time we left our room and even if gone for only a few hours, we returned to a clean room with fresh towels and a perfectly made bed. We spent nearly half a day just exploring the Stratosphere - and I must admit their great shops got a few of my dollars! Don’t miss the view from the tower either, it’s amazing how beautiful Las Vegas is at night. We felt we really got a great value for our vacation dollar at the Stratosphere. I would highly recommend this hotel for those who value great service over superficial glitz - although it’s plenty sparkly enough there for a really fun vacation base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a somewhat awkward location”
Reviews.Author: Mylife71479
Reviews.Content: So I must say beforehand that I thought that the location was going to be in God-Only-Knows-Where and that I was going to end up mugged or dead by the end of the trip. Ok....now.......with that out of the way.....I can move on to reality......... I booked this hotel because of the price that I got. The room was decent, nothing major but clean. Bed wasn't heavenly but it was soft enough to sleep comfortably. The tub in the bathtub was deep which was great to soak after an 8 mile run a few days out of the weekend. The casino was great. I won a decent amount of money, signed up for the ACE card and even got some perks. The buffet was ok nothing to write home about but good enough to satisfy your hunger without making you run to the bathroom. The towers and all of the shops are cool. Make sure you stop at Fat Tuesdays and get a huge drink. Getting to the hotel wasn't bad. I actually took the bus directly from the airport which stops right up the block from the hotel. Getting to the strip is fairly easy with 3 options (well four if you dont mind walking): 1. Walk down to the Golden Nugget and catch the Monorail (Most expensive): The monorail is fast but drops you off at certain points OFF the strip so unless you're going to MGM Grand or Harrah's its not exactly convenient and it costs the most. 2. Purchase a bus ticket and catch the Deuce down the strip (you can also use the regular bus pass). The only drawback is that the Deuce stops at every stop from the Stratosphere all the way down the strip (stops are like every .25 to .5 mile) and the trip take virtually forever. 3. Purchase the bus pass with the SDX (Express) option. The express bus only stops at certain stops and cuts down GREATLY on the trip time from the Strat. Note that the Gold line doesn't pick up on Las Vegas Blvd. adjacent to the Stratosphere. You have to cross the street and catch it on St. Louis St. (which is right around the corner). The Strat is great for the price and a cool place. If you dont mind being away from the lights and glory, I'd definitely stay there again. The casino is more than accommodating and the hotel is decent. Oh! And the rooftop pool? Amazing. Had a great time playing water volleyball with tons of strangers. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to enjoy a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: dispatchangel911
Reviews.Content: Service was wonderful, room was comfortable and clean. Great time at the pool. Dining at the Top of the World was a one of a kind expericence!

Reviews.Title: “Very exciting hotel- lots to do”
Reviews.Author: laurenbaumbach
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, convientent parking and lots to do just in the hotel itself. Decent location and rides on top are great. Restaurant is way overpriced (lounge 107) and not the best service. The hotel and ride prices are very affordable. I would stay again, but after experiencing other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I would only stay here again if I was extremely broke.”
Reviews.Author: urmomzhott
Reviews.Content: I was looking everywhere online to experience my first birthday in Vegas and came across a cool sounding hotel with rides on top on the hotel. I'm an adventurous person and at the time I figured oh I don't want to stay at a really expensive boring hotel when I want to have fun too and party. I was wrong. The descriptions were misleading and to walk down the strip from the hotel can be far! The 'rollercoasters' were pretty boring and really small. Something you'd find at a broken run down fair. None of them were really thrilling like they advertise. The stratosphere is at the far end of the strip almost towards the bad part of town. Had to take a monorail or bus everytime which ate up our money. We tried the walking for a day and it was too much for our bodies and were only 22!! I paid for the second highest to the suite, which was for the strip view. You can't even make out what's what from the room because were so far from it. What I paid was definetly not worth it. Room service didn't come for two days and doesn't knock before she comes in. Very rude. Tried the buffet there. Absolutely horrible! It all looked so pleasing to the eye with so many assortment varieties to choose from. I was excited until I tasted the food. I can tell it was high grade quality food but it was just the way they cooked the dishes were not appetizing. I only liked things they couldn't of messed up on like the cheese, the pickles, the deli slices and the vegetables. Disappointed, because I eat anything. The casino is beautiful on the inside and the staff is always polite. The shopping mall upstairs is very amusing and gives you something to do. It was fun. Quite a few varities to eat at too wheather on a budget or not. IF YOU DO STAY HERE, STRONGLY RECOMMEND not paying for a fancy room, not paying for the buffet, bring your walking shoes, if you have to take a bus or monorail, pay for an all day or 24 hr pass and the observation deck is not worth the money during daylight as well as the thrill rides.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: Remington5th
Reviews.Content: After some of the reviews here, I was reluctant to book a room here. I paid $29.99 for a room with 2 queen beds trough american airlines vacations. I was expecting a dated and well worn room. I only needed it for the night, so I did it. I was on the 10th floor witch was 2 floors above the shopping center roof. Beautyful air conditioning units on the roof! So the view wasn't great but it wasn't awful. The room was neat, clean and not very worn. I requested a smoking room, and it didn't have that smell from years of smoking in it. It also had a LCD 32" TV (Not that a TV makes a room) The room had a few maintenance items that could be addressed. The toilet seat was loose, and a spot in the shower where the caulk is starting to discolor. Check in was very easy. The staff was very friendly. Free parking. Cant rate the casino or resteraunts as I didn't use them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Relation price quality”
Reviews.Author: fliafor
Reviews.Content: A good choice for staying with kids and teen agers because of the attractions at The top of The tower, where day or night you have free access to The best view of The strip, and The city. Well located, at The end of The strip. The casino is not so big but it is okey if Gambling is not the main pourpose of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: LeonieF88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in May 2011 and loved it. The hotel was immaculate, the staff were helpful and the room was very big as well as being clean and tidy - though being Vegas we didn't spend much time in the room. The check in was quick and efficient with very little waiting time even though they were busy. We paid approx US$350 for the 4 nights and booked via expedia. There were no additional charges once we arrived at the hotel. The casino is smaller than some of the other hotels but it was also cheaper with $5 blackjack tables (most in Las Vegas are $10 - 20 minimum). This hotel is about one hour walk from the other hotels on the strip but there is a good bus service. It is closer to the 'Downtown' area which is the old Las Vegas. We actually liked being away from the big casinos as it was a lot cheaper (ie food, diners, casinos, general shopping etc). We also liked being away from the main tourist area as it was a bit less manic. The Stratosphere is the tallest building in Las Vegas and has a viewing platform up top as well as roller coasters. Being scared of heights this didn't interest me but it seemed a popular thing to do. There is a great pool at Stratosphere as well. Overall I loved this hotel. It is best suited to people who are on a budget but still want to stay somewhere nice. If you don't mind being away from the big casinos it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Every Man Casino”
Reviews.Author: Maxim_LV
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is great for the average person. You don't feel like you need a suit and sportcoat to fit in. The service is great, the accommodations are worth what you pay, and it's a fun time. The Maxim ACES-V Review - Accommodations: The new rooms they advertise and that come with their general deals are their "Select" rooms. The rooms aren't large, but they're very new-age looking (as are the hallways leading to them), they come with flat screen TVs, a nice desk and a comfortable bed. There is a chair and a small table, and that's about it. On my most recent stay though, the toilet did drip which was a minor annoyance. (4/5) Cleanliness: The rooms tend to be very clean here. Nothing to complain about. (5/5) Extras: Soap, shampoo, conditioner. There's a safe in the room. Very basic. (4/5) Service: Check-in is generally quick and efficient, even right at 3pm which is check-in. Check-out tends to be a longer process because there is less staffing and the people who check-out at the desk rather than through their TV (or by just leaving) tend to have issues that take longer than checking in. (4/5) Value: You can get rooms at the Stratosphere for around $20-$30 during the week and slightly more on the weekends. If you're staying here though, rent a car. The Monorail ends at the Hilton now that the Sahara is closed and after dark, there's not much comforting about the trek from the Stratosphere to Circus-Circus.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: yoda61
Reviews.Content: Very clean . remodeled rooms are very modern. We spent one night here on our way to California. Staff was very accomodating. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pooh2010
Reviews.Content: The room is "The Oasis Suite " , 700 sq. ft. of romance featuring, Jetted Tub opening into a living/sleeping area. Luxury King Bed plus Sofa bed. The room is clean, roomy, and comfortable. The view is great. Strip view and can see the “Sky Jump"

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: dancefreek4
Reviews.Content: I've visited the Stratosphere before and had an amazing time.I have no real complaints about our trip except for one thing. My friend and I really wanted to go and just relax, eat good food, gamble, and go to the jacuzzi. We were sad when we saw that the pool area was under construction. Ive been in the pool area before on a previous trip and it was so much fun. The pool is very shallow but good enough to cool off in. That was the only negative about the whole trip. The hotel was still in tip top shape. The rooms were very clean and taken care of. The staff were extremely nice and caring. We ordered room service multiple times and they were quick about getting it up to our room. We dined at the Italian restaurant on the property and we were in heaven. The food was scrumptious. We also ate at Roxy's, and we loved it. Our room was right next to the tower jump and we could see people free falling day and night! It was so awesome to see. The Stratosphere is a distance from the strip but not too bad. Make sure you have a car because you probably don't want to walk through the area around the hotel. Its a great place to stay and the rates are unbeatable. Parking is free. Just watch out for the Starbucks prices in the hotel... We bought an iced coffee with 2 extra pumps of vanilla and it cost up 9 dollars! each extra pump was 2 bucks!!! CRAZY! Overall, I cant wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: crystalnette
Reviews.Content: I was dissapointed that they did not live up to my expections. When I checked in they gave me a room that someone had just checked out of with towels and bedding on the floor. The staff is overworked! They never apologized for the nasty room but did assign another not as nice but still another. The casino is good and the restaurant had great food. The view from the top of tower was awesome and worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights stay at the stratosphere-good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil1935
Reviews.Content: we moved from golden nugget to the strat for our next 2 nights, again i could not fault the hotel etc, they let us check in early and our rom was ready, had good service at restaurant and the casinos, go up the tower for the views, well worth it and if you are feeling brave, do the skyjump. if you feel even braver do a proper tandem skydive, which i can only describe as amazing. we then moved to treasure island for last 3 nights of holiday

Reviews.Title: “It really is worse than that”
Reviews.Author: george2sooty
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, with the extremely rude check in staff,to the rooms they tried to trick us into, which were more like hostel rooms, where do I start. The only thing this hotel has going for it is that it is at the shopping Mall end of the strip so you save a few dollars in the cab. Everything else is very low rent, and poor, I think it must be one of the cheapest places for American tourists to stop, perhaps they get vouchers on cereal/ packs of crisps/ fries.

Reviews.Title: “great new rooms”
Reviews.Author: theellitts
Reviews.Content: room was great better than mgm we stopped at on the same trip, hotel is out of the way. we paid £16 a night compared with £50 a night in the mgm grand. pool was good. and best thing is the free pass to go up the tower as often as you want day or night great view at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great times!”
Reviews.Author: DaveInNorman
Reviews.Content: First time i stayed there, and I will be back. It was just a fun place, helpful staff, and very clean, spacious room. And so reasonable for what you get. The casino was fun, too, and some great restaurants on main and mezzanine levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great new rooms”
Reviews.Author: OnlyVegas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Strat several times for work and pleasure. My company appreciates the cheap room bill and as long as I can get to the monorail quickly, the convention center is a short ride away, so I don't mind the location. I was given what was apparently one of the upgraded rooms on my last visit and was very impressed. Everything was new, clean and comfortable. I have stayed everywhere from Caesars and Mandalay Bay to the old Binions downtown. For the money, I don't think there are better rooms avaiilable in the city right now -- at least the price I paid, which was about $40/night las fall.

Reviews.Title: “THE STRAT IS MY KIND OF PLACE”
Reviews.Author: rrgtarpon
Reviews.Content: the moment I got to the Stratosphere I was treated very well it s a good hotel and casino the rooms are clean and the upgraded they gave me was awesome Roxys diner was really cool it s like dinner and a show and the food was good. Location is on the strip but kind of far the great thing is the deuce which is the bus system in vegas stops right in front of the Stratosphere going both north and south a 3 day bus pass is like 12 dollars and well worth it the buses run all night no drinks are allowed on the bus so drink them before you get on there is a resort fee of like 15 a night but you pay that any where you go and it allows you unlimted access to the tower which is like 6 dollars a trip so a couple trips should make the resort fee up the show Bite was cool it has some great music and overall it was good for the price well hope you enjoy the stratosphere as much as I did

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, but nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: howelldw
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks long stay at the Strat. I chose the Strat based on priced and proximity to my meeting location. Upon arrival I chose to upgrade to a newly remodeled room for $20 additional per night. You arrive at the casino level and get blasted with cigarette smoke. The hotel elevators are in the back of the casino. The remodeled rooms were nice. Pillows and room lighting were terrible. Otherwise, it was nice. There are only about 15 cable channels so don't expect much channel flipping at night when you are winding down. Internet is available for $12 per day. The tower is awesome. The rotating restaurant is good but expensive. Plan on $75pp. There is a food court on the "R" level which include McDonald's, El Napol Mexican, Auntie Ann's, and a sandwich shop. A buffet is located on the casino floor. Pool service is excellent and the wait staff are attentive. Taxi stand out front. Fares are about $25 to airport. $15 to far end of strip and $10 closer in. You are about 3 blocks of walking to get to the Sahara Monorail Station. Bus stop in front of hotel. Express bus is $7 per day. Do not try to walk anywhere towards the strip. It is a lot further than it looks. I did both the monorail and cab. The cab is best overall for front door delivery. Book show tickets before you get to Vegas and have a good itinerary in place before you arrive. Shows and dinners are expensive. Plan on $300 per night per couple. Lunch average is $15-20 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view, great room, scary rides !!”
Reviews.Author: magicmum4
Reviews.Content: On a recommendation from my son we booked Stratosphere for our Vegas stay - and were not disappointed. The room was great, plenty of pillows, plenty of towels, housekeeping during our stay was excellent. In house buffet was also great value, and very good food. Good variety of other eating places for all budgets. The pool area is marvellous and we enjoyed some great swims - to the surprise of the staff I think as it was probably quite cold for locals ! And it 's a great place to watch the Sky Jumpers !! We indulged on room service breakfast one morning and it was excellent. While it's at the top end of the strip there is good public transport - we chose the Monorail whichstops quite nearby, but the bus service is also handy. All in all we enjoyed a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay, happy to recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Rachandkev
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the MGM grand earlier in our trip and stayed at the stratosphere because it was so much cheaper than the MGM rates, I'm glad we did because we got to sample 2 of the many hotels on the strip. We checked in quite late as we had driven back from the grand canyon and all the rooms of the type we had booked, king size I think, had been given away. Ibwasn't very happy as we had booked about 11 months before but the check in assistant immediately said she would give us a room with 2 doubles in the best section of the hotel, it was a lovely room, the added extras weren't up to the MGM standards but I'm only talking about things like MGM shampoo etc nothing major. We had a view of the stratosphere sign and the sky jump which was excellent to see, they even put a sign in the window to warn you what they are doing! Overall an excellent stay, happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved”
Reviews.Author: Dije101
Reviews.Content: Staff and welcome excellent. Renovations meant rooms were much improved on our last visit

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: flowergirl3785
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. The front desk staff were very helpful. Our room offered a nice view of the mountains. You do have to go all the way through the smoke filled casion to get to the elevators that go up to your room. The pool area is very relaxing. The value of this hotel is great. Although if you don't take the $5 shuttle, the cab fares to the middle of the strip begin to add up. There isn't much entertainment at this hotel with regard to shows. The Top of the World Restaurant is excellent. The view from the top is not one to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: menry66
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed with this hotel at all. The customer service stunk. I had a towel stolen from my room, went 2 days with little hot water & little water pressure. It's on the strip at the very end, you have to walk quite a ways to get to the "true strip" The food in Roxie's was awesome, but that was about the only thing I enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere - great location and room”
Reviews.Author: bormanator
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the week as the rates are low and the Sahara was closing. I liked my room, the location of the hotel, the places to eat. Roxy's restaurant has very good food, but the staff wear terrible outfits. You get unlimited Tower access when you stay there and that is pretty cool. On top they also have a cable ride (ilke bungee but no bouncing) and an 8 person ride that hangs over the edge. No way! On the Tower lever (second floor) is a very nice sub shop (forget the name) and a McDonalds, plus lots of shopping opportunities. Nearby on Sahara is the McDonalds where I went for the free Wifi. The Deuce bus stops right outside. Pool is there but I never used it, no shade. In the casino they had $2 and $3 Blackjack. Staff were all nice. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, clean rooms, comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: justmeTX016
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Stratosphere. The rooms were well maintained, beds were comfortable with lots of extra fluffy pillows. Check in was fast, check out was simple.Pool was nice and great for small children, (not deep) After staying at 3 other Vegas hotels with terrible experiences and uncomfortable beds Stratosphere will be our Vegas hotel from now on. Free valet parking was a huge plus for us as well.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the hot spot”
Reviews.Author: Kjetil-Sk
Reviews.Content: A great hotel but in my opinion too far from down town. The hotel is the talest building in Las Vegas so you have a great view from the top floor...who also have fun rides for anyone with a strong stomage

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: guyandtracey
Reviews.Content: Just spent a great holiday at the stratosphere. The hotel is well down the strip and not in the greatest of areas but that was the only downside, but the Deuce bus stops right outside and you can use it all day for $7. Stayed in one of the remodelled rooms which had everything we needed apart from drink making facilities. The beds were comfortable and the room was spacious. The casino itself was good with plenty of slots(if thats your thing) and nice staff on the tables, a big thanks to Gina from Mexico, for your patience in teaching me blackjack. The Ace players card is well worth getting even if you don't gamble as you save 25% at the buffet and 10% in other outlets.The pool is fine, plenty of sunbeds the only issue was the loud music which was impossible to escape and often the only spare beds were by the speakers!!! When I and another guest complained to a lifeguard, all we got was attitude but following speaking to the supervisor a small reduction in volume followed but surely the hotel could provide a quiet area to suit everyone? Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit - still a great hotel however a few minor faults”
Reviews.Author: kaylz86
Reviews.Content: I visited the Stratosphere again in March 2011 having previously visited the hotel in March 2007. We arrived late afternoon having travelled from the UK. The que at reception was quite long however it did move quickly. We had a mix up at reception with our room request however it was soon sorted out and we were given a newly refurbished room in the tower. Although we'd paid for a strip view which was not available we did still have a good view as it was looking onto the tower so we could see the bungee jumpers all day which was fun. The location of this hotel is not the best however we knew this when booking. The area feels safe during the day however I would recommend a taxi on the evening if you are going up the strip. We ate in the hotel restaurants on 4 occasions and unfortunately we were dissapointed with some of the restaurants. Roxy's Diner none of our party enjoyed. The waitress serving us had very bad manners and at one point slamed a drink on the table, the food was ok. The buffet restaurant again was ok, I personally enjoyed the breakfast more than the evening buffet however this may have been because we ate at the buffet quite late around 8ish. Felini's we all enjoyed the food very much however again were disapointed by the service. The menu states that a service charge will be added for parties over 6 - there were 4 people in our party however the service charge at 18% was added to the bill. When I queried this with the waiter I was told there was an error on the menu. I explained that because the menu states parties over 6 then they should honour what is advertised to the customers until the menu is amended. The waiter went on to explain that he and the other staff were on minimum wage and needed the service charge to get by. I was starting to get annoyed at this point - we always tip generously when we receive a good service anyway so this excuse was not on. I asked to see the manager and was told he was not there. I asked when he would be back and I was told not until the next day. Once I said I would come back when the manager was present the waiter told me he would remove the service charge. I found it suspicious that the waiter could just remove the service charge like that once I'd said I'd come back to speak with the manager. We still left a generous tip as we did enjoy the food however if you are a party under 6 beware of this and check your bill. We also used some of the snack bars such as mcdonalds and tower pizza which were both lovely and good value for money. The pool area is lovely and the waitresses around the pool are very polite and attentive. It's nice to go up to the pool to relax however please note you can't take any drinks to the pool area. We did experience problems with the guests on our floor half way through out stay who quite frankly were rude and ignorant. The most vile people I have met in my life. There were 3 ladies in there party and the noise they made during the night was unreal. Now I know it's vegas and everyone is there to have a good time however singing along the corridor, shouting along the corridor, slamming doors and playing music up until 7am is not on! My mam noticed them one day in the corridor and asked if they'd keep the noise down and they replied "no they would not as they were on vacation and they didn't give a F...". To be honest these so called ladies looked like they'd just jumped off a Jeremy Springer show. We sometimes came in at 3am or 4am but we always respected other guests on our floor therefore were as quiet as possible. Overall it was a good stay in the hotel which has some very good facilities. The hotel is clean and spacious and the pool area is lovely and relaxing. Just beware of rude guests and a rude waitress in roxys!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: arnie321
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Strat for 11 nights in April me and my wife really enjoyed our stay,the rooms and all the facilities where fine all of the Brits seemed to enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel. Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegas58
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere hotel Las Vegas is a great hotel. The new rooms are very nice, They are big and roomy. The renovated Casino, hallways, lobby and rooms Are so nice. The casino lights change colors that is so cool. This is my second time coming here and the staff are so friendly. Some staff are rude but that can be changed. The pool looks very nice. The price rocks too. Free valet parking in front of the casino, how awesome is that. Me and my family came to this hotel for our second time becuase the staff are so nice, the hotel is very beautiful. sure its at the end of the strip. But its worth it! Good luck Stratosphere Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for years”
Reviews.Author: diehardlionfan
Reviews.Content: We are regular Vegas travelers and have been for years. We stayed at the Stratosphere by accident once and have never stayed anywhere else since. If you want to waste money stay at the Bellagio but if you want a nice room, great po0ol deck, fabulous staff and a hotel that cares then the Start is for you. All at tremendous price points. We will be holding a reception at the Top of the World June 16th and the restaurant is an award wining experience that is enjoyed every time. People who dislike the Strat seem to be looking for reasons and no hotel is perfect all the time. Mistakes get made. I have stayed at most strip hotels and a few off strip like the Hard Rock. No hotel has done so much to show us they want and value our business. Another huge plus for Canadians. They have clamato juice at every bar in the hotel so they actually make a Ceasar.

Reviews.Title: “superstay”
Reviews.Author: cookie190817
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Sphere.All the staff were very friendly and helpful.Rooms clean and presentable. The food in the 24/7 cafe was very good and great value for money. Only downside is the location but with the bus it wasn't too difficult to get to the strip. On the whole a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - value for money - lovely new room!!”
Reviews.Author: Colesee
Reviews.Content: On honeymoon from NZ - we were immediately upgraded to a newly refurbished room on the top floor of the hotel - HUGE bed, and lovely new, clean bathroom. Dined a couple of times in the 1960's cafe (cant recall the name) - very good food, and great service. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from the top of the tower!”
Reviews.Author: Piccolognomo
Reviews.Content: The room was quite new, functional and really large (mine had 2 queen beds). The bathroom was simple, comfortable and clean. The shower's drain didn't work properly so I wrote a note to the cleaning lady in the morning asking her to check it and at the evening everithing was in working order!!! No views from my room (just a white wall ç____ç), but the one from the tower was really breathtaking (1,149 feet into the Vegas skyline)!!! And I didn't spend nothing to get there cause there was the tower admission included in the price of the room. Free parking but NOT free wi-fi in the hotel (if u have yr own laptop u can go to Starbucks Coffee in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Great can wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: wimmie23
Reviews.Content: Going back to the Stratosphere Monday the 30 of may for the 4 time every single time we have been we had a great time. No complains what so ever great staff rooms are big and very clean. Would recomend this hotel to all of my friends and family. Cant wait to stay for an other 10 days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire-Couple
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 2 nights whilst on honeymoon and it was a fantastic hotel. The hotel is at the end of the strip but it was only $7 for a 24 hour bus pass and i actually liked the fact it wasnt in the middle of all the rest of the hotels. The room was fantastic, we were on the 23rd floor so had a great view and we upgraded to get a jacuzzi bath. The receptionist was very helpful giving us maps and information about the place. We stayed in the hotel the first night and i for one took full advantage of the $20 all you can drink between 5-9 :O) We walked along the strip looking at the hotels and i can say i would definately stay here again, although all the hotels looked amazing i did like that it was quiet near our hotel. Overall a fantastic hotel and excellent service (and stronger than normal cocktails if you tip the waitresses (we tipped $2 each time for 2 drinks and they were very strong heehee) p.s i have only rated the location as 3/5 as i know most people would probably want to be in the middle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: savrbck
Reviews.Content: For all the trouble we had when first checking in, I thought the managers did an excellent job of making us happy. The first lady(susan) to check us in, wasn't very helpful! Wanted to put us in separated rooms, which we were going to take, then gave us a key to a completely different room. Way too business like and not friendly at all! I personally think, she cared more about getting you processed and out of her hair. After what took us over an hour of wasted time and going back to the long line, we were finally told we could upgrade and have adjoining rooms. Why didn't she suggest that in the first place, is my only question? Susan needs a new job!! So we had a package deal, but it didn't mean our trip was all about being cheap! I really did want to spend my evening with my husband. This was a special request before we arrived. Other than that, it was great!! Rooms were clean and neat! The rest of the staff wasgreat!! Would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst among popular hotels in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Stratosphere Las Vegas in April 2011 together with my father for 3 nights. I booked this hotel due to a great deal I found on their website. Initially, my first choice was the Luxor but I decided against it. Unfortunately, I regret my decision as the Stratoshere did not meet my expectations. First of all, location is not the best. We rented a car so this was not a huge problem, however I would have preferred to stay in walking distance from the main attractions. In addition, there are not many restaurants and shopping facilities nearby and the area looks shabby and unsafe. Especially if walking north of the hotel, there are lots of homeless and suspicious characters, some of them even spend their time in the casino. I was quite astonished that homeless people can enter the hotel premises without being noticed by security staff. Furthermore, front desk and casino area look worn if not even dirty and there is cigarette smoke everywhere. The pool is average, nothing special but not bad either. Nevertheless, I felt disturbed by the loud music which made it impossible to relax. This seems to be a problem in all hotels in Las Vegas, though. Apart from the tower which offers only mediocre views, there is nothing to do in the hotel. Restaurants and shops did not seem to be appealing to me, especially compared to the unique experience of Venetians’s Canal Grande or others. As a positive aspect I have to mention the room which was double the size of what I am used from Europe. Mattresses and beds are great and I could not hear a single sound from outside. Air condition worked well what was very important to me as windows cannot be opened. Also no bad criticism on staff, everyone I talked to was friendly and helpful. I will not stay there again if I return to Las Vegas in the future. The Stratosphere is not really worth its money, even if the rate is much lower than in comparable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere this time because i wanted to see the roller coaster on the roof and the rate was good. Well the roller coaster is closed...Doh! However the other roof top rides are something to see as is the bar and viewing deck on i think level 108. My roof was very nice (standard room i believe). The hotel is at the very end of the strip, but that may be a bonus for some. I had a car and parking was free, just tips, i liked that. The taxi ride to the other end of the strip cost about $18US. there is no restaraunt at this hotel, unless i missed it. I only found Starbucks Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “the stratasphere is great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kingyEngland
Reviews.Content: i had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for a week. 1st the ROOMS We found the rooms of an excellant size, comfortable, in a good condition with nothing on the sheets,no mould around the bath or stuff down the loo. we were on the 20th floor with a view of nothing much really, but who cares about the view and wants to sit looking out the window when your in vegas? 2ND POSITION/ TRANSPORT The hotel is aprox two thirds of the way down the strip, why this comes as a great surprize to anybody is beyond me with all the ways you can find info out about hotels. if you dont do your homework b4 you go dont blame the hotel for where its situated. the bus stop is aprox 20 yards from one of the side doors of the hotel. they r $7 for a 24hr pass. you may want to get the monorail which took me 15 mins to get to at the back of the sahara. $28 for a 3day pass. 3RD THE POOL the hotel has a large pool area with loads of sun beds (towels provided) but does get busy at the wkends. there is music being played all day and is quite loud at times but it didnt bother me. i was really surprized that there bar prices where not that bad compared to some hotels ive stayed at on the strip. 4TH FOOD The hotel like most has a buffet which is reasonably priced and is discounted to guests(25%) along with the roxys diner(10%) there is also an italian. there r a couple of fastfood joints upstairs. 5TH THINGS TO DO AT THE STRATASPHERE You can also go up the tower for free. There r 4 rides up there which r extra. if you are looking to do the new sky jump when up there, then dig deep in to those pockets cause its a $100. that dosnt include a photo thats extra.sorry stratasphere in my opinion this is not reasonably priced, $50 yes $100 NO there is a show called bite that is on most nights discounts available from the discount booths up and down the strip. 6TH GAMBLING pretty much what you would expect from a casino loads of tables and machines 7TH OVERALL this hotel in my opinion gives excellant value for money. yes it is a bit away from the centre of the strip, but the cost of a room out weighs this. you may read some bad reviews but when a hotel has thousands of rooms, there r going to be the odd problem. you only have to read the reviews of some of the more expensive hotels which all come with there own set of problems. so i would highly recommend this hotel. if anybody would like anymore info you can contact me through tripadviser if a member of stratasphere reads this i would like to make a couple of comments to you but cannot find an email address

Reviews.Title: “Best value stay in vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: phippo99
Reviews.Content: this was our 2nd trip to vegas and we werent disappointed. The Statosphere is located at the north end of the strip roughly a mile from the rest of the hotels which is just close enough to be near the action but far enough away to be out of the main crowds if you want to have some quieter times. The hotel itself has got all the ammenties you will need, clean rooms, comfy beds, in room safes etc. The casino floor has plenty for everyone to play plus there are different areas to eat, roxy's, hotel buffet, fellini's etc. We ate at Roxy's and tried the buffet and wouldnt have any complaints with either. The service we received was very good and all the staff we spoke to couldnt do enough for us. The pool on the 8th floor is nice, clean with plenty of space for catching the rays. We stayed in a new select room which was perfect for our needs. At the end of the day there are more glamorous hotels to stop at with bigger rooms right in the moddle of the strip etc but at the end of the day why spend £1000's to stop in your room and admire the size of your sofa in the corner...we prefer having the extra to spend in the shops or on the tables!!! All in all if your looking for a nice clean hotel with very good service/staff and a good price then the statosphere would be near the top of my choices...i look forward to going back soon!!!! (also check out the C bar between 5-9pm for happy hour, bottomless martinis, beer and margritas a great way to start the night!!) 10 out of 10 for me!

Reviews.Title: “loved it so much we are going back!”
Reviews.Author: msbizal
Reviews.Content: i read all the recent reviews and was a little scared about the location , but im so glad we stayed here. i liked it was not in the middle of the hustle and bustle...and was closer to fremont street! the room was awesome..20th floor view of the strip and mountains and the people jumping from the tower....it was awesome..comfy beds....friendly staff...and roxys diner is amazing! the only thing i didnt enjoy was the pool closed at 6pm , i thought that was a bit early......we are coming back soon and bringing friends with us!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Stratosphere!”
Reviews.Author: LadyLestat
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here and I love it more and more each time. Check in was quick and easy. Booked a Stratoshere Select (well worth it if you're staying there for more then 3 days). At time of booking, I was told i'd get a king bed, but at check in they only had 2 queens available. No problem, I had them put a note to switch me as soon as one became available, and next morning, there was, on the same floor. They even had a worker deliver me the keys instead of going back downstairs. New room was clean and huge. Lounging by the pool was awesome. Wish they were opened past 6pm though. Try the strawberry lemonade at Roxy's. The Buffet is delicious. Well worth the price. Went there for brunch and dinner during the stay. Just stay away from IHOP's up the street. That place is bloody disgusting. Filthy! People beside us had to send back their food and my friend I met there had a hair on the plate and sent it back as well. Overall, I had an awesome time and will continue to stay at this resort (stayed at other hotels on the strip and was not impressed). It's away from the strip, which is nice at night to wind down. People are friendly and I'm glad I met such wonderful people. I really don't understand why people are so negative about this place. Great clean rooms and good value. Relax and enjoy Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced horrid service”
Reviews.Author: Psyren
Reviews.Content: We did not get the size or quality of room we paid for..Strip View..we were given..roof/vent view. Front desk staff were less than friendly..quite rude on three separate contacts. The diner food was below average terrible service, but the dining choices are very slim, so we tried the tower shops. There are three choices in the Tower McDonalds is one of them..the food at the pizzaria was horrific and pricey. We had free entrance to the tower which was perpetually closed off for weddings. NOT A GOOD OPTION KIDS EITHER. You are isolated at the north end of the strip and have to walk quite a ways to get to the tram. Unless you want to bungie or do the thril rides all day..there is really no other entertainment. The casino is okay...but hospitality is not a priority at the Strat. I had heard great things about the Strat...but wow were they misleading. Really need to go again and stay at a better hotel to enjoy Vegas the way it is suppose to be enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Ill never stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon01247
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 night recently, and it was not a pleasent stay. First, the rooms, not anything like the pictures. I had blood on my blanket, which I called housekeeping about, got a machine. Left a message and no one called back. Second, I had what looked to be the after math of the buffet left in my toilet, smelled great! Thanks a bunch, NOT! Not to mention the cracked and moldy caulk in the shower.. Lets talk about the service now.. The lady at the desk that checked me in was great, but other then that... awful! Whats the deal with the stairs? You dont like people to use them? Cause I waited for a evevator for an hour, while the asian tours used the elevators. Mind you, they have 6 evevators! When I asked 3 staff people about the stairs, they told me I had to wait. So now Im late to check in for my flight. I got to the desk and they will have no problem printing out my boarding passes, for 9 dollars!!! I was very excited to stay here, and I come to vegas every year. It really looked nice and sounded great. I will never ever even consider staying here again. I will also be telling my friends and family to stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is wonderful !!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasparty12
Reviews.Content: They did a great job on renovating the place! It looks great! People say its far off the strip. But its not that far from the bus. And the bus takes you to the center of the strip for like $7 for 24 hours so its all good. The new Select rooms are big and nice. Wonderful and nice staff. Great view from the tower. It has a mall. Nice casino, The lights in the casino change colors so i thought that was Awesume. Guests get to go on the tower for free. Overall its great for its price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - clean huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2FoxTravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two children (ages 23 & 19). We loved it, the rooms were huge with good sized bathroom. A minor problem on booking in where they had given my son and daughter a king room was quickly sorted. Staff were very helpful. Views from the tower magnificent. The only down side is that it's not in the heart of the strip. But we preferred this as we could chill out without the madness of the strip. Bus routes nearby were easy to use. Las Vegas was great, loud and mad. My daughter being only 19 wasn't too much of a problem, they are very strict on ID and made her stand away from the bar (which we found amusing), but apart from that there's loads to do for under 21's. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep I've had at a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sgygi
Reviews.Content: This was the quickest check-in I've had at a hotel in Las Vegas. The room was extremley nice for price, great value. The beds we really comfortable for a hotel. The overall stay was a pleasant surprise for a hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “good price and quality”
Reviews.Author: george2455
Reviews.Content: recent trip choose the stratosphere as i was on a budget from arrival found the service and quality to be of a high standard check in was quick and easy had a large room with two queen beds, much more than i needed. good size bathroom. the rooms are not the most contemporary but suited me just fine large pool area with plenty of space had a great view of the city from bedroom window not at the centre of vegas i know but easy to stroll up the boulevard and if you wanted transport plenty of cheap taxis the view for the main tower is fantastic and the rides are scary even to watch the upper level in the large tower could do with a revamp was worried that travelling on my own i might not enjoy vegas so much as i was not there to gamble but to take in the sights. found people friendly and was always managed to engage with others in conversation overall a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Brian182
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere with my wife over Easter weekend. We booked the Oasis Suite, which was great!
