The bathroom is HUGE, with a shower for 2, whirlpool tub and his/her dual sinks. I opted for the slightly more expensive Stip View room, which really wasn't necessary. You'll spend virtually no time gazing out your window, so don't bother with this upgrade. We arrived around 8am and our room wasn't ready yet, but the hotel held our bags, and promptly delivered them as soon as our room was available. The C Bar was a great people watching spot, and the drinks were VERY cheap, considering this is Vegas! You get free admission to the top of the tower if your a hotel guest, and this is a MUST! Incredible view day or night. Try the Jet Fuel drink at the AirBar, you won't regret it ;) Stratosphere is a little bit down the strip from other major hotels, but this actually proved to be better for us. At 2am, we liked that this hotel was away from the hustle and bustle, and more relaxed. Great hotel, great service, great value!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Guilford_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about the hotel is that it's adequate. The shower was hot, the bed was comfortable and the up-front rate was cheap. IMPORTANT NOTE: In room wfi is billed daily PER DEVICE. At check-in we were just told that it was a daily rate, however, since I had two devices (laptop and iPad) that charge was doubled. Not a bank breaker monetarily, but I hate surprise charges. Housekeeping was poor to mediocre. Upon check-in, the bathroom sink was black with residue from the last guest's hair dye. When the room was "made up" the sheets were not always changed and one time the dirty linens were left on the floor. As for the casino, it's dark and lacks the energy of the casinos further down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: inseglet
Reviews.Content: the room is huge, I was travelling alone and had two king size beds all for myself ! Very comfy beds by the way. The only downside is its location... right at the end of the Strip (Vegas main street), which means, far from the main touristic spots... The surrounding is a bit dead, not much going on. There's no Free internet either, and a small fridge would definitely come in handy too. But the view from the top is nice and it's cheap...

Reviews.Title: “At the far end of the strip, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeetagain2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 'select' room which was good, and as expected. We paid on average about $50 per night which seems very cheap. There is no free wifi, or coffee machine or fridge within the room. The stratosphere is at the far northern end of the strip and not at all close to anything - we did not expect it to be so far north. Although the Deuce bus serves the hotel, it would have been nice to walk to all the action on the Strip. There are a few shady characters in the location and did not want to walk at night. The facilities in the hotel were fairly unattractive and it was necessary to get on the bus and go down the strip to find coffee, wifi and food . Simply due to the distance from the main part of the strip I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Fuchsinn
Reviews.Content: We booked Delux Premier View room with dinner buffet package but in we got standard room with view to garage for the same price. Dinner was not included into the price. We have to pay additionally. So, site pictures and add do not match with reality. There are a lot of other places in Vegas to stay with better comfort. But everybody should experience the rides at Tower!

Reviews.Title: “It felt like we're punished by booking with Travelocity”
Reviews.Author: LucasGremista
Reviews.Content: We were a little confused and undecided about which hotel to choose in this first stay in Vegas, I got married last November and this was our honeymoon and was hoping to have the best time and the best hotel possible within our budget. There was the stratosphere, the Luxor and the Circus Circus, all around the same price, we ended up choosing the stratosphere because I really wanted to enjoy the tower view and amenities. So we checked in and asked for a king, NON-SMOKING room, and when we got to the room, it had probably one of the strongest smoking odors I've ever felt, I have rhinitis and my nose doesn't work that well, so, if a smell bothers me, it's because it's REALLY BAD. I don't like to complain, I work in the hotel business and I know that sometimes it's really had to deal with people requesting and complaining about stuff. But in this case we had to ask to change the room because it was a whole week there, so we changed and the other room was at the same floor, and a liiitle bit less worse than our first room, but I thought we just had to suck it up and keep it. I was a tough week sleeping, candles helped a lot otherwise it would be impossible. In one of our last days there, we decided to go and check the pool, and it's quite far from "Travelocity people", you have to go down the "Tour" elevators, walk through the cassino and take the "central" elevators, and a looong walk from there. BUT in this case it was a good walk cause we saw how we we're treated, they gave us a TOTALLY different hotel, this "central" area it's like the hotel we were waiting for, nice hallways, clean and renovated rooms, I felt like I was in another hotel, we felt they mistreated us because we booked travelocity, they gave us the old, stinky stratosphere. and the LOCATION is the worst possible if you are trying to enjoy the Vegas Strip, it's the very first hotel at the north of the strip and the surroundings are not pleasant, to say the least, you have to walk about 1 hour to reach the heart of the strip, if it wasn't for the bus, it would be terrible. We mostly only had contact with the front desk staff and the tower staff, including a nice gentleman at the elevator, and they were all TOP NOTCH, it's not their fault that we got such an old and stinky hotel, we're definitely not staying there anymore. We should have gone to the Luxor, or even Circus Circus. HINT: When purchasing tickets for shows, buy them at a place called HALF PRICE TICKETS, it's the way to go, if you buy at the venue, or with your hotel concierge you will pay twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxed stay!”
Reviews.Author: Baby-Dragonfly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for 3 nights in April, 2011. We booked it for the excellent price and didn't mind the location that was a bit away from the centre even though still on the strip as we had a car and were not planning to walk too much anyway. We arrived at the hotel at around 1am and were quite tired - the check in was fast and without any problems, staff greeted us with a sincere smile and upgraded us to one of the newly refurbished rooms. That was a great bonus as it was our wedding that we came to Las Vegas for. The room was very spacious and clean, beds huge and comfy, all the necessities like shampoo and hair dryer in the bathroom. The noise in the hall 24hrs was the only downside but it is Vegas - the city never sleeps - that was to be expected. Overall, a very nice and comfortable stay; would recommend it to anyone travelling with a car.

Reviews.Title: “A lifesaver”
Reviews.Author: smonroe13
Reviews.Content: We arrived a night early than anticipated and couldn't find a room anywhere. Finally at the end of the strip we went to the stratosphere. They found us a very nice quiet room and offered to extend my stay for free because I checked in so late. My room was very clean comfy and wish I could have spent more time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean rooms... Dark casino..”
Reviews.Author: NYC-DR-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and upgraded to a newly renovated room for a small fee. Room was very clean and nice, a positive side about this hotel is that there isn't so many people walking around as the hotels closer the strip. If you have a car and you're planning to do activities this location would work perfect for you as is very easy to get in and out of the strip and they have a Starbucks conveniently located on the ground floor to grab something before getting out in the morning. If you're planning on gambling this is NOT the place for you. The casino looks depressed and dark, I wouldn't spend my money here.

Reviews.Title: “Sure shot for Gaming Freaks - Really Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Mehrishi
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent experience as per the services & location of the hotel. It is located in the heart of city. Rooms are average & nice ones. Star Hotel and really a good option for Gamblers. The connectivity is really good with the local transport system as you get all the facilities right at the door steps. You also have all the major tour operators pickup facility at this hotel. HUGE Casino & night life around this hotel. Walk away dsitance from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel / Great Staff/ Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: WeLuvVegas
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas 3 or more times a year and have stayed at quite a few of strip hotels, but definatly prefer the friendliness of the Strat...We stayed 4 nights and had an excellent time. The staff was very sweet. We upgraded to the new select room and were pleasantly surprised at how nice they were. The beds very comfortable and the housekeeping staff was very patient with our schedule - sometimes not getting to clean the room until well after 3PM.. The location of the hotel is at the far end of the strip, but the bus stops right in front of the hotel and you can get a 24hr pass for $7 so not a big deal. We will be coming back in the fall. Hint#1: You can get a killer Mudslide at the poolside bar! Hint#2:If you like slots :) Use your players card -nice comps.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jantaff
Reviews.Content: what a holliday, spent a week in vegas and wish it could have been longer. the flight was long but again worth the effort. the stratoshere hotel is awsome to look at and check in was hassle free with the staff being very friendly and polite. the first thing you notice is the meca for gambling (obvious i know) but even i didnt realise how much there was. the rooms are clean and comfy and i was lucky enough to have nieghbors who respected others sleep. cleaners did a good job and the room always looked like i had just checked in. the tower is well worth a look (free if you stay in the hotel) and the views over vegas were brill. the hotel does a buffet which is good value for money (25% off with your loyalty card (free to hotel guests) so it cost around 15 dollars. getting around vegas is best done on the bus (7 dollars for 24 hours) they are frequent and quick and the bus does the strip and down town. the strip speaks for itself, showy and full of live. i liked all the free shows put on and there is so much to see wierd and wonderfull things. the trip was made by a visit to fremont street, a must in my opinion as the big screen and music show is amazing (check it out on youtube) the evening flew by when i visited there. would i go to vegas again YES YES and a definate YES

Reviews.Title: “You can still get the total Vegas experience here.”
Reviews.Author: willisg71
Reviews.Content: I had read several reviews of this hotel/casino before staying here and as far as any negatives, I guess I just don't see the major issues that people had problems with. Yes, it is far away from the rest of the strip, but the Deuce bus comes right to the hotel. That's a $7 per day fare that will take you wherever you want to go. The monorail is just behind the Sahara, about 3/4 of a mile away. That is $5 per ride. Cabs can take you wherever you want to go for less than $20. If you can't afford to pay those prices, why are you in Vegas in the first place? As far as the "bad neighborhood", well I wouldn't venture off of Las Vegas Boulevard, but as long as you stay in the well lit area between the Stratosphere and the Sahara, you will be fine. And if you didn't want to leave this hotel at all, you would make out great as well. Plenty of gaming, bars, restaurants and general entertainment. If you want to party with Kim Kardashian or Britney Spears, well, yes, stay at the MGM Grand or somewhere else down the strip. It isn't really that kind of "hip" party hotel, but for 35+ older, this is probably your style. The only drawback is the wireless internet issue. I like to keep track of work when I'm on vacation, but it was a hassle to get my laptop hooked up, not to mention the $12 per day. I just avoided it in the end, I was on vacation after all. Probably not the best place on the "strip", but it met all of our needs quite well. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Believe Anyone Wouldn't Love The Strat!!!”
Reviews.Author: kittenkiss
Reviews.Content: We just got home from staying at the Strat for 6 nights and loved it. It has everything the larger casinos have, just on a smaller scale. It was clean and the customer service throughout the hotel and casino was excellent. We ate at several places within the Strat and we never got a bad meal. The buffet was delicious and reasonably priced. (Compared to the buffet at the Mirage, which was disgusting and overpriced.) Played a tournament in the Poker Room and it was very well organized. We never had a problem getting a drink while gambling and we gambled a lot. The pool was nice, (not crazy great), but great service, good music and lots of places to relax. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. The Bartenders at the 107 lounge made me feel like I was a "High Roller" even though at the time I was only dressed in jeans. The Big Shot was a thrill, and a bargain at $13. We never once waited for an elevator and the valet was quick and always ready to give us directions. We drank at three different Bars and all gave good service, even at 5 a.m. when we were just getting back from Fremont Street. We had five couples that stayed at the Strat and they all loved it. I've only been home for 3 days and i've already recieved comps in the mail.... What's not to love....

Reviews.Title: “perfect for purpose”
Reviews.Author: michael30Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic but it has everything that you could want, the pool is fine, the rooms are clean and it has a McDonalds upstairs!! It isn't too far from the strip to travel in everyday, a cheap cab ride or a long walk, just dont get the deuce bus service it is a bit of a joke and a hazzard as they pile people onto the bus until you cant breathe! Vegas is just amazing and most of the time is spent looking around at the other hotels that are the major attraction of Vegas so I wouldn't worry too much about the rooms not being as glam as others. we stayed in the venetian at the start of the trip and i was v happy to stay there for 6 nights on our return to Vegas and we will stay in the Stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: trevar
Reviews.Content: We ended a three week visit to the US with three nights in Las Vegas, and the Stratosphere was a pretty reasonable place for us to stay. We paid a little extra for one of the upgraded rooms, and although we don't know what the old rooms were like, we were reasonably happy with it. Though quite small, it was nicely renovated and mostly comfortable. Like most of the hotels we stayed in in the USA the beds were really high and that was kind of awkward; they're really just a little to high to comfortably sit on them to put your shoes on! The most frustrating part was the pillows, though; they were extremely thin, and the filling split as soon as I put my head on it, so I may as well have not had one at all. I did ring housekeeping to ask for a better one, and they said that they only have thin pillows, so I should use two (really, having the filling from two pillows up beside my head is no better than having the filling from one there, so I gave up pretty quick and used spare clothes to prop my head up). The other frustration was the constant noise from some enormous fans (airconditioning units? coolrooms?) just below our window. Not particularly loud, but after the noise of the casinos the last thing you want is more noise, so it was rather frustrating. The lack of a fridge in the room didn't help either. The shopping level of this hotel is in decline, with quite a few empty shops and a rather tired look to the place. The Mexican restaurant, though, is fantastic and well worth a stop. The hotel isn't a long way from the strip, but after a night of wandering the casinos on the Strip you will probably want to take a taxi back. The public transport options in Vegas are extremely expensive, and we found that a taxi from the Strip to the Stratosphere was only a couple of dollars more than the bus or monorail, so we didn't use the bus at all. One advantage of being at the Stratosphere though was being able to drive to it and away from it with a minimum of fuss. We didn't at at the Stratosphere's buffet, mainly because I found the advertising a little deceptive. They promote a 10% off arrangement, but it turned out that it was only for one member of the party, and it was still quite expensive, so we went elsewhere. Circus Circus had a great buffet at a much better price, and there's a Denny's right next door. Overall, I'd say Stratosphere is a great option if you're on a tight budget AND get a good deal. Otherwise, you can get a better room closer to the centre of the action, or a cheaper room just a little farther out.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, nice rooms, but taxi to the strip at night”
Reviews.Author: agrado425
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas to see Cher during her last weekend of shows. I'm not a huge fan of Vegas so I wasn't very excited about staying here for the weekend. However the Stratosphere was the perfect hotel for our stay. I went with 2 friends and we got a Suite room for very cheap. I didn't feel crowded at all. I wouldn't stay there for the night to gamble and it's in a not so great neighborhood so at night, I would take a taxi down to the main strip. So if you need to a place to stay and are going to Vegas for a show, the stratosphere is great. If you're looking for a place that you won't have to leave at all, I would splurge and go somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: pacificwest6
Reviews.Content: If youre unsure about staying here - dont be! I stayed for threre nights in March 2011 and it far exceeded my expectations. I did have one of the new upgraded rooms which was spotlessly clean and comfortable. Flat screen HD tv (Bellagio still has old style tvs!) The staff were all helpful and the parking garage gives easy access into the casino. Great Starbucks with genuinely friendly happy staff! I cant understand the negative reviews on here.....it is not the Wynne, but does offer the best bang for your buck on the Strip. The room rate was great and included access to the tower which is usually $14. Id stay here again in a heartbeat. It is at the far end of the strip but with a car absolutely no problem and there are also plenty of buses and it is ok to walk I saw lots of people walking into the strip. No problem with homeless as some people seem to suggest. Dont be put off by the negative comments - this has to be the best value for money hotel on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: EvaSmith12345
Reviews.Content: I had a vacation for my honeymoon. wanted to have a good time....i checked in late at night Cool stuff , clerk name Adriana accomodate me with a cool upgrade to a beautiful suite, she explained everything for us to do while we were there for the week!!!.she was funny and we were so tired but it was worth it... keep it up with Stratosphere with staff like that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: dhoag123
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son and I really liked this hotel and will stay there again next time we're in Vegas. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was friendly. The tower was fun. It's easy to get to the Strip from this hotel - just a 10-15 minute drive. There's a small mall selling inexpensive stuff - clothes, food, souveniers, other stuff - that's attached to the hotel. It was kind of "cheesy" but liked it because we could actually afford to buy things - unlike the 'high-end-malls (e.g. The Forum Shops or the shops at The Venetian) where you can pay $200 for a simple shirt. I mean really... who buys that stuff at The Forum Shops? Other super-fun things we've done in Vegas: * Indoor go-cart racing at Pole Position Raceway - awesome * Pinball Hall of Fame! * Indoor skydiving * Machine gun rental at The Gun Store * Amusement Park at Circus Circus

Reviews.Title: “Stay Far Away. You think you are saving money coming here, all you are doing is setting yourself up for a bad trip.”
Reviews.Author: Will_in_Austin
Reviews.Content: It is hard to know where to start: 1) The bartenders at the Casino bar were very rude all three days I was there. I mean beyond one guy having a bad day rude. I mean all of them all of the time. Rude to me, my wife and everyone else. You figure if you pay $12 a drink and tip these people might be nice to you or even just not be rude. 2) When we checked in the person who checked us in was super nice (Regina I think), and it went downhill from there. We had an incredible view of a PARKING GARAGE. I dont stay in the stratosphere to check out a parking garage all week. 3) The carpet in the rooms was disgusting and the rooms were just a tiny level above your common Howard Johnson 4) Not once while I gambled was I offered a drink. This is just common casino courtesy. This was a big issue with me. If I am spending money in your casino and staying there, at least offer me a drink while I gamble. 5) I was woken up every day at around 9am by the sound of jet engine vaccum cleaners. THIS IS VEGAS people. We stay out till 4 and sleep until noon. This alone would keep me from ever coming back. 6) The food options go from expensive to unreal pricey here. You figure being so far from the main strip of hotel you would offer something to entice people in. A cheap buffet, a gamblers special, cheap drinks. But none of those was available at all. Way better and cheaper drink and food options in the REAL strip. 7) There was no coffee maker in the room 8) The "air conditioner" in our room barely put out air. It was steaming in our room all weekend 9) The INFO desk people were no help ever and almost as rude as the casino bar bartenders 10) The pool was cool though. Even though drinks are $11 a piece, at least the pool was nice and clean and enjoyable 11) Needs much better ventilation in the casino. It smells like pee and cigarettes in there. Compared to stratosphere the bellagio was purified air. 12) Get ready to spend $15 each way on a cab,because this place is FAR away from the main hotels. Beyond walking distance. About 3 miles from Bellagio. If you want to have fun in a cool casino it will cost you $30 round trip on cabs. 14) The casino bar is a huge miss. They really need to clean it up and do something cool with it, replace the bartenders, offer more specials and they will have people meeting there and partying there hardcore. If these things had been like that when we were there we would have stayed at the hotel and spent all our money on drinks there. But it was a miserable experience even being at the bar, so we left. 15) Overall the hotel was sub par and the service was horrible. I was counting the minutes until I could leave the stratosphere. When I walked into the HARD ROCK Hotel I didnt want to leave and come back to the stratosphere (they are worlds apart). Worst hotel stay I have ever had and certainly not a place I would recommend to anyone. BIG IMPROVEMENTS needed. I could provide you a huge list of detailed fixes that would make this place enjoyable at least. Overall DIRTY AND OVERPRICED is the way I would describe my entire stay here. Spend the money and stay at the Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn or Caesars.

Reviews.Title: “If you want money for other vegas activities, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny530Penny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and had a blast both times. Yes, taking a cab or the Monorail to other parts of the Strip is a reality, but thats how it goes. You get to go up to the top of the Stratosphere for free as a guest. The pool is fun and welcoming. Plenty of places to lay out and friendly pool side service with a great mix of music blasted through the speakers. This place is not as glamorous as some of the new hipster casinos, and thats why I like it. I can be myself and save money for other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Was cheap and average”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked it because it was cheaper than other places. Rooms were ok but bit annoyed you had to pay for the internet. We also logged on both our devices and it charged us twice without warning us. The hotels right at the end of the strip, not the best location but there is a bus you can get to the other end. Overall it's average but good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, value for money, clean, comfy beds but a pain to get to the strip”
Reviews.Author: livesinnasuitcase
Reviews.Content: Now if you want to not be right there at the Strip, the Stratosphere is not a bad option. Value for money if you don't go at peak season. To be fair the inside does indeed look a bit like a cheap mall, but hey: it's Vegas! The room we stayed in was excellent! Comfy bed and a fabulous view over the strip! It looked spotless and nice. The choice of restaurants, cafes etc is also not bad, bearing in mind the location and the price you're paying. The Strip is not within walking distance which makes it all a bit of a pain if you want to go see a show or hop into the nightlife, since the Stratosphere has not really that much to offer... Make sure to book the restaurant on the top MONTHS in advance as they have a waiting list as long as a giant's arm.

Reviews.Title: “We experienced some disapointment”
Reviews.Author: junertwo
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Stratosphere before with little or no complaints. We found and still do find the rooms be be clean, roomy and adequate, and the staff helpful and courteous so no problems there. We were so disappointed that the show "American Superstars" had been cancelled without notice, even though it was still being advertised in the hotel. It was replaced with a show called "Bite" about sexy vampires I gathered. We were traveling with a young teenager and found that such a show was not suitable. We were also very disappointed that you have discontinued the singing staff in Roxy's Diner. Both the g rated show American superstars and the diner were the main reason that we stayed there to begin with. Your whole hotel seems to be geared for families with children and teens, and we were dismayed that there seemed to be nothing, other than the top floor rides for them. I saw many families with young children and teenagers. The several families that I spoke with expressed the same complaints. I do understand that equipment breaks down every once in a while, but the elevators situation was ridiculous. One elevator was out of service the entire stay and since one elevator was reserved for the top floor, that left 3 elevators to serve all rooms. Sometimes the wait was extremely long and after a long exhausting day, it was very frustrating to be jammed into an over crowded elevator. My last and final complaint was the lack of a coffee pot. COME ON even the cheapest motel offers a coffee pot. Next time we will stay a little closer in on the strip. If someone is looking for a good priced hotel with clean rooms and all the things I mentioned doesn't matter , then I could recommend this hotel but because it didn't serve us well I am marking this as don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - far surpassed my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: lovinlasvegas7
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Stratosphere. In fact, I don't even think I'd ever been inside the casino before. To be honest, I only booked this hotel because I couldn't afford the more (slightly) upscale one I usually stay at. I was a bit apprehensive when booking this, but decided to go with an open mind and see what I thought. I am really glad I did. I was very pleasantly suprised with the Stratosphere. To start with, check-in was very quick and the woman at the front desk even upgraded us to a room with a fridge, which was much appreciated. Our room was set up like a little mini suite, had a nice view of the mountains, and was very clean. We decided to check out the buffet the next day and were very happy with that as well. Not only did we get 25% off for joining/being a member of the players club, but the variety and quality of food was great! We also ordered room service several times and were happy with that, as well. As far as the casino goes, the slot machines seemed to be well organized and it was very easy for me to find my penny slots that I love so much. I even came back home with a few bucks! On our last night there, my husband and I went to see their show "Bite." We got 2-for-1 tickets since we were guests of the hotel. Let me tell you, this show was worth every penny we paid for it and more. There was awesome music, talented dancers, singers, and even people flying through the air. I spent one day at the pool and was impressed with that, also. It's pretty large and is located on the 8th floor, so there is a nice view of the strip. I should also mention that each and every single one of the employees I encountered at the Stratosphere were very friendly and helpful. I can't wait to go back; this is my new favorite hotel!

Reviews.Title: “dont listen to all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: hayley499
Reviews.Content: im writing this because i stay at this hotel twice a year and this hotel seems to be getting some bad press. frist of all the rooms are clean an a good size. beds are comfy house keeping are good iv never had any probs. checking has never taken more than 20 mins. people bang on about the loacation of this hotel. if you want to stay in the middle of the strip you will have to pay a lot more the stat tower dosent say it located center strip so people stop with the crying about the location. all in all this hotel has a few probs but what hotel dosent i will be returning in may and am looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the Price”
Reviews.Author: brandice81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the stratosphere because it was the cheaper of the hotels on the strip and now I know why. The hotel was nice but not great, it felt very outdated in some parts. The room was nice and spacious but our view was of a Carl's Junior restaurant and worn down apartments, the only entertaining thing about the view was we could see the bungee jumpers falling past our window every so often which was funny. I was disappointed by the pool hours (only open till 6pm) and the house cleaning only came once during our 5 day stay so everyday we had to call for towels. Room service was disappointing because they don't bill to the room you have to pay in cash which I have never had to do before and I thought that was odd. For those of us that need internet, its about 12 dollars per day and if you used your debit card when you check in (which I did) they take $150 from it and hold it until you check out but if you use a credit card they will only charge you by the day, which again is something I have not experienced at any other hotel before. Although we booked our flight and hotel together online we still had to pay a $7.50 per day resort fee even if you have no plans on using the pool, fitness room etc but it does get you free access to the tower observation deck which is normally $16 per person. The mall was fun to walk around in although I will say STAY AWAY FROM THE HENNA TATTOO BOOTH, I asked the woman working how much a small tattoo on my wrist would cost and she drew it on me with the henna ink and tried to charge me $60, STAY AWAY FROM THAT PLACE they will try to rip you off! I would suggest if you do stay here, since its so far away from the strip pay for the all day bus pass,the bus is called The Deuce and its $7 per person and is good for 24 hours, the bus stop is right in front of the hotel and it will take you up and down the strip all night (and its air conditioned!) Other than the few things I mentioned the stay was good, it was quiet at night so we were able to get sleep and the beds weren't to uncomfortable, so if your looking for somewhere cheap to stay and off the strip this might be a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “room was clean, but hotel itself was horrible....like inside the very cheap mall”
Reviews.Author: irchar
Reviews.Content: stay at the updated room only!!!..... room was simple but clean and nice, we didn't have th ebest view but 24th floor view just can't be bad once you can see mountains :)..... however hotel it self is far from the main strip ride on the bus can be anywhere from 20 to---90min...depending on the trafic and the driver.... very simple dinner th eonly place that open late to eat, it is ok to smoke in the hotel casino, people smoke everywhere but once you step into the lobby it simply stinks... I guess the ventilation systme needs to clean up....2nd floor that has the mall simply puts you into a depression mood...durty and horrible place, like you are in some god forgotten place....in the regular mall....no sense of Vegas or anything at all..... so we didn't use the hotel for anything but sleep.... if you are ok then room value is there

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is the worst!”
Reviews.Author: simplye73
Reviews.Content: The check in process was the only thing good about this stay. The room was decent but our tub once filled would not let the water out (clogged). I called housekeeping who said they would send someone up. We went out, returned and someone had come in plunged the tub, left a dirty ring around the tub and shoe marks on the floor towel. I was left to wash out the tub with the complimentary shampoo. Housekeeping never came to our room during our 2 night stay despite calling to which they replied "oh, are you ready" . I didn't know you had to be ready to have your room cleaned these days. Even after placing the call to housekeeping no one ever came to clean, make the beds or empty the waste baskets. The hotel is way to far off the strip and despite the advertisement for a "strip view", we were notified that there is no strip view. I will not only not return to this hotel but I will not recommend it to anyone. I was overall disappointment with the Stratosphere during my visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The bus is cheap, convenient, and 24 hours!!”
Reviews.Author: playingtheange1
Reviews.Content: My mother I and went to the Stratosphere in mid-December 2010 for my birthday. Neither of us had ever been to Vegas (or even the West Coast!), so we really had no idea what to expect. Before we left, we told all of our friends and family that we were staying at the Stratosphere. Several of them told us the same thing: get a car. Now, I normally do rent cars on vacation, as does my mother. But we decided not to on this trip because everything we wanted to see was all on the strip. And boy, I am SO glad that we didn't rent that car! First off, although the Stratosphere is close to the Downtown line, it's still on the strip (and an alright part, I may add!). We used the bus while we were there, and talk about a good deal! Unlimited trips for around $7 a day, and it ran 24 hours- even during off-season! Another good thing about the bus is that it was all tourists, so I felt safe (even during the midnight rides). The only time I encountered locals on the bus is when I had to go off-strip to go see a doctor, but there still wasn't anything that bad about it. Also, the bus stop is right in front of the hotel (across from a Carl's Jr., which is cool, because we had never seen one before!) But anyways, back to the hotel. The check-in line was a bit long, but it went by fairly quick. Now there was one HUGE problem that happened right after we checked in. When my mother and I took the elevator up to our floor, we walked in the direction where the arrows on the sign were pointing towards our room number. We walked, and walked, and walked. Finally, a young Australian lady told us that the sign arrows were pointing in the wrong direction! Now, this was obviously a printed mistake. But since my mother and I had just experienced a long flight, and we were having to carry our own non-rollable baggage, we took it as more of a sick joke. 2 words, Stratosphere: NOT FUNNY. Anyways, we got to our room, and that was fine. You could tell it had been re-done, as had all of the other rooms in the hotel. And I just want to point out that I did alot of researching online before I booked this hotel, and all of the other strip hotels within the same price range did NOT have remodeled rooms. In fact, they looked rather tasteless, plain, and shabby. *COUGH*excalibur*COUGHCOUGH* Sahara, Circus Circus. But the fact that it was remodeled made the room a good deal all by itself. Now, the tv was flat screen, but it was nowhere near as crisp and clear as my tv's at home (and one of them is 9 years old, and not even flat!) On the other hand, it wasn't THAT bad, and who has time to watch tv when they're in Vegas? And when it came to the bathroom, it was small, but it was okay. Again, who has time to potty when they're in Vegas? Hahaha. But anyways, we didn't take in any shows at the hotel, but we did gamble a little. One good thing about the casino is that they had very cheap minimums on most of their blackjack tables. Also, they had plenty of penny and nickle slots. I didn't consider the casino to be bad in the looks department, but it wasn't really all that spectacular, either. One thing that we did take advantage of was the mall area right above it. It was really cool to be able to wake up at God knows what time and eat a cinnamon pretzel from the Auntie Anne's. But my favorite thing about the mall was the fact that they had a Mcdonald's RIGHT next to a Fat Tuesday's mixed drink booth!! There's nothing better than getting drunk while eating a 4-piece Mcnugget at the same time. Now, the tower was OK. The line wasn't too bad. Be careful, though: they try to scam you into getting your picture taken right before they send you on the elevator. Of course, the view from the top ended up being amazing, both day and night (I suggest you go up there both times). The only thrill ride I took advantage of was that coaster thing that tips off the side of the building, on account of the fact that the wind was blowing too hard for me to ride that awesome round-and-round ride. Also, the one negative thing about the tower (and the hotel in general) is that there is no real nightclub. They did have a bar with a DJ right outside of the viewing area, but it wasn't a nightclub. It was more of a place to get overpriced drinks, and drunkenly dance around. There was like, no space at all for that. Aside from everything previously mentioned, we didn't do much else at the hotel. We partied at Tao at the Venetian and Lavo at the Palazzo. We saw a show at the Monte Carlo. We took in the Miracle Mile Shops, Madame Tussauds, the Forum at Caesars ( a MUST), and of course Margaritaville. Another thing we did was look at a lot of the other casinos and hotels just because we were curious. Oh, and we went downtown. It was an OK place to visit for a bit, but due to the vast amounts of schizophrenic homeless people, filthy casinos, and shadiness in general, I don't think we're going to take it in on our next trip. Fair warning about those Vegas homeless people: most of them really are psychotic. Literally. I think mental illness combined with substance abuse has gotten the best of them. And they ALL ask you for money, not just some of them. And they shake like a leaf. On top of that, some of them were missing eyeballs and limbs. =/ (I'm just warning you, that's all). Anyhow, we did have a good time in Vegas. Would I stay at the Strastosphere again?? If I was on a budget, absolutely. But if I had more cash to throw around for a room?? Probably not. Still, though, it's great for the money, and that cheap bus takes you anywhere in little time. But there's 1 more thing I want to mention, and that's that I did have to deal with the Stratosphere for a bit after I got home on account of the fact that I lost a personal check and a sweatshirt. The guy on the phone was very rude and sarcastic, and you could tell that he absolutely hated his job and his life. So if you do stay there, try to keep track of your stuff so you don't have to talk to this jerk.

Reviews.Title: “OK if on a tight budget.”
Reviews.Author: BERNIE2009
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere at Las Vegas is at the northern part of the Strip but very far from the heart of it. There are plenty of hotels one or two blocks out of the Strip and those are much closer to the heart of it compared with the Stratosphere. Once you visit the other hotels you realized that the Stratosphere lacks of luxury and plenty of details that make a guest feel comfortable at Vegas It is a must to get a car since as mentioned before, it is very far away. Bottom line, it is an OK Hotel just to sleep in but would definitively spend an extra $ 25 per day and stay at the Excalibur, Luxor, Montecarlo or similars. If you want to spent $ 50 more per day, you also find way better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great location and spotless with the most comortable beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: alexis8166
Reviews.Content: Visiting Vegas for the first time everyone said the Stratosphere was too away from the strip. How wrong they were, all the buses stop outside and run every ten minutes and is cheap. The newly refurnished room I stayed in was immaculate, spotlessly clean. There really is nothing bad I can say. For those wanting a little quieter evening the casino is large enough to enjoy but not too big to be intimidating. The starbucks right by the lift is very handy! There is food to cater for all choices and budgets. The sky jump was great fun! When I lost my purse (wallet) the staff couldnt have been more helpful-calling england to sort out the bank. Spotless pool and surrounding area with shady cabins for children/families. If there is a downside-its the typical American one of no kettles-so British should remember to pack one! There is a cheap shuttle back to the airport that runs when you want far cheaper than the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Fun”
Reviews.Author: mommytorw
Reviews.Content: Valet and room service were very prompt. Loved the tower. We ate at the resturant and had a lovely view. Rooms were clean and bed was comfortable. It was a short drive to get to the rest of the strip, but what a view of the strip from the tower. We did get a smoking room, but wow ,make sure the ventilation in the rooms works. Very stale smoky smell even in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “LOTS OF PROBLEMS... FAR FROM ALL THE ACTION”
Reviews.Author: jen_white_21
Reviews.Content: We were at the Stratosphere for 4 nights and I was down at the front desk 6 times in two days complaining. The front desk lines are long and the customer service center is long also. I wasted so much time because they kept messing up our rooms. Not only our rooms but also the room our friends were in. Our room key didn't work half the time and it is a long walk to get back down to the front desk. So for all our problems the hotel gave us free dinner buffet...dont eat there! it made all of us sick!! The walk to all the nice hotels and everything going on is very long!!!! This hotel is very far down from the strip and the hotel lines are very long with all the problems we had and got a lousy dinner that made us sick. My suggestions go to a nice hotel and don't waste your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to say the least...”
Reviews.Author: scottbradford1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed here duing CONEXPO and felt like I was slumming it. Spent the extra money for a renovated room and was glad I did. Spoke to several who did not and they were very disappointed. Food was so-so, casino was not busy at all compared to others we passed through or gambled. I travel to Vega$ every year and try to stay at different casinos and this experience rates as my worst.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting and Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: DivaChronicles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was located at the end of the Las Vegas Strip, but it was very nice and clean! Our room was nice, on the 14th floor, no spectacular view, but roomy and comfortable! The tram to all the Hotels is about a block and a half walk to the Sahara, where the Tram Station is. Very easy to use, 12.00 for single day pass, stops at all the major hotels on the strip! The Hotel housed nice resturants, and a very nice breakfast buffet! Be prepared to spend some cheese as all prices in Vegas are inflated at least double the regular price. DO NOT purchase "thunder from down under" VIP seats tickets.....what a ri p off! We were seated in the BACK of the club at a booth table and the dancers very rarely came to our spot...not worth 137.00 ticket! Hardly showed anyting!!!! BOOOOOO!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stinky Room”
Reviews.Author: jmedley
Reviews.Content: For some reason our room continuously smelt bad. Like sulfur or sewer, not sure which. The restroom was practically too small to turn around in,and in fact you couldn't open the door from the inside without practically standing in the bathtub. The casino, to me, was dark and somewhat dirty, at least compared to the nice ones at the better places up the strip. The good things about the place ... the people (employees) were very friendly and courteous. The food at the Roxy was great. And I guess if you like to go up high in the sky (I don't) there are lots to do up on the stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: FLDIsneyFan
Reviews.Content: I was booked for Stratosphere through a Priceline bid, and was a bit skeptical after reading all of the reviews. I love to travel, and rely heavily upon reviews but I realize that there can be many different perceptions of the same place. So - here's my "two cents." For $50 a night plus the resort fee of $7.50 per night, I had a good room to sleep in, a hot shower and a comfortable bed. I was in the Tour section, and very seldom saw any other people in the hall. The room was fine, clean and comfortable. The only time I heard noises was when the people would free fall from the 108th floor of the tower. There were adequate places to eat around the hotel both outside and in. I did the all day buffet on one day for $29 plus tax and had three very good meals. I especially liked that beverages were included with the buffet, something that is rare in Florida. There are about 20 or so shops in the Tower Shops, including a few eateries such as McDonald's & Krispy Kreme. The pool area was nice, clean and relaxing. Check in was expedient and express check out is available. The only thing I would change would be to have coffee makers in the room. Other than that, my stay at the Stratosphere was great.

Reviews.Title: “Long journey but worth it when we get here”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasgirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come and stay here every year for 2 weeks at a time, sometimes we come over a couple of times a year. Love the Hotel and the staff are very friendly. Even though the Hotel is quite a way up the strip this gives us an excuse to go for a long walk down the strip every morning whilst it is not too busy, then we usually return back to the hotel in the afternoon for some sun rays at the pool and a bit of gambling. Would love to know how people get their room upgraded, to get a decent room we have to pay extra when booking with our agent for a premier room but after checking in we usually find we are near the ice machine or we have a connecting door in the room even after telling the check-in staff we don't want a connecting door. We are going back again on 6th July this year for 2 weeks for our anniversary and really looking forward to it, but dreading the check-in process trying to explain what room we would like. After all the thousands of dollars we have spent in this hotel we should get upgraded automatically, but it always seems to be American travellers who haven't travelled far who get the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice but that's it!”
Reviews.Author: statey
Reviews.Content: Rooms are new and updated and that's it. Waited over 25 minutes to check in. rooms are so thin that you can hear EVERYTHING from your neighbors. I called the front desk 3x and no one answered. Room smelled like smoke and nothing to air it out. Buffet was actually not bad and for a good price. Restaurant choices are very minimal and very high in fat. The whole vibe to everything was off. I felt like it was cheap and under par. The spa is also not that good and very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations ever!”
Reviews.Author: MaoTao
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Stratosphere and had the time of my life! I booked through Expedia and got a deal for 3 people to fly and stay for a week for only $900!! Plus, we got unlimited access to the tower attractions included, and we got $15 off indoor skydiving! Best value I have ever gotten on a vacation. Plus we also stayed in an upgraded brand new Stratosphere Select room free of charge. Thank you sooo much Trip Advisor, Expedia, and especially The Stratosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: vvinay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent place to live on the strip. Apart from usual Casino attraction that most of those star studded hotels on strip gives, this gives an excellent food. Value for Money. Lot of popular shows & 24 hours a day is too less to spend there. The X-games on top of the Hotel is like amazing fear factor test kit. All in All if you have not gone there, you have to go there :).

Reviews.Title: “Old School, Suites spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: Nadocindy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite at the Stratosphere which was spacious, clean and the housekeeping was excellent, We had a king size bed, only one television (flat screen), a very large bathroom with a separate large walk in shower, a two person extremely large jetted tub, double sinks, and a separate room with the commode. The floorw in the entry way and bathroom were marble. Furnishings in the bedroom were "old school" but included a couch, chair, dining room table and king size bed in one very large room. Our room had a coffee maker, safe, and small refrigerator. The casino was smaller than the newer hotels and the payouts were very average. All the staff were very nice and appeared to be happy to have you there as a guest. The buffet was good/average and offered a very large assortment of choices. Roxy's diner was the worst food that my husband had eaten in a very long time. He could not wait to leave. The tower was worth seeing the view. Currently the tower is free for guests staying at the hotel. It was not crowded and we went at dusk and were able to see both the day and night views. It is 109 stories high. The rides are not for the feint of heart. We did not ride, but were very interested in watching. If the new glitz of the newer casinos are not for you, the Stratosphere is clean and friendly. We did not leave the hotel for the 3 days that we were there. If we had, we would have taken the bus up and down the strip and would have bought an all day pass.

Reviews.Title: “On the top of the world @LasVegas”
Reviews.Author: Roshuonline
Reviews.Content: The best hotel to watch the strip (the Las Vegas Strip). Great place to be, gamble, eat, drink, make merry, make (or loose) dollars...sinful, just gorgeous. The rooms are spacious, staff friendly and helpful, casino - all in place, shopping center is the best and surprisingly cheaper than the rest of the hotels close by; great breakfast, lunch or dinner options in and around the hotel; great adventure (scary but trilling - you need to have an extra heart) rides in the top floor; you can't get lost even if you are drunk; this hotel is a landmark in itself; must see and visit; be here.

Reviews.Title: “It"s worth it.”
Reviews.Author: blind3601
Reviews.Content: Had a blast with the family. I am definetly coming back to stay here. The waitresses kept coming back so you know those drinks kept coming. The rooms were beautiful and it is just five minutes away from the outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic stay”
Reviews.Author: Latespot
Reviews.Content: I flew to San Diego for my son's funeral. We were to meet in Vegas for a few days but it was not to be. When I arrived at the Strat my room was not ready but I was upgraded to a premier room. The place was great. The staff was all smiles. I used the conierge twice and they were very helpful. I can't say enough about the Stratosphere. The pool was great. I am going back in a month. I recomended this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Luck Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chintansinghvi
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas in Feb 2011 for an exhibition, this was the hotel we stayed for 5 days. the Hotel is excellent in all respects. Hotel has a superb (lucky for us) casino, starbucks, small shopping mall, McDonald.. Hotel is nice and decent located. The rooms are terribly average, infact poor quality but the hotel style and facilities make up for it. The hotel has some good adventurous activities like bungee jumping, Big shot etc which are great. All in all a good value for money hotel with a good lucky casino.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Casino & Hotel - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rickbell
Reviews.Content: A very clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Valve for money is outstanding. Food is good. View from the top of tower is the best. Rides are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS VACATION SPOT!”
Reviews.Author: AndiShah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 21 year old and 17 year old recently stayed at the Stratosphere hotel in Las Vegas, NV. What an awesome experience. Everyone was friendly and helpful. It was a fun place for everyone, including our 17 year old who couldn't gamble. The atmosphere is fun and fast paced if you want it to be or fun and relaxing if that's what you are looking for. The visit to the top of the tower is a must! If we were more daring we would've tried the rides. Maybe next time. All in all I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. We will definetely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best than expected”
Reviews.Author: Lauriqui
Reviews.Content: First, the good things: We arrived at the hotel at night. Check-in was fast and the girl at the desk was very nice, smiling all the time. Our room was pretty big, with everything you need, and bed were super comfortable. During our stay, we tried some restaurants in the hotel, which is very handy (Roxy's is quite good, Tower Pizza is ok, Starbucks is ok too), the casino is nice (not crowded, which I liked!) and the Tower is just amazing. Plus, the enter is free anytime you want as a hotel customer. There is a resort fee of 7$ per day, which was fine by me, as every hotel as a resort fee and most of them are a lot higher than 7 dollars. The pool, tower and fitness centers are free with this resort fee, which is great. The first days we didn't have a car, so we walked all the way to the Strip. It is not very far (if you like walking) and it is a safe area, we did it in the morning and at night. There are builings in constructon around the area, so it is not pretty, but it is safe. However, if you do not want to walk, the Deuce bus stops right in front of the hotel, which is great. Also, we took bus 108 from the airport, it stops right there too. The rest of the days we had a car and we parked it in the hotel parking. Parking is free in all hotels. I liked ours because it is easy to get it/out and really close to the hotel (about 1 minute walking!). You can see that some hotel parkings are very far from the hotels, but not this one. Also, it was safe at night. Now, what we didn't like: Our room was clean, however the shower curtains need to be changed... they were mouldy at some places! There were some hairs in the shower and walls, we do not know where did they come from, we do not want to know... we just decided to ignore them... Also, our room was in the left area of the "world II" building, which is near to some kind of big engines of the hotel... and they were noisy. They work 24/7! Electricity and sockets didn't work properly... sometimes we got into the room and the alarm clock won't work anymore... Not very nice if you want an alarm! Also about our room, even if we asked for a non-smoking room, ours smelled pretty bad... I understand you can smoke at the casino and some hotel floors, so I guess your non-smoking room can't be 100% clean... However, smell was pretty bad and we had to turn the air conditionned on at night to breathe. 2 or 3 days we came to the room and found the air conditionned on and all the lights on... we just don't know why. For about 3 days, one of the elevators didn't work and wasn't repaired. It is no big deal, but with 24 floors, we waited quite too much to get into an elevator... So, anyway, I liked this hotel, I think it is cheap and fine, people are friendly, all services are good and I really liked its location: not far from the action, well connected to everywhere by bus (downtown, strip, airport), and thanks to its location we didn't get stuck in the Strip traffic. It has all you need for a pleasant stay, and sure, you can find better, but for the price, this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel boring room”
Reviews.Author: ekalcin
Reviews.Content: Maybe boring room would made you spend more time in the casino. Beside the tiny tiny bathroom and the noisy aircon, small window, the hotel is actually not so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Kaukauna1234
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the cleanest hotels on the strip. Staff was very friendly. Waitresses were very friendly and service was very prompt. Had a great time in the casino!

Reviews.Title: “THE DIVE”
Reviews.Author: TheFrenchMayor
Reviews.Content: Staff is plainly rude. You walk-in right inside the casino. Every new guests look stupid, walking around to find the desk/reception. Check-in painfully slow, have to queue in a line for 30mn Rooms: sink is in the room, no wardrobe, stinking of tobacco as central aircon. tiny window, felt like in jail. Oh, should I mention, no sleep cos the train run along the hotel and trains blow the horns for minutes at a time right in the middle of the night also room next to ice machine! Less than 12 hours in this motel,yes, not a hotel, I upgraded to a premium room. Right, you are entitle to have furnitures and a proper bathroom. Still very noisy room, no ice machine, but this time the lifts and the low life guests screaming as they are drunk, then kids abandonned in the corridor outside their rooms at 1am... and still those trains. Staff: Reception: rude, Buffet restaurant: Rude, Cafe: nice but horrible food Location: crap: away from everything and noisy, beggars, addicts every 20 yards on the street. you would not walk around there at night time. Wonder why they have all these "Get out of Jail" bons places just next door to the next. Would that be a clue???? I selected this hotel for my first 3 nights to get over the jetlag. If my friends hadn't join me (in a proper hotel: The carriage house hotel + MGM Grand) I would have left Las Vegas. horrible room, horrible staff, horrible location, kind of OK food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service from Vanessa!!! Lovely lady!!”
Reviews.Author: Loriemetz
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing experience having Vanessa { I believe she's a manager of reservations } help me out with a reservation:) I had a been sent a letter offering me two free nights at the hotel , but I had recently moved and had left the letter at my other house up in Canada. I called and dealt with Vanessa -- she went way out of her way to help track down a copy of this letter in order to book my free rooms. After an entire afternoon of her looking into this -- she had sorted it out!! She's amazing !! She really went out of her way to help me!! The customer service in general at this hotel is great!! I would highly recommend staying in their newly-- beautifully remodeled rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: glittergirl48
Reviews.Content: stayed from 03-03-2011 to 03-08/2011 great value rooms nice and clean ck in ck out was a breeze everybody very friendly. used a 24 hr deuce bus pass to go up and down strip also to fremont street . fellini's resturant was excellant to eat at moderate prices buffet was good. also saw american superstars show really nice show will return to this hotel next visit to las vegas. went up to observation tower several times with my hotel pass awesome view

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly Hotel and best value in Town”
Reviews.Author: Kanhai47
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 14 night stay at the Stratosphere. We stayed in one of their remodeled rooms. The room was great with a wonderful view of the mountains. Everyone from the Check-In to the Casino Staff were friendly and helpful. We have been going to Vegas every year for the last 20 years and stayed practically everywhere and none can beat to value and service we received. You may be a way down the Strip but this doesn't matter because there is a bus stop outside the hotel and for $7 for 24 hours you can be anywhere on the Strip up or downtown in no time at all. We had a great stay and will definitely be going back there later this year or early next year. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great place to stay at a great price. Thanks to everyone at the Stratosphere for making our vacation. If you stay there make sure you visit Fellini's restaurant and the Top of the World. We h

Reviews.Title: “Great Time With Friends and Family!!”
Reviews.Author: motero12
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at The Stratosphere. This has been my 5th stay at this hotel and each time it gets better. Upon arriving the Valet was great. They were extremely friendly and helpful. When I arrived to registration, I was greeted with a smile and the the young lady was extremely prompt and helpful. Maybe it was becuase I was so nice and friendly, I was given some freebies which was amazing. I think they were accustomed to unruly guests who were impatient, be nice to these people and they will take care of you. My friend and I, went up to our Stratosphere Select Rooms, and they were great, nice rooms with with ample room. Great beds with nice linens and TV. I get to see amazing views where I come from and If I want to see a great view of the strip I simply went to the top of the tower and had this best view in all of Vegas. The casino was great nice low limits in comparison to the other hotels on the strip. Love the pool and I like the Fitness Center. I am a professional powerlifter/strongman, and it had the necessary equipment for me to get a quick decent workout it. I am in vegas to have fun, not to workout. If people want a great fitness center get a free pass to local gyms in Las Vegas. Great central location close to all the actions and also close to Freemont St. I would stat here again and again. Great Value and Damn Good Comforts for the price. I would have to pay 2x as much for the same room at MGM or 2x more for worse rooms at the some of the other Hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!! EXTREMELY HORRIBLE! CANT EMPHASIZE MORE! STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: desireepeach
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Vegas last night. What a horrible experience with this hotel! I dont even know where to start. I booked the Strip View Star Suite at this hotel way back in early Jan 2011. I made sure that it was a strip view and smoking. I was very excited because this room seemed nice and roomy. Fast foward to March 8, 2011. We check in around 5pm. Mayra Childs the front desk 'supervisor" is helping us. She tells me that they DO NOT have that suite available. I say "how do you not have it available? I booked this room about 3 months ago and you dont have it?" She tells me no they dont they are all booked and that they have the Grand Suite for xxx.xx more. I ask her if we can get that suite..she also tells me they dont have it avalable. She tells me i have a choose either the star suite with no strip view, or the romance suite. I asked for the star suite because i never wanted the romance suite. too small. She says ok and tells me i have to put down a $150 security deposit. Im like "wait, what?...no one ever mentioned this! I had the impression my room was already paid for" I didnt have enough on my card and neither did my husband so he had to go find a bank to deposit they money. I stood there till he got back and we were helped by some other man. We asked him is the room was at LEAST smoking. Nope. They couldnt even give us that. We asked if the rooms had a refrigerator and microwave because that is what we saw online. He says "yes there should be" . About 2 hours after we tried to 'check in", we get to our 'downgraded suite" and it was the ROMANCE SUITE! what i specifically said i did not want. I call the front desk and Mayra Childs picks up. I told her "I thought you gave us the Star Suite. You told me i had to pick the Romance Suite or Star Suite" She RUDELY tells me "Well, we dont have the other one available so I made it clear that now we only have the romance suite". I know what the romance suite and all the other suites look like, she didnt fool me. We look around and we realize there was not microwave. My husbands calls the front desk and asks them. They tell him to call housekeeping. He does and they tell him they do not have microwaves. So I call the 1800 number and ask a live person if their suites have microwaves. They tell me they do. Literally a minute later, the room phone rings. I pick it up and its Mayra Childs. she tells me "Hi its Mayra Childs from the Front Desk, im calling to let you know that im trying to make you understand that we DO NOT have microwaves!" Im trying to tell her "I called the number AND another man from front desk both said theyre would be" Im not sure if she heard me because she sounded really pissed off and just kept going on about the microwaves. She is still talking and going off how she 'explained to me that they do not have microwaves and she made it clear to me so why do i not understand that" She was seriously talking to me like i was a child! "You keep calling the front desk and asking all these questions about things we do not have avaible! im just trying to make you feel satisfied!" That was seriously the last straw. I let her know what i was ABSOLUTELY NOT HAPPY that I pay for a suite that wasnt available, i got downgraded and still had to pay the same. I couldnt even get a smoking room. Different people tell us different things. Took us over 4 hours to get everything settled. I told her some other things and asked her to leave us alone and stop calling us. I hung up the phone. Our first night there was horrible. The only good thing about the Stratosphere was that we had unlimited trips to the top of the tower. amazing view. Took like 30 mins to get up there since one elevator was available and there was a long line. We only got to go to the inside observation deck because the outside was "closed". Level 107 bar isnt all that great. We had to stay in a certain "area' of the bar. what the hell? Seriously, I have never had such a HORRIBLE experience! Circus Circus and Sahara have 1000 times better customer service! NEVER AGAIN WILL I STEP FOOT IN THIS HORRENDOUS PLACE! Watch out for Mayra Childs. Front Desk "Supervisor" She looks like shes 17 yrs old and she has some SERIOUS attitude. P.S our $150 "security deposit" was supposed to be refunded after we checked out...im still waiting for that to happen...

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, great value, don't let the location deter you!”
Reviews.Author: loopygal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 15-131, a “non-renovated”, non-smoking room between March 2nd-9th, 2011. If you’re expecting fancy landscaping, marble floors, and fountains, this is not the hotel for you. If you are deathly afraid of heights, look elsewhere. But if you want a comfortable room at a reasonable price, a laid-back atmosphere, and incomparable views of the Strip, and if you are a crazy adrenaline junky like myself who lives to dangle off an 1100 foot tower at the mercy of a machine, then the Strat is for you. Our room, though perfectly adequate for our needs as we didn’t spend much time in it, was nothing spectacular. Besides some dust around the AC vent and behind the night stand, our room was reasonably clean. It had a pleasant odor and was free of any smoke smell, as it should be. Our room was cleaned and the towels were changed daily. The furniture was on the newer side, and the beds were extremely comfortable yet firm. The linens were of a good quality and free of stains. (I could have lived without the throw pillows. The beds look inviting enough without them. If anyone in management is reading this, PLEASE get rid of them!) We had a new, flat-screen TV, although the remote was a bit temperamental. The window had some strange scratches on it that were beyond explanation. Maybe some previous guest brought a suicidal cat with them?? The bathroom was TINY; the tub was oversized and took up about 2/3 of it. It had very high sides, which helped keep the bathroom dry, just watch your step getting in and out! The toilet paper would only flush if you placed it directly in the center of the bowl (everything else did). This was the most annoying thing about the room, but on the day we were leaving I noticed a plumber on our floor, so hopefully this issue is being resolved. The Strat’s pool area is very clean and inviting, has plenty of loungers, and because it’s on the 8th floor offers great views of the Strip and the tower itself; you can see all the action going on at the top, as well as the Sky Jump victims falling. When I was there it wasn’t crowded, and had just opened for the season (it was barely warm enough for the water to look appealing). I imagine it can get super-crazy in the summer! The casino floor is nothing fancy, but is a good size and pleasant. The slots were loose enough to keep me interested, and I had no trouble finding a cocktail waitress most nights, even at the lower limit slots. The shopping here isn’t great, but it’s on the inexpensive side, and the souvenirs are good quality (no knockoffs) and reasonably priced. There are plenty of dining options, most of them inexpensive as well. The buffet is quite decent, but if you go for brunch, avoid the pre-made egg dishes and head for the omelet station, you’ll be glad you did. I also highly recommend Roxy’s. Top of the World is the priciest option, but the food is superb and it’s a once in a lifetime experience (lunch is far more reasonable than dinner). The one big drawback to the Strat that is brought up time and time again is its location, that it is too far from all the action, and that the north end of the Strip is a sketchy place. It’s true that the north end is not having a great time right now, but there’s no reason to go exploring it, and the area immediately outside the Strat’s front entrance is perfectly fine; the security guards are never far away in any case. I honestly did not find the location to be a problem; it is fairly quiet and the Strat tends to draw a laid-back crowd, which is a good thing, as center Strip is anything but. Also, ignore any horror stories you’ve heard about the Deuce; there’s a stop literally right outside the door. It’s clean, cheap ($7/ day, make sure you have exact change), runs frequently 24 hours a day and stops at every major casino/attraction on the Strip (even if you were staying in a more central location you would want to use it to go exploring places more than a 15-20 minute walk away, am I right?). The longest I ever had to wait for it was 15 minutes, and usually I didn’t have to wait more than 5. Finding a seat wasn’t a problem 90% of the time, and within 10-15 minutes tops we were in the middle of all the action. A couple of times there were a few “characters” on board, but the drivers/security guards dealt with them no problem. The Strat compensates for its location by its value and the fact that it has the most unique attraction of any casino in Vegas: the Tower. Guests get unlimited free access to the observation decks (it’s $10 each time if you’re not staying here) and I took advantage of this. I went up just about every day/night, and never had to wait more than 15 minutes. The view of the Strip from the top is breathtaking (another advantage of its location). The tower was never crowded, and I felt free to just chill there for as long as I wanted. The Air Bar on the 108th floor has a great lounge and serves up tasty cocktails, but I never felt obligated to order them when I didn’t want them. The rides obviously are a must. Guests also receive 2 for 1 unlimited one day ride passes, and if you can do Xscream and Insanity, no other ride anywhere else on Earth will phase you, as this is not your typical amusement park. Overall the property is maintained pretty well, which tells me that it’s doing good financially and will be around for some time to come, and though it’s not the fanciest, most glamorous place on the Strip it is far from the worst (I knew I’d made a good decision in booking the Strat when I saw some of the other properties, namely Excalibur and Circus Circus). The interactions I had with the employees were always positive; from the bartenders to the elevator operators to the waiters at Roxy’s, everyone was friendly and wanted to make sure the guests were having a good time, and that’s one reason why I would want to return. So would I stay here again? Probably, especially if some of the minor issues mentioned above are rectified (unless I find a killer deal at Caesar’s Palace, which I doubt.) Overall I had a great time in Vegas, thanks in no small part to the Strat, and I can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: sgordon3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Vegas. Although the location is at the end of the strip there is public transportation available. It had shops and food available on the 2nd floor (not all open 24 hours). Pool open 9-6. Looked really nice. Room was great. Good size and the bed was very comfortable. Got free access to the tower. With the free access our room was pretty much paid for.

Reviews.Title: “great value!”
Reviews.Author: mandysmear
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded in the new tower, our room was awesome. I have stayed in "better" hotels (according to other people) that were dirtier. We were at the MOnte Carlo last year. Our room looked like a regular run in the mill room that you'd get at a Best Western or Ramada. Nothing to write home about. Our room at the stratosphere kicked the Monte Carlo's room's butt! I've heard mixed reviews about this hotel, but honestly, we were good. We were close to fremont street. We were further away from the rest of the action, but cabs, the deuce and our feet did us just fine. My only complaint was that there was nothing open 24 hours for food. There was a few 3 or 4am nights/mornings where we were starved and couldn't get anything. Roxy's diner had decent hours for late night food, but we were pretty sick of it by the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “pretty average”
Reviews.Author: Jilliby09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in February, and it was ok, but really nothing to write home about. Reception / front desk has huge qeues, and is really slow to check-in. The concierge is dreadful, wouldn't help book anything except with the companies that he wanted to, guessing these are the companies he makes the most commission from, even though they weren't what we were looking for! Anything else, I was told to sort it out myself. The beds were comfortable and the rooms reasonably clean, although one little cake of soap in the bathroom that had to be transferred between the shower and the hand basin, and that wasn't refreshed for 3 days seemed a bit ridiculous! I had to ask to get a second small piece of soap! The room service food was very average and very expensive. The bar down in the casino is funky, and a good place to wait for friends, but make sure you take ID if you want a drink. Friends (in their 30's) were refused a drink because they didn't have ID, when they returned with their ID, the same barman served them and when they offered to show him their ID he said don't worry, pretty crap service. The view from the tower is awesome, and well worth the visit, and the rides are fun, although one was out of order the night we went up. The hotel rooms are not expensive, however you get what you pay for I guess!! This wasn't a dreadful hotel by any means, but doesn't stand out as a must return either! I think next time i'm in Vegas I'll try my luck staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money - stop the moaning!”
Reviews.Author: lesleynottingham1
Reviews.Content: i have visited Vegas many times. When its a special occassion i push the boat out and stay somewhere really nice (and expensive ) like Bellagio. When i just want an extra weeks holiday as nice and as cheap as possible i stay here. On my last visit the whole weeks stay was around the same price as one night at some of the centre strip 5* hotels. OK the location is not fab but its still on the strip and you can still stroll upto the action. i have seen off strip motels for the same price as this hotel. It has everything you want, a variety of food all prices, decent pool and good enough rooms. i would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a budget and expect to stay here again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and nice hotel - The best view in town”
Reviews.Author: mares889
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel - especially the tower and everything about it. Rooms are pretty much ordinary but clean, so is the pool - the best value hotel on The STRIP.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time!”
Reviews.Author: 4chrome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for Nascar week. (Wed. to Wed.) We had a very quick check in and checked out on our TV. Excellent non-smoking room on the 16th floor with a view of downtown. This was our 3rd time in Las Vegas and our first stay at the Stratosphere. We will definitely be back. Beds were very comfortable. Rooms were cleaned very well. (we saw one room housekeeping was cleaning and felt very sorry for her...some people are SLOBS!) A few times the room was cleaned very late in the day (4pm) but it was Nascar Weekend and that is to be expected. We asked for extra towels a few times, extra cups, and even another blanket. Each time we found housekeeping to be extremely pleasant and helpful. Ate at Roxy's Diner 3 times. Great food and fantastic staff! Buffet was average. Got our boarding passes at the internet station in the gift shop ($5.00 for 15 minutes). Budget rental car desk in the hotel..very convenient. Bus stops out front. Yeah it takes a while to get down the strip on the busier days...but it's VEGAS!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teresa60097
