Reviews.Content: This trip to Vegas was my sixth visit, all were leisure trips. This was my first time staying here, but my friends I accompany have stayed at this hotel several times. I thought my room need a little more cleaning after I noticed the bath tub wasnt cleaned, so I called the frontdesk and they contacted room service. The attendent came prompt and she cleaned my room from top to bottom and I thanked her and gave her a tip because she wasn't the who assigned to my floor. I stayed in the Premeir area and I had no problems finding my way around... Overall stay was GREAT and I will be returning in May 2011, I am hoping for EXCELLENT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value But That's About It”
Reviews.Author: MrWinky
Reviews.Content: This isn't my first time here, so I can't blame anyone but myself that it wasn't great. OK, first the good: Reasonably priced for a hotel on the strip, and you can go to the top of the tower as many times as you want during your stay. Now, here are the varying degrees of what isn't so great: In the room, the sink isn't inside the bathroom. So if someone needs to use the restroom during the night, they will have to turn on the faucet outside of the bathroom to wash their hands (presuming hygiene is part of their lifestyle), probably waking up their sleeping partner. There is only one casual restaurant in the entire hotel, Roxys Diner, unless you want to go to the top of the tower to eat pizza. Roxys is fairly priced for dinner, but if you want to eat breakfast there, expect to pay $6.99 for two pancakes (with absolutely nothing else included) and $3.00 for a cup of coffee. I would be lying though if I didn't say that the Extreme Grilled Cheese sandwich, which comes with fries, was what brought me back to the hotel for the second time. It's that good, and only $8.99, for the biggest grilled sandwich you will ever have eaten. The staff is very customer service oriented. Back to the not so good: the hotel is located at the far North end of the strip, pretty far from the action. Wi-fi is an extra $15 a day. That's just a plain ripoff. Did I mention that there is a dearth of places to eat in the hotel? Next time, I will stay somewhere else and venture into Roxys for the Extreme Grilled Cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, average location but when the buses are that good who cares!”
Reviews.Author: YoungGemma
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to do a last minute trip to Vegas admittedly as cost effective as possible. We had the choice of Stratosphere, Treasure Island or The Flamingo and opted for this hotel although we knew it would be slightly at the wrong end of the strip. Given that the buses are so easy (every 15 mins and $7 for a 24 hour pass) it actually made it really easy to get to the main part of the strip and also to Downtown which is in the opposite direction. I'd recommend the hotel, newly refurbished rooms, an average casion (although i'm not an expert) and free reign of the tower as we were paying guests. If you can't afford the helicopted flight over the strip this is a good alternative. In hindsight we may have chosen a more central location but for the price it wasn't bad! don't forget a trip to the Diner with singing and dancing by the waitresses - a nice novel idea although other than that and the expensive top of the world restaurant there's not a huge amount here and you cerrtainly wouldn't want to start walking around this end of the stip by yourself at a night.... All in all great value for money and fab views. Just buy a bus pass!

Reviews.Title: “Fool Me Once Shame on Me, Fool Me Twice? That won't happen.”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl022
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went for the NASCAR race weekend and stayed March 3rd through the 7th. The room was nice but not worth what we paid. There is not a coffee pot in the room for starters and the cleaning staff left used cleaning rags on our nightstand Sunday. They pretty much make the beds and restock the towels, that is it. When we found a cleaning lady she was irritated we asked for some plastic cups and a liner for our ice bucket. They were not restocked during the cleaning of our room that day. We stayed here specifically for the "NASCAR activities" they hype, what a joke. They had an autograph session Friday night and we stood in line outside our hotel for 2 hours. Really? I would think patrons of the hotel would have at LEAST been told we needed a wristband before we got in line and since we were paying to stay there, been towards the front of the line. When we finally got through the line for autographs 1/2 the drivers were gone. We paid $3 each for a concierge to print our boarding passes Sunday night for our Monday flight. There are no computers or printers for guests to use. The hotel is okay but I would not recommend anyone stay there nor will we be re-booking a room for future trips to Vegas. It is quite a walk to the action of the Strip. Overall I am disappointed with the lack of customer care given. The only stressful/irritating times of our trip was related to our hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Hotel is far from LV Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: MAU1967
Reviews.Content: About the htl, is far from LVCC, you can take a bus or shuttle ( every 30 minutes ) but really the traffic is complicate in peak hours. About the hotel have good view from the 20 floor, im not gambler but in LV are many casinos better than this. For business is ok, but you need know the distance many times is important. About the internet fares and telphones call are too expensive. Have two pools, gym.

Reviews.Title: “For a last minute vacation this hotel was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: marqueata
Reviews.Content: For a last minute vacation this hotel was great!!! Nice clean room, located near new Vegas. About two miles from old Vegas. For a smoking room it was nice

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere. The extra "fees" add up quickly and overall ambiance sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Rednorge
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vegas with two toddlers; probably not the best idea but when I was young I had a blast there. I'm starting off with the negatives and will finish with the positives. Negatives Bring extra toilet paper, because you have to ration what you get. There is no extra provided in the room. I had to ask for a refill. There was no Kleenex in my room either upon my arrival (which with two kids having a cold might explain why we had to use more tp). C'mon, even the cheapest of hotels provide an extra roll in the room. Ridiculous $7.50 per night resort fee, for a hotel that is definitely NOT a resort. They claim the resort fee covers the fitness center, swimming pool, 2 for 1 show tickets and the observation deck. Hmm, both pools are outside and when I asked if they were heated, the guy responded with "Well, sometimes," and then laughed it off. Needless to say it was too cold for us to use. Fitness centers are part of the hotel everywhere else and don't cost extra. No one wants to see the lame show, which is why the ticket price is so low. So, we basically paid $22.50 to go up to the tower once for 5 minutes. Soooo not worth it. Want to use the internet? $11.95 a day. My daughter got sick while I was there and we had to go to urgent care. They provided her with some antibiotics, which needed to be refrigerated. So, I called and asked about a fridge, another $10 a night fee. Want a smoke free room? Well, you'll get a smoke free room but you have to walk through smoke filled halls to get there. In their newly refinished area one would think that it wouldn't be too difficult to keep the smoking and non-smoking floors separate. All the reviews of the restaurants were horrible so the only thing we tried was McDonalds. DON'T use their spa facility, unless you like filthy floors and paying way to much for what you get. $100 for a full set of nails. $50 or $60 for a manicure. Again, ridiculous for what the quality and type of service you receive. The surrounding area is not the greatest. You are at the tail end of the strip and surrounded by very old and worn down buidlings and lame wedding chapel motels. Positives: It was cheap, but you get what you pay for. The security was awesome and we felt very safe in the parking structure. The parking structure is also easy to get in an out of. It is a few blocks walking distance from the monorail, which is convenient. We stayed in the newly refinished section. It was modern and basic and the bath was oversized, which was a bonus. The bed was also really comfortable. The furniture is cheap though and they didn't even provide a stand to put your suitcase on. C'mon guys, we are talking the basics here!!! The rooms were clean. Overall, I was really disappointed. Granted, we didn't pay much for the room, but I just felt that we would be charged for every last thing. Next time we will be staying at a Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn. You get far more value for what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy but worth the view.”
Reviews.Author: MunchettaB
Reviews.Content: The decision to stay at the Stratosphere for our Girl's Weekend was mostly based on economics (by far one of the cheapest room rates) but proved to be worth much more than what we paid. Not only was it conveniently located between New and Old Vegas but our stay offered us a large bedroom, friendly staff, and a free trip up the Tower to see the well-lit Strip. The only complaint I had was trying to sleep with such loud neighbors next door...which I'm sure we could have found in any Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: francoisuk1
Reviews.Content: I traveled to vegas with my wife to get away from the kids a little bit. When i got there it took about 20 min for me to get my keys wich i understand it was a busy weeked. Very dissapointed with housekeeping, they kept knocking everyday very early and always walk in and when i called housekeeping i was told by daniela this was standard procedure. My toiletries were never replaced overall very upset with their service. I decided to have lunch in roxys food was ok, the main bar was ok even when they dont have a nightclub. I returned to my room later at night and my room was not cleaned. I called housekeeping and was told im sorry sir we are very busy. Really? I was furious and went to registration and i spoke to a very pregnant but nice girl vero who said she was sorry and referred me to speak to her manager. Her manager understand my frustration and also was sorry she said she would call housekeeping for my room to be clean every day. I was very grateful for this and she also gave us show tickets for our troubles. I dont remember her name but very good to speak with if you have any troubles. She gave me a business card but it was someone else not her since she said she didnt have any cards of her own which in my opinion all managers do or should but oh well. My stay was plessant the only downside was housekeeping. I will probably return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MariaJM1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice rooms and are clean but for the renovated rooms you have to pay an extra $10 per day. No fridge or microwave in the room, very limited free tv channels. Internet is $12 per person per day and they want a $150 deposit for it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! NOT GOOD. It is on the strip but downtown side so takes 1 hour 30 min approx to walk to MGM and New York. Also not so good. Buses are the most expensive buses in US so far but still not bad to UK. $7 all day pass, $5 2 hour pass. Between here and Circus Circus you get beggers but no where else on the strip. The beggers are not offensive apart from a stroppy woman. After paying extra taxi's/bus fares you may as well spend the extra on a better location hotel. The Travelodge on the strip has free wifi and parking and is closer than this hotel!! And you get breakfast there. We know this as we were going to book but thought we may as well stay on the strip but that didn't work out as we planned!!!!! Planet Hollywood is the one we'll stay next time but MGM Grand is gorgeous. All the other hotels have better drinks and food offers than this one. Roxies 50's diner here though looks great and is ok priced. The circle K garage is cheapest for cig and alc and anything else. Buy cig from garage - A LOT cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Stay, Great View But Average Service”
Reviews.Author: prasanachand
Reviews.Content: The Stay was inexpensive, the view from above the tower was great. The free pass to the games was kool. Casino here is very lame, no crowd at all. Have to say one thing the Roxys diner her is the best place for break fast. I simply loved it. The service is very poor. The staff are un friendly. The location bad, its at the end of the strip so you will have to drive or walk to get to the main places of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Great clean room!”
Reviews.Author: oakraider
Reviews.Content: The room was a little small, but it suited our needs. We stayed in one of the older rooms but it was clean and great. Great deal if you have a car to get you to the other strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, But its at the extreme end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: PR21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, we got a good deal while booking, but i did not like the location, its at the extreme end of the strip and you have to take a cab or bus everytime you want to visit the strip. Hotel Casino is ok, not one of the best specially considering Vegas as it has lot to offer. Hotels attraction is the Tower which is good and you can enjoy the rides from the tower

Reviews.Title: “Good Night's Sleep - NOT!”
Reviews.Author: BirdieAbromovich
Reviews.Content: With its thrill-seeker attractions, the Stratosphere definitely caters to a younger crowd. There is live music at night (although not very good) and a bar that BOOMS music throughout the heart of the casino. Add an all you can drink bar and an erotic, vampire-themed show and it's no wonder that you hear people whooping and hollering in the halls all night long. The doors don't seem to have an adjustable return mechanism and unless you make a special effort, they slam hard enough to shake the room. This also goes on all night. I wrote before that the walls between the rooms are paper thin, allowing for all but the quietest of conversations to extend to the neighboring rooms. The slots this year were super tight. The rooms weren't anything special but the beds were comfortable - too bad it was too noisy to appreciate their qualities for restfulness. We appreciated that the housekeeping was good and all our requests were met promptly and effectively. Couldn't sleep, couldn't win at the slots - couldn't find a reason to convince us to go back.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jraja1
Reviews.Content: Great location on the north side of the strip, good rooms for the price with all amenities, big lcd tvs, helpful and friendly staff, free valet parking and self parking as well as a free ride to the tower included in room rate! The restaurants and bars are also amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convinient”
Reviews.Author: TasiAmes
Reviews.Content: Strastosphere: Las Vegas: Exceptional Location Date: 31 January 2011 We booked this hotel for our honeymoon for the weekend. Stratosphere is a tall tower hotel. The Nice and approachable -- free entry to the top Big casino -- nice chance to wins Easy pubic transport to the strip Nice resturant in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More.”
Reviews.Author: adampfb
Reviews.Content: We went for a friends 50th which I had sent an email asking for the hotel to arrange something 2 weeks before nothing was done and no reply was given. When I spoke with the supervisor on the desk she said "It was nothing to do with the Front Desk. I needed to speak with the concierge, but they had been busy with over 100 emails" did not offer to solve the issue or apologise. Next was the dirty towel that had a big black mark across. I took this down to the the desk and said "Not making a fuss could you please just put fresh ones in" this was not done until the next day by housekeeping. No in room safe or tea/coffee making facilities. The pizzas were nice and massive. The rides on the top were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Tallest Tower on the Strip with Thrilling Rides”
Reviews.Author: rajkul
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere was initially a tower with thrill rides, with addition of hotel to it, you can stay and do the rides at the same time :) Added to it you get 50% discount on the rides and free entry to the tower plus variety of other freebies. It is value for money and located on the Strip where all other Mega Casinos are present. The Strip is Las Vegas for me :) The only downside is that the hotel is at the end of the strip so you might have to travel couple of miles to reach the major casino's viz. Bellagio, MGM Grand, Madalay Bay etc. But it does work well on your pocket while giving u all the fun of the strip and the rides are a must if you are in Vegas so anyways you will be travelling all the way there :) so why not stay and save some money to gamble ;)

Reviews.Title: “was fabulous except poor welcome at check in”
Reviews.Author: SamirDewan
Reviews.Content: We were staying for 2 days at this hotel, room was upgraded complimentary and faced the strip and was upto the standard. Ravi at concierge was really helpful and showed real positive attitude, but that impression of freindly staff ended there as at check in an Albanian lady checked us in with extremely cold behavior. No smile, no name recognition and no information re the hotel provided at check in....asked for a complimentary check out for 12, were told off bluntly to pay for additional hour, as hotel is full and theres nothing she can do ; when when aksed to speak to the manager, the lady at check in grinned and left to call for the manager and returned after 15 minutes without a manager stating that she is willing to offer complimentary check out at 12.....the hotel is perfect and upto the standards and just down the strip with convenient access to transport...its just our excitement was scarred at check in considering an email prior to arrival to hotel re special birthday treat.......the receptionist gave a damn !! all in all, we quite liked the hotel, location, infrastructure, but our impression was ruined by the way check in was handled !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “overrall an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: germur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Stratosphere between the 3rd and 7th of Feb 2011. I was upgraded to a spa room and given a free ticket to see a show and must say that I was very impressed with the manager that was on duty. I enjoyed Vegas very much. My only gripe is the inconvience tax, paying for a pool and gym that I never used but was charged for the privilage of it being their. However in all fairness to the Stratosphere most other casino's also charge this fee.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value!!”
Reviews.Author: jwfrommo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Stratosphere for a long weekend in Feb 2011, everything was great. We stayed in the newly remodeled section & the room was beautiful & functional. Bed was comfortable & Casino was great also. Had dinner in the Italian restaurant in the hotel & it was also very good. Saw "Bite" and it was great! Used the Duece for transportation so end of the strip was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to spend your 50th Birthday!!!”
Reviews.Author: kcarnahan
Reviews.Content: First just let me say, when we were planning our trip I read alot of reviews about the Stratosphere and I was concerned because one person would rate it really high and the next hated it. I did call the hotel and talked to one of the girls and she answered alot of questions and put my mind at ease. Now that we have stayed, all I can say is.....there wasn't really anything bad about this hotel (little minor quirks but they all have that). Our room was very nice, spacious, the bathroom was huge, Very clean. I hardly ever heard noise from the hallway (did hear a little from the room next door at 3:45 a.m., so maybe the walls might be a little thin...LOL). The buffet was very good. If you time it right and don't have too wait in line to go up in the Tower, it is breath taking....what a view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: JAG3575
Reviews.Content: Met our needs and would probably recommend. However, there seemed to be a shortage of human resources with the result that even contacting housekeeping resulted in holding on the line. This caused slight inconvenience. Other, downside is that no drink making facilities in the room which, if you like your hot beverages, can tur out to be expensive in the long run. Pool closed for renovation which was disappointment to kids. If you are a guest, make sure you obtain special pass to the rides at $29.00 pp for unlimited rides (something we found out on the last day). No guest laundry but was able to use the one at Circus Circus KAO (probably the nearest)

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the value”
Reviews.Author: Edgar312
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend here a couple weeks ago and will say that basically you get what you pay for. Yes, for the same price you might receive a little better amenities else where but this is Las Vegas so every little thing you expect from normal hotels is not complimentary here. And what about this "resort fee" they charge. Why don't they just call it a "In case you're not a gambler or don't want to experience our tepid thrills" charge. Worst off, our towels weren't replaced and neither were the linens. That's a big no no. I guess the only thing that was nice was view from the top of the Tower. Vegas please get on board with the rest of the civilized world and pass a ban on smoking, please!

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for our purposes, but not incredible.”
Reviews.Author: JeremyHakes
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. Our non-smoking room was clean and did not smell of smoke (unlike everywhere else in the entire city). The remodel/refreshing of the room was good and everything was acceptable. We really appreciated being able to go up into the Stratosphere Tower at our leisure, which we did on 3 occasions - for rides, for dinner, and for happy hour at the Level 107 Lounge and Air Bar. We also used our tickets for the 2-for-1 rides. One of the best things (if not THE best) of the tower is there is NO SMOKING in the tower in the restaurant, bar, lounge, or observation deck, except for one small designated area on the EXTERIOR viewing deck, which we VERY MUCH appreciated. After being surrounded by smoke everywhere we went, it was GREAT to be able to relax in the tower and enjoy ourselves without breathing other people's smoke. A BIG KUDOS to the management for keeping it such. It is very difficult to get away from smoke inside any building in Las Vegas. We walked to and from the Hotel, except for the last day, for which we rented a car at the 2nd floor area (R Level - kind of hard to get to, but worth the visit) and we returned our car to the airport, which was pretty handy. Other than being a slightly long walk from the other areas of the strip, it was no big deal. We could have taken a taxi. My only note of irritation was the "greeter" when we entered the hotel from the bus shuttle was not anyone associated with the hotel - they were pushy time-share presenters for Diamond Resorts (Polo Towers in Las Vegas). Pretty annoying to have them be my first person I am greeted by in the hotel/casino. Wasted plenty of time with them, but my fault for not blowing through them instead of being polite. By the way, after being suckered in for the presentation with their "gifts" (some of which were Stratosphere Tower tickets - worthless since we got to go up the tower anyway), their presentation was terrible and I thought the Polo Towers sucked, too. Nothing to do with the Stratosphere, mind you, just saying.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a cool room when you sleep at night don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gobuckeyes11
Reviews.Content: The hotel will not allow you to set your thermostat below 68 degrees and our room temp was 70-71 at night which for us was not very comfortable. The room was muggy and suppose to be an " upgrade ". Customer service recommended we purchase a fan ( seriously?) The employees here are nice but are obviously restricted as to how much they can do customer service wise. Stayed here with a group for a conference and the host instructor wasn't very happy with the room setup and having things ready the first day by some staff in our conference room. Buffet was not very good. You can do better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better, even if on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: lauraswaft
Reviews.Content: Beware the resort fee on top of what you think is a great rate. Location is in a bad part of town--don't go out at night. Long walks to get everywhere. Halls were littered the entire stay (same litter--it just never got picked up). We stayed in upgraded, newly "remodeled" tower--makes me wonder what the alternatives looked like. They forgot to remodel the tub, which was cracked & cut our feet. The view from the top of the tower was awesome. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Czech81
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel at the low cost. We have free tower visit. Pool was nice. I´ve booked non smoking room but we got smoke smelled room - it was bitter experience. Use cheap taxi to reach the centre!

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain for the money”
Reviews.Author: MelloNello60
Reviews.Content: I decided to do an inexpensive get-away to Vegas, last July. So, I cashed some airmiles and booked at the Stratosphere. It was my second stay there. The rooms are clean and quiet. The Stratosphere does not have central air conditioning in the rooms, but has the separate wall unites, which are a bit louder but still ok. I spent most of my daytime hours by the pool to cool off in the summer heat. The bottom line is, if you don't mind simpler rooms than the Wynn, a northern location on the strip and a bit of a younger croud, the Statosphere is fine. I just take the bus to the central part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Lowro
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our stay. Rooms were very nice and clean. Several restaurants to choose from. Can't be the view from the Top of the World. In walking distance to other hotels. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel to ANYONE.”
Reviews.Author: adnilkatie
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered the worst customer service I have ever experienced.. I called before our arrival to ensure our reservation was in order. We had booked one stay and then gone back and added some days. We had also booked four rooms which we wanted to ensure were near one antoher. I spent 68 minutes on the phone with a customer service rep who said he worked out all the details. When we arrived, the reservation was a total mess and we spent another hour HOUR checking into four rooms. We left for the day on our third day there for a FULL day trip and did not return until 4 a.m. the following day. When I tried to get in my room, the key did not work and I spend almost TWO HOURS trying to get ito my room. The front desk clerk said our reservation showed us checking out that day (hence the two plus hours I spent earlier "working out" our reservation was in vain) and she could not override the lock-out. Even though our things were in our room, they LOCKED US OUT. There was no manager on site. I have traveled a lot and have NEVER had this or anything closely resembling this happen to me. My medication was in my room and I tried to explain that I REALLY needed to get in. She sent me up to my room THREE times assuring me each time I could now get in. Each time I went back down to the lobby I had to stand in line AGAIN to tell her the key didn't work. It was the WORST hotel experience of my life...BY FAR. I finally convinced her to get security to let me in my room. By this time it was morning and I WAS supposed to be checking out. It was awful. None of it made any sense. They had my credit card on file. It really was pitiful. Add to all this that this hotel is off by itself and it is not convenient to much of anything. You feel very isolated. The casino is poor, the buffet not so good and the rooms so-so. With so many awesome hotels in LV DO NOT CHOOSE THE STRATOSPHERE!!

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel and have no complaints at ALL!”
Reviews.Author: yvetteJamaica_Queens
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints at all about my stay and experiences at this hotel. What I liked most was the fact that it was away from all the noise and mass of people that fill the strip day and night. I actually only ventured up the strip three times and each time was annoyed by all the people wandering aimlessly with no destination in mind just clogging the sidewalks. I enjoyed all the restaurants in the hotel as well as the ones near by. I will be returning soon and staying here without even thinking of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality for the Money”
Reviews.Author: kaki3152
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Las Vegas for the first week of February,primarily because I obtained a great airfare/hotel stay deal. The cheapest location on the strip was the Stratosphere, which I had visisted many years ago when it was relatively new. After having been there two days, these are my impressions. The room is relatively large,very clean, with a comfortable bed, There is a large Flat screen TV. The only drawback is that the TV only gets about 20 channels. Two in Spanish, a Chicago station ?,,PBS, couple local channels and that's it. Not much to watch when you're trying to sleep off the worst hangover in about seven years.There is no cofee maker/microwave/fridge which is an irritation. At least, they could have a coffee maker! I understand they're trying to make money in these poor times but this is ridiculous. Another minor irritant is the Internet service. The Hotel wants $12/day for all day Internet service. Best thing to do is go to the Starbucks that's located behind Carl's Jr. (you have to walk a few blocks) and use their free Wifi and put your $12 to good use. As far as the hotel restaurants, the buffet is decent with a good selection, they have a Macdonalds/Starbucks on the premises, and several nice looking places which I haven't tried yet. The Starbucks on the hotel premise is expensive and has unfriendly help. Best go to the Other Starbucks, if you can help it. On the outside,within walking distance of the Strat, there is a Chinese Thai greasy spoon called Ochas [?] which serves up cheap good filling food. There is also a Mcdonalds/Star bucks/Dennys/IHOP near by. For the price/clean factor, I would recommend this hotel but note these minor irritants

Reviews.Title: “very cheap but great service”
Reviews.Author: julkas
Reviews.Content: we found a great deal on trip advisor and were very positively surprised when we arrived, hotel is huge with its own casinos and a roller coaster on the roof, there are some swimming pools and nice bed to sunbath . There some restaurants open 24 hour a day ( food is very average) . For the price we could use washers and dryers what was a huge advantage as we were doing some road trip. Its a very affordable place but clean and fashionable.totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value,good service,awesome view”
Reviews.Author: czkAlberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, booked newly renovated room which costs $10 more but it is worth it.Room is modern , stylish,comfy beds with good linen.There is 42 in flat screen TV .Hotel staff was helpful and proffesional.Few restaurants included McDonalds located above the casino.Casino looks bit old and we do not gamble so can not judge.Unlimited access to the tower was just added bonus and the view was spectacular,the rides on top are out of this world Hotel is at very end of the strip,ok if you have car or I used bus - $7 day.Nothing pretty surrounding the hotel , some run down houses and land for redevelopment.Would not recommend anyone to hang out outside at night around the hotel.We walked to the hotel one night and seen some shady people on the streets.Beside that hotel itself is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Calder_Girl
Reviews.Content: The first room we got has a great view if you leaned over and looked through the tiny window. The bathroom did not have a sink and the door knob has a sharp screw. The sink was in the bedroom and did not drain until maintenance came. We moved the next nite to a room with bathroom that had a sink (so we did not disturb each other in the nite) and bigger window but it looked out on the roof and at nite the floodlites made sleeping difficult. So we moved again to a better room - finally - for two nites. Staff were helpful and the rooftop pool was almost deserted even though it was quite warm out - bonus. Getting to registration you had to go through the casino - poor layout. The buffet was not very good and Roxy's Restaurant was just ok. Fellini's was delicious! Starbucks was good and have delicious pastries. Because its at the end of the strip, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Value”
Reviews.Author: UkEverywhere
Reviews.Content: When you go to vegas you dont go for the best hotel that costs the most, why? because you can stay in the cheapest hotel like the stratosphere and still get all the benifits of going into all the expensive hotels. All the hotels are open to everybody, you can eat at their resturants etc, so why pay big bucks for a room you'l hardly be in. I just came back from the stratosphere just days ago and it was brilliant, fantastic rooms, we upgraded to the brand new rooms with jacuzzi and a fantastic view of the strip. Granted the stratosphere is a little out the way but their are cheap buses every 10 mins that can take you directly into the strip. Benifits of this hotel is that you can go to the top of the tower for free if you stay in this hotel as many times as you like and get discounts on the rides, where as others will have to pay full price. They also give you 2 for 1 tickets to see the American Allstars which is defo worth seeing. I loved it here and its good value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... but at the very end of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Pixxidix
Reviews.Content: Location: far off the Strip. A free bus will take you along the Strip but it is always crowded. Walking from the Stratosphere to the other end of the Strip is extremely tiresome: beware in summer the Strip is extremely dusty , Las Vegas is located in a desert after all. Rooms: very good value for money, very big rooms with great views. One show or ride is included in the hotel price, which is always good in Las Vegas. Casino: average.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time, but still have a rash from the bed"”
Reviews.Author: ddg93221
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere from 1/15/2011 to 1/19/2011. We enjoyed the stay and despite the negative reviews about the location, we found it to be ideal. It was a short taxi ride to wonderful downtown Fremont St. and close to the new strip. The only negative experience we had was a rash that I developed while sleeping. We have been home a week and I still have the rash. I went to the doctor yesterday and she said it was possible bed bug bites or an allergic reaction. Free internet with the resort fee would have been ideal.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL BUT THE LOCATION IS NOT THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: OSCALGOR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to las vegas for a couple of days and we had a great time. The hotel is comfortable, nice, clean and they provide good service, there are shops, restaurants and theaters inside the place and this is a plus. The only matter is the location wich even wheen the hotel is located on the strip but kind of not close to the main hotels and casinos. You must take the public transportation and the bus stop is right out side the hotel and is 24 houres. It will take you about 25 minutes to get "Cesars Palace" for instance. The rates are low and the hotel is good and if you do not mind to be not close to the main casinos this is a really good option for familys, couples and singles. At the top of the tower there is an small amusement park recomended just for intrepid people and the view is amasing too. Just a piece of advise do not go to the 7-eleven behind the parking lot at night, the area behind the hotel is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “What a good deal the Stratosphere is.”
Reviews.Author: x1achilles
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1-3 December 2010. We were on a cheapo package deal from SFO that cost US$297 for air and two nights for both of us! Then, Exped(ia).ca gave me a $300 credit for booking. The whole trip was FREE! We took the city bus from the airport for $2 each. Dropped us off right by the hotel. At check in the agent asked if we would like to upgrade from a floral print 80s room to a 2010 re-done room for $10. YOU BET! What a great deal! The room was big and had a decent view. Guests get free admission to Tower. Worth thirteen dollars ea. Since it was December, we didn't try the pool..it may have been closed. Pluses: Price, rooms are excellent, staff is friendly, Free admission to Tower, quiet. Minuses: Location is odd, between the main strip area and downtown, Restaurant we tried (Rubio's Diner) was not good nor cheap. Overall, you cannot beat this deal!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Officionada
Reviews.Content: This was not a perfect stay, but a satisfactory one. Thanks to great Vegas packages we booked a 4 night stay in Stratosphere Select king bedroom “Premier tower”, on the 19th floor. We chose this hotel due to the newly renovated rooms. We arrived at 8AM and check in went smoothly; we were 3rd in line and our room was available immediately. At check in, the hotel charged us $7.50 per day ($30 in total) for the observation deck access. The room was clean, with new furniture, carpet, LCD TV with very few channels, curtains, with a basic bath and a view of the mountains. The view was not facing the Las Vegas Blvd. strip. The bed was comfortable, the room and bathroom were clean, so I cannot complain about that aspect. We also requested a non-smoking room since neither one of us smoke. However, either the A/C ventilation ducts are not properly constructed or maybe someone was smoking next door (probably both), every once in a while we could smell nicotine in our own room. In addition, the room walls are paper thin. We had a family of 4 next door and we could hear all the yelling and screaming, which was quite obnoxious. Thankfully, they did not stay there long. The hotel is very basic, Roxy’s 50s diner, buffet, Italian restaurant, gift shop, and McDonalds. Cbar is at the casino level, and Up in the Air bar on the 108th floor. The bungee jumping area is on the 108th floor as well. Free parking and I am not certain about Wi-Fi b/c we did not use the internet during our stay. No one was rude, and everyone was very pleasant. We had a car, and I would recommend for the use of one since the hotel is at the very end of the strip. Hope this helps. I am including some photos.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pebz86
Reviews.Content: Rooms was very spacious and clean with plenty of space for all 4 guests to comfortably move around. Pool was clean and staff at the pool were great, ensuring that anyone who wanted/ needed a drink got one. Only hangup would be the location. It's a bit far from the main strip area but the monorail is nearby. Good hotel overall and very happy with the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money and the gambling is good”
Reviews.Author: Barneyboones
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a Friday and Saturday night stay and were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and modern look of the rooms. We weren't sure what to expect given the cheaper price. The gambling was great - lots of loose slots and 5 dollar crap tables. Good place to gamble for hours on end! The location is one of the only negatives. Will have to drive or taxi to get close to the rest of the strip action. I requested a strip view room - don't fall for that ploy! There's only so much of the strip you can see from this far down the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Strato up!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelmaster69
Reviews.Content: stayed in the stratosphere select rooms last weekend...We liked it. The rooms were clean and new with modern amenities. For the price, you really can not beat this hotel. Yes, everyone likes to complain about the location. So? It just depends on what you want. It is right between the new and old strip and close to the outlet mall. If you are into strip clubs...well Industrial is right behind you, take your pick. If you have a rental car or your own car, I don't have issue with the location at all. If you like to wander aimlessly up the strip taking pictures of different casino features...well you probably want to move on up the strip. It was a middle class crowd, trending toward slightly younger. It was not as smoky as the old strip with much fewer of the degenerates that like to wander Fremont on their last 25 cents. Also, it is not as stuffy as some of the others up the strip. It has some fun bars, a couple decent shows, a mall upstairs (although aging) and the view from the top of the tower is amazing (free tower entrance with room). Also, they had a $20 all you can drink special in the bar at happy hour. And, if you decide you want to venture up or downtown...well, I think I saw a few thousands cabs looking to take you the long way around the block and reach in your pocket. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation, clean, modern”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and loved it. We did book one of the newly renovated rooms (make sure you ask for one because not all have been done) it was clean, modern and new. Great big LCD TV. Included free access to the Tower (normally $15) and to the roof pool. Customer service was awesome. We used the Valet and they were quick and friendly even when it was hectic. Check in was smooth and our rate was awesome! The location is North of the main portion of the strip but the Monorail is a close walk or you can drive down and park at another casino. After seeing the chaos and lines down in the main portion of the strip we actually appreciated being alittle removed from it but still able to visit. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It's a decent hotel... Shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: Smizz
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of the The Strip then The Stratosphere isn't for you. If you want to be away from all the noise and closer to the... less friendly looking part of town then sure, go for it. I'm not saying that this is a terrible hotel, it's just the location. I think it's at least half a mile from The Bellagio and all the other main hotels, which is a shame really, but I suppose this is why it's such good value. The hotel was spotless. Despite being a little out of date and in need of maybe a little refurbishment, the rooms we stayed in were clean and quite spacious. We were at the back of the hotel so our room was facing the freeway (which is miles away so don't worry about that) and had stunning views of mountains in what must have been the Mojave(?) Either way, the view was very nice. The beds were comfy, the bathroom was clean and I think the maids came every other day. The breakfast buffet was quite nice and the fresh omelettes were always a great way to start the morning. There are quite a few different restaurants dotted around the ground floor and they are all good quality with reasonable prices and even the fussy eaters among us were able to find something they enjoyed. I didn't bother with room service because it seemed a bit pricey but it was there! Going to the top of the tower is a must! We didn't go on the roller-coaster as the terrified faces of many put us off, ever so slightly. But, if you're into being hung 1000ft above the ground then you'll enjoy it. Either way, there is plenty to do up there and I'm sure the whole family will find something they enjoy. So, in my opinion, The Stratosphere is a nice hotel with features that other hotels do not have. It's great if you're on a bit of a budget and don't mind a walk or a taxi to the heart of The Strip. If you want something a little more central and not too over priced, I would suggest Luxor or Excalibur as they are very close to everything. Overall I give it a thumbs up but would probably look for somewhere else if I was to return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: calvin43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night at the tail end of our trip to Death Valley. The room was very nice. We heard no noise during the night, the shower products were excellent and the hotel itself was nicely appointed. Check in was very speedy and painless, as was checkout. The only odd thing was that the very large HDTV was being fed SD signals, so the image quality was poor. But that's a minor nit -- I highly recommend this hotel -- particularly for what we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, a north of the strip”
Reviews.Author: rfembach
Reviews.Content: Was in Las Vegas for Vacation. Was looking for a good and cheap hotel. Stratosphere was a good choice. Had a room on a remodeled level..... ask for it its worth. Pool is ok, during weekend to loud. The bare pool on the roof top is not worth to go and you have to pay an addional 10 bucks for it. Rooms were very quite and comfortable... finally a good deal... a little bit north on the strip... but thats ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: salvisaloni2
Reviews.Content: I had booked 2 rooms for 3 nights through the stratosphere website. I arrived at the hotel at around 7:00 pm and the lady at the check in said that I would not be able to get any rooms. I would have to upgrade or take smoking rooms. I explained to her that I was allergic to smoke so I could not take smoking rooms and that we were all college students with a tight budget so we could not afford an upgrade. I said that we could wait and asked her how many hours it would take for the rooms to be ready. She refused saying it could take a very very long time and she would not be able to even get us any rooms at all then. She refused to call housekeeping and find out how soon they could get some rooms ready. I then asked her to give us one smoking room and we would put our bags in there and told her we would wait for the other non smoking room since I am allergic to smoke. There were just 4 of us anyways and she could easily have arranged that. She againg refused. We also could not afford an upgrade. She refused and said it was hotel policy and that I could check on my itinerary where it would be stated that the room bookings are just requests and the hotel reserves the right to ask to upgrade. Nothing like that was written on the itinerary. She said that she would be able to do nothing for us at all and I was forced to pay for an upgrade. The towels in the rooms also smelled of cigarette smoke. Due to my smoke allergy, I had to go and buy a towel from outside. I am extremely upset that my stay in Las Vegas was spoiled on the first day itself and I was forced to pay more just because the hotel could not give us our rooms. It was 7:00 in the evening when we checked in and I would think their rooms should be ready considering that I never saw any housekeepers on my floor after 4:00 - 5:00 p.m. My family owns a motel in Texas and I do know a lot about hotel business so I do know when I am being made a fool of. I think this was just a way to get us to pay more money. I will be returning to Vegas next year but i will definitely not stay at Stratosphere again and will never recommend it to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value even at dirt cheap prices”
Reviews.Author: TripTrip83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. My first words of advice: Yes, it may look cheaper than the other hotels, but when you factor in at least $30 for transportation costs each day (that is - if you want to go anywhere other than the Stratosphere - which you definitely will) then the cheap room rates are no longer all that great a value. We were "upgraded" to the new tower. If that tower was new, I would hate to see what the "old" tower looks like! The rugs & throw pillows had many stains, the handles of the dresser drawers were loose and spun around every time you tried to open a drawer, the shower head had green mildew all over it, and the rubber baseboard around the bathroom was warped and falling off. Thankfully we checked both keys before heading off to the conference, since my husband's didn't work. That took another 30 minutes in line to fix. When it deactivated again the next day, we just didn't bother fixing it. Upon arriving at our room, we found tons of little scrap pieces of paper/tissue all over the rug. I have no idea when they last vacuumed. In addition, they didn't even come to clean our room one day and another we had to call for service. On the last day, when we were checking out and didn't need to be anywhere, they decided to start banging on our door at 9am & drilling something in the room next door. The icing on the cake was the final night when we decided to get our free admission to the tower. We ordered a drink at their super cheesy bar (half the crowd is in sweatshirts and the other half is dressed like hookers). They didn't have Jack Daniels or Captain Morgan (really?!?!) so I settled on a rail rum & coke. It cost $18! Plus, it came served in a plastic cup with a giant attitude on the side!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but far away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: deepc7
Reviews.Content: For the price, its a great place to stay. We stayed for 5 days, and never had a problem with anything. The hotel is at the end of the strip, away from the glitz and glamour of the other hotels. This hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the center of strip at other hotels like Ceasers Palace and Bellagio. Would recommend it if you want to be in Vegas, but still have some peace and quiet. As for me, on my next trip, I would prefer a hotel which is at the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Cheeseball Haven”
Reviews.Author: Meg424
Reviews.Content: If you can avoid this hotel, do so, dumpy and very cheese-y. Horrible lighting in the rooms, thin towels, and the negative list goes on and on. Spend your money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but great deals on price”
Reviews.Author: 10_Downing_St
Reviews.Content: Clean room, clean bathroom, what more would you want for such a cheap price. Location is good if you are prepared to walk. (or get a taxi). Only a 30 minute walk (about 2 miles) from the outlet stores. Not too scary at night. The concierge was completly useless. Go to the Venetian or the Luxor and they are really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on north Strip”
Reviews.Author: maxim_mos
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights for unbelievable price - 21 usd (excl tax and resort fee). Overall, the hotel is good. Big renovated rooms with LCD screens. The location is so-so - a little far from the main attractions on the Strip - car is recommended. All guests have free access to The Stratosphere Tower (costs 15 usd). Free parking (as all Strip hotels). Wi-Fi is not for free and cost 12 usd per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deals”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Vaca7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Stratosphere for our anniversary vacation. We stayed two night and it was perfect. We have been to Vegas before and we knew we didn't want all the hype of a newer and larger hotel. Since the stratosphere had awesome deals, we decided to stay there in a vegas view room. The view wasn't the greatest nor was the room, but it was decent for the price we paid. We only live 6 hrs away in driving time so we go up a lot every now and then, so staying in a north strip hotel was no big deal for us. However, if you live farther away and will only come to Vegas once, I suggest staying somewhere in the middle of the strip so that you can walk everywhere. The stratosphere was a great hotel except that it was far away from pretty much everything. I did love the casino and we did better in te stratosphere casino than in the othere middle of the strip casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, to stay but not great”
Reviews.Author: Jeepmancrd
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel, with remodeled rooms and comfy beds. The bed linens were clean as well as the bathrooms, but i found candy on the floor which werent mine. The windows were drafty and would moan loudly when the wind blew. The atmosphere at the main bar in the lobby wasnt great, didnt spend much there because of this. Casino just ok. Check in staff, and the guys out curbside were great. No complaints there at all. All in all ok hotel located a bit too far down the strip, but there was a bus stop right outside. I wouldnt stay there again after seeing all the other options while in vegas, for little or not much more money. But quite affordable all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: cvs666
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the stratosphere for a friends' reunion for new year's. The prices for 4/room were the cheapest here, so we took up the tower deluxe rooms. Vegas rooms are not the most plush, but these rooms were downright drab- they upgraded us to the new tower, but the carpets inside these rooms were faded and old, the bathroom was tiny and the room was just basic. The A/C was either too warm or too cold and made a loud noise every time it regulated itself. And no coffee maker in the room too, something I haven't seen happening even at motels. As for the hotel itself, it has a great brunch buffet spread, value for money. But the average casino on the strip is a lot less shadier than the main casinos here. The view from the top deck is awesome, and we didnt do the rides as it was too cold. The monorail station is a few blocks away near Sahara, but it might be nice to carry comfortable shoes for the walk and wear your heels in the train. However, if you are 4 people to a cab, cabs just might work out cheaper, as a one way monorail ticket costs $5, and it only costs $12-17 to the strip by cab if you dont take the freeway. All in all, it was an average stay at stratosphere- you can get much plusher rooms and hotel ambience at other hotels on the strip rather than a motel feel here- so spend a wee bit more and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, far from main Strip”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one day and probably won't be back again. This is one of the smallest room I have ever been in Las Vegas. Bed was uncomfortable, and it's hard to get around 'cause it was so cramped and dark. Not a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: canayen
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night Dec 22. Solo male traveller. I was on my way from Death Valley to Grand Canyon and just wanted a place to overnight -- not interested in gambling. I booked on hotels.ca. The first room was fine except that it was right opposite the main bank of elevators -- noisy. So I requested a room change and got it. Quite smooth when you consider it's a big hotel and I was paying budget prices. The second room was great and I slept like a baby.Very good value. The plus of the hotel is the tower -- really magnificent views and three or four death defying rides, etc. Good fun watching. The minus is that you're at the north end of the strip, so it's quite a hike to the central strip. The neighbourhood is not excellent, but not threatening. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again. Parking very easy. They waived the resort fee of about $8.00, I think because I booked through hotels.ca. I actually did stay there a few days later -- again a stop over as I had an early flight out. This was after Christmas and so the hotel was sold out. I ended up in a room that had a door to an adjoining room -- so when a large family took that room I could hear EVERYTHING. I complained to the hotel and they explained that they were sold out and could not move me. A polite chat with the friendly family made for good relations. The lesson in all of this is that when you get cheap rates on rooms, it's "caveat emptor." Check the room out thoruoghly when you get it and if necessary, make a request to change. I felt that putting me in that room without telling me about the adjoining door was really unacceptable as neither I or the family had any expectation of privacy. However, overall, the staff were helpful and friendly, and I'd stay there again. Checkout was simple and fast. I didn't sample any of the restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: If you want to walk around the strip, then this is not the right hotel for you. There is lot of walking, look the map before booking. But that is the only negative thing, location is kind of in the Strip, but it's also long away from everything. We booked the new Select rooms, they were really new. And very clean. Loved it. Pool area seemed nice, but they closed it when the calender turned into November. That sucked, it was almost 90 degrees outside and pool was closed. There is lot of small stores and small restaurants inside hotel and a Starbucks just next to the elevators. Parking garage was huge and short walking from hotel entrance. I'm not going back to this hotel, because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “4th time in the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: jflem
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay here and once again I wasnt dissapointed. The rooms are large and clean. Our room had a jacuzzi and living space. We had a view of the strip and pool......the pool parties are great by the way. The buffet is the best value on the strip in my opinion, and a few other good restaurants. The rides at the top are something else, make sure you do the big shot. Everyone complains that this hotel is at the top of the strip but I have stayed in more central hotels like PH and MGM and I always fing the taxi journeys about the same. For the price of the rooms here I think its hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, poor location and blah casino”
Reviews.Author: misterburns
Reviews.Content: Got a deal through Bookit.com, top floor room for $50. Newly remodeled. Was indeed very nice, great view, super beds, nice large bathroom. But the casino was blase, very boring, dull, old, creepy... and there's nothing around. If you just want a nice room, stay here. Otherwise, I would go stay elsewhere closer on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “there is no rooms in the tower dont pay extra thinking you will be staying in the stratosphere room!!!”
Reviews.Author: milly50226
Reviews.Content: We book the stratosphere select room which we had to pay extra thinking because of the name and the way it was advertised we were supposed to have a room in the top of the tower but SORPRISE!!!!!!! there are not rooms in the tower it is just and observatory area besides that unfortunatly situations the hotel is prety decent our room was clean i dont any complaints except that one but if you have a couple extra bucks to spend dont try to upgrate your roon you will still get the same room with a different name just go to a hotel that you dont need to walk that much and truly be in the middle of the strip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it was very good.”
Reviews.Author: gittinsj
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is a relatively inexpensive hotel on the strip. Actually, it's very cheap. The rooms are nice and clean, and it is fun to explore the hotel. Be aware you may be charged a $7.50 room fee per day, which I'm not sure what purpose it serves. Wireless internet is not free, and you charged $11.99 for every person that uses a computer in your room. Be aware of that, as it makes it seem otherwise. Even so, with the wireless fees, the room was still likely cheaper than many other places we could have stayed. There are a number of restaurants that you can eat at, which is nice to be able to not have to leave the hotel if you don't want.

Reviews.Title: “For the price I paid for the room, I was blown away”
Reviews.Author: Az84
Reviews.Content: I came to visit Vegas for a day for business and was looking for a cheap place to spend the night. For a weekday night I paid under $40 for my room (including the resort fee). Paying this little I didn't know what to expect, but I was bracing for the worst. When I entered the room I was shocked. The room was spotless, large (I had to get a room with two beds, both of which were big, clean, and well made), had a big screen TV, and a seperate clean bathroom. I've seen some of the other cheaper hotels in Vegas (like Circus Circus) but this one definitely is a step ahead. The walls are somewhat thin, but thankfully the night I was there my neighbors were all quiet. The front desk is located in the casino, so you have to walk through the casino just to check in and out. The night I was there the casino was suprisingly active. They had quite a few roulette tables, two of which were packed, and they have a seperate poker room in addition to a few other poker tables scattered in the casino. There's a retail area above the casino that has a lot of different stores and a few restaurants (McDonalds, Krispy Kreme, Ruby's, and a Mexican place). Nothing high class, but I don't think anyone would expect that considering the price you pay to stay here. There was also a theater that had shows (adult oriented after 11:30 PM), a free fall attraction (108 story drop), and a rotating restaurant that is supposedly pretty good. You can call for room service (which comes from the Ruby's restaurant) but they take cash only. I asked them if they could charge it to my room, but since I reserved my room online my credit card was closed and would have required a $50 deposit (refundable, I assume?) to re-open. That kind of sucked, so I ended up just going down and picking up the food myself. If you plan on doing the strip, you'll need a car unless you really like to walk. There's ample, free parking available on site. If you're heading to Vegas on a budget, this hotel is an extremely solid value. You're within a 2-5 minute drive of the heart of the strip, and can stlil get a good casino experience just by staying on site.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good- but better options in terms of location are available”
Reviews.Author: Vikram1210
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel solely for Saturday nights' stay, as other hotels on the Strip were damn expensive on Saturdays. However, to my surprise the hotel turned out to be pretty good. We reached the hotel around 1100 HRS on Saturday (04 DEC 10), the check in line was pretty long, however due to multiple people assisting the visitors, it did not take long for check in. The front office staff were very friendly. Though the check in was at 1500 HRS, upon request early check in was given, more importantly upon request the room was upgraded to room on higher floors with a good view. All of this without any extra charge. The room was pretty big & more importantly clean. But who goes to Vegas to stay in Hotel room. The hotel also provides great discounts for the people staying with them. We received several coupons for food, stage shows, and adventure rides. Which we completely loved. We saved around $ 100 through coupons. As we got one ticket free on purchase of one show ticket which costs around 50 bucks, and also got discounts on rides. The most important aspect of this hotel is observation deck. The entry of which is free for people stay-in. Which means a clear $12 saving per person. The observation deck is the best part of staying in this hotel. From here you can see entire Vegas at one go. The observation deck is open till 2AM, and with good seating arrangement and also a bar. There are plenty of slot machines and a big casino. There are plenty of food options available. We did not try the Top of the world restaurant as there were not many options available and also considering it was a bit expensive. The only disadvantage of this place is its location. This hotel is located at the end of the strip. Hence, there is not much of an option in case you intend to go out for a walk on the strip. However, as this is away from the strip, its calm. So one can actually get a good nights sleep. Though the hotel is good. I wouldn't go and stay in this hotel. As there are many hotels available right on the strip. However, there is nothing wrong with this hotel. Its good for a day' stay.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst Vegas stay I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: sirdigger
Reviews.Content: Checked in first room was filthy with used condoms in trash. Next room was ok. We had 2 queen beds. Woke up first morning with swollen eyes. definately allergy. Call to housekeeping to have bedding changed. next night son comes in sleeps in same bed. next morning swollen eyes and throat. This really sucks when your here to work the rodeo for 12 days. Next night husband cones in. Next morning guess what??? yep another case. go to dr to find out we have a staff infection. Will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly a Great Hotel at an Affordable Rate”
Reviews.Author: sulitster
Reviews.Content: I named my own price at PRICELINE.com and was disappointed to get the Stratosphere because of some of the negative comments in here about the hotel. Boy was I wrong! This hotel really is a fantastic place to stay at. The hotel certainly seems to have a great management team that oversee the operations as it is evidently seen in the services provided to me during my stay. Employees were all smiles and respectful. My room was a newly remodeled one called the "Select". The bed was so comfortable that I had the same good night sleep like I was sleeping on my own bed. The room was quiet because it had central type airconditioner. The TV is of the flat screen type although I think that the hotel should have more channels on it. There is a $11.99 charge for internet. Make sure that you get the actual hotel's wireless signal (Cox Stratosphere) because there is also the TRAVELER's WiFi signal that is cheaper at $9.99 but it is at dial up speeds and I find that you have to be at the window to get the strongest signal. My room is clean so kudos to the housekeeping. The only suggestion I want to make is for the shower curtain to be spread out by housekeeping after they clean the tub so that the curtain will dry out and not get that musty odor. Took advantage of the 2 for 1 deal on the American Superstars show and also went up the observation deck that is free to hotel guests. Parking is free and I saw plenty of security guards on bike patrol circling the property even during the daytime. There are so many positives about this hotel that I definitely recommend it to anyone going to Las Vegas. I can certainly say that I will stay at this hotel again next time I am in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have asked for more !!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is at the north end of the Las Vegas strip, it is a little way from the main part making it a little quieter. The hotel was undergoing some updating around the public areas but this didnt affect us at all. Our rooms were the lowest priced of the hotel (king bed regency room and a twin queen for the kids) but you would never know it, the rooms were large, clean and functional, the bathrooms were small but clean and there was always hot water. Maid service was very good. The hotel itself was clean and the staff were very approachable. There were restaurants and fast food places along with the buffet and shops, it seemed to cater for many needs. The prices were as you would expect of a Vegas hotel. Parking was ample and not too far away from the building itself of course there was always the valet which was much apreciated after a day out. We travelled with our children 17 and 19, so it was a little awkward at times as they were not allowed to hang around in the casino part which you had to walk through to get anywhere, so we were constantly aware that we needed to keep moving through, this is standard in all of the hotel casinos. Unfortunately there was nowhere inbetween where you could have a drink and a sit down without having to go into a restaurant. Apart from this we were more than happy with the value and service we got from this hotel. We would recommend Stratosphere Hotel and Casino to any of our friends and family and would definately return there ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KenJeffs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a few years previously, and remembered it as a functional place to stay at a decent price. Now, having just returned from a 6-day break, this hotel certainly deserves praise for the well thought-out refurb work undertaken. Having read some of the reviews before I set out, I was slightly wary beforehand - but from check in until departure, I found all the staff to be welcoming and friendly. My newly refurbished Premier room on the 21st floor was very pleasing; this fresh and tastefully decorated accom was maintained by the housekeeping staff who did a great job daily. The buffet (with 25% discount for room guests) was true value! Although located at the end of the Strip, the frequent buses stopping directly outside (with a ticket machine to purchase a 24hr valid ride ticket for $7) negated the need to jump in a taxi. Also conveniently, the Downtown bus stop was located directly opposite. Overall, a really good place to stay at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “The service is top notch for a value hotel”
Reviews.Author: artvndlay
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel/casino complex. The consistently high level of service we got from the staff was really appreciated and not expected at the price which we paid. I think in all areas this hotel exceeded expectations and I would be happy to stay here again. Location: Yes, it is not very close to other strip hotels. Not a big deal, we cab it almost everywhere we go in Vegas anyway so instead of a $10 cab ride it is $15. And if you are cheap the bus does run down here. Rooms: Had a room on the 23rd floor of the World I tower. Good view of the strip but the window was dirty. Views don't matter too much here though, just go up in the tower which surpasses anything from the rooms by far. A little larger and nicer than my friends room in World II tower (16th floor, no strip view). Clean, comfortable. Very quiet as well - could hear the jumpers scream on their way down from the tower but was not a concern when I tried to sleep. As far as I can tell the different towers are really just different names for elevator banks as they seemed to be all connected as one building? Casino: Clean and very little smoke. Staff here again was good. Similar to any other strip casino of this caliber. There is party pit way in the back of the casino...seems like it is in the back so there is less chance it will offend the mid western sensibilities of their average guest? Guests were of all types - less of the typically annoying bachelor / bachelorette parties but still a few younger singles around. Restaurants/Shopping - Nothing spectacular here that I tried, but we did not eat at Top of the World. We did eat at Fellini's which was ok for the price. Tower: The tower is worth a visit. Especially at night or during sunset. Maybe not the best view of the strip but very good. And included if you are a guest at the hotel. Not a guest? I would see if you can find a guest to take you up - each guest gets 4 swipes of their room key (per day I think). The tower is not cheap if you are not a guest, $15 I think. Service: This is really what sets this hotel apart. For this price, I expect a clean basic room with very minimal service. However, from check in to check out I thought the staff was amazing. They really went above and beyond in more than one instance for us and were always pleasant when I interacted with them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: minijetset
Reviews.Content: Room was nice since they have updated them. The view from the 107 lounge is magnificent and the happy hour's were very good priced for vegas. If you don't stay there make sure you at least stop by and go to the top. I have been there 4 times and couldn't believe I waited this long.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Fabulious, Family, Food for wedding”
Reviews.Author: Wedding1203
Reviews.Content: We went through "Hotel Planner" to book rooms and got an awesom deal on room rates and then had some upgrades to suites. Went to Vegas for our daughters wedding which was at The Little Church in the West (also great) We checked in 12/1 - 12/5. Casino was being remodeled so each morning more areas open and really looking swank. Staff very friendly and helpful. Desk was able to get us front row seats for the Blue Man Group (also a must) Only downers...lighting in bathrooms dim and location down the strip from all the other well know casinos. BUT no big deal, took bus or cab right from front door and never had to wait. They upgraded the honeymoon suite to an even better suite for our daughter and son in law. Hostess are great, one even came and helped my daughter & bridemaids with their hair and make up. We are from the south and felt like we got that Southern Hospitality in Vegas. We had the reception dinner there in the Fellnis Itillian resturant. Private room, private staff (Stephan was funny and great) good rates with several options to choose from and they also provide a yummy 2 tier wedding cake with cham toast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean hotel but at wrong end of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: AJackson44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in a King suite. Room was clean, good size with very comfortable bed. The casino is at the very end of The Strip and a fair walk from the heart of The Strip, however shuttle bus stop is right outside. Room was good value for money (weeknight stay) however if you want to be right in Las Vegas I don't recommend this hotel. Other amenities at the casino were average.

Reviews.Title: “4th Stay at the Hotel & it is getting better each time!”
Reviews.Author: LeelaKed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere from 22nd November until 2nd December; I love this hotel but what made this trip more special is that we experienced some of the changes that the hotel and were upgraded to one of the rooms that had been newly renovated. We were in room 42211, which had lovely views of Down Town and the mountains beyond. The room was perfect and soo clean. We could tell that the Stratosphere was making huge improvements to try and bring in more guests. I cannot recommend this hotel more than I have; the staff are lovely and we have had no cause to complain. The only downside was that there was a lot of work going on in the casino and that we weren't there to see the finished job but it means we will need to take another trip back to see what it looks like. The renovation work had no impact on our holiday and you couldn't hear a thing from the room, which is a plus. This hotel is a bargain and is a great base particularly for those of you who want to get the most of Fremont as well as the main Strip. Lots of transport options like Monorail, the Deuce or even a taxi. I can't say anything bad about this hotel, it's been an old faithful of mine since 2005 and will continue to be whenever I visit Las Vegas. Love the changes so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Shoegal81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel from November 2010. When we arrived we checked in after about a 20 minute wait, the check in staff were polite and helpfull, and we paid to upgrade to one of the select rooms, i know not everyone has to pay to get this though. The room was on the 22nd floor, great view! It was tidy, clean and had everything we needed, except a fridge, but ice machines are just down the corridor. The safe was easy to use. The shops and amusements in the hotel are good fun, but pricey when it comes to buying snacks and bottles of coke etc, i reccommend using the little gas station just past the IHOP outside the hotel, it was $3 for 2 2litre bottles of sprite, whereas its almost $3 for a little bottle on its own in the hotel, the starbucks there has an inflated price also, obviously on account of how handy it is etc. We were both first timers to Vegas, and found the gambling abit daunting, yet the casino table workers were really nice, explained rules to you, and were really friendly, and the girls supplying free drink if your gambling couldnt be any nicer! It was good fun in the hotel, relaxed and really just abotu enjoying yourself, and of course the view from the top is spectacular, there is even little sofas for you to sit around in and just take it all in! The Stratosphere is a fair walk from the strip, but not an impossibility we did it a couple of times, in doing so you can get to see what nearby you, and rest of times we used the deauce bus, it was so convienient just to hop on and hop off with a $7 ticket whcih covers you for 24 hrs. The bus stop to go to the outlet mall is at Denny's which it a 4 min walk out the back of the casino, and i HIGHLY reccommend shopping here, the bargains are unbelieveable, we actually did it over 2 days as there was so many shops and choice, and the italian in the food court is awesome! I personally wouldnt reccommend Roxy's diner, my food was cold and to be honest not the best, i felt nauseaous after eating there, portions are HUGE! But as with the rest of the hotel, staff couldnt be nicer, they really do pretty much anything to keep you happy!Theres nothin a tip wont get you! It was a dissappointment the pool was closed as it was hot first few days there, but the weather soon changed! windy and cold! Overall the hotel is comfortable and has everything you require on your doorstep, even if its a little bit more expensive than venturing further a field for it, but i cannot complain about our stay, we were made very welcome, comfortable, and request was met with a smile, and if i was to return to Vegas i would have no qualms what so ever about staying here.... i would rather pay $7 to get around than pay over $100+ per night in a hotel further down the strip which i believe would provide an equal service! The area isnt too bad at all either, i was worried from reading reviews here, but its all common sence really, who would wander round an unfamilliar neighbourhood at night?! We actually went 3 miles north into the "Old Town" and visited a wallmart and various little shops along the way, it gave us a view of what its like to live in Nevada as aposed to the Vegas Strip! Dont be put off by reviews marking this hotel down for rediculous things liek door hinges and adjoinign bedrooms, its very welcoming, friendly and extremely friendly on the wallet if you want money left over to enjoy the outlet malls!!

Reviews.Title: “cool Place”
Reviews.Author: GoodOldTimes
Reviews.Content: i love las vegas n i love to stay here. it's always fun. the rooms are well priced and comfortable. the gaming lounge is cool

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: EJandAA
