Reviews.Content: Pros: -Got an upgrade room for $49 bucks with jacuzzi, strip view and fully renovated - If you have a car its right in the middle of downtown and the main strip. If you don't there's a bus stop right in front. - Service was excellent for my few days - The shops are price reasonably and got a daily refill at Fat Tuesday's - Free access to the tower and 25% discount on the buffet for registering to their casino club. - no crowds Cons: - Not a luxurius themed hotel - Pray for not having all drinked up neighbors - no crowds if you are in the mood of partying it up - Walking distance from the strip and downtown

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnHDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Select room at the Stratosphere in August. This was my third stay in the hotel and,as usual, I was very impressed The Select rooms are on the top 2 floors of the main hotel. The room I was in was partially remodeled and had a 42in LCD. The room itself was very quiet and was perfect for a sound sleep, especially after an 11 hour flight from London The Select rate included V.I.P. check-in and we were checked in and on our way to our rooms only a few minutes after arriving at the hotel The only minor problem that I had with the hotel was the buffet. I had the "brunch" buffet on the first day as I was very dissapointed with the food and I believe that it was also very overpriced for the selection of food on offer. I was very impressed with the customer service staff in the hotel. I filled in an on-line questionaire about my experience with the hotel and I recieved a personal e-mail from the customer service manager on the next busness day. While the hotel is a bit far from the centre of the strip, there are two seperate bus routes (ACE Gold Line and Deuce) which bring you to the centre of the strip in no time. There are also buses to both of the outlet centres from right outside the main doors of the hotel. I am currently arranging holidays for January and am seriously considering staying here again..

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: donna1981xx
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Vegas (and the US) and having read some of the bad reviews and having been warned by friends that we chose the worse hotel we were slightly worried. However we were plesantly surprised. Our room had a king size bed (super king size in UK sizing) a chair and coffee table a 42" TV a safe a very large spa bath tub and shower. We are normal people, not rich not poor but the not the kind of people who like disigner clothes we are the average joe couple and i have to say Vagas as a whole was dissapointing the best thing about it was coming back to the Stratosphere each night. The shops in every Hotel/Casino were all the same Prada, D&G disigners coming out your our ears and many had 3 of the exact same one in the same place!! rediculas. The Strat was the only one with real affordable shops, my husband bought a Lakers Coat for $79.99 + tax the same coat was $140 +tax every where els. The food in the start was amazing. we stayed 7 nights and we ate breakfast and dinner their 5 times. in the buffett what a choice!! we were amazed. The room was cleaned each day and fresh towels given. Gambling wise we stuck to the strat and to the machines we didn't win anything but we didn't lose either so it was all fun. The only bad things about the hotel were that their was some work going on, small areas at a time but you havd to find other ways to get around with no diverted walk way signs when we were in a hurry to catch our flight carting our suit cases behind us and trying to get to the check out desk it was not easy. Also the alarm clock did not work which is the reason we nearly missed our flight, the laundry service is well over priced. 5 pairs of knickers, 5 pairs of socks, 1 pair of leggings and a shirt, 1 pair of jeans and 2 t shirts cost us $50 (thats including the tip) The other thing was the fire alarm going off at 7.30am the morning after we arrived. but other than that it was great. Advice for people staying here, the best way to get around is the duece bus, it's very cheap $7 for 24 hours and stops at all the hotels. Also for decent priced clothes shops try Ross's (it's on the strip not far from the strat) and also Primm Valley. The shows are over priced in vegas, the best value one was deffinately American Superstars, as a guest of the strat you get 2 for 1 tickets and it was quite good. the others we went to see we paid a lot for and shows in Vegas are rushed and over in an hour! I have to say having seen both the vegas Motown Revoe and the Blackpool one and the Vegas legends and The Blackpool one Blackpool wins both hands down i'm affraid..and no1 is more shocked than me!! I went for the shows after all!! Finaly the Tower, we never had a meal up their but wish we had, the view from the deck is amazing, unfortunately it was too cold and windy to go on the rides but they looked great! I deffinately recommend that if you are not a snob and you visit Vegas stay at The Stratosphere, it's the best hotel for normal down to earth people. the staff are so friendly, it's clean and the food is good. Vegas was an experiance, we probably wont visit again as once you have seen it, youve seen it, the buildings are great i got my pictures but once inside them they are all the same. However in the future if i was to ever come again for a few days i would not even have to think abaout where to stay..we loved the Stratosphere!!! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Good for money, but dont plan on sleeping much”
Reviews.Author: filmmakr
Reviews.Content: I usually like to stay at a different hotel every time I go to Vegas, just to sample new places. This time I visited Stratosphere. Mainly just because I got the room for about $29 a night. I forgot about the resort fee though which I think was like $9 a night. Arrived at the hotel around 1:30 PM. Went to check in. I know check in time wasnt til 2 PM but we told our room wasnt ready. In fact our room wasnt ready until a little after 3 PM. We got one of the newly remodeled rooms on the 34th floor. The view was very nice. The room was alright. Had a king sized bed, a small flat screen television, and a bathroom with a tub/shower combo. My first major complaint was that even thought the thermostat was set at 68 degrees. It always felt like 80-85 in the room. I cant sleep when Im hot and sweaty. The AC would kick on about every 15 mins and only stay on for a minute or so and definetly not enough to cool the room down. Secondly, the walls here are paper thin. I could hear drunk people coming back to their rooms, singing and being obnoxious all thru the hours of the night. And I am a very light sleeper so I get awakened fairly easily. They let you use your room key to go to the top of the tower for free because you are a hotel guest, otherwise you would have to pay. If you are planning on walking, DO NOT stay here. It was way too far at the end of the strip. i had a rental car so not a big problem. All in all, I would probably not stay at this hotel again, unless it was free, even then I would probably pay for a room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Buffy24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere November 9-13, and only paid $200 total for 4 nights, including all taxes and fees (and a Friday night stay). Yes, the hotel is older, but they are doing some remodeling. They recarpeted 2 sections of the casino while we were there and it looks a million times better. We were in town for a conference and also for fun. We booked one of the newly remodeled rooms. The room was very nice and we had a view of the tower, so we got to see people doing the "free fall" from the top. Very cool. My only problem with the room was that they didn't have any kleenexes and left only 1 bar of soap. I prefer to have one for the sink and one for the tub. They also replaced them every day, which I don't think is necessary. I only noticed noise being a bit of an issue in the morning, but it was always after I got up. The parking garage was very close to the tower we stayed in, which was great. The area surrounding the hotel is not so great, but we had a car, so we drove everywhere. All of the staff we encountered were very pleasant. We ate at Roxy's one night and found the food to be good and not terribly expensive. Yes, it was a bummer that the pool was closed. HOWEVER, it is an OUTDOOR seasonal pool, not indoors. I don't know where one of the previous reviewers got the idea that it was indoors. They had planned on having it open, but then started remodeling the 8th floor and that is where the pool is located. We prefer to stay at the center of the strip, but would stay here again. Also, I don't know why people get so up in arms about not be able to get rooms together. It is not an instance specific to this hotel. Every hotel will tell you they cannot guarantee rooms next to each other because they don't know if someone is going to extend their stay, or what. They can only offer it to you if it is available in the room type you booked on the day you arrive. They cannot save it over several days. The only way I've found to guarantee rooms next to each other is if the hotel offers some kind of family suite, which is basically 2 rooms that are connecting. Not many hotels offer that though. Make sure to check out the lounge on the top of the tower. Awesome views of Vegas and live music on some nights. Tower admission is free if you are a hotel guest, but we skipped that and just went to the lounge. This is a clean, basic, inexpensive hotel. If that is what you are looking for, your good. If you want something fancy, stay some place expensive and quit complaining about it. You can hardly expect 5 star rooms for $34-40 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: california_dreaming1
Reviews.Content: It was adequate lodging and there were no problems. It was certainly not a room with a view. The fitness center was barely adequate. Half the machines seemed to not work properly and what was there was quite dated. For the right price it is okay. There is a very authentic Mexican restaurant next door that is no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: oldbenz
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal so decided to spend a little more on a king grand suite. It had a main room, with a pull-out sofa,a separate TV and bar/fridge area with a coffee maker. A dining table was also in the room. The bedroom had the adjoining bath. The shower had good pressure and the water wasn't soft. Heaven forbid you drop anything in the toilet because it has some epic flush power. The room was kept clean at all times. We would certainly stay here again! We found the staff nice, the casino fun, and enjoyed several restaurants on site. It was also convenient to take public transportation to get to the strip,Fremont St.,etc.

Reviews.Title: “was not happy at all, this place was not to great at all nov 14- 17 2010”
Reviews.Author: ampsforyou
Reviews.Content: To start it off, 7.50 a night resort fee suck. we stayed three and half nights. that means 22.00 in fees. 11.50 a day for internet really suck, I took my laptop to see what was going on in vegas and was not going to pay 36.00 bucks for there internet. to far fom strip. slots where real tight, al of vegas was that way though. staff was nice. We got a smoking room, and it smell real bad. I smoke and if i knew it was going to smell that bad i would have got a no smoking room and smoke down stairs, food was not the greatest for the price. got hit with a time share as soon as we walk in the door. one night they had to turn of the water, because of the remodeling that suck big time no shower. if you are thinking you are getting a deal you are not. if it looks to good to be true, its not.. lot better deals on fremont st. meals with room ffrom 17.00 a night and slots not as tight. 24hr bus pass 7.00 best deal

Reviews.Title: “Most Terrible Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Diamond2p4u
Reviews.Content: When we booked the hotel we booked two rooms assuming that they would be next together. When we got there we were in for a rude awakening. We kept getting the...There's no Guaranty policy. We were unhappy with that so they waived the resort fees and told us that we could switch rooms in the morning and we'd be together. The rooms were in two completely different towers of the hotel. Went back the next morning and the manager gave us there's not guarantee policy spill again. Talk about pissed off. Checked out he told us to come back at 6pm. We came back there was a new manager who gave us the same no guarantee policy that the rooms would be close together. She finally got us some rooms that were pretty close together. We even went for the deluxe rooms assuming they would be really nice. They were average nothing too spectacular. Anywho get to the new room and in the bathroom there's dirty towels and someones old crusty hot pink bath pouf hanging up as well as a broken towel rack with nicely folded towels. Had maintenace and housekeeping come up ASAP to take care of the situation. Housekeeping came and was cleaning my sister told them to clean certain things. One called her a crazy lady and made bird noises in Spainish thinking we wouldn't understand. We asked for our friends room to be cleaned as well and they said we needed to call for it to be cleaned when they could have walked across the hall. Called it in and they had to clean it anyways...so they talked crap about that. The water was awful. Guess u can't do much about that. The entire hotel including casino smelt like mildew. It was a ghost town in there. Suppose the hotel is doing some remodeling but that doesn't mean that corners should be cut by not having enough staff. There were only like two waitresses to serve the entire casino. They took forever to come back with the drinks. One got mad because I moved to a slot machine and got a funky attitude. Not to mention there are swarms of homeless people around that hotel. It's on the end of the strip....far from everything. The location was terrible. Oh yeah the bar upstairs was ok. Also we couldn't swim in there IN DOOR POOL because it was closed for the season. What hotel do you know has a seasonal indoor pool. That sucked big time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service/Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cutie1978
Reviews.Content: I flew to Vegas for Halloween.. Entering the hotel noticed a lot of construction going on, and i thought 'crap service is going to suck"!...Approaching the front desk was very busy, I was greeted by Adriana she was very pleasant, outgoing...she explained everything about the hotel and made our lives easier to find everything. I loved the rooms they were remodeled on a high floor, the view was gorgeous!!!..Stratosphere for my next trip!!! thanks to the staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but better than I'd feared.”
Reviews.Author: DJDB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in one of the new Select rooms. Now to be fair I had justy come from 6 nights in the Four Seasons in San Francisco, so my expectations weren't great. But for $40 a night the brand new room was perfectly acceptable, everything new clean and fresh, and a fantastic little bathroom with an excellent shower. The only thing that drove me nuts was the smell of vanilla air freshener which nearly made me choke. I didn't allow the maids in to clean once I got there to stop them repeating the "freshening", I still ended up with a nose bleed from something in the air. The casino itself is fairly cosey, didnt try any of the restaurants, went to Ocha, and excellent thai place, across the street. Checked out early after 3 nights as originally booked for 7 and had no problem. I think kowing I was only there for three and heading back to Four Seasons at the other end of the strip made it bearable. Still very good value for the money,, but make sure you get the new rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location, noisy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very updated, clean and the hotel has many attractions inside. It is a bit far from the strip, but within minutes with the bus or car you are there. Don't need to pay more to stay on the strip. The access to the tower is free for hotel guests ($15 savings). The rooms do not have acoustic, so you can hear whatever your neighbors are doing / talking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you can.”
Reviews.Author: wkjones
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. The first room we were placed in had a weird smell, very obstructed view and overlooked a service roof. I also saw some bugs as well as linens that looked like they were soiled. Kinda scary. We were moved to a new room but it still was not exceptionally clean or updated. Due to an auto convention there was little chance to change our locale. Would not revisit this hotel. Made for a rather sad 50th birthday celebration.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: poncharelo2
Reviews.Content: For the price paid, everything was better than expected, really. The hotel room was very clean. The service was excellent. The casino is... well, like most casinos. Nothing less, nothing more. I actually think with what I won there paid for my stay (playing roulette and the big wheel, but I don't recommend this one to anyone, later learned that the house advantage is huge, I just got lucky). The only complaint is the location. If you take the Deuce you'll be fine, although it's very slow. The monorail is an 8min walk away. Not too much, but after walking in the strip and hotels for hours, it's something. But hey, for the price paid you can't expect to be in the center strip at Caesars Palace. BTW, the buffet is very good ($20+tax). There's a McDonald's open 24/7 inside. You can get up the tower up to 4 times a day.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: kittylover05
Reviews.Content: Really clean, beds were so nice. Hardly any channels on the tv. The top floor with the shops and resturants were nice and they don't rob your eyes out. It's all the way at the end of the strip but no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Nice stay but was away from the casinos hub”
Reviews.Author: Jaddar
Reviews.Content: Had been to Las Vegas last year in Nov 09,we got pretty good deal from stay.Overall it was a nice place to stay after all the fun we had in LV we just use to go room to sleep for few hours.View was good ,Amazing and scary rides. When you go on top floor u can see the entire view..it was beautiful .The location is not that great because it's far away from everything need to walk alot but Bus stop is nearby . The rooms are clean.NO INTERNET AND EXPENSIVE .

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great rooms, great location, music very loud at pool”
Reviews.Author: 1wabbit007
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 3 times now, will always go back, we always get great room on a high floor, room spacious and clean, anything we asked for was always prompt. Great locaton on the strip, deuce bus service runs up/down strip and downtown continously just outside it. Buffet is always very good value and tasty. My only gripe is the pool is always freezing which is a shame cause its huge and gets underused, everybody crams into the jacuzzi. This time as well the music at the pool seems to turn up every hour till it get unbearable about 4pm, probably a clever tactic to get customers back to casino. On a whole though this hotel is great and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - if you're not too fussy”
Reviews.Author: hakanut
Reviews.Content: Firstly, our stay in Vegas was very short, so we wanted to make the most of everything, and our hotel room was really only a place to sleep and hold our luggage. With that in mind, our experience at the Stratosphere was mostly a pleasant one, and for $40 per night, we were satisfied with what we walked into. We paid $7 for a 24 hour bus pass which got us to The Strip, to Downtown Vegas and then to the Premium Outlet stores for shopping the next morning. The bus stops just across the road from the Stratosphere. My only complaint - (and maybe this is a Vegas or even USA wide thing), is the amount of cigarette smoking in INDOOR public areas. I was really taken aback that in this day and age, the USA has not caught up with the rest of us and outlawed smoking in public places ESPECIALLY inside. We had a room on a non-smoking floor, but people smoked IN the elevators, in the lobby, on the casino floor - EVERYWHERE. My clothes stunk by the end of the night, - and reminded me of the 80's when smoking used to be status quo - and accepted everywhere. All that aside, our stay at this hotel was worth the money. And if you're like us and really just wanted somewhere pleasant to lay your head and rejuvenate for the next day - Stratosphere is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “out of the world experience.”
Reviews.Author: musafir0102
Reviews.Content: The best part about the hotel is the adventure rides that it has. Unfortunately they are not free any longer (while one of my friend said that they used to be for free earlier). The buffet is also excellent. We had no reason to step out of the hotel for the entire 3 days that we guys stayed at Vegas. The rooms were absolutely excellent and the service was outstanding. It was absolutely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Room was awesome, but hotel........... a ghost town!”
Reviews.Author: mrsfrankenstein
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for Halloween with my husband. The room was newly redone which was really nice, flat screen t.v. cozy bed cleaned daily when we returned from the strip. Some downfalls to the hotel were location, resturants, and the area was really scary. Put it this way unless your going to the bus stop don't go out at night!! Picketers were outside the hotel,(something about labor disputes) pool was not in use through our whole stay. So paying a resort fee was annoying. They are doing renos so we heared jack hammmers everytime we walked in and out of the main lobby. The overall feel of the hotel was this was the place to be in the eighties but now it's so run down. Like the title says ghost town!! Halls empty, resturants empty, casino more than thirty tables in all but only three dealing at any given time. If you were to stay in your room for four days this would be a perfect place, but lets get real!

Reviews.Title: “Stratospherically bad!”
Reviews.Author: OzzyTraveller26
Reviews.Content: A friend and I did a roadtrip from NY to LA and stayed in numerous hotels - some great ones (highly recommend the InterContinental in Chicago), and some average ones. However, the Stratosphere in Las Vegas was without doubt the worst of them all. Among other things: - Was thrown into a smoking room despite repeated protests - Water tap didn't work - Toilet seat didn't stay up (consequently - dirty floors) - Bathroom door lock broken - Power sockets not working - TV remote only worked from a close distance - Internet charged per laptop session - Filthy windows - Condescending staff and indifferent management What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas. Except bad hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “The Stratosphere is slowly growing on me...”
Reviews.Author: Metalhead55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere for 2 nights on October 22nd and 23rd. I stayed on an offer that allowed me to stay in one of their suites. The check in clerk was very nice and he assured us we has a room with a great view. Upon arriving to the room we had a nice view of the rooftop a/c system. The room wasn't very clean as there was dried rice and M & M's on the floor. I'm not one to complain as I don't spend much time in the room. As long as I have clean sheets, clean towles and a place to shower, I'm good. The room was very big with a king size bed that was as hard as a rock. My friend slept on the couch bed. When we pulled out the sofa bed that 1st night a thong made it's debut and gave us a good laugh. We were coming and going all hours of the night so we just let that pass. During the day they were fixing the rooms on either side of us, so we were not able to sleep in that much with the sound of drills and hammers. If it wasn't for the Fat Tuesday in the shops and free admission to the tower I would not consider staying here again. Another plus was having Auntie Anne's Pretzels on property! The staff was always nice and helpful except for the time share people in the front of the hotel. At least I knew how to avoid them. We had a chance to eat at Roxy's and thought it was ok. Going to the top of the Stratosphere was wonderful. It was my first time after many trips to Vegas and that just took my breath away! Both day and night views were excellent! Overall, I would stay here again, just for the tower admission, the pretzels and FAT TUESDAYS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Lobby Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ikeroni
Reviews.Content: The check in process was the absolute worse here, the worst that i've had in Vegas, (4th trip). We arrived early at 7 am. We tried to check in and was told that there were no rooms available. This was Friday early morning. So that meant they were fully booked on a Thursday? Anyways, they said to try back at 9. We ate thier breakfast buffet, which was ok, nothing special. Finally, at 9 we went back to check in and they said that they didn't have anything, and that housekeeping doesn't come in till 10:00. WHAT?! Why didn't they tell me that to begin with?! So I asked if I could pay for an upgrade, with 2 little kids needing to get settled in, they said no, that if they gave us a room (at 9:00am) they would have to charge us yesterdays rate. So this told me that they DID have a room, but they didn't want to give it to me unless I paid a whole night's rate for it. Seriously? Where's the customer service. So I was *reminded* that check in is actually at 3:00 pm. When we finally checked in, no apologies, no free breakfast coupons, no complimentary upgrade for making us wait, nothing. Out of all the hotels in Vegas, you would think that they would want you to return to them, but I guess they don't care, so my advice is... if you want a cheap place to stay and don't mind walking a whole lot or poor customer service, then stay here. If you are looking for a hotel that actually cares what you think should you have an issue, that is actually on the strip and closer to everything, then try Mandalay Bay or Bellagio, those are my personal recommendations because i've been upgraded with out there being any problem that they had to make up for. I would have stayed there, but we had to stay at the stratosphere for a wedding, not by choice. I do have to say that the girl in the elevator in the tower was very nice. She asked if we were staying with them, and I rolled my eyes and said a very unenthusiastic yes.... she told me that this was strange because they are trained to give the best customer service, all they preach about is customer service. But that isn't what we experienced. Oh and the lobby is in the middle somewhere, again, lots of walking. It isn't conveniently located at any of the entrances. They were doing some remodeling which would be nice if it was a new lobby, but no, it's a new VIP Lounge, so I guess you must be VIP for them to actually care about you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with super value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelinUndertaker
Reviews.Content: What a place to stay, above the strip, great parking and most of all a staff to die for. This is a hidden gem. If you are looking ot get away from the craziness of the stip in Las vegas but want to be apart at the same time the Stratosphere is the place to be. I enjoy the sights on Sahara Ave which is convenient and it allows you to get on I15 with ease. This is my favorite place to stay and will always make the Stratosphere part of my Las Vegas Travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern rooms albeit the hotel is a bit far from everything”
Reviews.Author: elmatic
Reviews.Content: For $30 a night, I wasn't expecting much but got an amazing and massive 2 double bed room with very clean and modern furnishings. Check in was a bit slow despite it being 11pm at night and there were 8 people working at the front desk. Check out was an absolute breeze. The hotel is a bit far from everything so get yourself an all day monorail pass. The closest station is probably a 5 minute walk. The room rate includes free passes to the tower which provides amazing views of Vegas plus you get to see up close all those brave enough to do the tower rides strapped in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad location!”
Reviews.Author: magicalfountain
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was good with plenty to do room was clean ( one dirty towel nothing major ) service wasnt great there wasnt anybody going about to help out with any questions. we upgraded to a premier room with a view of the strip but the view was very poor all you could see was the sahara - not a strip view. Free tower admission was great and worth having a look. Its a bit too far from the main part of the strip and we ended up paying for a lot of taxis as it was too far to walk more than twice a day.

Reviews.Title: “Jello shots”
Reviews.Author: Wsmith957
Reviews.Content: I tried my first jello shot at Fat Tuesdays! Excellent and very cheap! Jello shots were only a dollar! Fat Tuesdays was our favorite hang out spot, as the workers were very friendly there! My wife and I stayed drunk, thanks to Fat Tuesdays!!! The casinos were nice and very inviting! The room was very nice and the bed was soooooo comfortable! We went up the tower and rode the rides on two different occasions! Lets just say, the rides are fun whether your drunk or not! We had a great stay and this was our first time to Vegas and hope to come back again next year! We loved the Stratosphere and Fat Tuesdays!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money you spent”
Reviews.Author: Ahtin
Reviews.Content: I came to Vegas for a 4D3N shopping trip with my mom. Our 1st impression when we checked into the room, was beyond our expectation. The room is big. The 2 single beds in the room would have been able to sleep 4 adults instead. since ours was on the 6th floor, thus our view wasn't that great. We have a group of friends staying on the 24th floor. The view is magnificent. The toilet is spacious with a tub. The room is clean. But the only downside would be there is no kettle provided. The hotel has a casino which is 24hrs open, filled with mostly jackpot machines. There is a couple of restaurant/food joint,Mcdonalds,gift store plus the whole hotel is filled with stores and bars. Plus, don't forget to get on the ride at the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money, while not being in the most prime location.”
Reviews.Author: Wyotraveler33
Reviews.Content: I booked one of the newly remodeled “Select Rooms” at the Stratosphere Hotel and was very pleased with my accommodations, as well as the hotel and casino in general, with only a few minor exceptions. For starters registration was very speedy. Also the lady at the counter was very friendly and made me fell very much welcomed. In any event my first impression of the hotel was very good. My very clean room on 17th floor featured a tile entryway, as well as updated contemporary furniture with a flat screen TV and desk. My room also offered a nice view the casino’s electronic marquee, as well as the Stratosphere Tower. A number of times I was able to get a great view of one the jumpers from the tower. While not in the middle of the “Strip” the hotel/casino is served by both the Deuce and AceGold bus routes (just note both do not use the same bus stop). For just $7 you get access to either line for 24-hours. These lines offer service both to other spots more south on the strip, as well as downtown (Fremont Street Experience). I was able to get a great rate great through hotel’s website, with a discount on top of their already reduced price. In addition to the room rate plus taxes I was charged a $7.50 daily resort fee. While this fee is less than what is charged by some other hotels ($10-$25) it still should be figured into your rate when booking a room at this property. This fee gives you access to the tower (best view of the strip in my opinion), pool, and fitness center (did not use the latter two). It does not however give you internet access witch is billed at $11.99 per day. In conclusion I found this hotel to a very good value, while not having the mid-strip location many travelers look for. I will again stay there if I am able to get a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: J0andJames
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Stratosphere was unexpected, our flight back to the UK was cancelled due to bad weather in England and it was a case of finding anywhere that was available and cheap as we hadn't budgeted for an extra 2 nights. The casino and lobby were average, we had to queue for a while to get our room. The lifts were a bit rickety and small so I am glad we weren't too high up. The room was very basic but this was expected for the price, it was unfortunate that we had just checked out of the luxury Mandarin Oriental and it was a bit of a reality check! The bed was comfortable enough. We didn't really have a view, I think it was the base of the tower so we tended to keep the curtains closed. The best part about staying this hotel was the free access to the tower, we went up there day and night and got some great photo's. We took a lovely aerial photo of the wedding chapel we got married in. Roxy's diner is a really nice place to eat, they have the biggest milkshakes ever, you won't need to order any food if you have one of those! If you are on a budget this is a perfectly comfortable hotel but the walls are very thin, it can be quite distracting if you are trying to get to sleep and next door have their TV on.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Polkaholic
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package deal thru Expedia. The hotel rooms are average size. The bedding is super soft. Wish the room had a safe and a fridge. Our strip view was OK (Stratospher tower blocking much of the view). The buffet is average. The casino is like most others. Would stay here again. Would I recommend to a friend? Yes if they wanted to be on the strip but away from the action. It's quite a hike to get to the center of the strip (City Center, Wynn, etc.) Take the Deuce to get around. $7 for a 24-hr unlimited pass.

Reviews.Title: “Muito bom!”
Reviews.Author: felipeteixeirabr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Lots of things to do inside. Clean rooms, great service. Not in the middle of the Strip, though. You gotta catch a bus or a cab if you want to enjoy the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel and amazing view”
Reviews.Author: coolgal142
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very inviting! The staff was friendly! They messed up our booking but they fixed it right away and even up grated our room! We got a room to over look the strip! The rooms were well kept, clean, quite, and comfortable. The only down fall is that it is at the way end of the strip so it is a walk to get to all the action, thats why i gave it a 4. but other then that we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable way to do Las Vegas on the cheap.”
Reviews.Author: jess_bessAustralia
Reviews.Content: I scored a bargain rate for this hotel- $38US a night for a king size bed!- and I was not disappointed. While it is on the strip, it is a fair hike to the main action, so you'd probably have to take a cab or bus. There are great facilities within the resort including a beautiful rooftop pool and spa, some shopping and a really nice Italian restaurant. It took a long time to check in, which was annoying, but my room was super comfortable and such a bargain! Much cheaper than some of the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: BD_IC_2801
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere and would be happy to recommend that hotel to our friends. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and WHAT A VIEW!!! Guests can access the observation deck for free. Guests also get great discounts on the rides available at the top levels of the hotel. There are several great shops and restaurants available at the hotel, especially Roxy's Diner. The employees all take turns singing 1950's and 1960's cover songs, and every one of them is quite an entertainer in their own right. And OMG, the Strawberry Sundae is very reasonably priced and is HUGE!!! They will be happy to provide several spoons. The Raspberry White Chocolate Cheesecake is also delicious and is big enough for two to share.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean Rooms, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: RBJFTravelFans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere last month for a family trip/sporting tournament held adjacent to the property. We have stayed at other hotels along the strip and had visited Stratosphere for the American Superstars show but would not have selected this property had it not been for the convenience to our event. When we arrived, the bell desk was very friendly and greeted us, checked our bags and told us it would not be a problem to check into our rooms early. We had reserved three rooms and requested adjoining/adjacent rooms. However, the front desk clerk told us check in was at 3 but she wasn't sure when our rooms would be ready. She wouldn't allow us to go any further in the check-in process even though it was after 2 pm. We thought this odd but resolved to take a cab to tour the strip and come back later in the afternoon. Another friend arrived and a different clerk helped him and gave him keys and immediate access to his room. Although we had a special request since we had requested three rooms in close proximity, we thought it odd we couldn't even register and pick up our keys later. At this point, we inquired with the desk clerk who helped our friend and we were able to check in immediately and he agreed to call us on our cell when the rooms were ready to check in and told us to pick up our keys at that time.. Needless to say, we were not pleased with the first desk clerk but very happy to have at least been able to check in. This did however give us a cautious feeling about this property. Once we were given keys (and were notified by the second clerk via cell phone), we were pleasantly surprised at the rooms. The tower we stayed in was recently renovated and our rooms were quite spacious. We had asked for a king sized bed but this orientation was not available in the selection of rooms we were given. If we had wanted to separate from our family we probably would have been accommodated but it was more important for us to be close to family. All of our rooms had two double beds. We were close to the elevator yet there was little noise in the halls. The rooms seemed to be well insulated and we had a peaceful night's sleep each evening. The decor in the rooms was average, but freshly painted and carpeted. The counter in our bath was not granite but still clean and nice. Some perks that are nice - to two for one access to the shows, free access to the observation tower with room key, discounts on buffet with sign up to player's club. Roxy's Diner features singing wait staff which is a nice surprise. Food is just ok. Buffet is decent. Good food and nice variety. We didn't have time to try the other eateries but there were also some quick food options in the food court. Would recommend this property for those who are not looking for elegance or extravagance. It is a good choice and great for the price. We paid approx. $30 per night and the value can't be beat. One negative - no free wireless. Internet is charged on average $10/day. One other negative would be the location. We were warned by our cab driver to not venture out the back door, or even the front due to the neighborhood. This frightened us at first but once we settled in there were no problems in the interior of the property and you wouldn't necessarily want to venture out back because it only consists of a garage which they said was safe and beyond was empty lots and a declining neighborhood. We did venture out the front door since that was where our event was held and we did not encounter any problems. All in all, a good choice for those on a budget and who isn't these days? This hotel has a lot of nice features for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money if you're not fussed about being near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: roxypev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to split up our journey from Death Valley to Bryce Canyon. We returned to Las Vegas a week later for three nights and then stayed on the Strip. We paid £25 and for that we got a huge room and unlimited access to The Stratosphere itself. We went up once in the day and once at night. To be honest, I didn't think the view of the Strip was that good, but it's worth a look - particularly if it's free! The room was nicely decorated and very clean. My parents had a room across the corridor from us but near the lift which was really noisy apparently, but we didn't hear anything. Because we were passing through we were happy not to be near the Strip. We took the Deuce to the Fremont Street Experience in the evening and had dinner at Main Street Station Hotel buffet, which was huge and really good value compared with the prices at the more popular hotels down the road. The hotels on the Strip are definitely a lot classier, but I was pleasantly surprised with what we got for our money.

Reviews.Title: “First time there and would go back....”
Reviews.Author: PIRATES
Reviews.Content: We were there for our daughters 10-10-10 wedding ( 2 nights) at "The Little White Chapel" down the street. I had reserved 2 king rooms and when checking in was told no more king rooms unless we upgraded to a mini-suite for $15/per night which we did. The room was Ok, and would of been better off with the Queen beds now that I look back for the extra $$. Rooms were clean & beds very comfortable. The slots seems looser than I expected. We played roulette also and the staff was wonderful and so very nice. I did hit a "royal flush" playing video poker that surprised me for a $1000 that was great. Would go back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and near enough the strip to be ok”
Reviews.Author: Been_seen_done_it_al
Reviews.Content: Great if you want something cheap and a good start to learning some of the games - the dealers are always happy to help. First time I had played Roulette and I came up on top - with free drinks friendly staff. The clientel are not the most sophisticated but what can you do its cheap and cheerful. The tower view is also free if you stay here which is good - although the view is a little obstructed by some construction happening - its still good though. The pool is pretty average - but the main strip is in walking distance. The rooms were basic but spacious enough for 4 people. If you want something ver cheap and no frills this is the place, although during the week you can get cheap big names such as MGM and Luxor - my recommendation is in downtown called Goldern Nugget - which has been remodelled and has an amzing pool!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Dawn84
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Stratosphere from a review from friends. Said that it was cheap and cheerful and it was. Recently renovated so it is very comfortable. The rooms are clean, clean sheets everyday, however the cleaners do not make the bed if anything on the bed, ie PJ's. They also do not clean up any litter if it is not in the bin. The casino is very cheesy - but they are in all the casino's, even the Bellagio! Also you can smoke in the casinos so they often smell of smoke and for a non smoker from the UK where it is banned it can be quite a shock and off putting. The casinos are also very big and can be difficult to find the other attractions. The hotel has a lot of eateries, such as a buffet, Roxy's diner, McDonalds, an Italian, pizza stand and Mexican stand. Caution, the food portions are huge in all of the places, and the rest of Vegas. The breakfast buffet also served lunch at the same time so dont be suprised to see people with pot roast next to their omlette. A great selection - but no cereal and fruit selection very limited to only melon. Fruit and veg very hard to come by anywhere in Vegas. The shop is a little over priced, but still cheaper than the rest of the shops in Vegas so buy your novelty gift in the Strat rather than any of the hotels on the strip. The pool is a good size and the jacuzzi is great as the pool can be quite cool. It is great watching the skyjump from the poolside. The pool snacks are of good value (ave $8)and normal American food...massive nachos, massive burger and chips, massive ceasar wraps...a good idea to share. A great choice of frozen cocktails. ($9) When checking in, ask for a room above the 8th floor or you will be looking onto the roof and generators, which can give off a little noise and looks grim. The hotel has a few bars where there is happy hour, $20 all you can drink at certain hours, other than that alcohol is expensive, that is said for most places. The bars up the tower are great for views and a better atmosphere, again having happy hours. There are a number of rides at the top of the tower, not quite Alton towers but still exciting with the great views. The towe has unlimited access for hotel guests, views much better at night as you can see the whole Las Vegas Valley! The TV is not the best if you like to have it on whilst getting ready, with TV ads on every 2 mins. Quite a lot of channels in chinese or spanish. There is an option to pay for the latest films in the cinema and adult movies. Location wise it is ok, at the top of the strip, you can walk to Circus Circus in about 15 mins and 5 mins onto the Wynn. We walked to the bottom of the strip in about 2 hours making all the stops to watch the TI pirate show and Bellagio Fountains which are spectacular and a must see. Taxi's are reasonable, ave $15 to anywhere on the strip and ask to go the quickest way down the highway rather than the strip as it is always bust and a lot of traffic. Or the bus is $7 return, but can take a while as it makes a lot of stops and is packed. You get what you pay for in this hotel, cheap but cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind theft occuring, this is the hotel for you.”
Reviews.Author: corigirl93
Reviews.Content: During our stay we had to call the front desk several times about clean linens not being provided and bathroom not being as clean as it should. On our fifth day of a week long stay we noticed my husband's watch was missing, after calling the incident in 2 men came to the room and interrogated us on the value and description of the costly designer watch and they claimed the risk management team was unavailable and completed a form for them to contact upon our return home all the way back to Cleveland and if we wanted we could call them. We called on Monday when we were home and was informed they were still investigating. On Thursday we finally got a call from a Liz in lost prevention that informed us according to the law there is nothing they can do because they ask staff and no one took it! That the H***! No sorry, no offer of reimbursement and actually no remorse for the theft. I will never syat there again and will tell all and everyone I know about this inceident. This hotel cares nothing for it's patrons! Simply said "THIS HOTEL SUCKS!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but not great, far from the strip/action”
Reviews.Author: roudesign
Reviews.Content: PRO/CONS The hotel by itself is clean and nice casino, pool, gym and the rides on the top of tower. Room clean, nice, spacious. They change the room after we complain for noise from the ice machine (see cons) Amenities are casino, pool, gym and the rides on the top of tower. The tower rides and views are great. Buffet is OK, but no great. Management responsive , but not easy to reach (have to stay in the line over and over to change the room because of the noise) Affordable if you reserve the room few weeks before. CONS: Broken ice machines on the hallways (not a singular case), with permanent running compressors.If you are unlucky and get the room close to the ice machines, you will not be able to sleep because of the noise.Nobody fixed them, they preferred to reassignment to other room. Noisy rooms at the lower floors if close to big AC units or to the parking lot (there were buses idling for hours) Buffet can be a little bit less money/person. Restaurant on the tower very , very expensive. Room are very expensive if you try to go straight to reception, or to extend your stay.An extension for a day can cost you 3 or 4 times compared with the reserved price. The hotel/casino is to far from the strip, the cab fares added fast to the price of the room, better pay a little more and stay in the middle of the action, and walk. Overall OK, but nothing special by Vegas's standards.

Reviews.Title: “A So-So Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ron P
Reviews.Content: When booking the room, the prices were so low, I thought they were giving Las Vegas away. Not just at the Stratosphere, but at other major hotels. After comparing prices for a week’s stay, I opted for the Stratosphere, booking one of the deluxe rooms on the upper floors. Check in was slow, but when we finally arrived at our 20th floor room, we found it dirty, with bits of trash on the floor under the table and an egg-shaped container of M&M’s leftover from Easter behind the nightstand. The room was unimpressive despite having been remodeled within the last 7 months. There was no coffee maker, no microwave, nor mini-fridge. Calling the front desk to request another room, we were informed that a mini fridge was available for $15.00 a night. I could almost buy one for the price I would have paid for the six nights of our stay. The next room, on the 21st floor, was as lackluster as the first. Showing your room key does get access to the roof top and a two-for-the-price-of-one unlimited discount on the rides once there. Signing up for the “Ace Play” card will get you 10% off in all the restaurants and 25% savings on the hotel’s buffet. In the future, I’ll pay a bit more to get a coffee maker and a microwave. Two restaurants we visited here, Top of the World was a bit pricey but worth it, but we got bad service & cold food twice & Roxy's Diner.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place for the value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best hotel for people on a budget it is remodeled great rooms great service. Makes you feel like you have money even when you dont

Reviews.Title: “They ate my Twinkie.”
Reviews.Author: Shananigans14
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Vegas before, so by the time I was on the plane there - I'd already felt like a kid before xmas. We paid $15 extra each night to have our rooms upgraded to their select rooms. These rooms were reno'd a month prior. I felt this was our safest bet, so we wouldn't be disappointed with an 'old crummy' room that I had read others complain about before. We chose this hotel because of the website used for air + hotel packages. I disliked how far it was away from the center of the strip. Thankfully the other 2 people we were with, got a rental car, so they could drop us off at MGM or Mandalay and allow us to work our way down the strip. I enjoyed the room, until Thursday - the day before we were to leave. The maids came in, as usual throughout the trip, but this time did more detailed work than the last 3 days. Which I was fine with, until I realized they had taken one of our twinkies, ate half of it, and then left it on our desk. I was pissed at this - not because it's a $2 twinkie that can be replaced - but the fact that it wasn't even theirs to take! There was also a dirty rag on the tap in the shower. At that point I had it! I went to the desk, and after explaining my story, they offered to refund the one night upgrade fee. I guess it was an expensive twinkie, but what didn't make me feel any btter is that they said - "we've heard weird stories in the past about our maids" We primarily got the room for the safe, and boy after seeing that - we're SO GLAD we did. We also purchased locks before leaving for our luggage. We didn't use them for the flight cuz TSA would've broken them off, but we used them every day in the hotel room. I swear, if we didn't use those locks, they would've went through our stuff too! I would never reccomend this hotel. Pay the extra $10 a night and go somewhere else. The casino was lowsey, the roxy diner (which was supposed to be 24/hrs) randomly closed while we were there, and the tower was the only good part. I'm glad I had my Vegas experience miles away down the strip away from this hotel for most of my stay. Next time, I'll get a hotel room at MGM, Excalibur, or Mirage. Those seemed to be the primary places we were always at.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, noisy room, bad location”
Reviews.Author: dpmcgloon
Reviews.Content: Average hotel at best, paid $50/night but would have been happy to pay a little more for added convenience . Longish check-in process. Intermittent sleep in my first room due to mechanical noise and paper thin walls to an adjoining room. Requested room change and found the hotel staff were very accommodating. Second room that did not feature adjoining rooms and was much more comfortable. Hotel is located miles from the Strip or Downtown in a seedy looking area. Tried the monorail (not recommended unless you like lots of walking) but finally settled for the bus to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but bad location.”
Reviews.Author: avapopelectric
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere in October 2010. The hotel itself is OK. The rooms were fine, although we didn't get our room cleaned until maybe 2-3 pm on one day (even if we always left the hotel around 8am). Beds & pillows were clean and comfy. We were on a non-smoking floor, which was great because I would notice some weird smells on some floors (and in the casino). Carpet was very old... But we always got good sleep because the Stratosphere is not a 'party hotel' with lots of noise during the night. That's definitely a plus. We ate at two of the Stratosphere restaurants (Roxy Diners & Fellini) and both were good for the prices. Getting on the tower is pretty impressive (and free), even during the day. Check-in was a breeze and everyone was nice to us. Pool looked nice too, although I didn't use it. The view was impressive from there! Now the location is just awful. It's really far from the 'good part' of the Strip. We didn't feel like catching the bus (slow and full most of the time), so we walked A LOT. Honestly, even if it was cheap, I could have gotten a better located hotel for an additional $10/night. I would suggest paying a few more bucks and stay somewhere closer to the Strip. Next time, I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNewlyweds09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to come to Vegas a day early and didn't have a hotel booked for this night so we tried our chances with Stratosphere and were pleasantly surprised. I was a little apprehensive, however, upon check-in I requested a room with one king bed instead of two doubles and they upgraded us without any additional charge to the Presidents Suite. The Suite was HUGE. Had a full kitchen, large dining area with table, living area with Flatscreen, large wet bar w/ sink and full size fridge, large king bed which had nice linens and another flatscreen in the bed area. The bathroom was off of the foyer and had a garden tub. Nice value for 40 dollars! Unfortunately, we got in around 11 pm and checked out the next day to go to our hotel, Bellagio, so we didn't really explore any other part of the hotel. We did, however, order room service around 12:30 am and the food was yummy. I personally prefer more up to date / upscale rooms. However, if it wasn't for that, I'd stay here in a heartbeat. If you're on a budget and want a clean room with friendly staff, stay here. Location is so-so. At the far end of the strip. Would need a car to get to the main areas (ie: Bellagio, Venetian, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: carlosmercado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as it was the host hotel for a Racquetball tournament where we were participating. Our room was always clean and the staff courteous. We asked for a smoking room and even so, it DID NOT smell of musty smoke. We don't know what they did, but it did not smell even though we smoke in the room. Didn't have time to gamble due to the tight schedule for playing racquetball, but it seems like a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and an awesome view!”
Reviews.Author: BDSmiley
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here. The rooms were clean and really quiet so you can sleep through the night without any problem. The service in the casino and at the pools was very friendly and courteous. My personal favorite part of the casino was the "Bite" burlesque show! I had a great time and I look forward to my next visit. The only down side to this hotel is the location is on the far end of the strip so you will have to take a cab to get to the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap and nice”
Reviews.Author: wimaxwell
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel for the price. The only problem is that no one there knew that the adult pool was closed. Other then that the room was nice and big. Good view from the window. Got free passes up the tower.

Reviews.Title: “fun fun fun”
Reviews.Author: grannytime
Reviews.Content: the best value for the money good times good food great atmosphere. service was top knotch. why stay anywhere else very close to all you want to see and do

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: dmarie2121
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my husband, in-laws and sister-in-law for 4-nights. We were in Vegas for the first time to celebrate my husbands birthday. We arrived before the 3pm check-in time, and the staff was very accommodating with getting us checked-in early. The first thing we did was go to the buffet. Pizza, pasta, fried rice, fish, tacos and then desserts. Tons and tons of desserts. Much better than I expected after reading other reviews. Our rooms were great and newly renovated on the 24th floor. The best part of my particular room was having a view of the tower rides and seeing people jump off. Wow! Very entertaining. With your room key, you actually get to go to the top of the tower up to 4 times per day for free. My husband enjoyed the Stratosphere casino more than any other hotel due to minimum bets being lower than the other casinos. He’s a newbie and felt more comfortable gambling with smaller amounts of money while learning. Very convenient having a McDonalds (open 23 hrs) and Starbucks right in the hotel. There is also a popcorn store, Auntie Annie’s, and a Fat Tuesday’s walk-up bar. I got a huge yummy frozen drink for $8 that I took back to my room. The location was not a problem for us. We took the monorail and bus. The monorail starts at the Sahara (short walk, next block) and the bus picks up from the front of the hotel. Neighborhood didn’t feel unsafe at night, just not as many people around as the middle of the strip. Almost quiet. The only criticisms I have were the annoying and aggressive sales people trying to get you to sign up for tours. Thankfully they seem to always be in the same place, so we knew how to avoid them. Also, no one let us know what was available in the hotel. It would have been great to get a map upon check-in of the inside of the hotel that let us know what was there and where everything was. We had to explore everything on our own, and were pleasantly surprised to find so much within the hotel. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again. BTW--don't forget to sign up for the Ace Rewards card b/c it gets you discounts on meals in the hotel and you can enjoy the bottomless happy hour for $20.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: MrsTirrell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. We were looking for something inexpensive but still provided the Vegas experience (NOT a motel!) This was the best deal we could find at a casino. The front desk was less than organized but it wouldn't stop me from staying there again. The lines were very long when we arrived early in the morning. We had taken an overnight bus ride from Phoenix to get there so we were beat and wanted a shower! We asked about early check in and they had nothing available yet. They offered to call us as soon as housekeeping got to it. We ended up checking back around 11AM and it was ready but we never received that phone call. On check out you are allowed to keep your room keys as a souvenier in all Vegas hotels. I didn't learn about this until I checked out at the front desk took my keys back but again, it wouldn't stop me from returning for a visit. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We had a nice view of the mountains. We received free tower admission with our package which was a really cool attraction. Definately a must see in Vegas! We also received discount thrill ride tickets by booking through the stratosphere website. We ended up not using them, I chickened out! But it was still amazing to go up there and see the views of Nevada as many times as we wanted. The casino had decent slots and good beverage service. It is a bit off of the main strip area though so plan ahead for that. We rented a car for the week that we were there so we had no problems. The casino's (in the new part of town) offer free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer experience ..... will visit again”
Reviews.Author: Raj050
Reviews.Content: Great customer experience..... We were five in our group... when we visited this place.. Customer service was very good..... they fulfilled what ever we expected. Its accommodate all most every thing like restaurant, casino, gym, food court... You don’t have to go out for any thing out… Overall I am satisfied. I will recomand to others… even it had one of best rides and entry is FREE FrEE !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellet experience”
Reviews.Author: joytiju
Reviews.Content: There was a good deal with trip advisor just 25.99 per nifgt for 4 star hotel..one of the famous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Alot more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Ngaire5
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was quite concerned about the safety of the area and the location of the Stratosphere however we were not at all concerned about either of these things. The area was fine and at no time of day or night did we feel unsafe and with the buses travelling straight past so regularly it was easy to get down the strip or out to the outlet shopping malls if we wanted to. The service was excellent with easy check in and check out and our room was great and had clearly been quite recently renovated. All in all we would definitely stay here again and it had to be the best value for money that we could recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Rooms, worth the extra buck!”
Reviews.Author: heatherbella
Reviews.Content: My husband, infant daughter and myself stayed at the Stratosphere for two nights in September 2010. As our daughter was rolling we chose to upgrade to a newly renovated room, thinking the carpets would be cleaner. It was well worth the extra $15 a night. The room was beautiful! We asked for a high room and ended up on the top floor (24) with a view of downtown (Freemont Street). The king sized bed was great and we slept well. Some Vegas hotels can be noisy at night. We liked that there was McDonalds and Starbucks in the hotel as it made for a nice and easy breakfast. We enjoyed the pool, no complaints there! We took our daughter to her first buffet while at the Stratosphere and quite enjoyed it. Kids under 5 are free at the buffet so that's nice. The food was decent and there was a good selection. One neat thing we found is you can watch people jumping off the tower on your hotel room TV. I think it was channel 31. While baby slept one evening my husband and I spent some time watching people leap off the tower. The one thing we didn't like is that although the tower ride was free we had to wait in a long line with everyone else. The baby was tired and fussy so we didn't end up going. Too bad. Although we didn't eat at the tower restaurant this trip, we did 3 years ago and quite liked it. A reservation at the restaurant gets you up the tower for free and you don't have to stand in line. If you're thinking of paying to go up the tower I'd use that money towards a meal instead and then get up the tower for 'free'. The meals aren't super cheap, but considering the view we thought it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: ally0911
Reviews.Content: As said,nice hotel and ameneties are ok, thought rooms were a bit dated but ok for the price. Location is a bit isolated, fair old walk to get to the main action but frequent bus services and numerous taxis outisde at all times of day and night

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: shoediva202
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Stratosphere and I must say that I wasn't impressed. It is a fairly nice and decent hotel for the money but the location is terrible if you plan on travelling the strip. There were a few annoyances such as a slow drain in the sink and bathtub to which it smelled like sewage from the drain in the sink. The beds were quite comfortable as well as the linens. The restaurants left something to be desired but the Top of the World restaurant had good food and of course is a little pricey but the views were spectacular! Long story short next time I'll pay a little more for a better room and stay mid or north of the strip. There are alsofar better deals off the strip. If you are traveling with children and are looking for an affordable and clean place to stay then this is also an option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not convenient”
Reviews.Author: mana91
Reviews.Content: Stayed there only for the low rate but our room smelled like vomit and we saw the spot on the floor which they had not cleaned and had to ask for a room change. They changed us the room with an upgrade and waived the resort fee. The hotel is too far from the strip and the bus is very inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rates but dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2556
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Las Vegas for our honeymoon. Everything was amazing except for our hotel. We stayed at the Stratosphere which is not centrally located on the strip but that was ok because a 24 hour bus pass is only $7. We upgraded our room to a Spa Kind Deluxe Room with a view of the strip. We arrived to the hotel after 10pm and had to wait almost 25 minutes to check in since their was only 2 people at the front desk. We got up to our room and ordered room service and decided to take a jacuzzi tub in our bathroom. We filled the tub and turned the jets on. To our suprise black mold began to come out of the jets. We found black gross stuff in all the air vents and jets in the tub. I alerted the front desk who seemed to care less. The next day I left the service please on the door with a note asking them to thoroughly clean the tub. However when we arrived back to our room at 7pm that night it still had not been cleaned! We left and came back to the room after seeing the hotels show Bite (which is not worth the $49.95) to find that our room still had not been cleaned. So I called the front desk again and they offered to send someone up to clean it right away, but at this point it was 1:30 am and I was ready for bed. The next day they did clean the room but neglected to even touch the tub. So I basically upgraded the room for nothing since I couldn't even use the jacuzzi tub. QAt checkout I brought up my troubles with the front desk and it seemed they could care less. If you want to stay at a place that pays little attention to the concerns of their guests then the stratosphere is for you. There are better places to stay on the strip for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “3 Wall Racquetball Tournament”
Reviews.Author: Arod238
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas, the hotel was the site of a 3 Wall Racquetball & Handball Tournament from 9/23/10-9/26/10. We thought the hotel was great it was close enough to beginning of the Vegas Strip as well as the Fremont section. When we weren't watching and playing in the tournament we took advantage of the dining and shopping at the hotel as well as in the general area. Getting to the strip was easy using the Monorail System, it was clean and easy to get to our destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and would do it again”
Reviews.Author: crazycook57
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were clean and nice. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms large and clean housekeeping did a good job of cleaning everyday . The price was right and we enjoyed staying at the strat. Even though it was away from the hussel of the big hotels we didn't have any trouble getting to the main part of the strip. And it was nice to go back to peace and quiet at night. I would say its a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on central strip instead”
Reviews.Author: Jenshall
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel was below average, but not terrible. The problem was that to enjoy Las Vegas it's much better to stay in the centre of the Strip, as this hotel is way up north were the strip is no longer flashy and facinating, but instead shady and creepy. Hotels like New York New York is in the middle of the strip but still not very expensive, and nicer as well. Better choice to experience Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: billytourer
Reviews.Content: great value for money, very large room and nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: sampras53449
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Stratosphere for the World Three Wall Handball Championships. I was incredibly happy with the rooms, the staff, the value, and my overall experience. Having never stayed at the Stratosphere, I did not know what to expect, but my expectations were exceeded. I would certainly stay at the Stratosphere again, and I would definitely recommend the Stratosphere to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Whistledown
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay. Not luxury but adequate rooms and resort. Nice to have free access to the tower. Tough to get around the casino floor and find restaurants and the checkin. Check in on Friday night was long. Good facilities and free parking. Location is a north of and good distance from the main casinos on the Strip. $12 taxi ride. WiFi charge. Good buffet for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere has something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: geddylee2112
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Friday and Saturday. In town for a big racquetball tournament. The hotel staff was amazingly friendly, helpful and attentive. Got to take the jump from the 105th floor and the crew at the Jump site was great. They kept you up on everything that was going to happen and made it a very memorable experience. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone coming to the city that never sleeps. Two enthusiastic thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere was an amazing host for our event”
Reviews.Author: stevelerner
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere hosted a first of a kind event and went above and beyond for all the participants. It was a pleasure to stay there with the quality of the hotel, courtesy of the staff and great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Event Staff and Management, Hotel and Casino Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: davecvincent
Reviews.Content: Recently, my colleagues and I stayed for a full week at the Stratosphere, as we attended the WOR/WPH World 3 Wall Ball Outdoor Handball/Racquetball Championships (across the street). On site, the Stratosphere employees and staff kept the event location safe and clean and were very hospitible. Inside the casino I noticed all employees very alert and ready to serve you. One worker bent down and picked up a small speck of garbage as she shuffled to another part of the casino. I admire the little things like that. The hotel rooms were very clean and impressive. Valet parking is the easiest I have ever seen with no pressures from staff or extra wait time; even during rush hour. While Checking in, the desk managers and staffers were pleasant and friendly, plus... the price to stay at the Stratosphere will never be beat. Room service was a work of art and very easy, fast and friendly. I wanna know where the Stratosphere found such nice people to hire! I was amazed to see the fitness center was free. I've traveled all around Vegas and everyone else wants $25-$50 a day!!! For this alone I am coming back. I am so genuinely pleased, that I will always book my Vegas hotels by checking availibility at the Stratosphere first!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong location, location ,location”
Reviews.Author: shudawoodakudda
Reviews.Content: The only tip that we could give about this hotel is ......stay at the Wynn! The pool at this hotel looks like a carpark with a large puddle in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, well priced”
Reviews.Author: Milschicky
Reviews.Content: The rooms were modern and much nicer than we expected. We used the gym which had enough equipment to do what you need to. Pool area was good. Views spectacular. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jishylicious
Reviews.Content: I loved the shopping area, and the rides are awsome. It's a pretty average hotel, not extremely luxurious

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and you need a car”
Reviews.Author: Monty_RTA
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of days at the Stratosphere hotel. We had a suite with one queen bed. The room was clean but for a suite it was small. Did have two large flat screen TVs. Other than that the room was to exciting. The best thing about the hotel is that it included access to the top of the tower. The worst thing was the location. It was a hike to get to the rest of the strip. Ended up taking a car and parking closer.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 3 times and will continue to stay and recommend”
Reviews.Author: RingOandCrystaL
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere... Some say its like marmite. You either love it or hate it. I 1st stayed here in 1998 and again in 2001 then this August. I like the Stratosphere for a number of reasons but mainly the price. £23 per room per night was the last price I paid. Fantastic value. The only problem we encountered during the 5 night stay this year which was a little disappointing was when we went to go out to the pool area on 1 of the days the pool was closed (IN AUGUST!!!) and the 2nd time I went out there I had a coke in a plastic glass with ice from my room and was told I wasnt allowed to take it out there only ones bought from their bar were allowed! Otherwise highly recommend this hotel. Yes there are many along the strip that are bigger and maybe even better but for the location between downtown and the 'main' part of the strip you are dead in the middle so it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “It't just bad”
Reviews.Author: sig
Reviews.Content: This hotel need to hire more friendly people. Also they have way too many smoking rooms, than demand, so they pushing those rooms. Our room was connected to the room next door, and it was just impossible to sleep. You just can get a better deal in Las Vegas, than this hotel. In conclusion if you want to 'smoke' cigarettes without smoking this place is for you. And like I said at begining of this review, specially the front desk people need extensive training in customer service, they rude, uncooperative,etc... Will not stay at this hotel, even for free.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel, very clean, but smoking is allowed in public areas!”
Reviews.Author: suearoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the stratosphere on 9th September with my husband and two teenage children. The room was very clean but with no tea making facilities in room. We had a strip view room so after dark the view was amazing. Unlimited entry to top of the tower's observation deck that is not to be missed. (usually 12 dollars each if not a resident) Meal in Top of The World restaurant was very expensive but food was great. Buy breakfast at ihop diner down the road, its much cheaper. Smoking allowed in public areas, not so good for non smokers and hotel is vast and pretty much left to find own way around. A mini map would be useful on check in! Wi Fi had to be paid for on a daily basis but parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “nothing fancy just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: simpleyme
Reviews.Content: we stayed 7 days overall our room was good the beds were soft the housekeeping staff kept our room clean and stocked with with shampoo condition and shower gel also plenty of towels room was good sized ,not fancy but no complaints,we felt safe ,parking was free no coffee pot ,so we bought one ,there is a CVS pharmacy pretty close our biggest complaint was when we checked in we were told by the front desk the pool was open till 8;30 which is too early for us but okay the guy who helped us with our bags said the same thing so we went out and walked the strip a bit ,it was so dang hot so we hurry back to our hotel at 7 get our swimsuits on up their by 7:30 the pool is closed! its a long hike to the pool and we pass endless people with little children in swimsuits going to the pool I felt sorry for them as its a lot of work and disappointment for them, there is an adult pool somewhere but that would not do family's any good do to the lack of a reliable pool and I would not stay here again we stayed in many hotels on our 3 week vacation and this is the only one without free internet,we went to fashion show mall and went to the apple store to check in with our friends this was not a bad hotel it just had no frills at all

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Room - Great Pool - Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: DaddyDogs
Reviews.Content: I've upgraded from The Orleans to My Hotel / Casino of Choice - The Stratosphere. This is my fourth stay at the Strat in the past two years. They comp me 2 of 5 days. The other three at around $25.00 per nite. The alcove room on the 21st floor beats rooms at Bally's and The Flamingo. Cleaniness is the best at the Stratosphere ... as good as if not better than The Orleans Hotel and Casino. Originally from Brooklyn, NY, I know good Italian food. A bit skeptical I ate at Fellini's Restaurannt...the Seafood dish was great!. Like a Zuppa de Pesce. The nickel video poker is a joy next to the Seccurity Desk. This was the second time I hit for a Royal Flush for $200 {4,000 nickels!}. Cocktail service is good and the beers are ice cold! Just give the beautiful cocktails waitresses a $1 tip, and they keep coming back every 5 or 6 minutes!. The pool...aahh my favorite...why? NO SHADE! I hate shade. From 10AM until 6:30PM pure sun and the pool is super clean and the water is crisp (not ice cold!). The Pool at the Stratosphere is better than The Flamingo!! I stayed at The Flamingo. Their pool is too winding...like for kids....too many palm treess....too much shade and the lounge chairs are right next to each other....yuk!
