The pool at the Strat is also better than the pool at the new city center {Aria Hotel}, better than the pool at MGM ....also too winding and a lot of shade and better than the pool at The Mirage whcih has way too much shade. I go to Vegas twiced a year.... 2 full weeks, really 15 days during Memorial Day and another 15 days around Labor Day. With the comps I get from Harrah's {Total Rewards} and the Stratosphere...total 15 days cost me $130.00. You heard that right $130 for 14 nigths stay. 6 nights at The Flamingo (was charged $55 for one night on Labor Day), then on to The Stratosphere for 5 nights where I was comped (free stay )for 2 nights, and the other 3 nights at $25.00 each night, and then to Bally's for the remaining 3 nigths all three nights comped....$130.00 total hotel stay. And I play the nickel and quarter video poker machines. Maybe gambled (and lost) $1,100 for 15 days. But where you can go on vacation for 15 days for $130 + $1,100 = $1,230? NO WHERE! And where the weather is clear skies for all 15 days except for 15 minutes on day 3 where it poured cats and dogs! Otherwise the weather is second to none!! I love the hot weather,,,I'm in the pool from around 10:30AM straight to 5:00PM the hotter the better....no suntan lotion,,,I get nice and bronzed by day three. No sunburn, no lotion of any kind except for a dab or two of 99 cent moistruizing cream from Walgreens on my face at the end of the day. I love Vegas....just got back the other day! All I can say now is 8 months, 33 weeks, 231 days and 4 more haircuts...and it will be VIVA LAS VEGAS, next year, beginning around Memorial Day Weekend 2011 at Ballys, The Stratpsphere and finally on to The Flamingo!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: KandS_313
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Labor day weekend and I was honestly expecting a so-so kind of experience. Due to the location and the low cost of staying here, I wasn't expecting much. Fortunately, I was wrong. The staff is great! Every single employee I encountered was nothing less than cheerful, helpful, and courteous. I'm talking about the valet staff, the gentleman who checked us in, the housekeeper, the bartenders and cocktail waitresses in the casino. I was really impressed. As for the room, we opted for one of the newly renovated rooms and I'm glad we did. It was a tad small but it was comfortable, clean, and nicely decorated. Really, I can't say enough nice things about this hotel/casino. The location wasn't really an issue since we had a rental car and were able to get around. Traffic is another thing but it has nothing to do with the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not the fanciest place but does the job”
Reviews.Author: Kannix
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the premier tower of the stratosphere. The rooms are big and the beds are great. Ask for a room on the 17th floor or up. These have been redecorated and look very nice. The lower floors area bit worn out. The pool is a nice place to stay although the dj starts blasting music through its single speaker at 4 pm. So if you want to hear yourself think choose the righthand side of the pool. The fitness room is ok. The equipment is a bit old but it does the job. The view from the tower is great. We made our trip up there Around dawn. That was great. The casino isnothing fancy, its a bit old. The hotel is a good 1,5 miles off the real starting of the strip. (encore and wynn) That is a bit far and the wLk over there is not nice. The deuce busses are. Good way of getting around. A night although the strip suffers from servere traffic jams. Count in an houre to get from mandalay bay to the stratosphere by bus. Next time i would chose a hotel more in the centre of the strip. Nb. There is no free wifi in the hotel, it is at a charge of 12 dollar a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun and Pleasant Stay at the Strat!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeraboa
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night (Sept 9-12) stay at the Stratosphere with my husband and a group of friends. We had an easy VIP check-in with our Stratosphere Select room. Joy checked us in and was so pleasant to work with! Great staff! We arrived at the hotel by 10 AM and were able to go right up to our room (it was a Thursday and a little quiet). Every day got a little busier as the weekend approached. The room was near the elevators on the 23rd floor, which was fine until the last night when the drunks next door stayed up a little late and got locked out of their room and banged on the doors at 5am. (-; Not a big deal for us though, as we both fall back to sleep easily. The view from the 23rd floor was awesome! It isn't a strip view and it is above the parking garage, but you are up so high, the mountains are the main focus. The night view is also very cool! The room itself was updated with granite bathroom countertops, nice size tub, flat screen tv, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on in a hotel, and trendy decor. There is a turndown service and chocolates on the pillow. Also bathrobes if you would like them. I loved the Select Room! The pool was a blast! Again, nice mountain view over the wall. Drinks were a little high- $6 beer, $10 for a fruity concocotion, but there was good music, lots of people, and it was a lot of fun! The casino didn't love us, but that's ok- that's why they call it gambling, right? I was up about $200 at one time, but gave it all back by the end of the weekend. We played a lot though. The buffet was good. Not great, but not bad. Pretty average. Loved the Bananas Foster! Potstickers were good too! If you show your Player's Club Card, you get 25% off. Saturday was a Champagne Brunch with chilled crab legs. Nice. Loved the Mimosas! We ate at Roxy's Diner late one night. It was decent, but plan on spending at least $30 without alcoholic beverages. Sandwiches are about $10. During the day, they sing to the patrons. Some of our group had a fun waitress named Aretha. They said she could sing like the great lady herself. We saw the American Superstars show. Elvis, Rod Stewart, and Michael Jackson were all very good. We got a 2-1 deal for staying at the property. $60 for a VIP booth. Very good seat and good show. I was a little disappointed because I was looking forward to the Britney Spears and Tim McGraw impersonators, but neither were there that night. )-: Check out Sunday morning was also easy. There weren't many people up and about at 8am on Sunday. (See previous "drunks" comment!) We walked to the Venetian (a very do-able 2 miles or so) and taxied back for about $10. Taxi to downtown was also about $10 one way. I don't see the location as a problem at all. The hotel was so reasonably priced that it is worth budgeting in the taxis. I should have paid more attention to the Players Club. I had about 1800 points on my card and was going to cash it out for $3 when we left. I had forgotten to do it earlier. There has to be at least $4 on your card for cash back, but I had $9 in comps I didn't know about! I'll have to go back within a year and use it! I went up to the tower and rode the Insanity. Awesome!!! One of our group also jumped off the tower. He said he has never been so terrified in his entire life. It was a great time and we can't wait to go back! I don't know why anyone would give this place such a bad review. I didn't see anymore shady characters than anywhere else I've been. Nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: deskclerk102
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and was very impressed. A rate of about $52 including the resort fee got us a double queen on the 23rd floor ("select" room), which had clearly been recently updated. Everything was immaculate...even the hallway carpet outside was spotless. Views from the room were excellent toward Sahara and the strip...lights were awesome. Also had a view of several "jumpers" bungee jumping from the tower throughout the evening...to each his own:) The staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to accommodate our needs...from the desk to the valet to the bell services....no complaints at all. The buffet was pretty good for the price ($19 or so per person, but the ACE card knocks it down to $14...well worth stopping by the desk to get the card). Just your basic buffet by vegas standards, but not bad at all. Hotel guests get into the observation deck free any time, which is a tremendous deal. If you have 3 or 4 people in the group who like to frequent the tower, it basically pays for your stay considering the usual $12-$15/person charge. There is a nice mall area attached, which included a McDonald's if you just want something quick. The lobby and casino areas all looked nice and clean (although yes, there is some smoke...it's a casino:). There was a wide selection of games and minimums. My only complaints were: Internet access is $12/day, so it's essentially "emergency only"...and the 8th floor pool closes at 8:00, which is ridiculous. But otherwise, everything was great. The main complaint folks seem to have about stratosphere is its location. I wouldn't say the place is in a bad neighborhood, but it is at the end of the strip on the edge of the main stream. If you want to walk everywhere...it's just not for you...plain and simple. But, if riding the deuce bus or walking over to the monorail at Sahara (less than 2 blocks away) makes sense for your stay $$-wise, you can get a lot of bang for your buck here. They appeared to be remodeling in areas and some of the lower floor rooms may be getting a facelift now as well. Although, if you're only looking at a $5 or so per night difference for the select room upgrade, it's a must do. I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: LaronzaW
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on this hotel on vegas.com and it was worth it. Our plane landed at 7 am and there was not a room available for us but they let us get our suits out and go to the pool. We got a cabana and the service was EXCELLENT!!! Callie our server was EXCELLENT and was very helpful. They called us when they had a room ready and we were surprised at how clean the room was and it had a lot of space. The TV was outdated but we were not in Vegas to watch TV anyway. Our phone didn't work but we had cell phones so we weren't worried about that. It is kind of far down on the strip and we caught the Deuce buss which has a pass for 7.00 for 24 hours. If you can afford it please take the monorail the deuce stops at every hotel and it takes FOREVER to get anywhere. The casino was great I won 25.00 and I only put in 2.00 so I was happy. We wanted to do the sky jump off the hotel but it costs 100.00!! I wasn't willing to do that. The mall in the hotel was great and whenever we had a question people were quick to help us. I would stay again but next time I want to stay closer to the strip. The 21+ pool is great and the Italian restaurant has great food for GREAT prices.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel-Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: gsethi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just average. The location is way off the mark and the breakfast offered is just average. The room is neat and clean and well furnished. The staff is very pleasant and courteous. Would recommend to stay in other hotels and enjoy great casino life... A tip: Please spend some time in a casino before starting playing!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: American70
Reviews.Content: The hotel was musty smelling and so was our room.They need to remodel the rooms and the entire hotel. This hotel was offered as a SouthWestTravel Package. I believe someone in the marketing area needs to spend a night at these hotels before they offer them in these packages. This package was not cheap. The rooms were old and run down.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: twinklepink
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in August 2010. The location was no big problem as we were aware of where the hotel was however taxis could vary in price a lot so I’d recommend always taking extra money with you just in case. Found the monorail pretty useless- often the exits/ entrances were placed far into hotels so you had to walk what was probably the equivalent of the strip in and out of the casinos anyway! Taxis line up outside the hotel so there was never any waiting involved. The hotel itself was faultless, the staff were very helpful and polite and check in was very quick. The rooms were always cleaned and the air con was on when we arrived which was very appreciated. The air con unit could be switched on and off as required. Our room was on the 5th floor and we never ever had any problems with noise during our stay. The casino is pretty much the same as any casino in Vegas. We didn’t eat at any of the restaurants as we wanted to try some of the trendy places to eat on the strip- which were around the same price range really. Drinks were slightly cheaper here than in the heart of the strip. There are a good range of shops upstairs and a MacDonald’s which was always open late and very handy. Be prepared to be searched (like in the airport) on your way up to the tower. The views are fantastic! There were some dodgy looking characters in the streets surrounding the hotel although we were never bothered by anyone and to be honest there are dodgy characters throughout the strip anyway. The only thing that has made me book elsewhere for our trip next year is that we did underestimate the walk somewhat. I had bad blisters and very sore feet two days in although when you are walking there is so much to see and do that you don’t feel like it’s a long walk. There were also no safe deposit boxes available. If you want to see Vegas and have a budget to stick to- or are only here for a couple of days I’d really recommend this hotel. It was clean, friendly and exactly as the website makes it out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with consensus”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews I've read about this property are pretty accurate. I was here for two nights in January of 2010 for a meeting and frankly would not have stayed here but for that reason. Good: Professional and friendly check in desk. Quick and very helpful. Room was clean, with fresh duvet and comfortable bed. Somewhat spartan decor. Bathroom was also clean. I was actually very surprised with the comfort of the room. I did not have much of a view, but that was not a priorty for me. Decent diner for breakfast. Could be quite crowded though. Starbucks handy but also could be quite a wait. I'm a sucker for the rides up top. Helps to be a guest because then you can skip the annoying line (mostly)--however, even the guest line can be on the long side. I was even with a woman with a cane and severe mobility issues and they made her wait for me to go through the line before they would let us up the elevator. Seriously? Oh, and the insidious picture taking was just inconvenient. O.K.: Casino--on the small side with a very varied crowd. Too smoky though. Did win some money on blackjack, despite playing with some bad gamblers. Other restaurants weren't very appealing. Not so great: Location. Yeah it is on the Deuce route, but that bus can suck the soul out of you. I guess if you want to balance your time between the strip and downtown, then the location can be a decent compromise. I did not find the location to be particularly dangerous or sketchy, just kind of sad.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere was a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ALANSC7
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere Hotel and Casino was a pleasant surprise. I had an easy and courteous check in at noon and my room with a strip view was delivered as promised. The room was clean and reasonably well appointed. The room charge included a 24 hour free observation deck pass, which is about $20.00 each if you're not staying there. In the early afternoon there was a long security line wait to the rides & observation decks. However, when I went back at sunset there was no line and I breezed through. There is both an indoor and outdoor observation area and both have 360 degree views. The indoor deck has a gift shop, bar, and comfortable seating that enable you to hangout and enjoy the view. This is also the area where you can access the thrill rides, so watching those is part of the fun. They have a nice buffet where the servers seemed genuinely happy to see their guests. The buffet has options for whatever time of day it is for you. You can use your players club card points to pay at Starbucks and the buffet. The casino is sharp and well designed with a very friendly staff. Good parking garage. The only drawback to staying at the Stratosphere is a high noise level in the rooms, or at least in the room that I had. The room was very noisy even when the people in the hallways were doing normal things like closing the door to their room or speaking in normal tones. But then again, who goes to a casino to sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good location to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: timefinder
Reviews.Content: At check in I was notified that my 2 bed rooms had been downgraded to a one bed room with a mini fridge at an extra cost per night. I was told this was all the hotel had available, should not have been because this room was booked well in advance! Room was on non smoking floor, could smell smoke all night long, maybe from other rooms on same floor. Room was old looking needed major updating. Casino was ok, Buffet was horrible and high priced. Service was terrible. Roxy's diner was a nice place to eat. Tower restaurant had a nice atmosphere but our server was to busy flirting and we were not impressed. We had our car broken into the second night we were there and had to spend most of the next day getting a window replaced. This was in the self parking area of the Stratosphere. I was told by our glass serviceman that they get around three to four calls a month at that location. Amazing that there are no security cameras. I noticed locals and really seedy people walking across from some apartment buildings across the street right into the employee parking garage the leads to the self parking and security never stopped them and told them to go around to the front entrance. I cannot stress more that you stay at a hotel further up on the strip. I would say from the Encore and Wynn towers on up. Stay away from the area around Circus Circus, the Riviera and Stratosphere. PAY ATTENTION! I would not recommend this hotel to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for first time visit”
Reviews.Author: kkr_supporter
Reviews.Content: Good Clean room. The check in was smooth and less time consuming. Although it's at one end of the strip if you have a car you don't have any problem in travelling to other parts of Vegas. Alternately you can purchase a all day pass on Deuce Bus and freely move. You get a very good deal if you travel mid-week. By booking this hotel you have free access to the top of the stratosphere tower (for 4 persons) for a wonderful view of the Las vegas. This alone is more than the money you spend to stay in this hotel. I strongly recommend this hotel to all first time visitors and moreover, if you have young kids, they will really enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap option if you don't mind taking a cab to central strip”
Reviews.Author: SSB79
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at the Stratosphere and just like last time, I took a cab to and from central strip since the hotel is at the very end and quite a long walk away. There was a 20 minute wait at the checkin line which is about the same as I remember from last time. The room itself was pretty decent although it had a "grand" view of a parking lot! This was more than compensated by the FREE admission to the top of the tower. You get up to 4 tower admission swipes with your room keycard everyday and the views are absolutely amazing. I didn't do the rides since we were short on time but they looked really cool and exciting. All in all, its a pretty decent yet low-cost option within a cab drive or slightly long walk of central strip if you are just looking for someplace to crash. Oh also, the hotel has free self parking for guests in an attached parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Baragin Hotel, Only Stayed For the Rides”
Reviews.Author: emmaxoxo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, for the rides at the end of our roadtrip -- though we never made it to the rides, well we did but had just had breakfast and didn't fancy it! Anywho we checked in late around 9pm, valet parked. The hotel was at capacity and we got upgraded to a Premier suite instead of just the standard room we had booked. The room was huge, king bed, sofa bed/TV area, dining table, kitchenette, his & hers sinks, seperate toliet area, huge tub and walk in shower. The upgrade was nice, though the sheets felt damp to lie on, not to touch -- werid. It was only one night, so we survived. They charged a resort fee, like most Vegas hotels, but no wi-fi included, that was other $12 on top. Would recommend staying mid strip for a Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “On the edge of the Vegas Strip - but great value”
Reviews.Author: chadchernet
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere Hotel is at the far end of the Vegas Strip, roughly a 30-minute walk to the center of the Strip and where most of the action and grand hotels are located. However, if you are searching for a hotel with value and don't mind walking, taking public transportation or driving, then this is the the hotel for you. For example, we needed to extend our trip for one extra night, a Wednesday, and the rate we received was only $38. That is the cheapest I have ever seen a room for a major Vegas strip hotel to offer during the summer. We were also upgraded to a mini-suite for an extra $10 per night. NOTE: This hotel, as for most others, do not have coffee machines inside the rooms nor do they have water fountains. This is for the simple reason that they would rather have you buy these beverages from them at a markup. Welcome to the "new" Vegas. As for entertainment, the Stratosphere offers their most unique and defining attractions on the very top of their hotel, 108-110 stories up. If you stay at the hotel, you receive comlimentary admission to ride up to the top of the tower. Once you arrive there, they offer (for a price), a multitude of adrenaline pumping rides for those who are not scared of heights. You can take the "Big Shot" (shoots you upwards above the tower), a motion ride that holds you over the edge of the tower, or the newest attraction - a freefall over the side assisted by multiple cords and harnessess. The hotel itself also offers a beautiful pool, we only visited it one day on Tuesday, but they have a DJ and poolside party from Thursday through Sunday. You can even watch those indiviudals crazy enough to freefall from the edge of the tower. Drink prices inside the hotel are average for Vegas these days, $5 for a domestic beer, roughly $8-$10 for a mixed drink. Overall we thouroughly enjoyed ourselves, the only drawback was the distance to the center of the Strip and the time it takes to reach it. Summetime in Vegas is etremely hot and dry and 30 minutes outside may drain your energy.

Reviews.Title: “We selected this hotel because of price...”
Reviews.Author: canadian-eh777
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of price. We wanted to be near the strip. What we discovered was there was plently to do at this hotel. The tower was exceelent. We were allowed to go up while we stayed there. The price to go up in the tower was $16 per person (we were 4 people) so it was excellent value since we paid only$76 for a sat night stay. The room and bathroom was clean and updated. The view from the tower was amazing. We got up to the tower twice - once at night and once in the day. The 3 rides were discounted because we were staying there and were great run. They have sky jumping there and even though we did not do it we enjoyed watching people jumping off. It's probably the safest way to try out sky jumping. For breakfast head to IHOP as short walk from the front lobby. We had dinner at the Italian restaurant in the hotel and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Fun and a Good place to start in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jetseter87
Reviews.Content: Although it's not ideally situated , the stratosphere is within walking distance of the hustle and bustle of the centre of the strip and a short bus, taxi or limo ride. If it's your first time to Vegas than i do recommend the stratoshpere it's not as expensive as some of the other hotels and seems to have enough to keep thrillseekers happy with the rides at the top of the tower. A trip up the tower of course worth while just for the fantastic view. Although not as flash as some of it's brothers and sisters, it's also not too basic to make you feel like your not in vegas at all. All the hotel facilities and swimming pools are well maintained and can't complain neither about the food. All in all a great place to stay in vegas, especially for first timers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a long walk from the rest of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Michelle444
Reviews.Content: I really loved staying at this hotel. The price of the rooms was great, although I understand this is because they expect you to gamble and drink. The drinks however were not even that expensive and there are other things to do besides gambling. The pool on the rooftop is great and there is great service both in the casino and up at the pool. I, however, expected to be able to go up to the top of the stratosphere for free or for a cheaper price, being a hotel guest, however these lift tickets were still very expensive even to guests. The other downside to this hotel is the noisy lifts. Our room was right next door to the lifts and you could hear them speeding up and down all the time and throughout the night. I don't think would have been a problem however if we weren't in the room right next to it. Overall though, I thought it was a really great hotel with a great pool and good restaurants and margaritas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: vichold
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere is the nicest hotel that I have ever stayed in at Las Vegas, the rooms are clean and a good size. The hotel staff are very friendly on the many occasions which I delt with them. Value for money this hotel is excellent. The only negative thing I could say is that the hotel buffet is a bit over priced for what it is $14.99 breakfast and $19.99 plus tax dinner(also it is more expensive at weekends) but then you don't have to eat there if you don't want to.

Reviews.Title: “perfect if you know what you want....”
Reviews.Author: canthony
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas several times and know we hate being in the thick of the strip. It's just way to crowded down there. We are also comfortable driving around town, so we always get a rental car. This made the Stratosphere a great location for our family - my husband, myself and two boys under 10. The price was great: about $40 on a weeknight, $70 for weekend. The rooms were clean and the beds extremely comfortable with quality linens. Bathroom snobs will be disappointed; the facilities were merely utilitarian, but very clean. The pool area was nice and large, complete with ping-pong tables and water polo nets and balls. I was also pleasantly surprised by the quality of the buffet, and with the player's club discount, it was very reasonable. As much as we enjoyed the hotel, it was also nice to be able to get other places easily. If you're planning on staying at the Strat, do yourself a favor and spring for a rental car. Driving around town is easy if you stay off the strip and there is always parking (valet, even) at other casinos. We were all over town in the five days we were there, including a trip to the Grand Canyon, but the Strat was a nice home base away from the mass of humanity with a comfy bed to crash in.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed second time and was happy”
Reviews.Author: gejsha
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and we were happy with the room and service of the rooms, but wont stay here again because of the location. Its off the main strip and would like to stay more in the centre next time, anyway recommend fully. The 50`s restaurant on the ground floor has fab food but horrible service. Good fitness centre as well, love the pool on the top floor :)

Reviews.Title: “a perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: mannmade4
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one week with my teenage daughter check in went fast but if you arrive at a busy time you would have to wait like 1/2 an hour the room was spotless the beds were amaizing .we never herd the neighbours the pool was nice with a mixed crowd ,loud music playing all the time relaxed atmosphere the food at the pool was great and well priced we really enjoyed the free guest access to the tower the view was amazinggggggggggg we used the bus everyday to get to the busier area of the strip (the bus stops next to the hotel) great service the hotel has quite a few restaurants in the complex and within walking distance . great trip I would stay there again (great price )=great value P.S. we saw the older more well known hotels in the area and felt they were so dirty,run down and depressing and smookey and felt they were not a good value evean if they were cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms at a bargain price!”
Reviews.Author: vctorianne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere for 3 nights. First impression was great, rooms were very large, beds were huge and so comfy. I'm sure 4 people could comfortably sleep in it! No view from the window which was a tad dissapointing. Casino was a good size with lots to try. Tried the buffet at the hotel which was really good. I think it was $20 each. But the selection was great, lots of different kinds of foods to try. Definetly left feeling full! Views from the top of the observation desk were AMAZING. We tried one of the rides too (there are three). Visited the pool only once, but very adequate. Large pool with lifeguard, lots of sunbeds etc. Location is good, it's located at the top of the strip so quite a walk if you want to reach the bottom. There are two bus services (Ace & Deuce) which go up and down the strip. 7$ for 24 hours or you can get a three day pass for $15 (which annoyingly we didn't find out until the end). The Deuce literally stops at every hotel, so even though it's only a mile or so down the road, it took ages in traffic! Recommend waiting for the Ace instead. It only stops at the main hotels so you can skip a load in the middle and go straight to the bottom of the strip. Like all of the other Vegas hotels, there are lots of shops and restaurants inside the hotel itself. McDs etc etc. Of course if you want any extras (Wifi) you have to pay bucks. Nothing is free. But we didn't try it. Also a gym but we never tried it. Overall this hotel is great for the price! We paid £100 for 3 nights which is brilliant. If you can get a similar price then go there! I would stay there again rather than pay $$$ to stay in the bigger hotels in the main part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect LV stip hotel”
Reviews.Author: gittelbug
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is a great hotel at the end of the strip perfect for those on a budget but still want their hotel to meet up to the high end expectations of the LV Strip. The room was updated and clean with comfy beds and an amazing bathtub. The only downsides of the hotel was that the facets in the shower/tub area looked moldy as did some of the grout looked moldy as well. We loved the free passes to the top of the tower that were included in the room! It was amazing at night. The free parking was a huge plus! The parking is a bit far from the check in and when leaving there is no sign that directs you back to it. But it's 100% free, even for non hotel guests, so it's worth the walk though the casino. All the staff members were friendly and helpful when we had questions or needed directions. Be wary of the internet as it's 11.95 for 24 hours per computer. So we got charged twice in one day for net access, which is why i rated the value lower than I normally would.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic holiday in vagas”
Reviews.Author: cromedome9942
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have visied las vagas, first time was on a tour with travel seans west coast tours.This one stopped at stratopher hotel and we were verry inprest with it then even though we wwas taken round all other hotels in vagas this hotel inprest my wife her sister @me.So we came back this year to stay for a week and and sayed we would stop again at stratospher, this time my daughter also came,what a loverly holiday we had.From booking in to checking out the staff were excellent wish i could have spent more time there...PS if you stay at this hotel please visit the swimming pool on eighth floor magic ,bar staff brilant also visit top of tower at night i give it ten stars.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time back”
Reviews.Author: tingtongAU
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time at Stratosphere. Service is EXCELLENT. We were originally put on the 7th or 8th floor (whatever floor the pool is on) and within a minute of us being in the room, the noise/chaos from kids/teenagers and drunks going to/from the pool was enough for both of us to decide this means no sleep for us. When the staff delivered the bags, I mentioned this to him and he immediatley rang up, changed rooms for us to another floor - I was so impressed. This made our stay alot nicer. The hotel has the best buffet as far as we were concerned. The variety is huge. We enjoyed the stay and would stay there again - the hotel is starting to look a little dated now but that kind of suits that end of the strip. We shopped at Premium Outlet about 8 minutes away by taxi - next time we will buy a suitcase from there and fill it. Outstanding bargains!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at the end of the L.V. strip”
Reviews.Author: jamers526
Reviews.Content: Good room with Kind Bed w/ flat screen TV & well kept bathroom. Room service was great and the casino was of course lively! The Roxy restaurant on the main floor is delicious. The Air Bar is awesome and the staff is great! Checked out from our hotel room by phone and was done in literally 10 seconds! The hotel was a great get-away after spending the day walking the strip and in and out of different casinos all night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: WestWind12
Reviews.Content: We liked the room and the tower experience but not the casino or one of the restaurants. This was our first visit to this hotel/casino. Our truck would not fit in the parking garage so the very friendly and helpful bell hops directed us to the outside parking across the street. We approached the front glass doors in the Vegas summer heat not knowing what to expect. As we walked in the noisy, smoky casino greeted us and I had to ask someone where the hotel desk was. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. We then had to walk through the casino to find the elevators for our section of the building. We got a great deal on the room price. The room including the bathroom was large and the beds were comfortable. We did not have a view but for the price were not expecting a view. There were some cigarette burn marks in the room. We did go up the tower and that was a must do, just for the view if nothing else. The walking route from the room to the tower was not very direct and forced you to walk past many stores on the way. We ate at Roxies diner once - it was the worst food of our trip. I could go on, but in short, we liked the large comfortable room (even without a view) and we liked the tower experience. We did not like the one restaurant we tried, and the cigarette smoke in the casino and other parts of the building was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated but awesome views”
Reviews.Author: broadshouldersgal
Reviews.Content: The carpark was very far from the main lobby, which means the hotel is huge and has 4 wings, I think. Check-in was slow (20 mins) even though there were 7 or 8 staffs at the counter, but check out was convenient: just drop the key card off the box. Room & bathroom were clean & of decent size. Comfy pillows & huge bed. We went out to take a walk & realized it was pretty far off from the main strip, but managed to visit Sahara Hotel & some kind of huge outlet nearby. Also saw a few wedding chapels nearby. Good walking exercise if you eat a lot. We then walked inside our hotel to discover many shops as well as restaurants. We had free access to the tower & the night views were amazing. We went up to the tower again the next morning & the views were even more awesome. The thrill rides were only OK but we didn't try as we were on our way to Knotts & Disney anyway. The swimming pool was lovely as we looked down from the tower. Overall, great value & a good place to stay for only a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “There's better places to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: thechubber
Reviews.Content: First of all, Stratosphere is located right up north on the strip. Meaning that if your ideal mode of transport along the strip is walking, do not choose to stay at Stratosphere simply because it's too far from the main attractions on the strip, that are located in the middle of further down south. Plus, the hot weather does not exactly encourage long walks. The rooms were small but decent and the only thing I did not really like about it would be the lack of coffee makers in the room. If you're carrying lots of luggage, take note that the carpark is located a distance away from the rooms. You'd have to walk through the casino in order to get to the lifts. More walking to do as well, not much of a worry unless you're carrying heavy baggages. Overall, I would definitely not stay at the hotel again mainly due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Canadians in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: TahneeSmith
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, but far on the strip from the other well known casinos/hotels. other then that it was a good price for a good hotel. we found that all the casinos and hotels had the same layout once you were inside. the food at the buffets were amazing and the staff was very nice and helpful. we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcbj
Reviews.Content: Stayied one nigth at the hotel in a Spa Suite. The room was ok, but a littel oldfashion no flatscreen or coffee maker!! The bathroom with the spa was working well, but do not expect any romantic atmosphere in this room. The lightning is massiv and connot be dimmed at all. The was plently with space in the room, but noise from other rooms TV, conversations etc. could be heard clearly. (Sleeping was ok, without any noise at all). Be aware that the wifi fee (11.99$) is per device and not pr room. At check-out I was charged 2x11.99$ because it had both connected my labtop and my cellphone. The fee also gives you access to a full equiped fitness room, a huge outdoor pool and free admission to the observationdeck. TIP: The is a buffet at the Casino level with all you can eat for 20.00$ + tax.I is a nice buffet with foof mad by a chef and not a lazy boy!! The is a lot to choose from !!

Reviews.Title: “You could find a better deal”
Reviews.Author: kupkakekelci
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with another couple ( all of us in our young 20's) on a road trip and reserved this hotel for our stop in Las Vegas. PERKS: Reasonable prices, comfortable beds, free parking, Starbucks in casino, and free passes for tower each day DISAPPOINTMENTS: Internet costs $10 a day, small bathrooms, Casino wreaks of smoke and it's very thick (the nicer casinos didn't smell like this) , the buffets were over priced, and we had to lug all of our luggage to the other side of the hotel through the casino. TIPS: You can get a better hotel in a more decent area. I'm fine with walking, but when we were there it was 117*F and the heat was just too much to walk all the way to the main strip and down.

Reviews.Title: “awesome loved it”
Reviews.Author: jen3178
Reviews.Content: i booked my trip with travelocity i loved it at the hotel it was a great trip when i return to vegas it will be at the stratosphere thrill rides was awesome the view was great i really enjoyed my stay it was my first time in vegas and it was enjoyable thank you stratosphere hotel and employees

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL STAFF MAKES THIS PLACE A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: truereviewsPhoenix
Reviews.Content: First off, let me start off by saying that they have a bunch of low lifes running the VALET parking and all of them dont look happy to be there. when me and my fiance checked in we were helped by some very rude receptionist that told me the room i booked wasnt available and that she would have to put us in a standard room which wasnt what i paid for, but we were driving for 5 hours from phoenix and i just wanted to shower and get a bite to eat on the strip. so when we got to our room the ac wasnt working correctly and the bathroom was horrid. the floor in the bathroom was cement (literally) and stand up shower, and the rug in the entry way was very stained. i called to the front desk and asked if we could be placed in a different room and they told me someone would be up to give me the new keys to the new room. about 1/2 hr later some guy delivered the news keys and walked away without asking if we needed any help or anything. the new room was OK, better bathroom and ac worked. I have to say that every single staff employee that works at this hotel including the store employees, mcdonalds, & starbucks all have a serious attitude problem. We found out other guests were having the same problem while we were standing online at starbucks. If you like being around dirtbags and in a screwed up area on the strip as well, then stay here. the next time we visit vegas we will definetly not be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous stay! Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Dancemom27
Reviews.Content: With only a few weeks to plan our trip on a strict budget, I set about researching choices. The price was right for our 7 night stay, so despite some of the more negative reviews, I decided to take my chances with the Stratosphere hotel. Yes, I was worried, but went with an open mind. We arrived late (10 PM) on a Monday night and yes, the lines to check in were long. But it moved, and check in was a breeze once we got to the front. I appreciated the check in staff member's advice to not (as I was planning) put our room deposit on my pay as you go credit card but on my other card to avoid delays in it being credited back. We were pleasantly surprised with the news that since we had booked on the "Perfect package" through the website, the Resort Fee would be waived making our weekday nights only $27 a night! We were given a room on the 14th floor and was a little worried when we were directed to the World II elevators. I needn't have worried. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean and I was surprised by the nice huge flat screen tv (recent reviews have stated old tv's but we were told that almost all of the rooms now have the newer tv's). I've read complaints about the sink being outside of the bathroom being a problem for some, but I've stayed in other hotels with this design, and it doesn't bother me. In fact, it makes things easier when, for example, one person showers and another one needs to put on makeup or brush teeth, etc.. Water drained well, and shower water pressure was fabulous. Housekeeping was great. There was one day that the 2 teenagers spent a lot of time in the room (and put the do not disturb sign on the door) and our room didn't get made up, but we were left a message from housekeeping to go ahead and call them when we wanted the room done. I thought that was nice. I did leave a small tip every day for housekeeping ($2-5) which I think goes a long way to ensure good service. Every other day our room was done to perfection and sometimes we were left extra supplies. We enjoyed the pool immensely and had no trouble getting loungers. One nice touch....I was leaving my room one day and a security guard was knocking on doors that weren't closed all the way warning them that leaving the door like that could be a problem. I thought that was great. Valet service was awesome. The guys were always friendly and offering help with directions which was great. We used the bell desk a couple times too and those guys were unbelievably friendly and helpful too. All in all, for the whole 7 days we were there, we were treated with the utmost respect by all staff and would definitely stay at the Stratosphere again. I understand that sometimes bad things happen to people on vacation, but I'm not sure I understand the horrible reviews on this place. Either some people are too picky or expecting the world for a small price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever - no respect for guests”
Reviews.Author: topbanana059
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Stratosphere on a 2 week break in Las Vegas and we were very disappointed with what we experienced. I haven't ever written a review online before - but felt so upset about the stay I thought I should at least share with others thinking of staying at the Strat. We were first of all placed on the '5th' floor which we soon found out was actually the 1st floor - and had a view of a brick wall and air con units. This was fine for us as it was only a base. However only a few days into our trip we were rudely awoken by a security guard doing checks at 7am causing the shutters across the lifts to clank and crash several times. Eventually this was resolved but was too late to get more sleep. Then a few days later we were then awoken at 5am but banging and drilling noises and after several calls down to front desk the noise just continued. Each time we were told that the issue will be dealt with and that 'the manager would be told', however the noise continued. We then discovered that building work had started on the casino floor - the noise we could hear was a pneumatic drill breaking up tiles and the banging was the replacement tiles. We asked the builders how long the job will be - and said 5 days!! basically mon to fri so that weekend guests aren't affected presumably. They were again noisy the next morning and we were ignored by requests for them to start later. Presumably, building work is cheaper if they can start early rather than a reasonable time in the morning that would be suitable for paying guests stayinga t a hotel. We were also not notified by the hotel at all about this building work. We were so appalled. We were then given a letter the following day to say that the hot water would be off for the entire day until late afternoon. We then decided to move room - this was something we wanted to avoid given that all our belongings were unpacked already for a 2 week break. As we couldn't bear another early waking, we asked to be moved and to be fair the lady we spoke to did this without any hesitation or the need for us to be assertive with the request. She however placed us in a disabled room in the premier block on 12th which was dated and unclean and lacked the facitilities we were using in the other room. All in all we were very disappointed in our stay at the hotel and would certainly not stay there again. If anyone is thinking of staying, i do think it comes cheap with a package flight deal which is great. having free access to the tower is cool and being halfway between downtown and the main strip is good in order to see both sides. I would either recommend staying elsewhere - perhaps closer to the main places on the strip to save on taxis, or I would defiantely ask for a high floor room to avoid any interruption. I was disappointed they didn't respect their guests - i mean, why place guests staying for 2 weeks on the 1st floor when they knew building work was due to start for half that time. We didn't stick around a use many of the other amenities there. However we did try the buffet whcih was pretty grim. The plates had old food stuck to them and the plastic glasses were all chipped. Contrast this with the bellagio buffet and you'll see the strat have a cheek with what they are offering. Other things about staying in LV - use the deuce bus, only $7 per 24 hour hop on and off. Don't use the starbucks internet terminal - go across the road to the locals cafe where internet is much cheaper for longer. Also try to book tours and trips online before you go, or even while you're there - don't rely on the tour operators vying for your business. Hope this review helps someone with their decision about where to stay. In sum, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good value with the free access to the top of the tower.”
Reviews.Author: kinwa
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is a bit aways from the hustle and bustle of the strip. This was fine with us as we had a car and made several day trips out of town and the location was perfect for easy access to/from the freeway. We really enjoyed the free access to the top of of the tower that came with our package deal. Amazing views day and night. Even a bar and awesome rides up there. It was somewhat noisy in the hallway but then we turned in early by Vegas standards.

Reviews.Title: “Too many choices in Vegas to settle for this one”
Reviews.Author: tuftedtraveler
Reviews.Content: The things they do right, EVERYONE does right--reasonable price during the week, nice pool, fine buffet, ok slots, etc. So, housekeeping errors made this too much of a compromise for the convenience and price. They never did make up our room first day--at ALL. Then second day it took FOUR phone calls to get the room made up by 8:30--so we had no clean towels to shower for dinner or shows. Main problem was that they kept PROMISING to be there for hours and hours so we would leave to give them room to clean--in effect we were kept out of our room for the SEVEN HOURS-four phone calls and empty promises--it took to get them there. It finally took a call to hotel manager--it was unbelievable--I could not even get them to bring me towels for three hours. NEVER again--there are just too many other options. (Have to say, Valet service was outstanding and location at end of strip made for easy in/easy out for day trips though--that was a plus) Next time I will try for the other end of the Strip--we spent a great deal of tiem at Luxor and guests there were very pleased and atmoshpere was cleaner, more professional.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time Was Had By All”
Reviews.Author: cynnerz
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at the Strat. Despite of the complaints I have read online, I stayed regardless. Not a single problem occured either time. This trip we checked in at 3:00 pm on Sunday. Check in was quick, considering the lineup. We had rooms on the 22 nd floor in the Premiere tower, one with a strip view. You can't beat the price. The location isn't as bad as some make it. If you do not have a rental, the Deuce and the Ace stops are so close to the hotel. We were not bothered at all by beggars, and we walked from the Strat to the main part of the strip.(two women). I see more beggars in Ottawa than I saw in Vegas. As with any city, you have to have your guard up. The bar in the casino has happy hour every night. 4-7 for $20.00. Great service and no crazy drunks. The buffet was good. Went on the last night. Tony was our server and was fantastic. The recession has hit Vegas also(believe it or not). Tony was the server, bus boy, and cleaner. That boy hustled. We all made sure he was tipped well. That is one thing I noticed in Vegas, people were rarely tipping their servers. In one restaurant, a table of four left without leaving a thing. Servers don't make that much money and tips are their bread and butter. We shouldn't forget it. I would recommend the Strat for a stay for sure. The Premiere Tower has great rooms. Clean rooms, quick elevators and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “it was a good deal”
Reviews.Author: spykitten
Reviews.Content: During week days the price was super cheap. My room was clean and comfortable. Tried the rollercoaster on the tower (pretty wimpy) and the buffet downstairs (wow, what variety!) There are also a lot of little shops in the base of the tower.

Reviews.Title: “nice location and view”
Reviews.Author: vsvs123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our holiday in LV. Very big hotel and well maintained. Continental breakfast was excellent. Hotel is centrally located offering good views of the city. I would definitely stay there during my next visit and recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD TIME”
Reviews.Author: drummerSwanseaU_k_
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 12 nights this July and had a great time at The Stratosphere we had a room on the 18th floor that was big enough and clean and comfortable with views of the mountains. All the staff we met were great and good at their jobs.The pool was a good size and again clean. The food and drink at the pool was handy (the chilli cheese fries were to nice) The band at The Back Ally Bar was very good and were the best bar band that we saw in Las Vegas. There is no inroom safe but free ones are at the desk. We never felt unsafe in or outside the hotel and used the Duce and Ace buses every day. After a busy day or night on the strip or downtown it is a relief to return to the Stratosphere.Overall it was better than we could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ticketmuc
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere may not be the best hotel on the strip but we did not want to spend to much money. However, you get a lot for your money. They have clean and big rooms, decent pool area, nice casino, located at the strip (but quite far away from everything else but still better than freemont street) We signed up for their reward program and received some meal vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to do on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun26
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot of things to do for a fair price. A great place to go on a budget, and still get a Vegas experience. The tower is the best attraction because of the views. Rooms on the strip side have great views. The atmosphere is fun, but is not for children. It is located in a shady part of town on the far end of the strip, so if you plan to visit other venues the location is not the best. However, I would stay again because the value was great, and the employees were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were decent, but did lack details (like providing the little shampoos or more than one washcloth).

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Kristian
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast, 10 mins and we were all set for our rooms. Had 2 rooms on 22th and 16th floor. Both Spa Luxury Rooms. Nice, big, CLEAN, and a big spabath. Cons: Didn't like the 11$ for Wifi pr. day and no fridge in the rooms. Pros: The casino and eating places was nice. Even the buffet was good! The pool was nice and big to, and the waiters (Jessica) was fantastic! I'll recommend the Bikini Blackjack and the BlackJack tables near Roxy's (Dealers from BITE) Location is not bad at all. 10 mins up the strip by walking and you're on your way to the nicer area of the strip. And for 35$ pr. night i would call it a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, loads to discover.”
Reviews.Author: coolmonna
Reviews.Content: Went with my family for 8 nights, and 7 days, about 2 years ago. When we go on the shuttle bus, people where looking at us when we got off, must be one of the worst locations on the strip but the hotel was good, great smell, great casino. Didn't gamble much doe. Nice all-in-one room (2 queen beds, bathroom, stink, television ect.) Pity no mini frigde. Great swimming pool. AND jacuzzi, open from 6 in the morning, great little gym, pool restaurant SUCKS though.the tower is amazing and the view is un-explainaible. Check in 10 mins nice and quick. Fantastic chinese restaurant that opens in weds&sats. Nice mc.donalds upstrairs. Had great fun. Hopefully going back very very soon. Over all 4.5 had a blast and hope you do too. Monna <3

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel and It Shows...”
Reviews.Author: dream_travelers34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Stratosphere for my brothers wedding from 8-11 Jul. I had reservations about staying here from the jump, but my brother insisted that everyone be located at the same hotel. He had gotten group rates and the rooms were rather cheap. First of all it's located at the very north end of the strip in what I would call the "ghetto" part of the strip. It is out of walking distance from the central/north part of the strip. So if you plan on walking the strip don't choose the Stratosphere. We arrived and the only room that was left that day in the group reservation was a double queen. Not all of our family had even arrived yet, so we were like...ok. So we asked for an upgrade to a King room on the 20th floor (original rooms were on 12th floor. We also asked for a good "view". So we paid the extra $15 per night for this room upgrade and went to our room and I've stayed in some normal chain hotels better than this room (Fairfield Inn, Country Inn Suites, Holiday Inn Express...etc.). First off, there is no such thing as a good view from any room in the Stratosphere. The only good view we had was one of crazy people sky jumping from the top of the tower! Other than that it was a view of the run down end of the strip. The room didn't have a microwave or fridge. The upgrade was a flat screen TV, that wasn't even HD. My wife pulled the sheets back on the bed and there were stains and hair on them, so we had to call housekeeping for a new set. The bath only had two drying towels and one small washcloth. The air vents in the bathroom were covered in dust. As we settled in the room, we heard this loud vibrating noise, so we went out in the hallway to see where it was coming from. The sound was coming through the AC blower unit in the hall. We went downstairs and asked the folks at the front desk about it and they said "Oh yeah, we are doing some remodeling above your floor and they are jack-hammering up there from 8am - 7pm daily!" Are you serious??!!!Needless to say, it wasn't a good experience hotel wise for us....If you're not on a budget or at the expense of someone else's request, don't waste your time on the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Entrance to observation tower”
Reviews.Author: lillymom
Reviews.Content: The hotel does NOT make it clear that if you are staying at the Stratosphere, entrance to the observation tower is free with your room key - also, you must go thru a metal detector. But so glad we went! Hotel, etc. was very nice. would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great value for money, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mtvesuvio
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Stratosphere after a long and delayed flight, check-in was straightforward, staff were friendly and helpful, we were directed towards the hotel lifts. On arriving at the room, could not have been more delighted, it was large, clean and very comfortable, we had a view of the car park, freeway and mountains in the distance, it was a lovely, although we didn't intend on spending much time in the room. No faults with the room. A perfect base to our Las Vegas stay. We were only in Vegas for 3 nights as we were doing a road trip across to San Francisco. The casino was one of the more pleasant to be in I found, as a non smoker, it was less smoky inside than all of the other casinos, the staff were very friendly, and the ladies in Starbucks always had a smile for us early in the morning. Staying in the hotel gives you the added bonus of going up the tower for free, which is a wonderful experience, the views are amazing up there. Didn't go on any of the rides, not that much of a daredevil ;) The hotel itself is large enough to keep anyone entertained, we ate at Roxy's diner where the portions were enough to feed a small army, really good service there. We literally had to tear ourselves from the hotel to go down to the rest of the strip. After reading previous reviews about the location, we were slightly worried about travelling down the to strip, but had no problems, it was a short walk to the Sahara Monorail and that took us right down to MGM. When we were ready to come back, we got a taxi all the way up the strip and that only cost us 11 dollars, which was quite reasonable we thought, after all, traffic is quite slow in moving up the strip, with all the lights etc. Would definately stay at the Strat again, location was fine, value for money was second to none, and the hotel itself we found to be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but bad location”
Reviews.Author: MarieMc85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Stratosphere for three nights in June. First impressions were not good. The hotel is situated right at the end of the "strip", miles away from all of the other hotels and bars etc etc. We were not sure where to park our vehicle so pulled up next to the valet. We had just come from San Francisco where you had to pay $20 for valet so I did not think it to be an unreasonable question to enquire about the parking. The valet told me that either I could park the vehicle in the multi storey car park or that they had valet. I asked whether you had to pay for the valet? He replied "no" and told me to park the car at then end. As I drove away, I heard the valet's poking fun at me and saying "Do you have to pay?" in a fake, posh English accent. So, I decided to reverse and tell them that due to their rudeness, I would park the car myself and that they had just lost themselves a tip. We parked the car in the multi storey car park and checked in. We went to our room and it was very nice and comfortable although our view was of the carpark! The bathroom was big and clean and the beds were really comfortable. The hotel has a great pool on the roof with lots of sunloungers. Although I did go into the bar area and request a diet coke and was told that they couldn't serve me as I didn't have any ID on me. For a diet coke! This was ridiculous and I had to keep going to the waitress desk and buying my drinks! So make sure you bring your ID with you to the pool if you want a drink (whether it be alcoholic or not). We ordered food from the pool area and it wasn't very nice. The American diner is good for breakfast and the Italian restaurant was lovely and the staff were very nice. As previously stated, the hotel is right at the end, away from everything else. This is good if you want peace and quiet but not so good if you would like to be within walking distance of the main hotels and casinos. Overall I would stay in the hotel again but if I return to Vegas I would prefer to stay at the other end.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: patgt
Reviews.Content: First time to vegas.Talked to others who had been to vegas many times.Read many many reviews before deciding.The stratosphere was clean,well appointed and economical.The staff was friendly and helpfull in all encounters,and I was particulairly pleased with the valet guys.I have a somewhat rare car and was initially worried about leaving it in the hands of strangers.After talking with the guys I felt quite confident in their professionalism.The hotel is located somewhat away from the action but the main strip or freemont street is a bus ride away.I would stay here again and I would recommend it to others.One minor thing,I should have seen if I could have had a small fridge in the room:other than that a good time.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't want to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Ruby_Dooby53
Reviews.Content: I travelled here in 2007 with my family. Id say everything about this hotel is average. The room wasn't the best room I have stayed in. We were meant to have a good view in this hotel. I'd say we had a nice view of the car park. The room was rather shabby, dated and a disappointment. The basin was outside of the bathroom.. I was shocked when I went to use the hair drier and it blew all the electrics in my room. There was no breakfast on offer here and when planning to purchase some I was shocked when there was no places to get breakfast. It was too far out on the strip with an hour walk at least if you choose to walk it to get some sun. The best thing about this hotel for me was to rides on top of the tower. I don't feel the staff were overly helpful in this hotel and weren't particularity bothered about any of the enquires we had. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone as its too far out and not the best hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Stay South of the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: expresso1964
Reviews.Content: The hotel was kept clean, but the room looked much nicer in the web pics. What they call a "Strat Select" room is not very different from any other standard hotel room. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful. They would be the biggest positive about the place. The biggest negative would be the location. It is just off of the strip and more to the north end, which is the older, more rundown part of the city. Therefore you have to walk thru a pretty scary part of town to get back to the hotel after walking around the strip. We drove our car out to park in other hotels before we went sightseeing, just to feel safe upon our return in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Loud, Loud!”
Reviews.Author: MAB1974
Reviews.Content: 1. Worst night's sleep in two weeks holiday. 2. Walls thin, with adjoining door 3. Our room next to lift. All of the above fine; unless - 1. You have been up for 40 hours getting to Vegas 2. the people in the room next door hold a party and start screaming and shouting like drunk obnoxious idiots 3. the lift is annoyingly loud and used appromimately 5 times a minute all night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pick carefully”
Reviews.Author: girlvegas
Reviews.Content: I did my research and read the reviews and decided to challenge some of them. And I was wrong!! I called reservations a couple days before arriving and requested a fridge because one my friends had a medical condition and needed the medication in a fridge. The front desk attendent that we had was rude not friendly at all. I requested non smoking and the room smelled. They had mentioned that it was a additional 10 per night and didnt even have one! They also said they have no resort fee but they did when we checked out. The hotel is far from the strip not, and unsafe to walk to the centre of the strip. You either have to take your chances walking or taxi it to the monorail. The amount of money we spent on taking a cab it would be worth it just to pay the extra and stay at cesars, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, to bad smoking is allowed”
Reviews.Author: Sweeetypie
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, hard to find directions inside the hotel. We had a non smoking room but still smelled the smoke of other guests. Parking is free in the garage behind the hotel. The pool is nice but not heated. The view from the tower is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad...the price was right.”
Reviews.Author: 012512Name
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas about two or three times a year. Stayed here for one night, would not really want to stay any longer. We stayed in a suite, which was really nice. The jacuzzi tub in the suite was the nicest I have seen while staying in Vegas. The bed was very uncomfortable as it had springs poking me in the back, but I am not one to complain about everything, so hey, it is Vegas, have another drink. Typical hotel experience when it comes to staff and amenities and such. The Stratosphere is quite far from the rest of the hotels on the strip so expect to stroll awhile down a few skeezy blocks but that is not the end of the world. You really can’t beat the prices so if you are looking for cheap and don’t mind walking lots and don’t care to be in the heart of the strip, this might be a worthwhile stay for you. There is a great Italian restaurant in the casino. The observation deck is great at night and you can’t beat the view from up there. The rides are over-priced, but it is Vegas and what isn’t? I have been on the observation deck and the rides multiple times, so that is the draw for me, but I would rather stay at the Imperial Palace for around the same price because it has a better location, even though the rooms are older.

Reviews.Title: “Fun filled stay with lots of shopping options”
Reviews.Author: billuDelhi
Reviews.Content: It is a huge hotel having Four conected tour. The rooms were not very plush. There was no LCD TV provided in the room. The AC was good but noisy. It was located almst at the end of the strip, therefore not a very good veiw from the room window. Bathroom fixtures were not very mordern. The casino was very good with lots of different games. The shopping arcade was having many shops selling goods/souvinours at reasonable rates. The best was the tower with with most exciting rides and free fall jump. We enjoyed the swimming pool the most. The brunch was really sumptous with a variety of food and desserts.

Reviews.Title: “We Love the Straosphere”
Reviews.Author: brattyvette
Reviews.Content: If you want the party with out cover charges and no need for. V.I.P. Both pool are awesome, every time I visit we have a great time. Cute black jack dealers and let's not forget the tower georgous view it's unforgetable. You must go up

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure your hopes arent stratospheric”
Reviews.Author: Gryphon7777
Reviews.Content: Hmmm. Well. The stratosphere has basically seen better days. It has definintely been superceded by the other newer hotels. Firstly, it is really one of the outer casinos along The Strip, in a not-to-flash neighbourhood. Certainly I wouldnt be walking around outside at night. The room was dark, an old TV, no ceiling lights (only lamps), the toliet seat wouldnt stay up by itself and it was crowded (door just misses toilet..and the toilet tissue holder is very public toiletish), there were cords and cables everywhere, the smoke detector was barely attached, the toilet was noisy and the whole floor smelt smokey (despite being in a non smoking room) - the toiletries I refused to use, the vanity and basin were outside the bathroom. The bed was alright, check-in was a breeze and as with most carparking, it is a long hike (through the casino of course!). The good aspect was free access to the skytower. The shopping arcade - dont even bother - the highlight is McDonalds. Overall, it is past its hey-day. But I suppose, that is why it is a good price when compared to other mega casinos. Definintely for the budget aware and families (not for couples wanting a nice romantic weekend). And of course, it you go for the pokies.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is rude, casino is run down, avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: NickChick
Reviews.Content: From the outside, looks like a good choice. Very run down on inside, need refurbishment. Most of all, staff beginning with the front desk to everyone in the casino was RUDE and very unfriendly. If this place is so bad to work at, they need to move to another casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RowlTD24
Reviews.Content: Checked in late Sunday nite, king room not available like booked, but they promised to make it up the for the rest of the stay, and boy did they. They upgraded us to the top 24th floor to one of thier premire suite and it was great. Large jaccuzi and a view that overlooked the strip. Plus some other little perks that came with the room. It's an older hotel, but well taken care of. As good of treatment as in any of the bigger strip hotels. Since it is older, it seemed a lot less crowded than the bigger ones we went into. If you like to lay out, as my wife does, check out the pool on the 25th floor - no kids allowed. The the only thing that I did not like were the small square pillows on the beds and the hotels location. It is two block from the monorail that runs from the Sahara to the MGM, and that is a life savor for getting around and much cheaper than a taxi. And last, if you are flying in, take a shuttle, it is much cheaper than a taxi as both times I used one on this trip, they turned the meter off just as I was getting out and then ran the price up higher than what was on the meter.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel/Expereince On the Strip by far!”
Reviews.Author: 613princess
Reviews.Content: Don't let people fool you on how Stratosphere really. is. We stayed for 4 days. In that 4 days, the hotel services came into our room once. The first day we showed up they screwed up our reservations. The man who served us then said there may not even be a room available after I made reservations and talked to the staff the night before and prepaid everything. I had specifically asked for a room with nonsmoking as my partner is VERY allergic and causing health problems. I told the staff that from get go, they offered me the |only room available at the time" of 2 beds in a smoking room. I had booked a king in nonsmoking. I then had to make a big deal infront of the man for him to realize this isn't a deal of comfort, this is truly due to a health reason. He then magically found our room, sounds convienient huh?He then tried to make it seem like he was out of his way to get me a room that was lower graded than what I intentially paid for, on a floor lower than what I was told. It took them an hour to get our luggage to us.The maid who came once was because we had to trap one down and ask. Which our service sign was up constantly. No clean towels, no extra luxuries. The ice cube machine was gross. The room was very basic, which was fine. But when all is said and done, the staff weren't friendly at all. In fact I would NEVER goback, NEVER advise my worst enemy to go. The location is horrible! You are constantly being followed by bums and being harrassed for cash and such. That alone with the pure ghetto feel ruined the whole luxury and feel of the hotel aside from them doing it themselves. The pool was dirty, wasn't cleaned, people were spilling drinks into the pool, there were cups and straws which were floating in the water. The lifeguard was in the pool and completely ignored the fact there were objects floating in the water. They do not care about their outlook to customers nor control that problem. THE ONLY THING THAT SAVED THIS HOTEL WAS ROXY'S DINER AND OUR SERVER CASH. He was amazing, friendly, helpful, the prices and food were amazing, that is the only thing good about that hotel is the fact that diner is located within it. When we had gotten the professional pictures done, the staff was horrible, slow and not well trained. BUT there was a gentleman named Adam, he was amazing. If you are to get your pictures done and service please ask for him! With everything said, for the price of the hotel, and it being convient in price, isn't worth your entire first Las Vegas experience nor sanity. Please, enjoy your Vegas experience else where, NOT there. If I were to reccommend anywehre it would be by far THE MIRAGE, we walked into that hotel and everyone was friendly asking what they could do to help, it was spotless, welcoming and beautiful beyond words. when they found out about our experience they offered us a discount for us to stay with them. TI was very friendly, I strongly advise that everyone take our experience into consideration and reconsider if you have leaned towards the stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed here; basic but practical”
Reviews.Author: seasidetraveler7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times; very basic hotel but can't complain for the rates. The room has a "wall unit" AC that is loud, but works well. My only gripe is I prefer to have the sink with the rest of the bathroom, not outside it. That way if a friend is sleeping you don't have to make a bunch of noise in the room getting ready.

Reviews.Title: “Less price, good stay”
Reviews.Author: Blumenfee2002
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 2 nights here in the Stratosphere hotel in June 2008. The hotel Stratosphere is a good hotel to stay for less money, and most time included is a ticket for the tower. How fun and great, we was fascineted from the view over Las Vegas, the stripe and the landscape. Room was pretty, clean and big, the window was to the back side to the parking garage. A nice and clean bathroom. WLAN, hmmm, is the same in the msot other hotels, is to pay per 24 hours. The dinner buffet at the Stratosphere we have also enjoyed, was a good buffet for a normal price. We will come back, clean, big and good rooms, what we want more.

Reviews.Title: “Good for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Archer83
Reviews.Content: I did my homework ahead of time and knowing I wanted to be on the strip I went through at least twenty hotels and the Stratosphere came out on top in terms of the cheapest rooms. I only paid something like 27 dollars a night (not inc. internet) although this was booked months ahead. Parking was free and easy to find and convenient. Rooms were fine. Internet is pricey - 11.99US for 24 hours, but it is good quality. The rides are good value, didn't see the topless vampire review although wish I had now... There's a good 50's style cafe in-house too. Only thing is, location isn't the best if you want to go downtown to somewhere like the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you're on a budget. Ability to walk 5-10mins to the Monorail is advisable..”
Reviews.Author: Memma87
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget this is the place to stay, other than the Luxor which is also quite cheap. Yes, its away from the Strip but it's only going to be inconvenient if you're not willing to walk that little bit extra to the Monorail Station at the Sahara. Put it this way, if you're going to go to the Bonanza store on the corner or Sahara, the Monorail is only across the road. We upgraded at the last minute to a King room, which was the best thing we ever did. It was really cheap. Check in was busy, but they got through it quick enough which suited since we got in late. Our room was huge. Bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel is spotless, the staff are really friendly too. The only problem I had with it was even though we had paid the resort fee before arriving, we were still expected to pay to get to the top of the tower. Not the much of a big deal since we spent most of our time out on the strip exploring anyway. I had to just emphasize the fact that it's only a short walk to the monorail which will then take you to any of the major hotels !

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but too far from everything else”
Reviews.Author: pic-y
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the stratosphere june11-13th 2010. We booked at the stratoshere because it was cheap and the reviews were mostly positive. But it was NOT WORTH THE SAVINGS. The hotel is technically on the strip but it is FAR from everything else. We enjoy walking and do it whenever we get a chance, but it was just not practical. The hotel is at one end- nothing goes on past it- its isolated from everything else. We normally enjoy walking but you do enough walking-even if your hotel is in the center of everything you will do tons of walking. There is so much to do that it's not worth being far, the time you spend walking to get to the strip is wasted time. The location is just not convenient.
