There are several long blocks of 'dead area' between the stratosphere and where the strip really begins (you can tell because the streets are dirty and not paved and there is no activity. You have to walk about 15 minutes (we walk fast) before you get to where the action actually begins. I'd recommend staying in the middle of the strip- even if one block over- there are actually small resorts back there that i wish we had known about. The casino in the hotel is also not as nice as the other casinos. There were some positives: we were able to check in early, we were on floor 12 right near the elevator and had no issues with noise or anyhing, the room was fine- basic hotel room with just enough room. I liked lunch at the Roxy- it was relatively cheap and the turkey burger was soooo good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Excellent Rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Warren814
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal - about $60.00 a night (we stayed Wed thru Fri). The room was comfortable and clean - if the temperature of the room is satisfactory, don't mess with the thermostat or unpredictable things might happen when the temperature outside is over 100. Also, the hotel wants $13.00 a day for internet but unlike other hotels (e.g. the MGM chain), they don't hit you with that stupid "resort fee" that includes the internet. Search the travel sites for the best price - then call the hotel and get them to match the deal (they will, although they are likely to take away the free ride at the top of the hotel). The walk from the free parking area through the casino to the hotel lobby wasn't a big deal (unlike other hotels on the strip). The only "problem" was that thIs hotel is at the very end of the strip - if you are trying to get to a show at the other end of the strip then take the freeway (or tell the cab to do that, otherwise you sit in stop-and-stop traffic for as much as an hour - the red lights are mostly red and the road is loaded with dozens of advertising trucks for "Hot Babes".) The strip is supposed to be "family friendly" but I was surprised to see women pushing baby carriages down the strip and into the casinos at midnight with other small children. The strip has become a sleaze market in recent years - if you bring your family, keep them off the strip as much as possible - use the freeways. You wouldn't like your son getting a business card handed out for hiring a gay or transexual prostitute. As to the gambling, the slot machines aren't paying out ANYTHING in Vegas - unlike the old days, you won't be playing very long. If this doesn't change, Vegas will become a distant memory as the casino hotels complain about the "bad economy" and the general atmosphere there sinks into sleazedom.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER ON EARTH!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stez17
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was cheap and also had ok ratings! But the truth is: This is the worst hotel ever on earth!!!! I cannot even begin to think what an awful place the stratosphere really is!!! 1. We were waken up at 3am by this horrible snore coming from next door guests, we called the front desk, they said they'd just send someone up to wake this dude up. But we did not want that, we wanted to have the room changed, since this guy would only be checking out the day before us. It took AGES to have everything sorted, finally we were in a different room by 5am. 2. My parents were trying to call me 4 bloody times, and each time they got refused even though they gave the right name and room number. We called the front desk to ask what the hell was going on, the woman kept making excuses, saying its not their fault, that it must've been my parents that not getting something right! Which was just crazy! In the end, she said the reason why they rejected the calls were because the letter 'Z' was not pronounced right. I just could not believe what she just said, I mean how we say Z is different from how the americans say it, but i cannot believe for that different accent reason, they rejected my parents call 4 times!!! which they were not sincere about it in the slightest!!! 3. On our last night, we got back at 11.30pm, and our room was not cleaned. We were soo tired and angry, we called the front desk telling them we left the hotel at 2pm, and there were 2 cleaners outside servicing the floor. However, the front desk woman said they left us a message on the phone asking us to tell them when we'd like our room to be cleaned, we said we had never got the message, and she said that's because she had deleted it just now. Anyway, she said she could send someone now, but again, she never apologized or anything, instead she sounded like it was our fault and how dare us call her up about it! In the end, we never got them to clean the room, we just could not be bothered with this hotel anymore. We have never stayed in a hotel where the staff would be this horrible to their guests, making up crap excuses for their mistakes. AGAIN, WORST HOTEL ON EARTH EVER! DO NOT STAY THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: Hydronly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Expedia and payed about $30 for 1 night. We were staying at another hotel but because we wanted to go up in the tower it was cheaper to book a room with free tower entrance then buy 2 tickets to the tower. Crazy? Yes it is but we didn't mind, we got to try out another hotel for a night ! The Stratosphere is located on the north side of the strip, you could say its the end of the strip. This location has a couple budget hotels/casinos in the area, Circus Circus, Sahara and the Riviera. All these hotels cost about $30/$45 for one night and we've stayed in all except the Riviera. Stratosphere has by far the best value. We were really amazed by about our room luxury and view. The atmosphere I liked less, when I go to vegas I like it to be old skool dirty vegas. Cheap buffets, girls dancing on the game tables and beer for $1! So if that's what you're looking for I you will not find that here... I read some people's reviews here writing it's a bad neighbourhood. I guess that totally depends on where you come from. Compared to many other big cities I have visited this part of Vegas, around the stratosphere, is like Disneyland. Basically the entire strip is one big 24 hour theme park and you do not really need to worry about your safety as long as you stay on the strip. This place is not far from the Gold & Silver Pawn Shop which features in Pawn Stars on History Channel. Just a few minutes north from the stratosphere. And it's located right next to the Bonanza, world's largest souvenir shop! Parking is of course no problem, parking in las vegas is never a problem. This city is designed to drive from one casino to the next.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, amenities not included”
Reviews.Author: kolC
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid (booked for avg $35 via Orbitz on day of arrival) we were expecting to see dead roaches if not passed out human beings in our room....it was surprisingly nice and clean and big! even one with a view and a very decent bathroom, even pleasant decor. But for everything else from coffee machine, to fridge to microwave to internet you'd have to pay $10-12/ day each, so it could potentially add up. Also the $7.50 resort fee is a good price for 3 tickets to the observation deck which would cost $48 otherwise ($16 each) Dont compare to Bellagio class, but casino is ok and pretty standard, its not like Circus Circus that you have to be wary of everyone around you.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: frugs33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room had modern furnishings. From our room we could see the people jumping off the tower. The hotel is a bit far from the main strip, but I appreciated being away from the crowds further down the strip. We found the Deuce bus to be useless, and walked back to the Strat twice late at night.. The area does get seedy from Circus Circus northwards, but I felt safe. There were lots of other tourists and families walking back too and the homeless didn't seem any worse than those in my own city. We got comp tickets to American Superstars and enjoyed the show. The buffet was fresh and had a good variety; the servers were quite cheerful and efficient. I also liked that the casino was navigable unlike other hotels where we could not find the exit to the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, On Las Vegas Strip, No Complaints Here”
Reviews.Author: Daniel Anthony P
Reviews.Content: I once again had to come to Las Vegas for a meeting, My boss was already staying at the stratosphere and he said just to stay here because our meeting were to be held down the street at the LV convention center. I called the Stratosphere and booked a room, when I booked the room. the nice lady gave me a complimentary upgrade to a high floor strip view room. I arrived in Vegas at noon it was 105 degrees outside ugh!!, I had asked for early check in and was told that would be no problem because rooms were available, check in was quick only 10 mins, I walked to my room in the premier tower, room 32168 (on the 21st floor), the hallways were nice and freshly painted, it was clean and comfortable. Upon entering the room I was shocked, this room wasn't that bad!! nice sized bathroom. ample closet space, huge FLAT screen TV, nice comfortable bed, and an average sized window looking toward the Sahara.. I was impressed with the room, considering how low the price was and on a Saturday.... the only problem i had was my sink kept backing up and the housekeeper never showed up, i called housekeeping 4 times. I wasn't really in the room all day so it didn't bother me too much. Overall great value, on the strip, clean ,safe, and comfortable will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A TOTAL DISASTER , WONT STAY THERE EVER !!”
Reviews.Author: rosannar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst, cheapest hotel I have ever stayed in. We went because our friends have been there and told us it was fine. First, is at the end of the strip, in a very bad neighborhood, we didnt even felt safe at night walking around there, it was surrounded by building that look like a project, windows broken, grafitti, abandoned buildings, etc they were even some homeless people around. It is far off anything interesting in the strip. Then the hotel has this bad smell as soon as you walk in, the rooms are awful, they didnt put enough towels, or soap, one day they didnt even put shower gel,another it was shampoo, nor shower cap, thank god I never rely on it but still, we have to constantly ask about it, then they gave us this room with an ugly view, not even the strip. only place to eat late at night was Roxie's so expensive and the food so greasy. there were people mainly teens walking around dragging big coolers to their rooms, the level of people was very low. The smell of the room was awful, I have to keep putting inciense and body splash in the room to tone it down, some days it was past 3 pm and the room was not even cleaned. I am sure there are better choices in Vegas at good prices that quality doesnt need to be sacrificed. We didnt even felt sure leaving nothing unlocked and the guest some look like hookers the woman, most of them drunk or else, and the men look like gansters, the only reason we didnt left was because it was a prepaid package

Reviews.Title: “noy so bad”
Reviews.Author: CheektowagaDiner
Reviews.Content: people said not to stay here not safe.we were fine , took a cab to mandaly bay and worked the way back, we were fine the room were nice , ck in was greataswas ck out, nice pool the food goodnat as loud and noisy but nice , we will stay ther again

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel at the North End of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Keith11a
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Stratosphere for 6 nights and had a very enjoyable time. Room was spacious and comfortable and cleaned every day except one. Staff were helpful and friendly, gym was very well equiped. Checking In and out takes a while, as not enough staff are allocated to check-in/out, whilst others stand around doing nothing on the information desk (managment to note!). That said the value is very good at around £50 a night for three of us sharing. It's not Caesars Palace but you're not paying the money. The location is a downside, about 1 mile from the start of the main strip but other hotels are being constructed in-between so when these are completed it will be better for the whole area and the hotel will not feel so "out on a limb". Always felt safe as so many people around so no concerns there. Excellent views from observation deck (free entry for residents) and the rides are certainly wild. Free parking is useful, internet access is pricey so best to go to the Apple Store in Fashion Show mall or to Miracle Mile shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, clean, close to the strip overall good value!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLOVESTOTRAVEL27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last May, overall I did not really know what to expect.. We were somewhat pleasantly surprised, the room was clean, the hotel was in good condition, we had free access to the stratosphere tower, free parking, lots of services and restaurants at the hotel(Mcdonald's, Starbucks, some cheap souvenir boutiques). The only gripe that I have with this hotel is the front desk service, we arrived at the hotel at 2 am and they only had 2 people working at the front desk, it took us over half an hour to check-in which was frustrating.... Also they had never warned us of the 8.50$/a night resort fee... which is significant when your room costs you 30$/a night... Also the service that we received at the hotel was not very welcoming or friendly. Other than that, we had a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be”
Reviews.Author: k832905
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a week. Checked in very late on a Saturday night. Was first given a room that was accesible for disabled people (which I am not) that didn't have a bath. Then was immediately switched to a beautiful room on the 21st floor. I couldn't hear anything from the traffic or from the rooms next door. The bed was very comfortable and the service was great. Definitely go to the top of the observation tower, both in daytime and at night. And I suggest taking the ACE bus instead of the Deuce - it gets you up and down the strip a lot faster - they both cost the same at $20 for a 5 day pass. And I recommend Tix4tonight for last minute tickets to shows - they have the best deals on most of the available shows in Vegas. Pool was also a great place to relax. I wouldn't walk north of this hotel at night but it felt very safe at the bus stops at night which are next to the hotel (they are well lit outside of restaurants). If you drink bottled water, go to the Circle K just a little bit down the road. You can buy a case of 20 for only $3.49 instead of paying close to $2 a bottle in the hotels. For the great price, you cannot beat the Stratosphere as a place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Erbaa
Reviews.Content: you can forget the time when you play games and its a great audience in there... if you have a heart pls dont use the train or other tihngs...

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: yellowlilax
Reviews.Content: My unanswered (through several emails) message to Stratosphere Hotel: We booked and stayed at your hotel November 6-9. We had a very large group with us, giving your hotel a significant amount of business. We had called previous to our stay to ask about an upgrade. The woman on the phone explained the upgrades and we were interested in the mountain view king bed room. We went ahead and booked that and upon check-in were charged for that upgrade. We also were thrown with a "there is also a $7.50 per day charge as well" Fine, whatever. We were tired and wanted to get to our room. Not happy about the hidden fees though. We got to our room and found we had 2 queen beds, not a king. I went to go into the bathroom to take a quick shower and we had no toiletries whatsoever. We ended up with the hassle of tracking down housekeeping to give us our toiletries. 3 strikes with your hotel within minutes of arriving is not the way to impress guests. My husband went down and complained to the front desk about us not having a king bed and not having any toiletries and the snotty front desk person said "well ask housekeeping" and "you paid for the view, not the bed" and refused to do a thing about it! Then, to top it all off, the walls of your hotel are paper thin. Every time someone hit their automatic lock on their car in the parking garage, we would hear it. Every car alarm that went off, we heard it. We also got stuck with the awful room by the elevator and heard "ding ding" all night long and heard every word of every conversation of people getting on and off the elevator. I had to call the front desk at 5 am to complain about the neighbors who were screaming at each other too. Security did come up once, but it never stopped. In fact, they proceeded to pound on the walls because they apparently were mad we called security. Also, we were supposed to be a nonsmoking floor and people were all over the hallways smoking cigarettes. We barely got a few hours of sleep at your hotel. We would have been better of sleeping in our car! Overall, we had an awful stay at your hotel. I would really appreciate some sort of refund of our money for what we endured. I would appreciate a response back. I am a very frequent visitor to several travel websites and read reviews of your hotel and booked regardless. Now I wish we never would have. I will be adding my own soon if something is not done about this. Thank you for your time.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysmiling43062
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with the room. When we checked in, we were offered a "newly remodeled room." When I asked what was newly remodeled, they said "they have flat screen TV's and such." Well, that was all that was "newly renovated" but the remotes were hard to use (you had to push hard to get the tv to turn on). In our "newly renovated" room, that apparently means you have to give up a bit of room space and bath space (I was here last year so I know the size difference). Next time if they ask, we'll decline the "newly renovated" room.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: kawill
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas several times a year and have stayed at most of the larger resorts on the strip. This was our first time at the Stratosphere. We bid and got it on Priceline and I was a little leery as I haven't been inside the Stratosphere since it was Vegas World a few decades back. Upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised. It was much more modern than our last visit. This isn't a "theme" hotel, but it is nice. Nothing really stood out about the decor it was just "nice". The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The bathroom was incredibly small, but fine. They have a shopping/food area which contains several shops, a McDonalds and the waiting area for the tower. If you are a guest in the hotel you can ride to the top for free with your room key. We went in the daytime and for the night view. The views were incredible. There are both inside & outside viewing areas. Most people didn't know about the outside area. Don't miss it! Pool is on the 8th floor. It is large, but ambience is kinda boring. It was like a cement playground. Walk to pool from our room was looonnng! I don't mind walking, especially in Vegas, but this was a bit much. Ask for something with easy access if you plan to use the pool. Lots of foot traffic on 8th floor if it matters to you. All in all it was an average stay. Nothing to complain about or compliment (except the tower view), but I wouldn't fear staying here. It was just "average".

Reviews.Title: “What a great first Vaction !”
Reviews.Author: Teri41
Reviews.Content: I just want people out there to know our trip to the Strat was great. It has the most beautiful view from the top! The Rooms were very clean and all the gals that worked there were very kind. We had a lovely time there Just wish we could have won a few dollars. The only draw back is being so far from the other Casinos. But the Duce (remember to buy a pass for 7.00 for 24 hours) is a wonderful way to get around. Even late at night we never felt at risk, the people were very helpful and kind. We knew going in to this Hotel was a ways from everything so I have no big complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again tomorrow...”
Reviews.Author: Adrian9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Stratosphere for 7 nights between May 5th and May 13th. We booked a 'Strip View Premier - 1 King Bed' over the internet direct with the hotel about 6 months beforehand and paid a total of just under $600. If you book this way you can cancel up to a day before the first night of your stay and you don't pay the full amount until check out, unlike booking with expedia or similar. We arrived at about 7pm local time on a Wednesday evening, check in took about 15 minutes. The room we had booked six months before wasn't available ("we don't guarantee room availability sir.") but we were given a 'Strip View Premier - 2 Queen Bed' and a promise that we could upgrade the next day. The room was big enough that we didn't bother changing. We were in room 31460, meaning the 14th floor. The room was clean, well appointed and had good air conditioning. There was a limited view of the strip and of the pool. The bathroom was clean with a good shower. There was no noise from the elevators and the room was cleaned regularly and thoroughly. The pool area on the 8th floor is large and vibrant, there is single deck 'bikini blackjack' at the weekends with some very friendly dealers. The pool bar is lively and relaxing. It gets very windy around the pool, but you're in a desert and even in May it was hot enough to lay by the pool most days. Taxis in Vegas are a nightmare. Everything's on one street but every taxi journey seemed to include a freeway. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel, the Deuce is cheap but stops everywhere, the Ace is better with fewer stops, and there is a bus goes to the airport in about 25 minutes and costs 2 dollars. The best way to get around is to walk over to the Sahara (5-10mins) and get the monorail. The monorail takes just 14 minutes to travel to the other end of the line and it stops everywhere you'd want to go. The casino was ok, generally the same as all the others. They have single deck blackjack in the evenings by the back bar and outside by the pool. The dealers are attractive young ladies who don't wear much and are very friendly. I highly recommend it. The food at the Top of The World is good, but expect to pay about $100 dollars a head. The view is worth it though as the room revolves once every hour or so, and the service is excellent. The buffet is a good deal too, they provide a massive range and everything is good. Roxy's Diner is basic but adequate and cheap. Register for an ACE card when you check in. It's absolutely free and gets you 25% off the buffet as well as other things. The area was safe day and night. There were a few homeless people but it was far better than New York or San Francisco. I was quite happy to walk places any time day or night. In all I found the Stratosphere to be so much more comfortable that the Bellagio and the MGM and I would choose this hotel again, especially as we paid less than $90 a night (about 57 GBP).

Reviews.Title: “Way better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: jmannz
Reviews.Content: Looking to do vegas on a budget then this place is for you. Rooms clean and comfy,yes it is down one end of the strip but only a ten dollar cab fare to get right into the midst of all the action the strip has to offer.Got free entry into the tower a must do at night.Had lunch at Roxys diner very good had a dj playing and the wait staff sing live. Dont be scared to stay here,it is not the venituian but it aint a fraction of the price either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: satriani
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a friends wedding and for the price a very good hotel. Its at the end of the strip but dont worry about the area, its fine. We walked down to the Pawn Shop thats on TV, about 30 min walk during the day and had no problems. The pool area is fairly large and very clean. The casino is not nearly as crowded as the ones on the middle of the strip. The Sahara is about a 10 min walk and from there you can take to monorail all the way down to MGM, it stops about 7 times on the way. Our room was very clean and spacious and I dont understand bad reivews about this place. We saved a bunch of money on the hotel and had more to spend on the fun things in Vegas. I would stay here again. Tio, the deuce bus stops here and the monorail is about 10 min away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, poor location”
Reviews.Author: dee_jay_ay
Reviews.Content: It was very cheap, but if I visit Las Vegas again I'll be spending a bit more and staying closer to the middle of the strip. The hotel looked tired, the rooms were spartan and functional, but nothing more. It was a bit like staying in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Hang Your Hat”
Reviews.Author: Faeriedust20
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Stratosphere for three nights over the May long weekend. We know before going that it was at the far North end of the strip, but I was looking for a good deal, and this was it! We didn't arrive until about 9pm on Friday night, and waited in line for about 20mins to check in. We had only paid for the most basic room with a King bed, and didn't bother asking for an upgrade since we weren't planning to spend much time in the room. We were given a room on the 20th floor of the World 1 tower. Had one small window, but no view of the strip. The washroom is small but the tub/shower is a good size. Bed was comfy and we slept well. Definitely take advantage of the Ace Play card; that gets you discounts at most of the restaurants and shops in the hotel. it's free to get, so very worth the money you'll save. We went to the buffet for breakfast on two mornings, and we thought it was really good. They put out quite the spread, so you won't go hungry! We ate at Roxy's Diner once for dinner; good for a quick, cheap meal. On our last night we splurged and had dinner at Top of the World; what a view! The food was excellent - best lobster bisque I've ever had! We each ordered an appy and entree, and half a bottle of wine. With a generous tip, we spent $180. If you go to Tix4Tonight, they also have coupons you can buy for different restaurants, so for $3 each, we both got 25% off of our entree. The restaurant is revolving, so you'll enjoy a 360 view of the strip, so definitely go for dinner as opposed to lunch. We also tried 107 lounge for a quick bite the night we arrived; too expensive for what you get, in our opinion. We only spent about an hour at the 8th floor pool on one day, as we wanted to see the sights and it was my first time in Vegas. The drinks were good, but pool was cold! We weren't bothered by the music even though we were right under a speaker (it wasn't live, though). Casino was quite large and although I didn't do much gambling, my fiance seemed to enjoy it. Be aware that if you take the Deuce bus, it will take about an hour to get from the Strat to the opposite end of the strip. We had to be at Luxor at 9 for our show one night, and we left our hotel before 8pm, and just made it there on time. So regardless of what mode of transportation you choose, leave lots of time if you need to be somewhere at a certain time. You cannot be in a rush in Vegas! Overall, good hotel for the money but it would have been nice to be more central along the strip; I just couldn't find a good enough deal!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melinda1973
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival noone speaks to you or even makes eye contact! They see you with bags and no one directs you to front desk. It was our anniversary and on our check in info and no one said a word! Not even a smile! They just shove keys at you and point to elevator! The hotel pool is loud and trash every where! Drinks are outrageous and staff never checks on you! The pool closes at 830 and the hot tub is small and always full! The halls will have room service trays sitting out all day! There are also pizza boxes and trash in hallways! There are no grudges in the rooms! The walls are paper thin! It's Vegas so when the lady next door started moaning at 330 am I thought oh well! By 530 am I was outdone! The screaming and head board banging was crazy! So I finally had to bang on the wall to make them stop!!! The fire alarm at 700 am was the final straw! No one tells you anything so you don't no what to do!! I would never stay at this rude establishment again ! The only plus is good pillows and close to bus stop!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: yankeecap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May and got a great rate through another site. About 170 for 4 nights. Payed an upgrade fee of about 16/night on arrival for a higher room that was supposed to come with bath robes but they never showed up. This hotel has small windows, so no matter how high you are, the view is limited. Bedroom area was spacious and had a comfortable King bed. Linens were adequate. Turn-down service good. Housekeeping service was good. Bathroom was TINY! That was the major negative for the hotel. Sink was outside in dressing area. It was difficult to close the door while standing in the bathroom and no, I am not huge. The 8th floor pool was very loud the first afternoon we went there so we never went back. Obnoxious "house beats" by a DJ and some guys banging on bongos, etc. There was nowhere on the deck to escape the racket. The 25th floor pool is "optional topless" for the ladies so we did not attend. Not a bad place, but they need to shoose their market. I recommend making this one more family oriented and leave the "pool club" scene to those who do it well. Next time I go back I will choose a nicer place, pay a little more, and get floor to ceiling windows. HIGHLY RECOMMEND- Day trip to Mt. Charleston if you have a car. Hash House a-Go-Go for an unbelievable dining experience. Two locations in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Fire Alarm at 7:00 AM”
Reviews.Author: laportecadillac
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was good for the price but I was jolted out of bed this morning at 7:00 A.M. to the sound of a fire alarm. Being on the ninth floor I was not going to wait to see why the alarm was going off. My wife and I rushed down nine flights of stairs to get to safety. Upon getting to the ground floor and waiting outside for several minutes, we were never approached by staff to inform us of why the alarm was activated. After several more minutes of waiting we proceeded to the front desk to find out what the problem was to get the response of “I didn’t know an alarm was going off”. We then approached the front desk manager who gave us a similar response but then called security to find out the situation. He then simply stated that there was a water leak that caused the alarm and maintenance was working on it. I find the lackadaisical attitudes of everyone involved very disturbing. I would have expected more information as to the situation and if it was safe to return to our room. I should not have to seek out staff to get this vital information. Much better standard operation procedures for situations of this nature should be in place. This occurrence has very much tainted my stay and makes me wonder if I choose the right hotel for my stay. We still have 3 more nights to our stay and hope to hear from someone as to how this deficiency is being addressed. I have sent these concerns to the manager and Will see if I get a response and will update this review.

Reviews.Title: “avoid the shops in there!”
Reviews.Author: howdydoodyannat
Reviews.Content: cant comment about the hotel itself, as i didnt stay there, but there is a stall that sells remote control cars/helicopters etc there. avoid. they initially sold me a small r/c helicopter.when that stopped working after 5 minutes, i took it back. they said it was broken,they have had problems with this model (yet continue to sell them). after what seemed like chat -asking me where i was from, how long i was in vegas-i was leaving that day, they persuaded me to pay extra to get the next model up. arrived back in england, helicopter worked,again, for 5 minutes, now doesnt do anything.the stall is called stratosphere toys. avoid these conmen.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money if you're prepared to walk!”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire89
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere for 1 week in May for a holiday and family wedding. This was my first trip to Las Vegas but I have stayed in a number hotels around the world, also visited many others on the strip. Location - Overall the hotel is good value for money but location could be a lot better. It is at the very end of the strip and you can walk (at least 30 mins to main part) or get the bus, monorail or a taxi. We walked and got taxis the first two days then got to grips with the bus. Bus is cheap, $7 for a 24 hr pass and you can hop on and off the Deuce and Ace buses. Make sure you always have the correct change! Change bills at Bill Breaker machines in casino (no charge). Taxi approx $10 one way to strip but make sure the taxi driver doesn't rip you off by taking a longer route, especially at night. Also hotel location in rough area of town, we saw two police arrests, homeless people etc. Hotel - Hotel is no frills with a large casino and some good facilities, free admission up the tower if you are a hotel guest. Sign up for the Ace membership card as soon as you arrive, its free and gets you 25% off the buffet as well as a cheap meal offer in the American Diner. Rooms - We were lucky with our room, having requested a king bed when booking we ended up with a disabled access room so it was large with a wet room (no bath). Also requested a high floor room so great view. King bed was enormous and very comfortable. Upgrades not worth it unless you go for a suite (our friends had the premier room, next grade up, and it was small and quite dark, only differences a flat screen tv and dark wooden furniture). Our room had basic toiletries (take your own!) but maids came to clean it every day. Floor of bathroom stained but room was clean. Room had iron and board, large tv, wardrobe. No fridge but ice machines in hallway. We bought a 20 pack of bottled water from the K mart petrol station and kept in room! Also there is a McDonalds in the tower shops, 2nd floor of hotel, for cheap soft drinks etc. Amenities - free gym, restaurants, bars, Tower shops good value but on the cheap and nasty side. Free pool although very loud music played non stop. Drinks by pool v expensive and they confiscate your drinks if you take your own (outrageous!). Food and Drink - tried the American diner and Italian, both very good and substantial portions. Not so impressed with the buffet, surprisingly little choice and I didn't like the decor of the restaurant. McDonalds and authentic mexican in the Tower Shops section. C bar in the casino had a good atmosphere and divine raspberry mojitos. Drink offer of all you can drink between 4-8pm for $20 on cocktails and beer. Within walking distance there is an IHOP and Dennys for inexpensive breakfasts. Liked best - value of room rate, american diner and italian restaurant, views, staff helpful and friendly Liked least - poor location, noisy pool area, high prices of drinks, dated decor Attractions and activities - Really recommend visiting all the top strip hotels and the attractions. Loved the dolphin habitat at the Mirage, well worth the $15 entry fee. Eiffel tower ride brilliant and we caught the free Bellagio fountain show at the top! Go see the lions at the MGM for free, the Bellagio conservatory, the gardens at the Flamingo and the shopping streets in the Paris hotel and New York New York. Also Coca Cola world and the M&M factory and the free circus acts in Circus Circus. Shopping amazing, I've never seen so many designer stores and malls. Avoid - the New York New York rollercoaster, really painful bumpy ride and not worth $15 fee. The rides in Circus Circus, outdated and 3 rides broken when we went. Our trips - we splashed out on two things and they were worth every penny, a helicopter landing tour to the Grand Canyon and a show, Le Reve at the Wynn. Both incredible! We booked the helicopter tour with Papillon before we went on their website and then got the show tickets when we were there. You can get discount show tickets at the special booths on the strip, offers released at 9.30am every day and people queue, but they don't have every show. Le Reve was an acrobatic water show at the 5 star Wynn Resort, we went for the lowest price splash zone seats (1st two rows) but we literally only got the tiniest drop of water on us and for front row seats it was fab! Restaurant recommendations: Joes steak and crab in Caesar's Forum Shopping Mall (expensive but great Stone Crab and wonderful service), Le Mon Ami Gabi located outside Paris (french, great steak for only $20, lovely wine and service, views of Bellagio fountains), Hussong's Cantina, Mandalay Bay shopping mall (best Mexican and margheritas to die for!). Conclusion - I would recommend the Stratosphere hotel for cheap accommodation and if you are prepared to get public transport up the strip. Watch the food and drink prices, a beer by the pool was $7 and you pay less in the Bellagio! If you can afford more, there are beautiful hotels on the strip, Paris, Bellagio, Mirage, Wynn were some of our favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: devonsb
Reviews.Content: the hotel is at the end of the las vegas strip and hence is a little out of the actions spots. However there are busses which ply on the strip every 15 min which makes it convenient to travel. They are cheap too with a $4 charge in which you can do multiple journeys in 24 hrs. Room was small and cozy; the view from the top of the tower is awesome - entire vegas can be seen from here. overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value!”
Reviews.Author: SaraM17
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was nicely furnished and clean. The service at the front desk was prompt and organized. There was some confusion regarding the pool, but all hotels have their remodeling periods. The best part was that when you stay at this hotel, you get free passes to go up on the viewing deck as many times as you want! We only paid around $30 per night to stay here and passes to go up in the tower are $20 per person, so even if you only want to go to this hotel to go in the viewing deck, stay for a night and save yourself a bunch of money.

Reviews.Title: “A good mix between old and new Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ricbkk
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly nice. The rooms are big, the service good and the prices very very reasonable. We booked over the internet and received free passes to the viewing deck which was a good experience. However some of the rides there are not for the faint of heart. The Stratosphere is definitely not as grand as some of the hotels further up the strip but it is very close to the monorail and a fraction of the price. Also as an added bonus directly opposite the hotel was a small little restaurant with the most authentic Thai food I have ever tasted outside the country itself. Overall the hotel was just far enough away from the main strip to be able to get some peace if need be yet still accessible enough to hit the center of the strip within a few minutes of exciting the hotel. I would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: teamsandor
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas several times and decided to stay at the Stratosphere this time because the rooms were cheap. Was pleasantly surprised. Room size was average but very clean and I have to say the beds were fabulous. Most comfortable hotel beds we have ever slept on. Also had great pillows. Nice assortment of places to eat. Liked that this is not an overly large place. Finding coffee in the morning was easy. Morning coffee run took only 5 minutes. Only drawback is the location, which is at the far end of the strip. We bought a 3 day pass for the Ace/Deuce bus and used it often. Bus stops right in front of the hotel. Overall stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: _Le_nochka_F
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at S. for 3 nights. I have chosen it because of good reviews, but was disappointed on arrival. Check-in was ok (but we arrived late). The room (it was called "spa-suit" or smth like this) was very basic (European 2 stars). The bathroom was nice (the only thing which was satisfactory), but they don't provide new shampoo/soap if there is even tiny amount left in the old bottle- was annoying. Shower gel doesn't exist as well as shower caps. As we have arrived late, we ordered a dinner to the room- huge mistake! It was the quality of fast food, but we have payed about 90 USD for it. Hotel is situated at the end of the Strip, so expect a long walk to the centre. We haven't minded walking, so for us it was not a problem. If you want to save time and money- the monorail station is located 5 min walk from Stratosphere (at Sahara). The only plus of the stay in S. is that you get admission for the tower for free. This is worth visiting-remarkable view! Overall, the hotel is nothing special. If you budget is not too tight, choose something different.

Reviews.Title: “More than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: wmarti31
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience. We booked online the day before (late afternoon) and put a note saying that would love to check in early because we were arriving at LAS around 7 am. Got to the hotel around 8:30-9 am and went to see if they would let us check in that early. The lady told us that they did not have a king size bed (as requested) until noon or so, but she offered a double queen, which we gladly accepted. Had a great experience overall. Went up the tower a couple of times, and did not know that hotel guests don’t have to pay to go to the top of the world. Remember that you are away from where everything is on the strip, but if you don’t have a car and don’t want to walk, you can take the Deuce bus (a very nice double decker bus), which charges $3 each way, or $7 for 24 hours, and runs up and down the strip. Our only inconvenient was that a couple of lady from the room across sat on the hallway both mornings that we were there, around 7 am or so. Looked like someone in the room wanted to sleep, so they went to the hallway to talk, which woke us up. Can’t blame this on the hotel, but instead it shows how rude some people can be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: watty777
Reviews.Content: We stayed herelast year and had a small noise issue the cleaners room was right next door and they were in and out all night but we got it sorted the next day and we changed rooms, this year we booked a higher floor our room was fine spacious and clean, our friends room however had not been cleaned and the bed had not been made my wife rang the desk and complained we were immediatley offerred an upgrade for our friends right opposite ours, the upgraded room was only slightly bigger than ours and is not worth paying extra for but fine for no charge. I like this hotel as it is not overwhelming it is at the nortern end of the strip and is too far to walk th the major hotels, we always have a car so we drive and park for free in ceasers palace or MGM and walk around from there.The buffet is ok although we stayed at the gold coast hotel next to The Riviera once befor just off the strip from Ceasers Palace and it is the cheapest and better than a lot of the others and a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: BocaRatonOtto
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in, to the minute we checked out, we received excellent customer service from all staff members. This hotel has lots of things to do. I highly recommend making to the top of the tower. They have an inside and outside observation deck with great views of Las Vegas. I also recommend doing the rides on top of the tower. Yes, they look scary but I guarantee that it's an experience you'll never forget. It's very safe and very worth it. Make sure to buy your tickets downstairs before making it up the tower. They also have a bar on the 107th floor of the tower and it's a great place to get the night started with great views of Las Vegas at night. The hotel also has a McDonalds and Starbucks on the 2nd floor courtyard and a variety of other stores and restaurants for everyone. The rooms, halls, and elevators were kept clean and everyone was always nice and smiling. The A/C in the room and the hot water availability was excellent. The beds and linen were also very comfortable. The pool area is simple but large and kept very clean. The bar staff was also excellent especially the girls :) You cannot ask for more. I can go on and on about this hotel and their staff. It was a great Las Vegas experience and it all started with a great flight and a great hotel. By the way, make a left out the hotel on Las Vegas Blvd. and there's a bus stop just 1/2 a block away. Buy the all day pass ($5) and you can go up and down the strip by riding the Deuce bus. I believe the bus pass is also good for every route if you need to get off the strip. Have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, friendly staff and lots of options”
Reviews.Author: mlbjzsn
Reviews.Content: Our trip started with the check in process. The lines move fairly quickly. Chris C. checked us in and was very helpful and pleasant. He knew the hotel and gave us a great room. The room itself was a nice size and really quiet. Hallway noise was very minimal even staying right off the elevator. The hotel is very clean, and the staff is welcoming. The top of the world experience is awesome. We didn't ride the rides but they were awesome. We stayed a total of 4 nights. The restaurants we went to were great. I recommend Roxy's it is a nice place, it’s affordable and has a great atmosphere. If you have a rental car traveling between the main part of the strip and the hotel is simple and painless. I cannot rate the bussing system; but it would be about a mile on foot. I would recommend the Stratosphere Hotel and we are already booking our next visit in Aug. It was overall a great experience for me and my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit but a long way up the strip”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaticBlonde
Reviews.Content: This is a very simple LV hotel. It's clean and basic, but a long way up the strip so you don't have a lot that simple to walk to in the evenings. Rooms are simple and clean and service is efficient and friendly. I wouldn't recommend staying here purely because of its place on the strip. However, the restaurant at the top of the world is a must and for you thrill seekers....the rides and views are stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Just how a Las Vegas Hotel should be!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1303
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and got an amazing deal on the Romance Spa Suite and I'm so glad we booked this because it was everything that an hotel suite in Las Vegas should be - fun , OTT and BIG!!!!!. There was a bit of a wait to check in but that didn't bother us. The check in staff were friendly and not at all stuck up like other hotels I could mention !!!! I would definately recommend that you eat at the TOP OF THE WORLD restaurant in the evening - the views are incredible and the service is superb! The hotel isn't in one of the most inviting areas but definatley worth a Visit to experience the old fun side of Las Vegas and catch the best views of the City! ENJOY!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: squiddygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there a year ago and loved it!!! We just got back from Stratosphere last night and again loved it! We spent the first 3 nights at the excalibur and never again!!! The casino at the stratosphere pays out unlike all the big names in town. The pool was awesome. We played volleyball, bean bag toss, beer pong while listening to great music! The buffet was great, good food choices, roxys had a great burger and fry combo for 6.99. Because we stayed before they comped us the most amazing suit ever! It had a couch, table and chairs, king sized bed, hot tub. I will never stay anywhere else ever! It may look old in the pictures but its not old and dingy looking at all.someone said on one of the reviews that they charge to enter the pool, and no they don't! That's a lie! Book ur room, you'll have fun and love the soft beds and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: sleepy_nate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere for a nice little getaway. The flight was cheap, the room was even cheaper. We got upgraded when we arrived, so were on the 18th floor in a suite. Rooms - were very clean, everything was in order, flatscreen was nice. As has been noted before, there is very little selection of TV channels. The bed was very comfortable. It's a bit of a stretch to call these rooms a suite, as there is really only a nook with a chair and the cabinet that has a fridge in it, but for the price we paid, we weren't complaining. Windows aren't large, but the view was nice. Service - the Bell desk was not very helpful when we asked for directions, they were very brusque and did not explain the directions very well. Our room was looked after satisfactorily every day. Drink service in the casino area was ok as well. We are not big spenders, so maybe you don't get as good of service if you aren't dropping the dough. Shows - We went to the American Superstars show. It was OK, not very much energy and passable impersonations. You can tell when someone is just going through the motions and not putting all their energy into it. But hey, I'd probably get pretty bored doing the exact same thing every night too. Restaurants - Starbucks - just like any other Starbucks, just more expensive. You pay more for your caffeine here then say, the Starbucks down at the Fashion Show mall. Buffet - pretty good, we thought. Good selection and quality. For all the places in the Stratosphere we tried, this was probably our favorite. Roxy's Diner - Horrible. Poor service and poorer food. We showed up and there was no lineup to get in, yet the two employees at the door were more engaged in their own conversation than seating us. Finally acknowledged us and seated us. The wait staff was slow and inattentive. And our food was horrible. We wanted a nice sit down meal of real food. The food was greasy, overcooked and had no flavor. The ambience may be nice, but it doesn't make up for the rest of it. McDonalds - what you would expect from McDonald's, dependable cheap junk food. Good for that late night snack, or cheap breakfast option. One thing, if you have the Players card, you get 10% off at any Stratosphere owned restaurant, but make sure you show them your card and then make sure you check your receipt that you actually got your 10% off. At the McDonalds we showed our card, then they proceeded to charge us full price and we had to ask for our discount amount back. At Roxy's Diner, they did not ask us for the card, we had to mention it, then remind them again when the bill came. Supposedly the Starbucks is owned by the Stratosphere, yet they declined our card. It's not that big of a deal, but made us want to spend our money elsewhere on our food and drinks. If you are going to use Transit to get around, use the new ACE Line Express. This thing is great. Just like the Deuce, but less stops, and it goes out to the Premium Outlets. We used this extensively to get around the strip. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and look forward to our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Its okay, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Baz180
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the beds are comfy, but they are basic, air con is good and is the only source of outside air. You can hear next door, shower, talk, open close their curtains, the walls are very thin, and you get woken up a lot during the night by returning guests. Housekeeping is superb, always done promply. The pool is okay, nothing spectactular, but the music is really loud, you just can't listen to your MP3 at all. It makes it hard to read a book unless you really concentrate. Forget sleeping around the pool. There is no escape, the speakers are everywhere. The pool on floor 24 is privately owned and charges $10 per day for gents and nothing for women, even if your a hotel guest. The gym is good. The casino is okay, $5 Blackjack, $60 dollars to enter the poker tournaments, and the usual slots. But its a very smoky enviroment, as are all the casinos we went to. The Restaurents are good, Fellinis is very good and reasonably priced, Roxys does your breakfast and Burgers, they have a McDonalds in the shopping court and a Pizzeria, which does superb sandwiches. The Top of the World restaurent is good but expensive, $110 for 3 courses and a glass of wine. The view from the Tower is superb and worth a couple of visits. The location is at the far end of the Strip, it takes 20 minutes to walk to Circus Circus at a pace. The bus is good, catch the Ace outside Carl Jr, it comes up to the strip just before the Wynn. You can get 3 or 5 day passes from this stop. There are a lot of homeless people about outside the hotel asking for change etc, which does lower the tone a bit. Overall, not bad, but would go to a better location next time.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD VALUE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: almajosgan100
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed this hotel, We paid 25 euro per room per night which included admission into the tower viewing deck.Check in was painless and the rooms were lovely and big , pleanty of room in them,,big beds,clean bathroom,and storage. Housekeeping every day, could not find fault with room. we were on the 12th floor looking down the strip ,but the roof with air con was below us so try get above 14th floor for better view. Pool area was clean lively with cafe and service, towel were provided, We ate in Roxy's Diner one evening, which was typical diner food, fries, burgers sambos. etc it was not too expensive,Starbucks was expensive compared to Washington DC. Casino area was a bit dated, carpet made you seasick and signs to show exit not clearly marked, The viewing deck was good, there is a bar at the top, but i would not have paid to go up there, not worth the price , then you have to pay for the rides also.. There is a gas station nearby with convenience store, area is a bit rough especially at night, a lot of homeless, although they dont bother you it did make uncomfortable walking back one night,The bus stops right outside the hotel going both ways, Freemont street is 10 mins on bus and is cheaper to gamble and eat on then the strip. However we did have brunch in the Bellagio, They have lovely restaurant called 'cafe Bellagio' which wasn't expensive 14dollars -club sambo 15 dollars -pasta and it was lovely..well worth it. This is an ideal hotel for visitors who want to do Vegas cheaply and are not serious gamblers, hotel is clean, safe and kid friendly. You are a bit down the strip but the bus outside soon sorts that, there is now a new bus running as well as the Duece its the A gold (I think ) it only stops at certain points on the strip so you get up the other end far quicker and your Deuce ticket is valid on it. Dont be put off by the fact its down the strip, I have stayed in MGM Grand which was a nightmare to get from and to your room by the sheer size of it..Would go back to Strastosphere again for the price,

Reviews.Title: “Far from the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: USTravelLover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing special. In typical Las Vegas style, the elevators to the rooms were strategically hidden to make you walk through a maze of games and slots with all your luggage in tow. They fail to mention in fine print that there is a "resort fee" which was $7.50 per day to use the gym, pool, tower, and "amenities". Also their "modest" internet fee is $12.00 per day, which is fairly steep. Simple items like coke or bottled water are way overpriced in the gift shops, and the neighborhood is not the greatest, although I didn't feel unsafe. Public transportation to the main strip was not adequate, the busses were filled and could have run much more frequently. It was just not a great Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GET A MASSAGE HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: VegasLover10
Reviews.Content: Okay cheap rooms, fine. They were clean, bathrooms are ridiculously small. But we paid $150.00 for a massage and it was a joke. You check in at the Salon. They seated us on some gross couch. No robe/slipper deal. Said the showers were being cleaned so we couldn't use them?? The price was sooooooo out of line for what we got. I realize they don't advertise a 'spa experience' but come on. My person needed help in the technique department from the word go. We stayed here just to save a buck. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Linzerella99
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd and last time I'll ever stay at the Stratosphere. Both times I had issues with either getting locked out of my room (maintenance couldnt even get in to get my stuff for 4 hours!!!!) or overcharged. The staff was rude addressing my issues and never once offered an apology for my inconvenience. I am a travel agent and would never recommend this place to my clients again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jchormann
Reviews.Content: This place was much nice than I expected. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are very clean and recently updated. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant. The location is not ideal b/c it's on the very far north end of the strip, however, the monorail is close by. I stayed for one night before heading out of town and it was prefect.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: psaltyne
Reviews.Content: I knew what I was getting into when I reserved my room at the Stratosphere, but I didn't have much choice as I was traveling with a larger group for a wedding (that was thankfully NOT at the Stratosphere). Pros: Nice buffet, good value of casino games, big rooms, soundproofing is surprisingly decent...going up to the tower is pretty cool. Cons: Bland rooms, a little dirty (I found some other hairs on some towels and on the first night found what I believe to be part of a rat claw - just one digit - IN MY BED, disgusting TV remote). The location is waaaaaaaaaay north of The Strip - do not believe that it is walkable, especially in the hot summer months. Also, there is some low income/section 8 housing right across the street, so it's not like you would even WANT to walk around there in the dark (unless you are insane). The Stratosphere casino is smokier and more disgusting than most - and there is NO WAY you can avoid it as you must get through it in order to get to the hotel lobby or to the self-parking. The other clientele in the hotel reminds you as to how cheap the rates are - ANYONE can afford to stay there. I should have gone with my gut and booked at a property closer to the Strip (like the Hard Rock). Luckily I had a rental car so it was not nearly as bad as it could have been, since everywhere else has free parking as well. Also - no coffee makers in the rooms and do not let the "High Speed Internet Access" fool you - it still costs $12 per 24 hours - and even then it's not really "High Speed".

Reviews.Title: “Great value, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: colinl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days on business, great value hotel, rooms are clean and tidy and a good size, ours even had a fridge which is unusual for the big hotels in Vegas. I would not normally write a review for such a big hotel as there are plenty on here, but thought I would as I was surprised at how helpful the staff were. We had a very weak wifi signal in our room and needed to use the internet heavily (although 12USD a day), they moved us to a room close to the wifi transmitter which did the trick. one thing to note is that the hotel is not in the middle of all that is happening, so you do need to walk a bit to get to the interesting stuff, or take a car.

Reviews.Title: “The Stratosphere Hotel and Casino, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SaraH223
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a first stay, right at one end of the strip... cheap and clean accomodation... mcdonalds in the hotel n all!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean. Perfect beds!”
Reviews.Author: mishy30
Reviews.Content: Firstly, upon arrival we were told a high level room was not available and the only room was a smoking room (despite requesting high level and non smoking). The receptionist made out there were no rooms available and the highest room was on level 8. Some people would have accepted this and if I was in the UK I probably would have; but being the States I refused to accept it. We were then found a room on the 12 floor. Got to the room and it was opposite a very noisy ice machine. Went to reception and complained and was given a room on the 20 floor. So, dont accept what you are given!! The room itself was very comfortable. I have never had such a comfortable pillow and bed in my life! The beds were huge! The hotel is relatively well sound proofed. We had a room that had the connecting door but did not hear our neighbours. The hotel is a good 45 minute from the heart of the strip. There is a bus service but it gets very very busy so we used the Monorail (pick it up from the Sahara hotel) and that is quick and hardly anyone uses it. 12 dollars a day for internet is a bit of a joke, considering most of the hotels I stayed in throughout USA it was free. The pool area is nice and clean - music pumping which was nice as it enabled me to switch off from the loud americans!! I would recommend this hotel if you want to be away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Rooms, Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_Choy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over 4 nights and had a horrible experience. Pros: Very clean rooms with clean toilets. Reasonably big rooms. But that's all. Just a basic room for a good night sleep.Very cheap as well. A few fast food restaurants(Carl's Junior across the road) and iHOP nearby so there is no problem with finding late night supper and breakfast. Cons: Location. Do not by deceived by the description "located at the north end of the Strip". Yes it IS located at the North End of the Strip but the walk to the real "glitzy,glammy ,bling bling" action of the Strip beginning from Wynn to Luxor, is a 30-45min walk away. We can see Mirage hotel from Stratosphere, but it is literally a mirage in the desert(how appropriately named) which seems so near but yet so far. The Deuce which services the Strip is useless too, as it can take nearly 30 minute for the bus to travel that short distance from Stratosphere to Caesar's Palace due to jams and visitors taking a long time to buy tickets on the bus. The bus can take 10-15min just to pick up passengers at each bus stop. The frequency of the Deuce bus is very bad as well. Service. This is the worst part of the hotel and the main reason why i rate this hotel as a 1 star hotel. I know that Vegas was 'built-on-20 dollar tips" but i did not expect to pay for every single advice and assistance! Check-in staff were unfriendly and concierge was useless. She hardly answered any of our questions and the only expression she has on her face is a stoned one. Asking the casino and hotel staff simple questions like 'where can i purchase the American Superstar tickets' are more often replied with a 'expressionless-no eye contact' point to a certain direction. But the WORST part is yet to come. During 1 of the night when we return to our room, we couldn't open the door with our card. When we went to the check-in counter, we approached 2 check-in ladies who were chatting for assistance. They brushed us off and told us to approach another lady instead because 'they were busy'. So we approach the lady whom the 2 ladies pointed us to for assistance. She was counting some cash and look flustered when we asked her for assistance. Unsurprisingly she told us to approach the first 2 ladies whio were chatting instead!! Super pissed by now and when i told the 3 ladies off only did another guy came to help us. Please note that it was 12am and there were NO OTHER guests checking in or out. Well as the guy checked our reservation records, he had a puzzled look on his face and it took him quite a while to recode the access card and return it to us. Apparently we had overstayed our bookings and this information was not told to us by the hotel staff. We only discovered our mistake on the next night and this mistake cost us to miss our flight for 1 entire day!! I admit that it was my mistake but the hotel staff should have kindly let us know about it, or at least ask if we would like to stay another night instead of just recode the card after checking our bookings! The lady who handled our check-out the next day also had a puzzled look on her face and even had to consult her manager during the checking out. I am sure that they are aware of our overstay and yet NONE of them bother to inform us. The check-out staff could have mentioned that we are charged an extra night but didn't. We could have catch an earlier flight out of Vegas if they informed us earlier but nothing was done. I am not sure if they just can't be bothered or have an integrity issue, but i am definitely not coming back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: fauxtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere is an excellent value (stay for several days for $100-$200). Very nice rooms, large, decent views if you know what to ask for. Great views from the tower! Not very accesible to the rest of the strip - several minute cab ride to the nearest "major" casino/hotel. I've been told they have an phenomenal pool, the refurbishing has been finished by now.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abby82uk
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from my second time visiting Vegas, and the first time I stayed at the Stratosphere, and it was brilliant! The room was nice and clean, 2 massive and very comfortable beds. We looked out over the mountains which were lovely; the bathroom was a bit on the small side, but very clean. At check in, the staffs were lovely. Wendy who checked us in was very friendly and helpful, and she mirrored all the staff we encountered at the Stratosphere. Within the hotel itself the swimming pool was lovely, there was a nice sized hot tub next to the pool, and I really liked that we looked out over the strip and we could also see the rides at the top of the tower. Again, there were attentive waitresses and bar staff ready to take our orders. The casino was quite large and there were loads of cocktails waitresses waiting to get drinks for us. I liked that it wasn’t as busy as the other casinos, because we could always get on the tables and machines we wanted, and drinks were served really quickly. I would definitely recommend Roxy’s Diner inside the casino as a fun and reasonable place to eat. The food was lovely and there was a really nice atmosphere. The waiters all sing and we were serenaded by two waiters called Ike and Frank who were both amazing singers! All in all I would definitely come here again, although you are away from the main action really liked this, as it was a nice chilled out hotel and definitely value for money! Thank you Stratosphere for making our holiday really special! See you soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave any valuables in your Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravelbuddy
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Stratoshpere on Thursday, April 1, 2010. Our reservation was for a King Size bed. We also told the person when checking in we wanted a king size and showed him our confirmation. He said fine. We get to the room and the bed is not a king. We phoned the front desk and they said they didn't have any other rooms with King size in them. Thanks alot, so we got downgraded instead of upgraded. All we wanted was what we booked back in February. Disappointed, but we let it go. We went out the next day, but when we came back into our room our lugage had been rumaged through. We were upset and phoned the front desk again. We told the manager and he said he would notify housekeeping. Lucky for us we kept our valuables with us and didn't leave anything worthwhile to steal. The hotel did nothing for us, I will not stay there again. There are so many things they could have done to make our stay better, but they chose to do nothing. I will not stay there again. We had to go to the bar and pay for a beer at $6.00 each, because a cocktail waitress was never to be seen when we were there. There is so many other places to stay, try somewhere else, obvsioulsy the Stratosphere dosen't care about their customers. Just remember, protect yourself and your belongings, don't be to trusting.

Reviews.Title: “close to the strip and cheap ..best budget option”
Reviews.Author: rinkos
Reviews.Content: well..we stayed at THE BEST suite in that hotel...the star ...me and my dad... well..the view is crap..there is another casino being built right ahead from it....so dont go there for the view..the casino itself...also crap if compared to strip ones..line belagio . but...and this is a big but...the price for the best suite it ridiculous ...u have a bus driving from that hotel at regular intervals all along the strip...and its price is not worth mentioning... room is wide..jacuzi and shower where very nice too... and there is a very funny 50's diner at the casino level...and fun rides for kids at the top.. TIP - go to the top of the tower at night...cause from there u can really see it all...less costly than a choper :) IF U WANT MORE THAN THIS...than i would suggest go to VENICE ..of all the hotels in the strip ..that would be the only one worth paying the price...u must visit there..amazing architecture...feels like u landed in ancient rome or greece. to sum it up...great location and budget price..and dont miss that 50 diner TAKE A CAMERA THERE. and i suggest u FAKE A BIRTHDAY TO ONE OF UR GROUP

Reviews.Title: “definitely say again”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller028
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in October 09, great hotel, clean, rooms great, fantastic cheap eateries. Big price difference in meals between this hotel and the hotels in the middle of the strip. I had a meal $10 in Stratosphere, same meal in New York New York was $15. The casino was good, staff helpful, nothing a problem. Only downside was the hotel is quite a way up the strip so we used the bus more. Going to Freemont Street at night the buses were packed as it's the last hotel on the strip, but a small price to pay for value for money and a great hotel. Planning another trip in March next year and will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong information.”
Reviews.Author: kimandgracie
Reviews.Content: We called the hotel to ask if Beach Club 25 was open. "Yes, it opened April 1." We arrived April 8 only to find out it was closed. We had many other options, obviously, to stay elsewhere but chose Stratosphere because of Beach Club 25. When we complained, the Operations Manager told us there would be no compensation for choosing this hotel over the others. So we went to the 8th floor pool and watched dads dip diaper wearing children into the spa. Rude people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djwd4z
Reviews.Content: I just came back from spending a week in Vegas to visit my brother who lives there. I've no been to Vegas many times and stayed quite a few places. I can say that the Stratosphere is one of the nicest places I've stayed. The rooms were very nice and room service was well taken care of. Unfortunaly it was on the cool and windy side last week and I didn't get to use the pool much. It is a bit far from everything but we had a car so that really didn't matter. I look forward to my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: njwmidlands
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at the stratosphere, our room was v.ery clean and had clean towels and maid service every day. There is now a new bus service called the 'ace' bus, it costs $15 for a 3 day pass (the price of a single cab ride) and stops at limited stops rather than every one to the strip and downtown, well worth looking into. You purchase your tickets at one of thepaystations situated at the stops, so this makes getting around a lot easier and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathy30
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a few times now, less children orientated than some hotels. Found the food wonderful but on the expensive side.The staff were extemely friendly and efficient. We had a problem that the room they gave us was unmade, they moved and upgraded us immediately, which was great as we were very tired.Yes it is at the edge of the strip, but that makes getting the bus along the strip easier to get onboard as they are always queues. They now have 3 different buses along the strip, which started the week we were there, they have slightly different routes but most hotels have leaflets. Free trips up the tower a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet rooms, great pool”
Reviews.Author: vancitytraveller77
Reviews.Content: Let me first say this is not the place you want to stay if it's your first time to Vegas. You WILL be disappointed with the location (it isn't walking distance to the main part of the strip - unless you want to spend an hour walking there). This was our ninth time to Vegas so instead of exploring all the hotels we just spent most of the day by the pool and then took the monorail to centre-strip for dinner , entertainment and gaming in the evenings. The monorail station is at Sahara, which is about a five minute walk from Stratosphere. The price was right, the room was very clean, recently renovated and and the beds were comfy. There's also a great corner store near the hotel with cheap booze. Overall, a solid experience. If I'm looking to do Vegas on a budget again, I would definitely consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: DeltaCharm
Reviews.Content: After reading awful reviews about the hotel I had booked I switched to the Stratospere and I'm glad I did. It was clean and quiet. The buffet was good. The elevator was fast. Called for more toilet paper and got it within half an hour. Plenty of towels. Comfortable beds. Hairdryer worked. Short walk to bus stop. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: kevinthecheesehead
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying i got this hotel on a really good deal so it was the only reason i booked it, i read online that the location was pretty bad and i would agree. Very far away from anything. About a 10 minute walk to even get to the monorail. Its not a nice area either, just walking i was threatened a few times from people and seen cops arrest a few people. Not many many "great" options for restaurants or entertainment as you have to go down the strip a lot to eat and for most entertainment. Rooms were fine, clean, and cleaned every day. Pool was very crowded and had poor drink service there. Although if the pool were a little less crowded it would of been a nice place to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel BUT far end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: _liz_daisy
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend in Vegas with a friend and had a lovely time! The hotel was much better than we expected considering it is 3 stars. It seemed more like 4.. the casino and bar were great (bottomless happy hour 4-8pm for $20 is well worth it!!) The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were spacious and very clean. The champagn brunch went down very well! Great choice of food and prompt service. Definitley take a trip up to the top of the tower and if youre feeling brave go on one of the rides! The tower is free if you are staying there and a great photo taking opportunity as long as youre not scared of heights! The only slight (very slight) downside to the hotel is that it is located at the end of the strip meaning you either have to be up for walking lots (which is what we did and i recommend because you really do get to take in all the sites) OR pay for a bus / taxi.. Vegas is a fantastic place. This was my first time and I would love to go back again! there are so many fantastic hotels to chose from but if you get a good value deal here at the Stratosphere, then I would highly recomend it! Oh and the pool... a much appreciated bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view...but so far from the activity”
Reviews.Author: Robi86
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. It was clean, the staff friendly and the prices reasonable. The only problem we had was it is very far from the "big guns" of vegas. We did take the advise of another review and got the monorail pass, but let me tell you there is still alot of walking. Word to the wise avoid the Sbarro pizza place in Bally's. It was nasty! The deal with the monorail is it comes in at the back of the hotels and then makes you walk through the "malls". If you have good walking shoes, buy the pass, otherwise you may want to take an overpriced taxi or find another way. I was impressed with the lounge at the Stratosphere. It was dimly lit, and you could walk around for a 360 view of Vegas. Drinks were pricey, but not more expensive than anywhere else. My advise, stay here if you drive or don't mind walking alot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Room, Great Rate!”
Reviews.Author: moondancer718
Reviews.Content: Compliments to the hotel staff, service oriented, friendly, prompt, and informative, never felt like I was being rushed except at Starbucks in the hotel casino but they are not part of the hotel. My room was comfortable, clean and relaxing. The king bed was so comfy with lots of fluffy pillows. It would be nice if there was a coffee maker in the room to avoid the Starbucks abrasive staff early in the morning. The pool area is super, only thing the weather was windy and cool. First day the pool was closed due to the weather. Second day it was open but pool is not heat ed and was too cold to swim in. The jacuzzi was very popular! Hotel guests were friendly while warming up in it. Beautiful views. No problems with location since I had a car and it was easy to get around to the other casinos but still bring good pair of walking shoes to walk through hotels/casinos. Dont buy show tix at the hotel, better prices and selection at the half price tix stand by the Peppermill on LV Blvd. Saw Penn and Teller show at Rio and it was fun. Check out the bass player of the jazz duo that plays b4 their show! Also they sign autographs and take photos with the audience after ther show. Really nice guys! Penn even spoke to my son on my cell phone. As far as food goes, I dont recommend Felleni's at Stratosphere.
