Have eaten there b4, but this time I got sick about 3hrs after eating their bruscetta and fagoli soup. I was sick most of my 2nd day. Decided not to eat anywhere at the hotel after that. Save your food $$ and eat at the Venitian instead, prices are almost exact. Had the buffet at Paris and was disappointed after waiting nearly an hr in line. Temps of food was lukewarm to cool. Good selection of grilled vegetables but it is no where near as good as it used to be. Pork loin and Duck were dry. Beef Borgonion had a sheen of oil on top. Deserts were so-so and no choco mousse. Seafood was overcooked. Skip Stage Door Deli at Luxor. Nothing like the one in NY. Pretty so-so. Great gelato at Venitian in St. Marks Sq and expresso at the Expressomente by the waterfall. Check out the conservatory at the Bellagio. Fantastic along with the dancing fountains. There are great rates throughout LV right now, my rate was $24.00 per nt. Less expensive than camping. But even the more upscale resorts have great rates. A great travel bargain with lots to see and do. FYI if you like room service it is offered and honestly the prices are pretty reasonable compared to other hotels. I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: brierganbler
Reviews.Content: When me and my wife go to vegas we love to stay at the stratosphere. The casino host we have is the greatest. The slot machines are fun to play and sometimes pay out pretty good, the rooms are as nice or better then most high end hotels in vegas. Downtown is only a short drive away and the staff is very helpful. If you plan to stay in vegas for fun or pleasure i would recommend the stratosphere over most others.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: ledzep1061
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through priceline name your own price and bid on a 3 star property. The Stratosphere is nowhere near a 3 star, probably a 2 star! - We took a cab from the airport taking Paradise Rd., and the cab fare was only 426 with a $5 tip. The check-in was smooth +, but the room we requested non smoking king wasn't available, we goyt a non smoking queen. - The view from the room was nothing spectualer even though we were on the 20 th floor, probably because the window was so small. - Also there's a problem with the water! There's an odor to it! - the bedst part of the Start is the Tower, which I would visit again! + We checked out after two days and relocated to a suite in New york New York.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really stress enough how bad the neighborhood is”
Reviews.Author: roosdawg
Reviews.Content: So I have really mixed feelings about the Stratosphere. The front desk people were all very nice and helpful. I stayed in a premium suite. They quickly moved me to a room with a better view when I requested it. The room was huge, very clean and the bed was really comfortable. I was solo, so I would have liked the TV to be a little better. Maybe a silly complaint in Vegas, but not really many channels, the TV was old and the remote was 50/50 on working. Kind of annoying when you just want to unwind for an hour. The tower was cool, I didn't really think the view was mind blowing or anything, but definitely worth a look, especially since it's included. While I was happy they offered $5 blackjack, the tables were disgusting. Not just stained, but crusty. Seriously, they need to be replaced. Nobody made any attempt to move all the empty glasses and dirty ashtrays in front of me when I sat down at the table. Even the goofy pit boss kept making small talk with me while I was sitting there with all that stuff in front of me. I noticed this as a trend not just one time. I stopped playing there after about a half hour because it was just so gross. There are a million places that all offer the same games, why would I give my business to one that is filthy and doesn't even care. So give the housekeeping and desk service a raise and fix up that casino. It is seriously lacking in hospitality and cleanliness. Just depressing. Everything around there is cheap, there's a liquor store right down the street so that's handy since I don't like to pay bar prices in Vegas. But the neighborhood, my God! I'm from New Jersey, so it's not like I can't handle myself or I haven't seen the hood before. But believe everything you hear about how bad this hood is. When I first got there I walked down the street to the 7-11 to buy water. I could tell I was in a bad area, but it was close, mid-day and I needed some water. The next morning on the news I saw that a clerk had gotten held up there the night before. The first night I was there I definitely caught more than one drug deal go down and also saw a prostitute and her pimp having an argument as she was staggering away from him on any number of drugs. Probably averaged getting asked for change 3 times per block. Then there are just your general mixed bag of shady characters hanging around. When I went across the street to the Subway the second day there was a guy with a swastika tattoo having a shoving match with his girlfriend in the parking lot. I started taking cabs and the monorail after that. I could go on, but that should give you an idea. Based on that, I can't really recommend it to anyone who wants to walk around comfortably. It's especially nerve racking in Vegas when you have more cash on you than you normally would. It's far away from everything so cab fare kills any bargain you might get on the hotel. Your best bet is to walk to the Sahara monorail, but again walking around in this neighborhood with money in your pocket could be the biggest gamble you take in Vegas! The only way I could really recommend it is if you just want a big clean room at a good price and a good night's sleep. The bed was exceptionally comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “My Trip”
Reviews.Author: Elaine56
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. The shops and restaurants were great. The restaurant revolves so you get to see the whole city while your eating. Won some money but of coarse put it back in to the casino. It was great. Want to go back. Went on the rides on top of the hotel but wouldn't do it now. Must have been crazy.

Reviews.Title: “High standard of service and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: autoflex
Reviews.Content: My expectations of the Stratosphere weren't particularly high, given the low price I was being charged across a seven-night stay. But after a slightly brusque check-in process, I was incedibly impressed. ROOM: The Premier Room on the 14th floor was equal to most other Vegas rooms I'd stayed in, with all the amenities I'd expect (full range of towels/cloths; tissues; potions and lotions; comfortable kingsize bed (with plenty of pillows); small closet and desk; phone and clock-radio). I might have liked more channels on the TV than the fairly basic line-up (no Weather Channel; no Lifetime, for example) but hey, I wasn't intending to spend that much time in the room. Maid service was polite and efficient (I never came back to a non made-up room, something I've experienced in other, dearer hotels). POOL: The main hotel pool area was large and not exactly lush (but look carefully and you'd identify some plants here and there) and the music was trendy and VERY LOUD (it would drown-out even a personal stereo), but really quite OK once you got used to it, and the beverage service was frequent and efficient. There were planty of loungers, which were actually quite comfortable! Overall very relaxed and not nearly as uptight as some other Vegas pools. The water, in March, was pretty cold, but at least that meant it kept the pool from becoming crowded! TOWER: Hotel residence gets the bonus of free access to the Tower - it also means you can experience the tower when the lines are short (and keep coming back if they're a bit too long). I actually only went up the tower once during my stay, but still felt the free pass was a real boon - great to know I could've gone on up anytime I liked (and I imagine it would be a really good extra attraction for families). EATING: I ate only in the Diner, where the food was good and the staff friendly. Across the street from the Stratosphere are a Dennys and an iHop - nice to have those options so close (and fairly unusual in Vegas). CASINO: I'm not interested in gambling, but the casino seemed fairly busy, but by no means not crowded - kind of intimate and small enough to rule out getting lost (which is sometimes a problem in others) LOCATION/AREA: I had a rental car so found the location convenient for getting anywhere in Vegas (and the self-parking was easy to find and convenient for the Premier Room elevators, less so I guess for the other rooms). Others have commented on the seediness of the area around the Stratosphere, but I found this not an issue at all - it was in fact nice to feel you were actually in America rather than in some sort of fantasy park packed with fellow tourists, which is often the case when you're limited to the main strip area. Having a car meant I could easily visit the other Casinos via the back roads that provide access to their car parks (Industrial Road on the West side and Kovak Lane on the East) and this meant I can confidently say that the Stratosphere has one of the better self-parking garages! Traffic in Vegas is pretty bad at most times, with long waits at many of the hundreds of traffic light junctions, but you get this if you use taxis too, so a rental car is worth considering when you're staying at the Stratophere because it is, admittedly, a bit out of the way. And it does mean you get the freedom to visit "real" shops, restaurants and other attractions at your leisure, rather than limit yourself to the theme-based casinos, wonderful as they are.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: maiafridman
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere was everything we expected! The service was great, although not the luxuriest in Vegas, is great for the price, as I checked the lowest in the city (in that kind of hotel). We booked it directly with them and the price included 2 visits per day to the tower (that costs U$13 for non guests) and also has very convenient promos for guests. We took advantage of the "all you can eat all day" for just U$25. It´s just minutes away from major hotels in the strip and it´s even very close to downtown or Premium Outlets for those who enjoy walking. Perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Alcohol Didn't Stand A Chance”
Reviews.Author: lovingthelash
Reviews.Content: 3 phrases of importance for this review. 1. 9 British legends 2. 1 stag party 3. 1 week of complete carnage. ONLY READ IF YOU WANT TO KNOW HOW AND WHERE TO LASH. We arrived at the strat on monday 15th march after a serious amount of travel (24 hours) thinking we'd be a bit tired we ventured to our spacious hotel rooms on the 23rd floor after a painless check in. no queues or difficulties. the rooms were large and well equipped. serviced everyday and sometimes twice if required. especially after one of the party decided to drench one of the beds in an ellaborate water fight. (no charge from the cleaners). We hit the casino. as you might of heard they are pumped with oxygen this will automatically give you a second wind so we were off. hit the back alley bar 10 dollars buys you a 2 pint pitcher it might be a bit bigger but after 15 or so we gave up this arguement. the casino has the cheapest tables on the entire strip with lots of 5 dollar tables and the dealers really do help you out if you have no idea. just ask and they'll talk you through your hands until you get the jist. The C bar in the middle offers unlimited drinks between 4 and 8 everyday for 20 bucks possibly the best deal you'll find in vegas. The pool although no where near the nicest has possibly the fittest bar staff. who have great banter. their best moments include judging a belly flop contest/ feeding grapes ceasar style to the party/ prank calling our mates hotel rooms. This hotel is a great base for big parties. its not to big so you won't get lost like in the MGM. it offers cheap drinks. only cheaper would be freemont street. and in general was awesome. Many say its to far from the strip well a taxi to ceasars costs less than 10 dollars and when you divide by 4 or 5 is nothing. Onto the drinking in other places. if you have time to do freemont street GO. its 2 bucks a beer and 3 bucks for shots everywhere. if your looking for a serious night out go to the VooDoo lounge in Rio's. go early and get a stamp so you don't need to queue or pay to get in this will save you about an hour in queue and 30-50bucks on the door. it varies on how hot you are. this place is off the chain you're partying 52 stories up on a roof terrace packed out with talent and a view that will blow your mind. watch out though, the price of drinks will get you. especially if you start nailing jager bombs. it would rate in my top 3 nights out ever. good luck to anyone that is going soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Money you Pay..”
Reviews.Author: CaliDreaminn
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10pm(bell trans airport shuttle $15 roundtrip was worth it; better and cheaper than a cab would be) and waitied less than 5 minutes to check in. We were able to catch a cab right in front as soon as we were ready to head out to the center of the strip. We requested 2 Queen beds non-smoking room and thats exactly what we got. Plan on bringing your own blowdryer because the one in the room isn't powerful enough (works for guys maybe??) Again there is no fridge or coffemaker but there is an ironing board and iron. Housekeeping kept up with room nicely and room service was pricey. Expect a $3 charge just for them to bring it up. (Cesar salad was $18) Gift shop was open 24 hours and wasnt too over priced and was stocked with the necessities. We did run over to the Circle K (walking distance) and for $2 bought a big 2 gallon thing of water to keep in the room which saved us a few dollars... and we also went to the liquor store and picked up our drinks there ( expect to pay a good chunk of change for drinks!) so for $12 we were able to have our drinks before we went out because even though your gambling they waitresses hardly come around.... We were able to catch Monorail to travel to main part of strip through the Sahara Hotel which was walking distance from the Stratosphere and yes, I said we walked to these places and we were not approached ONCE by anyone asking for money. Overall had no problems, great service comfortable beds and pillows and would def return....

Reviews.Title: “More than ok.”
Reviews.Author: Larissa2005 Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more than ok. And who stays in their hotelroom when visiting Las Vegas?! You only sleep and shower there... To much to see and to much to do. The hotelroom is not important.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: cptnharley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere this week in one of the Mini Sweets, booked non-smoking. Got a smoking room, this room was the worst, there is no insulation for noise between the walls. Three doors down takes a shower at midnight, and you hear it. Some one 5 doors down shuts his door, you hear it. Kids talking in the hall, you here it. You call the front desk, and all you get it I'm sorry,they dont care. Rick

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip, Great City, Ultimate fun”
Reviews.Author: sunilkapoor
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to las vegas. Las vegas is really an ultimate city. This city never sleeps. Truly amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Economic...doesnt drain the budget & leaves room to play with $$”
Reviews.Author: beach_kids70
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and efficient. Treated my family wonderful, considering we paid $181pp for hotel and r/t airfare from SC. Older Hotel on north end, but a quick bus trip couple blocks down is the hustle and bustle of the strip. They have an awesome little city inside on 2nd floor, great foods available, clean, older decor, lots of 2for1's @hotel saves $$. Fun Casino won lots of slots, unlike @strip hard to win. Bus stops are directly out front and it takes you to Freemont Street (north) or LV strip (south)...lots of fun. Good water pressure (showers), room service. Staff is soooo nice, made for good experiences and memories. McDonald’s @hotel has reg. priced menu, not tourist trap prices. Gift store on 1st floor has reg. priced drinks, LV souvenirs..not tourist trap prices. Overall experience was pleasant..had fun. Loved the staff they were all so nice!! Oh, buy bus passes: 24hrs for $7pp or 72hrs for $15pp (you must buy 3 day passes @ticket stands/blue boxes by certain bus stops, one is by freemont st when leaving). Great/cheap way to get around!

Reviews.Title: “Beginning to show its age and too far away on the strip”
Reviews.Author: simple_travel_guy
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted to surprise me with a spa suite, we've often stayed at the Luxor's and really enjoy that. Our first clue that things may not go according to plan was the check-in. "Yes, you have a newly remodeled room with an upgraded bathtub." It was no suite, just your average Vegas room with little colour and few decorations. The tub doesn't fit two comfortably. Sign of the economic times, a lot is closed (such as their "upscale" sushi/Asian restaurant) but they have a new bar, the "Back Alley" which is hard to find but serves really great "street" tacos fresh off the grill. Scantily-clad servers make it a treat. The current show is "Bite" which has been around for a while but has a new vigour considering all the vampire hoopla lately. It's topless and tasteful. No Cirque du Soleil but it'll do. It's too far down on the strip to be near any action, I wouldn't stay there again but I will come back to their rotating restaurant for a romantic meal.

Reviews.Title: “Economic Hotel can make for a graet trip with some research”
Reviews.Author: KwiChan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 day trip to Vegas. The Stratosphere is an average hotel, nothing better or worse. Here's the skinny: Room: Basic room, no frills but clean and quiet. We had an awesome view of the mountains and "Old Downtown" from our 16th floor room. Food: We ate at Roxy's Diner, Felinis, and the buffet. All were decent and not hugely overpriced except for maybe the buffet. Casino: I'm not much of a gambler but they appeared to have all of the standard table games and machines. I won $4.90 playing video poker, big spender right? Shows: We saw "Bite" it was OK. Attractions: Stratosphere has amusement rides on the top of the 1000ft tower. If you have a strong stomach or an adrenelin junkie these are for you. Tips: If you are in Vegas you MUST rent a car for one day and go to Red Rock Canyon. It's 20 mins out of town, costs $5 to get in and is absolutely amazing!!!! On your way out of town make sure to eat at Jamms restaraunt on South Rainbow, very very good. Get a players card. They're free and it will get you 25% off the buffett, plus comps if you're into playing the machines. The hotel also offers 2 for 1 show tickets for guests and unlimited trips to the top of the tower. Invest in a good pair of shoes. As far as I'm concerned walking is the best way to get around. You can take the monorail from Sahara to MGM for $5 a ride or you can take the "Deuce" bus, but the bus is slooooooow and CROWDED, it took us 2 hrs to get half way up the strip and we stood for most of it. Get off the strip. Everything is more exspensive on the strip. The days of cheap food and drinks are gone. Downtown is cheaper and just as good. We ate at Firefly in the Plaza downtown and it was really top notch. Do your homework. check out www.vegas.com and www.cheapovegas.com for good information on where to find deals.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fun trip,but rooms were small --everything else was perfect”
Reviews.Author: ARELIOUS
Reviews.Content: we went there in a group of 10 friends---man what a fun it was.we went there during our labor day weekend trip.initially we had 5 rooms. Stratosphere is a good hotel ---like the ride called X-Scream.. pool was ok . we like the casino ---who remembers --we used to go to hotel around 5 A M And used to play some table games for next 2 hrs and then used to go to bed....we had only 2 complains ----rooms were small and very first day housekeeping didn't clean any of room and i called them at 2:00 am that why our room wasn't clean but no answer and later on they called and asked if want room service now ...common at 2:00 am????? we just asked new sets of towels for morning . this hotel is far from main strip that we knew before me made reservation but this might help who will be going here....overall it was gr8 experience for 1st trip to Vegas, will be visiting Vegas next year but will try different hotel just for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: pathfinderfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on first week of march. Rooms were really clean and good style. Entrance to tower is unlimited for guest. Room service was fast. Housekeeping does a good job. Overall good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Strat”
Reviews.Author: sassafrass319
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Strat for my first venture to Vegas with my boyfriend. The only problem is it is a far walk down the strip to get to the other famous hotels like Caesers etc. But, after we explored the other hotels and area's...we went back to the Strat because it had everything we needed there. During the day we played crapless craps (only offered at the Strat apparently) and the employees were very helpful and courteous. We also hung out by the pool and drank some coctails. Waitresses seemed to be on top of things. We also went to a Vampire Topless review show that was held at the Strat. It was pretty cool and my boyfriend got picked to go up on stage HA HA. It was a lot of fun and the hotel had everything we wanted. And, the view from the top is awesome. Definitely make reservations at the Top of the World restaurant. It's pricey but an amazing view and the entire restaurant spins extremely slowly so you have a different view every time you look out the window. Fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms at a great price”
Reviews.Author: mokigrand
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the International Pizza Expo and stayed at the Stratosphere. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable considering we only slept there. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The casino isn't great.....smells like smoke....but since I'm not a gambler it wasn't too big of an issue. We ate at the Italian restaurant at the hotel and it was very good. The price we paid was very reasonable so I can't complain. This was great for a convention but not where I would vacation.

Reviews.Title: “This is the dirtiest hotel I've ever...”
Reviews.Author: Darcy34
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest hotel I've ever stayed in. The lobby smells like smoke and must. The rooms themselves were fine. The housekeeping staff does a good job, and the rooms are spacious. However, the air conditioner didn't work well. The room was constantly moist and stuffy. We went to a a couple bars in the hotel on our first night, and they were dirty and gross. The people who stay @ this hotel are gross. Mostly gold chain wearing people and old broke down gamblers. The bartenders are friendly, however. The location is awful. Irbid @ the far end of the strip in the ghetto. I get uncomfortable walking around the area, and it cost a lot to get cabs everywhere. Any money we saved on the room was spent on cabs. Don't wate your time and vacation at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brett_Travis09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my favorite out of the three we stayed at in Vegas. Had 2 smoking rooms booked went to check in around 11am but we could only get into non smoking, no big deal, we took one non smoking and the others in our group waited til after 3 for a smoking room. The rooms are pretty basic. The beds and bedding were VERY comfortable. Towards the end of the strip but if you want to walk the strip its really not to bad of a walk. Close to IHOP and a Circle K so if you need something its a quick walk. The tower is something you must really do! Even if you are afraid of heights you can still go look out at the bar view. But its truely amazing! I loved the Stratosphere it is my favorite hotel in Vegas so far!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: South81
Reviews.Content: I did see the pics before booking the hotel and for the CHEAP price offered, I was expecting some nighmare issues. I was happily suprised, the hotel is incredibly clean and the room + bathroom are huge with great views, comfy beds. Also, there is a buffett restaurant downstairs that worth every penny. But the best of all is the observation deck on the top - its AMAZING!!!! the 360' views at night is a must. One crucial tip - its cheaper to book this hotel through TRAVELOCITY than its directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isaac931
Reviews.Content: LOCATION This is the last hotel on the North strip (Las Vegas blvd.) Is near walking to the sahara Hotel, Circus Circus hotel and The Riviera hotel, then if you want to go to Encore, Wynn Fashion Show mall is not to far to go, walking is like 1.60 miles (2.53km) so is good, on summer take your bottle of water and in winter with good wither clothes, and thats all, but if you dont want to walk you can take a bus in thr sidewalk of the Stratosphere (The Deuce) 2 floor bus, and is cheap, for 24 hrs is 7 usd because one wa is 3 usd, and take you to all the strip north to south, is slow because you have many stops, taxis are expensives, ad the monorail nearest point is in the Sahara. SHOWS We went to American superstars (imitation of many artists such as Elvys P., M. Jackson, Britney S., Crisitna Aguilera, Rod Stewar, etc.) is a 1 hour show, is cheap and the performance is good, the teather is normal. HOTEL ROOM In general the hotel is pretty, good, nice and clean, the bedroom is so good and clean, and you can go everyday of your staying for free between 10am to 11:59am to the Stratosphere tower deck.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartaG1
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay!hotel with casino,pool etc.we had everyhting we needed..and we unfortunately left my husband's shirt but just because we didint look closely for our stuff just before we left lol;)but that only means we'll have to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: VickiH3
Reviews.Content: Took my Freshman and Senior and the hotel was great. Lots to do and see together as a family on and off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and quirky”
Reviews.Author: Heather0118
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere offered so much for famlies. My children loved everything about the place and we all had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “In the clouds”
Reviews.Author: DaveS5
Reviews.Content: We got married in Vegas and decided to stay at the stratosphere because of their reasonable prices. we also got married in the tower at the stratosphere. the hotel was very nice. clean rooms and helpful staff. the only real issue that we had was when we moved from our normal room to our suite. the shower drain was backed up and had filled the room with sewer smell. this was especially troublesome considering we were having our reception there. it took a while for maintenance to come and fix the issue. the room also smelled of cigarette smoke, which is fine for me but the wife doesn't smoke

Reviews.Title: “A bit off the main track”
Reviews.Author: toon_ada
Reviews.Content: To be honest, its a decent place to stay but it really is just that bit too far north of the the strip. If you walk into the main strip from here, its a good 15 minutes before Circus Circus and then another 15 to Ballys and i'm no sloutch. A few nights we took the car but that stops the drinking ! The casino is good but possibly needs a bit of a clean and coming from the UK , you take it for granted that people have stopped smoking inside but they haven't in USA. The hotel room we had was massive, but that was because we had a disabled room ! That was not a problem as everything was spread out . The rides on the rook were great and a must do if you visit and the view is superb.The staff were pleasant and helpfull but i wouldn't stay there again. I was told that it wasn't too far away. I think it is and that just makes that little bit of difference. Stay more central is my recomendation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: edwinmleonc
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, exciting, nice rotating restaurant on top, amazing roller coasters on top of tower which make this hotel unique. Service was excellent, good size casino, good restaurants and shopping near by

Reviews.Title: “Best 21st Bday Trip”
Reviews.Author: dancefreek4
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Stratosphere! It was my 21st birthday and they gave me a view room since it was my special day! The service was great, very helpful! Rooms were clean and beautiful. Pool was awesome, very shallow, but it was hot so it did the job. The distance was not that far from the strip... if you have a car, the strip is like 4 min away. Overall, great experience, and we will be returning again in a month for my brothers 21st!!

Reviews.Title: “Best fun I have ever Had”
Reviews.Author: TravelinUndertaker
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. First time with spouse, loved every minute of it and will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Went to the top for the view and rode the roller coaster and slingshot at the top”
Reviews.Author: Dougieb8
Reviews.Content: So much fun!! This is a very casual place and the view from the tower is breathtaking! I wouldn't want to stay here as it is out of the way of the rest of the strip but make sure to visit this gem of a place...especially if you are an adrenaline junkie!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Time at the Tower for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Lovebug87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in Aug 2009. We stayed for 4 nights and 3 days, which is just enough time to spend In Vegas, I would not suggest staying there for a whole week, not much to see after a couple of nights its all the same. We got a very good price at the Strat from Bookit.com, I would say one of the nicest hotels for the money. Don't stay at Circus Circus if your looking for cheap, you get what you pay for there. ( my parents stayed there) The only thing that sucked about the hotel was that it was at the end of the strip, but that was fixed once we discovered that the monorail was only a 5 minute walk to the next casino! Don't take taxi's if you stay in vegas, take the monorail. You can drink on the monorail, just like every where else in vegas. It is like 5 dollars for the whole day or like 10 dollars for 3 ... don't quote me on the prices tho. For cheap drinks go to the monte carlo, its 1 or 2 dollars for mixed drinks !! Something that we had no idea about until we came home but go to OLD VEGAS apparently it is really neat, we never got a chance to see it as we didn't know it existed My parents rented golf carts that look like farm animals over there and drove it around the city, haha. The only glitch at the Strat was that we wanted to rent a car from the car rental place in the casino to see the grand canyon. No body told us that we had to be 25 to rent one there, they told us other places on the strip would rent to us, but because we were not 25 they couldn't enter us in the computer, they didn't tell us about anyother rental places either, so we wasted half a day looking for a car rental place, and by that time there was no point as it is a 6 hour drive !!!!( something else we didn't know) The pool was very nice to relax at, we couldn't stay outside for longer then 30 min due to extreme heats tho. ( I think just because it was August it was EXTREME heat) The show BITE was very.... exotic is the right word... my boyfriend forced me to go... I would suggest to do the players club $25.00 Buffet. as for $25.00 you get breakfast, Lunch and Dinner buffet all for 25.00 per person for one day!! real money saver. Happy Hour is lots of fun too ... its at the bar in the casino, the serve beer and hard martinis and margaritas... thats its... so prepare to get drunk , one flat price of 20.00 per person from 5-8 gets you unlimited alcohol. And NO we were too chicken to go on the rides.... but if you are a dare devil I would suggest it as it would be a once in a lifetime kind of ride... If we were to go back to Vegas We would definitely stay here if we wanted a guaranteed good stay for our money. But we might splurge and stay at the Venetian or Ceasers Palace!

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad”
Reviews.Author: BirdieAbromovich
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our initial room. The entire view was of the heating/air ducting, the clothing drawers were dirty and, there was a giant hairball that prevented the tub/shower from draining. We expressed our disappointment and we were moved to a much nicer and cleaner room. The customer service representative who helped make that switch was wonderful! Pros: ~ We appreciated having a variety of eateries with a wide budget range. ~ Except for the condition of our first room, the housekeeping was great. They did seem to forget us one day though! ~Lots of towels and pillows. ~ The customer service was exceptional. The Best? The beds were SO comfortable!! Cons: ~ The walls are between rooms are much too thin. On our last night in our room we heard our neighbor’s conversations as if they were in the same room with us. This really negated the wonderful comfort of the beds because it prevented us from getting any sleep since they were up until the wee hours of the morning. ~ No coffee pot. ~ Separated from the rest of the strip to the point transportation was necessary to visit anything else. ~ Photography tripods aren’t allowed on the observation deck. I found out about this AFTER schlepping mine all the way there. I didn’t get an “official” reason and I couldn’t find any literature indicating I couldn’t take it along. By the time I checked it with the bell desk and actually got up to the deck, I lost the desired lighting. This was a great disappointment to me. The Worst? High priced internet!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SheriW2
Reviews.Content: I recommend staying at the Stratosphere for a cheap stay at a nice casino/hotel. It is at the end of the strip, but there are buses to take you anywhere you need to go. Or, if you like exercise, it is 3 1/2 miles to the other end of the strip. A nice workout! It's also positioned in the middle, so you can go down to the old strip, the Fremont Street experience. Also very cool.

Reviews.Title: “2 Double Bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyS73
Reviews.Content: Not only are the rooms clean, there easy to find. You still have to walk through the casino to get there, but easy stroll to find elevators. We were there during a huge wind storm, so we didn't get to enjoy the rides on top, but they look scary! It's a hike from this hotel up the strip, so bring your walking shoes! oh BTW, we were early and we checked out late and they were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “On the strip but - not really”
Reviews.Author: BBee82
Reviews.Content: We chose the Stratosphere because the price was right and we figured it would be nice to be on the strip for our first Vegas visit! The hotel itself is ok - clean and reasonable. Casino is good, not very much entertainment but the buffet is VERY good. The main issue is location - the bus aptly named "The Deuce" is always crammed full and it takes a good hour to get from the Strat to even the Mirage. Reasonable place to stay if it was closer to the action. Nice view though!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the action”
Reviews.Author: sandythatsme
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself wasn't bad, and the price was cheap. However, you need a car or a bus for everything because too far from all the "goings on."

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArG21CHE
Reviews.Content: So i stayed in the stratosphere for the first time being that i have stayed in many other hotels in the strip(bellagio,hard rock,luxor,excalibur,the mirage etc...) this time around we where looking for something cheaper in price so we saw that stratosphere had great values we booked the luxury grand suite for 3 nights and it was i was very suprised big room soft beds very nice and the service was great did not wait a long time check-in was fast and smooth the casino it cool.. restaurant where very good and the tower is amazing view the roller coasters are fun too definatly going back already book a room for march

Reviews.Title: “great rates if u know where to look”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethG9
Reviews.Content: good rates ( we looked on hotels.com ) and great pool for the kids. good restaurants....close to strip and across the street form ihop. this is the only hotel we stay in when we go to vegas.

Reviews.Title: “decent place to stay if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: I just needed a cheap night in Vegas and the Stratosphere had the best prices. With a car, it's a good choice. Without a car, not so much. It would be a long walk to most of the other Strip casinos. I guess you could take the "Deuce" bus for 3 bucks, but why? With a car, your transportation problems are solved, and the low rates make up for the slightly isolated location. Having your own wheels is also useful for dining, as the hotel's offerings -- while more than adequate -- are not generally well-regarded for exceptional value or quality. All room rates at this price now include admission to the observation deck, which is an interesting half hour diversion (not worth the price of admission for non-hotel guests, but a nice freebie). Some of the nearby houses and businesses are run-down, but once you're at the hotel, this doesn't really impact your stay. Rooms are surprisingly pleasant -- kind of like Sheraton-quality. Very good beds.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jamesisaking
Reviews.Content: For $30 a night in the middle of the summer, you can't ask for a better price. However, the location is slightly north of the strip, so traveling via the taxi or monorail can get a bit expensive, as well as time consuming. Just don't expect luxury, a la the higher-end hotels on the strip itself.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: sandyreil
Reviews.Content: Great view, away from a lot of the craziness but not a far bus ride and worth the money savings!

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyB1
Reviews.Content: awesome rooms, cheap, fun casino, great staff, great pool for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: ElisaBethBreeze
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, lots of stuff going on, and helpful staff; they know all there is to know about shows if you cant decided.

Reviews.Title: “The prison of hotels pure hell”
Reviews.Author: Adamg846
Reviews.Content: OMG what a freakin dump. If you want to stay in prison for your trip to vegas stay here. The rooms reak there are no pictures on the walls, its so awfull. It was my ultimate nightmare. I quite literally would not recomend my worst enemy o this place. Please the price is low for a reason, because its a hole in the wall dump.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid.. Definitely you will be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pavi1105
Reviews.Content: I booked a romantic spa Suite in this hotel for better price. When i called them, i was assured that i will be given any floor above 15th floor with strip view. when i reached there i had a shock to see a backside room in 12th floor. The staff was rude and he wouldnt listen to me. Locationwise, this is way away from the strip. you cannot walk from the strip to here and you cannot drive either( because of the traffic). So please avoid and stay in some hotel in the strip.you would be better off to stay in Ballys or planet hollywood than this. Please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere (Mar 09')”
Reviews.Author: rjones77
Reviews.Content: Good rate, nice rooms. Pool was freezing, and at the end of the strip. Otherwise well worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but far out.”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my son for five days and this will be my 8th time in Las Vegas. I find that all of the strip hotels are very similar with a huge casino and big rooms. The Stratosphere was only let down by its distance from the main strip and use of the Deuce bus service is a must at 7 dollars a day. Being resident entitles one to go up the tower for free and the views are stunning, as are the rides on the top that have to be payed for. The restaurant is a 50s themed one that serves basic American food . Fifties music is played and every so often one of the staff would take the microphone and sing a song. My son tried to buy a hamburger from the joint across the road and was told that he couldn't because it was a drive in and he wasn't in a car!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Silverparakeet
Reviews.Content: I went with my family for 3 days. Even though it is towards the end of the strip, it was a great experience. The hotel was clean and the lobby was a very clean. Overall, the experience was great!

Reviews.Title: “OK once, but probably won't do twice”
Reviews.Author: spooncherry
Reviews.Content: You expect Las Vegas to be crazy, and it does deliver. I went for my wedding in mid-December. The room was clean, on the 21st floor, did not have a view of the strip but was kept really well. Unfortunately in December the pool is closed at night and I was there during their room service blackout, so at least on night one I couldn't benefit from that service. Lucky's was closed, and the Starbuck's plays music extra loud to discourage loiterers. If you are stuck at night, the double decker bus does pull up across the street and there are always enough other tourists at any hour to ensure some safety. Also, the Sahara is only two blocks away, and it is the nearest access to the train that takes you down the strip - it's a bit of a hit, but the speed, convenience, cleanliness and safety often make it a better bet than taking the bus. The spa connected to the Stratosphere is just a glorified hair salon with spa-like services. It is even the size and shape of a mall shop, and despite a "spa menu" in the hotel room that says you can charge services to your room, you can NOT charge services to your room, or at least we could not. I also found it to be the single most stressful "spa" experience of my life. Loud music, horrendous fluff television and a really mean-spirited and gossipy atmosphere among the employees left me feeling more instead of less tense after my massage and facial. You assume that your manicurist is judging you, but mine didn't even try to hide it. The truly alarming and hateful discussion about women's bodies reminded me that yes, I was in Vegas, but left me wondering if the employees had any genuine concern for their clients at all. Combine this with salon-typical high pressure sales and I was mostly relieved to get out of there. Chapel in the Clouds was efficient and lovely, and our photographer was a great guy. I'm not sure who does their photo editing service, but they operate way too much on assumption about names (asking clients relevant questions always increases sales, yo.) Also, the cover they tried to sell me on had me making an unfortunate weasel face. I'm assuming that they got me mixed up with the actual bridezilla that I saw the photographer actually running away from several hours after my own wedding. Also, for adults, see Bite. It's a hoot. The Strat's OK, but skip the "spa." It might as well have had a slot machine going off the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with the best view from Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: HelenaTS
Reviews.Content: We've paid 25 usd for each night and everything was ok. And the best thing was that as a guest from the hotel we had the chance to go up to the tower and enjoy the beautiful view from Las Vegas every day!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: damers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Strat first in 2001, again in 2004, then again in 2008. And I have just booked to go again for two weeks in September this year!! This hotel has everything. The rooms are fantastic and clean, the service is awesome, and all the staff are very friendly. I have never really won any money, in fact the opposite, but it still doesnt put me off! The food at the top of the tower was great, but the italian place is the best of all. the food is just too good for words. I cant wait to go again, and I cannot stress how good this hotel is for the value. I know a lot of people say its a long walk to the main section, but being English, a bit of a walk is part of my daily routine anyway! Half an hour is nothing to us!

Reviews.Title: “Rediculouly good value”
Reviews.Author: jw3737
Reviews.Content: we paid 25 bucks, yes 25 dollars for one thursday night. we did pay a 7.50 resort fee but that included a ticket up the tower(which is like a 15 dollar ticket otherwise). There is nothing special about the hotel or casino and nothing special about the rooms. Everything was clean, the bed was comfortable, one crappy tv(who watches tv tho), and i was suprised that the shower was so nice and roomy. Downside is you do have to take a cab to the north strip which was like 10 bucks, but this place is great for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, lovely rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Irmani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days between a long drive from the California coast on the way to the Grand Canyon. I'm not a casino person, but the rooms were very comfortable and the pool area was lovely. The view of the strip from the cocktail bar was beautiful. It's great value when booking online (our deal was something ridiculously cheap like £19 per night) which is amazing for such lovely accommodation. The food left something to be desired - enormous portions of otherwise flavourless food which was horribly, inedibly oversalted (this was true of the four places we ate in the hotel). Drinks cheap and nice - but eat elsewhere. If we ever make it back to Vegas we'd definitely come back here really - it was so much nicer than the Hilton where we spent one night before flying home for three times the price - and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Read it!!!”
Reviews.Author: tes241
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Strats for 6 nights for our anniversary and AEE convention. We never had problems...they always clean our room, fd and concierge are always helpful. If you dont want to be bothered by hskpr, put the dnd sign and before you leave put the service sign on....it's that easy. Yes, it's far from the middle of the strip but that's ok...the duece (bus) stops in front of the hotel and goes by every 10-15 mins...it's cheap..$3 one way, $7 24 hrs, $15 5days ppl (make sure you have exact change). Strats Guest gets a free entrance at the tower but you have to pay for the rides- rides looks fun but we chicken out. IHOP is 3 mins walk thats a +. Last thing.....do your homework.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but with poor points. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: brittanykleigh
Reviews.Content: Generally we are a couple that likes to be left alone. I don't really like being bothered all the time by employees unless I want their help. The employees were helpful and pleasant at checkin and if I needed to call them for something. Coctail waitresses are prompt and friendly. We booked throught the stratosphere website, which I recommend over any travel or discount websites because the strat will give you the best deal or match the best deal you can find. Then you know you are all set. They gave us the option to upgrade for an additional $5 per nt from a high floor premier strip view room to a studio deluxe room. Frankly the room was lame. The pics on their website are way too nice, much nicer than the room I had and I was quite disappointed. The bed was very comfortable, but the decor and furnishings were very bland and not as I pictured. I'm not sure what I would have had a view of in the original room, but in the room we ended up in I had a view of one of the legs of the tower. A big cement block right outside my window. great! haha All in all the room was clean and nice, but not as I had expected and we didn't spend that much time in there anyway. However, QUIET ... we were right off the elevators, never heard them and only once did we hear a roudy group in the hallway. It was silent there! IT was awesome that when I wanted some piece and quiet I could get it in my room! so for the price ... you couldn't beat it. we paid an average rate of about $70/ nt. Frankly I was pissed that they were charging $12.99 per day for internet access! I can go to a McDonalds at home if I want to and have FREE wifi!!!! This made me VERY upset and I complained and got a comped mini fridge brought to my room, which I was supposed to have in the "studio" anyway, but whatever. We bought cereal and milk and had breakfasts in the room instead of spending the money out so that was a great idea. With your room you get unlimited admission to the tower, which is about $15 per person per trip up ... we went up there every chance we got. It more than made up for the crap view from our room. It is gorgeous up there!!! There are a variety of things to do up there, we didn't go on the rides, but they looked fun. They are building a new one right now- a bungee jump off the tower. There is a restraunt that is VERY pricey so we just had drinks there. There is a bar, an artist who does fabulous characahers etc. It's a relaxing spot to grab one of the leather sofas and just look out and chat. BITE - the stratosphere's show. Good show, fanominal dancers, great music. DO NOT pay extra money for the VIP section seats. all the tables in the place are round tables that fit 10 ppl and they are simple padded aluminum chairs. They will tell you when you buy the tickets that they cannot tell you what seats are left in general admission and that if you buy these tix the computer will auto pick your seats. Otherwise if you want to pay xtra then you can pick your seats in the VIP sections which are some booths or tables that are up close. THere is not a bad seat in the house, I would not recommend wasting the money on VIP anything at this show ... the coctail waitress never even came to the 'vip' table we were at HAHA Some VIP ... Other than that- GREAT show. The location is NOT THAT BAD! Every one says It's in the ghetto .. blah blah blah. IT's really NOT that bad. It IS in fact quite far from the center of the strip - we never walked down there. Buy a Deuce bus pass for 24 hrs for $7 pp or 3 days for $15 ... TOTALLY worth it! There is a stop going north and south right outside the hotel. The longest we waited was for 20 mins on sat night around 6pm. otherwise we never waited more than 5 mins for the bus. this was great so we didn't have to spend a ton of money on cabs. There is a dennys and an Ihop right outside the hotel and across the street either way. You can walk to the Sahara for $1 blackjack in about 5 minutes. Honestly, on our 1st trip to Vegas we were not reallly that into the main strip. It's cool to go see it all and take pictures, but every hotel is basicly the same things and it is SO FAR to walk the whole thing. We LOVED the freemont street experience. LOVED IT! It's closed off so you can get to both sides of the street easily, there is a dome covering the street with a light show that is so neat and you are outdoors with the airy feel, but it feels very intimate. The Four Queens Comedy Club was AWESOME! $15 pp to see Butch Bradley was the best money we spent in Vegas. It was GREAT!!! We prefered Freemont St (aka old las vegas) to the strip anyway. Football on Sunday was in the theatre in the stratosphere was great! 7 projection screens with the game and a variety of snacks nachos, hot dog, baked potato, wings etc for just $2 each was wonderful! All in All ... Vegas is a fun place and the Stratosphere was good. Pros and Cons, but we would stay there again, but keep in mind not to spend any extra money on the room because it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Started out good and ended poorly”
Reviews.Author: aprkontra
Reviews.Content: Visit: 01.23.10: After many visits to Vegas and staying a various Hotels we are always looking for good deal…On our last visit we decided to stay at The Stratosphere, they offered an excellent rate for a Saturday Night... The experience at the Stratosphere, started good and ended poorly…. The room was nice, clean, the Bell Service... (Chuck) was A+, EXCELLENT… the Bartenders were very nice…and the drinks kept coming with great service…. But as part of each experience in Vegas you must evaluate the dinning… and at the Stratosphere if your looking for a late night snack or meal then your not in luck, especially at LUCKY’s….… First of all the Hotel is located in area close to the slums of Vegas, there really isn’t anywhere else in walking distance to go once the sun goes down… The only restaurant you can eat at after 12am is LUCKY’s and if your going there, your out of LUCK….After a night on the strip we went back to the Strat,,,, it was late around 1am we wanted to get something to eat so we went to the only restaurant that was open in the hotel… When we arrived at LUCKY’s we found it empty,,, maybe one or two customers being severed,… we were told to wait for a hostess before seating, this took over 10 minutes. Finally a reluctant employee came to seat us, offered us a drink and that’s pretty much it for the next 20 minutes…. We watched our waitress walk passed us two or three times…. but never stopping to ask for our order… we decided to leave; I went to the Hostess and asked if I owed anything for my Ice Tea, she knew I was upset for waiting so long and still charged me…$3.50 + or –… With our present economy, to keep business coming back, customer service means everything… and with the Service we received at LUCKY’s, it guess it doesn’t mean much to the Stratosphere.. in was HORRIBLE. I will not return to Stratosphere. ……. In addition we were in town for a show,,, so we had to take cab down to Caesar’s Place…this cost $15 each way…So the location is not the greatest… If you wanted to go downtown the price for a cab is pretty much the same as it is for going to the heart of the strip……. Basically if you stay here and want a late night snack… pack a lunch because the restaurant service is the WORST I have ever experienced… Mr. Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Dekko1969
Reviews.Content: The casino was ok. The rooms was spacious and very clean. I enjoyed the tower observation deck which was included in my total reservation cost. I did not do the rides but my friends had a blast. I would recommend to book with their website direct. They had better promotions and packages than any other travel site. I would recommend for you to sign up to their casino club. They give you a lot of benefits if you sign up.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: MTBTrails
Reviews.Content: Left the cold Colorado mountains for some mountain biking in the desert. Very reasonable price for a 4 night stay. Rooms were clean but on the small side (similar to the rest of the original hotels on the strip). Everything worked as it should and the service was good. The band at the hotel bar was top notch with no cover and inexpensive drink specials. We didn't miss much of their music the 4 nights they played. This location is on the far north end of the strip so walking the strip is quite a hike. The monorail station at the Sahara is an easy 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Price, Location a Little Less”
Reviews.Author: AlexMarc77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during News Years Eve week for a friends wedding and to ring in the new year. Overall you could not beat the price for the room, even though New Years Eve night it went up dramatically but that was expected. For a holiday week you really couldn't beat the price. Yes it is up north on the strip away from the newer hotels but that actually made it easy to get and from during traffic times. The rooms was somewhat plan overall but for spending time out having fun it was ok. Since I was there for a week, I used the iron several times to keep formal clothes pressed but the iron had a short cord attahced to the ironing board and a mount at the end of the board which made it difficult to iron. The casino was nice overall and the majority of the dealers were very nice and helpful during play, even help answer questions and play recommendations. Spent a lot of time at the Blackjack tables where the dealers were extremely nice. The restaraunt at the top of tower is faboulous (pricey but good), you get a rotating view of the whole city while you eat. Once done eating you can go upstairs to one of the decks for a bar, view, or rides.... BUT it was cold as ice up there! I would recomend this hotel to young adults and for those who are not bringing children. It is perfect for those that want to have fun and explore town.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jamespurdie
Reviews.Content: The Bad…… We paid extra for a strip view room, but I would advise against this. The room did have a strip view, but the view was of Denny’s restaurant and the window in the room was on the left side of the room, right next to the bed and you could not see anything out the window unless you went between the bed and the far left wall, the window was only 3ft by 4ft. The 2 double beds we got were the most uncomfortable beds me and my 2 other friends slept in, we kept waking up every 30 to 40 mins and the pillows were way to soft, after you put your head on them it was only 2 inches thick if that. They also had the air condition right under the window on the left side of the room, right next to the bed, so what happens when you use the air the person next to the air would freeze and the other people in the room would not feel the air at all unless you turned up the air to high and the person next to it would be so uncomfortable, believe me I was the person next to the air and just to let you know I like it cold but not that cold. The bathroom was very very small, just a tub and a toilet, the sink was not even in the bathroom, we had a 3ft by 3ft area to get changed in. My friend ordered room service and got a carafe of pineapple juice (It was not pineapple juice it’s a pineapple drink) and a shrimp cocktail and ask for avocado but got cucumber instead, the total was for $42.35, after looking at the shrimp cocktail with only 5 medium shrimp and no avocado like she asked for she only wanted the carafe of pineapple juice that ended up costing $16.90 The Stratosphere has taken to adding a $7.50 plus tax resort fee per day, probably so that they can low-ball the room rate for comparison purposes and then make it up in the resort fee. They never stated it in the reservation that I booked online with Yahoo travel. Now for the good….. All of the staff where very friendly We called for extra towels and we got a ton of them Check in was fast, our check in time was for 3pm on a Sunday but they let us check in at 1230pm, it only took about 5mins. We ate at the Roxy's Diner, it’s a 50's style diner, food was great and the girls were dancing and singing right at our table. The waitresses at the C Bar where very friendly and we spent about 3 hours there. Over all the price was right but I don’t think I will be going back to the Stratosphere to stay in their rooms anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere hotel review”
Reviews.Author: DaveW4
Reviews.Content: good clean rooms, helpfull staff, good amenities, generally a very good hotel. oh and the rides at the top are awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price, location manageable”
Reviews.Author: HolidayAce1
Reviews.Content: Firstly yes this hotel is located at the end of the strip (thats why its cheaper) the people who complain about this should stay elsewhere. It is possible to walk (30-40 mins) or catch the bus. The hotel is very good; clean tidy, great staff, big rooms, nice food everything you could wish for. I am planning to return to vegas this summer ( I will stay in the New York New York) based on the fact that it is in the center of the strip thats the only reason. If you want a great hotel and don't mind the location then please stay here you wont be disapointed. If you want a better location stay in the NewYork NewYork it looked great when I was in it.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: NB20091219
Reviews.Content: Hi there...just a quick note to say that my husband and I got married in Vegas....upgraded to a room on expedia, only to find out it didn't exist when we got there. The room was not cleaned properly & there were a pair of women's underwear left for us....each day as the maid then thought they were mine. Umm it is inconvenient to find a coffee...no coffee in the room. It's a bit noisy at night time, depending who your neighbours are...as for location-it would be more convenient to stay at a hotel in the south end of the strip. Overall - not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A place you'll never forget!”
Reviews.Author: Maxine2310
Reviews.Content: I took my partner here to celebrate his 40th birthday. Our room was spacious and the maids kept it immaculate every day. The staff were all friendly and very helpful. Although it is situated at the end of the strip, don't let this put you off because there is a fantastic bus that takes you from one end of the strip to the other for $7 for 24 hours. There are lots of other hotels within walking distance that you can go into and enjoy. You must eat at the Top of the world restaurant in the Stratosphere. The restaurant revolves and you can see the city of Las Vegas for miles. The view is amazing. The food was excellent, and yes it is more pricey than many of the restaurants around, but it is worth every cent for the quality and experience. A three course meal including a bottle of wine was about $200 including a tip. I would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bull Riding Finals”
Reviews.Author: Admaddux
Reviews.Content: For an older hotel it is the best. You get all the glitz without the price. Very affordable and very nice rooms. Loved it and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A sleepless night”
Reviews.Author: MABBERO
Reviews.Content: First impressions were good with large, well decorated clean and tidy room for a good price. This hotel is on the strip though is still a LONG (30-40 min) walk from the larger hotels such as Bellagio and Caeser's Palace. The good impressions were shattered by EXTREMELY thin walls in the hotel. We were kept awake all night and most of the morning as a result of these thin walls and a noisy neighbour. Despite complaints to reception etc the situation did not improve. This of course meant no rest resutling in tiredness and a ruined stay. Reception offered a limp apology on check-out. Wouldnt recommend if you want some sleep!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: shinagwa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere in December. First trip to Vegas and went with a group of 3 younger couples. Picked the Strat for the low price on a travel website. Price was good, but from what I see and read since the trip, you can get a better hotel in a better location for just a bit more. Strat is located on the Strip, but on the far North end, and is quite a walk from some of the hotels with more attractions. Good news is you can ride the Deuce, a bus that goes up and down the strip, for cheap (although since it stops and every other casino, it takes a while). Casino was nice enough, rooms looked like any other cheap hotel chain in the country (i.e. Super 8) and don't give you that VEGAS!! feel. Staff was helpful. Some of the in house restaurants were "closed for repairs" when we were there and we couldn't get on the rides due to the wind. All in all just an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the top...”
Reviews.Author: Crabcakeahoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, having previous stayed at another Las Vegas hotel. The rooms here aren't very big and you could see that it needed spruced up a bit, but otherwise everything was clean. It's location is a little further out from the main hotels but you can catch the Deuce bus which runs up and down the strip. Although it is walkable. The view from the top was amazing, we tried to get reservations in the top of the world restaurant but it was closed for a private function. So if you plan to stay here try and book the restaurant at the same time. Also the famous 'little white chapel' is just 5 mins up the road if you fancy getting hitched. The staff weren't as helpful as the staff in the other hotel we stayed at. We wanted to weigh our suitcases buy they didn't have a set of scales in the whole hotel and were rather rude about it. Other than that, if you are on a budget this is a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but not bad”
Reviews.Author: tawill
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews but this hotel really isn't bad. It was very clean. The grounds, the casino, walk ways, shopping, rooms, dining, everything is clean and well kept. We paid $25/day to upgrade from a basic king room to one with the jacuzzi tub. I was glad we did. The tub was huge! And the bathroom was bigger too. Otherwise, I think you pretty much get the same. The rooms are simple and have really no amenities and are NOT very sound proof. The neighbors next door were fighting all night long and you could hear every word! No in-room coffee. I brought my own little 4-cup pot and made my coffee each am. There is a Starbuck's right in the casino but a basic small cup of coffee is $3. There is good shopping and very good restaurants right in the hotel. For daily goods you can walk to the Circle K store. There is also a liquor store right across the street. The neighborhood, once off the Stratosphere property is a little undesirable until you get down more towards center strip, but nobody ever bothered us and we had no problems walking around. We used the airport shuttle to get to and from the hotel for arrival and departure. $12 pp round trip. A cab would have cost quite a bit more since it's north strip and further from the airport. We walked quite a bit but would use cabs to get back to the hotel at the end of the night. We rented a car (Budget located in hotel) and went to the Hoover Dam and Lake Mead one day. It was awesome! We really enjoyed it. The lake is beautiful too. Drive down to it and go for a walk on the beach or have lunch in the cafe at the marina. Go early though...head out to the dam right away in the morning. The traffic later in the day is unbelievable. But we were there on a Sunday so perhaps it's worse then. Watch the Belagio water show, it's spectacular and also the Treasure Island pirate show. Both free, outdoors and entertaining. This was our first trip to Vegas. Would we go back? Not sure. We don't gamble but there is quite a bit else to do there. It's a cheap vacation, that's for sure. All in all the Stratosphere is a nice hotel, very inexpensive but enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great price at the stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: snowwoman23
Reviews.Content: Although the stratosphere is at the end of the strip we walked both sides of the strip to see all the attractions from the hotel. we stayed on the 25th floor great view great price...very clean no noise...great price we stayed for 30.00 a night we also got unlimited tower trips to the top with our hotel stay and also 2 for 1 tickets to any shows in the hotel. we went to see a show bite it was a very good show for old and young its a good for men and women not for kids....very good show i would reccomend. anything we needed from the hotel questions or anything it got answered. there is a food court in the hotel with even a mccdonalds in it and they even let you use coupons there also. there is alot to do in the hotel besides gamble. the food is awesome we had the buffet for dinner every night it ws great 20 a person seafood friday and saturdays.....but if your looking for more of a budget buffet some where they alot of others you can go to and eat for alot less and still eat good food. the room smelled good and was clean and was beautiful.....our window was right under the rides that was at the top of the stratosphere we could see the rides and people on them from our room. the temperature was good when we were there...last day was warm we good only last 2 hours walking and headed back to hotel. in front of circus circus right off the walk there is a bar set up with margaritas or strawberry daquiries for 1.50 glass and there wonderful we had them mix half margarita and half strawberry its awesome.......and there frozen blended......they sale the souvenir cup or if you have your own they will fill it we did have our own we bought 3 cups and put it in our own cup its alot cheaper that way then we shared and had a covered big cup to sip while walking in warmer temps. there was alot we didnt see we will go back and will stay there again........we stayed 4 nights.......you just cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the top”
Reviews.Author: katymc2010
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, amazing view from the top...have to be crazy to go on the rides up there

Reviews.Title: “Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: AliWiseman
Reviews.Content: I can't fault this hotel. Cost the price of two drinks per night to stay, located nicely in between new and old Vegas, making it an ideal base, and the views from the tower.... amazing. People who grumble about this hotel are the sort of people who turn their nose up at travelling on a bus, or won't walk more than 400 yards. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Stratosphere. The room was a bargain for a rate of $39 plus tax and $7 resort fee. Check in was somewhat painful having to wait ten minutes but I have heard of much worse in Las Vegas. The room was spacious, clean and everything was in working order. This room didn't have a great view and wasn't luxurious but was more than adequate. The rate included admission to the tower, fitness center (very large but not the most recent equipment) and pool (closed in winter). The casino is about average size for Vegas standards and had a few decent dining options. You can also find some lower stake games here as opposed to some of the higher end properties. The location is at the north end of the strip and requires some time to walk to other attractions but it is also closer to downtown. I would definitely stay here again especially at a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Does not have Wi-Fi Internet”
Reviews.Author: i-hate-screeen-names
Reviews.Content: The hotel advertises "high-speed internet" on it's website. This hotel DOES NOT have high-speed internet. In our room we got a 2MB connection, which is awful, only when we sat by the window, which was an actual recommendation from the front desk. Sitting on the bed resulted in intermittent connectivity. I downloaded an app for my iPhone to walk around the hotel and try different floors and see what the WiFi signal was like. It was terrible everywhere. NO they don't have a business office and NO they don't have ANY rooms with hard wire options. If you need WiFi internet access for your stay do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kolla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 20 - 22 and also stayed here earlier in 2009. At $ 28 p night + tax it was again excellent value for money. The advantages of this hotel is the location, we travel light and on a small budget. Bus 108 Paradise goes directly from the airport and within 28 mins it drops you off very close to the Stratosphere. If you want to do this, ask the bus driver for the $7 24h bus pass with which you can also go on the Deuce Double decker bus for the next 24hrs. Also when you stay here you have free access to the Tower, a $ 16 value p person right there. Its very nice to go up in the tower at night and view the Strip and see the rides on the top of the Tower. Check in was quick and the staff are very friendly, I used the bell hop to store our bags as we arrived early in the morning before we could check in and we had a late evening flight and had to store our bags at the bellhop on the day we checked out. The rooms look like a bedroom and bathroom in a new showhome, very nice big rooms and very comfy beds. I only use the room to sleep and get ready when I stay in Vegas, so for this its excellent value for money. I would highly recommend the Stratosphere for their very nice new rooms, friendly staff, the 108 city transit bus that runs back and forth to the airport and the Premuim Outlet Mall and seeing the strip from the Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and funny”
Reviews.Author: RikyUnreal
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere Hotel is one of the huge hotel-casino in Las Vegas. Standard rooms (for two persons) are very spacious and comfortable, and the price is really hold down. With the room key-card you can access to the observation tower for free, so you can admire Las Vegas from 1000 feet. Beautiful. I found only a glitch. The room was a little cold (it was december) and air conditioner doens't work correctly to raise the temperature. I slept with and extra bed cover.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay again, Thanks Startosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Kerryokequeen
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Strat, my husband and I love it here! But lets get things into perspective.... we love this place cuz it's far enough away from the crowds on the strip. we love this place because we can stay in the Grand Luxury Suite for 7 days for under $700 US. we love this place because somedays we can just hang around the shops and casino and relax! Our room was awsome! on the 21st floor of the tower side suite 32153, great view of the mountains. as you can see from the pic's wet bar, jetted tub, so much room for two people. We stayed over christmas Dec. 20th - Dec. 27th only complaint would be that room service was unavailable during our stay. We enjoyed Roxy's and the courtyard buffet while in the hotel, good food for a good price. the slot machines were good to us, my hubby won a $500 jackpot on Elvis quarters, and I did well on the penny "Wizard of OZ" ($325) The place was clean, the staff we very nice, the room was the highlight. Most people on a budget will get the best bang for their buck here at the strat, those who need to be right in the middle of the action might not choose this hotel. I personally find it perfect, and will continue to stay and play at the Strat....I Love Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: Birger83
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our stay at Stratosphere. When we arrived we had to walk through the whole Casino with our luggage to reach the reception. The check in went okay but when we arriverd at our room, it had not been cleaned: dirty sheets and a used condom on the floor. We immediately called reception and they asked us to wait for a guy that would come and check it. We had to wait for about 15 minutes (we were incredebly tired though) befrore someone arrived and confirmed what we stated - as if reception did not believe us. Finally we got a new room.. Great, one would think. The next day when I went up our room, the room key did not work. The room was registered on my friend's name. He had left the hotel and when I asked for a new room key, they said my name was not registered in the hotel! I said I could perfectly describe what was in the room and that my ID and other stuff could confirm me also staying in that room. They let the manager come and he sent me to some kind of guard. Had to wait over 10 minutes and when I explained him the situation, this guard refused in an impolite way to come along and check my room. I had to call my friend who had to come back from shopping so we could get new room keys (his also did not work) and so I could get registered. Finally everything worked out? Not so: the day after our room keys refused to work again so... back to reception... And ine more thing: I wanted to go swimming one day and there had been a very small storm before noon. In the afternoon weather got better so I went up to the swimming pool. Closed. Because of the stormy weather. Too dangerous. You must know sun was shining at that moment. I replied: "I see..." I just could not get myself motivated anymore to ask for further explanations.. I have been travelling for years and I have stayed at many places, but this definitely is the worst service I have ever encountered. I will definitely never go back there, although rooms and price/quality (disregarding service) are okay.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: karan33
Reviews.Content: Having read many bad reviews of this hotel I was getting worried about staying here. But I didn't need to worry. I was pleasently suprised. We did have to queue to check in but it was the same in all hotels. It didn't take too long. The hotel was very clean. Our room was big and had two queen size beds which were very comfy. Our towels and beds were changed and made everyday. Unfortunately our view from our room wasn't that nice but we were only sleeping there. In the hotel there were some places to eat. Our favourite was Roxy's Diner which was very good value for money. Friendly and helpful staff. Yes the hotel is at the bottom of the strip but it isn't that far. We walked a few times and it took about 15-20 minutes. If you dont want to walk, there is a bus stop right out side the hotel and one across the road from the hotel where you can get the deuce bus which goes up and down the strip. Be prepared to sit on the bus in busy times which is most of the time. Do have the right money for the bus they do not give change. $3 one way $7 for 24hours. I would stay in the stratosphere again as it was such a good price and it is a good hotel. The tower was excellent, the views are fantastic. It was quite nice going back to the hotel at night away from all the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable by Vegas standards, but excellent by UK standards!!”
Reviews.Author: poptart78
Reviews.Content: I always like to take note of where reviewers are from on Tripadvisor, as this can sometimes give a good indication of the standards they are used to in terms of hotels. Being from the UK, where most hotels are overpriced, and you can't even rely on the big expensive chain hotels to have clean, fully equipped rooms, my expectations might be lower than others!!!! This was the second time I'd stayed at the Strat, so I already knew what to expect in terms of rooms, service etc. The rooms are spacious and clean. We were given a room with an interconnecting door to the next room, which I was wary of as it can sometimes mean that your neighbours sound like they are actually in your room. I was right to be wary, as that night my husband and I were kept awake by what sounded like 2 hillbillies in the next room arguing about where they wanted to go on the strip.
