That, coupled with suspicious loud rodeo-style 'yeehas' and 'yeah babys' from across the hall prompted me to call the front desk and ask to move rooms. This was done quickly and efficiently. One of our favourite places to eat in Vegas is Roxy's Diner in the Strat. The portions are huge, the staff are friendly, and the 50's kitsch style of the place makes it a fab place to visit. I recommend the huge hotdogs! There are several other eateries in the hotel/casino including Lucky's cafe which is good for breakfast. There is a small shopping centre in the Strat which has a range of shops - good for gifts and the odd souveneir. In terms of a base to explore Vegas and the rest of the strip, you either need to be prepared to take cabs or public transport, or wear extremely comfortable shoes! I'm not a fan of public transport (translate - I'm lazy), so we got a lot of cabs. I noticed it was quite a bit more expensive than the previous time I'd visited, eg $10 to the Fashion Show mall. All in all, I enjoyed staying at the Stratosphere, rooms are of a better standard than most UK hotels and there are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops to keep you entertained. We paid a bargainous £17 per night to stay here, so it's hardly suprising, but some of the guests (most notably those staying in the room next door to ours and across the hall) are...well, 'different' to the type of guests you'd find in some of the better, mid-strip hotels. We are returning to Vegas in a few weeks and this time will be staying at Caesars to avoid paying for loads of cabs. The only downside to the Strat was the location - it's still a great Vegas hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a Strip hotel on a budget...just wear comfortable shoes!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: spiral_nic
Reviews.Content: got upgraded on arrival for 10 extra per night, this got us a premier upgrade and a king room with a separate lounge area with tv. hotel had no fridge or safe, but plenty of space and quiet. free entry to top of stratosphere. note, this hotel is the far end of the strip, bit of a walk to the other side with shopping centres etc

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: dsj019
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to anticipate on my first trip to Las Vegas. Stratosphere was a great cost effective hotel experience, The stratosphere had many great perks with staying there... one being you could go to the viewing tower unlimited times. One thing I did not like was the location and the proximity between it and the other big named hotels. Walking to other locations was not particularly easy. The rooms were always clean and well kept. A refrigerator would have been nice in the room.

Reviews.Title: “No clarity on entry fees to the tower”
Reviews.Author: cmv28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel as part of our tour itineary to las vegas and grand canyon. The stay at the hotel is very comfortable and there is no issue about the comfort. Only two points are on negative side 1) there is no coffee/tea maker in the room and for the same you have to come down to starbuck coffee shop and most of the time there is a queue at the coffee shop 2) There is no clarity about the entry fees to the tower block ,(part of the hotel only) some of my tour mates they went without any fees whereas i have paid the entry fees of aound $11 per person. Tourist who are staying here may please clarify before entering the tower block

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay, shame about the view”
Reviews.Author: Loulabelle44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Stratosphere in November 2009. The hotel is lovely, comfortable and modern. The check-in was swift and efficient. We only had to wait a few minutes. We paid extra for a strip view room, but I would advise against this. The room did have a strip view, but only if you looked out to your right. If you looked out dead ahead, you view was actually of one of the Tower's legs. It was OK, but a little disappointing. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. The whole casino was clean, spacious and well laid-out. We used the Back Alley Bar to watch football on Sunday afternoon, and the service was pretty terrible. The waitress was standing chatting to a large group, without even bothering to look around to see if anyone else needed service (we were pretty much the only other people in there). My husband tried to get served at the bar, and still waited ages even though the bartender wasn't serving anyone else. As others have said, the location is not that great, being at the far north of the Strip. One morning we decided to stroll to the main part of the Strip, and it took about 30mins to get to Treasure Island. The room was a pretty decent rate, and unlimited admission to the Tower was included, which we used a couple of times and would throughly recommend, even if you're not staying at the Strat. All in all, for the price we paid, the hotel was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a nice cheap Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Minniebrad
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere was everything we had hoped, providing nice clean cheap accommodation for our group while in Vegas. The rooms were big enough, basic but everything you need, after all we didnt spend too much time in the room. Loved the casino itself. Played for hours and hours at the blackjack tables. The buffet was pretty crappy. From memory i think it was around $20pp. We later went to Rio's buffet and for about $25pp it was a much better option with some of the best food we ate while in the USA. While the location is a bit far away from all the action, we had a rental car which made getting around easy and the free parking service was very easily accessed. All in all we would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Vivaa Las vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: GemmaCaine
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, right at the top of the strip but still a good place to stay! :D good photo opportunities at the top of the whole strip! :D

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad & the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Pnwgurl
Reviews.Content: First off I tried to book a room on the web site & it was broken. So I made my reservation on line. When I arrived the line at the desk was a mile long. It was like that the whole stay. You could never talk to a real person without being in line 45 minutes. I booked a larger room but it was just normal hotel size. No coffee maker in the roo and they charged me for a small fridge . One of the reasons I booked this hotel was the 24 hour room service. So I called them the first nite. After being on hold for 20 minutes I was told there is no room service because of a remodel in the kitchen. They sent me to luckys dowstairs and it was $20 for a sandwich. When I asked for extra towels in the hall from the housekeeper I got the third degree. I had dinner at the tower one night and it was $200 for two ppl. When I made reservations she said the cost would be $30 each. Granted the dinner was good it wad not 5 star. More Like something you would get at the Buffett. Over all the bed was comforable but you can't sleep because they vacuum the halls 24/7.Oh one last thing. I went to printy boarding pass and they wanted to charge me $5.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: A Brit from SE Kent, UK
Reviews.Title: “Friendly Reception staff......Clean Hotel......BUT OH, SO NOISY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jegs21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 14 nights (Yes 14 !!) The reception/concierge staff were always very helpful and polite, but many of the casino dealers were very aggressive and rude. Our room on the 23rd Floor was of a good standard, always clean and neat. BUT.....................................................THE NOISE WAS INCESSANT. Notwithstanding the casino noise, which I accept is inevitable, the continuous music wherever we went, was played at a very high volume, even at the swimming pool on the 8th Floor. We complained on several occasions and were told that the volume was pre-set and could not be altered. Even at night we were woken every night by the train hooter about 0100 & 0200 hours and we were on the 23rd Floor !! The Buffet is very good value as is Lucky's Restaurant. If you go down The Strip, make sure you visit O'SHEA'S Bar....Cheapest Beer in Town and the Best Bar Staff !! All in All.......An Experience......Not what we really expected....But Hey....We've been there, done it and even got the T Shirt now !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, We Had a Blast for a Small Price”
Reviews.Author: chellecali
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to Vegas to have my wedding ring repaired by our jeweler. We live in SoCal, so Vegas is kind of a regular trip for us. Usually, we stay on the Strip at the Bellagio or MGM. This time, with a specific reason for the trip, we chose the Stratosphere based on price and proximity to our jeweler. Neither of us had ever been to the Stratosphere, let alone stayed there. This was our first experience. On arrival, the self-parking was so easy and accessible. We checked in for our 3 night stay at about 11pm on a Wednesday night. We were upgraded from a standard room to a room on a higher level with a clear view of the Strip for about $20 more. Our room on the the 23rd Floor was nothing special, but the beds were comfy and the view was excellent. No mini-bar or fridge. Very old-school, tube TV with limited channels. But we weren't there for TV-watching. We gambled at the Stratosphere on the VERY LOOSE $1 slots and came away with more than $1000.00. Also, across the street and down a block, we played $1 blackjack at the Sahara and also won a good deal of money there as well. It's nice to NOT have to bet at least $25 a hand, even though we did that at a $1 table. We stayed at that table for no less than 6 hours on the first day and 8 the next. We walked back to the Stratosphere with more money in our pockets than we started with. The only bad thing about the Stratosphere was that there was no room service available during the time we stayed. That's a definite downer. Otherwise, when we're going to Vegas just to gamble and NOT LOSE OUR BUTTS, we'll definitely stay at the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY stay FAR AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: hotchick3
Reviews.Content: Excited about a trip to Vegas, well don't pick this hotel the WORST! Stay in your car if you have to, at least you know if it's clean or not. We swtiched rooms four times, I was exhausted from packing and unpacking so many times. Once we got settled into our room # 4, we realized we had bed bugs. The room was already paid for, so nothing we could do except spend more money to stay somewhere else. They offered us free drinks at the BAR, LA DEE DAH! The staff is horrible and so rude. The only people that were even friendly at all were the Bellhops and the Guy who puts you into a cab. What does that say?

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Lucia78KC
Reviews.Content: My brother checked into Stratosphere for his wedding. I was with him and his fiance and the first problem he had was the price of the room. They had reserved on-line and paid for two nights but they were told they had only paid for one. We all went up to the room to drop off luggage and the room was dirty. They had large stains on the carpet and so-called jacuzzi looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Then, they asked for a room with a view and what they got was a view of parking garage. The "happy couple" decided to cancel the room and went down to the desk to get a refund and the staff didn't seem to care one bit and didn't try to make things right. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Blueberry79
Reviews.Content: Spent about 10 hours here... used a coupon from travel flyer picked up at restaurant. Clean, quiet, comfortable, safe and reasonable priced place to sleep. Everything worked, was clean and was bigger than expected.

Reviews.Title: “awful downmarket hotel in worst location in vegas with terrible service and staff who couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: drsgbaker
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. We arrived late (around 10pm) but even then had to wait half an hour to check in. When we finally got to a receptionist she advised that we had been upgraded. Having reserved a room with a king bed or 2 queens we werent quite sure what to expect. However, when we got to our room we discovered we had been allocated a dreadful room. It had a really odd layout; the lounge area was bigger than the sleeping area and the two were separated with a wall which blocked out most of the light from the one small window. To add insult to injury the bed was a standard double and they had left a pull out bed in the lounge area. We asked for the pull out to be moved immediately as it took up so much space and it was still there an hour later - when we called down to again we were told it would be in the next hour - this was at 11.35pm so we told them the next five minutes or not to bother - we were just on the point of moving it into the corridor ourselves some 20 minutes later when someone finally came to take it away. To top it all off we were right next to the lift shaft and, being Vegas, we could hear the lifts all night. We had gone straight downstairs to complain when we were first shown the room but received a none to helpful or friendly response - the long & short of it being they were full so we could put up and shut up and try again the next morning to see if we could be moved. When we asked what was "upgrade" about that particular room we were told it was the view. Our view from our less than big window was the car park. The following morning we went downstairs at 10pm to see if there was another room available (on the way we could see just how awful our room was compared to others which were much more spacious, had king or 2 queen beds and big picture windows) and were told this would be possible but that they could not give us the room number until 12 noon. We were only in Vegas for 4 days and frankly did not want to spend half a day waiting around in the hotel but seemingly had little choice so we went to the pool area. The staff there were just as indifferent to their guests and made no show of hiding their boredom. There was nothing attractive about the pool area - all flat hard concrete with nothing to soften the edges (no planting nothing, just sunbeds and the pool and very little shade with only a few umbrellas). On top of this they had R & B blaring from the speakers situated all around the pool - this was so loud that it drowned out my ipod. It was the straw that broke the camel's back and after 15 minutes i went down to research alternative accommodation on the internet. When we went to check out 1/2 an hour later the reception made it clear that they really couldnt have cared less. I've since written to the hotel to complain and not even received a response. The only plus point? The door staff - they were totally charming and polite - a complete contrast to the reception staff who really couldnt give a damn - they could certainly learn a few lessons from them. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend!”
Reviews.Author: ValentinaB1
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel and restaurant on top of tower! Big and clean room with beautiful view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: infectbnl
Reviews.Content: If you travel on budget and would like to visit Vegas properly (staying in a major casino) I think you'd like the hotel. Its location is just next to the old town and not far away from the strip. You get a free ticket to visit the panorama floor and if you are brave enough I think you get a discount for the rides on the top of the sphere. Room was nice, did not spend much time in there :).

Reviews.Title: “cheap lodging nothing more”
Reviews.Author: NYSjonny
Reviews.Content: I had great expectations for the hotel and the view above was indeed spectacular in the tower. Our hotel room as all the rooms were in a seperate bloc and as such did not have a nice view. The hotel is located on the other end of the strip in a neighborhood that was not as inviting as for example the MGM neighborhood. The room was a bit run down and we have the feeling that it was once a big thing - the attractions on the top of the hotel - but that that time is gone. The bar in the casino was just not lounge enough and felt cold without atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino!”
Reviews.Author: SabarishR
Reviews.Content: It's got some of the cheapest tables on the strip - with $5 minimum bets on let it ride and roulette and other card games. Very useful for those new to casinos and those who dont want to lose all their money too quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Northern Strip”
Reviews.Author: CTFoodCritic
Reviews.Content: If you want to be right in the thick of things, this isn't the place for you. We, however, didn't want to be. A great smaller hotel and everyone who worked there was simply wonderful. The service level was extraordinary, and I'm hard to please as I work in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYTRAVELLERS55_9
Reviews.Content: Good quality rooms, normal Vegas Casino facilities, about 20 minutes walk to centre of strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and still as good as the last time”
Reviews.Author: divajules
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel was in Jan 2005, when I travelled to Las Vegas by myself and I'm please to say returning 4 years later the standards have not slipped. This hotel is out of the hussle and bussle of the main attractions of the strip, however for the price and quality I don't think anything anywhere else can beat it. If you are someone that wants a decent place to stay and not pay over the odds then this is the place for you. The pool area is great, the choice of food places is great and you'll find that the prices are slightly cheaper than that of other hotels. This time I took my friend and to be honest we didn't mind the walk to the main part of the strip, as it allowed us to view other parts of the strip that you may not bother to go to when you have everything to hand with the hotels that are located centrally. There are shops close by and an internet cafe across the road. Taxis are cheap and not too far from this hotel there is a large shopping outlet, which you will need a taxi to get to. Since 2005 they have created a mono-rail, so if you don't want to take taxis and plan to do several stops on the strip this is a great way to travel. With the exchange rate falling, things are becoming slightly expensive, however still cheaper then the UK. A dinner buffet in most hotels will cost you aboout $22 p/p, however the Stratosphere does a meal deal where you can have a buffett breakfast, lunch and dinner for a set price and if you are a quest you do get a discount on the buffett prices. We spent a lot of time at the pool area during the day and the barman certainly kept us amused. The bar offers snack food which is great if you want a quick bite. Overall this is a great place to stay not only if you are on a budget but if you'd rather splash out in the casino then on your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “The view has gone”
Reviews.Author: Hans_JGB
Reviews.Content: We did stay here the last night of our trip to this part of the US. The rooms were good, service was fine. The shopping area was a little outdated, quite odd simple shops actually, not what you would expect. The stay included unlimited number of trips up the tower for the view of the Vegas Strip. I realised that the construction in progress a little down the Strip will eventually ruine the nights' view from this tower. Its unique selling point will at some stage be gone, when they continue to built up this high in front of the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great value”
Reviews.Author: jifae
Reviews.Content: My wife and I from Scotland spent four days at the Stratosphere Hotel in June 2009 and from the Car Valet to Reception the welcome was helpful and friendly. The Room on the 17th floor was adequate with a large comfortable bed, and clean linens with good pillows, and fine towels. The facilities were good and swimming pool large and well equipped. The Buffet was as good as you wil get in most Las Vegas Hotels and was execellent value whatever time of day you chose to dine and special prices were on offer. The Tower Restaurant was just a wonderful experience and the service was second to none with the Manager paying all guests a table visit and chat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Clean rooms, grotty area”
Reviews.Author: Tractorfactor
Reviews.Content: All in all a very good stay this hotel isnt in the best area to be honest but in saying that we had no problems ihop and dennys just yards away monorail at the sahara about a 10 min walk roxy's diner is a must, they do a great roast beef duece stops just outside for either downtown freemont st (5 min bus ride) or you can catch the 108 bus to the fashion outlet mall as well rooms were very clean and sheets changed towels etc changed no complaint there luckys cafe open 24 hours and u get free admission to the tower as well all in all a very good hotel if u dont mind being that end of the strip i found the best nightlife downtown anyway to be honest freemont street is a must !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manja009
Reviews.Content: I sayed in Stratosphere hotel for 3 nights and the room was great. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. If you stay in this hotel you also get free entrance to a Stratosphere tower, where you can enjoy panoramic view and take a ride....Insanity is the best :)

Reviews.Title: “What a great value! Best Price for a really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelchecker13
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend at the Stratosphere hotel. This wasn't my first stay, I went there with my family several times. Every stay was simply GREAT! I really love the value you get in this hotel. Okay, it isn't in the "heart of the Strip" but you can get there very fast. We had a very spacious, clean room and paid only $40 per night! This is an amazing deal! Furthermore, we ate at the "Top of the world restaurant" which was an amazing experience!! We loved, loved the view over the whole city and the food was great! The service was brilliant and the staff very friendly!! If you stay at the Stratosphere don't miss the restaurant and the bar on top of the tower! Try to make reservations, it can get really crowded, especially on the weekends. We really liked the pool, it offers sunbeds and also towels for the guests. Even if not located in the middle of the strip, Stratosphere is a really nice location to spend your Vegas expirience. Why not saving a little money on accomodation and spend the saved money on gambling or nightlife? Stay at the Stratosphere, it's a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the parking garage scam”
Reviews.Author: jpad138593
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere Casino and Hotel nov 6 & 7th 2009 and found the place very nice except the parking situation . Parked in the wrong area which had no gates blocking it and my vehicle was booted and 3 large security guards forced me to withdraw $100 cash to have it removed , I felt extorted and reported it ti the Gaming Commission and in the future I will be staying downtown where the appreciate longtime customers . Joseph Padilla Flagstaff , AZ

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times”
Reviews.Author: FreakyKitties
Reviews.Content: If you like bright lights and excitement within an elevators ride but a nice quiet room, this is the place to go :)

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE”
Reviews.Author: borisgoodonov
Reviews.Content: It is important to note that I was a VIP guest as the result of accumulating so many points on previous visit. Antiquated hardware throughout The free suite I was given was adequate but the toilet ran after flushing unless you jiggle the handle or remove the toilet cover and go inside the tank. Peeling paint in the toilet area. This was in a suite. Housekeeping Ridiculous how do you sleep in? Housekeeping is a very efficient operation here. Efficient to the point of discomfort. If you hang the do not disturb sign on your door they will call you that morning at about 1000 hrs to ask you when they can clean your room. YES, they will call between 10 o'clock and 11 o'clock to wake you up to ask when they can clean. There seems to be no designated cleaning time as they show up sometimes as late as 2 o'clock in the afternoon. So you can get up and go out and come back in the afternoon and your room is just as you left it in the morning. Room Service Definitely a hit or miss proposition. Sometimes they get it right and sometimes they don't. What is funny is after they get it wrong and they realize it they will call and ask you if everything is okay. They never call under normal circumstances only if they check and realize they forgot something you asked for. This is the ghetto/hood of hotels in Vegas as the result of this some people will be suspect of you. Do not be surprised if you are insulted by someone who works there until you identify yourself as a paying guest. You can assume the cocktail waitresses and the bellmen have been burned numerous times before by the hood element/low roller contingent that permeates this hotel as they treat you like a suspect not a guest until you tip them. Do not bother complaining about anything as I can most certainly tell you that you will be blown off. It gets to the point where you just get tired of asking for the same thing over and over again so you stop asking. I guess this is the strategy they wear you down. Fitness Center Do not waste your time They give a lot of points but when you order from their gift catalog ignore the pictures as you will not get what is depicted in the picture. You will receive a product but not what is depicted in the photo. Not worth the shabby treatment. I would rather spend my money someplace where they make you feel welcome. Keep in mind I have VIP/High Roller status here so I got the best of what they had to offer for free and it was still certainly not worth it. One more thing... complain about anything and you will very diplomatically be blown off

Reviews.Title: “on the edge of a dicey part of town, but cheap !”
Reviews.Author: JKD
Reviews.Content: we booked the stratosphere because we needed a one night stay before goinjg to Zion and Bryce. We knew that it was at the far end of the strip and hadn't planned to walk around, but we were still a bit taken aback by the area. It looks like lot of construction was planned, started and then stopped. Some locals mentioned that we shouldn't walk around at night because it is on the edge of the "bad part of time". (I still don't know what that means !) I imagine that since there aren't a lot of people walking around, the area might be a bit deserted and therefore provide opportunities for street crime. In any case, the room rate included complimentary tower admission. It was an outstanding view, but pretty scary. Then, we went to watch the rides on the roof. I don't ride roller coasters and the thought of dangling over the edge on two of the rides was not something that was remotely interesting. It was actually sort of frightening and entertaining at the same time, in a sick kind of way. But, several people seemed to be enjoying themselves, so I guess that's all that matters ! From all of my research, I have come to the conclusion that most of the name casinos have cheap rates for really bad rooms. To try to avoid that, we paid an extra $5 to get a deluxe room. The Stratosphere has taken to adding a $7.50 resort fee, probably so that they can low-ball the room rate for comparison purposes and then make it up in the resort fee. At least they stated it in the reservation, so I expected it. In any case, we pai $28 plus the resort fee and tax, so my expectations were at the motel 6 level. And, that's exactly what we got ! The room had been recarpeted, repainted and the furniture updated. Therefore, it was clean and neat enough. There was a small table and two chairs; the table was rickety and I was afraid it would break apart, but it didn't, The bathroom was dated - the tiles were lie Home Depot construction grade, some sort of cultured marble vanity top and old fixtures. The towels were thin and coarse. Overall, we knew about the poor location relative to the Strip, had low expectations and paid a little more to at least be able to sleep in a decent room. I would have to say that if you know what you are getting into, if you get a cheap rate, it's not too bad. Its location enabled us to quickly get on our way to Zion and Bryce.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BlizzGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights while attending a PubCon at the Las Vegas Convention Center. The hotel was easy to navigate, easy to find, and the staff was attentive and pleasant. Our room was neat and remodeled, with great beds and linens, we were extremely happy on the 7th floor of the Premium Elevator Tower (not sure what that was called.) The ONE downside to our stay was the "out of the way" location - they really need to extend the monorail system down to the Strat, it would make it the perfect conference hotel! We moved to the Luxor for the weekend after the conference and the rooms were not very clean, dirty streaks on the wallpaper and the carpet was gross - if you need to pick between the two, pick the Stratosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas trip”
Reviews.Author: BoydW
Reviews.Content: cheap, clean for what it was. I mean its Vegas. Ate breakfast at excalibur, buffet was small at strat.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: xyz10070
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the THE STRASTOSPHERE CASINO in Las Vegas and someone left a safety pin on the carpet in the room i was staying in. I accidently stepped on that pin & blood came out out of my foot..The casino did not want to pay for my medical bills much less compensate me for my injury. I would not recommend The Strastosphere Casino Hotel if you visit Las Vegas .

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, but I don't think I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ArtF3
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ok. Beds were comfortable. Smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming in the room (was supposed to be non smoking). Service was good. Casino was ok. Buffet was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but way too far from the action”
Reviews.Author: PDXbree
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel itself, the room was pretty and clean and did look recently remodeled. The only complaint I had was that it is such a distance from the rest of the strip that you had to take a cab to get anywhere which did make the low rate for the room not seem as low. Having never stayed here before I didn't think it looked THAT far from everything but once we tried walking we realized that in the middle of summer those couple of blocks to the Sahara to catch the monorail seem like 10 miles! I liked the hotel quite a bit, the casino was decent i just didn't care for the location. i wouldnt stay here again solely on that fact.

Reviews.Title: “The best in its class”
Reviews.Author: Philspain22
Reviews.Content: OK, so it is not the Venetian or Wynne, but we thought the Stratosphere was great. All the staff were fantastic, rooms good size and kept very clean. Lots of options to eat and with a bus stop right outside you are in the centre of the strip in 10mins and in Freemont street in 5! The pool area is good and the tower is amazing. One thing, this is NOT a quiet hotel. If you want a lobby to relax in, go elsewhere, but if you want great service, decent room with lots to do we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: zorey23
Reviews.Content: nice pool, great casion, nice restaurants, attractions at the top of main tower, not far from main hotels on strip

Reviews.Title: “Basically sound but deteriorating”
Reviews.Author: ukbod
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd visit to the Stratosphere just a couple of days this time. In a year there are some signs of a downward trend. The buffet while good value at $24.99 a day has gone down in quality and variety. It was amongst the best previously in my opinion. Our room upgrade never materialised and the one we received was very drab and dark and ill equipped compared to previous visits. The comps and cash backs have significantly reduced. The slots were much tighter. The staff were very helpful friendly and polite. Its position is now compromised having become a sleazy area at night and appreciably away from the main strip attractions. Very good value for money however and its acceptable for a short stay. Free gaming lessons in the morning and cheap tournament places always available. Use the Deuce Bus to travel the strip $7 / 24hr unlimited usage - goes right out to the Premium Mall at the opposite end of town,

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel and such a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: bladdered
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for five nights at the Stratosphere hotel in August. The hotel was friendly and clean and our room was spacious and well equipped. The staff were friendly and informative but didn't jump on you as soon as you walked through the door with your luggage, which was nice. I liked the fact that it was right at the end of the strip as we got the beauty of the whole strip by day and night when travelling along it. The only thing i wouldn't recommend is attempting walking the length of the strip in one go, as it is approx 6 miles each way!!! The buffet restaurant in the hotel was a bargain and served so many different dishes that even the fussiest of eaters would find something they enjoyed. I would definately stay at the Stratosphere again. A thoroughly enjoyable experience that i look forward to repeating!

Reviews.Title: “A Holiday Is What You Make It! Quit moaning over the little things and have fun!”
Reviews.Author: CSI_LILLY
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it was cheap and cheerful - away from the noise and bustle of the main hotels (about 3-4 miles up the strip), but also about the same distance to downtown! We went on 20th October for 2 weeks for my partner's birthday and it was fantastic! The staff were extremely friendly. Although is wasn't as glitz and glam as the major 'named hotels' - you're paying less than half the price and for a bargain accomodation which is very clean, topped up everyday with fresh towels, bed linen and tolietries. Freezing pool in October - hot jacuzzi though! Great Craps dealers and hostesses - never without a glass in your hand! All casinos in Vegas are smoking - this one is no different to the rest - if people want to moan about it, save your gambling for the airport is all I can say as that place is full of slots too for non smokers! $20 day all day buffet in the hotel, aswell as Denny's across the road which I would highly recommend for a wholesome breakfast ummmm... $7 deuce passes for all day bus travel - highly recommended! $15 dollars for a taxi to end of strip - if you pay more, give less tips! Go to Tix For Tonight for Half Price Show Tickets - never pay full and book the same day! Must try trips: Le Reve, Cirque De Soliel - fantastic show approx $80 each Marriage Can Be Murder - murder mystery dinner show $35 each Divas - transvetite impersonators $40 each CSI Experience $30 each - great for CSI fans Titanic Exhibit - $25 each Gondolas - $16 each - great if you like cheezy rides where they sing to you! Free Must See Shows: MGM Grand - Lion Habitat - anytime Flamingo - Flamingo wildlife habitat - anytime Bellagio - Fountains - after 3pm every hour on the hour Mirage - Volcano Erupts - 7.30pm and every 1hr 30 mins Treasure Island - Sirens TI - nightly Caesers Palace - War scene Wynn - waterfall show - daily Fantastic holiday not sure how much grand canyon and hoover dam trips were as we hired a car - but definately worth a visit! Whoever goes to this hotel, remember the important thing is to enjoy yourself - your holiday is what you make it! We loved every minute and hope you will too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Treated like a King!”
Reviews.Author: nevdestine
Reviews.Content: Customer service is everything and they understand it. The new management have turned this hotel/casino around. Excellant customer service. I stayed here last year and was not that impressed but I had 2 free nights so I decided to use them. From the telephone booking, to the free upgrade to the top floor when I checked in, to the free all day buffet(without asking for it by pit boss Brian Jacobs), to help making correct bets by pit boss Chuck, to Joel and Johnnie and the others teaching me how to play Crapless craps(a lot of fun), to Security directing me to great Tacos inside the hotel, to the Cabbie teaching me how to get down the strip by taxi without spending a fortune and how to get back without spending a fortune on taxis, to the great maids(the room was spotless). The bedding was very clean and extremly comfortable. Water pressure was a little low but it was in the morning. I gained 10 punds in 4 days. Great buffet. Great all you can eat tacos(real mexican tacos in the sports bar.) After checking in I did not leave the hotel/casino for 27 hours. It is right in the middle between the strip and downtown. Easy to get to both by bus or taxi. I took taxis. $8 to get to Ceasars if you take Industry road instead of the strip. Then get a Taxi at Imperial Palace to get back for next to nothing if they take the back street. A cabbie taught me this. The Casino was brightly lite and clean. The pool was open and great. There was a free full Gym but I did not get to use it. I would add some $3 dollar tables. I went downtown for that. Sometimes you just want to play for fun and not think about the bets. The property and parking structure had security on bikes with bright yellow shirts patrolling all day and night. I felt very safe walking around and leaving my car. I would keep Starbucks open 24 hours. They open at 5 am. Because of the time change I was up at 430 am. I asked Brain Jacobs where I could get a great cup of coffee. Without me asking, he walked over to the bar area and made sure I had a fresh cup of coffee. THAT IS CUSTOMER SERVICE! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “WHY such bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: MGale
Reviews.Content: I can't understand WHY the Stratosphere is getting such bad reviews..I didn't realize they had the rooms I'm reading about! My husband and I hit Vegas up every 6 months. This past July, we drove to Vegas from the east coast. We stopped over in Phoenix to see family, but our BIG destination was VEGAS! Everytime we come to Vegas, we always try to stay at the Stratosphere...(there's been 2 occasions we stayed elsewhere because PH was just a few bucks more per night...we do our gambling at Strat though!) We always stay in the premier tower and NEVER have any problems...we had adjoining rooms for 3 days with our teenagers and the window in their room was big enough to stand up in, not to mention the amazing view at night! I don't have a single complaint about this place. Housekeeping came by every day. Yeah, it's further down the strip..take the money you saved on the room and get rental car, take the duece or a cab...we chose to walk some days! Who wants to stay in a room when there's soooo much to see in Vegas?!? As far as safety is concerned, our vehicle stayed parked at the property the entire time. We went out to get things all hours of the night, and never felt threathened. There was almost always security patrolling the grounds..even on bicycles. No theft or damage to our vehicle or belongings. No need to feel unsafe :o) My teenagers loved the big shot and the observation deck. It was the very first thing they wanted to do when we checked in..they went up a second time at night before we left..what an amazing view!! The pool was nice..big towels were provided. We ate at Roxy's, Lucky's and a few breakfasts at McDonalds. We planned to eat at the Courtyard Buffett for one day, but the $20 all day deal is for players club members only. We called down before we went and they told us our kids could eat for the $20 per day as well..but that was untrue. They broke the too-good-to-be-true news to us when we went down there. My teenagers are so little, they wouldn't eat $20 worth of food in 2 days..so that wasn't too big a deal! Some of the shops were closed the past few times I was at the Strat. The casino has been one of the better ones to us. My hubby enjoys blackjack, while I'm a slot monkey. We always have a good time and there is never a shortage of cocktails if you TIP your waitress! All in all, the Stratosphere is middle of the road. It's not Planet Hollywood (Prostitute Hub) but it is safe, clean, comfortable and very affordable! We enjoyed our stay and have booked our next trip for March, which we will be staying again at the Stratosphere. It's gonna take more than a few bad reviews to keep me from staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: MaiA2
Reviews.Content: It was good for the price that I paid. Clean and close to airport and shopping Malls. I would recomand it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vegas - Awesome stay, but will go closer to the action next time”
Reviews.Author: SpeedChick21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strat for our honeymoon in Oct 09 and really enjoyed out stay. Didnt win a darn thing, but thats how it goes! We highly recommend Fellinini's Restaurant over Top of the World, prices are waaaaay better and the filet mignon was butter tender! AWESOME...the rides at the top of the Strat were great, Roxys Diner was awesome...Luckys was okay, service was slow. The room was very nice, large, we were on the 8th floor with a view of the casino roof, I think, and the strip. Recommend a higher floor. Pools were closed almost half our stay due to inclement weather (77 degrees???) lol...but were from MI so thats warm to us! The pools were nice though. Overall great stay...BUT next time were in Vegas we are staying somewhere mid-strip because it was ALOT of walking and a $25 taxi ride to the south end casinos. The duece is good though only $3 per person one way or $7 all day per person.

Reviews.Title: “las vegas vacation”
Reviews.Author: mrjphooley
Reviews.Content: first time in vegas,with the wife and my 14yr old daughter great holiday hotel very good ,very clean and tidy pool area great even the pool bar staff very good looked after you.even downstairs in the casino ,kids not allowed near tables and slots but my daughter never got asked to move.eating wise only 1 meal in hotel at luckys great meal,but for breakfast we went to dennys at the back of hotel or the ihop ,5 mins walk from the hotel both pretty cheap and coupons in the magazines you get everywhere for money off for meals.didnt try the buffet,not big eaters.traveling vegas go by deuce bus 3$ oneway or7$ 24hr pass ,taxis cheap but mount up stop start.did all the strip but found it seady in places with mexicans giving cards for girls to your hotels they hound you.even to women.did fremont street fantastic with the light show and the free shows,go to the california for something to eat,starter primerib dinner and a pudding for 7$ a person we went twice great value carnt go wrong.on the strip ti show was good then the fountains of belgegio and the volcano at mirage all free shows would recommend but their is always something going on on the strip great even for people watching,will go back to vegas in the near future but instead of getting a package holiday will just get flights and get accomidation when we get their because you can get great deals..on hotel rooms even for the 5 star hotel wynn and encore...mr j p hooley batley west yorkshire england....

Reviews.Title: “You get less than what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Enkephalyn
Reviews.Content: Old, worn, dark, depressing, odorous are the overall adjectives that come to mind when I think of that hotel. The worst part for us was the small, inconvenient window in the room. When checking in we were asked if we would like to pay $20 extra a night for "60 square feet" more room and free entrance to the tower. We were told it would also put us on the 21st floor versus the 8th floor. We paid the extra. Upon arrival to our room we immediately called the front desk and asked to have our room changed. We were unhappy with the small window and extremely claustrophobic feel of the room and the bathroom. (the bathroom was so small that the sink was in the living area) We were told by the front desk that all of the windows in the hotel are that size so moving would not make a difference. The next day we found we were blatantly lied to as we passed open rooms on the 8th floor that had large windows and much larger bathrooms. Luckily we were only staying 2 nights. There is no coffee pot in the room. The extremely tiny bathroom floor was sloped downward from age so that you feel dizzy when you are sitting on the toilet. As frequent travelers looking to find a deal, we have never ever stayed in a hotel of such poor quality. We planned on spending an entire day at the spa but seeing the quality of the hotel we decided against it.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: shellf1sh
Reviews.Content: for the price, it was a fairly decent hotel. the bed was clean and comfortable. the room was kept tidy though i'm having doubts with the carpet. we stayed in a premier room, a few bucks more than the most basic room. i don't think there's any difference with the basic room, the view perhaps? we had a view of the strip, or rather what's left of it coz we could see more of the obeservation tower. check-in was a breeze and staff was efficient and courteous. dining options were above-average and if those were not enough, they have a mall area at the tower with fastfood options. this hotel had a tour lobby which was great, as you don't have to wait outside of the hotel (like some) while waiting for your tour bus. you could also use the fitness center for free which i appreciate. all in all it was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “loved the stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: DianeMn
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas in early October and stayed 3 nights at the Stratosphere. I've been to Vegas alot and have stayed at various places such as Belagio, Imperial Palace, Flamingo, etc. Stayed at Stratospheret o save some money and wasn't dissapointed at all. Rooms very nice. Beds VERY comfortable. Stratosphere itself very nice, clean place to stay. We went up to the top of the needle which has a fantastic view of the city, went on one of the rides that dangle over the tower which was fun as well. As far as the location, it was fine. Definitely some walking to the main part of the strip, but enjoyed the walk. Close to the Sahara which has $1 blackjack which was fun. Our last day we bought an all day bus pass for $7 so was able to go to the far end of the strip (Mandalay Bay), then later at night took the bus downtown which is very quick from the Stratosphere. We didn't eat at the Stratosphere so can't comment on the restaurants there. Overall, no complaints about the hote/casino at all. Would definitely stay here again. The price was great.

Reviews.Title: “We checked out 2 hours after checking in!”
Reviews.Author: StEndas
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Las Vegas, to say myself and my girlfriend were excited about our trip would be an understatement. The fact that every ounce of that excitement was gone as soon as we stepped into The Stratosphere sums up how bad this hotel is. First of all, the location is atrocious. It's based in an extremely seedy area and there is a constant sense of danger. We counted 3 crime locations (based on the police tape) within 100 yards of the hotel entrance! It is also a 3 mile walk to the heart of the strip (The Bellagio, Caesars Palace etc.). Secondly, the smell is vile. As soon as we entred the casino/hotel lobby we both looked at each other as if to say "do you get that smell too?". When the elevator doors opened on our room floor, we both gagged at the smell that hit us. It's quite difficult to describe, but the best I can do is to say it smelt old and dingey. Thirdly, the room was useless. I drew back the curtains as soon as we entered the room, only to be faced by a 15 foot wall. There was absoutely no natural light whatsoever in the room. The smell also lurked in the room! We literally checked out 2 hours after checking in without even asking for a refund; we just wanted the hell out of there! We booked into the Paris hotel which was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Deakinfan
Reviews.Content: Loved it - not too tizzy, or "themed" beyond the boundaries of taste to witihn an inch of its life. Yes, it's right up one end of the Strip, but we liked this. Being away a little from all the hustle suited us just fine. If you are inclined you can walk the length of the Strip from the Stratosphere, or you can use the Deuce - a cheap bus that meanders slowly along. Our room was great - 22nd floor, great view, clean, very comfortable beds. All the staff were very frinedly, helpful and courteous. We ate in several different areas of the hotel as well as having room service on our first night and enjoyed them all. The buffet was great value with plenty of choice of food. The bar prices were very cheap compared to toher hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest ride !!!”
Reviews.Author: Fufulyn
Reviews.Content: nice rooms decent rates... Roller coaster on the top off Hotel/Casno Tower!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere,rooms good price for the value”
Reviews.Author: mslulu21
Reviews.Content: The service was great through out the hotel. I liked the free valet service which was convienent. The rooms were nice,clean, and surprisingly quiet. The beds were so comfortable I was pleasantly surprised and I booked through Orbitz and was surprised they gave me a nonsmoking room like I requested. The amenties such as iron, hair dryer, and room service came in handy. The pool was very relaxing but the drinks were kind of expensive. I wish that we would have gone to the happy hour in the Stratosphere all you can drink for $20. We paid that for two drinks at the pool bar. If you want to save money on food purchase an Ultimate Rewards card and eat breakfast/lunch/dinner for only $20. The location was near the end of the strip, we took a taxi ride which was convienently located in front of the Stratosphere and in five minutes we arrived at the Mirage/Treasure Island. It costs about $10 each way. Or you can walk about a mile if you want to save money. We choose to take the taxi to get us to the Mirage quickly, I had booked the Cirque De Solei Beatles Love show. The show is AMAZING, I will be going back again to see this. My husband and I aren't gamblers so I surprised him with a kayaking trip in Boulder City,Nevada. I booked this with the Boulder City Outfitters. We drove 45 minutes from the Stratosphere to The Hacienda Hotel where we were to meet our kayak tour guide. Boulder City Outfitters can also pick you up from your hotel in Las Vegas. We chose to meet there that way we could drive directly home. The kayak tour starts out at the base of Hoover Dam and is a 11 mile kayaking tour down Black Canyon. Our guide Scott was great ,had the best personality,and was very informative on kyaking and nature. He took us to different hot springs where you can sit and relax. This is an all day kayaking trip and I would not recommend driving a long distance afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: ParkLovers
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here, but the service and friendliness of the staff could not have been better. They offer nice perks for hotel guests with various discounts and trips to the tower. If you have any reason to visit the concierge, do so! They were fantastic. The only downside is that it is far from the other hotels on the strip. We stayed in three different hotels (Paris included) and this is our first choice when we come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Supergirl123
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 1 week in Vegas. It was my 2nd time to Vegas but first time at the Stratosphere Hotel - excellent value for money. The hotel is slightly away from the others on the strip but we took the Deuce Bus everyday to all the other hotels. $7 for 24 hr ticket. The bus stop is right outside the hotel and stops at every other strip hotel. We also took the Deuce to the Las Vegas Outlet Centre where you can pick up some nice bargains. It drops you off right outside. We also took it the Fremount St again it drops you right outside. When we checked in we asked for a room upgrade and received one to a bigger room for no extra fee. Hotel has lots going on and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: thomaszambra
Reviews.Content: stay in the stratosphere last week have to say rooms were cleaned every day and great value for money,staff were very friendly and helpfull would reccomend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Hotel and Tower”
Reviews.Author: NPT1975
Reviews.Content: Really fun and place to stay in. The tower is free when u stay in hotel. The shows r buy1 get 1. Nice casinos. BIG rooms and really comfortable bed. Nice bathroom with over sized tub. We did not have a view form our room, it was a concrete wall. TV, no refrigerator. There was alot of room for one. The hotel and casinps are really big so the signage is what helped through the place. Great restaurants. Gifts shops were really cheap. Check in and check out was ok. Really busy. Hotel is at northern end of strip so either there is a couple miles walk or a convienent bus u can take for a small fee. The tower and rides were amazing. The shows were unforgettable. If i were to stay in Vegas again I would stay here. Price was to our budget also. Nice east way to airport too. Valet parking and self parking was kinda confusing. But the staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: firsttrojan
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for a week in October. Great sized rooms, well maintained and cleaned to a good standard. We opted for a Delux Towe rView Room. It's worh a bit extra as you get a view of sorts. Excellent all day buffet at the hotel. For a special treat - Lunch at the revolving resturaunt on the 108th floor is a must. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Good range of eating and shopping outlets at the hotel. there were ony two negatives that we had relating to the hotel. 1. Very noisey (MUSAC) acroos whole pool area on the 8th floor. - Turn it down- or zone it please!!! Overpriced drinks at pool as well. The pool itself was lovely- but what a pity about the excessive noise. 2. Wi- Fi acces very overpriced at $11.95 a day. ( Walk up the street 100yard ad get it free at a local mote or Dinerl!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Here!”
Reviews.Author: littlerubiez
Reviews.Content: This was my second time visiting this hotel. For the price (29.00) a night, you can't beat it. I stayed there with my children ages 8 and 14 and they loved it. The hotel is off the strip, and you do have to either walk or catch a bus to get to the main part of the strip. The rooms were very clean, I was impressed that I saw all the decorative pillows and comforters being changed out daily. The front desk was more than helpful. When I checked in they gave me a ton of ideas of things to do in Vegas with kids. My check in went very fast. My kids enjoyed the rides at the top of the hotel, and the 24 hour McDonalds in the hotel was a godsend! The pool is nice, and it qas quiet. It's by no means the biggest most expansive bad boy pool in Vegas, but if you are there to lay out in the sun and get wet every once in awhile, it's perfect. Overall I have no complaints about this hotel. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryc82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for the first time this year following a friends recommendation. We have visited LV many times before staying at a range of hotels from Wynns on the strip to Vegas Club on Freemont Street but our stay at the Strat was the best stay ever, yes even better than Wynns. The atmosphere is fun (unlike Wynns) the suite we booked was fantastic . We enjoyed it so much we never left the casino and when we moved to another hotel later, we went back to this one as we enjoyed it so much. Don't worry about the negative reviews, this place is great value for money and good fun.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: Raime
Reviews.Content: Rooms not well maintained, desk not helpful, rooms not really cleaned daily. Stayed with kids and grandkids at this hotel and everyone wanted to leave. Went for a grandsons baseball tournament so 12 family's--none happy. Location is bad, not really safe to wander around after dark --lots of drunks etc. Absolutely no reason to stay at this hotel. Lots of much better options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - just some small issues”
Reviews.Author: niccuk
Reviews.Content: Booked the Stratosphere 6 months prior to arrival, tried to contact the hotel on several occasions beforehand but no-one wanted to deal with my quieries, asked for the front office manager email address but they wouldnt give it?????? 8 of us arrived at the hotel, the receptionist where very friendly and check in was very quick, and we all where put on the same floor. the staff at the buffett were excellent, maybe could have had more variety for breakfast food. we had dinner in top of the world restaurant, service was very good, main course let it down slighly, views from the top were excellent there were 8 of us all guys so plenty of drinking done, $60 a round, but the bar staff where NOT FRIENDLY, one of the guys kept giving us dirty looks and refused to serve us, maybe we should have tipped him more. aksed to speak to the manager but he refused to get him and told me to go to the reception if i wanted one. the bar was filled with prostitutes who would come over and ask if we would like fun, we didnt mind as we had a laugh and a joke with them. but what i found strange was that the bar staff seemed to be telling the girls who to go and talk to, maybe they knew the guys with the most money. IF MANAGMENT ARE READING PLEASE ADDRESS. service got that bad that we refused to drink in that bar of the hotel, we did find a local bar at the back of the strat, called dinos, very cheap and a fun bar with loads of friendly people luckys is good for food, the burger place is ok. i would head back to the strat, maybe if the bar staff got better. went to the superstars show, dont go it was terrible

Reviews.Title: “Fun get away”
Reviews.Author: mare723
Reviews.Content: We were out visiting family in the Las Vegas area and we always stay at the Stratosphere. We tend not to wander the Strip, been there done that, and wanted a hotel that we could relax in and really enjoy Las Vegas and it's beautiful desert. I love that there is ample parking and the hotel staff is always helpful. We had a problem with the TV remote not working, we thought it was maybe the batteries not working, but they came up w/a spare remote and a tech to see if there was something more with the TV. Once they realized it was actually the TV the tech quickly fixed it and was extremely courteous. We've never had a problem at the Stratosphere and will always stay here whenever we visit Las Vegas. The views at the top of the observation deck on the tower are fabulous! The city itself has many wonderful museums and parks, explore them you'll see that Las Vegas is an amazing destination.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Chapel in the Clouds-Top of the Stratosphere was PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: im_dawn
Reviews.Content: We got engaged in Las Vegas in May 2007 and decided to go to the Top of the Stratosphere to see the view of Las Vegas...it was AMAZING...it is just breathtaking up there (especially at night!) I said to my fiance, "I wonder if you could get married up here!" There it started....the planning process! We decided we wanted to get married at the Top of the Stratosphere in Las Vegas! So we did...23 family and friends ended up joining us on May 26th, 2009 and I wouldn't have changed it for anything it was just as I had pictured it =D The view was incredible-we LOVED IT! and our guests definately had not only a wedding they would never forget, but also a trip they would remember for the rest of their lives =) I will now break down my review of the Stratosphere...it is kind of complicated..overall I give it 5 stars-I almost don't want to give it an average rating at all, because at times they went above and beyond for me. For example we had 23 guests and their small chapel only seats 20 people-they upgraded us to the larger chapel for FREE...which I thank them from the bottom of my heart for..I just can't imagine 3 of our guests having to stand after flying from Michigan to Las Vegas to attend our wedding-so that was sooooooo nice of the Stratosphere to do for us!!! When we first started the planning process it was all through email, when you live in another state and you are getting married in Las Vegas....you have to do EVERYTHING through email...you kind of hope for a speedy response..sometime I would get a response the next day, sometimes it would take a week or more! Sometimes if I really needed an answer I would go over my wedding coordinator, who wasn't getting back to me, and send an email to person in charge of Chapel in the Clouds, because she ALWAYS got back to me either the same day or the next day =D Sooooo emails were kind of a pain, but once I figured out that contacting the person in charge (Adel) worked quicker...I contacted her with most of my questions =) Our Minister, Richard was the NICEST guy EVER!!!! We couldn't have picked a better Minister if we tried-the minute we met him, I just loved him! He was great and calmed any nervous feelings we had. He performed a beautiful ceremony and even posed with my grandma and her Elvis shades (I'm a big Elvis fan so all my relatives put on Elvis sunglasses/sideburns at the end of the ceremony to surprise me haha) Richard was a complete sweetheart and I can't thank him enough for making our ceremony so perfect! I wish I would have remembered to give him a big hug at the end of the ceremony. Our Stratosphere Photographer-she had a chip on her shoulder from go, not sure if she just didn't want to be there for the whole whopping 30 minutes she was paid to be there or what, but she was rude and not very pleasant to work with. (I'm not saying it was necessary, but I mean how hard is it to be nice for 30 minutes on people's wedding day!) She wouldn't let any of our relatives take any pictures with flashes on, therefore nobody who took pictures besides her pictures really turned out in the chapel. We were then rushed out of the Chapel and up to the Stratosphere Observation Deck, which is fine cause we were going up there anyways and she took some more pictures, however she managed to get the "No Smoking" sign in most of our pictures. However, I will say any attitude she had didn't bring us down one bit...Richard (the minister) the gorgeous chapel, and THE VIEW of Las Vegas...completely made up for her =D The next day we went to view our pictures and pick the ones for our package (we were to get (1) 8x10 and (3) 4x6's with our package) each additional picture was priced ridiculously high for example (1) 4x6 was $10 each! YIKES...we bought 9 more...so it was $96 and some cents with tax! Anyways our 8x10 was a beautiful picture of us on the observation deck overlooking the strip...with the "No Smoking" sign next to us and I asked if they could please crop out the "No Smoking" sign because I can't see that hanging on our wall with the sign you know...LOL and the woman told me that she wasn't sure...WHAT?! I could crop that out easy with Photo shop myself! Give me a break..anyways she told me she thought they could after a few minutes of looking at it, but that it would have to be shipped to us and that would be an additional $15 for shipping and handeling! I asked when she thought that would get to us and she said probably within 4 to 6 WEEKS! I was stunned...since the picture was supposed to come with our package that we were being charged an EXTRA $15 and it would take 4-6 weeks to get it! Geesh....anything to make a buck I guess... I'm REALLY glad we did the Las Vegas Strip Photo Tour with Toner Photography though for our wedding pictures...we would have only had a couple professional pictures if we went with Stratosphere pictures alone. YIKES! Overall I wouldn't have chose to get married ANYWHERE else in the world-the setting was perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbrokenn
Reviews.Content: it was my first time staying at the stratosphere hotel. it's way at the end of the las vegas strip, but it's not too shabby. it's a pretty hotel and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of walking”
Reviews.Author: SRPatro
Reviews.Content: Rebooked at the Stratosphere, from The Trump because the Trump didn't have a casino in it. I would never had known that had I not been reading a comment on Trip Advisor. If you stay at the Stratosphere you can go up to the observation desk for free. On the 2nd floor is a Mcdonalds. If you want coffee while getting ready in the morning, you will need to bring your own. The hotels don't provide a coffee maker and if you want a small refigerator, it will cost you $10.00 a day. Had we known how far the hotel was from everything, we would have bought a 3-day Monorail pass. Would have been cheaper. You can take the Deuce (bus) up and down the strip, plus downtown, but it stops frequently. There is an Ihop between the Stratosphere and the Sahara if you want a cheaper breakfast. The Grand Lux Cafe in the Palazzo is a sister cafe to the Cheesecake Factory. There are a couple of good restaurants for lunch, in the Flamingo Hotel that are reasonable. Don't miss the Titanic Exhibit in the Luxor. It will be there for 9 more years. You will see artifacts that were brought up from the ocean floor. Saw the Beatles Love show at the Mirage, The Jersey Boys at the Palazzo and Lance Burton at the Montel Carlo. The Jersey Boys is the number one rated show and it was the best show I think I have ever seen. If you see anymore shows, save this one for the last because no other show will come close to being so good. Next time we will stay at either the Flamingo or Paris since they are more centrally located. On yes, don't miss the fountain water shows at the Belliago. We never saw the same show twice.

Reviews.Title: “way more than i expected”
Reviews.Author: pinkkisses9498
Reviews.Content: i booked my room at the stratosphere 7 months in advance and paid for it in full. When i arrived i was told they had just given away the last room in the type i reserved but not to worry. they gave my husband and i a free upgrade which was great. we were there for our anniversary and on a tight budget. we had lunch at the Top Of The World and were treated to free champange since it was our anniverary. the stratasphere is a great hotel with outstanding emplyees. i don't have a single complaint and will be returning next year. we also won a little money off the slots there to they are not as tight as most of the others.

Reviews.Title: “I heart Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: checkin-chick84
Reviews.Content: Like many other people that have wrote reviews on here about the Stratosphere I was also very worried about what we were going to face when we eventually reached the hotel. But like everyone else we were pleasently surprised. We arrived 2 hours late (thanks Virgin) mid afternoon no queue at rception so checked in straight away needless to say it then took us 10mins just to find the right elevators (un beknown to me we'd booked a premium tower room) which had seperate lifts. Our room 04-11-18 (dont ask bout the way the room numbers work cos i still dont know!) was big with a huge king size bed which I must say was the comfiest ive ever slept on. Bathroom was also nice and big with a long vanity shelf for all my slap! Large window which even tho we didn get a great view was stil nice to get some las vegas sunshine. Room cleaned daily some days it wasnt cleaned til mid afternoon but at least it was still cleaned. Used both the pool on floor 8 and also the 'european' pool on floor 24 both pools fine tho the euro pool on floor 24 was quite difficult to find and once we were there it was free for women but my fiance had to pay 10%, dont think he was too chuffed! bewarned if ur going to the pool to relaxe quietly then sunbathe elsewhere once it hits midday the music by the pool is pretty loud but u get used to it. People are right the casino was a bit grubby and it did smell a bit but then smokings not been banned there yet so think thats the only reason I noticed the smell. Didnt really eat in the hotel except for the buffett breakfast which was awesome an quite reasonable ($13 all u can eat) Mcdonalds and Starbucks in hotel too. The main bar in the middle of casino did all u can drink cocktails daily between 4pm-8pm for $20 which we thought was quite good until one of the bar staff got our drinks wrong an we had to fight just to get it changed- they were the only staff that wernt so helpfull everyone else were amazing. Had one night of luxury eating at the Top of the World restaurant (which revolves) at the top of the tower. This restaurant is very pricey but well worth it (we spent about $200 for 2 courses) the view and food is phenomenal (we ordered gigantic 14oz steak). if ur going make a reservation the first day u get there as its very popular. we requested a table by the window which even tho we were told it wasnt guaranteed we managed to get one which really made the night. As for the location which seems to cause some concern for many people, it is at the end of the strip and it is in a slightly run down area but there was never a time I felt unsafe or uneasy whilst walking to or from the strat hotel. As for homeless people or beggars i dont actually remember seeing that many of them and even the ones we did see didnt bother us at all. The monorail is about a block away its jus round the coner from the Sahara, the only thing I would say is that if ur going to use it go thru the sahara to get to it rather than round the back entrance i felt more uneasy there than i did newhere near the strat. however i found that even just walking to the monorail was tough work (it was 107degrees when we were away) so if id had to walk further down the strip i prob would have passed out so i suppose i can kinda c why the location bothers some. we found it easier jus to get the Duece bus which stops just round the corner from the strat an wa sonly $7 for 24hours and it stops at every hotel along the strip. Some days it does take longer to get down the strip depending on day of the week/ volume of pasengers but it was jus too hot for us to walk a great distance! I would definatly recommend the stratosphere hotel to people looking for doing Vegas on the cheap, this was our first time in Vegas and i think if we'd stayed in a more central hotel it would have been too overwhelming.it definatly broke us in gently lol. However saying that i think next time we'll stay in a more central/luxurious hotel (ive got my eye on the MGM Grand) but would definatly go back to the Stratosphere if we were going to be Las Vegas regulars! ha ha. If uv booked and are worried then please dont cos the strat's fine for what u need it for, its clean with easy access to the strip. I love vegas so much that even tho weve booked to go to the Maldives for our honeymoon next year im trying to persuade my H2B to book vegas instead! ;) Definatly do the Top of the World restauant its pricey but worth it Dont try an walk from the strat hotel unless ur going in the winter

Reviews.Title: “would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: hayden23911
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was clean and had good service. It is off the strip but within walking distance to a monorail which will take you all the way to the other end of the strip. 72 hour monorail unlimited pass was only 30 bucks and well worth it. It also has a bus stop right outside the hotel to go to fremont which is awesome, fremont had $2 coronas and a great atmosphere. What the hotel lacked in location, it made up with the all you can drink deals it had from 4-8 daily for $20 bucks (martinis, margaritas, and draft beer only but still well worth it). The pool was nice and quiet which was nice cause you can party anywhere else in vegas obviously, the rooms were clean...there is a liquor store almost next door with good prices, only downside is the hotel doesnt give you a mini fridge in the room...you have to rent one for $5 bucks a day.

Reviews.Title: “25th Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: TerribleLadyT
Reviews.Content: The room was on the small size, the beds were comfortable. There was not much to do in the hotel itself. The hotel was at the end of the strip and I was not comfortable with the surrounding neighborhood. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A dump in the rough.”
Reviews.Author: squirrelslikenuts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husbands birthday. We normally stay at NYNY, but thought we would stay at the other end of the strip--just to check it out. Needless to say, it was a curiosity that was satisfied before we even reached the hotel. The hotel itself really wasn't that bad--an attempted room rejuvenation in 2005 (I believe) did little to cover the age of the hotel, though the bed was incredibly comfortable--so that was a plus. The gambling area smelled like your grandmothers basement, and actually felt muggy. All the blocks around the hotel looked like the projects, and to get back to our room at the end of the night we had to turn down approximately 15 requests for cigarettes and money from bums. The location and surroundings really have done this hotel in. It's too bad, it must have been a pretty nice place at one time.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than I imagined”
Reviews.Author: travelgurlNY
Reviews.Content: The location was at the far end of the strip. Not near the monorail so we had to take the bus which wasn't a problem but the concierge had us go across the street to catch the bus which landed us way far away from where we wanted to go. Long line to check in at 11 PM. Fire alarms going off in the middle of the night with no explanation or apology and rooms were not cleaned until 6 or 7 pm every night. Will never stay here again. Bellagio here I come!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun at a low cost”
Reviews.Author: jdtb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice if looking to have a good time at a low cost. The rides on top of the tower are great. The hotel itself is a bit far from the strip, but it is pretty cheap to get a cab. The rooms are clean. Great pool!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, off the main strip, showing its age.”
Reviews.Author: kami1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip together in twelve years. Having never been to Las Vegas before weren't completely sure what to expect. This hotel was very inexpensive so that is why we booked it. It is off the strip, but not that far. You can also ride the DEUCE bus for cheap up and down the strip from right outside the hotel, so don't let the fact it is off the strip deter you. The hotel was clean, but it is starting to show its age and there was alot of remodeling going on in the casino at the time. We paid to stay in a room above the 14th floor, but we ended up on the 5th floor. Also our second night there water began leaking from the ceiling in our room and we had to be moved to another room, also not on the 14th floor or above, and when asked about compension, we received only an apology. All in all, I would stay here again if you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay. Do not expect alot as far as the customer service goes though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenncy7373
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas many times before and always have stayed at the MGM, but my family were staying at the Circus Circus RV park, so we chose the Stratosphere for its location. Wow I liked it better than the MGM. Rooms are beautful, updated, (we were in the premium rooms, sound expensive but were only $48 a night!). Normal restarants that everyday people eat in, great pool area and loved the casino. Had a great time, and have already booked my next trip to Vegas with them in Dec.

Reviews.Title: “A Positive Experience on Three Separate Visits”
Reviews.Author: Carimakan77
Reviews.Content: This is rather a belated review and is submitted to dispel any feelings of apprehension which may be generated by some of the negative reviews of the hotel and its location. My friend and his wife recently booked a 10 night stay at the Stratosphere based on my recommendation and, after doing so, were somewhat perturbed by some of the reviews on the Trip Advisor Website. The number of negative reviews represents a fractional proportion of the vast number of guests who have stayed at this hotel and have had a very positive experience which includes my wife and myself on two separate visits and latterly a third visit with extended family. These visits were in March, 2007 (4 nights), June, 2007 (7 nights) and October, 2008 (8 nights). The hotel represents great value for money. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. There is a choice of restaurants/diners within the hotel and in particular The Courtyard Buffet which caters for breakfast, lunch and dinner and offers a wide choice of dishes to suit every taste and is very reasonably priced. The Champagne Brunch on a Sunday is not to be missed. You have immediate access to the Stratosphere Tower with its panoramic views of Las Vegas and The Strip in addition to the three "white knuckle" rides at the top of the tower - not for the faint-hearted. The location of the hotel is at the North end of The Strip but did not present any problem at all. The "Deuce" bus stops immediately outside the hotel and will take you up The Strip or alternatively to Downtown Las Vegas and Fremont Street. The light show at Fremont Street is not to be missed. You can buy two types of ticket on the bus - a one way ticket or a 24 hour pass. During our visit the one way ticket was $2 and the 24 hour pass was $5 although this will possibly have increased now. If you are moving up and down The Strip or to Fremont Street, the 24 hour pass is the one to buy. A big plus as regards the location of The Stratosphere is that you will not have a problem boarding the bus outside the hotel. As the run up The Strip progesses the bus gets busier and busier and if you were staying in a hotel in the centre of The Strip, boarding the bus is not so easy. The hotel has an open swimming pool which was fine but we only used this for an hour on one of our visits. If it is your intention to sit around at a swimmimg pool then Las Vegas is not the place for you. There is so much to see and do. Sitting around at a pool seems to defeat the purpose of coming to Las Vegas. Our first visit was for 4 nights which just wasn't sufficient and on returning home, we immediately booked for a further 7 nights some 12 weeks later.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: emup11
Reviews.Content: My review is based upon one nights stay, but boy what a night.
