Check in was simple and painless, we booked 3 rooms for my family and they were all modern, beautiful, clean with all the mod cons you would expect in a room. We didnt have much of a view, but we were told this when booking and agreed it was ok because we only paid $27 dollars a night per room. The beds were the most softest and comfy and l cant think of anything negative to say. The most awesome part is free admission to the tower, the views are amazing, my son was brave enough to pay the $12 to go on the ride at the top of the tower 1000ft above ground. Even though we were only there one night, l would certainly go back without any hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: snowflake74
Reviews.Content: When we booked our stay at the stratosphere I was a little apprehensive due to some of the reviews. We were pleasantly surprised from the moment we checked in to the time we left. We had split our vacation up between two properties and after we left the stratosphere and got to the other property (which was almost twice the cost) we were sorry we left. The service staff were wonderful. Everyone was friendly, helpful and courtious......from the staff at the check-in desk, to the bell hop, to the waitstaff, to the guy who gets your taxi......we have no complaints. They spent the time to explain the layout of the hotel, where we could find everything, what promotions were available, how to use the rewards card, etc. The room was very nice. Nothing elaborate, but clean and fresh. The bathrooms were very roomy with a lot of counter space (ladies!!) and the shower was wonderful. The buffet was reasonable, a nice selection of dishes, and the wait staff were always available. We didn't get to the italian restaurant but heard that it was very nice. The pool was a nice size and not overly crowded. There were always chairs available. There is no shade, however, unless you're lucky enough to get loungers with an umbrella, but who wants shade at a pool anyhow?! The casino floor was easy to navigate, and there was a nice selection of slot machines, tables for black jack, rouellette, etc. We went up to the top of the tower at night and the view was great! It 's free if you're staying there at the stratosphere. We went downtown one night, it only cost about $8 by taxi, and it was a lot of fun. The stratosphere is a bit out of the way being at the north end of the strip but if you're not looking for all that hustle and bustle everyday, it's worth it to stay there and spend a bit of money for monorail ride or the bus or even a taxi to take you to the strip if you want to go. It's a nice place to relax as well as to gamble without all the crowds. We plan on staying at the stratosphere the next time we go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking both the city and the hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerF09
Reviews.Content: although this hotel is a little off the strip, their prices are extremely good value. The choice of food was good and the staff extremely helpful. The crowning glory of this hotel though was the Stratosphere tower, especially at night, it's surreal to take in the grandeur of Las Vegas at a height of 1300 or so meters (if I remember correctly). would definetely recommend to a friend.......

Reviews.Title: “International Visitors Beware”
Reviews.Author: MackaVictoria
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Stratosphere early September. We are from Australia and booked our accomodation on line and payed by credit card. This was the last time we paid by credit card. When we arrived we paid cash for the remaining balance on the room and cash for all other purchases made during our stay. When we departed I phoned the desk just to make sure there was nothing outstanding. On our last credit card statement we received three separate charges from the Stratosphere totalling $144.77. We have no idea what these are for and I have now sent three e-mails over the past week asking for an explanation but have received nothing in reply. My recomendation is that if you are considering staying there, pay by some other means other then a credit card. I will now have to phone then to find out what these charges are which means I now incur another cost.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, Where do I start?”
Reviews.Author: ITop_CatI
Reviews.Content: Firstly Buyer beware, when you book a room online (In their words) "They do not garentee that you will get the room that you pay for, it is simply a request". Oh and i should note that when you book they make you paay for the first night upfront. We "requested" a King bed, non smoking strip view premier room. When we checked in they said "We are booked out of the king stripview premier non smoking', Instead they gave us a SMOKING Stripview room with 2 doubles. OMG!!!!! This room STUNK!!!! An Ashtray would have smealt better!!!, When we complained they didnt realy care, they basically said Tuff, take what your given. We will move you to the room you requested tomorrow. OMG Overall i was EXTREMLY Disapointed about our stay and will NEVER recomend this hotel to anyone! The only good thing was the pool i guess, oh wait i forgot... it closes at 7pm....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, much better than others in same ratings”
Reviews.Author: toakley2
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from staying 9 nights at the Stratosphere, and I must say after reading a lot of reviews, before going, I was hesitant. But dont be, checking in was very quick, we arrived on Monday afternoon. When getting to check in the girl was very helpful, and told us we could upgrade, which we did. Our room was on the 16th floor, bedroom plus lounge and fridge, with 2 windows overlooking the mountains, and that cost us an extra $200 for 9 nights, which I thought was very good, room very clean and maid came every day, we could not have been more pleased. We opted for the $19.99 all day buffet most days at hotel, and I must say the choice was endless, breakfast excellent, mid-day excellent, evening meal excellent and had an excellent carvery, with different cuts of roast beef, and turkey, what more could you ask for the money. The hotel is away from the main strip, but we opted for the Deuce bus, though a bit slow, for $7, you get 24 hour pass to ride on or off as many times as you like. And the bus stop is just outside the hotel. I would say the only down side to the hotel is the location, it is not in the best of areas, ok during the day, but be careful at night, there are some undesirables about. But it is nice to get away from the main strip, from all the crowds, and that is what you get staying at the Stratosphere for the money you pay it is could value, we know its not a five star hotel but its better than the hotels near by, Sahara and the Circus. Just one last thing I would say the staff and all the Americans we met where most helpful and polite, and should be proud, they made my wife and myself most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be called the CRAPosphere!”
Reviews.Author: holdinontomysoul
Reviews.Content: I reserved a "Romance suite with a view of the strip" two weeks prior to me staying here at the Stratosphere. Upon check in, the lady at the front desk informed us that the suite I had booked two weeks ago was not available and they had changed our room to a "Star Suite" instead. When we asked her what the difference between the two rooms were she told us the romance comes with an open tub to the living area and the star suite did not. We were in Vegas for our one year wedding anniversary so the open jacuzzi tub was our selling point on booking this suite. After explaining this to the lady, she went to speak with her manager and about ten minutes later comes back and tells us we are going to get a romance suite after all. GOOD. We were charged a $7.50 resort fee daily during our stay here, yet this place is nothing spectacular. We stayed on the 12th floor and had a view of the rooftop of the 11th floor. The carpeting in the hallways is old, and all bunched up in areas. The windows in the rooms do not open so you can not get any fresh air into your room. Our room was a large size but nothing spectacular. This is the only suite I have ever stayed in that came with plastic wrapped plastic cups! No glasses at all. The tub is seperated from the shower which was expected, but what was not expected was the mold inside and on the sides of both. Absolutely disgusting. My husband and I didn't even use the tub the entire stay because if there is mold all over it, it couldn't be very clean. The wall connected to the shower had been molding and rotting away to where there was a hole forming on side where the wall paper and dry wall were missing. The only good thing about this place was the room service. It was quick and not very expensive but my food arrived to my room nice and hot and tasted good. The location of this place is horrible as well. They fail to mention you are about a 2 mile hike to the general fun parts of the strip, be prepared to drive or catch the deuce if you plan on staying here and seeing the strip. It is across the street from Fun City Motel. Very classy! I've stayed at suites all over in Las Vegas and would recommend any of them compared to this Craposphere. For the $400 you will pay for a weekend here at the Stratosphere, you can book a nicer, cleaner, more conveniently located suite at either Palms Place, or The Signature Suites at the MGM. Both are very good values for your money. Don't waste it here!

Reviews.Title: “Moldy bathrooms, hidden charges, dirty carpets”
Reviews.Author: webco317
Reviews.Content: I guess for the cheap price on priceline.com I wasn't expecting too much, but I truly wasn't expecting a ton of mold around the bathtub, dirty carpets, and hidden "RESORT" charges for this dump. The casino is pretty nice, but the hotel portion is a dump. There was construction and we had no hot water from noon-2pm during my stay. The only view I had out of the window was of construction. I wasn't made aware until after I got home that I had access to a free ride up the tower. No one told me this, and everything I read said it was $15. I would avoid this hotel and go to the tropicana instead. The other complaint I have is that I purchased an all you can eat buffet for $20 a day which was a great deal except for the fact that they had 250-300 degree pancake syrup on the buffet. I got a drop on my finger and ended up with a third degree burn. Several other people were burnt on the buffet as well.. Even after paying the $8 a night resort fee, they wanted an additional $12 for me to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A clean value no-frill hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meli_Montreal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Pirceline and paid only $40 for one night. At first, I was worried about the quality of the hotel, since it is only a 3-star hotel. However, my view changed when I checked into this hotel. The hotel is very clean, which is a big plus for me. The price is very good as well. The restaurants / food options at this hotel are better and cheaper than Treasure Island I've stayed at. There are couple of things everyone should be aware of: 1) Location: it is a little bit far from the strip. If you don't mind taking the deuce, it should not be too costly to get to the strip. 2) Booking surcharge: when I checked in, they told me that there is an additional $7 daily surcharge for using the gym and the swimming pool. I know that Treasure Island also charge a surcharge to use these facilities. However, Treasure Island DID NOT force people to pay this, whereas the surcharge at Stratosphere is obligatory. On the other hand, there is a very nice outdoor swimming pool that is available at the hotel. Overall, I might not stay at Stratosphere again. Even though the price was reasonable, after the daily surcharge and my taxi fare to get to the strip, it is not much cheaper than other options on the strip. If you plan to stay at the hotel and use all the fitness facilities, it might worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been 4 stars if not for the Resort Fee!”
Reviews.Author: ChgotoCancun
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is not in a good location. We wanted to walk around a little (not go to far) and see what was around the hotel, but nothing was. We could walk to Denny's and that was about it. If we kept walking, we could have walked to the Sahara, but turned around first. The area is a little sketchy. Our room was a premiere room and we only paid $29 a nite for 4 nites. Then, they add a $7.50 a day resort fee. For what? For nothing we used. This is just a way to lure you in for a great price and then just add a fee, in which you have no choice but to pay. Our room was comfy and clean. Our view was of the parking lot (which we could hear clearly car alarms going off). We were on the 14th floor. Again for the price, not too bad. We did not gamble in the Casino, but it was never smokey or loud. We didn't have to walk all the way through the casino to get to the elevator, which was nice. The bathroom was sort of remodeled. The tile around the tub looked new, but the faucet was original. The counter was Corian and plenty of space, but the flooring was original. We got body lotion, shower gel, hand soap, shampoo and conditioner, all of which smelled great. The parking was adequate and free. No problem finding a spot near the parking elevator. Check in was fast and service friendly. Elevators plenty and quick. Good signage throughout. There were cute shops and eating establishments (McDonalds) on the 2nd floor. All in all, the hotel was pretty much what we expected. The room was nice, the location not so nice. The pool was nice, but not worth the $7.50 resort fee. I would recommend the Stratosphere if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and feel it's excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: LeelaKed
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Stratosphere Hotel & Casino. I don't go on holiday to make judgement on the hotel as I spent 85% of my time visiting the resorts rather than hanging out in the room and not taking advantage of the country i'm visiting, but I have to say that this hotel is brilliant and excellent value for money. There is no illusions of grandeur here; there rooms are basic and kept clean every day. The staff are friendly and helpful. The facilities at this hotel are great - there is a pool and gym to use, which I didn't take advantage this time. Staying at the hotel meant you get discounts for the tower and rides as well as the shows. There are several restaurants in the hotel, which meet all different tastes. My particular favourite is Roxy's Diner which is a 60's style diner and the very talented staff sing to you. The hotel is walking distance from a few hotels at the top of the strip and about 10 minutes in taxi from Fremont Street. I would say that it is perfectly situated because it's away from the heart of the strip and a lot quieter. I'd definately recomment this hotel and those who have gone on my advice have really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: nadodiganesh
Reviews.Content: I used the casino in here and the room just to sleep and wash. The view from the top is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Grat hotel/casino at the end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: af01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when visiting Las Vegas. We chose a "Romance Suite" on the 26th floor, the room was big, the bathroom even bigger, and the jacuzzi opening up into the living area was a nice touch. We had a view to the tower and part of the strip. One thing, that really wasn't that romantic was the thin foldable wall into the bathroom. You could hear EVERYTHING when someone was in the bathroom, really - I don't want that, especially not in a romantic suite. The hotel in general is old (from Las Vegas standards), I think it's from the 90-ties. It could use a freshen up, but the style is ok and it offers a good value for money. We had lots of fun in the casino, the service was good and we really didn't miss anything. We had dinner at Top of the world, I can recommend that. The view is spectacular, overlooking Las Vegas and The Strip. The food and service was great. After that we took a trip to the roof, the rides are incredible - we stayed on the observation deck, that was just enough for us :-)

Reviews.Title: “stuck in 1972”
Reviews.Author: africanfrog
Reviews.Content: booked a suite at the stratosphere, based on internet reviews and pictures... rate was great so i guess beggers cant be choosers, but room was straight out of a bad B gangster movie, the smell was terrible, and the view... on the parking lot despite being on the 18th floor. beware when you prepay on line, they still hit you with a tourism tax upon arrival... we checked out, now at the Terrible's clean, cheap and super friendly!. one more thing, the restaurent on the top of the tower is way over rated and hyper expensive. 180 USD for 2 for your basic meat and potatoes and a couple of glasses of wine.... view is great, but you get the same with a cocktail at the lounge.... oh, and also wifi access is 11USD... free at the terrible's...

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CasBenit
Reviews.Content: Clean basic Las Vegas hotel - no frills. Free entry to the Stratosphere tower. Located at the end of the Strip - main casinos and attractions not within walking(< 15 min) distance. The monorail however is a good option and starts at the Sahara Casino across the street (USD 13 for one day unlimited use). WiFi 12 dollars for 24hrs. Fast check-in and check-out. Free parking, noisy aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: MickeyR74
Reviews.Content: Can't praise the Stratosphere enough! From the check in service to the room cleanliness I could find no fault with this hotel. We paid about £27 per night for 5 nights in September and on arrival they didn't have two non-smoking king rooms together, so they gave us a free upgrade! The pool area was spotless, the guest relations desk were great. I'd recommend making as much use of the concierge as possible. We had questions for them every day and they were incredibly helpful and even booked a tour for us. The buffet is excellent value for money but one tip - get a rewards card as soon as you get there. You get a 25% discount in the buffet restaurant and it's definitley worth it. We ate there every morning and on three days we ate there in the evening too. For $19.99 you can eat there unlimited all day. Stratosphere offers a brunch buffet so don't be surprised to find spaghetti bolognese on offer for breakfast! Service in the restaurant is excellent and I recommend a visit to Roxy's Diner, on the casino floor. Great food (again, better value if you have your rewards card) and the servers even sing classic hits for you!! I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel not so good location”
Reviews.Author: cami1684
Reviews.Content: if you want to go to Las Vegas and stay on the strip you have to know that this hotel is at the end of the strip. it is a good and clean hotel with big rooms . it has an incredible restaurant at the top of the tower and many attractions. Also they have organized good shows cabaret and of course dont miss elvis presley. the swiming pool is great and it has also a jacuzzi. good luck

Reviews.Title: “Stratospere Excels After Hotels.com Screwup”
Reviews.Author: chitown2bayarea
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Stratosphere exhausted after a drive from Napa and tried to check-in. I was told that hotels.com messed up the reservation and made it for the following day. I was then told the rate was much higher for that night, which erked me but I kept my cool (cant say the same for my sisters crazy friend), and the front desk agent brought the MOD (Christopher) out to talk to me. He wa very personable and professional, and so was the front desk girl who helped us at first (never got her name but she was from Hawaii and also very cute), so I decided to stay. Anthony the bell-hop, who was also very nice, showed us to our room which had an awesome view of Vegas. The next day I went to the pool and was very impresed. There is a topless pool on location as well, but it is a pain to get to and the only girls that I seen topless weren't worth the time to make it up there. Parking is a pain but thats what valet is for. Overall a very noce hotel. Thank you to all who made my stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, a little far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: mlonetto
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights and it was great, the hotel is huge and the rooms are great. The area near the pool is cool and we have fun there. There is a fitness center and lots of shops on the 2nd floor. Everybody is really nice. The only problem is that the hotel is far from the strip, a car is needed to move and visit Las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “a room without a view”
Reviews.Author: costalmeida
Reviews.Content: we chose the romantic suite so we could stay at the hotel and spend our days resting into the room. But our room was on the 6th floor, and had no view... all we could see was a white wall and a ceiling... even after asking for changing, they kept us in the same room...

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: anon24
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from Veges after spending a week there and staying at the Stratosphere for most of our stay....... after reading all of the reviews we were expecting the worst.... however it was fine, in fact more than fine. We got a very cheap deal for our 6 night stay, our room was on the 17th floor, it was clean, spacious and quiet. The hotel had efficeint check in staff, helpful conceige and was generally a nice place to stay. The hotel has 2 swimming pools 1 on level 8 which is nice, and then 1 on level 24 - now this one is free for ladies to get in and gents have to pay..... it took us a while to figure out why... its a topless area to sunbathe!! oh also Roxys diner does the best milkshakes....... we also ate at the top of the world restaurant at the top of the stratosphere tower, it was pricey but very good food and the views of vegas were fabulous. Location..... ok so yes you are right at the top end of the strip, but the Sahara hotel which is 5 minutes walk has the monorail station which takes you right to all the hotels along the strip - about 5 or 6 stops in total, it runs until 2 or 3am and we found it very efficient. The Stratosphere has a Starbucks so every morning we got our lattes and wandered to the monorail... Grand Canyon..... this is a must do... we went with Pappilon on the first class sunset tour, it was amazing and by going slightly later in the day, when the sun was just setting we saved ourselves from the 42 degree heat - there is no shade in the grand canyon. Other must do..... go and see dolphins at the mirage and the white lions and tigers there too, i could have stayed there all day watching them.... play on craps... its hilarious and we actually won by doing nothing, we weren't big gamblers in vegas we were more interested in seeing the sights so when we did gamble it was just for fun. Shows.... we went to see Jubilee at Ballys which is the longest running show in vegas i think, with the showgirls, lots of bling and feathers and also Cirque du soleil - mystere again the oldest and original - there are 6 cirque du soleil shows in vegas. Both shows were amazing. At the end of our trip we stayed for one night at the bellagio....... OMG amazing..... definately a great way to end our holiday... I cant wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “great holiday spot, lovely pool, restaurants and casino not as tacky as some”
Reviews.Author: lippylou26
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay...the all day buffet was great value and had a good selection of food, nice pool to relax beside with a reasonably priced bar, bizarre american hang ups about toplessness aside,roxys diner was lively, staff helpful, room spacious although we got talked in to paying for an upgrade when we got there as they had "overbooked at our price level" but we ended up with a great room. was handy having the retail floor for 24 hour Mcdonalds in the hotel....yarm Angus burgers! Only disadvantage was quite a long distance down the srip to the hub of it all but not a major prob

Reviews.Title: “Treated in a brutal way by security personnel”
Reviews.Author: Eugene_v_P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on August 23rd. The room was quite nice and clean, but the way we were treated in the compelling stratosphere tower (part of the hotel) was simply brutal. At the security at the entrance of the stratosphere tower we were treated in a very unprofessional and impolite way by the security personnel. The responsible officer behaved very impolitely and shouted to me and my wife and both our (10-year-old!!) children. When the metal detector went off, he behaved in an even more crude way. His behaviour was a classic example of misuse of position. He did not respond to my questions about his misbehaviour, nor did he make his apologies. I understand that safety in the hotel has to be ensured, but this should be done with respect for their guests. If you want ot avoid these disappointing experiences stay away of the hotel or don't pay a visit to this tower. I complained on the website of the hotel, but simply did not get any reaction at all.

Reviews.Title: “first timer”
Reviews.Author: paula812
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the statosphere, I wasnt expecting much but was very pleasantly surprised. We upgraded to a suite for the whole 18 nights whcih meant we had a seperate room apart from the bedroom. It only cost us another £60!!! The room was spotless and the room service second to none, no matter wath time of day we left the room when we came back the towels and linen, bins emptied. The hotel itself is a little out of the way (at the end of the strip) but it never bothered us at all. To be honest its not as manic as all the other hotels so it was nice to come back to a bit of sanity!. We went to both of the pools adult pool, 24th floor which was ok but not worth the $10 for us as we couldnt sit in it too long. The other pool was fine with a much lager pool and eating area, I didnt see any children either. The best part of the holiday for me were the trips, I am so glad we booked them, the Grand Canyon fly, helicopeter, boat trip and then a walk around on the top was fabulous well worth the money as a once in life time think. We also did the lake mead and hoover dam trip, a much cheaper day and also brilliant. We did a few of the big shows but to be honest we enjoyed the Frank Sinatra and Barbara Streisand, " The show that never was" which is on at the Riverea, this was briliant she not only sounded like her but you would have thought it was her to look at too. We were all escorted in, in couples and sat at a table, (just as it must have been back in the rat pack days.) The artists shook everybodys hand as we left this little theatre. Unfortunaltey we didnt get too dressed up (we judged it by the previous big shows we went to) I am soory we didnt as it would have been appropriate for the occation. The last day we went to the resturant at the top of the tower, we only did brunch as we had spent up and the brunch is 1/4 of the price of evenign meal, another fabulous and excellent service with value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean For an 'older' hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoPeoplez
Reviews.Content: Great rooms - they were very clean (we had two separate rooms far from eachother on the same floor); I was quite surprised, being that the hotel has been there for quite some time and I found a SWEET deal on a similar website <hint>. :) We ate in one of the casino restaurants -- way over priced. Find somewhere else OFF the strip for a much better value. The View from the rooms were marginal - make sure when you check in that you ask for a room that faces the strip - you'll get a better view then a back-side industrial lot! Make sure you ride up to the top while you're here!! (they typically give you a free ticket to ride to the spire!) The rides are nominally priced, also, worth the $36 per person for all the rides! Definitely good bragging rites when you get back home!! All in all, I enjoyed it, the rooms were clean, amenities were there (workout gym is on the same level as the shops! AND they don't charge you extra to use it!). The pool is nice, too!!

Reviews.Title: “can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: TNT_9
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from Vegas and want to share our experience with your readers. This place sure exceeded my every expectation in every aspect. The room was basic, but what else do you want in a place to plunk your head for a few hours then back to being out-and-about?? Above all, it was VERY clean, neat and tidy and everything worked as it should. The view from both our rooms was very good as well. The hotel eateries were above par and entertaining and the food...oh the food...they sure know how to prepare a fabulous meal!! The Back Alley girls dealers were very unexpectedly very good at what they do...and that includes being knowledgable, helpful and most importantly very easy on the eyes!!! Wow, I have nothing negative to say about The Strat and will be my first choice for when I return!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough to want to return”
Reviews.Author: tpittManitoba
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that it was very nice to stay at the end of the strip where it was easy to get around from. All the amenitys were right there and it was not at all congested with people. Which is why i would return to stay at the stratosphere again. Good food and entertainment. The machines pay o.k. but I am not much of a gambler anyways.

Reviews.Title: “ANother good visit - but casino / public areas in need of a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: like2travellots
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time we have stayed at the Stratosphere in the last 5 years. We like it here because it is quieter then some of the big strip hotels and has provided easy access to expressway, downtown etc that you don't get down on the congested part of the strip. The check in this time was much quicker then any of our previous visits (which is a good improvement as we have waited up to 45 minutes before). We booked an NWA world vacations room with our airfare (worked out to about $25 per night + the resort fee charged for the two night stay of $7.50 per night). Cheap accomodations. We were give some sort of an upgrade as we ended up in a mini suite with a separate sitting area in a regular size hotel room - divider wall - was a nice room, clean with two tv's and a fridge. It was clean and comfortable as we have come to expect here. Great value The pool area is now much nicer then the adequate pool area from last visit. They have spent some money on new surroundings and chairs and it shows. Enjoyable simple pool area. As my title suggests though - the rest of the resort - from the casino to public areas is slipping a bit and showing signs of age. The casino itself is much less fun then before wtih many of our favourite games missing - it is much more sparsely filled with video poker / slots then last visit - although we did like new 'video blackjack' game where 6 or 7 people sit around big screen to play real rules blackjack. Washrooms, tower area, common areas are all starting to age and less clean (especially washrooms) then last visit. Fortunately we found cocktail service to be as good as before (one reason we come here) - way better then other strip hotels and almost as good as outlying hotels and downtown hotels. Good visit - recommend for cheap, comfortable accomodations. TIP: If you are gambling at the stratosphere - use your points / comps at Arizona Charlies - owned by same group but the comps go a lot further at other locations - free breakfast most days from gambling the night before on our way out to see the town - decatur or boulder depending on which direction you are going. The comps don't go far (if any) in Stratosphere and to be quite frank we have not found the food or restaurants to be that good at Strat anyways - so we usually eat elsewhere with ACG coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation with everything at your fingertips”
Reviews.Author: ruralmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Romance Suite and were pleased with how luxurious the room was. The bathroom alone with it's spa bath was the size of a small unit and the king size bed was very comfy. It also had a sofa bed and two tv's. We also had a bar fridge and coffee machine.The whole room was very big and was more than enought size to fit my Husband, myself and our five yr old. I loved the fact that the stratosphere had everything at our fingertips. My son loved the Mcdonalds , the buffet was excellent and Roxy's dinner was great service and wonderful food. The other food outlets on the shopping floor were also very tasty and affordable. While staying there we had the opportunity to see the American All Stars show which was brilliant. We also enjoyed the viewing deck on the tower. We however were not brave enough to try out any of the thrill rides. We also loved the fact that the bus which takes you along the strip was just outside and was very convenient. The only down side to our stay was the laundry facilites. While it was great that they were free to use, there were not enough dryers and out of the ones they had only two worked and dryed the clothes properly. I unfortunately had one that took over 3 hrs and my clothes were still damp even after being on the hottest setting. The other thing I felt the hotel lacked was shade at the pool. We enjoyed the pool but as for umbrellas to shade the chairs they were few and far between and sitting near the pool soon became very hot and uncomfortable expecially when trying to rest and watch your kids. Overall our stay was wonderful and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DenisV
Reviews.Content: Recommended to single travellers and groups of friends. This hotel is located on The Streep, but at least 20 min from most of the other Casino hotels. The hotel offers convenient shuttle service to the middle of the Streep (Planet Hollywood hotel) and back. You can save time and money taking this shuttle instead of walking to major hotels or taking "crawling" Duece service . The pool is great. The hotel has lots of enterntainment, restaurants, cafes and bars. The bar on the ground level offers unlimited drinks between 4 p.m. and 8 p.m. for $20. Great deal! The hotel is very close to the Premium Outlet Mall (5-7 min cab ride) and the monorail (5 min walk) and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: femtrav
Reviews.Content: a group of friends preselected this hotel and therefore I booked the same hotel. I think, considering the hotel is a 3star, it is pretty good value for money. It may not be the most glamouros hotels in Vegas but they are only a short taxi ride away (or 20mins by foot). Rooms are a decent size and clean - not the trendiest furniture (throughout the hotel that is) but the bed was comfy, bathroom always clean. When I stayed in March they just opened the new pool which looked pretty good from top of the Stratosphere Tower (compared to the other old, existing one) Staff was very friendly, the casino downstairs not very glam but good enough to lose a few bucks at the end of a good night out. When I stayed in March they just opened the new pool which looked pretty good (at least what I could see from on top of the Tower) Since you don't need to sleep much when you go to Vegas - this hotel is more than good enough to drop of your suitcase and go back to shower and change clothes! PS: I dare you do the rides on the Stratosphere tower! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere didn't refund reservation fee”
Reviews.Author: ambotlangnimo
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite January 2009 for our trip August 2009. But by July we found a better deal for Excalibur Hotel. I cancelled the Stratosphere reservation and received an email confirmation with the cancellation number. I trusted that the reservation charged to my account was going to be credited back. Credits reflect on credit card accounts in 3-5 business days and I got busy I totally forgot to check back. September 2, I saw a charge from Stratosphere hotel on my credit card for $2.84. The first time I called their accounting department the person I spoke with told me the charge was for something authorized at the front desk but she doesn't see what for. I told her we cancelled the reservation and never stayed at the hotel. She was very rude. She said she didn't see that the reservation was cancelled and that since this is the first time it happened, as a courtesy she will credit my account. Courtesy?!?! I told her I could give her the cancellation number I got from email. But she declined. After we hung up I called back to speak to the front desk manager to see what was the charge for and was told that since the reservation was never cancelled on their system I was charged for one night plus taxes. Meaning the reservation fee of $103 was never credited to my account and the $2.84 I saw just charged was for taxes. And the accounting person told me she'll credit me $2.84 as courtesy?!?! For sure she had seen in the system I was charged for one night! I called accounting again and this time had to be angry at them to give me back my money. This 2nd accounting representative was also very rude. She hung up on me after she angrily said my account will be credited back. I had to call back to ask her to send me an email confirmation from her that my account will be credited back. They make you feel like you were trying to cheat them when infact they are trying to cheat you. Not even an apology from them. What a customer service! I'd NEVER even consider Stratosphere Hotel the next time we go to Vegas. To think we usually go there as a big group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a touch of mold and cigarettes...”
Reviews.Author: btb30224
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Stratosphere was ok. It could have been great though. I work for an airline, and was able to take my Mom to first trip to Vegas. Looking online, we decided on the Stratosphere because of the prospect of a great view. We arrived at the hotel without a hitch by taking one of the many pay shuttles that are at LAS. The cost was $16.00 (one way). We arrived at the hotel, and checked in, and then went on up to our room which was in tower three on the tenth floor. Upon exiting the elevator, we were bombarded with the stench of mold and stale cigarette smoke. I did not complain to management or anyone concerning this, but I did mention it in the survey they ask about. If you are traveling with children to Vegas, be careful of this hotel. They have two swimming pools, one is topless and they say that it’s “adults only”. Ways to get around? If you’re on a budget, go with the Mass Transit. You can get a 24 hour access pass to the buses for only $7.00!

Reviews.Title: “Just AMAZING ; we'll be back for sure !!!”
Reviews.Author: BluffMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere from august 22 to 26 2009. We chose a TOWER PREMIER room, which was situated on the 21st floor with a view of the Strip. We were more than pleased by the room itself : it was very clean, well decorated, with a big bathroom... We paid a little price for our stay at this hotel and the room was over our expectations. The SERVICE was the major positive point of this hotel : everyone is smiling, caring, and making sure that you are satisfied. The room was cleaned perfectly and different personnal touches were left in the room every day (extra towels, extra lotions or shampoos, extra pillows...). The concierge desk is useful, with competent employees that will help you no matter what you're looking for. We also ordered room service a couple times and the food was always excellent, the service amazing and quick, and they even called 15 minutes after the delivery to make sure our order was OK. The menu is available 24hours and there is plenty of choice, from sandwiches to more elaborate meals like Dijon salmon in pecan crust or a 12 oz T-Bone. If you feel like having a cozy and relax evening in your room, trust the room service for your meal, you won't regret it. The VALET PARKING is just the best thing. Every hotel in Vegas offers free valet parking. But at the Strat, we were served by nice and competent employees, ready to give us information about the city or directions. It is well worth the tip. The casino is less crowded than at the other resorts, it is not smoky at all and big enough to please anyone. It is not as glamourous as the Bellagio's casino, but hey : at least you're not walking on the feet of a bunch of tourist that only came to your resort to visit it. As in many casinos, the drinks are free, as long as you're playing... We went to the Top Of The World restaurant and enjoyed a nice dinner with a splandid view of the Strip. It is a bit pricy but you expect that from a classy restaurant. Try the Duck Ravioli with the Foie Gras : it's EXCELLENT ! We also accessed to the Tower's observation deck and did the rides (BigShot and X Scream). There was no waiting for the rides and they are a thrill of a lifetime ; don't miss that. Some people say that the Strat is far from everything : that's not true. It is at the north end of the Strip, so yes, if you don't have a car you will walk a lot to get to the south end. But we kind of enjoyed being a couple blocks away from the noisy, crowded, traffic jammed mid-Strip at night time. We rented a car so it was not a problem. And even if you don't have a car, there are a couple of monorails (some free, some expensive), there is plenty of taxis and also buses... You're never out of options. In other words, is we ever go back to Vegas (which is almost certain), it is sure that we won't hesitate to book at the Stratosphere. We visited the Bellagio, the Wynn, the Mandalay Bay... They are gorgeous, but you have to manage yourself through the lobby surrounded by hundreds of tourists in their flip-flops taking pictures at every step... I wouldn't pay that much money for a luxury resort in Las Vegas. They are just TOO crowded and you won't enjoy the things you paid for. Stick to the Stratosphere, you will be pleased !

Reviews.Title: “Wicked, couldn't ask for more!!”
Reviews.Author: morgand12002
Reviews.Content: I spent 15 nights in the Stratosphere this month and it was brilliant. This was my second trip to Vegas and this time i wanted to be 1/2 way between the strip and Fremont and thats what i got. On my last visit i stayed in the Terribles and that was a good hotel also but was much further away from Fremont it was closer to Sams Town. The room was fantastic it was of a good size and the beds were so comfortable i found it hard to get up on a morning. The staff were friendly at the front desk and the housekeeping staff were lovely, my room was cleaned daily if i requested. The pool was brilliant as well as the topless one at the top of the hotel. Women go free woo hoo, i do not like bikini lines. But be aware of the perves that pay $10 to watch you! Ice machine was on every floor and free. Lifts were very spacious and the quickest ones i've been in. Make sure you take using your room key to the best advantage because you can get to the top of the tower to watch the rides for free, others have to pay a fee and also the gym is pretty neat. The only downfall to this hotel is where it is based for some people, you have to walk a little to get on the strip. Not that i mind this, but my feet did at the end of my trip with all of their blisters. The monorail is very good in Vegas but it's a shame that it only go's so far, if it done the full route of the duece my feet would not have suffered so bad. That is my main concern of Vegas the transport, especially the deuce(bus) it take approx one hour to get down the strip. If you go to Luckys you can even get a takeaway, which is good if you do not want to eat in. I loved the vegetable spring rolls and chips with chilli sauce. Addictive If i stayed in Vegas again i would stay in this hotel. The staff and my room fely like home, i didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money, a bit away from the action”
Reviews.Author: xgunslingerx
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff was courteous and it felt very comfortable and safe. Breakfast buffet was great, lunch not so much. you can walk about 4 blocks to the really fun parts of the strip, but you might not want to do it late at night. Rooms were really comfortable. The pool was nice but again, nothing great. I think that there are obviously much nicer places to stay in vegas, but the cost of this for the quality was really great. We got a free trip up to the tower for all in the room. I think you can ride the 3 rides for all day for 45 dollars or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: RhondaV
Reviews.Content: It has been a while, but, I have stayed @ the Stratosphere twice now. It is a bit away from the other hotels, however, you can get a 24hr. bus pass for $7, that takes you the length of the strip including Freemont St. (old Vegas). If you are just using the room to sleep and shower, it's great. I wouldn't stay @ this hotel if I was goint to be spending an extended ammount of time in my room. It's clean, cheap, the pool and bar area are fun, and the staff is friendly and efficient. I also did not see many children at the Strat, which I thought was great. Vegas is about gambling, drinking, and partying. It's definately NOT a place for kids. Disney is a better choice for a family vacation. I have also stayed @ Treasure Island and am staying @ Mirage this year, but, I would not rule out the Strat for future trips due to the savings factor alone.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: salemBeds
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is a ffantastic hotel & great value due to its location just off the main strip. We got a taxi to the strip which wasn't very expensive. Rooms were huge with lovely big bathrooms & great views of strip from panoramic windows. Nice big pool area with space to sunbathe. Scary rides at the top of tower, I managed 2/3, the rollercoaster that hangs over the edge was awesome!! dont think about it just do it!!!! Literally never sleeps, people sit in the casino all day & all night! Did a fab helicopter trip over strip & the trip to Gand Canyon is well worth the money, even though its a very early start! Overall this hotel is great value for money compared to other hotels in Vegas & as you can go in every hotel anyway I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My 30th Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: prdrprincess
Reviews.Content: The room was nothing like the picture. I wasn't expecting the Ritz but the room was old and our view was of the garage. Only local channels,no real cable channels. I am so glad that we bought a Timeshare further down the strip. We will be staying there anytime we come in.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but a little bit to far on the strip”
Reviews.Author: musiquedenuit
Reviews.Content: we spent there 3 night in august. The price was really competitive, that's why we picked it. but pay attention as it is located far north on the strip so you'll have to take a cab or bus to get to the other well know hotels and casinos (by the way, the bus always gets stuck in the traffic so it may take 30 mins to get to the centre of the strip). our room was nice, clean and spacious. we also liked the swimming pool and there's also a free gym for the hotel guests. finally, do not use their internet stations: most of the time they do not work but charge you anyway (it happened twice to us and we had to go to the reception to get our money back). Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite, great value for money - but Las Vegas not for families”
Reviews.Author: binmadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a Romance Spa suite (huge room and bathroom with jacuzzi) with a connecting 2 queen bedroom for our kids, on the 16th floor, for less than the price of a Holiday Inn in LA. So great value for money, and staff were efficient if not particularly friendly. Our 11 year old loved the 'extreme' rides at the top of the tower, and we saw an amazing magic show at the Sahara next door, complete with disappearing tigers. BUT!! I'd wondered whether to include Las Vegas in our fly-drive of California/Arizona (yes I know it's in Nevada, but you get the picture). I'd heard that there was more to Las Vegas than gambling, drinking and shopping. that it was now 'family friendly' - well don't believe it! To start with the hotel: you can't avoid crossing the (enormous) casino floor to get to the restaurants, the tower, the shops etc. It's smoky and seedy (grim-faced loners playing the machines with all their luggage next to them....) If the kids so much as stopped for a second to look at the roulette table as we crossed the floor to have breakfast, we were pounced on by the security guards and told to keep moving. The 'family' pool area has practically no shade, in temps over 95, and again, when we went within 10 yards of the bar to order food, we were barked at by the barman. The major Strip hotels (Forum, Circus Circus, Bellagio etc) are amazing to see. But overall, I found the extravagance depressing, and the atmosphere totally un-family friendly. I couldn't wait to leave and get to the Grand Canyon. Now there's a real wonder of the world, made by God not property developers. Conclusion: if this is the kind of thing you like, you'll love it. Just don't take your family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room....fantastic views....get the premier suite though”
Reviews.Author: flicky08
Reviews.Content: the room was fantastic. The staff were friendly, given a book of vouchers. The down side was the casino was shabby in comparison to other hotels. However as we had the premier suite it was the best we stayed in in Vegas. We stayed in the Luxor, and the MGM, and our friends who stayed at the Venetian also thought the room was great, wirlpool bath, 2 televisions seating area ect. This hotel is at the end of the strip though...but the monorail is within easy reach. If you stay at the hotel you can get to go up the tower at any time free...rides at the top are a must...even if you only watch!!!!!! and go at night as well to see the Vegas lights.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Vegas - loved it! I'm going back”
Reviews.Author: MontrealVegasGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a family vacation with our kids in Vegas. We stayed at the Stratosphere. We had a huge room with 2 double queen beds that were very comfortable. We stayed on a higher floor (21 and up) - and there was no noise. We had the possibility of view of the Spring Range Mountains or the Vegas strip. Price was unbelievably cheap, 38$ US/night This was a great family hotel - the staff was efficient and pleasant! There's lots of interesting things for the kids to do at this hotel - they will not be bored. I will be returning at this hotel, since I had such a wonderful time in Vegas - what a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel just a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: cycobomber
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vegas for 1st time on a friday night. Staff upon arrival were unreal very friendly and helpful and we were checked and into our room in 20 minutes max. Place was buzzing. Stayed for 5 nights before going to NYNY This hotel can not be faulted. The staff food and restraunts all wonderful esp the 50's Diner with the staff singing away. The rooms great strip view. The only problem is as this was our 1st vegas trip i found that without a car and relying on the Deuce the hotel is out of the way. This does make it conveniant to downtown which is a plus but as most of our time was spent sightseeing the strip so not too conveiniant, Apart from the location this is as good as any other hotel We had a great time here and i would consider staying again on service and vibe of the place alone.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the strip attractions.”
Reviews.Author: rwc38
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and nice. Check in was uneventful. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The casino within the hotel left a lot to be desired however the amenities and shops were good. The location is quite a way from the main action on the strip be prepared to use public transportation or a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MikeV84
Reviews.Content: Very inexpensive thanks to an early reservation, but they give you their least attractive rooms when you book early. We got a handicapped room with roll in shower, which wasn’t very pleasant.. The room itself was good, but rather small. They have a free guest laundry room, which is nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money....clean hotel very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: luvtomovetosouthwest
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay a bit off the strip. The hotel was great for what you paid. The rooms were large, and very clean and very comfortable beds. I guess they remodelled the rooms in 2005 and 2006. The staff was quite accomodating. I booked a deluxe room and got two queen beds. The difference between the deluxe (I was on the 8th floor) and the premier room is that the premier room is on the higher floors with a view of the mountains and the strip. But if you have unlimited access to the Tower why do you need a view from your room then? The only drawback may be that you have to walk about five minutes to the monorail (which is in the Sahara Hotel). I highly recommend you take the monorail if you stay at the Stratosphere. I purchased a three day pass for $30.00 The neighbourhood itself is not that great and there are some broken beer bottles on the street and some homeless people that may or may not harass you. Although I felt a bit uneasy taking the monorail back on my own and the thought of having to walk back yourself, I did not have a single problem as a solo traveller during my stay at there. Also, the good thing is that I did not have to wait that long for the elevators (unlike the previous hotel I stayed at right at the strip). I would definitely stay at the Stratosphere again

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the money”
Reviews.Author: curt1480
Reviews.Content: July 27th, 2009 We stayed at the stratosphere after making our reservations online. The check in was a little bumpy because we booked through hotels.com and not direct. The clerk confirming the reservations was irritated and difficult. She wanted us to pay more for non-smoking rooms together which we had confirmed before we started our trip. First night we kept hearing noise that kept waking me and the family in both rooms. The next day management comp us a free show for the whole family and got us rooms together. The rooms were roomy and very clean with really nice bedding. Slept like a King every night. The show was great and kids got pictures with the singers. The Mc Donalds on property was a bigger help than I thought it would be with returning to the hotel late after going to various shows each night. Don't forget about the pool on the 8th floor---but go early or late because the sun can be brutal in the afternoon sun. Book your rooms Sunday through Thursday and save the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality for a low price. Tower views are outstanding, and the attractions!”
Reviews.Author: Nonina
Reviews.Content: We could only stay 2 days but we left very happy! You cannot skip going to the top of the tower! Views and Xtreme attractions are amazing! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Total Value”
Reviews.Author: losharoth
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that the hotel was so nice. The quality is comparable to a Best Western, Holiday inn, La Quinta etc. The staff were very nice (except for one problem) and when we had a problem with our room we were given a free upgrade no questions asked. Although it is out of the way, you can catch the Deuce tourist bus right outside the front door or walk 1.5 blocks to the Shara and jump on the monorail, it takes about 10 minutes to get to the busier part of the strip. ---We had a room with a jacuzzi that overlooked the living room in our suite and you could watch tv from the tub. This was a very good value - got it for 36/night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...3* price tag with 5* service...”
Reviews.Author: TheSmithsSouthWales
Reviews.Content: After reading the bad reviews about this hotel, all I can say is that they must have stayed in a different Stratosphere to the one we did!! If they wanted a 5* Hotel in the middle of the strip...that’s what they should have booked! We saved a substantial amount of money over the fortnight compared to the prices of the central strip hotels. It was our first time in Vegas so we had nothing to compare it to, but we couldn't fault the hotel...it is what it is...a 3 star hotel, not trying to be anything its not. From check in to check out, every staff member we spoke to was friendly, attentive and nothing was too much for them. I'm sure the tipping made a difference but you all know how it works in the hospitality industry! Our room was very clean, housekeeping were always present around the hotel throughout the day and if you left a DND sign on the door in the morning, they would leave a voicemail for you to call them when you were ready for the room to be serviced. The pool area was great, complimentary towels and always plenty of sunloungers no matter what time you went out. Fair enough there weren't any designated swimming lanes BUT...your on holiday not practising for the Olympics!! The staff were great around the pool and the food was really good. They have a great choice of restaurants, we ate in Fellini's, the food and service was perfect. We also had food in the Top of the Tower restaurant, we had lunch instead of dinner because it was half the price, the food was nice but still expensive. It's worth going there though for the experience of being in a revolving restaurant 800 feet high. We didn't have chance to eat in Roxy's because the queues were always too long..which speaks for itself! Very popular. The observation deck is free and unlimited for hotel residents, definately the best view of Vegas. The rides are not free; they are $15 for each ride. When we checked in we were given $5 free slot play each which was a nice touch and from that we won $23 between us. We watched 'American Superstars' in the hotel which is half price for hotel residents. The show was a lot of fun and great value for money at only $19.99 each. The hotel is a fair walk from the strip but its definately worth doing it at least once to take everything in. We didn't use the Monorail, just the Deuce bus service which has a stop right outside the Casino side entrance. At $7 for a 24hr access pass it is definately worth the money and we used it almost every day. We never waited longer than 15 minutes for a bus and the drivers are very entertaining to! The Fremont Experience is close to the hotel and you can get the Deuce there aswell. Only advice is to avoid the Deuce if your in a rush to get somewhere. We decided to get a cab to and from the airport so we didn't have to make any stops or changes, it cost us $40 the day we arrived because of roadworks but only $20 on the journey back to the airport. The only negative comment I can make is that we were approached a few times for spare change when we walked to the general store. As long as you’re polite and stern, they just thank you for acknowledging them and leave you alone. However, this is no reflection on the hotel just the area it is in. We hope this review helps you if your planning to stay at the Stratosphere, you can still go and see all the other more expensive hotels, you just know when you put your head down after a long day...your still in Vegas and paying a lot less than everyone else for the same experience! To put the money we saved into perspective, we were able to watch David Copperfield, Jay Z, American Superstars, KA Cirque Du Soleil and go to the Grand Canyon!!!...not a bad sacrifice for staying in a 'supposedly budget' hotel ;)

Reviews.Title: “Top Of The World - Top of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: biggles81
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere is located at old end of town closer to Downtown, and the old end of Vegas. It is a fair hike to the high end of town but well suited for our purposes. Really enjoyed the Top Of The World restaurant for wife's birthday. The best of the rides was closed due to wind..........a gentle breeze. Pools and gymnasium very good. Rooms comfortable but a bit pricey for this end of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you come here with kids !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jonnyjet777
Reviews.Content: Went to the Stratosphere in July with my family on the "Breakfast Package". Booked two rooms which includes two breakfast buffets per room. Went down on the first morning only to be told that only people over 21 qualified for the included breakfast. A bit embarrasing and ended up paying again for the kids. I went through the booking process again to see if I had missed some small print but no, no mention of anything at all. It seems if you can't gamble, you can't have the food !! We were in a room on the swimming pool level. Rooms were fine, just an awful view of the multi-storey car park. To give room its due, the triple glazing meant there was no noise from the cars. Overall though, came away feeling I had the wool pulled over my eyes and had been ripped off. Not a good feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Will absolutely never even set foot in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: travelhopper23
Reviews.Content: The customer service is terrible. They are rude and dismissive. I had people taken of my room, specifically telling them to change the key b/c they were not to be allowed in. I came back and hotel security had still allowed them in the room. Their defense was "There was not note in the computer specifically stating they were not to be let in." If I took their name off, and changed the key, do I really need to say more for you to do your job and not allow 2 random people into my hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Chels74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Stratosphere for a week, August 2nd-9th, for a rest and relaxation trip. We have both been to Vegas numerous times so the location was not an issue for us. We got an incredible deal through Allegiant Air which we couldn't pass up, so decided to go for it and take a chance. We arrived at the hotel at around 1:00 in the afternoon, check-in went smooth and there was not a long wait. The check-in clerk was very nice, took extra time to go over the different rooms they had available. Hubby and I decided to upgrade to a Player's Club Room which only cost us an extra $15 per day. It had a brand new mattress, new bedding, updated decor and fridge. Our room was exceptionally clean (my only real "must have" in a hotel). Granted the room was not overly fancy by any means, but it was spacious, comfortable and clean (can you tell I like clean rooms?) In fact the entire hotel was incredibly clean. I was always seeing staff sweeping, dusting or vacuuming. Overall the hotel itself is modern and I did not get the sense of it being run down in anyway. Of course there was some wear & tear here and there but with the amount of people in and out of these mega hotels there surely would be! After getting settled we took a tour around the casino/hotel area in order to get familiar with our surroundings. It has four restaurants (Back Alley Bar and Grill, Fellini's, Roxy's Diner and Lucky's Cafe) a Starbucks and the buffet on the casino level and a McDonalds, Mexican restaurant, Ben & Jerry's, Fat Tuesdays, a Weitzel's Pretzel place and Chicago Style hot dog restaurant on the upper level. Also, there is the Top of the World restaurant high up in the tower. We ate at Roxy's Diner which had excellent food, great service and decent prices. The waiters and waitresses sing 50's & 60's songs which was a lot of fun! My husband acquired a new crush on Gidget, one of the waitresses at the diner. She sat next to him and sang a bit of a song while we ate! Too cute! We also ate at Lucky's Cafe which was also very good, great portion sizes, the prices weren't too bad and the food was great. We also tried the buffet one day and did the $19.99 All You Can Eat-All Day Long deal. It is a great deal that is for sure but we found that we over ate the entire day and didn't want to come home with an extra 10 pounds to lose! Overall, it was an okay buffet. The food was just so-so, however, they did have a great selection of different dishes so there is something there for everyone. We also ate at the Mexican restaurant upstairs. It was good as well, not the best mexican I have had but the prices were also decent and we received huge portions. Our main goal was to relax by the pool during the day and work on our tans. The main pool is on the 8th floor and has awesome views of the surrounding mountain ranges. We were always able to find a lounger, they have a vast amount of them surrounding the pool area. There is not a lot of shade to be found and there are only a handful of umbrellas for people to use for shade, so my advice would be to get there by 9:00 am if you want to secure an umbrella for the day. The pool area also have cabana's for rent as well. Monday-Thursday an all day rental is $50 and Friday-Sunday is $125. The cabanas were basic but they did have a mini fridge stocked with bottle water, a flat screen tv, two loungers, and free rental of the pool loungers. We did not rent a cabana because we were always able to find a quiet corner of the deck and an umbrella to use. The adult only pool is on the 25th floor. You must be 21 or older to go into that pool area because it is a European style pool (topless sunbathing). We decided to go check it out one day and we both just loved it. It became our hang out of choice! It was much quieter and had a more mature vibe to it. We especially liked it because there were no screaming kids! Pure bliss! The view from the 25th floor was amazing as well. The service was excellent as the bar tender got to know everyone at the pool because there were not very many of us. Great service by the pool attendant as well. When you arrive he asks you where you would like to sit, he takes the towels over to your seats, sets everything up for you and makes sure you are comfortable. Nice touch! The location of the hotel itself has some good points and bad points. If you are going to Vegas for your first or even second time, I would not stay here. I say this because it is at the very end of the strip and getting to the strip takes a long time. If you have the money in your budget to take a cab to and from the strip then it would be okay but if you are on a budget and will be taking The Deuce or are wanting to walk, think again. Hubby and I didn't mind it at all, grabbing The Deuce and just watching the sights as we made our way down to the strip was just fine. We have seen all the hotels and been to the majority of the attractions, so we were in no rush to be anywhere at any given time. The good thing about being at that end of the strip is you are sort of half way between the strip and Fremont Street, so catching the bus to either area was really easy and convenient. You are also over half way to one of the outlet malls as well, which was a very short bus ride from the hotel itself. One other thing we noticed was that because we were way off the strip, we could walk out of our hotel and walk down to the convenience store to grab munchies and alcohol without being stuck in massive crowds walking up/down the strip. It was a quiet area and everything we needed was right there - internet cafe, convenience stores, bus stops, Denny's, IHOP etc...very handy!! In the end, we both had a great time and achieved what we wanted from the vacation. We would not hesitate to stay at The Stratosphere again. The value for your money is there!

Reviews.Title: “Good and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dillano
Reviews.Content: Good and nice hotel to stay. Reasonable price! The room is awesome but the swimming pool is not cool. I do prefer the swimming pools which have separate lines. It is easier to swim. Another point is that the swimming pool does not have a ceiling. It is an outdoor swimming pool and located on the 8th floor. It is extremely hot in the afternoon (till 7pm!!). There is another swimming pool located on the top floor. This swimming pool allows women to half naked and men have to pay $10 (as to see what they want to see, I guess lol). The hotel is not right in the city CBD so it is quite tiring to discover if travellers prefer to have a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from centre of the strip”
Reviews.Author: holdreamerbrissie
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel on price. Upgraded to a suite after a poor hotel in LA. Room was good, clean spacious, huge bathroom. The entrance of the hotel though is old and looking grubby. Also found that the hotel is to far from the action of the strip. Would have been better off staying in amore central hotle on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “What you save in dollars, you make up for in footsteps.”
Reviews.Author: talk_show_host
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is a great hotel, not shabby and not too high class that it drives the price through the roof. The Strat is much cheaper than a lot of it's counter parts mainly due to its location. It is about two blocks north of the rest of the strip. It is very close to Fremont Street, which is an older part of the town definitely worth checking out. If you would like tips and tricks for surviving Las Vegas for a first-timer, learn from my mistakes and read this: http://lostinreviews.com/2009/07/tips-for-vegas/

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: TorontoChris2004
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews, I was a bit worried about staying at the Stratosphere and went in with very low expectations. However I must say I really enjoyed my stay at the Stratosphere. Upon arrival we were told that there were no more non smoking rooms with a king size bed which we had booked. This was quickly resolved we were given a free upgrade to the 23rd floor which had a wonderful view. The rooms are a bit dated which I knew going in. However housekeeping did a wonderful job and the rooms were very clean. The food at the various restaurants were good but I really enjoyed the $20 all day buffet. The food selections were very good. The trip to the tower (which is included in the price) was very good and gave a breathtaking view of las vegas. The only thing which I did not like was the hotel was a little far from the main action on the strip, however the $7 all day deuce bus pass was well worth the price. However based on value for money I would difenately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying here just for the trip up the tower”
Reviews.Author: cdth
Reviews.Content: The view from atop the Strat is magnificent, and if you plan to see it, consider a stay here. At $16 per person to go to the top, that's $32 for a couple, and our room, with taxes, cost us $37 (yes, Vegas is begging people to come right now). Unlimited trips to the top are included with your hotel stay. (As regards the 4 star rating, I view ratings as within a price category, that is, value for the money. Actually, at the bargain price offered, I should probably give the Strat a 5, but somehow that seems excessive. It is, simply, a nice enough place that is currently a terrific bargain.) The accommodations are nice: A clean, refurbished room, attractively decorated, comfortable Serta mattress, large, comfortable bath tub. The hotel pool is plenty nice enough, though not special or memorable. Not sure I'd stay here for more than two nights (because of its location), but it's a bargain right now if you plan to go up the tower. And if you are braver than I am, you have your choice of 3 rides up there. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Crazy rides on top of the world”
Reviews.Author: dmcelmurry
Reviews.Content: It's a long walk to the others hotels on the strip. totally take the bus; its cheap and fast

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: enchantedeverafter
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a little worried about staying here because of the location but my mind was put to rest when we pulled into the parking garage and security was patrolling the area on bikes (and keep in mind there were about 5-6 of them and at 3am). We checked in rather late at 3 in the morning and waited in line about 15 minutes. The girl at check in was so nice. She was very apologetic about our wait (which compared to The Flamingo we checked out of was nothing). She gave us a coupon book to use around the casino. It is a great coupon book and we used a lot of the coupons in it including a coupon for free admission to the top of the tower (which was amazing by the way). We ate at several restaurants including the diner, which was fun and Top of the World (a must try). We stayed in a suite one night and a standard room another night. Both rooms were clean, in good condition, and quiet. There was always someone cleaning and people actually smile and greet you here as opposed to some other hotels we have stayed at in Las Vegas. The beds are comfortable and the linens are a clean, crisp white. The showers are hot and have good water pressure. The other thing we enjoyed about this hotel was that it has a very convenient lay out. There are many things for families to do here including a large swimming pool, small arcade and amusement park rides at the top of the tower. I highly recommend The Stratosphere. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “they lost my reservation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wendyguo
Reviews.Content: it was the worst stayed ever!! first they lost my reservation, then when we got into the room, it smelled like throwup and even had a big wet spot on the floor, so we had to change room, then in the other room, the bathroom wasnt clean!! and on the last night there, the TV shut off and wouldnt turn back on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money”
Reviews.Author: tobHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I guess this is one of the best value-for-money hotels you can find on this globe. Full service, clean, access to the tower, great view from the room… for an incredible price. Would definitely come again. The location is not that superb (a bit far from the main action), but we managed one night to walk up and down the whole strip. Otherwise we used the Las Vegas Monorail, leaving from the nearby Sahara station.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a not so great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingamazon
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to las vegas for a concert, and booked a room at the stratosphere for four nights for a special of 28.00 a night including the resort fee. Our room was nice and clean, and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was small, but it was clean, so I really didn't care. Housekeeping was superb, so no problem there. There was an old stain on the carpet near the phone, and scratches on the window, but it didn't really bother me. I wasn't too crazy about the neighborhood though. The hotel is located at the furthest end of the strip, so you can be walking down the street with tourists, mixed in with crazy folks. All in all, I was pleased with my stay, but may try to stay in the heart of the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “I got ROBBED not 500 feet from the fron tdoor”
Reviews.Author: Brewse
Reviews.Content: Not a great start to this visit. When we arrived to check in ( at the time we were told to when booking the room ) and our room wasn't ready. The guy at check in was very nice so not too big of a deal. We wasted an hour or so and finally were able to check in. Once we got to our room we were very disappointed. The room was nothing as described during the booking process. The room was very small, smelled bad, and the view sucks. Not to mention the disgusting stain my wife found as she turned back the covers on the bed, don't wan to even think about where that stain came from... I called the front desk to complain and was told I would have to come down and speak to a manager, which I did. The manager took care of the issue and put us in a suite that closer resembled the room description given during the booking process. SO everything is "all good" right....Not for long...I decided to walk to the circle K for cigarettes and on the way back was bombarded by guys trying to sell fake drugs to tourists...After politley denying all these guys a guy comes up to bum a smoke, which he saw me purchase and as I pulled them from my pocket $40 fell outta my poket and faster than I could even blink this black guy came out of nowhere and grabbed the money and ran like he was running from the police. I tried to chase him, but he went to a dark alley, and let's face it $40 just isn't worth my life. Will I return to Vegas, you bet....Will I return to the Stratosphere? HELL NO!!! Stay away from this side of the strip, very bad vibes, very shady people everywhere... Do not let money fall out of your pocket, you will get ROBBED!!! Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Money, Nice Casino and Nice Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: vegasfanNj
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying this was my sencond stay at Stratosphere but I visit the casino here on every trip. Check In was easy and room is always clean and well furnished. The rooms are not large but your average hotel room. Casino has a large variety of games and slots. Including my favorite Elvis .25cent (PLAY ELVIS). Casino is know for having loose slots. I would say that in general my luck here is better than most on the strip. Casino has a nice food court as well as a few restaurants. I have only tried JJ Rockets but thats a good time as the wait staff sings to you. The TOWER is definetely worth a trip. You can spend as much time as you want on the observation deck and there is The Tallest Starbucks in the world on top. Not to mention the three rides on top which are all fun. Drink service is pretty good usually dont have to wait long for a drink in the casino. Only complaint would be the PLAYERS CLUB personel. They are like zombies with absolutely NO PERSONALITY. Also dont get swayed into believing therir coupon book is worth 150 dollars in comps as a reason to stay here. They are filled with junk for the most part. If you can get past the rude players club people then your stay should be pleasant. LOCATION. Im not bothered by the location here because last time I was attending a tradeshow at the convention center and Stratosphere is pretty close to that. Not to mention between downtown and main part of strip. Better rent a car if you stay here though coz TAXI's will be expensive. Dont bother walking to the strip coz the walk is LONG and full of construction areas with broken sidewalks.

Reviews.Title: “This for the price of a motel 8. Wow.”
Reviews.Author: nighttribute
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Not "Dirty Vegas" hotel. The rooms were spotless and new -Great restaurant in the tower with both amazing food and view, I highly recommend it. -More free drinks are served there then when we played at the other casinos Cons: -What room/view you get will be a gamble when it is crowded -It is at the far end of the strip, but this could almost be a pro. If you use the Deuce, which has a stop outside the hotel, it costs $15 for one 3 day pass.
