And often the bus drove right by crowds waiting at buss stops closer to mid-strip because of overcrowding I would absolutely advise staying here

Reviews.Title: “Good choice on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Frankyslav
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere hotel is a very, very good choice if you want to have a budget accomodation, but still be on the Strip. It was very cheap (30$/night), the Deuce station is in front on the hotel, Monorail station is only 1 block away, and if want to walk it takes about then 10 minutes to the center of the Strip- Wynn,Venetian, TI,Mirage... Room was pretty big, bed OK, well worth the money. Big plus is a Str.tower- with the best view on the Strip. Free for guests! Some excellent thrill rides on the top. Try The Big Shot!

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: snifflesmcg
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights. We arrived here after a horrible experience in Boulder City, NV. First, we loved that we could find the hotel easily as it was the biggest thing on the strip. Took awhile to check it but once we parked and got to our room, it was wonderful. I am convinced these beds were by far the most comforatable beds we have ever slept in! We also paid almost nothing for these rooms. One night was $55 and I believe the other was around $35. Not bad for Vegas. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: msna
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, large but well kept. Rooms were kept very clean but one downside, no fridge, there was an ice machine near our room but would be much better if there was a fridge. Room had an iron and ironing board which was good too. No tea/coffee making facilities so make sure you take your own. Bed really nice and comfy, excellent bed linen. The hotel itself is a little bit away from the main strip but it didnt bother us at all, the view was not that pleasant either but, we werent there for the view. All in all a nice hotel. Internet extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EKR2009
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for intially 6 nights (we ended up staying 13 nights)!12th-25th July.We had read the reviews and were very sceptical about the hotel. Having read the reviews we were worried especially after we had just done a cruise for a week. (we are on a round the world trip at the end) so we feel we are quite the experts when it comes to reviewing hotels!!! The room we had was lovely.21st floor. Huge, 2 queen beds clean and well maintained every day with fresh towels etc etc. No smoke smells and it was spotless. Only small window but great view of the mountains. No complaints at all and far better than we had read on trip advisor. The pool on the 8th floor is excellant and has a huge sunbathing area with loads of sunbeds. We love the sun so this was perfect for us. It doesnt get too busy (it was too hot!) the service is good from the bar staff. Our biggest complaint is the loud music played everyday and repeated everyday too. We dont mind music but not the same songs day in day out and blasting in your ear all day. Perhaps they could have a quiet 3 hours in the afternoon so it pleases everyone!?? This seems to be a regular complaint by all on trip advisor. Come on Stratosphere time to act on your guests feedback!!!! There is also an adults only pool on the 25th floor but we didnt use that it looked too crowded in for us. The restaurant buffet that is $19.99 all day is excellant in our opinion. There was a huge variety everyday and if you cant find something you like there is something wrong!! Considering the prices to eat on the strip this was a bargain and offered healthy food instead of burgers and fries. They do have that too tho in Roxy's diner! The casino was huge and not smokey in our opinion as reported. We dont smoke and didnt notice any problems with this. We went up the tower several times as it was free. Best views up there and to top it all when you get your tickets to go up the tower you get some good vouchers to use for e.g 2 for 1 on cocktails at C bar in the casino. Or buy one draft beer get one free in back alley bar. They all add up to saving money. Plus the voucher booklet they give you on check in is good too. Dont ignore it! The rides had to be seen to be believed! There is an adequate gym in the shopping area. I gather it has been moved from the pool area. Well airconditioned and has towels and water. Yes the hotel is at the end of the strip but that is well highlighted by the reviews and website so it shouldnt be a shock to anyone booking this hotel! it just means a short walk to the Sahara to catch the monroail or the bus runs up and down the strip for 3 dollars each. The monorail is 5 dollars one way so can work out quite expensive. We walked the strip more often than not as you see more. We saw the hotel show American Superstars and Michael Jackson was fantastic. Very strange to see him and then meet him. Excellant double moves and looks wise. The area next to the hotel is a little dodgy but that is no different to anywhere in the world and as always you need to stay on your guard and be observant. There are lots of homeless asking you for money but all the ones we encountered were very polite. The launderette on the 6th floor is great and good that it is free but gets busy and in all honesty for the size of the hotel there should be 2 or 3 of them. Especially when washers break down, although mainetenance were very good and got the company in to sort them out. Internet is $11.99 for 24 hours which is steep in my opinion but we needed it. The hotel does get busier at weekends and there are more queues everywhere but that is to be expected. Talking of queues we had no problems checking in at all. There were 8 staff checking in and they were excellant and helpful. All in all we have had a fantastic time here as it was our first visit to vegas and the Stratosphere was everything we wanted. Dont be put off by the other reviews just book the hotel and keep an open mind. We did and we are very pleased with outcome. Thankyou Stratosphere!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: rickh57
Reviews.Content: It would be nice to be closer to the middle of the Strip, but with a rental car, that wasn't too big of a deal. We loved the views from the tower, eating our anniversary dinner at Top of the World at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Where time doesn't matter...”
Reviews.Author: mrs_short
Reviews.Content: The Stratopshere is a nice, clean, good value for money hotel. Many complain about the location but I personally thought it was a great location. Although it's the Northern most hotel on the Strip, it is only a 5 minute walk to the Sahara where you can catch the monorail to the main part of the Strip. And then when you fancy going downtown to Fremont Street (a must) it is only a short taxi or bus journey. Overall the service was ok, it varied from place to place within the hotel. The check in staff were nice and polite and helpful. Room service were quick and also polite. The staff in the gift shops were very helpful and always had a smile for you. The only two minor irks were a couple of waitresses in Lucky's were rather rude and the drinks ladies that come and bring you drinks when you're gambling were few and far between. The beds were made most days and clean towels were provided. We were in Tower 2 and had great views of the mountains, especially beautiful when the sun was going down. Most of our time during the day was spent lazing by the huge pool on the 8th floor. There were plenty of beds and a bar for when thirsty. During the evenings we ate at one of the restaurants in the hotel. Lucky's was nice, great selection of food, but as I said before, the service wasn't always up to scratch. Also, if you are in a party of more than 8 they automatically add 18% tip to the final bill, which is fine if you receive good service, which in some cases we did not! So we tended to split into groups of 6 and tip according to the service recieved as it was hit and miss. We also ate in the 50s style Roxy's Diner. It was always very busy as the service was excellent, the entertainment was good fun and the food was great. There was also the shops on the retail floor where you could pick up McDonalds, pizza, Mexican and all other kinds of take away. We never went hungry! The casino was ok, plenty of machines and tables to choose from. Played every day and never really won much but never really lost much either. The C-bar was nice to chill out in away from the machines if you just fancy a drink. The tower was brilliant. Amazing views. Plus it's free to go up there if you are staying in the hotel. I recommend going up there during the early evening and watching the sun gradually slip behind the mountains and at night when the Strip and downtown are lit up. Beautiful! We also went to see the American Superstars show, half price as we were staying at the hotel. It was good, Rod Stewart and Christina Aguilera had pulled out the night we went so a couple of the performers we didn't really know but Michael Jackson and Elvis more than made up for it. The rides at the top of the tower are fun, although I just watched, was too chicken to actually go on them! But you can go out onto the observation deck and stand in a lovely warm breeze while everyone else gets scared half to death. I would definitely go back to the Stratosphere. The location is great, it's good value for money and for the most part the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: CrystalFell
Reviews.Content: After staying at the MGM Grand for 2 nights this was a little disappointing. It is quite a long way up the strip so took a while to get to places. The room was very small and we were given 2 beds rather than the 1 requested. The bathroom was very small and the hand bason was outside in the bedroom. The pool area is very average and we much prefered the MGM grand river pool. I would pay the extra money to stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: ayslynne
Reviews.Content: I visited Vegas in August 2007 with my mum and dad for my 16th birthday and I can overall say it is a brilliant hotel. The service was great, everyone was really friendly. The beds were huge and so comfy and our room looked right down the strip which was amazing! I definitely recommend Roxys Diner, we went there for a meal on the day of my 16th and the waiter spotted my 'Birthday Girl' badge and i was later dragged up in front of everyone else in the restaurant and sang 'you're sixteen, you're beautiful and you're mine' to me, so that made my birthday even more amazing. The view from the observation deck is stunning, Vegas is such a beautiful place at night time. It may be far up the strip but there's a bus stop just 2 mins away. I'm going back to Vegas again this August and staying at the MGM purely because we want to try another hotel but i very much recommend the Stratosphere!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CASINO, GOOD FOOD, GREAT SERVICE, CLEAN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: haileysmom22
Reviews.Content: Hi, I research every single place that I have ever stayed and actually didnt with this one so im leaving my review for others. I went here with my partner he been to veags 15 times (i was a firtst timer) he never stayed at the strato tho either. So, we walked in, great casino area checked in, tower room smoking clean and great value for a hotel in vegas ( cuase really when do you sit in the hotel anyways) the sink are was small tho, shower was great, but bathroom small as well. The double queen beds filled with pillows, never seen cleaning lady but had do no disturb sign the whole time, but had towels when needed. I belive the italian restaurant felini's WAS GREAT best service, great food, not overpriced. oh and the caffee on other end was great for brekfast. cheap too. not too many people during the week, but weekends was filled with lots of babies and parents. hard to get on tables in the weekend. far location, but rent a car, taxi is not overpriced either. all in all for 6 nights flight and hotel costing me 800.00 I was THRILLED and would stay here again. ANYTIME! oh p.s they have two ppools one topless on the roof, and one inside. I didnt attend either, lol but pics are great!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and service but the revolving hotel is the worst.”
Reviews.Author: senapati
Reviews.Content: We got an upgraded room and the room was very good. Best hotel for what you spend. There is a fridge and 2 TV's. But be prepared to stand in long queue to check in to the hotel.There will be lots of counters to check in but maximum of 5 people will help you in checking in but they are very slow. Room services are very good here. One thing I didn't like in this hotel is the Revolving hotel. Their service is very bad. There was one photographer in that hotel and her attitude and expressions are very bad. And the food is very expensive. But rememebr not to share your food. Because they will charge you $8.00 extra per person. And remember that they will watch you. Instead of sharing you can order another dish. This is the worst thing in this hotel. Rest all is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, poor location”
Reviews.Author: peejay_dk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice before in Vegas in more expensive hotels, so I was hugely surprised about the value of this very inexpensive hotel. We stayed for three nights and except for the closure of the pool the first day (and the rather noisy prostitute next door the second (and third) night) everything was very near to perfect. Only small issue is the location. We had a car, so it wasn't a big issue, but a location closer to the main part of the strip would have been preferable. But what can you expect for only 40$/night?

Reviews.Title: “I love the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: chuckyd48706
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at the Stratosphere twice, and we loved it both times. The first time we stayed we did not know what to expect, it was our first time in Vegas, and the employees of the hotel made our stay very enjoyable. The second time we stayed we both knew pretty much what to expect, and the hotel didn't let us down one bit. I will agree that it is far from everything on the strip, but you can buy a 24 hour pass from the duece (double decker bus) for $7.00 per person and you can access anyplace on the strip at any time. As far as being full all of the time this is not true, and yes it may get crowded, but that is everyplace in Vegas. I also like the fact that once I get to the airport, I no longer have to deal with my luggage until I get to my room at the hotel. I find a shuttle that is going to the Stratosphere, hire it to take me and my girlfriend and they take the luggage load it up, and once we get to the hotel the bell hop takes over. They give me a tag and when we get to our room all we have to do is make a call to the bell desk and they bring up our luggage. If you decide to stay at the Stratosphere get a players club card, I can not stress this enough. With this card you will get free yes free game play, free shows, and free food. You can also get your room for free, the second time we went, I didn't have to pay for the room at all because of my players club card. I am now waiting for my next offer, and I was told it would be a better offer (such as flight included). The shows are great and the food even better. The only thing I can say is that I will be back, and I will be staying at the stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet a/c unit........but beige and bland”
Reviews.Author: zany_janey
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Stratosphere for 3 nights with our teenagers. Quick check-in was good, although we'd requested 2 rooms, one with a king bed and the other with 2 queens but they could only give us both rooms with 2 queens so was a bit disappointed there. Good sized rooms but no refrigerator and the ice machine on our floor was broken for our stay, meaning a short hop up to the next floor and back down (or vice-versa). Very reasonable room rates but charge for wireless internet was an absolute rip-off. The views of the strip were great. However, the view from the top of the tower/lounge/restaurant was breathtaking......we just went for cocktails but next time I'll book a meal in the Top of the World Restaurant with the revolving floor - I know it hasn't got a good review food-wise but that view will be more than worth it. We booked the 'Bite' show which was quite good and different from what I was expecting. The bar has a $10 minimum on the poker machines for free drinks, but the drinks were strong so not bad value really. Roxy's Diner @ the Stratosphere is good fun - bit on the expensive side but good for snacks, drinks and staff karaoke. The buffet in the Stratosphere (I think it's called Plate) is excellent value, especially for breakfast - just remember to take your room card with some ID too or they won't let you in. I found the location to be ok, the deuce pass is quite good value and the stop isn't far from the hotel so you can hotel-hop for 24 hours all for $7- not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “OK, just a bit busy”
Reviews.Author: netbakter
Reviews.Content: The good: location (everything within walking distance ;-), nice panorama, friendly staff. The room was alright, although the bathroom could have been a bit larger. The bad: don't go there if you want to have a relaxing evening. Remember, it's Las Vegas and so it is quite busy there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Gaming!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brownybros
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere for a 3 night stay this July. I initially booked a Premier Tower room, but once I checked in, I asked about an ugrade to a Suite. I ended up getting an Executive Suite for a total of $200 more for all 3 nights. Altogether, the move was worth it as the Suite offered better strip views and such comfortable space to relax in the room. The only drawback was that it came with a King size bed (ok for couples) and a pull-out sofa bed. Between my buddy and I, that worked and we each had our own bed. Our room was in the Premier Tower on the 24th floor (top floor), located nearby the Private Pool on the 25th floor. he housekeeping was superb (Irene) and she made sure our place was always clean and new bed sheets. The gaming was excellent. The tables were always at $5 (most, if not all) and the Pit Bosses were so friendly, always encouraging to drinks and joining the Ultimate Rewards program that the hotel offers. What I specifically enjoyed were the people visiting and gambling there. There were many folks that are avid Startosphere gamblers/visitors. They seem to like staying there and gambling there. After my strip, I did too. I plan on returning later this year...

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Value”
Reviews.Author: teacherlady
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here with my two teen age children just prior to our wedding at the Bellagio. For the last 2 days we were joined by the "Mom's" (my mom and my soon to be mother in law). It was a great place for our needs-the kids loved the tower and the thrill rides, the McDonalds and the pizza place on the shopping level were big hits and even the mom's enjoyed the view from the indoor observation deck. We had a rental car and parking was easy. I definately recommend the Premier Tower rooms-access to the garage is quick, Starbucks is right at the elevators, and also access to the shopping level is easy. The best part was you don't have to walk across the casino every time you come and go. We have stayed in both towers and the Premier is definately better. Our room was clean and the staff was good at keeping it that way, despite 2 messy teenagers and their exploding suitcases. The pool area was great, although the really loud holiday weekend dj was a little bit much. We were always able to get lounge chairs and it was never too crowded. Again, getting there from the Premier tower is super quick-just an elevator ride to the 8th floor. Our room was nicely decorated with 2 queen beds and a decent sized bathroom-roomy enough for the 4 of us to all be there at the same time and not fall over each other. (again, much larger than the World Tower rooms). The rooms have been remodeled and look it. We had a view of the jumbo tron on the front of the building, the thrill rides above and a bit of the pool area. We ate at Roxys and Luckys and also frequented the Starbicks in the casino, where service is super fast. The kids really enjoyed Freemont Street. We also visited Red Rock Canyon, which I highly recommend. We want to go back in either the fall or early spring when the weather is more conducive to hiking. There's a new visitor center opening at Red Rock in the fall of 2009. We also ate at the nearby Tiffany's Diner, which was great, cheap and easy to get to. The White Cross Drugstore (Where the diner is located) sells very reasonable supplies-tooth paste, post cards, shampoo, even alcohol. We bought a styrofoam cooler for $2 to keep bottled water and drinks in our room. It worked out really well. Overall, the Stratosphere is a great value for families. We will go back with the kids again.

Reviews.Title: “ok for price - location not good”
Reviews.Author: stewartmck77
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a premier non-smoking room (and the room smelled of smoke!). Very spacious room with 2 queen beds and spacious bathroom. V clean. Location is not good as you are at the very far end of the strip away from everything. There is a bus that goes up the strip but it is extremely slow and takes an eternity to travel up the strip. There is also a monorail which is a 10min walk from the stratosphere but I didn't get this. The pool was good BUT they play music there the whole day and it is really loud so reading or listening to your ipod is nigh impossible. This was pretty annoying. Buffet in hotel is good. Overall, this hotel was really cheap and good value if you don't mind having a bit of a trek to get to the main part of the strip. If I went back, I'd pay more and stay closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value... but I'll look elsewhere first”
Reviews.Author: TA12MO
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the hotel in general were very clean. The tower was amazing--easily the best view of the strip. The location has its pluses and minuses. It is definitely too far to walk to the main strip, but if you rent a car and you plan on getting out and about quite a bit, the location is great due to easy highway access and no strip congestion. The people... eh... not so good. They were not rude, but they could have been more helpful. If I ever go back, I will avoid the "World II Tower" at all costs. I don't think I will stay in that thing if they try to drag me up to the room. The elevators to the tower were terrible and, everyday, during peak periods, I was stuck waiting forever and then riding in a packed elevator. Awful. Also, the room had no view... literally. The view out the window was of a wall about two feet outside the window. The pools were shallow, but nice and not overly crowded. And the parking was great... very convenient and only a short walk to the inside of the hotel. The price was quite good, but with the price, we got what we paid for too. Next time, I will definitely pony up the extra $10 per night to stay elsewhere, but this was still a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: huskertravelers
Reviews.Content: We were quoted a rate but upon check in they tried to tell us we needed to pay more even though we had paperwork with us. It took a a lot of our time to get them to straighten it out and had to call in the manager who was not too friendly. We still ended up having to pay more than the agreed upon rate. But with my daughter getting married the next day I did not have the energy to argue about the discrepancy. I was not about to let his arrogant attitude ruin my day and ended up just walking away and joining my family members who were staying at a different hotel.The room was ok, no frills..I could not get an internet connection in my room. It was clean and had a lot of room in it. We enjoyed the pool area and discounted ride tickets. Except for the billing error and management attitude,it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ajchi3
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay here on wotif.com for the bargain basement price of US$40 for a Saturday night, one night stay. I did get charged the resort fee on arrival, which I think was $8 - but in the grand scheme of things, this still made my stay affordable at under US$50. I arrived just before midnight so check-in was very quick. Parking was easy in the self park and not as far away as some other casinos. I arrived and drove straight down to catch the last Fremont St Experience show of the night, this was good - a very laid back vibe (the bar at Golden Nugget looked like fun). As it was quite late I found food options limited (true of everywhere in Vegas though) and ended up getting McDonalds. I stayed in a standard room (didn't pay extra for the premium tower), and I thought room was very good. 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. Room was on the far side of casino and seviced by seperate elevators, just FYI as this wasn't a problem for me. Everything was clean and worked, bathroom also (hairdryer provided). I breifly went to the pool (adults only) on level 25, not particualrly fancy but good for some sunshine and relaxation. They did play rather loud music though which, at 10am, was a little much. This pool is optional topless (men have to pay an entry fee), there is another pool on level 8 for families. Stratosphere is located right at the North end of The Strip, if you're aware of this you can plan accordingly - I stayed one night here, and spent it at Fremont St - then spent 2 nights in the centre of the Strip. This way of breaking up your time in Vegas is udeful in cutting taxi/bus costs and walking time. My stay was absolutely fine, no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.... better last time.”
Reviews.Author: dragon2java
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Stratosphere, and both times the Housekeeping staff were top notch. Last time the room was perfect, this time was a little too dark/cave like with one tiny window for my taste- I imagine that was because this time reservations were set thru Expedia rather than thru their own reservations system, but considering the cost, I really can't complain. Oh, and the beds were suprisingly comfortable! The distance from the Strip is a bit of a pain, but hey, again, for the price that's o.k.... Exercise never hurt anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: roxbren
Reviews.Content: Maybe we just got the worst room at the place, but we were really disappointed. Weird room layout, bathroom was incredibly small, water from the sink smelled so horrid that we used bottled water to brush our teeth. Front desk staff wasn't very friendly. We weren't happy about the mandatory sky deck fee per night, we only used it once! I'm usually the type of person to give up some conveniences for a good deal, but this was just too much. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Stratosphere Hotel - highly recommended !”
Reviews.Author: MN-Traveler521
Reviews.Content: We 2 stayed at the Stratosphere this last Tuesday and Wednesday nights, after having booked the deluxe room ($30/night) just last Sunday morning on travelocity. Just before that I had read a review on this webpage about an armed robbery at the Circus Circus Annex (motel-style buildings behind the CC towers). I had to cancel my existing reservation at the CC Annex. The Stratosphere is a really nice place; our room on the 11th floor in the Premier tower was clean and elegant. The 2 beds were set up higher than normal (a plus for us taller people) and the comfort level for sleeping on these beds was top-notch. The pool on the 8th floor was clean and refreshingly cool. We were there at 8 AM, quiet and not crowded, but the sun was already high and intense...over 100 degrees. Hotel check-in and check-out was a breeze, the staff there were pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed several buffet meals there, at 25% off for adult hotel guests. You can have the all-day buffet special at $20. Now I read the recent review stating the $5.99 breakfast special at Lucky's (?) Restaurant - wish I had known that earlier. At any rate the buffet had a good selection of all kinds of food items. The only letdown was that the pineapple chunks in the fruitbowl tasted not the freshest. The northbound bus stop along the Strip is easily visible from the hotel entrance, but the southbound bus stop is kinda hidden, you need to walk north about 200 feet to get to it. Not a big issue. It is advised to get the RTC bus system pass. We each had the 3-day pass at $15 each. (otherwise, one trip on the Strip bus will cost $3 for adult) Stratosphere hotel guests have unlimited access to the 2 levels (one is open air) of the Tower observation deck at 108 & 109th floors. Access until 1 AM. Shops on the 2nd floor were interesting...the area had a Parisian/Eiffel Tower atmosphere. We watched the light/music show at the Fremont Street Experience, and enjoyed the (Yesterday band) Beatles concert (lots of songs from 1963 to about 1967) there, too. Refreshing rain on Wednesday afternoon. Visited the Atomic Testing Museum, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money!”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Ciriello
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere at the beginning of June this year and found it to be quite a pleasant stay. Our room was very clean and tidy and excellent value for money. Staff were very nice and helpful. We ate at Lucky's (24 hour cafe), food was tasty and plentiful, my partner just loved the "all day breakfast" for $5.99!! We had a meal at Roxy's Dinner, brilliant atmosphere with great music. We went to see the show with the different stars, two tickets for the price of one, what a bargain!! Lots of good slots and tables. Gym was free, which is a bonus as many hotels actually charge. Yes, the hotel is quite away from the strip, but to be honest we caught the monorail and found this quite reasonable and we were able to nip up and down the strip. "Fremont Street" is a must if you visit Vegas, although very different from the strip, the live music and atmosphere is great!! We enjoyed our stay and would have stayed with them for the full 10 days that we were in Vegas, but unfortunately we found the pool area far too noisy, I agree that Vegas is a 24 hour city, but flying from London UK (13 hours in total) sometimes you just want to rest by the pool! Unfortunately the pool area was blasted with R n B music, don't get me wrong, I love the music, but not when I'm trying to rest!! Shame really....anyway I would recommend this hotel. If you plan to go to Vegas, have fun, we did and fingers crossed we will return next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun, All the Ammentities of a 5 star hotel for alot less money”
Reviews.Author: bluethunder320
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere was alot of fun...Plenty of shopping at their mall in the hotel...Plenty of restaurants to choose from and alot of games and slots to play at this casino for less money....We stayed in a Spa Suite with a strip view for what it would cost to get a basic room at a higher end hotel...We loved it...Rooms are modern...I even got to see their cheapest room available and it was roomy and very modern.... The pool on the 8th floor was hugh and a nice setting with poolside bar and eatery with plenty of lounge chairs to relax under the sun.....The Tower with the rides is awesome and would have to say most people visiting Vegas come to see the tower...While you stay here you get to go up for free as much as you would like while others have to pay..Great views, shops, bar and restaurant at top of the tower....All in all...great place to stay with all the ammentities of a 5 star hotel for alot LOT less....

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cmcatch22
Reviews.Content: We arrived about an hour before normal check in time and found almost no line. Within 2 minutes we were at the desk. They let us go ahead and check in even though we were early. We got to our room which was in the Premiere tower and it was nice; certainly nothing to complain about. It was cleaned every day as expected. The Casino wasn't as smoke filled as I'd feared so that was definitely a plus. The Stratosphere is a little north of the rest of the strip but it's only a two block walk to the Sahara where there's a monorail station that can take you up and down the strip. There's also a bus stop there if you'd prefer to go that route. The only real negatives we experienced were at two of the restaurants there. Lucky's Cafe had bad service and bad food. Roxy's Diner had good food, but the service wasn't any good at all. One of the days we decided to try their all day buffet for $19.99. That turned out to be a pretty good deal as you can go back as many times as you like all day long. Overall it was definitely a good experience and we got an amazing deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great time @ the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: 505girlatheart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Stratoshpere Feb of 09! We had a great time. The check in line was very long and took longer then at a normal hotel. It didn't damper our spirits though. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very curtious. There was a bar in the center as well as a fabulous bar/diner at the stop!! It rotated as you ate so you a 360 view of the city!!! There were also rides at the top which were far to "scary" for us. but the view and the photo ops we got were fabulous... Vegas lights as far as your eyes could see like an ocean of lights.... The food was great, drinks were great. Very Romantic setting..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Summerstar
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from the Stratoshpere because it was so cheap, but I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very nice. The casino and restaurants were nice. It was definitely worth it. The pool was not too good, though, because the water was cold and kids are not allowed in the jacuzzi. And drinks were EXPENSIVE. But otherwise, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “average(vegas standards),clean,friendly”
Reviews.Author: hatter42
Reviews.Content: didn't know what to expect after reading some of the reviews left by other travellers but have to say that overall the Stratosphere was fine. downsides - only one - our room wasn't made up even though we checked in during the early hours of the morning following a long flight from UK.........this was very frustrating! upsides - cheap to stay at, clean, friendly, good buffet $19.99 all day, nice swimming pool with waitress service at your sun bed, happy hour 4pm-8pm in the C bar, rooms spacious and clean, views ok. location - lots of negative reviews on location, particularly in that an average trip to the strip was $15 however we were greatful in one sense that we could taxi back to the Stratosphere to escape the hustle & bustle of other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “probably one of the best value for money hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: weebles_8
Reviews.Content: where else can you stay in an international quality hotel for us$25 per night??? was even cheaper than all the backpacker hostels in vegas. is right on the strip at one end. buses travel up and down the strip every 5 mins stopping right outside the hotel. costs 3bucks each way or 7 bucks for 24hrs. free laundry on 6th floor was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough for me”
Reviews.Author: tink1958
Reviews.Content: Went there on a tuesday but it seemed like a friday. The check-in was long but the desk clerk was very friendly. I smoke but was told to not take a smoking room because they smell very bad. Clerk even said so. She gave us a nice room with view of pool and some other casinos but the room was at the end of long hallway. I had to walk a long way to go smoke. They don't have coffee makers so you have to walk to restaurant to buy coffee or casino floor to get it from waitresses.Thought the bed was very comfy and overall the hotel was ok. Nothing to write home to Mom about.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: vballguy63
Reviews.Content: We got in late and was surprised how long the check in lines were at 10pm, but this is Vegas after all and planes arrive pretty late. Beware that there is a resort fee of $7.50, so although the base rate is quite good, you must remember to add the additional fee on top of it. When we checked in, my daughter who was exhausted went to sleep, but I wanted a bite to eat. Surprisingly all but one of the places close at 11pm. This is Vegas and they are closing at 11? I ordered the hamsteak special and it was very tasty, just wish there were more options. Also, since it is so far north, it would have been difficult to go anywhere as walking can be problematic. The beds were pretty hard, but the room was clean. As a frequent Vegas traveller, I forgot why I had not stayed there recently, now I remember why.

Reviews.Title: “probably wouldn't recommend to a friend”
Reviews.Author: RamblinRabbits
Reviews.Content: We booked the Stratosphere only beacuse it was $26/night and we were on a budget. I think next time I'll cough up a little more money to stay somewhere else. Watch out for the Tahiti Village time share people in the casino. They lure you in by just being friendly and then they won't let you go. My advice is to just ignore them and keep walking. Also beware of paper thin walls. It wasn't really bad, but it could have been. The people next to us were pretty quiet, but we could hear everything they were saying. oh and its like $10-11 to go up in the tower and $12 for 24 hrs of wifi. So, all in all, the Stratosphere was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: spokanecrazies
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a three night stay at the Stratosphere Hotel. We checked in late on Monday and were in a room that was less than what we paid for. We were suppose to have a room with a view of the strip, but we had a view of a parking garage. The room was far from what I would call clean. There were cards, candy wrappers, dust galore under the bed and the couch had enough garbage and change in it to fill half a trash can. The location was a little far from everything. We did find the bus system to downtown very easy and we really enjoyed our trip to Hoover Dam. If and when we return to Vegas, the Stratosphere will not be on our list of hotels to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, fantastic view of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Katrina12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Stratosphere for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. The staff were o.k, but waiting in line was a bit of a hassle especially after a very long journey. The room was a little warn, but o.k. The best thing about the stratosphere was the view! especially from the tower, something you must do while visiting Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: lazgene
Reviews.Content: I paid $24 for a mid week stay. What a deal. Of course you get what you pay for. I rate this hotel a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDocUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere a few years ago in December. For the price it was great value. We had a huge room with a great few. Note: it isn't in the heart of The Strip so prepared for a short walk. If you do go, make sure you go to IHOP for breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not excellent...less attractive casino”
Reviews.Author: arnibaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3nights. We got the room thru priceline bid @ $60 per night. The room was clean but the pattern was just like a motel room. i did not like this room. The bathroom was so small and dark. Any kind of smell from bathroom was easily spread through out the room. Bathtub was and wash basin (which was out side the bathroom) had some water logging problem.. within a minute the wash basin becomes full with water. Bed, room lights, air condition, TV etc were in good condition. Breakfast was expensive but prompt and enough for 2 people. Hotel staffs and checkin staffs all are very good. Parking has enough space. The casino was not so impressive in comparison to other famous casinos on the strip. But good to play, casino staffs are good and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shsan
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Stratosphere. Rooms were good. Hotel and casino are also very good. The tower pass is free for guests staying in the hotel. And enjoyed the mexican food at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but not to play..........”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen4
Reviews.Content: As always, we had a great stay here at the Stratosphere Hotel & Casino during our two stays here in May. We arrived mid May for several week tour of the west by rental car, and this was the first leg of our journey. At the end of our several week trip, we stayed here again before flying home. The first room we had was ok, nice, clean, comfy, but the a/c in the room was this tiny 12 inch by 12 inch vent or smaller......in the wall that took forever to try to cool you down, and it only goes down to 68 degrees (and trust me it never reached that low whatsoever). I didn't sleep well that night, it was hot and stuffy in the room and having allergies/sinus just made it even worse. In playing the slots, we had lost our money quickly as the slots are definitely not loose like they were when we stayed here last summer. They were just eating up the money in a heartbeat!! So we opted to do other things in town and enjoy the Strip by bus. The staff here at the hotel is really super, they really go out of their way and are genuinely friendly kind people. They always are! Our room was nice, although the second room we had, which we used our points from our players club card to upgrade to a nicer room (and the air did work much better I must say!) the room was a little in need of some room cleaning tlc with some mold in the bathroom in several places including the tub/shower. We ate at the diner inside the hotel just outside of the casino area, the service was slow and the food was ok, nothing fancy. It was the diner that's styled like the 50's, I can't think of the name of it right now. Locally we caught the Deuce bus (24 hr. pass is only $7 per person!) right outside the hotel, down away a bit from the cab area at the posted bus stop sign. It was a long ride uptown at night, but worth the savings. If you're in a hurry take a cab, the bus stops at every other hotel it seems and if you don't have the time or patience, this is not for you! We had great service from all the bell personnel we met, from check in (FAST!!!) to checkout!!! Great people to greet you and take care of your luggage, and they were fast bringing it up even when they were really busy the second time we visited. All in all I would stay here again as I have before, but always upgrade the room for the comfort of better air conditioning. Thanks to everyone for making our stay nice here at the Stratosphere Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome strip hotel w/attractions”
Reviews.Author: greeny925
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for the weekend for his birthday and we had the best expereince ever and we frequent Vegas a lot. First off the hotel deal we got (under $100 total w/tax-1nite) was unbelievable to be on the Strip w/strip view. I highly recommend signing up to get email deals as u save a lot verses booking directly through hotel or travelocity or somewhere. The service everywhere was amazing, we were on a budget so we went to the cafe in the hotel that stays open 24-hrs and the waiters were so awesome and outgoing and friendly, food was amazing too for under $50 total for 2 w/tip. You absoultely having to go on all 3rides there (cheaper doing all three/verses individually) they are def an adrenaline rush. Lastely we opted to celebrate birthday just at the bar in the hotel verses club which actually turned out better, we like the one its a circle lounge right by front enterance of hotel, with couches and plasma tv's, they had a live DJ who totally rocked gave my boyfriend a shout out and played whatever music we wanted so we had our club right there. Then pool on 8th floor was great-topless pool on 25th floor if u r daring, had great drinks and drink specials, food was AWESOME, and we played water volleyball w/other guests and the same DJ was there on the 1 & 2's. Even Valet & bellsmen were great! WE HAD A BLAST!!! CAN'T WAIT TO GO BK THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value -- great service!”
Reviews.Author: Anuket83
Reviews.Content: I read about so many horror stories in these Vegas reviews that I was on edge about my own experience! I definitely shouldn't have been! Within 25 minutes of arriving at the Stratosphere, we were checked into our room and it was EXACTLY what they'd promised us - a premier room with a view of the strip. My only negative experience (and it was great for my health) was all the walking. Because the Stratosphere is so offset from the hot spot of the strip, we ended up taking quite a few taxis, and it wasn't all that expensive. All in all, we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a great bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: bubba777
Reviews.Content: Loved the stay and the rooms had all new funishings, new carpet and can't beat the 24 hour breakfast offer at Lucky's for $5.99. We went to some of the higher end hotels and received no drinks while gaming. At Stratosphere, we were waited on immediately and the atmosphere was very friendly and not stuffy. We went to Bellagio and Treasure Island and received no drinks at all and very stuffy hotels. I would stay here again for the bargains. We skipped on the duece bus although for $7 all day was really worth it, but we had a rental car and just used valet for everything. The beds were very comfortable and easy access to everything. Loved the food court as well open 24 hours on the 2nd floor. The hotel also had a DJ in the evenings which was very cool compared to some of the other ones that seemed flat and boring.

Reviews.Title: “Very diapointing”
Reviews.Author: staceytetz
Reviews.Content: When I booked this trip, I knew the Stratosphere was one of the older hotels and I expected to find it slightly outdated and possibly even shabby in a of couple ways; What I am trying to say is that I had modest expectations given the age, location, and price of the hotel. What I did not expect was a hotel room that looked more like it belonged in a flea bag freeway motel rather than on the Las Vegas strip. There were no pictures/art on the wall, but plenty of nail holes, the ceiling in the bathroom was stained with rust, the sink was mega old school and not mounted to a cabinet unit but rather freely to the wall with a tiny, tiny shelf next to it for your things which did not even fit a normal sized cosmetics bag let alone three as there were three of us travelling, the sink was loose from the wall, the walls were paper thin and we could hear everything above, below and beside, and, to top it all off, the room smelled like an ashtray even though there was a 'non-smoking' placard on the door. Even the smoker in our group was put off by the smell. It was one of our group's first time to Vegas and I was so embarassed having been the one who picked the hotel. Considering the cost of the taxi cabs to get to the rest of the strip, any other strip hotel would have been better and probably ended up being cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Best Of The Budget Hotels”
Reviews.Author: myslbek
Reviews.Content: just returned from a week long stay at the strat, and have to say, it is by far the nicest of the budget hotels on the strip. we went to vegas for my sisters wedding and the travelling paty was split up between stratosphere, circus circus and the riviera. After seeing the other hotels accomodation, we most definatlly got the better choice. stayed in a premium king room and had an excellent view of the mountains from our room. the bed was very big and very comfortable, air conditioning worked a treat, and bathroom was huge. rooms are cleaned daily and toiletries included, also replaced daily. The pool on the 8th floor is large and spotlessly clean. plenty of sun loungers to be had, and even the drinks from pool bar are affordable. There is music played all day at the poolside, and is great if you are VERY into R&B, and dont mind listening to the same CD being played constantly for a week!! The strat has a happy hour in the C bar from 4pm-8pm daily, (whoever, this only includes beer, martini and marguerita), but for a cost of $19.99 per person, its a bargain, as alcohol prices are extortionate along the whole strip ( average cost of a beer is $8.00), then add tip!!. We found the hotels buffet to be a good option for meals. an all day ticket costs $19.00, and the range of food is excellent. The strat is at the very end of the strip, which means a VERY LONG WALK to see the other attractions, or an all day bus pass costing $7.00, lasts for 24hrs, but has much needed air conditioning. Be warned tho, it takes a good hour to get the full length of the strip, due to traffic and red lights. A must is a visit to freemantle street in downtown las vegas, prepare to be amazed!. A taxi from the strat costs about $10.00. one last tip (as this whole resort is 1 huge tipping culture) , BEWARE OF AIRPORT TAXI DRIVERS.. an airport run should cost $20. on arrival to las vegas, we were charged $35 as the driver went the long way round onto strip (there is a direct route as we later found out). The strat is a bit out of the way compared to other hotels, but if you dont mind a walk, or a bus ride, it is well worth the rates charged.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel, good value but paper thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishMark1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Stratosphere for 4 nights and the service was fine, the staff were helpful, the rooms were clean, always made up and comfortable. My only real gripe was the noise which travelled from the room next door. The walls must be very thin as our neighbours were not always being loud but we could hear everything....literally EVERYTHING! and it did disturb my sleep on a few occasions. Some of the other casinos are more modern and glamorous than this one which may appear a bit dated and smell of stale smoke more than the others but it was cheap and suited our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Value for money, but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Hotbox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Strat for 3 nights in April on a road trip around California/Nevada and chose it based on the incredibley cheap prices available via Expedia. Upon arrival there was minimal queing and we upgraded our room for an extra $15 a night and from reading some of the reviews, i think this was a very good move. Our room was very modern with a large comfy bed, large bathroom with whirlpool bath and good views of thr strip. The restaurants and casino within the hotel while not amzing, were still good and we enjoyed a bit of a gamble and some feasting at the buffet! The parking and valet staff was very good with a very quick turnaround. The only downside is the location. The Strat is considered to be on the Strip, however it is at the far northern end and is approx 2 miles from the likes of the Bellagio and Caesars. There is a bus available, but it is very slow and on some occasions, walking could be the quicker option! but for the price we paid for the room, we were not too put out by the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate for room on Price Line”
Reviews.Author: cu1992
Reviews.Content: The staff were very accomodating at this hotel. The party that booked our rooms was late because of travel difficulties but the staff allowed us to put the room on our credit card and check in early. This was appreciated because we have a 16 month old that needed a nap. They brought our crib to the room quickly as well. No complaints about the room or the staff. The burger style restuarant had good food but slow service. The hotel also had a McDonald's on the 2nd floor which was a great value. Overall experience was very positive.

Reviews.Title: “Drab room at the Strat”
Reviews.Author: travel_soldier
Reviews.Content: We got a deep discount on the Strat through e-bookers - about £30 for a room. I can only guess you get what you pay for at the Strat. The good: Central location, free entry to the tower (which would otherwise cost $16 per person). Beds comfortable enough. Parking is free, but this is probably the case with all the casinos. The bad: Low ceilings, given two small doubles rather than a single king bed, tiny dingy bathroom with basin outside the bathroom it was so small, jet engine air conditioner unit. Some stains on the carpet. The ugly: Our room was just above the funnels for the casino's air-con/kitchen etc. Very noisy and unsightly. In short - it served its purpose for a night of accommodation. If you are staying any longer serious consider upgrading or probably better - somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: caamsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel in late September 2007 for my wedding at the Bella Luna chapel at the hotel. My husband and I had a group traveling from Maine with us, unfortunately our flight coming into Vegas was delayed for a day due to weather. We showed up the next day and the hotel still had all of our guests reservations after giving them a call that evening to let them know our parties would not be arriving until the next day. We were charged for our night that we were still in Maine in traveling limbo - but working in the industry I was familiar with hotel policies. While at the hotel we enjoyed the casino, bars, the nightclub (it had a section for each decade - the 70s, 80s & 90s), the chapel, shops & McDonalds was even there. Our room was clean, great standard king room with a seating area and a partition seperartion for the bedroom - which was great when everyone was getting together and we met up in my room. I have the greatest memories from my stay and wedding at the hotel - the chapel staff including the photographer were amazing. Can't wait for my return trip to Vegas to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointing experience! Never again!”
Reviews.Author: ranchogrl
Reviews.Content: The service was incredibly awful. The check-in line was comparable to airport screening, only slower. Apparently the very strict check-out rules do not apply to the Hotel itself at check-in, Because although we arrived at the posted 2:00 check-in time, our room was not ready until 5:00! We waited in the lobby for three hours! When I complained that my stay was now less than fourteen hours, and that I would like an extension of the checkout time as a courtesy, I was told this was not possible unless I paid a $32.00 fee. Very disatisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on North Strip, clean and human-size hotel”
Reviews.Author: M0ntreal30
Reviews.Content: After coming back for the fouth time from Stratosphere, I'd like to say i'm always surprised to read reviews like '' The worse hotel on the strip...'' First, who ever did stay at every strip hotel and rated them. It's definately not a 4 or 5 stars hotel but it's a real bargain on the Strip. No, if you don't plan to visit parks life Hoover dam, or do Canyons tours, you won't alsolutely need a car. Monorail is a few dozen yards away . PLus of this hotel: * not too big, not too small. about 2500 rooms, and a casino floor which is easy to navigate in. * good selection of inexpensive restaurants on site * u can go for free in the tower * large pool with plenty or chair . Lot of space between chairs, which is not the case at Mirage for example. *Fair selection of slots machines *Hotel guests are more on a casual dress code than other expensives options on the strip Cons: *at night, the area between Stratosphere and sahara is a little bit scary . The should send more police there to monitore drug dealers or other bad stuff like this... *strong cigarette smoke odor , mostly on casino floor *exept dining at the Top, option for dinner are not very fancy ( Buffet, some casual restaurants) * the removed self check-in machines which were very useful when waiting lines are long. Had to wait about 30 minutes ,even with a late evening arrival ( 11h30 PM) *make sure to ask for Premium tower beside regency Tower as their rooms are nicer and ask for superior floors Overall, it's a good base to explore Strip, visit some attractions nearby and you still have money to play in Casino or see shows .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Jeejy
Reviews.Content: The location is quite far, if you choose to stay here you should have car.The room in the new building is good and clean and good value for money. Check in/ out service is fast, no need to wait and que up.They also give us a fun book that was a great deal.You can visit the stratosphere tower free in daytime. The breakfast buffet is O.K. The hotel also has a adult pool ( women enter free) We don't spend so much time in the hotel, so we don't mind about the service. It's good value for money! Just stay in day time and go-out for show,dining etc on the strip at night and save you many bucks..it worths!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, another good stay...”
Reviews.Author: Rich16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year from Sept 29 to Oct 2, 2008, in their promotions, although the rooms were much better, paying just $ 26.55/night plus taxes, i got pictures about the improvements they have made, i am not sure if its all the rooms, but the new bedding is much better than last years...the only thing lacking really is the location, other than that, its another good stay at the stratosphere, of course if you wanna go where MGM Hotel, NY NY Hotel, and others are located then take the "Deuce" the bus that goes up and down the strip 24 hours a day, (double decker bus) they did raise the prices up from $5/24 hours to $7/24 hours and that starts the moment you purchase the pass, so if you bought it at 1pm today, it expires at 1pm tomorrow, of course you gotta have the exact change, another option which i took this year was the 3 day pass which sells the pass at only $ 15.00 comes out to 5 bucks a day which was the old price, buy it online, or at Vending Machines located only at a FEW locations....

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay - Amazing value for $33 per night”
Reviews.Author: mightymousemighty
Reviews.Content: Yes its not the bellagio, but at $33 cant argue. No problem with housekeeping, clean every day. The stratosphere business model seems to be pile them in cheap and make money on the buffet and casino. Overcame not being in the centre of action by hiring a car for our stay which allowed us to hop all over vegas. With each casino having a free garage we turned a slight negative into a big positive. If you stay here without a car and move around alot like we did expect to pay in taxi fees which if you have payed higher room rates just doesnt add up. We were on a 3 week vacation and used the cheap laundry facilities. Dont bother either the washing machine or detergent offerred is rubbish. I suspect the Stratosphere is like Marmite. You love it or hate it!

Reviews.Title: “Lazy housekeeping staff. Stay here if you don't mind a dirty room.”
Reviews.Author: jeminlondon
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight to the longest check in line I've encountered (and I've travelled a lot!). Waited 30 minutes to be assisted by a gentleman that spoke basic, broken English. We had a lot of trouble understanding him. In the end the information he provided us with told us what he meant to say! The room was large enough, with a spa bath. On the second day of our trip, we arrived back to our room at 8pm prior to going out for the evening to find that our room had not been cleaned. We rang housekeeping and were told it would be done before midnight. Arrived back and it had been cleaned around 10pm. Third day, same problem. Rang and was told the same thing. Arrived back at 10pm again to a still uncleaned room. Made a complain to the front desk to be told it had not been reported to housekeeping and that there was a note on our account that we had the "Do not Disturb" sign on the door. As we had left at 8am that morning for the day we certainly did not put the sign on the door. Housekeeping finally arrived at approx. 11pm. On the very last night of our stay, I requested a blanket. I rang six (yes, that's right, six) times to request it over the period of the day. Again, I made a complaint to the front desk where it was met with little concern from them. Also, note that the hotel is at the end of the Strip. To get to the main areas it is a 30 min walk, or you can catch the Deuce bus (if you can fit on) and it will probably take the same amount of time but at least you are in air conditioned comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with plenty to do, but poor location”
Reviews.Author: MillsMC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 18 hotels in Las Vegas, and this one is better than average. I really like the Stratosphere. I think that going to the top, looking at the view of the city, and watching the crazy people ride those rides up there is the best thing to do in Las Vegas. I live in Vegas, and it's a must-see for my out-of-town visitors. If you stay here, you get unlimited free passes to the top (usually $15). They also have good shows, like American Superstars (imitators of various singers) and the adult topless vampire-themed bite. The pool has recently been refurbished. I'm anxious to see it, because when I was there, it was nice (on the 8th floor). There is also an adult-only pool on like the 30th floor, and access to the gym is free. The buffet is a better deal than most on the strip, at $17. All of this is very important, because even though the Stratosphere is technically on the strip, it's far from the action, and in a questionable part of town, at that. You can obviously take the bus or a cab to the main part of the strip, but it's a far walk, and you might not feel comfortable doing that. But for how much they charge, and as much as they have to do there, it's definitely worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Ummm a not so good exp.”
Reviews.Author: spanda011
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at the place. The hotel is great and so is the casino. However i did not find the place to be great value for money. I think there are better places at Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Far enough away, but close enough to the action”
Reviews.Author: tofwig
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel deal for a steal. 3 people in a delux room for £54 (ish) each. check in was simple, we did try the "bribe" at check in, she took the $50 and gave us NOTHING more than we had booked already. was worth a try! i read quiet a few reviews and was expecting it to be in a hell hole of a area, but we found this not to be the case. The casino was fun won a lot, but lost alot too. the drinks service was fantastic i could not fault the girls coming round one little bit, as long as you gave a dollar tip you would soon be asked AGAIN within 5-10 mins, maybe this was down to our british accents? who care's we made it pay! hats off to the girls! we did little more than drink and gamble while in vegas for our first trip and i found this hotel spot on. only a short cab ride / monorail ride away from the action in the middle of the strip but far enough away to escape it for a few hours. we will be coming back to vegas again and i wouldnt think twice about booking this hotel again. anybody having second thoughts as to this hotel. calm down, dont worry. I am glad we didnt stop in the middle of the strip because its too in your face you need a little time to recover, and you could be tempted to over do it knowing your only 5-10 minute walk away to get changed and then your back out again, this could be a bad thing, ha. all in all us lads from castleford had a fantastic time even though hatton lost. Vegas...............You ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: rijets
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed in the Stratosphere hotel in quite a while and I quite enjoyed it. They had provided a room in their newer tower and it was better than last time since it has been remodeled. The bathrooms could of used a upgrade since they looked much older than the room itself, but overall still a good place to stay just on the price of the room alone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean super-cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: sfbay22
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a casino on the strip. Stopping over in Las Vegas for the night, the Stratosphere had some great deals in April. The room was nice, well furnished. The only downside is the fact that it is at the very end of the strip, pretty far from everything else to see in Vegas. There is a shuttle down the strip (which we did not try), but it could be a pain to get to restaurants or other casinos if that is what you are looking for. Only other downside is that the pool closed so early (7:00pm)

Reviews.Title: “Gloriously Valued”
Reviews.Author: leighdude
Reviews.Content: We met up with our friends in Vegas. They were staying at The Stratosphere. We got to spend a few nights with them. The hotel itself is really pretty. I love the fact that you can see it when you're driving into Vegas. The beds were ultra comfortable. The prices are what blew our minds. About $45 per night. Everyone was very friendly at the hotel. The pools are great too. The Stratosphere even has a house DJ. Unlimited drinks for $19.99 at C-Bar from 4-8 is a steal too, if you're a drinker. It's a busy weekend-revolving casino. The only downsides that we had when we stayed there were the distance from the Strip and also the air didn't seem to work very well. It got pretty hot. Overall, I would recommend a stay at the beautiful Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orengivi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Stratosphere and it's the only hotel that didn't upgrade honeymooners from all hotels we stayed in our honeymoon. The hotel is on the beginning of the strip, amazing view from the tower - highly recommended for both day & night - but rather then that, it's average. No such defference for higher floors, cheap room will do its job, nice buffet, nice pool, very close stores for cheap drinks and snacks, nice staff and slow service. I would defenetly choose next time better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbride08
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue . . . however with many recent stays to Vegas and reviewing other hotels we've ventured into along the way I would to do some good for Stratosphere Hotel and Casino. My hubby and I have stayed twice at Stratosphere. I was very hesitant the 1st time because #1 being location and #2 being not so great reviews! I have never been more impressed with a hotel. Yes the location is definately the downfall but you know what . . . it's Vegas plan to walk and wait no matter where you stay. And you have the option of the Deuce. The hotel was very clean, service was great . . . although when arriving we heard people screaming at the employees at the front desk about issues but our stay was wonderful. We had issues getting into a room but not a biggie . . . they actually put us up in suite for the inconvience. Comfortable clean rooms!. Loved the pool area and even ventured up to the European pool as well for awhile to sunbathe. Had a blast at the Stratosphere. Food prices reasonable with gift shops and a McDonalds on the 2nd floor as well. You can purchase your own alcohol and snacks, ect. That was nice and convienent. Didn't mind the location at all. Loved it so much we booked again in December for Xmas and stayed in a Romance suite. Loved the HUGE jacuzzi with the french doors. Beautiful view, wonderful experience. Never has the Stratosphere disappointed us. We haven't stayed in a few years now. We stayed at the Mirage for our Honeymoon and all we could say was how we wish we would have stayed at the Stratosphere instead! Will return again . . . miss staying there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: travelingbuddy034
Reviews.Content: stayed at the stratosphere this past weekend and it was great. rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.only problem was the tubs,they were so high and hard to get in. last resort on the strip but within walking distance to start your trek down the strip.go up on the tower and the view is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: almagutten
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere is a great place to stay at. Though its a little bit away from the action in the center of the strip. Liked the pool and the buffet. Dont forget to pay a visit to Top of the world for a dinner with fantastic view. Stayed here two times and i probably will go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A view of the LV strip that is magical”
Reviews.Author: raag76
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere gives a magnificient view of the Vegas strip. And the crazy rides on top are only for the braveheart. We got a strip view room and enjoyed the amazing night view of Vegas from the comfort of our room. The breakfast spread at their restaurant, though pricey, offers a wide variety for all tastes. Conveiently located with plenty of parking space and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Louway
Reviews.Content: this was the 1st place we stayed at on our trip we were happy with all aspects of our hotel choice quality and cleanliness. we got a great deal on this hotel and wanted to stretch our dollar further. We had a hire car so found it no problem to get around. without transport it would be difficult due to distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice pool, otherwise with kids stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: xkmail
Reviews.Content: When I got to the hotel all the rooms were booked I got free upgrade to a 2 room suite. The suite was beautiful, the linenes fresh, nice paint, wonderful mattress, 5 star room. Now, North vegas strip is kind of away from the other hotels, most of the hotels nearby are for transients and crackheads, you do not roam around at night at the Stratos. The next morning we walked to the dennys for breakfast, stratos has a $19.99 all day buffet, pay once, eat all day all you want, great deal but we were only there for a few hours and could not comment on the food. they also have a 4-8pm happy hour, all you can drink $19.99, but I don't drink either. Nice poker room, nice and busy casino floor. Staff was beyond friendly, pool on the 8th floor is nice, lots of lounge chairs, nice towel bar. Bring a beachball they have a big net over the pool, otherwise like $10 for a "rental ball". Not real family friendly like SouthPoint, Mandalay, Luxor, or Circus Circus. PS the stratos is not a hotel per say but an attraction, it has two wings that are 23 stories and I say again, nice rooms, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better deal elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: AzJules
Reviews.Content: For the money we should have stayed elsewhere. Our room was located in the Regency Tower. We had trouble finding the correct set of elevators and were redirected by staff several times to where they "thought" the elevators were. Although it was a non-smoking room it reeked of smoke and other contaminates. The room was very small, in need of renovations, and the bathroom was more like a small closet where it was difficult to open the door and get out because the toilet was located so close to the doorway. The shower nozzle was positioned approximately 4 feet above the shower tub floor, so if you are taller person, like me, you have to contort yourself for a full wash. The smell of the sulfur water was enough too make you grab your purse and not come back until you were ready to pass out to the constant hum and hissing of the AC units right outside our 2foot wide window. The hotel is on the strip but at the far, far end which requires lots of walking to get to any worth-while attraction. On the plus side, the beds were comfortable. The first time and last time I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: SonyaRedDeer
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Statosphere was great. The Hotel was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We had no problems checking in. From check-in to being in our rooms took about 12 min. Our rooms were in the Premier Tower, with a view overlooking downtown. We had non-smoking rooms, with close access to the pool on the 8 floor. With the weather being in the high 20's, it was great relaxing by the pool. The staff was very friendly, and more than willing to help. Food was also fine. For the price we paid, you just can't go wrong. Remember people this is not "Ceasar's Palace or the Bellagio" , if that's want you want then fork out the $$ and stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere staff were useless”
Reviews.Author: JShoey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere for 3 nights after a 5 night stint at the Excalibur. The Stratosphere was very clean inside and the room was nice and well furnished. After gambling away I found the slot payouts were ridiculous and there was a serious lack of slot machines. I chose this hotel/casino because of the promised nightlife and entertainment. On the first night there the C Bar was busy and that was pretty much it. The Armadillo bar is unmarked and hidden at the far end of the casino with only a few people out front. I was told by hotel staff that the bar had changed several names over the past few months and no one knew the open and close times for it. The nightclub, although advertised, is non existent. I encountered rude staff at check-in, slots, bar, starbucks, ticket counter, and tower. Signage is also terrible, it is pretty hard to find your way around the place for the first day. The pricing sign at the tower tickets booth says $12 for hotel guests, its actually free and the staff member that told me this hinted for tip. Overall the place is cheap but the staff and anything relating to information and signage is beyond terrible, and the walls are extremely thin. The BEST places to go in the Stratosphere are the magic shop and nacho restaurant both on the shopping level, these people were great.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & clean, but away from the action.”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Bradley
Reviews.Content: We found the Stratosphere to be a very clean and reasonably priced hotel. But... If you're lookng for evening entertainment away from the gaming tables then this isn't the place for you! It's own nightclub has closed down and the advertised 'live nightly entertainment' simple didn't exist. You need to head down the strip for your evening jollies. This isn't a great problem as the Deuce bus stops right outside the hotel, but the ride down the busy strip can take an hour! It's just as quick to walk but is a bit of a trek to find the action, and it's best not to wander around the area near the Strat after dark. We were happy with the Strat for this holiday, but wouldn't stay there next time as it's just too far from the fun. However, if the location doesn't bother you then there's nothing wrong with staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Would Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: alhambramd
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is so-so, the facilities obviously need some remodeling. The hotel is about 1 mile north of all the action, quite a way to walk. The pool area was mediocre. The entertainment was likewise bland. We did get to see "American All-Stars", which was Stratosphere's celebrity impersonation act. Also, got a chance to go to the top floor private pool, which was advertised as a "Europen Pool", i.e. patrons can be naked if they wish. Men have to pay for entrance while women get in for free. It was all hype tough, the pool was just so-so. It was a good thing we got rooms in the new wing. At least the rooms looked fresh. it was quite a walk though to get to the elevators (or pretty much to anywhere). PROS: Cheap rates CONS: Off-strip THE VERDICT: Unless I was looking for some isolation, probably would go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Returning Guest Returns Once Again”
Reviews.Author: MOJO329
Reviews.Content: We are returning Stratosphere guests this time staying in a non smoking double queen deluxe room. These rooms are somewhat smaller than the premier rooms that we have usually stayed in. However, our room met our family's needs perfectly is was clean throughout and comfortable. We did not use the pool area at this time due to the cool windy weather that Las Vegas was experiencing during our stay. We appreciated the routine patrols that security makes throughout the hotel's self parking garage-it was a reassurance. We dined at Lucky's Cafe for their breakfast special(s)-it was enjoyable and met our family's appetite(s). However, the Tahitti timeshare resort personnel can be abit bothersome as you enter/exit the hotel/casino with their offers of show tickets if you give of your time to attend one of their resort timeshare seminars. Should we visit Las Vegas in the future, we will definitely consider staying at the Stratosphere once again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay here, thank goodness”
Reviews.Author: TXGirl2001
Reviews.Content: Okay, no we didn't stay at the Stratosphere on our recent trip to LV, THANK GOODNESS! We were with a large group and some of the group did stay there. Overall, their comments were that it was okay, but has gone downhill. We all met at Lucky's (the 24 hour cafe) to eat after a late night - the service was nice, food just okay. What was very off-putting were the other people in the restaurant/casino area. My husband was approached by a man on the way into the bathroom, who asked him if he needed any crack or weed. Another woman in our party was approached by an obviously intoxicated (or high) man, who was mumbling something about what time the gift shop was open (which was right next door). It was actually a bit scary to me and we were glad to leave when we did. This place might be a good value compared to some strip hotels, but a little too shady for me.... The hotel needs to have better security and be more vigilant about keeping people safe.

Reviews.Title: “The View from top is Just AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: bingu_kar
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere Hotel, Casino and Tower is the place to be in if you want to have a bird's eye view of Las Vegas Strip. I loved the view from top. But the rides on top are crazy. If you are an adrenaline gushing thrill seeker, you are at the right place. Nothing compares the rides at the top of the Tower in terms of thrill. Casino is great, just as it is at all Las Vegas hotels. One disadvantage though - This hotel is relatively at the far end of the strip. So, other attractions are a little far off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, would recommend wholeheartedly!”
Reviews.Author: ccameron71
Reviews.Content: We were nervous after reading many negative reviews, but couldn't have been happier with our stay. The hotel was clean and comfortable, our room, the basic one was large, clean, recently decorated with a fantastic bed.
