The food was nice throughout and the Courtyard buffet was great value at $19.99 for all you could eat all day, it was a bit repetitive over the course of 10 days but that was the only small niggle I could find. If you're after Wolfgang Puck go elsewhere & pay the appropriate price! All staff were very friendly towards us and the cocktail waitresses were very attentive. We liked the position on the strip as both downtown & the Strip were within easy walking distance, anyone who claims otherwise unless they are elderley or have a physical impedement is just lazy! The local area is more "Real" than the central strip with some motels, 7/11's and even the occasional beggar (but even these called me sir!) but never did it feel intimidating or dangerous. As a final note I can recommend the little Thai restaurant just opposite called "Ocha", it doesn't look much but the food is delicious & cheap and you can get a $2 beer, not that common in vegas unless you're in a Casino.

Reviews.Title: “fun trip”
Reviews.Author: workingclassryan
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere is far down the strip and not accesible to anywhere except by bus which is unconvenient and taxis which are pricey. Our vacation was incredible but next time well shoot for a different hotel. Everything was very expensive and the staff were not very helpful, unless you can count the hoardes of agents trying to get you to sit through their timeshare seminars. the buffet was a good deal. 20 bucks for all day, and the food was great. The hotel was very neat and exciting, but we had more fun on the strip. vegas is awesome and we had a blast for our first time

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great value, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: thalimar1024
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas, and booked this trip through Expedia. Was a really great deal! Like most people state, the hotel is on the far end of the strip, but that did not prove to be a problem. We rode the monorail and the deuce bus to get around. The hotel is really close to the Fremont Street Experience, only a 2 miles away. When we first arrived, it was about noon, and check in is not supposed to be until 3 pm. They allowed us to check in early, no problem, and there was only a couple of people in line to check in when we arrived. I requested a room on the highest floor available, and they accomodated me on that, was on the top floor. The room was clean, we had a great view of the mountains. I didn't pay the extra $$ to get a view of the strip. Immediately the housekeeper made us feel welcome, very friendly lady. The room size is pretty normal compared to other hotels I've stayed in, and the decor was really nice. Beds were really confortable. There's is plenty to do in the hotel itself. There's plenty of restaurants to choose from, and even a McDonald's for a cheap or late night snack. A Starbucks in the casino. We went and saw the 2 shows they have available at the hotel, American Superstars and Bite. Loved both shows, the impersonators were absolutely amazing. I especially enjoyed Michael Jackson. And the other show, Bite, awesome show. The coreography, the music, loved it. And after each show, you have the opportunity to take pictures with the cast. And the best part is that by staying at the hotel, you get tickets for these shows at half price, which is buy one get one free, so it is a really great deal, 20 bucks per person, you can't beat that. As far as location goes, this hotel is not on the main part of the strip, but that's not to say that's a bad thing. There is easy access to transportation right by the hotel, whether it be the monorail, the deuce bus, or if you prefer, there are plenty of cabs waiting in front of the hotel. Right nearby within walking distance is a Denny's and an IHOP for those of you who like breakfast anytime of the day. I felt pretty comfortable with the location of the hotel. I would advise any of you who do decide to take the monorail, access it through the Sahara Hotel, there's a connection there. Rather than going the back streets which does seem a little unsafe, especially at night. I did not have the guts to get on the rides, but we did get to go up to the tower observation deck, which has a breathtaking view of the city, and at the same time you can see the daring people above you on the rides. Upon checkout, the hotel also offers late checkout at 3pm if you need it, for an additional $20 bucks, which is a great idea if you have a later flight. We utilized this feature, and was great since checkout is at 11, and our shuttle wasn't picking us up until 2:30pm. Checkout was pretty quick, the TV checkout was unavailable, but just a quick call from our room down to the reservation desk to let them know we were checking out was all it took. And just as a last note, I was not charged that $7 daily resort fee that everyone speaks of. I don't know if that was an oversight on the hotel's part, but I have my itemized statement and nothing like that is showing up. The only bad thing I did see is the fact that the hotel charges $12 per day for wifi access. A bit excessive, but I guess for the price of the hotel, you really can't complain too much. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody, especially if you're on a budget. I had a very good experience here, and would definetly stay here again. Everyone was friendly, hotel room was clean, everything was actually really clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Chidee
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal from a travel site for 29$ a night. Plus the 7.50$ resort fee + taxes...still all under 45$ a night for a Sunday through Friday checkout trip. Fantastic. Yea the Casino is getting dated, the rooms are just fine. Comfy beds, crisp white linens, bathroom is roomy (needs updating) and on the strip. The END of the strip but really... you're there to play in the "Fake Theme Park" which is Vegas...you're sleeping, not hanging out in your hotel room. Staff were friendly, check in was lengthy, check out speedy. Free shuttles to the strip at night, and if you don't wanna wait, 3$ one way on the Deuce bus or 15$ for a 3 day all access pass...what more can you ask for? Front door service to every casino on the strip and a bus to and from the airport!! The Stratosphere has shops upstairs, Fat Tuesdays for your Margarita refill and a few trinket shops, and a Mc D's for late nigh food. I didn't have a chance to try the buffet line was huge! Great variety of slot machines and tables. I was too chicken to ride the tower rides....but they looked awesome! The pool was clean and refreshing, I didn't realize there were 2 pools until the last day. Oh well next time! I also saw the BITE show at the Stratosphere. Campy, cheesy, like Buffy but with alot of boobs. It was great! I'll be back!!! I had a blast in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: maliceuk
Reviews.Content: I liked it as it was not really busy like some other casinos,did not get any hasstle.Was bargin holiday.Is in a good spot,near to downtown and the strip.It has food places nearby.Even the local bums were friendly to us.The buffet was great.We are planning on gpong back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel to stay in more than once.”
Reviews.Author: SueCoventryUK
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Vegas hotels ranging from the Monte Carlo to the Venetian, the Stratosphere is the most friendly hotel we have ever stayed in. It has great rooms, we stayed in a smoking room No3-22-02 it was very clean and decorated nicely. The only draw back was the very small bathroom but it was adequate with the bason on the outside. We ate at the Courtyard Buffet, Lucky's, Roxy's and Felllini's and found the food to be of high quality. If you want to eat on the cheap there are a few snack bars on the second floor selling burgers to pizza. All the staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are cleaned thoroughly every day. If you are going to be gambling then get the Ultimate Rewards card, you can soon rack up the points, the points can be used on food, drink or in the gift shops. The hotel is quite a way from the other casinos and a taxi to the middle of the strip is about $20 but there are other methods of transport including the Deuce bus and the monorail. We always said that we would try a different hotel on every stay but we have found a truely great hotel where we would go back time after time.

Reviews.Title: “What an unpleasent surprise.”
Reviews.Author: rc1933
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was for an attractive rate, however, after driving 8 hours we were confronted at the check in desk with a form I was required to initial approving an additional charge of $7.50. Not a lot of money but I consider their tactic very unethical and sneaky. We were tired and this was, of course our only reservation. I initialed the form because we were tired and wanted to go to a room and relax. The room was small and of the cheap motel variety. Not to relaxing. On the plus side, they had a good buffet. I well not stay at the Stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: daplushman
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Lost Wages (Las Vegas) so I did not know really what to expect. We arrived at the hotel and was impressed with the huge tower in front of us. After the long walk through the casino and dodging the time share sellers (no means no), we made it to the front desk. We check in with no problems and made it up to our spacious room. We went and hung out on the strip. The first night we caught taxis everywhere but we quickly learned that was the expensive way to go. The next day we discovered the monorail and that saved us a ton of money. We had dinner at theTop Of The World restaurant and that was great!!! Great food and we had the best view of Vegas in town. Other than the timeshare folks hitting you up every time you go to your room, it was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere is ghetto”
Reviews.Author: foofcabana
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I reserved a room at the Stratosphere because it was a good price at the time. We were welcomed by a friend who worked at the front desk. He immediately upgraded us to a suite. The room was pretty nice. In the casino i couldn't believe how many cigarette bums there were. I think I handed out about half a pack before I devised a strategy so people wouldn't bother me anymore. My girl and I were crossing the street and witnessed a drug deal. Also our camera was stolen from the hotel room. Thanks guys

Reviews.Title: “It was free and I still moved to another location!”
Reviews.Author: soleglo
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of the action on the strip, DO NOT stay at this place. If you do you will be walking many blocks back and forth to the action on the strip, or you can ride the DEUCE bus back and forth or take a taxi. The double room I was in was very small and the sink smelled like the sewer. I overheard other people with the same complaint. Another colleagues room had never been cleaned when she returned to it at 3 a.m., even though she had the placard on the door asking that it be cleaned. If you are on a strict budget I know these rooms can be found on hotwire for $27, probably cheaper on priceline, but I still wouldnt stay here. The breakfast provided was not good either, although the fruit was very sweet and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “great - especially for price”
Reviews.Author: dicknasty08
Reviews.Content: fun atmosphere - no pretentious bull like most strip hotels, but still nice. Plus good comps

Reviews.Title: “Far from the strip, but satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mmasmurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in mid March. The check in was easy and speey and the hotel employee was very professional and helpful. The room was nice and clean and felt very welcoming. the bell man was helpful and polite (I think his name was Mike). The only negative points is #1. we had mold growing in the ceiling of the shower. #2. the hotel is pretty far from everything on the strip. Take your walking shoes and some water b/c you'll need it. The monorail is nice to take. The hotel's website boasts of a free shuttle to the airport (FALSE) and a $3 bus to downtown and the strip (this is the strip bus, not the hotel's bus and is usually quite crowded). Fellini's was a nice restaurant. Even for being on the casino floor it was not loud. The food was good (had the lobster and asparagus over penne). Roxy's was a nice place for lunch. Good food and fun atmosphere. The popcorn place upstairs has good hot dogs and good popcorn. The breakfast buffet was tasty, but the lunch items did not seem very appealing. We had lunch at the Top of the World restaurant. The food was good, and the sites were neat but the service could have been a little better. Our whole family arrived after we did and everyone stayed in the hotel as well. The only problem was that one room did not have a remote control for the TV. The front desk had one brought up shortly after they arrived. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay. Would we go back? Probably so.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms - Awesome Beds - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: michiganmom24
Reviews.Content: Will go back! We chose this hotel because of the "cleanliness" reviews, and I have to say they were correct. In Vegas, your usually not in your room that much -but they were very clean the the beds were amazing! The buffet was good - especially with the "deal" if you are staying there. Roxy's was great food and entertainment. The Parking Garage was very user friendly - easy in and out - we just drove down the strip and parked. Lots to do at the Casino - with the shopping mall and the tower - casino was also good to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price but away from the 'center' of the strip”
Reviews.Author: iggyz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in March. Check in was quick but was told that the king strip view rooms were all taken and they would put us in a room on a lower floor and we could change in the a.m. We did indeed change rooms the next day but waited until the early afternoon until check out had occured. Both rooms were cleen and simple- good for a place to rest our heads for the night. In the mornings when we would leave the room and put the service sign on the door, if there happened to be cleaning ladies near they would ask if we were going to be gone awhile or for a short amount of time and regardless even if we popped back in to get something we forgot the room was already clean! The cleaning staff did a great job each time of giving us new towels & soaps/shampoos etc and overall did a really good job! All the staff that we encountered were nice & helpful,however, steer clear of the Tahiti Village people. My husband got sucked into the it and signed up, forked over the $40 thinking that we would just go back the next day and get a free meal & show tickets. I read the fine print later and it said that we had to sit thru a 2.5 hr time share presentation which they never told him. We decided not to do it and lost the $40 but we would have lost it gambling anyway I'm sure. The pool was nice- it was during the spring break time so there were quite a few 'kids' there which was fine. The drinks at the pool bar were great and not watered down. Roxy's diner was really good- especially the shakes (and the staff sings too). We went to the top of the tower and my husband did the Big Shot ride and he LOVED it (and he's scared of heights too). Also, if your a guest there you get up to the tower free. The shops & eateries on the upper level were'nt that great. There are two Travelocity.com consierge desks. We went to the one on the upper level to rent a car the day we were leaving so we could go see the Hoover Dam (a must!) and there was a big line and the people infront of us said they had been there 45min and apparently the car rental agency within the hotel ran out of cars and they were trying to shuffle some around & shuffle people to other locations for them! It was a mess. So I went to the one downstairs by the chek in and the girl there was super helpful and got us another rental from an agency off the stip and they picked us up and droped us off free of charge! After eating at they buffet at Excalibur (its HUGE & GOOD) we decided one morning to eat at the Strat buffet. It was really not that good or big- I'd go else where! We also ate at Fellini's which was pretty good, but if your going to spend the money on an Italian dinner go to The Hole In The Wall. We didn't find out about it until after and everyone said it was the best.The Stratosphere Hotel & Casino is at the north end of the strip. by taxi it doesn't take long (a few minutes) to get down to the center. I walked from the Strat to the MGM and it took all afternoon. Also, the tram is super cheap - I think $5 for 1 trip and $13 for an all day pass. It stops at the Sahara which is right down the steet and it runs every 6 mins- the signs for it are all well and clearly marked in the hotels. We never saw any shady people, hookers, or felt unsafe. Take this review as is but let me tell you that I alway read reviews and research things & hotels prior to going so I would consider my review fair & honest.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dp60
Reviews.Content: If any persons on the wolrd would think to save money just because you have to sleep few hours while you're in las vegas, than search for something else, everything you save from hotel room you'll spend on taxi ride to reach las vegas attractive spots. Since you check-in you'll feel not to be welcome, it doesn't matter how long is the line waiting for check-in, it will take around 30 to 60 minutes before is your turn, front desk employee very unprofessional and looks very unhappy to work in this hotel. I book tower room and without explanation she give me room in different block with different quality of furnitures and services, everything here looks very old and consumed after time to time, the casino it seams to be inside of sigars room, if you're non smokers you don't want even spend a minute around the tables, and also when you need to go your room you must pass through all casino and smoke air every where, orrible!!!!. The view restaurant has the baddest service quality of las vegas' restaurants with the most expensive price range for lowest quality of food. Las vegas is beautifull and you can realy enjoy your stay but don't stay at stratosphere if you don't want to go away with bad memory, las vegas does meet all your needs to enjoy your stay so stay anywhere else instead of this hotel. I like to go to las vegas almost every year, and this experience I will never forget as well I will forget the name of this hotel. I suggest to spend little more money and book your hotel 5 stars through hotwire.com, you'll be very well surprise and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Hotel--Far Away--Stay somewhere ELSE”
Reviews.Author: junepearl609
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the end of March 2009 and was terrible. I booked two queens with a premium view and got the parking lot. When I asked about this, I was informed that is a premium view, crazy. In the room, there was a table with two chairs and no recliner. Very Motel 6 like. No coffee makers and no cable TV. Got 8 channels. Asked about the coffee makers and was told only the sites have them. Bathtub was dirty as we found hair in it. Service in the casino was poor. I was sitting at machine and asked for a black coffee and was told I was not pplaying as there was no credits in the machine as I just sat down. I advised I was a guest at the hotel and I was forced to show my room key. The C bar bartender was horrible. He did nt how to make a martini nor a shot called snakebit which is Yukon Jack and Lime Juice. Crazy. Too far to walk to anywhere and at night it was creepy out with the cab drivers elling hey u want a date. The casino is rather small and you will get bored of thesame machines. Not even worth to stay for free. I am willing to give me details if wanted you may email me at sweetbug0609@yahoo.com as I do not want others to have experience such a horrible time when you are in Vegas, you are to enjoy your self.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected, but a problematic start”
Reviews.Author: Jesena
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews, we were quite wary about what we would find when we finally arrived and honestly, we were pleasantly surprised. But we had our problems first with the check-in. The check in line was not long, but it took a while also we said we definitly wanted a NON Smoking room. The lady wasn´t really interested in our wishes and just gave us a smoking room? After we went to our room (we booked a Deluxe King with a jacuzzi)... it smelled horribly. Yup, it was a SMOKING room. We went down again (with all our belongings and asked for a NON smoking room. But unfortunately, there were no more rooms left for non smokers. We had to down-grade to a normal queen room for a night, without even an apology or something free. The lady even claimed we specially asked for a smoking room ??? HELLO, we are not stupid. So we had to go down again in the morning and had to be in the hotel by 6pm to change into our King with Jacuzzi. That was the rocky part... In the end we were on the 20th floor with strip view, which was nice. The remodeled upper-floor section of the hotel does look nice and it is definitely an excellent deal. The roooms were cosy, clean and with lots of pillows and a good mattress. The casino itself is average and in typical Las Vegas style, so nothing special to tell you about that. The Buffet is not really good, it is cheaper than many others but not really a value for your money. Because the Stratosphere is slightly off strip, you may be willing to sacrifice proximity to the downtown to save a couple bucks. Just buy a bus ticket for the duece ($7 a day) and you get almost everywhere. The bus stopps directly in front of the hotel, so no problems here. All in all, no, this is not the Venetian so don't expect it. But again, clean, quiet and comfy. That's all I need! Would definitley recommend if you're looking for a cheaper vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to use the bus or tram”
Reviews.Author: Rocketfire
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Stratosphere for 4 nights. It was at least $100 cheaper than any other strip hotel. I have been to Vegas several times, so I knew we could use the Duece bus or the Tram system to get around. Our room was wonderful. The view was great and and both my daughter and I said that the bed was the most comfortable we had ever slept in. We wanted a nice pool, so this was one thing that sold us on the Stratosphere being an option. The pool was huge, but I wouldn't say it was heated. The service by the pool was great. The casino was small and old compared to the other places I have stayed; Mirage, Mandalay Bay, Treasure Island, Planet Hollywood etc. I have gambled at pretty much all the casinos on the strip including the Rio. It didn't have the newer slots, but at least they were all the voucher system. Because it was small, it got a little boring. I did win though, so I can't complain too much. Casino service - I was a little mad at the bartender. I was gambling at the bar for at least two hours and getting my drinks free. I had just ran out of credits and ordered a drink, and he charged me $9. The most irritating thing was my players card would stop working, and it always happened after the Rewards Club was closed, so I couldn't get a new card. So if you are going to use the slots, insist on two cards, in case one stops working. They blamed it on being near other cards or my cell phone. I had all my players cards in the same place, and none of the other ones stopped working, or have I had this happen to me before. I have cards that are 3 or 4 years old from the other casinos. For people that said the area was unsafe and had hookers and drug deals going on. I have no idea what they were talking about, because I saw none of this. In fact, they didn't have any of those annoying people handing out stripper cards in the area, which was very nice not to have to deal with that. I never felt unsafe. We took the tram one night and used the duece bus the rest of the three days. The bus gets a little old, but it can be very intertaining if you ride it with the right attitude. You meet some very interesting people on the bus. They have a McDonalds, Ben & Jerrys and a pizza place on the second floor, which was nice if you wanted something quick and cheaper. We spluged one night and ate at the Top of the World. It's expensive, but the food was good and the service was excellent. The view was awesome at night. I guess if you are someone stuffy and picky spend your money on a more expensive hotel. I would rather use the money for a show or a really nice meal.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: travelgal205
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews, I was quite wary about what we would find when we finally arrived and honestly, I was pleasantly surprised. The check in line was long, but the woman that helped us was extremely pleasant, gave us lots of tips as well as a map. We were on the 7th floor and had a view of the mountains, which was nice. The room was your average hotel room and had just the basics. But more importantly it was clean and QUIET! We slept great every night and the beds / pillows were soo comfy! Some of the nicest I've had. We rented a car so that fact that it is a at the northern end of the strip was not a problem for us. The strip was very easy to navigate and within a day we were cruising around, parking at all the resorts (free parking! Love it!) and didn't have to spend a dime on any public transportation. The only thing we did use that I hadn't read about was that they have a shuttle every night starting at 6:40pm which stops at the stratosphere, miracle mile and one other stop...but it's free and runs til midnight during the week and til 2am on weekends. nice if you plan to out late and don't have to worry about a designated diver. The driver of the shuttle was very nice, gave us lots of tips to avoid and other "must-sees". As for the rest of the hotel, we don't gamble so I can't give any information about the casino. We ate breakfast a few times at Lucky's and it was excellent. They have a breakfast special that is good all day - $5.99 for 2 eggs, ham and homefries. YUM! It was always packed but we never waited long. All in all, no, this is not the Venetian so don't expect it. But again, clean, quiet and comfy. That's all I need! Would definitley recommend if you're looking for a cheaper vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible deal”
Reviews.Author: lwx
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas before and understanding what an old casino and hotel will smell and feel like, I was fully prepared for what to expect at the Stratosphere. We booked online for the $38+/night no frill in the updated and remodeled upper-floor section. When we checked in late at night and asked to have a room closer to the one of our friend's family, the front desk girl couldn't find one in the price range we booked. She was very nice and got the permission from the manager to upgrade us (my and my friend's families) to two $200/night suites without any extra charge. What a pleasant surprise! I understand our case is probably an exception, depending on the goodwill of the front desk clerk. However, the remodeled upper-floor section of the hotel does look nice too and it is definitely an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this disaster of hotel.”
Reviews.Author: M1KE73
Reviews.Content: Don’t be tempted to save a couple dollars on the price of your room by staying at the Stratosphere – you’ll pay for it in the end. I am a traveler with experience staying up and down the strip and found myself at the Stratosphere in March 2009 for a family wedding. Prior to arriving the prices on the website looked reasonable and the room photos appeared stylish and inviting. But the pushy yet confused reception I received when booking my room by phone should have been the tip-off that something was not right. The average room – while clean enough – was well short on décor, space, and for most of my relatives, a view of anything other than a wall or dumpster. My bedroom shared a wall with an elevator that made it sound as though I was sleeping next to a train. I was not warned of this prior to checking in, and the staff didn’t seem to think it was a big deal. The staff at the Stratosphere is the least helpful, friendly and knowledgeable you will find anywhere, never mind in comparison to high standards I’ve experience elsewhere throughout Las Vegas. The uninterested room service staff finally provided two wine glasses after numerous requests – for a fee of $6. The staff in the tower complained about management throughout my ride up and down. Apparently the Stratosphere is not a great place to work. The casino itself is average and in typical Las Vegas style is impossible to ignore. This would not be an issue, if security staff stopped me no less than two times walking from the reception area through to the elevators because I was carrying my toddler (there is no way to get to your room without crossing the gaming floor). Because the Stratosphere is slightly off strip, you may be willing to sacrifice proximity to the downtown to save a couple bucks. Don’t. Any cab ride to the heart of the strip or the airport is at least $20. So unless you plan on staying in the hotel your whole trip (trust me, you won’t) this adds another layer of expense. Perhaps the worst aspect of the Stratosphere was its second rate selection of overpriced restaurants. I could go into detail about the lack of selection and the clichéd menu options that are priced the same as far superior venues up the strip, but hopefully you’re convinced the Stratosphere should be avoided by now. There isn’t much this hotel gets right. Even it’s free fitness facility – a plus in today’s pay-as-you-go market – shares a wall with a pungent McDonald’s restaurant. There are no indoor pools – meaning any swim off summer heat is out of the question. Whether due to the economy or the competition between the numerous hotels that dot the Las Vegas strip, the quality of accommodations, restaurants and customer service in Vegas are far too competitive for you to tolerate the Stratosphere. Thankfully this awful experience is one thing that went on in Vegas and will stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “If you are expecting a 5 star - book a 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: permanent_vacation42
Reviews.Content: I was rather skeptical after reading many negative reviews about the Stratosphere. Fortunately, we found them to be ungrounded. There was a HUGE line up when we arrived, but Joanne processed us through promptly and pleasantly when we got to the front of the line. The room was very large and clean. My biggest issue was with the bath - the shower was weak and the tub had problems draining... Other than that - we would definitely go back there. Actually - it's worth simply going there to ride 'Big Shot' - an absolute highlight! Also - if you are offered the opportunity for a 'two for one' ride deal - TAKE IT! It would cost two people the same amount to ride once as it does to purchase one 'all you can ride' for a day. We had a ball - did the Big Shot three times in a row - and would have kept going! :) Also - if front desk gives you a book of coupons - peruse them before roaming around the hotel. There are a number of places you can save money from various hotel vendors

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: ajj717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Vegas with 7 other friends. We stayed at the Stratosphere and overall, we had a good experience. I do advise that if you are sensitive to certain laundry detergents, you may have problems with their bedding. The hotel uses really harsh chemicals to clean with and it broke a couple of us out in a rash. When the situation was reported, housekeeping came and stripped down the room and had everything re-washed in different detergents. They were very accommodating and understanding. The hotel had more that what was expected...there are many shops, a hair salon, eating places, and of course the park. The view from the observation deck at night was amazing. I would recommend this hotel as long as you are aware that it's on the one end of the strip and you will have to take a bus/cab to get to other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the cheap Super 8 motels”
Reviews.Author: watch4luci1
Reviews.Content: Crummy room.............were promised a room with Strip View we got a parking lot. Old looking furniture...............not a decent chair to sit in only 2 wooden table chairs Very far away from strip Bathtub fixtures broke and it took 2 hours to get fixed then had to scrub the tub ourselves At checkout staff wasn't concerned that we were not happy about our room or stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: STL_Teacher_traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days as part of a package with Southwest Air. The room was a "Premium" King. The room was OK and certainly large enough for two. We had an issue with the sink drain which had a bad odor and was slow to drain. Calls to the front desk brought apologies and a housekeeper with some liquid to pour down the sink but the problem was never fixed. Further still - the sink isn't in the bathroom, but near the bed. Other than that, if you want to stay in a CASINO hotel, it's fine. (I was later told I should have stayed in the "new" tower. Oh yeah, and they charged me $5 to print out my boarding pass, which I thought was ridiculous. I would recommend the Stratosphere IF you can get it CHEAP!

Reviews.Title: “Don't say I didn't warn you...”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerboy
Reviews.Content: Booked four nights at the Stratosphere for myself and 3 friends flying in from the UK to celebrate a 50th. The hotel sounded like a good deal and I requested a possible upgrade on-line before arrival. I would say the "room" upgrade is more of a "view" upgrade. Unfortunately, the room was far to small for four males (Two of my friends got their own room later that evening), there was no refrigerator, not enough towels etc., for four and a television set from the '90's. All that for about $500 for four nights...Plus an additional charge for wireless internet access!! Our room was close to the elevator which meant there was a constant stream of loud and/or drunk guests outside at all hours along with fights requiring security and police intervention. The front desk staff were unsympathetic when the issue was raised. Generally the staff were pleasant although the bartender was indifferent - when you could get his attention - and the gentleman arranging cabs etc., was outright rude when asked a question. To get to the "strip" you can either use a cab, monorail, bus or walk. To walk you must pass what seems to be an endless pile of trash and debris with waste of every description. NOT recommended. Prices in the hotel (and just about everywhere else) were higher than expected or necessary. I would suggest finding a more central location for a similar price and avoid this hotel if at all possible. Not Recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “All the comfort for little money”
Reviews.Author: StevieJana
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. Granted, it's far away from everything if you have to walk it, but if you have a car that's not an issue. Always plenty of space in the self parkings. For about 36 dollar per night (via expedia), we got a large clean room. The 25th floor pool was closed, but the pool on the 8th floor did the job (renewed, so the water was cold). Internet is expensive (12 dollars/24 hrs) though, so we skipped that. If you have a car and you're on a budget, this is a good place to stay. Hard to find a hotel that offers this value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Basic Vegas Hotel good value”
Reviews.Author: stecky01
Reviews.Content: Not may restaurants here. but rooms were nice and clean with comfy beds. The view was rubbish though! The pool area was nice and quiet but nothing special. Went to the mirgae pool one day and it was absolutely packed and full fo posers so made us appreciate our pool where we played volleyball and had fun. The pool bar does some really good value lunch snacks so well worth it. Good value for money but may be worth spending an extra $20 a night somewhere nearer the main strip as a taxi was around $10 each way to center strip. Was nice to stay here after staying in hostels up until this point.for some reasn our $5 surcharge each day was already included in our booking price which was good. A tip i have is that if you nare planning on going clubbing dont be tempted to pay the touts on the strip anything for their "priority entry" cards. We didnt luckily and discovered that when you go into the casinos or even just outside the have staff handing out entry passes for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Boricua_Rapero
Reviews.Content: I booked my one-night stay for $77, including all taxes, through American Airlines Vacations. The Stratosphere is advertised as a hotel located right on the Strip. It is indeed at the very end of the Strip, but it is considered a downtown hotel for taxis and airport shuttles that will charge you an additional rate ($4-10 each way) to get there. After I arrived at The Stratosphere around 11:45 p.m. I was in line for about in an hour to check in. The hotel lobby was filled with cigarette smoke that my clothes, even ones in my travel bag, stank the next day. The check-in person didn't speak good English, so the fact I am from Puerto Rico and speak Spanish came handy. I had specifically requested a non-smoking room with a king-size bed. I was advised the only room available was a smoking room with two smaller beds. After 5 minutes of negotiations I was able to get a non-smoking room. I was tired after traveling from San Juan via Miami all day, and I was not happy to have to argue with someone at 1 a.m. My room was on the 5th floor with no view whatsoever. When I opened the curtains I had a wall just a few feet away from my window that blocked any kind of view, including that of the sky. I spent another half hour getting a BigMac meal at The Stratosphere's McDonalds, and I was then happy to check out 4 hours later. $77 sounds like a good deal, but an extra $5-$10 per night will get you at a nicer hotel, which I would recommend if your stay in Las Vegas is longer than one night. By the way, The Stratosphere charges $11 per day for wireless. What a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Is Worth the Price, But Do Your Gambling Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jeffthedrunk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stratosphere a number of times. My most recent trip was 4 nites in Mid-March. I booked a Spa King because I love the jacuzzi tubs here. Some people are bothered that they are located in the bathroom, as opposed to the bedroom with a view. For $41 a nite, ($7.50 per nite resort fee included), it is an AWESOME room. I spent approx 14 hours in the tub. Newer, more comfortable beds and slightly different color schemes are the main renovations (November 2008), but the beds are definitely an improvement. Besides the tub, everything else is standard for any 2/3-star hotel. The casino has tightened up on everything from table games, to slots....especially slots. I don't play them much, but always pay attention to see if a casino seems to be paying at least an average amount back to the customers. In four days, I did not see a single win on any slots totalling more than $25-75....that is max bets on machines of every denomination. You will lose $50-100 instantly by playing these machines and not have an ounce of fun. As for the tables, drink service is good, but the dealers (for the most part) are completely inarticulate. Every table I was at had players asking dealers to speak clearer, repeat things, slow down, etc. The pit bosses are surly, and their interaction with their own dealers is awkward to say the least. Dealers are constantly being reminded to do simple things like burn cards, and cut decks. I did play with an extremely friendly dealer though, who was enough to make me look for her again specifically, but I will not be gaming at their casino for a while, and I advise others to avoid it as well. Better gaming on Fremont, or play around on the strip. The rewards progarm is also not great here, which is another reason to game elsewhere. Restaurants: Buffet - closed; Asian restaurant - closed; Roxy's 50's diner - open 2 of 4 days; Lucky's diner - open 24 hours, all 4 days; McDonald's - open 24 hours, all 4 days. The service at Lucky's is always sub-par, but the food is actually pretty good, if you dont mind waiting 20-35 minutes. I have never, and will never eat at Roxy's. Servers sing 50's songs with the style and voice of your average American Idol reject while you try to eat. Seems more annoying than campy fun. Everything else was closed the whole time essentially, which was another downside. The shows are a joke, and the clubs are non-existent as of now I believe....we couldnt find one. Location is not great, but definitely as safe, or safer than other casinos on the strip, (i.e. Sahara, Circus Circus, Imperial Palace). There is a good number of security patrolling things. I walked to IHOP and 711 alone (both 1 block away) during the day, but still wouldnt want to walk alone at nite. Deuce bus is close for cheap, strip travel, and Fremont is close. So stay at the Stratosphere for a quality, clean, cheap room, with friendly service....and thats IT. Eat, gamble, and enjoy shows elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Londonstevo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK, great facilities, staff ok. Restaurant and all eating facilites were great. Hotel gets very very busy in the cabaret bar on the ground floor but atmosphere was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas if you are on a Budget!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: michael572
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay if you are in Vegas on a budget and do not want to sacrifice location or the "Vegas Experience" The Hotel has gone under renovations and the rooms are definately in the 3 and a half star category. I find that 3 stars in Vegas is more like a 4 star hotel in Canada. Las Vegas hotels seem to be held to a tuffer standard. For example....... a Marriott hotel Alberta might be 4 stars, but a 4 star hotel in Las Vegas is twice as nice........ how does that work? Stratosphere is located at the very north end of the new Las Vegas strip. A short walk across the street to the Sahara hotel where the Monorail starts, and you can take the train to dozens of other resorts on the strip. Stratoshere seems like the best deal if youre on a budget, the shopping, restraunts, nightclub and hotel room rates are some of the best on the strip. Even the "Top of the World" restraunt is good value for what you get, as it is high quality food in an incredable setting high above Las Vegas in the tower, for a price that is better then comparable Las Vegas restraunts of this type. Another restraunt I woudl recomend is the 50's Diner on the main level. The food is wonderful, prices are very competative, and the 50's theme is amazing! The swimming pool is my fav because its got so much space for tanning and so many chairs that you never feel like its too full, theres always a place to lay back on a chair, and a spot in the pool, unlike comparable top las vegas pools. There is even an Adult pool seperate from the main pool area, the adult pool encourages women to go topless. I was there around noon and all I saw were out of shape old women going topless, but it was still fun! Ive been to the Stratosphere 3 times for several days at a time, and i have always found the staff really nice there. Since the hotel changed owners about a year ago, and the new management came in, I have found that the staff are even nicer, some of the most friendly front desk service ive experienced in Las Vegas. The Casino is great, lots of fun games, and a lot of the newer games that are popular, The resort has style and there is a mix of people about 60% chic-style tourists dressed to impress and 40% tourists that dress like slobs. -The only bad things i can say about the stratosphere are that the Hair Salon is a huge rip off, about 5 times as much money to get your hair trimed and styled as comparable salons off the strip and about 3 times as much as the salon across the street at the Sahara Resort. Also, due to the design of the hotel, some rooms have a view of air exchange and conditioning equiptment or views of cement walls 30 feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Yes and No!!”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights with my partner and therer were some things I was happy with and some things I wasn't. We arrived about 7pm and were checked in within 10minutes, great after I had read about people waiting about an hour.I had paid for a premium view with a king bed. We were told that there were none available and werde given a premium view with two queen beds.The view was of a bad downtown area with nice mountains in the background, I guess its the mountains you pay for. The room was clean not very big but enough for a couple who only wanted it as a base. The housekeeping service was also good. The hotel amenities were decent, nothing special but nothing terrible, apart from the main pool being closed for refurb and the nightclub being permanently closed. The are three bars on the casino level, service in all three was dreadful but I noticed that generally in bars in Vegas there was nothing rushing the bartenders. The location of the hoel is right at the end of the strip, which is 4miles long, and although a 30 minute walk will get you to the main body of the strip, itsd not a nice walk and there is a cheap bus service right outside the hotel. The area around the hotel is a bit rough because its at the cheaper end of the strip, down where the motels begin and the beggers become a bit more aggresive, this is why the bus comes in handy!! The price compared to the main body of strip may cause you accept this, it did for me, but when a tour driver told me that the housing estate beside the hotel has a number of stabbings/shootings a week i though differently, but I didn't see anything like that. In total if you just want a decent hotel as a base then this hotel is fine. I would recommend it too a freind but not a fussy one!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Fee, Terrible service, Bad location.”
Reviews.Author: Jsw73
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Stratosphere. We stayed at premium tower room at $73. But we were totally disappointed. And there was hidden fee $ 7.50 for the resort fee. When we booked, they gave us the receipt which is $73 but when we checked out, they said we should pay $7.50 extra for the resort fee. In terms of its room and service, there was no refrigerator. There are only bed and TV and disposable cups. moreover, the heater was out of order. in terms of the service, when we asked for a bottle opener, they wanted to charge $7 to us. Therefore, we went down to the bar to open the bottle but they said we should buy one. It was the worst experience. And in terms of its location, it is located in the strip but almost end of it. You can find much better one with little more money. And one more thing, we thought a premium room of three stars would be better choice but it was wrong. You better go with regular room of four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lovinmambo
Reviews.Content: After reading several 'negative' reviews on this hotel i decided i would go with a open mind, so yes it isn't the best hotel on the strip but it doesn't claim to be either it is a 3 star but i do think that it is a fair rating. Check in was a little slow but we were there suberbowl weekend and the hotel was extremely busy, so a little wait was to be expected, we were given a room on the 20th floor no view of the strip but a lovely view of the mountains where we saw several lovely sunsets. The room had recently been modernised in tasteful brown and neutral colours, we had 2 queen size beds, t.v, alarm clock, iron and ironing board, hairdryer and a small table and chairs The downside to the room was mainly that the sink was actually in the main bedroom where you would normally expect it to be in the bathroom. The bathroom was tiny you literally could not move, but on a positive note the shower was very good and there was always a good supply of hot water. My biggest dissapointment was that there was no in-room safe which i think is must in any hotel these days. We ate at the courtyard buffet once for breakfast and then at evening i do have to say the buffet really isn't anything special to be honest we ate much better meals at Dennys nextdoor to the hotel where the food and the service were both excellent. To sum up the hotel i do believe it was good value for money we paid around $23 a night for the room however i would of been dissapointed if we paid more, the location isn't fantastic but the deuce bus stop is right outside and you can be at the heart of the strip within about 10-15 minutes. All in all if you are looking for a resonably priced accomodation on the strip then this would be a good option.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: resinator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at cheap hotels, expensive hotels, and middle of the road, places in Vegas and this is the WORST hotel I have ever seen. Here is the deal; the hotel is really far from anything else which is not a big issue by itself. The big issue is that the service is terrible, resturants are BAD and they are hardly open, casio is REALLY smokey, "resort" fee is insane for what you get, the hotel is DIRTY. The same wrapper was in the elevator for 3 days! Staff is rude. Getting a drink is almost impossible. A non-smoking room smells like smoke. The worst part is the noise! Across the street is a roller coaster that runs all day and it rattles the room every 15 minutes. It's like a 747 is landing on top of the hotel. All I can say is BAD, BAD, BAD. Do NOT STAY AT THIS DUMP. You would be much better off at Monte Carlo if you want a mid-price room. Cheap rooms are much better at Imperial Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great strip hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jbsmg
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided to book here, and I am very happy that I did. It was a great hotel! Everything was wonderful from the room, to the dining, to the casino!! It is far away from the main strip, however there are more and more hotels/casinos that are being built closer and closer to the Stratosphere... it wont be long until they build that far. The location isnt as "bad" as it used to be. I liked everything about the room, except the window was smaller than most of the other hotels... but we still had a great mountain view!!

Reviews.Title: “Reserve a suite if possible”
Reviews.Author: VegasBaby092
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nites at the Stratosphere, stayed in the "Star Suite" and loved the room. This hotel has the longest hallways I have ever seen so I was happy to find out that the suites were right beside the elevator banks. The suite was very big with a wonderful soaker/jetted tub, big enough for two (if you are so inclined). The neighbourhood was a little scary after dark, so take a cab if you plan to leave the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “great for the money”
Reviews.Author: funkypeep
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in april we just stayed for the one night, we wanted to go and see vegas at night from the highest part (apart from going in a helicopter) and we also wanted to try out the rides after dark, the bad points its a bit far out of the way, its a little dodgy at night, be aware of the $7.00 resort fee per night they charge you that after you have booked in, and thats the only bad points that i can find ! good points it offers really good rates, the reception staff are nice upon check in , the rooms arent huge but thay are very clean, the pool is great and clean, the casino is big and the slot machines are quite good at paying out, you get a discount for being a hotel guest to go up the tower, there is a fab resturant/diner called roxys its a cross between grease and happy days it does really great food and its inexpensive try the stratosphere shake but be warned dont try to eat a meal as well as the shake its huge!! we are going to vegas again in 2009 and we will be staying here again for a couple of nights

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but sometimes you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: SuperCupcake
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Vegas on our way back from Disneyland. The Stratosphere had rooms for only $30/night so we decided to stop there. We requested a non-smoking room and it was the smokiest non-smoking room I've ever experienced. So much so that I started to get a migraine within minutes. I called the front desk and they said they would send up a ionizer or something to get rid of the smell. "Alright," I said. 90 minutes later no one had come to the room so I called the front desk, told them that nobody had come and left the room to go get dinner, hoping the smell would be gone when I got back. Needless to say, it wasn't so we requested a different room. The new room was SO much better. No smoky smell. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was updated. No problems. Just wish they had given us that one to begin with or switched our room the first time I called. Ok hotel. Not great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price...”
Reviews.Author: KelownaCanda
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Stratosphere - Mar 2 - 5, 09. $31 + tax + resort fee for a 'premium' view room. Ended up in room # 31947 on the 19th floor. View was south toward the strip - the tower and the large Stratosphere front hotel sign obscure the view but you still see a large part of the city which is great. The room was clean, bed ( very good ) & bedding is quite new, tv picture was a bit fuzzy and had limited channels. All in all the room was great especially for the price. Ate at the 50's style diner once which was good and they put everyone through quickly. The 2nd floor where the shops are located has a McDonalds etc which was nice and a cheaper alternative. The hotel gives you a coupon book for properties within the Stratosphere which is nice - mostly 10% off coupons which can add up. Casino is acceptable although can be a bit 'smoky' and has an older smell to it. Check in / out was simple. Parking is excellent if you have a car. I rented from Advantage which I had never heard of. Great rates. Booked right at the airport. $170 US plus gas for 4 full days. Dodge Nitro SUV which was perfect. Shuttle bus takes you from the airport to the car rental place which is about a 10 minute trip. Very efficient. This was my first time to Vegas. Renting a car is great. Easy to drive around Vegas and every casino except Freemont Street has free 'self parking' that has great access. Yes, this hotel is near the North end of the strip. If you plan on walking be in good shape... Again, the rental car option is well worth it. So, the hotel is not new by any means but the price is great, the 'premium rooms' are more than acceptable, the location is not great but rent a car or use the Deuce. You will be happy especially if you will only be in your room to sleep / shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, no service!”
Reviews.Author: Jabbawoggy
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Premium Room" with view and king bed and without notice they gave us an unrenovated room with no view and 2 queen beds. Some lights, hair dryer and TV did not work. We immediately asked for another room but they told us that there is no chance before next day. Next day we had to make a complete new check in and then we had to wait in our old room for assistance with our luggage. After an hour waiting we moved alone. Next day I got a flu and we asked for hot water to prepare a medicine. They charged us 6 Dollar for 2 cups of some kind of warm water. In this hotel nobody is interested in helping you and that´s a pitty, because it is a nice hotel with spacious rooms (the second one with view and king bed) and, surprise, surprise, a lot of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “great for the money we paid”
Reviews.Author: scarblad
Reviews.Content: just got back from staying a 14night break at the strat. We were on thr 18th floor well impressed with size of room premier view for the total cost of $600 for 14 nights. I would highly recommend for people on a budgetr and it makes a change from the busy centre strip. I have previously stayed at Planet holl, mgm luxor, and treasure island. And it was equal to those in room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & staff. Beware of location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MerseysideShopper
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel at the end of the strip but I just want to advise people to be careful when walking about outside on their own. My stupidity, I suppose but it was broad daylight my husband & I had just got off a bus by our hotel & I said I would go to the shop! I was trying to find a shop when I was beeped from a car parked in a petrol station not that far from the hotel & on the strip , of course I ignored it . I turned down a street next to the hotel because I knew there was a shop there didn't think he would follow me, I am in my 50's but to my amazement he did! He also went past me a few times but luckily the traffic was busy so I managed to get to the shop. I told the staff what was happening & they said it was very dangerous around there & I should not of been there on my own because it happens all the time. (Bear in mind this was only about 5-5.30pm. ) They did advise me of a back way into the hotel & watched me go back. Thank you to them! I heard the next day it had happened to someone else aswell. I only told my husband but I really should of reported it. I know this is not the hotels fault but I just want other TripAdvisors guests & others to be very very careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: PokerDave
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Stratosphere hotel. Intended to just stay a week but was so impressed with whole place I ended up staying for 3 weeks during January and February. Had three rooms, all fine and cleaned properly every day. Lucky's restaurant served excellent food with fast, efficient, friendly service. I was in there at some point most days and I really couldn't fault it, all the staff were so helpful. Roxy's Diner is good if you prefer a more lively atmosphere and there are a few other places to eat too, including McDonalds. The buses stop right outside the hotel and run frequently 24 hours a day, going up to the main Strip or to the Downtown area - very convenient. For great value, this hotel is hard to beat. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “You get the little you paid for. BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: jb87
Reviews.Content: Ok so this was our first time to Vegas and we were on a budget! After looking at hotels on the strip and prices we choose to stay here after calling the hotel and the staff assuring it was a quick 10 minute walk to the middle of the stripe. So we booked a standard room with two double beds. When we got there we were so happy to be in Vegas we didn't see anything we didn't like,yet. When we checked in the lady asked us if we wanted to upgrade then showed us a room map of our current room and the suite we could upgrade for only $30 more a night. We did and it was a wise move. Our suite was spacious, two queen size beds, a pull out sofa and a huge and very clean bath room. On our second day the water didn't work on floors 15-24 (we were 23) we called 5 times to front desk said they couldn't do anything it effected all floors. We went to the pool, tanned and hung out for about 4 hours. We missed a full morning of sight seeing. When we got back to our room the maid was still cleaning it so we couldn't go in. It was bout 3 o clock and we still didnt have any water. We called down once again and they said we can go to another room in the west wing. So we walked in the casino, got the room key and found the room. We walked into a very small room- which was suppose to be our room if we didnt upgrade THANK GOD WE DID. The room was small dark and the washroom was so small I could touch both walls with my arms all the way out. We quickly showered and went back to our room. Didn't gamble much at all here! Two hands of black jack and 10$ in slots. The next day our toilet was stuck, called for towels that never came. When we checked out the didnt take anything off for the water not working for one day. Asked the lady to take something off, she took off the upgrade charge for that day. When I got my credit card statement they actually charged us for the room we went to shower in, as well as the upgrade that was suppose to be taken off. Called the hotel and they were confused on how to fix the problem and said they would call me back, which they did 4 hours later. Overall, if you are looking for a cheap place to stay and do not mind taking a taxi to the action part of the strip stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Return Visit...”
Reviews.Author: LuckySinger
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Stratosphere in less than a year's time and I was completely aware of what to expect, but was actually more impressed this time than on my last visit. I was initially upgraded prior to arrival to a Strip View premier room due to the poor attitude of one of their phone reps when making my reservation. When we arrived, there seemed to be some miscommunication and we were given a World Tower room, which was easily corrected with one phone call. Our room was extremely clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was also very clean and well-stocked. I was impressed with the quality of the linens/bedding and pillows that were in the room - something you'd see at a Hilton Garden Inn or a Hyatt Place, not usual in a "standard" room at a Vegas casino hotel! The 8th floor pool is undergoing a $2M renovation, so they converted the (much smaller) 25th floor pool into a family-friendly area. While we were there it was a bit windy, but there weren't a lot of people around, so there was plenty of space to lay out. I'd definitely go back once the renovation is complete on the pool. All in all, I'd definitely return to the Stratosphere and hope to do so before the year is out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to sleep but that is all”
Reviews.Author: Xanas
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay at the Stratosphere and was disappointed in it. I had taken a weekend to meet up with friends and have a good time however the nightlife that the Stratosphere offers is a joke. I had been looking forward to Polly Ester's and the Crazy Armadillo but both were a let down. Polly Ester's is closed now (I was told they lost their beer license) and the Crazy Armadillo was dead at midnight on a Saturday. My group were the only ones in the bar except the bar staff which were rude and laughed when were asked where the Crazy Armadillo was. The rooms were fairly comfortable, except our original room in which the floor was drenched and we were told it could take several hours to dry and asked if we could just wait it out. What kind of customer service is that? "Hey, your floor is wet, can't you just wait till it drys?" Over all I'd say pass on the Stratosphere. The shows are so-so, the gaming was bland, the restaurants are run-of-the-mill, and the rooms are just ok. Vegas isn't about par, bland, and ordinary, next time I'll look for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...can't beat the price either!!”
Reviews.Author: lisahyk
Reviews.Content: I attended the Magic conference Feb. 15 - 19th with a few of my work colleagues, we all stayed at the Stratosphere. I had never been to Las Vegas before and chose this hotel due to the fact it was close to the conference centre. It is an older hotel, but we found the rooms extremely clean, beds very comfortable, they even had down duvets on them. One of our more seasoned Vegas travelers in the group had just stayed at New York/New York one month prior and said that the rooms at the Strat where just as nice and because it is a older hotel the room's where also more spacious. I would stay there again for sure, especially for 55.00 a night. Location to the LV Conference Centre is great, you can purchase a three day bus pass good for all routes for 15.00. If you like to shop the outlet centre is about a 5 min. bus ride from the Strat. Catch the bus out front of Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: cleoder
Reviews.Content: A little out of the way but on the strip with transportation at the door. Very clean good sized room with view of strip. Freindly staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our room!!!”
Reviews.Author: OnthegoSaskatchewan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern, clean and always had hot water in the shower. The hotel is actually close to the bus stop you take to go the Outlet Mall. So if you like to shop this hotel has a great location. Plus the deauce pick-up is right next to the hotel -to take you down the strip. When booking our room for only $29.00/nite we also received show passes and 2 for 1 discounts on buffet. We loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware The Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPenguin
Reviews.Content: Though we booked a US Airways flight-hotel vacation package, and was told at hotel check-in that the room was prepaid, they charged me $7.50 a night for this "resort fee". Complaining at the check-out desk was like talking to a wall. I've complained to US Airways and my credit card. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay again.....”
Reviews.Author: Teagirl39
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I waited to the last minute to book a room for Valentine's Day weekend and ended up at the Stratosphere. I was nervous and skeptical about staying here after reading all the reviews. The hotel is located all the way at the beginning of the strip, in a seedy area. The check-in went relatively smooth. To my surprise, the room was not dingy or smelly, as I had imagined. It was clean and relatively modern (no flat panel tv). This hotel served its' purpose. I would not stay there again. It was a last resort since we didn't plan in advance. It is far from the action of the Strip. If you don't have a car, I highly recommend a different hotel. We had to drive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: vbenz99
Reviews.Content: The service was bad i stood on the 15th floor in a no smoking room but their was a bad odor coming from the room when i complained they did nothing about it i definetly would not recommend this hotel mabe to people i dont like i would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Clean, low min tables, bad food”
Reviews.Author: LPnerdN.C.
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful viwe of the city from one of the top floors and the beds were very comfortable! We felt like they had been remodled not long ago. The pool was closed, but you didn't know that until you walked a mile and found the one sign right outside the door. Felt like that should have been told at check-in. ( This pool was indoor.) The people that help you at the slots are rude, the rest of the staff is great. Call the concerige to get your return ticket printed. They only have a pay for each min computer and printer and it is a pain. My paper got jammed and no one close had a key. I waited almost 45 min. for help and I had to call the company to get my money back. Don't bother. It was so inconvienent and when I complained to the manager , he was a jerk! But, the place is very clean, if you like to drive the country side during the day, and casino hop at night, you can't beat the location. And it's easy to find your way home! LOL. We never got lost once and we drive all over the place, . Nev is really beautiful. The biggest draw back is the food is awful. I mean, it is so bad, I would go hungry. LOL. WE went to albertsons and picked a few healthy snack things up and kept them in our room fridge. Just make sure you eat before you go back to the hotel and you'll be ok. Nope...Not even breakfast! I mean it. Warning...danger will robinson...BAD FOOD! The casino is great if you are not a big gambler. Low min table's, the dealers are friendly and helpful, and it's not hard to get drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere was Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: TucsonAmeriCanadian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strat for a 3 night stay - yes, the Tahiti Village Getaway. We added another room for our two College kids, and upgraded to the tower. Our check-in was polite and very fast since we had the VIP check-in. Our rooms were ready and spotless. Nice linens, clean, nice smelling. The beds were most comfy and the pillows were wonderful ( I travel with my own, but wouldn't have needed to) We ate in the restaurant near the valet parking quite a bit, and when we informed them we were in a hurry one evening, they were most accomodating. One of the mornings we were there, there was a broken water pipe and the hotel didn't have hot water for several hours. Unfortunately, this did affect us, as we had just been to the fitness center in the hotel. So we washed with icy water, but didn't bother to complain (why?....%$&* happens!) About three weeks later, we received a letter giving us a complimentary stay for one night. We aren't going to go, but it was a nice gesture anyway. It is a little far from the center of the strip, but we had our own car, and also used the monorail. The exercise was good for us. Don't miss the rides up top..... quite terrifying! We also saw the cheesy show.... it was fairly entertaining. Very Vegasy.... what else do you need? As far as the TimeShare presentation.... we were very well prepared. I had told every single person that I spoke to from the first "lure" that we didn't plan on purchasing a timeshare, therefore, I had no guilt whatsoever involved when we made it very clear we weren't interested. When they brought over "guy #2".... I emphatically stated that our two hour obligation was up and we were not prepared to speak to any other person. They signed our slip... gave us our tickets.... and we were on our way within two hours. I wouldn't have purchased a unit even if I was a wishy washy person.... they really weren't even that nice I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-week package deals”
Reviews.Author: CentralCATraveler
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive pre-Valentine's getaway, so was happy to find package deals at most of the Vegas strip hotels for half to a third of what normal hotels cost in other cities. We drove there, so we were able to save the price of airfare. Our package included an upgraded room, free admission to the Tower, discount show tickets, and coupon booklets. Our upgraded room was a bit worn with stained carpets and old vinyl flooring in the bathroom. We had a view of the parking garage, so I'm worried what their regular rooms looked like. We had to wait in line a half hour to check in on a Sunday evening, so I'd hate to have to check in on a Fri. or Sat! We enjoyed lunch at the revolving restaurant at the top of the Tower. A photographer comes around to take your picture which you can buy for an outrageous price. Views are great though. Didn't try the thrill rides, but they looked scary enough. Also ate at one of their diners, Lucky's, which was fine. The specials are the best deal. The Stratosphere is at the north end of the strip, near a big outlet center. It took us 45 minutes to walk to mid-strip and we ended up taking a taxi back for about eight bucks. Also, a short drive away is Red Rocks Canyon which was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the Stratosphere !”
Reviews.Author: dragonknights
Reviews.Content: Long check in line, room RESERVED not available. I paid extra for a high floor with a view got offered a smoking room than got a room with a view of airconditioners on the ground floor with loud noise from room above. Poor service, key quit working 3 times had to stand in hall to wait for sercurity. Pool closed. Elevator not stoping on your floor. One elevator broke repair guys there for hours. Not a very nice casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates for hotel/ Bad Car rental agency”
Reviews.Author: Greely
Reviews.Content: We found great rates for this hotel on Expedia. It is at the far end of the strip so it is a long walk. You can also take the double decker buses up and down the strip. The rooms were clean and the breakfast in the hotel was very reasonable. The line up was quite long to check in but that's what you get for $55 CAD/night. We rented a car from Dollar at the airport. They had great rates $9/day but the lineup was ridiculous - at least 1 1/2 - 2 hrs. I decided to take a taxi to the hotel and go back later but it was still over 1 hr. Only 3 people working each time. I will never rent with Dollar again. All the other agencies had no line up at all and there are at least 8 of them in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: LeaDickinson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in January. My fiance, now husband, and I decided to 'runaway' to Las Vegas to get married, and this is where we chose to stay, while we got married at A Little White Chapel. We got a great deal. It was our first time out to Vegas. While it stunk to be a little far away from the strip, the Deuce for $7 you can ride all day long, and the stop is close to the hotel. The rooms were very clean and spacious. We had a great view of the strip from our room. Unfortunatley on the second night we were there (the night after we got married thankfully) I slipped and fell (apparently I'm a klutz) and hit my head pretty hard. The security staff came up, and then called the ambulance for me and unfortunately went to the ER. While of course it sucked having to go through that, the staff was very attentive and did a good job. The only complaint, our room door wasn't closed when we got back. But thankfully nothing got stolen. Besides the trip to the ER, it was a great trip. We also got buy 1, get 1 tickets for the American Superstars Show at the hotel. It was a great show, and definitely worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: WhiteFone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Friday night to Sunday night, while staying here during the Consumer Electronics Show. I got an average rate of $78/night, which included their resort fee of $7.50 a day, which makes that low rate they advertise initially, not so low in the end. The Good: - I got a very large double room at the lowest room rate. - Room comes with working TV. - Room was thoroughly cleaned every day. - Friendly desk staff - Free admission to Stratosphere Tower. - Free parking - Great view of I-15 from one of the towers. - Very comfortable; no noise issue. - While neighborhood gets a bad rap from other reviewers, not much of an issue if you have a rental car. - With rental car, location from rest of Strip is not an issue. - They let you check out through your cell phone. I was not going to get out of the room by check-out time of 11 a.m., so I called and they gave me a few minutes. You have to go to desk to get printout of final receipt though. The Bad: - Resort fee of $7.50 a day. - Long walk from room and elevator to parking lot. - Not most centralized location if you have no rental car. - Early check-out time of 11 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Were married here and stayed here...returning this March”
Reviews.Author: maggiesimmons1423
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3/2006 and we were married in one of the chapels. The hotel was very clean for the price...back then it was around 45 something a room...this year with the slowing economy we are staying for 27 a night. You just can't beat it. We thought of staying somewhere else, but for the price and we know it's CLEAN which is most important we decided to stay again. We use the Deuce for transportation so it's location from central strip isn't a big deal to us. Everyone who helped us with the wedding was great...the photo's were great, but expensive. We seen American Superstars while here with discount tickets...it was fun. Top of the world has a wonderful view and atmosphere, food was just minimal :( We ate at Lucky's Cafe I think it was called...it was good and fair priced! I'm staying again March 8-12, 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: kcashmore
Reviews.Content: Ok yeah its out of the way.. Not good for first timers or second timers.. However, get a players card.. they send me free offers everymonth for the last 3 years.. The offers are good ones. 3 or 4 free nights and a whole lot of freeplay.. slot tourneys.. food credit ect ect.. Cant beat it if your into the freebies.. Honestly ill stay here a few nights then move to another hotel for a few days when i want the frills.. The deals here are worth it. New beds in 08 and the rooms are more then enough to get a good nights or good days rest.. The pools are cool and fun.. good drinks and parties in the pool area . I have no problm staying here but i have been to Vegas 15 or 20 times and have seen it all.. Good place if your on a budget and you have a rental car.. Dont stay here if this is your first few times in Vegas..

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: MalMonroe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and love it. It's clean, the beds are large and very comfy, bathroom was clean and well equipped with towels, food from room service was good and always served within half an hour of ordering. All the staff we dealt with were helpful and friendly (on both occasions) and the views are okay - but to be honest, who wants to sit in their room staring out of the window all the time?! There is FAR too much to do and see in Vegas. I used the deuce bus on my most recent trip but unfortunately, all the drivers were extremely rude - they are obviously sick to the back teeth of tourists, especially from overseas, and it shows. The fares have risen slightly now - $3 one way and $7 for a 24 hour pass. Still excellent value for money - if you are brave enough. There's also the monorail which runs to/from various hotels on the Strip - again, good value for money at $5 a single trip and $13 for 24 hours but you have to negotiate the hotel lobbies and casinos and end up walking miles just to get to the stations. The nearest stop to the Stratosphere is at the nearby Sahara hotel. Sometimes it's easier just to jump in a taxi (always available at the front of the hotel) - they may be a bit more expensive but are much quicker and more convenient. I really would have liked a tea/coffee making facility and mini bar in my room but for the price I paid, I'm not complaining!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: RileyStafford
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas, as part of a three week road trip around the West Coast. The Stratosphere was the first hotel we came across, so we just walked in, and tried our luck at getting a decent room. We were in luck and we got a suite for three nights for $95 dollars a night. The hotel was a fair distance from the strip, but you could get a bus called the "Deuce" easily which would take you down the strip for around $3. The room was nice, with a Jacuzzi,and a big bed.
