The first night was great, quiet and we both had a decent night's sleep, but on the second night, the noise coming from the Air Con units on the roof was awful, and then if that wasn;t bad enough, the noise then coming from the water system's within the hotel ensured that we didn't get any sleep for the second and third night. We tried changing room's, but to avail, as they wanted us to move all our things out of the room at 3am in the morning!!! We did get a bit of money knocked of the bill. but not a massive amount, around $50. The staff at the hotel were all pretty rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: chillyciti
Reviews.Content: I didn' t really like my week in Las Vegas, but I did like my room. To be able to stay in the northern part of the Strip it was very cheap and the bed was very comfortable, tv reception was not fantastic but watchable. I got clean towels everyday and the bathroom and cleaning standards was quite good. I never was able to wake up early enough for it but I heard there are teaching sessions at 8.30am to teach beginner gamblers some games like crabs and such. The only negatives about the Stratosphere was that it was located a bit far from the central part of the Strip, so if you want to get around I suggest first thing is to buy a Deduce ticket. I bought a 3 day ticket for about $15 and bus took me up and down the Strip as well as Downtown. Other notable places it stops are Town Square (a cute little shopping area - although noisy because it's close proxmity to the airport) and Las Vegas Outlets. There is another Premium outlet you can visit but you would need to take another bus for that and it's very close from the Stratosphere, the Deduce bus ticket should cover the CAT bus fare as well. ... Sorry I got distracted with the outlet discussion The other negative was that my room was situated right next to the lifts. I know people really don't come to sleep in Vegas, but it does get distracting and noisy. I can pretty much sleep through anything so it didn't bother me but it doesn't help with relaxation if that is what you are after. So probably a room in Tower 2 room 22 is a no no for you. Please don't try the Sahara buffet it was not all that good. I have been told by a few of the locals if you want to have really good buffet to go to Rio for the seafood ones on the weekends. It's pricey but well worth the investment. I didn't get a chance to go but if I am ever in vegas again I would try it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal for first time visitor”
Reviews.Author: nomad1987
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal with this hotel so decided to go visit for the first time last long weekend. I must say I was really impressed with the quality of service and rooms provided to us despite our cheap deal. We got upgraded to a king size bed, jacuzzi and a view. Word of advice DO NOT PAY EXTRA FOR THE VIEW. It is not worth it as some bozos at Hilton decided building a hotel which would block a great view funny. The room was clean, odorless and the bathroom was decent ( no fancy stuff). Loved the Jacuzzi, the 90's color tv not so much but hey who goes to Vegas for tv. The casino is great for a beginner ( or any player ), the dealers were extremely friendly and eager to advice on how to play. The pool is not open though. All in all had a great time, comfy room, good cheap food and lost a lot of money = the most I could ask for from a trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Eat at Fellini's”
Reviews.Author: TipDeBierback
Reviews.Content: Visited twice in past 5 months. The casino is bright and airy and had generally good service and a fun atmospere. The supervisors were pretty generous with handing out food comps. Rooms are fine for discount travellers; you're going to get a vinyl shower curtain, not marble and glass. The room was quiet and comfortable. The ice machine on my last visit was a really long walk, about 6 minutes round trip. Nice view of downtown at night. Bring a car or take a bus to get around. It's kind of creepy to walk around the neighborhood there, not to mention really far from most places. The pool area wasn't especially crowded and the scant fake desert scenery was kind of cheesy, but the pool itself was quite large and enjoyable. Joined in a pickup volleyball game in one section. Since it is on top of the building it isn't very deep. You can watch some of the rides on the tower (which is impressive up close like that.) The show Bite is cheaply produced but the acrobats in it were first rate and garnered the most applause. The show could use some more personality and spectacle. Some humor wouldn't hurt either. Eat at Fellini's - you will not be disappointed. It's every bit as nice of an Italian restaurant as you could want for a reasonable price. The wine, the service, the food and the atmosphere are excellent! It's a great value for the second best Italian on the strip, after the incomparable Rao's at Ceasar's.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: dforce
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Stratosphere. With the mixed reviews and great price, I really wasn't sure what to expect. I carefully sifted through previous reviews on Trip Advisor and accepted the tip of one reviewer to tip the Front Desk. I did tip the Front Desk at check-in and was given a nice, newly renovated room on the 20th floor in the Premier Tower. We had a beautiful view of the mountains and a partial view of the strip. The room was very clean and comfortable. It was well beyond what I expected although the bathroom amenities were a little weak and I feel that you get more at even a Best Western in terms of lotion, shampoo, etc...but that was a minor point. It was more than adequate for our needs just not what I might expect of a Las Vegas resort hotel. The hotel is nothing fancy and does fit the 3 to 3.5 star rating. What I loved about staying here is that you could go up the tower for free and that you are closer to downtown. But if you are wanting the action and nightlife of the Strip, you are quite removed from it. But that's not such a big deal because of the Deuce bus. However, the price of the Deuce will be going up to $7.50 and if you factor in the cost of that plus the $7.50 resort fee, it might just be worthwhile to spend more to stay at a more central location on the strip like the Flamingo. The hotel is also located closer to Las Vegas Premium Outlets. It was nice staying at the Stratosphere and as they build more hotels closer to it, it may not feel so far out of the way. But next time, I will probably stay at a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: 10wink
Reviews.Content: The Statosphere is at the far end of the strip (last major hotel before downtown), it is a long walk down the strip to the major part of the action - dont let this put you off as there is the deuce double deck bus which stops outside the hotel (3 dollars one way or 5 dollars all day) plus the monorail is only a short walk. The rooms are quite large comfortable and above all clean - the casino itself is quite good with various restaurants and an all you can eat buffet - not as good as some and not the value they used to be but still excellent value. If you want to stay in vegas and are on a budget this hotel is remarkable value it is better than alot of the hotels further up the strip who charge considerably more, If you get a good deal on a hotel further up the strip then go for it location location location. If you are on a budget or simply want to sleep at night and want a good quality comfortable hotel - try the strat - you wont bedisapointed

Reviews.Title: “eh”
Reviews.Author: Happyatdisney
Reviews.Content: Yes, you can find great deals for this hotel - but beware of the $7.50 a day resort fee that will impose upon you no matter what. At least you can visit the top of the tower for free, which has beautiful views of the city. We arrived at this hotel at 1am, and there was a huge line for check in. We waited 45 minutes to see the front desk clerk, whom didn't seem to care nor apologize for our long wait. At least they could have offered water to us or something! We booked for 2 beds and she put us in a room with one king size bed. When I called the desk, she said they were all out of double-bedded-rooms. I told her that we booked on their website and paid EXTRA for 2 beds! In the end, they sent up a complimentary cot. The room was on the larger side, but the bathroom could have been cleaned better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: nicole2906
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas in December 2007 and stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel for seven nights. We arrived at the Stratosphere at about 8pm at night after travelling for around eighteen hours and when we went to check in there were no queues at the desk. When we booked we had paid for an upgraded room but we were told there were none of these rooms available so we would be upgraded again but would have to move to the correct room the following day. We agreed, got our room cards and proceeded to the lifts. We found the layout a bit confusing at first but was ok once we got used to it. The room we had been given for one night was a Player's Suite but I was unsure about what room we would be moving to the following day as the lady at the desk said we would have to move back to a standard room so we went back to the desk to enquire. By this time there were large queues and we had to wait about half an hour before it was our turn. I spoke to the lady again and advised her that we had paid for an upgraded room and wanted to check as she had said we would have to move back to a standard room. She said the upgrade we paid for was a room with more modern decor than standard, although this was not what it said when we booked it in advance. We returned to our room and within a few minutes received a phone call from the lady and she advised that we could stay in the Player's Suite for our entire stay at no extra cost! The room itself was spacious, we had a king size bed, table and chairs, desk with phone and TV. The bathroom was nice enough as well, had a bath and shower. The room was clean as well and we always had fresh towels. The hotel was quite a distance from the main areas on the strip but there was a bus stop outside the hotel and the services were frequent. Overall, our stay at the Stratosphere was nice and the rooms provided what we were looking for, just somewhere clean to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than expected”
Reviews.Author: WesternTravelers66
Reviews.Content: Most reviews has us scared but the hotel was great. The check-in was fast; employees were very courteous; room upgraded and immaculate; the reported "thin walls and loud housekeeping" was untrue. The casino beverage service was faster than most restaurants. A wonderful experience. The condo recruiters did meet us at the door but a few strong no thank you's had us all on our way to check-in. Hardly a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoggs
Reviews.Content: The Strat is great value for money with good facilities. Because of the location (downtown) the prices and table stakes are lower than the main strip. It is not really walkable and costs more to get there from the airport. Transfers taxi (fast and efficient) $16 per person each way Shuttle bus (goes to most hotels) $16 per person return 108 bus (slow but cheap) $2 per person per trip The last one stops on the corner about 50 yards from the hotel. It is part of the local transport system which you will get to know well. The Deuce is a bus that tours the strip 24 hours $2 per trip or $5 for 24 hours. Can take ages to get around but is essential. The hotel rides were out of commission when we attended and the prices in the restraunt made your eyes water. $50 for a steak (ouch). Rooms are spacious and clean and the hotel has all the slots tables and entertainment you want. Hire a car from the UK. Hotel prices through BUDGET are expensive. Dennys just behind the Strat is good for breakfast but try the all you can eat buffet it is excellent. Itallian restraunt charges 18.5% service charge. Beware and consider your tip. All in all a good base for a visit to the strip and further afield. Would recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel, great service & convenient, but beware of skin-irritants!”
Reviews.Author: a1cheung
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere hotel for the entire duration of our 5-day visit in Vegas. The place is situated at the end of the Strip, the last major on-the-Strip hotel until you reach downtown Vegas (off the Strip). The hotel itself is pretty much as expected. We stayed in the standard queen’s suite, with a good sized, simple room. The room appears to be a very clean room, until my husband started complaining about itchiness from carpet lice bites (I notice some itching too - initially I thought it was the harsh desert weather causing skin irritations, but the itch disappeared once we left Vegas…). The hotel is a bargain at $24 per night during the weekdays, so we are not complaining too much. But for that price you must book on the internet – it will be $59 for walk-in customers. Staff members were friendly and helpful – the Concierge was particularly patient with my endless enquiries. For transport and amenities, as the hotel is on the main Strip, so it has the convenience of the Deuce bus at the front of the hotel. For the bargain shoppers, there is the famous Premium Outlet situated quite close to the hotel – it is walkable distance (give at least a 30 minutes walk), but you can also take the bus or taxi there as well – about 10 minutes on a taxi, according to the Concierge. For cheap, fast food, McDonalds and Starbucks, plus a few others (including a very nice Mexican place on the first floor) are in the building. Outside, there is the fantastic Carls Jr. chain opposite the hotel, and a 24-hr breakfast chain restaurant within 1 minute walk. For Asian food there is a Thai restaurant opposite the Sahara about 5-10 minutes walk away. Circle K at the gas station next to the hotel is also a good place to pick up some essentials. For budget travellers returning home, there is a bus every 20 minutes on the corner opposite the hotel, next to Carl’s Jr. that takes you to the airport for $1.25! With frequent stops, do give an hour to get to the airport. Otherwise you may wish to opt for an airport shuttle for $8-$9 or a taxi ride. This hotel is for budget travellers with simple demands and is willing to put up with the distance from the major party venues at the heart of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, amazing view from the top,”
Reviews.Author: palenakamikale
Reviews.Content: 12 of us flew to Vegas 6 staying at the Stratosphere. We stayed the 2nd weekend in November. Check in was quick and smooth. We found the room clean and spacious. The restaurant "Lucky's had good reasonably priced food. Being at the end of the strip we had a blast taking the double decker bus to Freemont Street and the monorail up and down the strip. The view from t he top of the hotel is amazing. We did not ride the rides, watching was thrilling enough for us all. Great trip overall

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel - Identity Theft And Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: Tweetytravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Stratosphere on December 30, 2008 and checked in the morning on December 31, 2008. We met up with other family members after checking out, did the whole strip thing for New Years Eve until the early morning hours on January 1 then drove for home. Upon return home, we discovered that our credit card had been charged for a room on New Years Eve. Immediately calling the casino to request an explanation, we were met with the most unprofesssional behavior from hotel employees that I have ever had the misfortune to experience in my life. Apparently after we checked out, someone from the room either called the front desk or told security personnel-- (we were told different versions of how this security breach happened depending on which Stratosphere staffer we talked to)-- and claimed they were my boyfriend. This person said that "we" were too sick to leave and that "we had checked out accidently from the room television while ordering a movie." That alone should have alerted security to go check for identification from the room. It is inconceivable to me that the hotel did not check into this fairy tale a little further. Anyone with any kind of security experience should have been suspicious, especially since the hotel's own records showed that we had already checked out. The hotel did not check the room and ask for identification, they simply accepted the word of the person who was in the room and charged our credit card. I know I made sure that room was locked when I shut the door so I have my own suspicions. Regardless, the hotel should have asked for some kind of proof of who they were talking to on the phone. The hotel, simply stated, is now calling us liars. They are telling us that we have to PROVE that we stayed in another hotel on New Years Eve. This is absolutely ludicrous and an obvious case of identity theft and credit card fraud. The hotel has now now made their failures our problem. We ( and another family member who was also in Vegas) tried to speak with Michael Branch, Hotel Operations, and explain that the Stratosphere had a case of credit card fraud and identity theft that needed to be investigated. We requested that they check their security tapes that would show us leaving with my mother's car, with Colorado plates and handicapped placards. Mr. Branch stubbornly refuses to listen and states that the hotel tapes are erased after 24 hours. We explained to him that we had left the hotel, met up with other family members who were at Sam's Town and had gone to the strip to celebrate New Years. Mr. Branch said that he "personally spoken" with my boyfriend over the phone in the room and was told that we "too sick to leave the room." We told him that it was absolutely impossible because we were at the Venetian at the time that he spoke to someone in the room. We have no idea who they spoke to in the room, nor should we have to "prove" that we were at another hotel. Although we did not owe him any explanations, we offered the information of where we were for the next twelve hours, location by location and hour by hour. We also offered to give him the names of family members from Colorado and Nevada, who could give him an accounting of our whereabouts to no avail. Mr. Branch will not budge with his accusations. Mr. Branch obviously made a judgment error by not checking the room personally and asking for identification, especially in light of the fact that we had already checked out. The tall tale coming from the person who was in the room should have been suspect to anyone in the hotel business. Whoever was in the room was committing a crime which is the hotel's responsibility to handle. The Stratosphere is refusing to do so and stand by their judment that we are liars. Unbelievable. It all the years of traveling with my family, I have never experienced such unprofessional and rude behavior. I have never been accused of anything, nor have I had my integrity questioned by a hotel. In light of the fact that Vegas is having trouble filling hotel rooms, I would think that accusing guests would be frowned upon. We have no idea what happened in that hotel after we left, but Stratosphere employees need to be retrained in security procedures and hotel professionalism. They have an obvious scam going on in the hotel that needs to be investigated and not accuse hotel guests of being liars who have to prove their whereabouts upon leaving the hotel. If you do not like your integrity and honesty questioned, do not stay at the Stratosphere. If you do not want to have to prove your whereabouts to a casino after you check out, do not stay at the Stratosphere. If you do not like the idea that a hotel erases security tapes after 24 hours, do not stay at the Stratosphere. If you do not want to have to go through the whole identity theft and credit card fraud nightmare with financial institutions and law enforcement, do not stay at the Stratosphere. Other family members stayed at the Venetian, Sam's Town and the Golden Nugget and had absolutely no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good value base for first time visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: futurafoot
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal with Expedia and stayed for 10 days. This was our first time in Las Vegas and my husband's first time to the USA. We got 'got' at the baggage carousel by a limo man at the airport, who we knew was spinning us a line with the whole 'my client hasn't turned up so I can drive you for the same price as a taxi' but we decided to go ahead and agreed to pay him $51 excl tip. We'd been warned by friends beforehand that this would be the approx price anyway, so in the end we got a nice ride after 24hrs travelling. Our hotel room was on the 22nd floor close to the elevators. The room we got was clean, had 2 huge queen beds (very comfortable) and a big window looking towards the west of the city and hills beyond. The hotel is a bit out of the way of the main strip but I guess that's reflected in the pricing but $2 on the Deuce bus gets you anywhere from Downtown to the Airport ie anywhere along the Strip and $5 all day was the best deal to be had. We ate in the mexican cantina and Lucky's restaurant in the hotel and they were reasonably priced. It was a shame Roxy's was shut we would have liked to try that out. As staying guests you get free access to the observation deck of the Tower between 10 and 2 for great views. Best breakfast/lunch buffet we found was at NYNY hotel called ChinChin - a mixture of American and Chinese foods and great selection of fruits. Hiring a car and driving was easy to do but be warned that you need to factor in the insurance and tax costs are the killer. Having a car meant that we could explore the surrounding natural environment of deserts and Lake Mead recreation area. A real plus point as you get to see 'real' parts of the country. Definitely recommended. Just take care at intersections and know who to give way to! And don't get lost coming back from Lake Mead or else you'll end up in dodgy north-east neighbourhoods which we found quite intimidating to say the least! Red Rock Canyon was awesome and is only 30mins west much better than Death Valley in a lot of respects. Joshua Tree Highway too was beautiful. Take care not to underestimate the length of your car journeys though and be prepared to stop every few miles for all those great photos you will want to take. All in all, a fabulous trip and good experience of all that the Strip has to offer as well as balancing the artificialness of Las Vegas with its many surrounding natural beauties. Read up driving tips before you go though. Last caution about the Stratosphere or any other hotel is that you always get some hassle from the timeshare people - just be firm and polite. We also had a couple of nights where there was a lot of noise from people down the hall - partying big time in their rooms - to be expected I guess. This was usually at the weekends which tended to draw a much rowdier bunch including youngsters willing to crash on floors of their friends rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: JETSETG
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for a few nights while I participated in a video shoot for my company. I wasn't interested in sightseeing, so at about $40/night, I had to give it a try. The location is definitely far from the heart of the strip. Although the couple-mile walk isn't impossible, a taxi would be the best way to get around (and there are tons of them at the hotel). The room was VERY modest, but for the rate, it was acceptable. Just your very basic "motel 6-ish" type of room. My window gave me a perfect view of a large gray wall. Make sure you ask for a room with a real view! Everything was neat, and the room service was acceptable. The pool area was nice. Not great, but not bad. The overall atmosphere was nice and comparable to other hotels on the strip. There is some minimal shopping and a few good restaurants on location as well. For the business traveler, I give you 1 warning: if you have have much work to do in the room, you will be uncomfortable. There is a desk, but the large TV screen is permanently attached to it. So I had to do my work on a little round table (see photo). And there was only 1 accessible outlet near the table, so I had to unplug the light to plug in my laptop. Overall, you get what you pay for. A very modest room at a very modest price.

Reviews.Title: “They paid us to stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelpopple
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel on our trip and it came with lots of goodies! We booked directly with the hotel website which had better (more specific details) deals than a popular hotel booking website. Our room was clean but the view wasn't that great. The hotel has two pools that seemed quiet and enjoyable. Our room was about $50 for the night and on top of that we got 2 free rides up the tower ($12 each) and 2 free breakfast buffet's (about $14 or 15 each...can't remember) so all in all it was economically an excellent choice! The hotel was clean and the casino was very clean as well. I would recommend this hotel for those who don't mind staying a little further down the strip...away from all the main action so to speak.

Reviews.Title: “Great value despite distance from main strip”
Reviews.Author: Noogles
Reviews.Content: I thought the Stratosphere was great. I got a really cheap deal when I stayed, and got a huge room in the premiere tower. The room was really comfortable and spacious, as was the bathroom. I found the hotel part really quiet too, I barely heard any of the other guests when I was in my room. I would definitely recommend dining in the revolving restaurant; it was absolutely fantastic, and gave great views of the rest of Las Vegas. Although the Stratosphere is at the far end of the Strip, it didn't take us too long to get to the other casinos and there is a metro in some of the other hotels which makes the journey to the better hotels a lot shorter.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobinAlaska
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere during the 1st week in December. We were on the 8th floor of the Premeire tower. Our room was very large and comfortable and clean. Beds were nice too. Even though we liked being on the same floor as the pool, we were on the wrong side and had a view of the parking garage! So, it would have been nice to be higher up. Staff was very friendly and service was good. However, every time you walked thru the lobby to get to your room you were bombarded with the timeshare people. One salesman told us if we were not interested, to just give them a "two thumb's up" signal and they would leave you alone. It Worked!! Probably my only complaint about this hotel is its location. It is far from the strip and one night we took a cab to Mid-strip and it was 17.00!! We did try the "Deuce" (bus that runs the strip) once and it dropped you right off in front of the hotel, so that was nice. I noticed you could get an all day pass from then for only 5.00 and it runs supposedly 24 hours a day. This was our first time to Vegas and wow, you do ALOT of walking and it is expensive! Be prepared to spend 60.00 for lunch! This was at the Hard Rock Cafe.....food was good and service was good, but come on...60.00 for lunch! Holy Cow!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: andy-M28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel for a couple of nights at the end of November 2008 and really enjoyed our time there. It was our first visit to Las Vegas. We stayed on the eighth floor of the premier tower in a deluxe room and our view looked right onto the Stratosphere tower! The room and bathroom were huge and very clean. I was a bit anxious about this hotel after reading some of the reviews from other people but personally I never had any problems whatsoever. When we arrived it was after 9pm and the check in process was quick and hassle free. I should also mention that the double beds in our room were the comfiest beds we have ever had the pleasure of sleeping in whilst travelling! The heating/cooling system in the room was second to none. We ate breakfast in Lucky's cafe within the hotel and the food here was delicious. The only downfall with this hotel is that its not located on the main strip so its not as handy location wise as some of the other Las Vegas hotels. All in all though we had no problems with this hotel and really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff Great, Casino and Casino staff horrible”
Reviews.Author: me1115us
Reviews.Content: Took my nephew to Vegas for 3 days for his 21st birthday. I so wanted his first experience to be amazing. For the first hour it was. The hotel staff is wonderful and the premier room was nice but small. I have been going to Vegas for 29 years and I have never had such a bad experience with ANY casino staff. The dealers were unfriendly, the pit crew downright rude and the slots were so tight, we never hit one for anything more than $15.00. I took him to a roulette table that was EMPTY and the dealer could not even give him the time to learn the game. I will NEVER stay at the Stratosphere Hotel again and I will tell everyone I know not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: goldcardluke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a United Airlines Vacations package which included flights and accommodation in Las Vegas, Los Angeles, San Diego and San Francisco. I have stayed at several hotels in Vegas on previous trips (Harrahs, Luxor, Treasure Island, Embassy Suites). I thought Stratosphere was good overall. There were a couple of things wrong with the room which I would have asked to be fixed if I had been staying longer (flickering light, smell from the sink) but I thought the room was OK other than that. The sink was located outside the bathroom which was a bit annoying as you could wake the other person at night. The size of the room was good and I didn’t hear any noise at night. Getting to the room took just a couple of minutes from the lobby. Check in and check out was fast and easy. We went to see American Superstars in the hotel and that is a good quality show (you should get a discount as a hotel guest). We ate at the buffet – which is lower quality than some of the other hotels (Treasure Island, Mirage) but the price reflects it so I would recommend it. We also ate at the diner, which is fun with its singing waitresses, and the food was good. There is a cafe for breakfast, but we chose to eat at IHOP which is 3 minutes walk from the front of the hotel. Sahara is the closest strip hotel and you can walk there in about 10 minutes. We went there once for a buffet. It was a larger selection, but about the same quality and price as Stratosphere's one. We went up to the Observation deck (best viewed at night) which was free to us a hotel guests, and well worth doing. A Vegas tour guide warned me that the hotel nightclub (Polly Esthers), is best skipped and he also said that the area behind the hotel is quite rough – so we avoided both these! A cab from the hotel gets you to the centre of the Strip in just over 10 minutes (drivers usually take a route off the strip due to heavy traffic). I wouldn’t have necessarily chosen this hotel if staying only in Las Vegas but as part of a trip it suited my needs, and I have no major complaints. If you are on a tight budget I would recommend it – if you can afford a little more, Harrahs is good value and is right in the centre of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent hotel and great value for money despite the not so great location.”
Reviews.Author: Appreci8life
Reviews.Content: First of all I am not a gambler so I can't offer any advice about that side of the hotel. Actually gambling is a very selfish thing. Anyone gambling wishes that the other person loses in order that he can make a gain. Anyway, back to the hotel: although I arrived VERY early they checked us in right away. I booked the newer tower and I must say I was very pleased with the room. It was a very clean room and I know you're not supposed to mention this but even the toilet paper was of very high quality. The beds were surprisingly comfortable and were just as good as other beds in much more expensive hotels. The dissapointing fact was there was no in room safe. You would expect in a place like Las Vegas there would be in room safes. The hotel is far from everything and unless you have a car I think you will find it very hard to get around. Plenty of restaurants and fast food places inside the hotel. I also did the rides at the top with my kid and found there was no waiting time at all when I went. Another nice touch was the free laundry. You just pay for the soap but there was no charge for the washing machines.The rooms were cleaned daily and I can't fault this hotel in any way. Overall, I was very pleased especially considering the price (around 45S including the “resort fee” which gives you access to the top of the tower between 10am-2pm).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newry82
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great base from which to explore the world famous Las Vegas strip. The hotel is located at the top of the strip meaning be prepared to walk or take the convienent bus which travels up and down the strip. The tower is awesome and provides spectecular views of the city both during the day and at night. The rides at the top are not for the faint hearted and thats why i gave them a miss. The hotel has many shops and restaurants located within it as well as a heated jacuzzi, outdoor swimming pool and fitness centre. The value of the hotel was amazing considering the price we paid. Overall i would definietly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ridecss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while only planning on a one night stay. The first night I satyed on the second floor and had a view of the A/C unit outside. The second night I stayed on the 8th floor and had a good view of the north end of town. I had to park in oversize parking and it's a long walk to check in and then to room elevator. I didn't have a reservation, but had done my homework on line before hand. I told the desk clerk the rate I had found on line and he didn't even blink an eye when he gave me that rate. Rooms were nice, the price was right ($31) and I got a good nights sleep. I know there are nicer hotels on the strip, but since I didn't spend much time in mine I wasn't worried about spending the big bucks. The best value in Vegas is the doubledecker buses. 24 hour pass for $5, although buses get very crowded the closer to the strip you get. One bad experience in the buffet resturant. I seated myself since I couldn't find the hostess. Then a waiteress came up to me and told me my table was reserved for 6 not 1. There was no one else in the place. I told her I would be nice and not dirty up the other five settings at the table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer service And a great Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: tweetyca
Reviews.Content: I have to say that that Stratosphere has OUTSTANDING customer service! My boyfriend and I went to las vegas from 11/20/08 to 11/24/08 we were booked into another hotel on the strip We had an awful and bad experince with the other hotel the way we were treated from the time of check in. After thinking through the situation we decided to go to stratosphere directly and ask about availability for our other 3 nights of our vacation. We explained what our experince was at our other hotel to the check in person She totally went out her way to make us happy she reserved a Suite for us and even called our hotel about the refund policy. When we checked in the next day we again had great customer service at the check in counter our check in person was great very helpful and curtious he even said that our reservation had an e mail message from the girl who booked our reservation. We went to our suite and were very happy it was clean and just what we wanted from the begining a strip view in a high floor i noticed that the A/C was not working I went back downstairs and told our check in person about it he called engineering and by the time my boyfriend and I came back from dinner it was fixed. We had a great time at Stratosphere we will return again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL at the Strat”
Reviews.Author: CQtopgun
Reviews.Content: My wife called into a radio station about a" free Vegas vacation" .She thought she won something but I think everyone wins.We were going to visit friends in Lake Havasu soooooo why not spend a few free nights in Vegas. We checked into the Stratosphere at the special Tahiti Village desk. Check in was a breeze. We upgraded to a Premier Tower room, it had a jakuzi and a great view of the strip. Only $20. , couldn't beat it . We set up our time share tour for the next morning and received our FREE tickets for American Superstars, FREE buffet and FREE tower passes. We had good seats for the show, had a GREAT friday seafood buffet ( $20. value ) and viewed the tower during a full moon. Got some really good pictures.The tour was very interesting and not hi pessure at all, just not for us. The room was fine, bathroom was well stocked and everything was clean. Problems.............. the walls are paper thin and the people next door were getting frisky..... REAL LOUD type frisky and there was no coffee pot in the room, I NEED my coffee when I get up !!!! We called down and asked about one and were told that "they don't do that anymore, they bought the Starbucks downstairs " Overall it was a GREAT FREE vacation.Clean, cheap room,good food and I won some $$$ at the craps table .We had a car so we were not stuck in that area, which gets a little ruff at night.GREAT DEAL

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: Synergy19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights, and found it fairly decent given the price. It has one of the cheaper room rates on The Strip, albeit it's way at the north end of The Strip. The rooms are smallish, but serve their purpose. I'd have to say I enjoyed my stay there. It's location, as mentioned, is a bit far from the main Strip hotels...so unless you want to or enjoy walking, you'll probably have to take the bus to get around. It's a short walk southward to the Bonanza Souvenir Store and Sahara Hotel though. However, I wouldn't venture far in the general neighborhood of Stratosphere Hotel at night, as it's a bit sketchy. Because of the good deals, I would recommend Stratosphere. The inconvenient location would be greatest gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SENORAWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid this hotel offers excellent value...we have stayed here several times previously but this time chose to upgrade the room to The Premier Tower, a little larger but not much more expensive. Lovely comfortable bed, pristine linens, plenty of pillows. The bathroom was a good size with plenty of clean towels daily. Excellent maid service, friendly staff. We were allocated room 31191 on the eleventh floor at the back of the hotel. Overlooking downtown and with a good view to the mountains which looked wonderful in the sunrise every morning. I would ask for this room again as it was located just around the corner from the lift, most convenient and not at all noisy which was one concern I had when we first saw the location. The hotel is at the downtown end of the strip but the Deuce bus stops right outside and for five dollars for twenty four hours you have unlimited travel. One tip, do not use the stop right outside but walk over the crosswalk(outside Dennys) and use the stop there, hardly anyone else does and you avoid the queue, (if you use the exit at the top end of The Courtyard buffet you are almost there). The great advantage of this hotel if you want to go south down the strip is because it is the first hotel out of downtown, the buses are usually not too crowded. The Courtyard buffet is good and reasonably priced. A good selection of 'in house' shops, bars and eateries. We were given as part of our package free unlimited access day and night to the tower. A saving of fourteen dollars each time per person, we thought this was a great offer. If you only do it once go at night, the view is spectacular. Almost next door is an Internet cafe, a liquor store, The Worlds largest gift shop and a convenience store located at the petrol/gas station. I would certainly recommend The Stratosphere and will definately return.....the slightly inconvenient location is made up for by its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It was very stinking and scary”
Reviews.Author: Rocky88IowaCity_Ia_
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th time we stayed at the Stratosphere and it sure will be our last,each time we visit it gets worse. This time our room (3-16-21) smelled like sewer water, or human waste, we soon found out why, the bath tub would hardly drain and when it did it would back up into the sink. And we were suppose to brush our teeth in this smell. We complained to the front desk as soon as we smelled our room,even went down to the front desk and nothing was ever done. We should have asked for a refund right then and there, but we were stupid and stayed, they could have at least offered us a different room. Also that Friday night and Saturday night October 10th and 11th, we were scared for our safety as their were some shady looking Gangbangers hanging around the casino and we don't mean a few we mean a couple hundred at least. We went to our stinky room and stayed in both nights, so two nights of our vacation were ruined. We wrote the Stratosphere Management a letter and they did offer us a free room UPGRADE on our next visit. How Generous,after our vacation was ruined. We don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Clean Rooms, Cool Modern Decor, Tower is Great”
Reviews.Author: raquaman
Reviews.Content: I got a last minute deal here when I needed to stay an extra couple of nights in Vegas. I was very pleasantly surprised with the Stratosphere Hotel. Check-in was easy and the staff was very pleasant. My room was very clean, apparently newly renovated, spacious, and had a great view. Admission to the Stratosphere Tower was free to guests and I was very impressed with everything about it--again cleanliness, maintenance and friendliness of staff. The Stratosphere is on the North Strip and therefore not in the heart of the Strip, but a cab ride to Bellagio or Caesars is only about $10. Sometimes when in Vegas I prefer to be a couple of miles from the hustle and bustle of the Strip -- this is a new preferred hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Weekend Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Divine225
Reviews.Content: The reviews here had me nervous about staying at the Stratosphere, but my boyfriend booked it and I was on the hook! I have to say that we stayed in the Tower Premier Guestroom w/ View for about $62/night and the room was fine. It was very clean and the Hotel itself is really nice. It is wayyyyy North, up the Strip, but this was the only drawback. While guests, we saw both American Superstars and Bite (erotic, topless show) and both were entertaining. The staff was polite and check-out (thru the t.v.) was quick. Our first morning there, we were stopped in the lobby and offered free tickets to 2 shows, 2 free dinners, and 2 Tower Passes if we agreed to attend a 2 hr time share presentation. We agreed and enjoyed a full day of free everything! I am not sure why this place gets a bad rap, for the price it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: happywithkids
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Affordable 2) Buffet breakfast is a value for people with kids (Kids eat free) 3) Free admission to the tower during the morning hours Cons: 1) Far from the strip attractions 2) Check-in was horrible.. It took them 20 min to check me in & they offered no reason or apology for the delay 3) They charged me a $5 a night "resort fee" which I consider highway robbery. 4) No coffee maker in the room for 2 days. When it appeared, room service did not replenish the coffee 5) The laundry is free, you have to pay for detergent. However, the kicker is 50% of the washers/dryers do not work (which is a waste of time)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, below par service”
Reviews.Author: Texas56
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us, 4 rooms were booked, rooms are very spartan - but clean enough. We did not all do the same things at the hotel at the same time but all came together again with the same opinion of poor service. Definitely would not bother to stay there again with so many alternatives in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay in the Strat”
Reviews.Author: creditcrunch
Reviews.Content: So after getting a bargain on price-line I arrived for a 5 day stay at the Stratosphere Hotel and Casino Las Vegas. Its location is not all that bad and as many others here have reviewed you get what you pay for. Check-in has changed since my last visit and the counters that were located near the valet parking are now exclusive to another sister resort (Tahiti village) so you have to trundle right through the middle of the casino to the other end (easy if you arrive by taxi or airport van). With just over 15 of the possible 20 check-in areas open I was all done within 15 minutes and on my way to floor 23. I was offered an upgrade at registration for $15 per night I got a premium strip view with single king, and well worth the money. The room was basic with old fashioned television, a number of standard lamps, small coffee table and 2 chairs open hanging space with iron and board. In room Air-con and heating and comfortable bed, with clean duvet and scatter pillows. Bathroom was clean with all the normal needs present, bath/shower combo, hair dryer and plenty of towels. This is my 5th stay here and the hotel is in urgent need of refurbishment, all though the rooms and communal areas are clean they are showing signs of wear and tear. Wi-Fi is available for a cost as is entrance to the tower which I still feel is unfair for hotel residents. Plenty of eating places are available with Roxy’s 50 style restaurant as being my personal favorites. Ok so would I stay here again? Possibly but a number of my work colleagues got a lot more for not much more than I spent. It’s a popular hotel and is a good base to explore Vegas, but if your looking for something a little more special then spend the extra £20 and grab a 4* further up the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: earing
Reviews.Content: We pulled into the Stratosphere after driving from PHX. They had rooms for 29.95 (it was a Sunday) but we decided to upgrade to a suite, which was huge. In retrospect we should probably have stayed in the 29.95 room because we didn't spend much time in a suite that is easily as big as my house. We had a good time, the slots were VERY good to me (paid for my rock star suite). The buffett ehh, kind of Denny's but not that expensive. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: privatejoker
Reviews.Content: Well it was my first trip to America so vegas seemed a great first choice, We booked a good deal and the hotel was the Stratosphere , We Stopped for four nites. We were greated at the door and the checkin in was easy, the room yes were simple but the bathroom was excellent also having two double beds were great , To be fair we really was not in our hotel room much or even in the hotel itself much.the pool was great and clean gym ,bar etc the staff were very nice and had no problems. The only downside is how far away you were from the main strip but thats reflected in the price but getting a taxi was no problem and was only 10 dollars to the strip and between four of us was nothing do not attemp to walk trust me it takes ages !!!!also the shopping area was no were near as good as others. i did also not think having to pay to get into the tower was good as we were stopping at the hotel.but the view and the rides were great !! All in all a great hotel for what we payed and would have no problem staying again i miss the view from my room the sun coming over the hills .

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: sand4c
Reviews.Content: Check-in was relatively fast. I didn't wait more than 5 minutes to get to the next desk clerk. Check-out may be via the television from 5am-1pm (leave your room key in your room) or by dropping a check-out form in a designated box. The front desk receptionist was very polite and courteous. You can store your luggage at their bell desk your last day if your plane leaves late for the price of only gratuity. I have no idea if they plan to remodel any rooms in this hotel, but it would be nice to have a flat screen LCD tv such as sister hotel Aquarius in Laughlin or the Riviera (two casino hotels of similar size and price range) do instead of the awkward conventional TV with poor reception quality and a curved screen. The bed itself, the down blanket, and pillows were nice and comfortable. There wasn't a lamp in the immediate vicinity of the work desk area, which puzzled me. They charge a $1 access fee per call (including for local and 800 numbers), so bring and use your cell phone exclusively. They also have wireless internet for $11.99 for 24 hours. My view was of the parking structure, but since I hadn't specifically paid extra for a specific view of something more desirable, I didn't really mind (although my reservation did state I was to have a premium view, which it was not). I was disappointed in the bathroom. The floor was dirty and it was something you'd expect to see in a YMCA or high school gym locker room. There was no bathtub, just a shower (no glass enclosure either) with a drain at the bottom. No tile in the bathroom, just a concrete floor. I certainly didn't expect great things in a 3 star hotel, but I didn't expect a bathroom of such poor quality. Toiletries given were deodorant soap and shampoo. The maid also leaves an envelope specifically for tips. The buffet is better than others I have tasted throughout Las Vegas and Laughlin. There was a great selection of meat, salad, and dessert, among other food items. They have McDonalds and a selection of shops on their 2nd floor. Guests are allowed to access the Tower for free from 10am-2pm. Outside of those hours, it costs $10 for hotel guests/Nevada residents and $13.95 for non-hotel guests to access the tower, not including the price of rides. The Stratosphere is at the northern end of the Strip near the Sahara. It's relatively far from the hustle and bustle of mid-Strip, so if location matters to you, I would suggest you try a hotel in a similar price range in that area. The Deuce (double decker bus) is notoriously slow in traveling through the crowded Strip, so plan ahead and be at the bus stop at least 1 hour before any event or show you plan to attend. I probably wouldn't stay here again, but then again, I was always the kind of person to try a different hotel and experience every single time I came to a certain city. I was just much more impressed with the Riviera's and Aquarius' newly remodeled rooms.

Reviews.Title: “not happy with hotel”
Reviews.Author: guaponson
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the stratosphere for 4 days. The moment we came out of the elevator to where our room was at, there was an overwhelming stench of some hair product. Like stuff they use to perm hair with. We walk into the room and it was pretty plain for the price we paid. it looked pretty run down. We had two queen size beds in there. the first bed i looked at, had hair on it. the sheets obviously had not been changed. the other bed had the sheets changed. when we left the room, i asked the housekeeping lady to change the sheets on the bed. when we came back later that evening, the hair was still on the bed. the room walls were thin, so you could hear everything next door and outside the front door. We had the terrible view. the view of a parking lot!!! if you want to see the new strip, where all the other casinos are at, it's gonna cost you a pretty penny with taxi's. About $25-30 dollars. there was no shuttle service from the hotel. gambling is ok, but some of the waitresses wouldn't bring more drinks unless you were tipping them. if my wife and i were to vacation in vegas again, we DEFINETELY wouldn't stay at the stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: livegoodCanada
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Stratosphere. It is very comfortable, friendly and helpful staff, nice relaxing atmosphere, rooms very clean, bathroom clean, coffee provided in rooms. For the price it is way ahead of other hotels on that end of the strip. You can easily get to the other end of the strip by bus or taxi and save yourself a lot of money by staying here where the rates are reasonable. We tried several hotels in the area and Stratosphere was the best. We plan to go there again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Georgeeeeeee
Reviews.Content: Hotel part of Stratosphere is average. Entertainment system in the room did not work most of my stay. Soundproofing is min. between rooms and hallway. Good part- Casino and bar areas were good. Friendly service and good payback on Video poker. The tower is a good way to spend the afternoon. Rides are scary but worth it. Restuarant is overly priced but worth the experience for lunch. Must see- The show "Bite" was excellent, not just the topless part, but the whole show. I would vist the casino and tower in the future, but I would stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great....., but I rented a car!”
Reviews.Author: SerZeljko
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 nights in hotel and it was what I expected. Great value for money, but as I said I rented a car...We paid (I think 10$ for our stay for room with a view), and it was a great . Room was clean, nothing special. Pool is great (open gym, table tennis, volleyball, hot tub). Freemont street is near. But if don't have a car it might be hard to go down the Strip and back. After all, I think is't a good deal to stay there...

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weedav
Reviews.Content: Firstly, check my other reviews. I'm a traveller and I don't hand out good reviews without reason. If you book this hotel, then chances are you have paid WAY LOWER than any other hotel on the strip. When you consider this hotel, bear it in mind. You have paid a lower price for a reason. The lower price is because a) It's at the end of the strip b) It's not as plush as other hotels in Vegas However, the cost difference makes this a GREAT hotel if you want a good base to experience Vegas without paying the cost for a room at the more expensive hotels. I paid $40 a night. So, the ROOMS. I stayed in a non-refurbished room. It was big and clean with a standard bathroom. No complaints. The good thing about Vegas is that you can feel like you are staying at any hotel. I went to the Bellagio every night for dinner, drinks, and gambling. At 2am I got a $10 taxi back to the Stratosphere. I spent more time at the Bellagio without paying the $$$ surcharge for a plush room. I went into a couple of hotels more central on the strip that had similar prices and thanked my lucky stars I wasn't staying there. This is a bargain in Vegas. If you have a budget stay in a big hotel, if you don't then you will not get any better than the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “poor location”
Reviews.Author: sneaky_wan
Reviews.Content: stayed at the stratosphere for 2 nights in my last visit to Las Vegas on a package tour...as transportation was provided together with the tour, it was generally OK but if you are planning to walk on the strip at night...IT'S HELL OUT OF THE WAY! there are some thrill rides on the roof top but you need to pay to go up to see...pay more if you want to play... the rooms were OK...nothing to brag...but clean enough and i am very particular about cleanliness..

Reviews.Title: “Such a deal!”
Reviews.Author: BrowninLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere for 5 nights while volunteering in Las Vegas. Needless to say, I wasn't in town for the gambling or wandering The Strip. If I was in town to enjoy the Strip, I would stay further south, as the Stratosphere feels a bit isolated. The hotel room was clean and large, just what I needed for this trip. The room is best described as a motel room in a skyscraper: the furnishings are very simple, the walls are thin, and the price is right! (During the week, I payed $30 a night!!) I felt safe at the hotel, which I would not have in a motel anywhere in Las Vegas. The parking was really easy and the staff was really attentive and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Bubblesnbelle
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, horrible location, not what I was used to in Vegas. We have been to Vegas several times & had some reasonably priced, nice rooms. Stratosphere was comparable to motel 6. We decided to stay here because of the Top of the world restaurant which was AWESOME! Other than that would never stay here again. Stay at the other end of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: shonm
Reviews.Content: not a friendly location, under the average room. nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “didn't mind this place too much”
Reviews.Author: hlibebe
Reviews.Content: considering now much i paid compared to others for this room-i overpaid. was it worth it? maybe, at least for the experience. Pros: the room was definately the largest room of the 3 hotels we stayed at during our vacation in vegas; extra large col-king size bed; attached walkway from parking garage to the hotel/casino; ac unit cooled efficently, free access to the observation deck (which they normally charge $10). Cons: The place was a little dated looking; we were in tower2 w/ a not so great view of the parking garage n a northwest view of the rockies (which was nice); the ac unit was huge n noisey (even if was efficent); very small bathroom (though the toilet was super powerful-one of the other places we stayed at had a sluggish toilet that got backed up so we appreciated that at least this one was powerful..small things you come to appreciate); walking from the parking garage to our room was quite a trek ( we were at the back of the hotel); and as for the free access to the observation deck it is only from 10am to 2 pm, so if you wanted to be up there for when the night lights are up you have to pay. would i stay here again? probably not.

Reviews.Title: “They lied to our faces!!”
Reviews.Author: goofballWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere in 2007 & had a great time, so thought we'd go back. When we got there & saw our room (which was fairly dingy), we decided we wanted to upgrade to a room w/ a fridge, a view & a safe. They assured us that the suite had these amenities, so we upgraded. When we went to check into the new suite, we specifically asked, "does this room have a safe?" They assured us that it did. Sure enough, when we got to the room (which was a smoking room though we requested non-smoking) there was no safe. When we called them, they stated they could bring a safe up, but could not give us a timeframe. When we decied to check out and stay somewhere else, they didn't even seem to care that we were unhappy. They did not even apologize for lying to us.

Reviews.Title: “my trip was excellent”
Reviews.Author: lasvegascyndie
Reviews.Content: we were a little bit concerned after reading some of the reveiws for this hotel but i must say it was excellent in every respect . we enjoyed our stay staff was excellent the food was great the comps were great and location was not an issue as there are is the deuce(bus) that was great and taxi service to go were ever you wanted we seen 2 shows bite and american allstar both were excellent and we went to top of stratosphere also very enjoyable. room was clean i can not complain about anything. when i go back i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: travelTO1234
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the stratoshere for one night last summer. we were looking for a cheap hotel as we got to vegas late at night and were leaving for California the next morning. we paid under 100$ for the night and the hotel reflects the price. the rooms were old, and stank of old cigerettes. i'm a smoker and i couldn't stand the smell. i probably would not stay here again as it is far down the strip and there are other hotels in the middle in and around the same price range. if you're looking for a cheap place to sleep for a night then its okay.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Prices, Hotel Service”
Reviews.Author: fragileindustries
Reviews.Content: I had been booked into a horrible local motel just up the street, and was in Vegas for business, not pleasure, for four nights. I figured that didn't mean I had to stay in a toilet, I just needed a decent room for a decent price, and some amenities if possible. After two miserable nights in the motel, I drove the short distance to the Strat just for dinner, and checked out the room prices at the check-in desk just for the heck of it. Not only was the price quoted a full $20 LESS than the toilet I was in, all I could ask for was available. I stayed there the next two nights and was very happy. Got a decent fun book that gave discounts at the hotel restaurants. Air conditioning that worked, spanking clean room and great bed, Vegas views, room service if I wanted it, and after my hard day's work, I could put in a little play at the casino. I got free drinks while I played the same $5 on the video blackjack at the bar for days. Free valet parking (but do tip, those guys work for their money), security, it felt like the Ritz after the motel, and it cost less. I'm going back to Vegas at the end of the month for more business, and I'm booking the Strat instead of some sketchy motel in a bad neighborhood. If you're going for the complete Strip experience, and have money to burn, this may not be the place for you. On the other hand, if you've been there, done that, and are there for other reasons, I give the Strat top marks for value and service. The best bang for the buck on the Strip, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Mold in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: cloughnoel07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for free for 3 nights paid for by Tahiti Village. We found mold in the corner of the shower. Called the front desk to send someone up but no one ever showed up. We went to the front desk later and mentioned it again as we gave them our card for internet access ($12 by the way) They said they would send someone to clean it though if they did have someone take a look at it, they never said and it was still there the rest of our stay. Other than that the hotel room is clean, the dining has no incentives to eat there. The view is spectacular and their show American Superstars was great. They have a band in an open area lounge every night for free. Can't say how the gambling is though because we did no gambling there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - will certainly return”
Reviews.Author: julia687
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Stratosphere. I was in the Premier Tower and my room was a really good size, clean, the bed was really comfy and I had a really good view of the tower. I was on the 8th floor, the last room before the pool and I was a little concerned that if I wanted to sleep in it would be noisy but it wasn't! The tv had a good selection of channels and the shower was great. I ate at the hotel twice, the buffet for breakfast one morning which was super and I'd recommend it. And the Italian Fellini's one evening, the food here again was good and quite reasonable. All the hotel staff I spoke to were friendly and helpful. The shops on the 2nd floor of the hotel are good for picking up little bits and bobs - one of the gift shop type shops also sells beer and soft drinks that are handy for taking to your room and they were only a few cents more than 7 11 or CVS. And Mcdonalds was handy on my first night when I just wanted a quick meal. I was a little concerned about the location after reading several reviews before I travelled but I thought it was great! I used the deuce bus loads and brought a day ticket for $5. Outside the hotel is a 24hr Denny's, an IHop, Burger King, Bonanza gift shop (the largest in the world!), several tattoo shops and a wedding chapel! The Sahara is just a few moments walk and Circus Circus was about 15/20mins walk. I travelled on my own and never felt unsafe even at night. There were always lots of taxi's outside the hotel even at 4 am when I needed a cab to the airport. I did walk from the Stratosphere to New York New York one day stopping in at different casinos along the way, though it took awhile it is possible and quite easy to walk the strip. I like the fact that the hotel is inbetween the strip and Freemont Street so it is easy to get to either of them. Even if you stay in the middle of the strip your more than likely going to use the bus or taxis to get around anyway as it is that big. Also the other hotels that are the same sort of price didnt seem half as nice - I nearly stayed at the Imperial Palace (as suggested on the TA Forum) but was so pleased I didnt when I went in to their casino. If you want a nice hotel for a reasonable price and dont mind taking the bus or walking it is a great place to stay and I'd have no hesitation on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: pod13
Reviews.Content: Booked the stratosphere on hotels.com and got the night for $34. It was a decent room with a good view of the strip and for theat price, I can't complain. The room was fine, not trace of smoke. Pretty good customer service. I'd recommend this for anyone looking for a cheap night in Vegas. The only downside is it's a bit far from the other resorts to the south on the strip, but you can easily get a bus or taxi with the money you save here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good; location is OK”
Reviews.Author: shaggyman
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is a unique hotel/casino on the far north end of the Vegas Strip. That is the biggest complaint I have is that it is on the FAR north end. There is not much around it, and walking around at night is a little shady. We were a little afraid. The hotel itself is a decent, if not fancy, hotel. It doesn't have (or claim to have) the perks of a Bellagio. At the same time, you can get incredible deals for rooms. I have been in a "regular" room, which is decent sized and nice enough. I have also been in a two room suite, which was really nice--as nice as others I have seen on the strip. There is fairly easy access to the Monorail if you want to visit other major hotel/casinos on the strip. Just don't expect to walk to the busier part of the strip. It would be several miles both ways. If you get a room here, realize that you will likely want to travel south down the strip (or at least north to the "old strip, which is also a few miles away). The Stratosphere casino is a little crowded, but they do have decent priced stakes (unlike a lot of other casinos). There are some pretty ordinary restaurants, but there is more than one. The Stratosphere tower has great views and rides, but at a pretty steep price with a long wait. I keep hoping that other cool hotels or attractions build closer to the Stratosphere because it adds to the Strip and is unique. All in all, it is not a terrible place to stay because the hotel is decent and the prices are even better, but just be prepared to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Don't understand the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Stratfan1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from an awesome 3 day weekend at the Stratosphere. We were mildly concerned about the reviews and the fact the local travel agency more or less refused to book us there. All worries were erased upon arrival. We'd booked through Allegiant Air, and check in was quick, painless, and the clerk was quite friendly. We checked in about 8PM local time, and had no wait whatsoever. The room was basic, but quite clean and the beds were brand new and very comfortable. We had no misgivings about the location, because we knew where it was located before ever booking the room, something other people obviously don't bother to research (not the hotel's fault!!!!). Transportation was easily had, as cabs were availble out front 24/7, the monrail station was a short walk away at the Sahara, and the bus stops right in front of the hoetel, and will take you anywhere on the strip, as well as downtown, all for 5 dollars for a 24 hour pass! We found the bus to be much quicker than many people reported, but we didn't use it during "peak" hours. We'd hit the strip early anmd come home late, and never had trouble getting a seat or getting to our destination at a reasonable time. We'd been warned by the local travel agent the hotel was in an unsavory part of town. I guess everyone has different standards, but I walked the areas around our hotel all hours of the day and night without once feeling the least bit threatened. In all seriousness, I grew up in a town of less than 500, and would have more misgivings walking though parts of it than I would walking in this neighborhood. i was told by a cabbie that 3 blocks west would put me in a bad neighborhood, but that I'd be safe anywhere on the strip. Like anywhere, you've got to be aware of your surroundings, but that should be a given. After reading many reviews, some even in the same time period we were there, I can't believe we stayed at the same hotel. No, its not Planet Hollywood or the Bellagio, but were you seriously expecting that at these prices?!?!?!? If you want a cheap, clean room with comfortable beds,and are awre of its location, have no fear....the Stratosphere EXCEEDED my expectations in nearly every way! As an added bonus, due to the "new member signup promotion" I got a t-shirt, show tickets, free slot play, gift shop credits, etc all comped to me for what I'd consider a low to medium amount of play in 24 hours. The casino was what I'd expect, and the slots and VP machines paid out seemingly better than they did in other places. I guess I'm just not as picky as some people, or maybe I'm the only one who bothered to throughly check out the place enough to know what to expect, but I loved the Strat, and would never have issues recommending it or staying there again myself. Its not uber-fancy like much of Vegas, but again, for the money spent, was an incredible value. If you don't mind being a short bus or monorail ride away from the action of mid-strip, and appreciate a good bargin for your dollar, the strat is one of the best values Vegas has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BE-Pieter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere for three days. Clean rooms, comfortabel, Breakfast buffet at the café was very cheap and yummie!. Nothing bad except casino looks littly bit outdated.

Reviews.Title: “all I wanted was the room I booked through their site...”
Reviews.Author: DoctorJoe
Reviews.Content: I'm a physician who took some time off to visit LV to get people registered to vote. I booked a "premium" room and checked the King bed" request. Check out is 12 noon, check in is 3 pm. Arrived @ 5:30 pm (2.5 hours after check in) and they told me it was not ready. They did have a room with 2 smaller beds(queens) but not what I asked for. When I asked why almost 3 hours after the check in time, my room was not ready, the supervisor and the check in person looked quite puzzled and bothered as if my request was outragious. They were unwilling to call housekeeping to see if a room with a queen was ready, but just not in the system. They could not give me a break for a larger room, and quite honestly had no idea what the term Recovery meant. When I accepted the room and told them I would likly never book with them again, they just stared at me with a smirk and never apologized. Do they know we are in a recession and they cannot afford to lose any customers?? The superior room looked like something out of a bad airport motel 6. There was nothing Superior about this room or this Hotel. Don't waste your time on this hotel, there is much better out there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the low price”
Reviews.Author: katjm
Reviews.Content: room was supposed to be nonsmoking and reeks of smoke. can live with that, but room is supposed to be disabled accessible and the bathroom has very slippery linoleum floors, with a shower that could be accessible but the shower nozzle is broken. nothing much to recommend this hotel - the price was average, there is absolutely no reason to come here. it's unremarkable and less than worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: gnau
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on September 2008, mostly because we got a great deal online. It was Saturday night, many hotels were booked and those with free rooms didn't fit our budget. I had read not-so-good reviews about this hotel before and we knew that it wasn't what we were looking for, but the location was good for us and the room was reasonably priced, so we decided to give it a go. At first we walked long way through casino gambling machines to get to reception, just to found out that the check in was kind of a nightmare (and the check out took almost as long as the check in). We had to wait in a long line for a time that felt like an eternity, at least when you are tired and hungry. After checking in we dragged our luggage through the casino (again), until we got to the elevators, which were always so full we couldn't fit in. When we finally got our room, we were very disappointed. The room was located on the fourth floor and was very shabby with a terrible smell. Window was small and all you could see was some kind of backyard with garbage cans. Bathroom was okay, although shower curtain was very unclean and disgusting. Luckily the room was quiet, so we slept well in a surprisingly comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “We Opted Out!”
Reviews.Author: Adriansmum
Reviews.Content: I regret that I cannot give you much of a review of the Stratosphere Hotel as we barely made it past the front desk. I can only comment on the poor service at check-in. In July I visited the Strat website and booked a king bed smoking room for 3 nights commencing Sept 11/08. This trip was planned well in advance from Canada, for an Anaheim, Las Vegas, Reno road trip. We spent 5 days at the HoJo in Anaheim.. lovely! For our first 3 days in Vegas we enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Excalibur. The staff at the Excalibur went out of their way to please us and by the time the comps were calculated, our stay was free. After checking out of the Excalibur we tried to check into the Stratosphere. We arrived at 3:30pm (check-in time is posted at 3:00pm). The first thing the clerk said was that she could upgrade us for an additional $15/night. I said I wasn't interested in the upgrade and just to give us the king smoking room we had booked. She then stated we had booked a non-smoking room, and that she had no smoking rooms available. I told her that I absolutely booked a smoking room but she didn't want to hear that. She said to come back in about 45 minutes and maybe she would have a smoking room available. We returned about 90 minutes later, but evidently they still had no room for us. The clerk said that the upgrade room she offered us happened to be a smoking room. She also stated it had an extra seating area and a fridge. We weren't interested in extra seating room, but a fridge would have been nice and because we didn't want to wait any longer we decided to take it. We went up to a dingy upgrade room that did not have a fridge! Back down to the clerk... Just give me a regular smoking room! Sorry... none available, come back in a couple of hours. My husband nearly went through the roof! After voicing our concerns to the manager, our first night deposit was credited back to my credit card and we drove straight back to the Excalibur where were spent the next 3 days being treated very well, and again our comps covered the room! Amazing what good customer service can do. We will never step foot in the Strat again. Upon our return home, I located the email from the Strat confirming my reservation. It clearly stated smoking room, so not only did they screw up the reservation, but the clerk had the gaul to insinuate that it was MY mistake, and then try to push a more expensive room on us with the promise of an amenity that it didn't have, all after making us wait forever for it!!!! THE NERVE!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ems_dulce
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 3-night stay. Got a great deal for this hotel online, but was a little apprehensive knowing it was one of the more budget hotels on the seedier end of the strip. Surprisingly, we were very satisfied with our stay. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Room was kept clean and in working order. Free admission up the Tower was a nice bonus. Dinner in the revolving restaurant was definitely pricey, but was a great experience and made for a special night. We even went on one of the rides at the top of the tower - being way up there definitely adds a new dimension to "thrill" rides! All these things I had never even considered doing on my past trips to vegas, but I'm glad I did! The neighbourhood is definitely not as nice as the rest of the Strip. I only walked around outside one night to take the Deuce bus (used rental car on other nights), but had no problems at all. This is definitely one of the better, if not best, budget hotels on the Strip! (If you stay here, I definitely recommend a rental car - all the hotels have free valet parking so it's better than taking the bus/monorail!)

Reviews.Title: “Usual big hotel but value for money”
Reviews.Author: Whiskers007
Reviews.Content: Our contact was via Expedia and got a very good rate and able to pay in our home currency hich meant no foreign exchange commission or rate to make the stay more expensive. The front desk was the usual big hotel welcome one experiences in Vegas but the woman was pleasant enough and we had no wait in line when checking in at 4pm. Our room was huge with king size bed.Oddly though the toilet and bathroom area was tiny.Seems strange that with so much bedroom space they designed the room like this.Bed was very comfortable and plenty of pillows.No in room coffee or fridge was a drawback.Internet cost was exhorbitant at $11.95 for 24 hours.This is ridiculous when all the other motels ex Motel 6 have not charged at all. No breakfast included in price but it was a so cheap anyway it didnt matter.

Reviews.Title: “we love the strat”
Reviews.Author: jamiemcb
