Reviews.Content: we stayed three nights sept. 11th-14th. i have stayed here on many occasions. i had received an offer for two free nights, so i used them for sat and sun. payed for thursday night which was only 48.00. stayed in the premier tower. had a room on the 16th floor over looking the mountains and a partial view of the strip. they just put all new beds in. we had a king bed with a spa tub. this room is called a spa king.everything was fine in the room. no problems. the water pressure is not that great, but it worked. i had also received 2 free buffets, so we used them on friday night which was seafood night. we did not care for the buffet at all. there are shops and some food places on the second level which are pretty fairly priced. there is a mc donalds which comes in handy for a quick snack. overall we had a great time here and would stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go out after dark..”
Reviews.Author: McWomble68
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Stratosphere through Vegas.Com. I booked based on the price, which I thought was excellent value at $72 for two nights. This got me a large room called a Queen Suite. I couldn't fault the hotel itself other than the extra small bathroom / bath in the room. The only problem was when I went outside. The Stratosphere lies at the northern end of the Las Vegas strip and is currently seperated from the remainder of the LV buzz by numerous vacant lots and building sites. This unfortunately gives the undesirables of the town somewhere to hang out. They were there during the day, you just don't make eye contact with them. After dark you feel intimidated by them and it isn't pleasant. This is not a criticism of the hotel at all, just a comment on the poor and unfortunate position of the hotel. I would recommend paying the extra money and locating yourself further south on the strip. The Riviera and Circus Circus both offered the same price for two nights, maybe consider them as an option...

Reviews.Title: “Twas okay.....but I'd stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Kay-Marie7
Reviews.Content: The booking went reasonably smooth though I tried to book in the hairdressers via email in the UK as we were attending a wedding in the hotel - they confirmed I was booked in for 1pm but when I arrived (the day of the wedding) I was only actually booked in for 2pm which left me very short of time. When we checked in at reception we ended up having to wait for what felt like an eternity (approx 1 hour 15 mins) as the people in front of us obviously had some form of problem. We didn't get called into another queue and were just left which I thought appalling. The so called Manager was not particularly apologetic and didn't seem to see the problem. When we eventually got into our room (the newer tower) it was very clean, new and really nice though small in comparison to another hotel we'd stayed in. The view was of the mountains and the car park which was okay. We did however have a lack of bath towels - there weren't any! When we asked we were left a couple of hand towels and even though we tipped the maid this didn't change. Being a vegetarian I struggled to eat in the hotel as there wasn't much veggie choice so we ended up going out. Some of the other hotels on the main strip were great and it was easy to hop on and off the monorail link. The Strato only had access to the bus which was a bit of a walk and took forever. The wedding we attended was lovely - great venue and staff couldn't do enough for you - couldn't fault that bit. DVD and photos were fab too. The hotel was okay but when I visit Vegas again I'll stay somewhere else more "central" as it's a bit "out on a limb".

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: JulianNewbury
Reviews.Content: The strat's ok, pretty much a 3 star hotel, it was clean and the room was fine, and cheap! Didn't eat there, or gamble much, so used it just as a base for vegas! One thing I must be negative about is the 8th level pool! Its a pool party scene and one day they had a D.J who must have been the world's worse! Never once did the D.J play an entire song, not even half a song, kept changing them, stopping them - it got so bad I left!!! Also, they close the spa really early, and put 2 signs out which nobody saw, and the liftguard spent his life shouting to people to get out! But why close it so early, when the pool is open until 8pm?! Its only making it a nightmare for the lifeguard!

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere was O.K.”
Reviews.Author: tarheelblue89
Reviews.Content: I chose the Stratosphere because it was an Expedia special. And sometimes, you do get what you pay for. The room did not compare to my previous stays in Las Vegas at Caesar's Palace, Treasure Island and The Mirage. However, to be fair, for a Saturday night stay, those properties were double the price. Our room was in the World II Tower. The room was spacious and very clean (with an exception, I will explain) and seemed comparable to an average Fairfield Inn or similar property: two queen beds, desk, dresser and television. Our room had a view of the mountains. It was good, basic accommodations. Our only issue with the room itself was that the sink area and hand towels had not been cleaned. The housekeeping supervisor arrived quickly after I called. She was apologetic and immediately sent someone to address the issue. The casino at The Stratosphere was not overly crowded and had surprisingly clear air. There are a number of restaurants to choose from in the hotel. The Stratosphere is further down the strip than I had remembered. The only other casino within walking distance (in 103 degree heat) was the Sahara. So, if you want to visit other casinos, be prepared to take a cab or walk to the Sahara and catch the monorail. Overall, not a bad choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb stay at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: holzlynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for 4 nights at the end of August. On arrival we only waited about 20 minutes for check in then when the check in staff discovered it was our honeymoon they did not hesitate to upgrade us to the honeymoon suite at an extremely discounted rate. The suite was absolutely amazing, two wide screen TV's huge bed, and large bathroom with a double jacuzzi which has shutters that opened up into the room the view one of the large TV's. The hotel itself was great we could nto complain at all. There are restaurants that cater for every kind of food from McDonalds, to Chinese, to the all you can eat buffett. The swimming pool was lovely, however being British we could only stick the 45degree heat until about 2:30pm and then we had to go back inside. The hotel is at the downtown end of the strip which as we discovered is about a 6mile walk from the opposite end, but there is so much to see and do from one end to the other you can walk it without noticing. If you dont fancy the walk there is a 24 bus that runs up and down every 15mins or so or of course you can get one of the many taxis that waits outside to anywhere for around $10-$20 depending on how far you travel. Overall we had a great time and will definately be returning to the stratosphere just maybe not when its so hot.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere Stay”
Reviews.Author: tab00007
Reviews.Content: First visit to Vegas wanted something affordable, due to fact we were flying in as well. I personally liked the fact it was a little further down the strip from all the crowdedness. Are room did not have a view, but thats fine no big deal for us. The hotel gave us a great deal with a TravelZoo promo which included free lunch buffet for 2 and $20 credit at Starbucks (inside hotel) could not beat that deal. Also free passes to the top of the hotel and free tickets to go on the rides. Adding all that on top of the room rate, this hotel could not be any better. I would stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Stratosphere deserves better”
Reviews.Author: gottamove34
Reviews.Content: I find this place has be the most unusual when it comes to check-in. I, a chump-change gambler get treated better than those who use the VIP check-in. This has to be the worst VIP check-in on the Strip. The general check-in is much better. I'd like to say more about this, but it would involve hearsay. Rooms: Inconsistent. I've had nice rooms and I've had not-so-nice rooms. I like the small suites best. Standard rooms are a gamble I don't want to deal with. Gaming: It pretty much has everything I need highlighted by friendly dealers and a well-ventilated gaming area. Food: The fast food is nice and all, but there other good cheap eats in the area. The buffet is about as boring as it gets. Fellini's was a nice surprise with their courtesy and meals. Crazy Armadillo is a nice place for margaritas and practicing flair work. Lucky's Cafe is a fine place for breakfast. Naga could just leave for all I care. Top of the World, regardless of price, was still one of the best lunches I've had. This should be a required visit for all tourists. At the very least, take one ride to the top of the tower. It is truly unforgettable. Shopping: The second-floor shops are a nice curiosity. Too many souvenir shops but it's impossible not to have a favorite thing to do on this floor. This is also where the spa is located. It's OK for a casino-hotel but this is a landmark that deserves far better care and management.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob77Milan
Reviews.Content: the hotel is at the end of the Strip and far from the other casinos but is a nice place to stay and not expensive if you overnight during the week ( 50 euros per night with 2 tickets for a show). The Strip is reachable on foot (15 minutes) or by bus stop next to the hotel. You can also use the car (if you have one) because on the strip every casino's car parking is free. Do not have dinner in stratosphere buffet because is cheaper but non at the same level of the other buffet (as Bellagio, Luxor an montecarlo for example).

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere "OK, Nothing flash"”
Reviews.Author: crikey68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Stratosphere Aug 22nd to 26th, 4 nights. Arrived at Midday and check in was very easy, asked for higher room with king bed, no problems, stayed on 16th floor. Noted on previous postings that the 8th floor were the pool is was very busy and noisy, walking from the lifts to the pool thias definately appeared to be the case. Our room had views over the premium outlet mall, great for my wife! and views of the mountains, better for me! Went shopping to the outlet malls the one closet to the hotel is by far the best, had been to the one at Primm before so did not go back there. Picked up some great bargains. The hotel itself appears much older than it 10 years. Free use of the tower between 10-2pm, great views. Room was OK , bed comfortable, toiletries were ordinary, bathroom big with good size room. Most of the staff were friendly enough but some were downright rude and very poor representatives of the hotel, not that anyone really cared though. They closed the pool off to hotel guests one afternoon as it was a private party for people who had apparently spent large amounts at the casino...........boo hoo if you didnt spend thousands and again when we politely enquired about this it was dismissed and we were told to use the "adult pool", no thanks, free to ladies guys pay $10.00, nice little earner that is! The buffet was OK, ate there twice, Friday night was seafood, it was an OK selection nothing fancy, also ate at Roxys again nothing special very basic. They have a floor of shops on the second floor with McDonalds and some souviner places. We went to the american superstars show, had a buy one get one free deal, try get a free one and have a free one. Fair Dinkum this was ordinary, Elvis forgot his words, Rod Stewart dropped the microphone and infact probably played the part really well as he looked completely out of it and the show was billed for 90 minutes it was over in just over an hour, thank god! There are better shows on the Strip, pay a little more and see something like KA at MGM, now that's a great show! Had a storm the last day we were there and closed off the pool mid afternoon, fair enough but 2 hours after the weather alert was lifted the pool was still closed and noone you spoke too knew what was going on. Checkout was easy, completed via the TV. The guys at the Taxi stand did a great job by the way! Word of advice be careful walking at night time up the strip towards the Sahara when you exit the Hotel stay on the same side as the sahara, just past the IHOP on the other side it gets a little rough, we along with others were hassled by some drunks and made sure not to make that mistake again. A little rough around the edges but if you get it cheap enough like we did, go for it. Popular hotel with back packers and tour groups, there was lots of them when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly unlikely”
Reviews.Author: FussyBunny
Reviews.Content: I don't like to say "never" so... It is very unlikely that I will stay at this hotel again. The hotel was extremely outdated. I guess, for the diehard gambler, it's a great bargain b/c it was clean and inexpensive and I broke even in the casino. BUT I prefer the nicer amenities offered at some of the higher-end hotels. Especially the ultra convenience of getting to the pool (save for Treasure Island). At the Statosphere, getting to the pool was like walking a marathon, but once there I enjoyed it. One thing - they could spend more money on greenery by the pool and get rid the painted walls. Can you say "CHEAP"? The employees were very friendly except for a disgruntled woman at the Players Card window (but we all have our bad days).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: Mojoummm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the strat for a week and had a great time. As most families we were on a budget and wanted something on the strip within our price range. The strat is great for 'breathing' away from the hussle and bussle of the strip, and we found once we had done the strip a couple of times, we were happy to be away from the crowds! We didnt order room service as it was too expensive even for basic food orders, so we were delighted to find a McDonalds on the 1st floor of the hotel where we had our breakfast and coffee every morning! I would suggest that if your buying fizzy drinks that you go to Maccy's as you can have free refill's and it saves on the pennies! On check in we were automatically up graded to a premium room from a standard. The room was really spacious and very clean. Our room was cleaned daily with fresh towels, soap, shampoo etc. There are vending machines on each floor which have snack food, and a complimantary ice vending machine which is great for cooling drinks (even sunburned skin!). We found the entertainment in the hotel fab, live bands every night so we didnt always feel the need to leave. You must take advantage of the free viewing of the observation deck between 10-2pm, we saw crowds of people from other hotels who had to pay $18 to go to the top and its free for people staying at the strat. All the shows in the hotel are buy one get one free, (residents of the hotel only) which saves you loads as each show is $42 per person. The pool is on the 8th floor and there are plenty of sun loungers, I didnt think many people would be sunbathing in vegas...how wrong was i!!! We were in the pool ever day, they have a great little snack bar which serves food from 10am, I loved the chicken fingers which you get with fries for $8, very filling. The gym equipment is by the pool too which you can just walk over and use. They have a little jaccuzi pool too which is by the gym machines which we didnt discover till half way through the week. Im going to write prices below which we payed for things as I hope this will help other families who need to plan there budget. Just a little tip, when using taxi cabs, get them to take you via the 'freeway' as it cuts out all the traffic, although it takes you around the strip it cuts out the traffic and the meter goes up and up even when your stationary in traffic jams! Taxi from the airport to our hotel: $27 Taxi from hotel to Fremont Street $13 Taxi from Hotel to Belagio fountains $17 Meal for 2 in Roxy's Diner $42 ($50 with tip) Big Mac Meal $6 Rides at top of the tower varied $11-15 they has a pass which cost $33 which allowed you to go on all 3. We had a fantastic time at the strat and I would reccomend this hotel 100%. I read reviews saying that it was too far up the strip blah blah blah, it isnt. The taxi's are cheap if you want to go to mandalay bay bellagio etc. Believe me, when you have done the strip a couple of times, you just want to be away from the crowds!! The location of the strat is ideal for the strip, fremont street and those getting married as its right by the wedding chapel district. We got married on this trip in the 'shalimar wedding chapel' I think i need to write a whole new review for that! we had a great time, hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money - here's the info on the pool I couldn't find when I was look”
Reviews.Author: C&CCav
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to be overcritical as it was our first time to Vegas and we were there for a wedding and stayed at the Stratophere as that's where the wedding party stayed. It was clean, check in did not take forever (though others in our party waited about an hour), and it's a $17 cab ride (with tip) each way to mid strip. The monorail from the Sahara was cheaper, but it took me about an hour to get from my room to the pool at Planet Hollywood and I wished I'd just coughed up the $15 for the cab ride and had another hour at the pool. Overall it was a decent hotel for cheap ($50 a night) and you get what you pay for. We won't go back - I would pay more to stay in the middle of the action - but if you're looking for cheap and not picky and patient then you'll be ok here. The thing I wanted info on when we were going was the pool - and I couldn't find any, so here's more than you want to know. The pool is nice. It's on the 8th floor, good sized, and there are rows of chairs to choose from. I never went without a chair. There are cheezy little cabanas you can rent for $40 a day that include shade, a window-type air conditioner, pop and water on ice, and 2 nice pool floaties. There's a snack bar and a bar-bar at the pool, as well as a little c-store. The water was cold but bearable, and there was a volleyball net as well. I spent a day at the PH pool, which was nicer, but probably just because you knew you were at a nicer hotel - it really had no more amenities. If you're worried that the pool isn't going to be decent don't worry - it will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “$5/day Resort Fee...LOL”
Reviews.Author: billybclubbin
Reviews.Content: WOWZA!! i know a lot of Vegas 3* hotels charge $1/day for use of the phone (local calls) approx 5 weeks ago i stayed @ the Riviera hotel in Vegas and they chaged like $3day for a resort fee my room @ Stratosphere was one of the most basic 3* hotels i have staed @ in Vegas. The remote control for the tv didn't work. The bathroom was like 2 feet by 2 feet. The sink was actually in the room. Almost all the plugs in the room didn't work. Unless you're getting this place for a smokin' dealio I would recommend staying closer to the middle stirip or even the South end where a lot of casino's are connected!

Reviews.Title: “old dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: mk20707
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel; I stayed in better Motel 8s. Rooms are noisy (loud air-conditioning+highway noise) and dirty. There was no shampoo (I had to ask for it specifically). Beds are uncomfortable. Pool reminds me a municipal pool in Brooklyn; the 25th floor adult only European sunbathing pool is a joke; it has the ambiance of a high school parking lot. The hotel leads you to believe that the rooms are in the tower; but they are in a separate buildings. Location is also bad; it is the last hotel on the strip and the neighborhood is very unattractive. Rooms in Riviera (several blocks toward the civilization) are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY DISAPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: isiaVienna
Reviews.Content: We had a LATE ARRIVAL from NY, but the hotel was informed about before and we payed the full price. We were arrived at 3 a.m., the fly was late 1,5 h, we were arrived from Europe through NY therefore were totally tired, wanted get our shower and go to bed. BUT surprise surprise we had to wait for our room, at the desk problems with nobody-knows-what, than no room (????????) but suite and ... "very sorry". Suite was a ... PARTY ROOM not suitable for sleeping for 3 persons . Not at all! No bed prepared, only two places for sleeping, no shower... We have called the desk, and had to wait 20 min (!) for 1 pillow and 1 blanket. Yes. 1 pillow and 1 blanket for 3 persons! We were 3: my husband, my daughter 14 and me. We have tried to call the desk, but nobody answered. After 30 min house-keeping has made the bed for 2 persons, but what about the 3th`? We have ordered and payed the room with 2 double kings, therefore I went to the desk and asked to speak with the hotel manager. Only after that I have get my room. I have also received free tickets for the show All Stars, but we had jet lag and cannot go to see it. A friend of mine said me he had a similar problem with Stratosphere some years ago, therefore I like to tell this story to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Inclusive accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: repaholl
Reviews.Content: We fully enjoyed our 3-day stay at this hotel. We traveled with 4 children (7, 8, 12, and 17) and all of them got something out of it. The casino/lounge areas were bright, clean and not smokey as were some of the others that we passed through. The food choices ranged from inexpensive fast food to finer dining (Top of the World). The room was comfortable, roomy, and clean, and the staff were very accomodating and friendly. We even enjoyed the lounge acts. Another plus was the shopping area. The kids got to get tattoos and shop for a variety of inexpensive souvenirs. One downfall is the reported area. More than one staff member told us to "Stay to the right. Don't go to the left." upon leaving the hotel to walk the Strip. It didn't affect us though because I took them at face value and stayed to the right :-). I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it as well.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: pappy_28
Reviews.Content: stayed here from the 16th to the 21st of July. there was nothing wrong with the hotel.. room was kinda small.. but it doesnt matter when all u really need is a clean bed and a clean bathroom which this hotel had.. all the staff was helpful.. the casino was nice.. actually liked it better than the big hotels.. the restaurants.. roxys diner was very good.. good burger.. ended up eating at luckys diner 3-4 times since its the only one open 24 hrs.. was ok.. not as good as roxys. only thing one should consider is location. its kinda far.. though the monorail is close by. a cab costs arnd 18 to the center of the strip so if there are 3-4 ppl its better to take a cab. otherwise the bus runs right at the hotel as well.. all in all was a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark-nole
Reviews.Content: Hotwire described this as a 3 star hotel and casino on the North Strip, and was a steal at $19/night (mid-week/mid-summer). So I wasn't disappointed too much when "The Strat" popped out after commiting my credit card number. The room was above-average, the restaurants good, and the hotel and casino staff were very, VERY friendly. Having said that, the location (as others have pointed out) is very inconvienent. Yes, you can get from there from here via taxi, "The Duce" (Double-Decker bus), rental car or the nearby first stop on the monorail. Another "gotcha" is the extra $5 per day service charge for the pool and workout facilities. I didn't mind too much, and got my $10 worth for my two day stay. After that I moved to my original destination, The Mirage. Far superior in every level, but certainly not the rock-bottom price available at the Stratosphere. Enjoy Vegas, and don't hesitate to try this improving hotel and friendly people!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Great baby step to the Las Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: fluffybubbles86
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel for about midnight, checked in and headed of to our room. Good amount of lifts and managed not to get lost. Its a pretty small hotel compared with the majority of other hotels in Vegas. The casino is a good taster of what Vegas has to offer and the buffett bar and restaurant is amazing value or money. Going up the tower got us a bit confused but when we were there if you were staying at the hotel but not riding entry to the tower was free. The view from the tower is amazing and a great way to see Vegas. My sister did the rides and said they were fantastic. You can see one of the rides going over the edge from the observation deck, its unbelievable. We found the hotel shops when we went to the tower, because we were so taken with everything to do in Vegas we didn't know they were there. But they had everything from tacky souveniers to McDonalds. They also have an oxygen bar which is worth checking out. Our room was great, house keepers did a good job, couldn't fault it. Bell boy was quick at bringing up our cases. One thing i would say is it is a bit out the way of the main strip, so taxis are the best way of getting to and fro. We walked one day and were totally exhausted by the end of it. Theres also a bus that goes by, but taxis are by far the easiest and not that expensive. There is also i think its the states largest souvenir shop which is pretty close by and has a few not bad things in it, good priced groceries too. We had a great time staying at the stratosphere, i would recommend staying here as it is good value for money. Its very easy to spend in Vegas so saving a bit of money staying in a hotel which isnt quite in the high end is quite handy especially when its worth it. You can pop into any of the other hotels and have a wonder round and it wont burn a hole in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: netodude3
Reviews.Content: I had a great time my first time in Vegas. I only paid 39 a night for four nights. Room was average but we only slept for a few hours, then back to the casino and sightseeing. I read the reviews and was thinking twice after I booked the room. Things turned out to be great. The mall and Fat Tuesdays was a great touch. Gambling was average. Lost some/ won some. On the last night I won all my money back plus more on a very lucky hand of poker. That's Vegas!!! The dealers were very nice and had no problem showing you how to play at the Strat. The dealers at other casinos were just complete [--] to put it nicely. The only complaint I had was the check-in. Took around fifteen minutes to finally check-in, but the lady was a sweetheart and apologized. The location is a bit far, so expect to spend around ten bucks on cabs. Still, all the money I saved from staying here paid for all that and more. We tried a lot of the buffets at the other hotels, and we prefer the Stratosphere's food. Next time we will see more shows here.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit June 21 & 22”
Reviews.Author: Spuddysmom3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had no problems whatsoever, had stayed before so we knew what to expect(location, etc..) and were once again not disappointed with the service we received, we arrived about 11 am and checked in and found out our room was ready for us, our room was on the 24th floor of the Premier tower with a view of the city, our last couple of visits were in the World tower and I must say I liked the premier tower alot more, the rooms seemed to be alot nicer and it was much closer to the pool where I spent alot of time.. We also went to Polyesters(again) and it was great fun but was very hot!! I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than a Quality Inn on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: tomcat33333
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night at the Stratosphere, and there was not much wrong with the place, really, except that in Vegas, for about $95 a night, you should be able to get a better room that that found in an average Quality Inn. The bed was reasonably comfortable. Furnishings were dated. The room was clean, though the bedspread had burn holes in it. The bathroom is a split design, with the sink in the room and the toilet and shower in a tiny cubbyhole of their own. Shower was okay. There was no closet, only a rack at the end of the room. Speaking of the room, ours had a smallish window, and it looked out on a trash-strewn roof with another building some 20 feet away. So there was a view, and it was disgusting. We found two parts of the Stratosphere experience to be very positive. The trip up the tower is impressive, and comes free between 10 and 2 for hotel guests. It's worth doing, even if you do not want to go on the three insane rides they have hanging off the very top. People who are afraid of heights may have a problem with the tower, but I have some of that and the thing is so big and stable that I did not feel queasy. The second is tghe buffet, which on Fridays and Saturdays has seafood, which means all you can eat crab legs. And unlike buffets that really don't want you to eat much shellfish, this place gives you tools with which to get at the shellfish. The dessert bar was skimpy, but after all that good seafood, who really cares? In all, visit the tower and eat at the buffet, but unless you get an amazing deal on a room, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: s_cinnamon
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere is a Motel 8 with more then 20 stories. This hotel is below average: service, rooms, pool... everything but the buffet. The check in took us almost an hour, as our reservation was not in the system, although we made it trough the hotel website. the room was ok - but nothing more. it was clean, at least what clean means for this kind of a hotel - I wouldn't dare to walk the carpet barefoot. view was as everything in here rather disappointing: parking garages. the pool was filled with girls and guys gone wild and it was filthy. although we left our creditcard "open" we couldn't pay on the pool bar - an ID was required - so what's the point of leaving the credit card open when I need to carry it with me together with my ID? the check out took as long as the check in - even at 4AM (we had an early flight back home), there was only one agent present. the only good thing about stratosphere was the buffet - which I can highly recommend as it offers the perfect price performance.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Gazza036
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Stratosphere as part of our tour of the USA. Found the rooms very roomy and comfortable. Rooms clean but walls a little thin as could hear people in next door. Casino was fun with beer served frequently as you sit and play. Went to American diner which is great fun watching the waiters/Waitresses singing as you eat your ample meal. Also went to restaurant on ground floor for breakfast, excellent value with a vast choice of food and drinks. Location is not a problem as you are a 20 minute walk from main strip but found just outside the Strip is probably a bit quieter and think you need to get away from all the bustle at times. Pool area clean and great at the pool bar watching waiters flirt with the ladies! Overall I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than OK”
Reviews.Author: wahoobob
Reviews.Content: Place was clean as well as the room. Price was also very reasonable. The real problem is the hotel is located right in the middle of enemy territory. You are at high risk trying to walk anywhere. So unless you just stay at the hotel, you will run up a high cab bill. We spent on average 90 to $100 in cab rides to and from this hotel. $20 to $25 each way to just about anywhere. Found the food very marginal and expensive. Next time I'll pay a little more for a room somewhere close to "things" and save on the cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Radzyn315
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night for our Anniversary. I booked for $49+tax & recived a free upgrade to a players suite from an internet promotion I recieved. Check in was fast & efficient. The room was clean & comfortable. We were on the 21st floor and had a nice view of the city, not of the strip. Lucky's Cafe was good. They have an all-you-can-eat breakfast bar for $10. The gaming was hit-and-miss. We won some, we lost some, but ended up breaking even minus the food/beverage/attraction costs. They had a variety of games as well, all the way from old classics to cutting-edge technology games. Hotel guests are able to go up the tower from 10am-2pm for free. I was able to get passes to go up the tower although we were not checked in, just needed to ask the Front Desk. We did not go to the buffet, C-Bar, or Polly Esthers. We were too tired from walking Freemont or the strip. All-in-all, a satisfying outing.

Reviews.Title: “Great food and service”
Reviews.Author: costaricalovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for 2 nights (6/21-22). I do not think I would stay at the hotel again; but, I would definately go back to eat and drink. The rooms were acceptable; but, noisy. We could here other conversations going on outside. Also, I would not reccommend staying on the 8th floor (where 1 of the pools are), as it is extremely noisy and the hall ways is extremely HOT! We ate at the hotel twice and both times/places were excellent. We ate at Fellini's (Italian). There were 4 of us and we ordered 3 different plates and shared them. We had a halibut special (I can't recall the name) that was out of this world. It had tomatoes, capers, onions, garlic on top and it was served with potatoes. Our next dish was just a simple 3 cheese pizza which we added pepperoni and onions to; but, it was fantastic. The dough was incredible. The third dish was the chicken fettuccini; which was fantastic as well. The second place we ate at was Roxy's Diner. A fifties style establishment where the wait staff sings; so you are getting great food and great entertainment. I highly reccommend the burgers and the onion rings are wonderful. I am also giving this hotel an above average score because of the service. Everywhere we went, the employees welcomed you as if they knew you for a long time. I hung out at the bar in front of the sports book to play video poker and the service was impeccable. One of our bartenders (Eric) even suggested different drinks which were no charge as long as you were gambling. Heck, we were even just hanging out watching our bf's play video poker and still drinking on the house. Overall, our stay at the Stratosphere was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “no gambling in vegas”
Reviews.Author: bispu
Reviews.Content: booked in to stratosphere for 3 night stay , no gambling, first visit to vegas, the hotel is located at the end of the new strip , with the old town vegas a 5 min drive away , 2500 rooms,several eateries,shops and of course the tower. the room consisted of 2 king size beds , bath/shower, room was clean and every thing that should have worked did, the view we had was old town vegas from the 15th floor. swimming pool is located on 8th floor but did not use as weather was far to hot to sit about in. eat in the buffet restaurant , first morning was an incredible que, approx 200 people in front, but we were seated in 20/25 min,14 bucks for all you can eat, reasonable value as food offered up was sufficent in taste , eat dinner in american diner , chose wrong item from menu believing it was steak, it was a burger and not that good. had read previous reviews on hotel being dated , probally is a little compared with the new hotels , but i would not have any issue in returning to the stratosphere hotel. the tower part of the hotel gives excellent panoramic views of vegas,there are also 3 rides for the more daring, at over 100 feet i gave them a miss, you have to pay to go up the tower and for the rides. only one minute negative comment , only hotel upon travels in the u.s.a. not to provide tea or coffee in room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Willisk03
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel multiple time but this time was different. We didn't have the fun, helpful atmosphere we are used to. It was still a better place to stay than most hotels I have been to. We also had a great time at the pool. I would recommend renting a cabana, we had a great day!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place at great price”
Reviews.Author: bms13
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great, especially considering the price we paid for it. It may not be as plush or luxurious as some of the other hotels further up the strip, but I felt it was more than adequate. Before booking I read a review which recommended booking a room in the Premier Tower as opposed to the World Tower, which I would definitely also recommend, and it didn't cost very much more. The room was clean and spacious, and had everything we needed. The pool was great, there was plenty of loungers, towels were provided, and it was clean. There was also a pool bar selling alcohol, soft drinks and food, which I thought was really reasonably priced. I was warey about checking in as I had read horror reviews about very long queues,however when we arrived there were several receptionists available, so we checked in and accessed our room immediately, despite arrving well before our alloted check in time. I didn't see any long queues throughout our stay, however while walking through the Venetian we did witness a queue which was honestly about 2 hours long, which I think shows no matter where you stay there is a chance of queuing mainly due to the large volume of people staying in Vegas. There were long queues for the breakfast buffet, so we had breakfast at the next door Sahara which was really nice. The only restaurant within the hotel we ate at was the Chinese restaurant, which was nice, and also reasonably priced. We saw the American Superstars show which is held in the hotel, which was excellent, and tickets are 2 for 1 for residents, however the show was quite short which was a little disappointing. The hotel is right at the bottom of the strip, but the Deuce bus stops right outside, and there is a Monorail stop within the Sahara next door. One night we did walk to the main part of the strip and back, so even though its quite a walk its more than manageable. Altogether I was very impressed with the Stratosphere, especially considering the excellent room rates, and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stratoshere”
Reviews.Author: JimmeeK
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is decent hotel. We had a good experience. The lobby to check in is hard to find and you have to walk through the casino to get to it. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff was very nice. It looks like it may be ready to close as the mall area had empty stores. We ate at Fellini's Ristorante Italiano. The food was cold and had no taste. The area around the casino leaves little to be desired. Very old and run down. The main complaint I had was it was so far away from everything else. But for the price it was a good bargain. I would stay there again for the price and the cleaniness of the hotel/casino.

Reviews.Title: “A great down to earth hotel.”
Reviews.Author: serena2808
Reviews.Content: We loved the Stratosphere Hotel. It was very fancy and extravagant but much more down to earth than the other hotels on the strip. The atmosphere was very light hearted and fun. The Pool was fantastic, no problems with finding a lounger in the sun. The atmosphere was brilliant, felt like we were in the Club Tropicana video, the pool bar was great and the cocktails were delicious and fairly resonably priced. Highly recommend the Restaurant at the top of the Tower. Its a little on the pricy side, however it was very posh but not at all stuck up. Views were amazing and the food was out of this world. Also you get to go to the viewing level without having to pay any extra. The location is great in terms of views as you can see all the way down the strip, however on the down side it is quite a long way from the main bit of the strip (IE where Ceasers Palace is) and a bus or taxi will be needed. Having said that it is a little less busy at the Stratosphere end of the strip and it is closer to the old Las Vegas Strip (Fremont Street). Would definately stay at The Stratosphere if we returned to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gjp200
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel at the end of the Strip Good Value for Money , attentive staff , A great Stay !

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away if you desire any customer service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Smileygirl1178
Reviews.Content: First, I had booked a room a couple of months ago. I called a few weeks in advance to confirm a non-smoking, King sized bed. Seems like an easy request for a hotel with over 2,400 rooms! Not the case when I checked in, apparently my room had been taken and all I was offered was a room with 2 double beds. When I had explained this was supposed to be a very important trip, my husband and I were there celebrating our 5 yr wedding anniversary. She seemed like she didn't care. She advised me to call the next day to see if they had a room with a king sized bed available. No offer to upgrade, no free dinner, no show tickets, nothing! (FYI: Having grown up in Vegas, I know that they can offer all those things and more!) After hours of driving, this would've made the mistake easier to deal with. Anyways, this isn't the end of this, the next day when I called to switch to our original king sized bed room, they sent us to a room with a terrible smell of cigarettes. When I called down to the front desk to tell them I needed a Nonsmoking room, due to my husbands medical condition, "Tiffany" said she was busy and would call me back to the room phone in a 'few minutes'. When 30 MINUTES passed, I was done waiting and decided to call myself, she happened to answer, when I reminded her I was waiting for a return call, she said "Oh, I forgot", Then she said they would switch me to another room (Yes, THREE rooms now, neither upgraded or still, no comps or anything). I could not believe how HORRIBLE we were treated during our special trip. I talked to the front desk manager when we checked out and told her the experience, she offered a discounted room-rate, but at this point, it was not enough. She said I will be contacted about what happened with my stay, we will see how that goes. Do not stay here if you need a special request!! They do not care about you, just taking your money!

Reviews.Title: “Decent.”
Reviews.Author: Alberta83
Reviews.Content: We chose the Stratosphere because it was cheap and on the Strip. The location is great. The rooms were clean, large and had comfortable beds. The rotating restaurant at the top of the Stratosphere is AMAZING! It is expensive, but worth every penny. I am definetely going to eat there again the next time I am in Vegas. This hotel isn't one of the nicest ones on the Strip by any means. It is not fancy in any way, but it is a clean place to stay, with a good location. So, if you are just looking for a decent place to sleep at night, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: avelocko
Reviews.Content: Our first night they booked us into the wrong room so we ended up staying in the tower suits which was like staying in a travel lodge. The next night we changed to the Premier Suits and managed to get a managers special with a hot tub in the middle of the room! It was worth the money we paid, the room was enormous, clean and the shower could have fitted a rugby team inside it! One of the highlights of our stay was a meal at the resturant at the top of the tower. We had a set meal which was matched with wines and it was fantastic. Top quality dining, excellent silver service, and the revolving room was fantastic, great views of the city as we tucked into our food. One downside of the hotel was the area it was in. At night I felt a bit vunerable, especially when we attempted to walk to Fremont Street, there were a few gangs of people who seemed to enjoy intimidating tourists. Apart form that, the monerail was a five minute walk away, the casino itself was good. We both felt nervous having never gambled before, but the staff were ever so helpful and explained the rules as we played.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere a GREAT time!”
Reviews.Author: jdumke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas 3 years ago and stayed at the Stratosphere and LOVED it--gambling odds were better than the other hotels on the Strip, there was lots of entertainment, the view from the Tower was AWESOME and the pool area was GREAT! The convenient Monorail was a short walk away and made it really easy to get around pretty quickly. We ate at the buffet there every day we were there (4 days)--the price was right and the food was excellent and there was a lot of variety. Well, we just got back from Vegas this morning from our second trip. We didn't stay at the Stratosphere this time, but we stayed nearby, and we hung out at the Stratosphere every day! We ate at the very same buffet every day again, and the food was just as good as we remembered it. I wouldn't say the Stratosphere is for those who like excessive luxury (such as the style of the Bellagio, Palazzo, Caesar's Palace, etc.), but if you like to have fun and aren't high maintenance, it has a fun atmosphere, the employees are very friendly and helpful, and if you want luxury, you could definitely get it there for whatever you are willing to pay. Overall though, we think the Stratosphere is FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Strat!”
Reviews.Author: zan75
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks (yes 2 weeks in vegas) and no I am not insane, and stayed here for the full 2 weeks. It was a wonderful stay in the premier tower. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The beds are super comfy. Maid staff was fantastic. We signed up for the Ultimate rewards card (free) and it was well worth it. We had a few free meals at the restaraunts through comps from the card, got 2 free shirts and $20 each in free slot play. The restaurants were great also. Ate at Luckys, Roxy's Felili's and Top of the World. Not a bad meal at any one of them and the customer service was top notch through the entire resort. For the value of this hotel it just cannot be beat. Yes it is at the end of the strip, but cabs are always outside, it is only a 10 min (max ) walk to the sahara for the monorail or you can catch a bus right outside. Never once did we feel unsafe or uncomfortable in the area. Just be smart, like you would be at home and you will have no issues. I would recommend the Stratosphere to anyone for a short or long stay in Vegas :)

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, not so good either”
Reviews.Author: Cancyl
Reviews.Content: Considered quiet cheap for Vegas area, location not on the strip but no problem because most people drives so distance is not an issue. Hotel provides basic amenities. A little bit dated. They give lots of coupon which you can use to go up to the tower to see whole Vegas in the day time.

Reviews.Title: “Mile high in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mrquimleyb
Reviews.Content: This was our last night stay in Vegas after a week touring the Grand Canyon. We didn't have any recommendations but just took pot-luck and were very pleased. We stayed on a Saturday night for just over $100 - some of the other hotels further up the strip were 3 times as much. We booked into the Premium area of the hotel and our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel had good facilities and the pool was excellent. Between 10 and 2 hotel guests can go up the 1000ft tower for free and this provided and excellent view of Vegas and surrounding area. The rides at the top looked too extreme for us but for the real thrill seeker......The hotel buffet was also excellent and there seemed a good range of shows and entertainment for all. A good value for money hotel at the bottom of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “So Cheap and So Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Paula_AF
Reviews.Content: I was afraid of booking there because it was much cheaper than other places, but I had such a nice time! The room was big, clean, it had a bathtub and getting to the room from the parking lot wasn't that much of a long trip as it happens in other Vegas hotels. I loved staying there and the price is great.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Las Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: ssmcgarr
Reviews.Content: Here's my take on Stratosphere. Rooms are nice. Pay for the better room - it's worth the extra money. The first night was in the cheaper room and it wasn't as nice. Breakfast buffet was good. Had fun in the casino. Caught the trolley to go down the strip and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time At The Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: goatroper127
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were first time tourists in Las Vegas and were apprehensive about our booking at the Stratosphere. We had seen many of the other reviews, some great and some not so great, before we left. We were picked up at the airport and taken to the front entrance of the hotel where we got in line to check in. Didn't have to wait too long. Rosa informed us that the room we had reserved was not available BUT she would be glad to upgrade us to a much nicer room on the 22nd floor of the Premier Tower. What a nice room! Jaccuzi tub, huge window looking west over Las Vegas, and really nice King size bed. We really enjoyed the jaccuzi at the end of the day. A big highlight of our stay at the Stratosphere was our dinner at the Top of the World restaurant. It was very pricey but the food, the service, and the view was outstanding. The restaurant is on the 107th level of the Stratosphere and it rotates once every hour so the view is always changing and at night it is very romantic! Don't miss this if you stay at the Stratosphere. You won't regret it. My wife and I felt EVERYTHING at the Stratoshere was top notch. We didn't encounter anyone on the staff - from the desk clerks, cashiers, dealers, security, maids or anyone that seemed unprofessional at any time. On the contrary, everyone we encountered were very professional, helpful, and went beyond the call of duty to make sure we were well taken care of. Thank you all for a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Executive Suite”
Reviews.Author: az_loves2travel
Reviews.Content: We booked the Executive Suite at the Stratosphere in Las Vegas for three nights and it was wonderful. We ate the breakfast buffet once, it was really good fresh food. Visit the shops and fast food upstairs they are a great option if you don’t want to spend a lot on every meal. The casino was not as flashy as most of the casinos on the strip but it was nice and we had good drink service. We spent the majority of the time walking the strip and visiting the other casinos anyway. The location is away from the busiest part of the strip but the Deuce was easy to take, cheap and right outside the hotel. We used the Monorail one day during our trip and that was fun it does not stop everywhere so you will walk more but you don’t have to wait more than 6 minutes and its not crowded. I don’t think it matters where you stay on the strip if you want to see everything your going to be walking or riding the Deuce. The Executive Suite was nice and comfortable. The spa tub was big enough for three people that was freaking awesome!! The highlight of the day was getting all sore and tired on the strip then coming back to our Suite firing up the spa tub and relaxing with my honey so we could get dressed and go to dinner. It was like heaven, I spent a lot of time in the spa tub. Everything in the suite was decent, the bed was very comfortable and the service we received was great. The thing you must remember is that the Stratosphere is not the Bellagio no matter what room you get. Its nice but if you come expecting to pay for a Toyota and get a Mercedes you will be disappointed. I highly recommend the Executive Suite for someone looking to save money but have a nice stay and a little luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: judithbr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week. The hotelrooms are very clean and big. the hotel staff is very nice and helpfull! Wel loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Not so Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GRACE1121
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night and it we were very suprised and pleased. The food was very good and they have exceptional service. We dined at the Courtyard Buffet for breakfast and it was Great. There were many selections to choose from as well as great service by all the Staff. We had dinner at an asian restuarant called Naga and it was also good. This hotel is near the end of the strip and there are alot of cheap motels that make the location of it not so good. We did not go walking anywhere at night to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: jorgeq82
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I just returned from Las Vegas (May 4-8th) and we stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel and we had a great time the moment we checked in. If you're a first time visitor to the hotel, make sure to mention that because for newcomers, they offer special discounts and upgrades. For $20 more, we were upgraded from a standard room to a honeymoon suite which was gorgeous. It included living room with sofa, 2 t.v sets, spacious bathroom, huge bed and most importantly, a jacuzzi in the middle of the room. The hotel has great looking pools and outdoor jacuzzi in the 8th floor along with both an inside and outside gym available to customers. I also highly recommend a perfect Italian restaurant in the hotel itself called Fellini's. Of course, no Vegas vacation is complete without touring the entire strip but if you wish to just lounge in the hotel, Stratosphere has everything you can want in regards to gambling and other fun activities. The only drawback I would mention about the hotel would be the location itself. It's located at the end of the strip but that was easily resolved for us by taking a bus ride referred to as The Deuce. $2 for one way ride or $5 for an all day pass. I would also recommend renting a car, which we did and on nights that we stayed out late, we parked in the free garages in other hotels and then walked around the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Scary rides at the top of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Froggggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night on a special deal (£22) available via expedia. Hotel at the northern end of the strip. Hotel reception not well signposted. Room size and beds adequate but lacks in-room safe, limited TV channels and ceiling lighting precariously mounted onto ceiling wall which could be very dangerous for families with young children. Free access to the tower observation deck for people who live in the hotel between 10am and 2pm. Otherwise costs $10.00 for hotel guests and $13.00 for walk in customers. Once you get up there, great views of LV. You can also watch the 3 rides at the top, I've tried the big shot before which was bearable, however the X-extreme looked really scary especially when propelled to over the edge of the tower looking straight down onto the strip. Only advisable for those without heart conditions to say the least. Unfortunately the limited time that I had didn't give my a chance to get on. The other ride "insanity" wasn't running whilst I was up there, but looked dangerous when spinning you at a 70 degree angle perched over the tower edge..........................

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deals.”
Reviews.Author: Mystiki
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere is deffenitly not the fanciest on the strip, but if you are looking for a clean hotel for a very good price, then it's a great deal. I was a little worried after reading some reviews, but they should be taken with a grain of salt. First of all, the biggest complaint I have read on here, is the distance. No it's not center strip, but neither is Mandalay Bay, way on the other end. It's Vegas, if you don't like waking I wouldn't suggest going in the first place. The Deuce bus runs right outside of the Stratosphere, or you can walk a few blocks to the Sahara and take the monorail. We walked around ALL day, so whether we were coming from one end of the strip, or the center of the strip, either way our legs would be getting a work out all day. Another complaint I have heard is that it's a "horrible area" I wonder what kind of white picket fence neighborhood people are living in if they think THAT is a bad area. I would have felt completely safe walking to the hotel at night by myself in that area.. It's really not that bad, people are constantly walking around all areas, not just center strip. At least on that end I didn't have to deal with the constant cards being given out for hookers. If you live in a city you probably see A LOT worse. Thirdly, yes the hotel itself is quite outdated.. But for as cheap as you can get it, it's not that bad. Our room, and the others we were with had perfectly clean rooms. If you are like me and only really plan to shower and sleep (or barely sleep) in, then that should be good enough! Our bathroom even had a big soaker tub. Overall, if you want to save your money for fun things in Vegas, and if you really aren't one to spend all of your time in your room, this hotel has amazing deals, and it was well worth it. I'm not saying it wouldn't be nice to stay in a really beautiful hotel on the main part of the strip, but if you want to save some money, and if you think there are more important things to spend money on, then this place gets that job done!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price....”
Reviews.Author: laribee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in December, a $50 special, and we were spoiled after having stayed at South Point. The room was like an older Holiday Inn or Super 8. We didn't wait long in line, tons of parking. No serious problems, just average & dated room.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Suites are worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: a_traveling_couple
Reviews.Content: We arrived in May 2008 at 6:30 pm on a Sunday night. We were very disappointed to find that all rooms in the Premier Tower with nonsmoking king beds were full. This is what we requested when we booked through the hotel website. The only thing they could offer us was a handicapped room with a king bed. We didn't like it. It was a small room, had a view of the buildings air conditioners and the bathroom was AWFUL. The floor was painted concrete. No fan. No real sink counter. It was a walk-in shower with no tub. If you take a shower the water gets all over the bathroom floor. You can not walk in there with your socks on - your feet will get wet. No spot to set your shampoo or soap. And in the room the TV is located off to the left of the bed instead of directly in front. So we called the front desk and said we wanted a better room. We paid an extra $80 a night to switch rooms to the Executive Suite (12th fl.) and it was SOOOO WORTH IT! The entry and bathroom are all marble. The room is huge - 775 sq. feet. Crown molding, table, chairs, sofa, TV, fridge, microwave, 3 sinks, mirrored closet doors, HUGE jacuzzi tub, huge walk-in shower, separate toilet room...decent view of the Saharah Hotel. We were thrilled. One tip for people who like to drink: have your taxi driver stop at a store that isn't near the strip and pick up affordable bottles of alchohol and soda. Then put them in your room fridge and make your own affordable drinks. We stayed at the Stratosphere for 3 nights and took taxi's everywhere. Average price to the strip, the Palms and Fremont Street is $8 - $15 a trip. We hated the bus - it is slow and always packed with sweaty smelly people. We took advantage of the free entry to the top of the Stratosphere from 10am - 2pm if you book the package through the hotel website. It was one of the high points of our trip. No lines, friendly elevator service, no crowds, fantastic views inside (huge clear windows) and out (walk up the stairs to get outside). It will take your breath away! There is even a Starbucks at the top. Great place to relax for a few hours and enjoy the views. Bring your camera and video camera for sure. 360 views of the entire city. We also spent two days at the pool. We weren't impressed. Water was freezing cold. You can't relax in the water because someone is always splashing around with the basketballs or volleyballs. Umbrellas are hard to get if you come later in the day but there is some shade under a canopy far from the pool. The view of the mountains is nice and we enjoyed the hot tub. Plenty of chairs to sit on. There was just too much concrete and not enough greenery, plants and trees. They should revamp it with more greens and a warmer pool and then the place would be a hit. Drinks were expensive as usual for Vegas. It also costs $10 to visit the "private, tops optional" pool. There is a little mall inside the Stratosphere with a McDonalds. We went there every morning but the service was terrible. Very slow and unfriendly. Too bad. One of our taxi drivers said the locals call it the Shitosphere but we didn't think it was that bad. It was a decent, clean hotel if you get the right room such as the Executive Suite. The view is worth the taxi ride from the strip - going to the top is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: davina2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Stratosphere because my friends who I was traveling with had already booked the room there from Hotwire. I have absolutely NO complaints about the hotel. I booked my room from the website and got a better price than Hotwire was giving AND I was also given additional perks for booking online. The "regular" rooms online were 39.95/night ( I stayed Monday-Thursday) for 49.95, I was able to upgrade to the Premiere Tower which was a bit larger than the regular rooms and had a much larger bathroom. If you're looking for something extravagant, this is not the place to say. The rooms are very average..nothing more than a Super 8. Upon arrival at 10pm check-in worked like a fine oiled machine. They directed you were to go..it did take a while to get checked in--maybe 30 minutes, but once checked in, it was very easy to find our room. For 39.95/night we got the room, buy one get one free show at Statoshphere, 2 free tower passes, a coupon book worth $150.00. check out was 11am, but for an additional $30 Sun-Thurs you can choose to stay until 3pm. Worth it if your plane leaves later in the day. Stratosphere has some $5 tables which you cannot find at the higher end hotels. I didn't get much of a payout at the tables but I did hit pretty well at the bar poker machines. All you have to do is put $10 in there and play 2 credits to get all the free alcohol you want. The bartenders were awesome!! If I was to do it all over again, I would have chosen the Stratoshpere. The only downfall I found to Stratosphere, is that it's at the far north end of the strip. I will probably stay at a hotel further south on the strip next time, but the overall experience was very good. We ate every morning at the Courtyard Buffet..lots of choices, but nothing special. Worth the cost..we would eat once mid morning and then eat supper. We ate at Roxy's Diner one night. 50's motiff and great entertainment. The food was OK....The view from the top of the Stratosphere was awesome, the rides made my legs give out just watching them. I'd say give Stratosphere a try..especially for the money concious.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, a bit of a hike”
Reviews.Author: Arshes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights while he attended a conference at the Convention Center. Overall, the hotel was a decent place to stay. The staff was helpful upon check-in and check-out. We arrived early and were able to leave luggage with bell desk until room was ready. After arriving in our room, luggage was brought up. We weren't leaving Vegas until the evening of check-out date, so again, luggage was left with bell desk. The room was very basic but clean. Housekeeping did a thorough job daily, at a time that was convenient to our schedule. Hotel was a little removed from the rest of the Strip, for people who were relying primarily on their own feet for transportation. The Monorail was not too far of a walk to use. My husband and I enjoyed the separate adult only pool as well, allowing a nice break from loud kids playing in the regular pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for the price!”
Reviews.Author: tnpark17
Reviews.Content: I found the stratosphere on Hotels.com for 27.00 a night. It was WELL worth this low price. The hotel staff was very friendly and pleasant, the room was neet and tidy, the view was of a cement wall though (my only complaint). There are a few restaurants including a mcdonalds for cheap late night eats. I would rather stay somewhere more central strip next time, for a cheap trip with a great value hotel this would be my number 1 pick.

Reviews.Title: “this place sucks”
Reviews.Author: thisplacesucks
Reviews.Content: You indeed get only what you pay for. I guess for $60 bucks a night I shouldn't expect much, but rude check in girls, long long lines to check in and out and no towels in the room fall under that umbrella. Bottom line....don't stay here when you come to Vegas...spring for the upper crust....this place basically sucks. Also, the white trash in the gambling areas are a detraction as well, don't they have rif raff filters in that place???

Reviews.Title: “Great Value clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: kkremer
Reviews.Content: It is a truely nice hotel considering the low amount you pay for a room. The hotel staff is friendly, the casino staff tries to be. The pool is nice and big nothing special. The rooms are pretty large and verry clean. So a big plus for the stratosphere

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ringluvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel during our first visit to Vegas in 2006. I gave it 3 stars because our room was big and clean. The bellman and the other employees were very nice and helpful. Our room had a very updated bathroom. We did have a problem with the smell of smoke in our room. We'd requested non-smoking but someone had clearly been smoking in that room. They came up and sprayed something but then your smelled smoke and whatever they sprayed. The bed was hard and the in room coffee was the worst I've ever had. Be prepared to go to the Starbucks down stairs every morning. The casino seemed to be wall to wall smoke. While we were there, they were doing some renovations to the casino floor, so maybe it disturbed the air filtration system. But it was very smoky. It’s far from the action on the strip but The Deuce bus stop is right in front of the hotel. It’s very cheap. There is also a taxi stand (as with most Vegas hotels) right in front as well. I would not recommend walking in that area. It’s a little seedy. Further down the strip, I would highly recommend walking. We won't ever stay at the Stratosphere again. Not because it's a bad hotel, but because we discovered during the first trip, hotels more fitting to what we enjoy. If you feel like a hotel room in Vegas is just a place to lay your head for a few hours a day, then the Stratosphere is probably a good choice for you. It’s clean and it’s not expensive. We prefer a little more luxury when we travel, so we prefer the Wynn and the like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room with wonderful view of the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: maythefal
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from April 14-18. I booked three Executive Suites, one Grand Suite, and one Premier Room. Check in was a breeze, quick and efficient. Staff was very friendly. Below is a detailed description of all the rooms. Two of the rooms were on the 22nd floor, which were the best. I personally stayed in the Executive suite, and had my children in the connecting Premier Room. The suites can be both smoking and non-smoking, but luckily mine did not smell this time of cigarettes. Both rooms were very clean, and the beds are comfortable. While I have read complaints about the quality of the beds, I really have none. I think the beds and pillows are more than adequate. The Premier Room was the one with two queen beds, and the room is kind of small. It does not have a closet, but an armoire, which is quite small as well. The bathroom is large enough, and kept clean. The Executive Suites have a king bed and a sofa bed, along with refrigerator, sink, and microwave. It also has a small dining room table with four chairs. The room is considered a mini-suite, and it's very spacious. It has a mirrored-door closet with a safe, and a marble entrance to the room. There are two large picture windows that offer great views to the strip (depending on which floor you're on). The best part is the bathroom! It has a double sink vanity, with a separate area for the toilet (with a privacy door). There is a glass enclosed shower, with a separate spa tub big enough for two persons. Of all the mini-suites, this is my favorite one. The other two Executive suites we had were located on the 11th and 8th floor. The one on the 11th floor had good views, but the one on the 8th floor did not. It looked out onto the machinery located above the casino roof (at least I think it's the casino roof). The last room we had booked was another mini-suite, the Grand Suite. It's a little bigger than the Executive suite, since it has a separe living room/dining room and bedroom. The living room has a sofa bed, and the bedroom a king bed. It also has a sink, refrigerator and microwave. There is a TV in both the living room and the bedroom. Inside the bathroom you will find an open closet and safe. There is a double sink vanity, but it is much smaller than the one in the Executive Suite. It has a spa tub, but it's for one person (think of your regular house bathtub, but with jets). The toilet is separated from the bathtub, but only by a small wall partition (no privacy door). It is also an excellent room, but for my personal preferences, I will take the Executive Suite any day. The Grand Suite was on the 7th floor (all Grand Suites are located on the World Tower) and it overlooked the parking garage. Not the best view in the world, unless you want to check in on your car every now and then. All rooms were very clean. Staff was very friendly and efficient. Check out was even faster than check in. This is the third time I stay at the Stratosphere, and although it's the furthest hotel on the strip, you get much better room rates. The rates we paid for the mini-suites were less expensive than the cheapest room rates on the middle of the strip, and we had much better rooms. Since we always rent a car, the distance did not pose any problem for us. Parking is free in all hotels, so renting a car is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere unless you get a really good deal”
Reviews.Author: mdam
Reviews.Content: It was quite a painful experience staying there. I had booked on the hotel website itself, and paid extra for what they called a premier room, but they gave me a standard room, and even tried to pass it off as premier room. I reached after a very long flight, past midnight, and had to wait in queue for an hour to checkin. When I finally found my way to the room, the key card did not work, and had to call the security to get me into the room; which meant another 20 minute wait in the dingy corridor on the 22nd floor !! Other option of course, was to go back to the long queue, which seemed to get longer as the night progressed. I had specifically asked for a non-smoking room, but they did not have any, and offered to spray the room with room freshner, which I refused. Room was quite dated, with matching furnishing and antique bathroom. The drains were not working too well, either, but I was fed up to complain. On the first night, I was too tired to notice the noise from the corridoor and the adjoining rooms, but from the second morning onwards, it was a painful start to each day. No comments about the buffet, as I never ventured there, considering the rest of the experience. There is the tower on top, with a nice view, and also a few wild rides, but you can do those anyway, whether you stay in the hotel or not. But if you are staying here, then ask for a room rate that incldues tower admission and ride tickets. Overall, a terrible experience. Look elsewhere if you can, unless you get a dirt cheap rate that you just cannot refuse, and are willing to put up with all this for the money you can then handover to them at the large casino downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I had a great time at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: EmmyAndDuke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Stratosphere from April 7-11, 2008. We had a wonderful time. The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. Our check-in process was very smooth and very quick. We ate at the Courtyard Buffet for breakfast a couple of times. They have good food and a wide assortment of options. We ate dinner one night at Roxy's, good food and great entertainment. Our room was extremely clean. We stayed on the 21st floor in the Premier Towers. The walls are a bit thin but we never heard our neighbors during the night so no complaints there. The bathroom was extremely clean and the maid service did an excellent job keeping up everyday. The hotel is a bit far from the rest of the casinos on the strip but we bought the 3-day unlimted monorail passes and that worked out great. You just have to walk a block down to the Sahara and it is located on the street behind that hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and you can't beat the prices either. Great Bargain!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A clean base in Vegas - you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: JakeRM1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently completed a three night stay at the Strosphere Las Vegas. This was my second time staying at the hotel, but last time was with a buddy of mine. The Stratosphere is a good place to stay if you're on a budget. It is clean, the staff is mostly nice, it's safe and the attractions/food is cheap(er). We stayed in the "premier" tower, although if it is premier I feel bad for anyone staying in the less-than-premier tower. The room was straight forward but the bed was awful. I don't remember it being so bad the last time I was there but who knows. The walls are on the thin side. Although the hotel is on the very north end of the strip (it's the last hotel on the strip before you get to the seedy area between the strip and Freemont St.), I actually like the location. A $5 all-day bus ticket gets you up and down the strip very easily. Leave about 15 minutes to get to the Bellagio area. If you're heading during the middle of the day, leave about 30 minutes. The only time we took a cab was when we had a tight dinner reservation. If you're going to gamble make sure to sign up for the players club. I did on my last trip and two of my three nights were comped on this trip. I am by no means a high roller, but the hotel will do a lot to bring people into the casinos during the slower summer months. The pool was rather straight-forward. It has a pool-side bar which I thought was very reasonable. The cabanas are nothing more than plastic huts, don't waste your money. I'd like to correct something in the post before me. The main pool is free to everyone. There is an "adult" pool (read topless) where women are free and men are $10, you have to be over 21 to go there. I couldn't convince my wife to check it out, but I've heard good things. While staying at the Stratosphere, a lot of room packages include free admission to the tower. Make sure to head up there at night, the view is amazing. The bottom line, for the price the place can't be beat. However, for an extra $20-$40 a night, I will probably stay at a nicer place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: heid4882
Reviews.Content: The Bad= Location was a bit out of the way, lobby was super smoky and stinky. The hotel overall was nothing to rave about, but the price was fair. The Good= price, trolley swings by at random intervals so you don't need to take a cab, everything you need is in the hotel somewhere, even a little shopping mall area! Lots of different food choices. We ate at the Japanese restaurant one night... yummy! We also caught the impersonators show and checked out the tower, which were both pretty cool. You get a discount for the show if you're a hotel guest. The best part of our hotel we discovered on the last night of our trip.... POLLYESTERS! This nightclub was fun and unique. We all chipped in $20 each and got a VIP table with bottle service... unlimited drinks! The club has a 70's room, 80's room, 90's room, and 2000's with appropriate decor and music for each. It was quite unique! We loved hopping from the disco music to pop and back again. So, long story short... if I ever get back to Vegas, I would not stay at the Stratosphere again, but I would pay a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Strat!”
Reviews.Author: kwalker726
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere for our 1st anniversary and it was superb! We stayed at the Mirage the year before (when we got married) and that was really really nice, but it was pricey. The Strat was very inexpensive yet still classy and fun. The slots are very loose. The entertainment and food was great and the staff was very friendly. We booked our flight and room online, but when we got there, we told the front desk it was our 1st anniversary and they upgraded our room for free! The room was big and comfy. If you want to save some money, or have more money for gambling and entertainment, the Strat is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss”
Reviews.Author: dgom
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at 2am - we were supposed to be in the Premier Tower - we were informed they do not save reservations as some people do not turn up - made no sense to me - we were just lucky that they had some rooms left but were put in another area of the hotel - not what we had booked at all- we noticed other people who had also reserved non-smoking rooms being advised that there were only smoking rooms available. Then we were told that we had to pay $5.00 per day resort fee!!! Never heard of that one before. Room was ok -bed was comfortable but housekeeping was poor - they left garbage in the room and dirty glasses. Never saw any winners at this casino - but when we went to others on the strip we saw plenty of winners. Restaurants were very expensive - so we ate at other hotels - pool was free for women and children but men had to pay $10.00 - needless to say we did not bother to use this. Staff was very friendly but this hotel nickel and dimes you to death - would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: stupidduck
Reviews.Content: The walls were thin. We were kept up each night by people simply talking in the next room. The concierge desk were less than helpful with any problems I had.
