I was never offered a drink while I played the slot machines. I am mostly dissapointed in this hotel because I had a very bad experience with on of the tower shops ( Aqua Massage). The hotel would not help me resolve my issues. And I therefore feel ripped off. THe hotel is far from the action of the strip. We spent a fortune on cabs. We wasted a lot of time walking or waiting for a bus, which is why we ended up taking cabs. I do not recomend this hotel. Where other hotel do thier best to keep their customers happy, The Stratospher will do nothing at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, clean air, nice peeps, cheep gift shop at hotel”
Reviews.Author: OddieND
Reviews.Content: April 4-7th 2008 I like the place. We seen like 3 brides there over the weekend, Air was cleanier then i read about on here. The room was nice, they asked if we wanted a king bed or two queen ithink, the room was as ok size for a king, the drain stinked BAD when we ran the water. Nice size TUB. awwwwwww. i called for towels at night and they would be there in 5 min to replace then every night, we had allot of expensive things in the room so we never had the room cleaned. and we were nver there (house hunting) we seen 36 houses (Forclosed) houses in 2 days.- that was tiring. But we found 1. asked 50k below the asking price of 195k house-all re-modled. was worth (280k) settled at 167k Hotel-Everyone everywhere and the store's upstairs employees were all nice (all trying to make a dolla) but just to grab a piece of pizza is like 4 bucks, but it was good. the buffet downstair near slots were 34.99 for my hubby and I only. the food was very good, Brunch, large Variety, salad bar was good, the people are all nice, the town was very easy to get around with all the signs. If you buy somthing for anyone, get it in the hotel, not at all the shops around and near the strip. Coffee cup 8.99 pen 3.39. vegas towel- $10.00 you can get the same shirt in the hotel for 2.50 or go down the road at " the Largest Gift shop" and pay 12.99.. Use valet- we tiped them 2 bucks only when you pick up your car, they were more then happy with that. and offered to give directions. No tip- no "have a great day, Drive safe, can i help you with anywhere you need to go?" it's worth the few buck to just drop off the car to them, grab your bags and walk in the door, it is quite always to the elevator to go up to your room, you'll have to walk through the casino to check-in and get to your room. Check in ws easy, we were there about 3:30 pm on a Thursday, no line. Just sign a peice of paper and shove it in a box to check-out, took 1 min. FREE TOWER visit-if you stay at the hotel. From like 10-2 pm i think the time is, you can go up there for as long as you like, we were up for about an hour taking pics and relaxing. I'm sure it's better at night- but why pay.- Check all your coupons. Do not eat on the strip- WAY too high of prices. Travel down a few miles. Traveling on a monday was very easy. plane left out of vegas 4:30 we were there 4 hrs early, no need for that at that time. we walked about for about 2 1/2 hrs. Came home to ND my new Old English Bulldog puppy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved stratosphere hotel Las Vagas.”
Reviews.Author: nanagoogu
Reviews.Content: I went with my 38 year old daughter 25/3/08 to 1/4/08 we had the best time ever, this hotel for me was just in the right place as I wanted to go down town as well as on the strip.The duece bus stops just outside which ever way you are going and costs $2 one way or $5 all day, we used this every day, travelling up the strip and downtown freemont street the bus also goes to the las vegas outlets just outside town a must for shopping.We tried all the restaurants in the hotel, Lucky's was okay and roxy's diner with live entertainment from the waiters, also good.But our favourite had to be the courtyard buffet, we had champagne breakfast on sunday with salmon, crab + all the usual bacon, eggs, fresh fruit, cereals, omlettes to die for, made fresh to your own recipe,roast dinner even at 7 oclock in the morning, every fruit juice know to man, tea, coffee,hot chocolate any one who says different is either not telling the truth or has not been there.We used the hairdressers the nailbar and made a video at the dancing heads outlet, went in the tower and used the casino.The hotel offers a free laundry service on the 6th floor and has a wonderful pool with free sunbeds on the 8th floor. We visited the hoover dam and went to a show at olympic palace the venue was naff but the show was very good.we used the taxi's to hard rock cafe and freemont street if you tell the driver not to go down the strip it is reasonable.The room we had on the 11th floor had a good view of the mountains + freemont street, we loved the golden nugget downtown.I know vegas has a seedy side to it but it is also a lot of fun and before anyone says I must be easily satisfied I have been all over the world and realise people do have problems but use your sense and be aware then you can enjoy.the only thing I didn't like was the flight which is a killer, I would stay a couple of nights on the east coast next time and break it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaynorKW
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The desk staff were the friendliest I have ever come across and this applied to all other staff we encountered as well. Our room was huge with 2 beds, it was cleaned daily and we slept very well. We ordered room service for breakfast most days; as the portions were definitely big enough to share it was cheaper for us than ordering two separate meals from Lucky's diner. To get to the strip we walked across to the Sahara (about 5 mins) and took the monorail. You can get the bus in the opposite direction to the Freemont Street experience. We ate in the Top Of The World restaurant which was very expensive and not for vegetarians or people who feel strongly about animal rights (with foie gras, lobster, veal, venison and elk on the menu!). Vegetarian choice was pasta or a vegetable platter which was literally a plate of sliced veg for $38! You can go to the bar to experience the same views for free. The American Superstars show was cheesy but good fun and hotel guests get BOGOF offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - for the price!”
Reviews.Author: route507too
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stratosphere in August of 2007 with a friend. She had just been laid off and we were traveling on a budget. We stayed in three hotels all together over 4 nights that we were there. The first night we stayed at Binion's in Downtown Vegas, but the Fremont St Experience, the next two nights we stayed at the Strat, and our last night we stayed at Imperial Palace. We didn't pay more than $55 for any of the nights we stayed, and we only paid $39 for the Strat. In comparison with the other two cheap hotels we stayed at, the Strat was by far the BEST. From the inside of the hotel and hotel room, it may as well have been the MGM, NYNY, or TI. The rooms are completely comparable to those three higher priced hotels. The service was fantastic, we really only used them for check in and holding our bags, but they were completely friendly and we had no problems. Express check out made leaving to get to the final hotel super easy. The line for check in was a little long when we arrived, but nothing compared to what we saw of the line the next day. When you enter the main casino doors, the check in area is all the way to the right at the back wall of the casino, the day after we checked in, the check in line was just reaching those main doors! (Thank God we weren't waiting in that!) The rooms were really great. I couldn't believe we had only paid $39 a night for them. There was nothing shoddy about them (whereas our room at Imperial was slightly dingy, and we knew we had only paid about $50 for the room.) I didn't notice anything broken, no stains on the carpets (as one might expect in a $39 a night hotel), nothing was amiss. The major drawback to staying at the Stratosphere is OF COURSE the distance to the rest of the strip. (I wouldn't recommend trying to walk that far, especially in August!) It's great that getting a cab is so easy in Vegas though, otherwise there may have been a real problem. If you can accept that you'll pay slightly more in cab fare and a lot less for a room, definitely try a stay at the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: sparky2222
Reviews.Content: You are greeted with a 1 hour wait in the check in line. I had to stand in it twice. We were on a romantic getaway and had booked a room with a king bed. When I finally make it through the line I find out they don't have any more kings, so they put us in a 2 queen room. This was about 5pm. I of course objected, but they assured me they would put us in a king room as soon as 1 became available, for sure by noon tomorrow. I went down and stood in the line again at noon and guess what, no kings, but 1 will surely be available by three. Then it was 6, then it was 9. They never called like they said they would, and they actually expected me to sit around the room and wait for them to call. Unbelievable. The rooms were small and plain. Halls were dirty. Parking garage was scary. We checked out the next morning and got a beautiful room at the Paris for $20 more than the rate at the Scabosphere., I was given a fantastic room and checked in in 2 minutes. I had prepaid through Expedia. The Scabosphere wouldn't refund what we had paid for the 3rd night that we had already checked out. They said it was up to Expedia to do that. I called Expedia when I got back home, and they said they have to ask the hotel if they will refund the unused night. I'm still waiting for a refund that will never come. Expedia never called back either. No more Expedia travel/hotel packages for us. We saved our romantic getaway by ditching the Scabosphere and going to the Paris for a fabulous last day. .

Reviews.Title: “Best Suite for the money!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel94
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Grand Suite for a week. Very nice with large living room area, fold out sleep sofa with tv and fridge. Separate Bedroom area with large bathroom with jet-tub. Excellent for families if you want some privacy. The AC wasn't working, we did get that fixed. The cleaning staff is wonderful and always gave us extra towels and anything else we may want. The casino, is always crowded but the vibe is fun. The American Superstars show is great for the value, you can get 2 for 1 admission. They have Tim Mcgraw look-a-like and he is wonderful. Along with Michael Jackson who is hilarious, and Christine Aguelara and Elvis. They put on a great show. Had a phone-call the day of check-out and the guy said we still owed money. That was a huge problem, and If its still not resolved we wont stay there again. We made reservations thru the hotel, paid our deposit was given the total amount including all taxes and fees. When we went down to check-out the guy there had NO authority whatsover to do anything, it was up to the book-keeper and of course he wasn't there. So called the CC company and confirmed that all the hotel charges were Pending. I guess they figured it out but nobody ever called us back. So aside from that headache it was all good. I think if your a returning customer (which we are) and spend your money there, they should be trying to bend over backwards to make sure your happy instead of fussing over owing money (that isn't owed).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyetough88
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere Hotel is at the far north end of the "strip" opposite end as the airport. If you rent a car it is an easy drive and easy access. Parking is easy and free in the covered ramp, or you may choose valet parking for a tip. If you dont rent a car there are shuttle buses at the airport that will take you to the Stratosphere for $11 round trip. We arrived at the check-in desk about 3:00pm. There was a line but it moved quickly. From the time I got in line til I had my room key was about 30 minutes or less. The lady checking me in was welcoming and efficient. Check-in charges were as expected. There is a $5 resort fee charged at check-in per night. This is for use of the awesome pool, laundry, free tower admission between 10am and 2 pm. Expect a line here also at these times. Our wait was again 30 minutes or less. My package included free tickets for the rides on top the tower. If you like amusement park rides you must do the 3 on the tower. Very cool!! I must admit, the 2 that hung over the edge at 1000+ feet were a little scary but what a rush!! At check-in you will also get a few coupons for the buffet, Cbar, etc. The buffet was reasonably priced and the food good. Huge desert area. Soft drink, juice, tea, etc. included in price. We stayed in a spa suite the first 2 nights. It was a regular size hotel room, very clean I thought. View of the strip was cool. Spa tub was jetted and plenty big for 2 people. Our last night was in the Executive suite. This is a super cool room at a reasonable price Sunday thru Thursday. It has a king size bed, sitting area with a couch and chair, coffee table, tv, kitchen area with a fridge, microwave and sink. Batroom was huge with a jetted tub for 2, glass enclosed shower, 2 sinks, huge mirror. Table and 4 chairs under one of the 2 windows overlooking the strip. Again, I found both rooms to be very clean. They did require a $50 deposit for the Executive suite. Casino was as good as the rest. Again, it was clean. In fact it was much cleaner than the ones downtown on Fremont street, and cleaner than a few I was in on the middle of the strip. Cocktail waitresses came around to offer drinks. Although not fast enough in my opinion. Maybe a $2 or 3 tip instead of the $1 I gave will get them to check on you more often. Bottles of beer at the bar are $6 and 7 if you dont sit and play. This is the price I found at all the strip casinos. One block south of the hotel is a Circle K store. Single beers are $1.50 here. Stop and pick up a few on your way to the main part of the strip. I have read a few reviews about how "scary" the area is. This is not the case at all. It's Las Vegas. It's a city. The area is well lighted as you can imagine. Lots of people around. No need to wonder about the area. The Deuce bus stops out front every 15 minutes to take passengers downtown or up the strip. $2 each way or $5 for 24 hours on and off as much as you like. I could go on and on but better stop here. I do recommend the Stratosphere. It is clean, and very nice for the price. Staff was pleasant. I will go back!! Soon I hope. Jason

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: Emma853536
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this hotel. Room was quite bland and not very comfortable. The decor needs updating and the bathrooms are not nice. Also no complimentary toiletries which we thought was quite cheap. The best thing about this hotel was going up the tower, try the big shot its amazing! Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: bcindyj
Reviews.Content: First time taking my daughter for her 21st birthday. Horrible experience. Arrived and given a dirty room. Was moved 5 times in 12 hours. Was promised a manager would call me....still waiting. Have e-mailed my concerns.....still waiting. They are not at all customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good stay, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Karch72
Reviews.Content: I'm a Stratosphere veteran ... I've stayed there each year for the past 7 years for March Madness. I haven't had a bad experience yet. When it comes to rooms, I'd rather spend my money at the tables, so I'm not too picky ... especially when the price is right. In the past we had a nice view of the Strip and what seemed to be a modern room (in the Premier Tower), but this year we were put in a room facing downtown and the room didn't seem to be as nice. Tried to get another room, but the hotel was pretty booked. Oh well, it served it's purpose. If you're looking for a super high-class Vegas hotel, you'll be in for a surprise. This hotel is value based and is for an average clientele. It's off the beaten path a bit (and the neighborhood is a bit iffy), but otherwise I have no real complaints. Go in with an open mind and you won't be disappointed. I also heard that the property was recently purchased ... don't know if it will make a difference. Pros: Check in was smooth, Starbucks in lobby, good restaurant choices (sometimes a bit slow when busy), cheap table minimums, Valet parking, pool area and weight room is nice (but they sock you with a $5 resort fee), beds were fairly comfy Cons: Super slow service at the bar located by the Sports Book, no free Wi-Fi, rooms could use a refresher, housekeeping not that good.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas, great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CassD
Reviews.Content: We recently made our first trip to Vegas, from the frozen northeast. Booked as a package, I was VERY pleased with our stay. It was extremely busy when we arrived, check-in took a long time, but the desk person was wonderful. Our room had a great view, huge bath, comfy queen beds. While there is a heavy smell of cigarette smoke in the casino area and hall/elevators, our room did not. The restaurant on the casino level was open all hours, service was a little slow but the food was always good. There are lots of shops on the 2nd level, we found some interesting things to bring home. The Tower......awesome!! My son had a great time looking at the places we had already been to from the observation deck. I reallllly appreciated the guest laundry facility about half way through our stay. I did miss the in room coffee maker, but there is a Starbucks downstairs.... For a hotel to stay at while you are being the *tourist*.. this was a great place. We were never there long enough to use room service or many of the other amenities, but I would definitely recommend it, and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Full of criminals”
Reviews.Author: Craige22
Reviews.Content: This place is disgusting - I feared for my saftey in the after dark. Filled with low lifes. This place was depressing and put me off Vegas for life.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: TheGoose34
Reviews.Content: No complaints! My husband and I stayed here for our Honeymoon. It's definitely not as "romantic and classy" as some of the other places for a honeymoon but it was great for a less-expensive vacation. The room was clean, we had a very cool view and the staff was pretty nice. If you're looking for a fancy, ritzy place to stay, it's not for you. But if you want a clean, nice, comfortable place to lay your head when you actually sleep, it's great. It is a little far from the main strip but we had rented a car and drove to the main strip area. The parking in the casinos is free so that was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: RogerVegas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at here and was surprised. I did book a Casino Suite on-line for 119/night. The suite was large, had a sitting area, a bed in a seperate area, and a very large bathroom. There is a spa tub that seats 2 easly that has doors that open up to the living room. Also there is dual sinks and shower. The entry way and bathroom are marble. There are two TVs but neither are flat screen, but they worked just fine. The view was not so good, but didn't have the room for the view. The way the room is set up, you enter through a long hallway, then have the living/bed area -- so you don't really hear the noise from teh hallway. The bed itself isn't the best, but it was triple sheated. The room has a walk in closet. We only ordered room service and it was not badly priced, overall a short wait and not that bad. Nothing to say "wow" about. Prices were burgers for $13, Steaks $25, breakfast $10-$15. Check in was about a 45 minute wait The staff was nice at the front desk but a little so it seems. I was checking in on a Sunday around 4pm. I would hate to see it on a busy Friday night check in. Most dealers here do not speak English very well and can be hard to understand. Also not the too friendly. Could find a table from $5 to $25 easily. Cocktail service good. Also, we were able to purchase a 6pm late check out for $50 ($25 for a normal room I was told). That was nice. If you are looking for high end stay in Las Vegas, look elsewhere. If you are looking for a decent room -- great price then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, Gambling Was Great, Rooms Were Nice.”
Reviews.Author: MeMeG
Reviews.Content: Booked on Vegas.com and got a great deal for airfare and 2 nights for only 225.00 per person so I expected a cheezy hotel and found it to be very nice. Everytime we go to Vegas, (about once every couple of years) we try and stay somewhere different to get a different experience. We knew the Stratosphere is not on the strip so be prepared to have some extra expense in taxi's to go to the middle of the strip (Mirage). The hotel rooms were very nice. The lobby was nice and staff friendly and helpful. We arrived early in the morning (8:30 a.m.) and did not expect to get a room until 2:00 or 3:00 but they got us in a room at noon so we just left our bags with the bellhop and played some slots in the meantime. Our favorite machines are the Elvis and Wheel of Fortune quarters and they had both at the casino. We liked the room. Very tastefully decorated and had a great view of downtown. The only drawback was the air conditioning. We are hot natured and put it as low as we could get it (68) but it never got very cold and kind of froze up. Luckily it was March and not very hot, so we were OK but I think I'd be complaning if it were summer so hopefully it was just our room and not all of them. There is a McDonalds on the 2nd floor along with MANY MANY shops and there is a Denny's a block one way from the hotel and an IHop one block down the other way, so you can save a little money by eating there. The Nascar Cafe is within short walking distance as is the Sahara Casino and Hotel if you don't have a car and want a different gambling experience, but truthfully, this is the first time we could have never left the property and be completely happy about it. We never even made it to the top of the tower but we did catch the American Superstars show and it was really good. All in all, it's probably our second favorite hotel we've stayed at. The price was definately right and we did not feel like we were in a less-than hotel. We've stayed at the Golden Nugget, MGM Grand, NY-NY, and the Luxor and the room was comparable to all of them, but it was even better because of the price. We got the most out of our 2 days by booking an early flight there, and a late flight home so we really had 2 nights and 3 full days. We highly recommend this hotel and casino and shopping experience. We went as a quick 20th anniversary trip and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the views from the top!”
Reviews.Author: sassyjaybabes
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel on our wedding night having eaten in the top of the world restaurant. We were impressed with the service and the cleanliness. Our room was fantastic with a spa tub! Just what you need for a wedding night :P

Reviews.Title: “Far, Far, Away.....”
Reviews.Author: montesquieu
Reviews.Content: My fiance and myself stayed here in August of 2007. All in all it was a fun trip, but I wouldn't want to stay here again if I could help it. What we liked best- - This place was cheap, we booked about a week ahead of time. - It was clean and we never had any issues with anything in the room. - The pool was pretty nice and has a bar area, we spent most of our time here. It's shallow but has a waterfall and hot tub. - The buffet was surprisingly good! It was much better than the Sahara and I'm sorry we didn't go until the last day. What we liked least! - It took us almost two hours to check in (in this was at midnight). I think they had one or two people there. Everyone in line was extrememly upset and agravated and I was pretty sure a fight would break out sooner or later. The only thing that made it tolerable was it was fun to see everyone else freak out when they finally got to check in. - No fridge in room. But they'll "rent" a mini-fridge to you for 5 or ten bucks a day. - No wireless internet - They put 1/2 off coupons for the club in the lobby restroom, yet won't accept them! The manager would end up waving everyone through. Club still sucked... - You can only use your "free" admission to the tower during certain hours, AND it's a somewhat lengthy process. - AND MOST OF ALL- When it's busy it can take well over an hour to get down to the main part of the strip on the bus. We took the bus almost everywhere , because you can ride it all day for five bucks. A taxi might cost ten to fifteen one way. I think we spen four hours or so on the bus one day... Not a good way to spend your vacation... If you don't want to go down to the strip that much it's an ok option, but for this reason alone I think we'll spring for someplace closer to the action next time. -

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place!!!”
Reviews.Author: crb_girl
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas for our Honeymoon 11-17-07. Being there once before as a child I had not seen the Stratosphere( it wasn't there back then). We feel we made the right choice staying here. We loved everything about it especially Roxy's Diner & all the rides. We 5 days 4 nights and I didnt want to leave. This is a wonderful place to stay and I would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love the STRATOSPHERE!”
Reviews.Author: iluvmykhalil
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stratosphere 3 times in the past 4 years and obviously I like it or shall I say WE. My husband, sister and brother in law always wanna stay there. Ok, so the ONLY downside is the fact that it is at the end of the strip but... take a cab, the DEUCE, the monorail or just walk! The price and quality of hotel is worth it. We have stayed in the World Tower and the Premier Tower, the PREMIER Tower is the nicer of the 2 but they are both great. The pool is nice as well. Everything is in this hotel you could ask for, it is very clean, and everyone is friendly. GREAT breakfast buffet also! Ate there 2 days in a row! Worth the money for sure!!! We all loved it! Go to the observation tower for a great view if you are not afraid of heights. I recommend this hotel to anyone, my 5 year old son loves it, he says it is his favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Vagas”
Reviews.Author: The_Fogster
Reviews.Content: If your thinking of using this hotel or expedia please read before you book it! Traveled in a party of 7, should have been 8 to this hotel. On arrival discovered that room was in the name of someone who lost their passport and could not travel from the UK with us. Hotels response was instead of the 4 rooms we had paid for and were expecting we were told we could not have one of the rooms as the room was in the name of the person who dropped out! This was after an hour and a half in a queue trying to check in! Ended up sleeping on the floor of another persons room! Next day insisted on speaking to the manager who eventually gave us another room after an hour of calling expedia who were as useful as an ashtray on a motor bike. Their response for requests to sort it out was to tell us there was nothing they could do. Will be taking legal action on this one. The hotel is tired and expensive with not much to do. Service was slow and i didn't get a free drink until the third day! Location is bad as it is half way between the nice hotels, Luxor etc. and downtown, which was one and a half miles away. Don't walk it though as the area is very dodgy with plenty of massage parlors and tags sprayed on walls. Note while we were there Vagas had five separate school shooting incidents according to local news reports. Not a place for families. Don't wander the streets at night and don't walk down any side streets. Stay on the main street if you want to be safe. Treat yourself and stay in New York if you can. Watch out for the hookers who pounce on you if you are wandering round the hotel when you can't sleep There pimps usually sit in the elevator lobby's. Recommend you definitely give this hotel a miss and only use expedia if you don't want any customer service if you have any issues!

Reviews.Title: “OK Room”
Reviews.Author: MickiP
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The room was clean, and very affordable, but, it was very, very plain. We stayed on the 20th floor, and, fortunately, the elevators were very fast. Of course, you don't stay in your room much in Vegas, anyway. So, the hotel and room were fine, especially for those on a tight budget. There were plenty of slot machines $.01-$1) and tables (starting at $5) downstairs for those who are there to gamble, and the 2nd floor had plenty of shops and restaurants. This particular hotel, as most of them, allowed smoking inside everywhere, which was a bit annoying. The hotel was located at the older, less updated end of the strip, which is fine, because you can walk (remember the strip is 3 miles), or take a bus for $5.00 a day. Personally, I'd like to stay at a nicer and more modern hotel next time I visit ... one that allowed smoking in designated areas only, and on the nicer end of the strip, where you can visit the beautiful hotels and shows. Don't get trapped by the people trying to sell timeshares at resorts that hang around Circus Circus or other such hotels. They offer shows or money for slots, etc ($100) in exchange to hear the sales pitch for "2 hours" ... believe me, they take at least 4 hours!!! And, they're not fun. Been there, done that this time. We did get the $100 worth of food and slot money, but it came to $10/hr for the 2 of us, and took 4 hours out of our vacation. Then, the bus driver/ride that brought us back was like something out of a horror film. A 5-10 ride turned into about a 40 minute drive into the dankest of places, and we almost ran over pedestrians ... and, it seemed like it would have been on purpose ... you should have seen their eyes!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: M1NX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during our trip to the west coast. It was the cheapest of all the hotels in which we stayed but the room was as good as any.It was a large room with a very large bed and was very clean. We didn't have much of a view but we hardly spent anytime in the room anyway. The hotel itself is a bit dated and could do with a refurb, it's a bit 70's.But it had adequate facilities an we ate a buffet breakfast there once which was quite good.The highlight of the hotel is the tower and the wonderful tower restaurant. We opted for the lunch menu and it was well worth the visit.The views of Las Vegas from the rotating restaurant are spectacular and probably the best view of Las Vegas from anywhere,so even if you opt not to stay here I would recommend lunch in the restaurant. The hotel is not situated centrally for the strip and some people have commented the they didn't like the area around.Granted it is not the best of places on the strip, but we didn't feel threatened at any time. On the whole I would say that the hotel was fine and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but distant from the strip”
Reviews.Author: BeachGuy1
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere hotel has a nice outdoor pool and fitness area with machines and free weights. The rooms are large and clean with good views. You get free visits up the tower, which is not to be missed. There is everything from snack areas to fancy places to eat. The rooms have hair dryers and irons. The only down side it the distance from everything. Be aware of the huge rate changes on the weekend. I arrived on Monday and we left for the weekend for Zion national park in Utah. Vegas was better to visit during the week before it got very busy on the weekend. We did come back into Vegas the second weekend and there seems to be no down time, huge crowds. This is a good place to save money if you don't mind taking the bus, or driving. Be aware that a taxi ride may cost more than you think because a driver may take the long slow way to run the bill up. As a bus driver told us, a $10 ride in a taxi could end up being $40 if you get a dishonest driver. We experienced this the second week, so it does happen. The hotel's all star review is worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: willswifey
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas February 21 - 24, 2008 to get married at the Stratosphere and we had a really good time. There were about 15 of our friends that met us in Vegas for our wedding and we were definitely pleased with the results. The ceremony was beautiful and the food at the Top of the World restaurant was pricey but well worth the money. They give you plenty and it is delicious. I would stay at the Stratosphere again in the Premier Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: auntkid
Reviews.Content: The size of the bathroom - in a room for 4 people was extremely tiny and not user friendly at all. Although only 2 occupied the room, we found the dressing/bathroom area far too small.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average - Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Arkgal49
Reviews.Content: We were given an "upgrade", for an extra $50 bucks a night, what a joke. The bed was horrible. You could feel the metal in the bed, Motel 6 has better beds than the Stratosphere. Everytime the air kicked on there was a big boom in the system. Not a problem unless you are trying to sleep. We were given a disabled room, even though we aren't, every time we showered the floor flooded, the water was only warm twice during a two week stay. It took forever to check in and check out. The hotel staff as a whole could care less. One night there was a huge pile of dog poop in the elevator, we told someone, they acted misput that we told them. Our daughter could not get in the hot tub even though we were with her. Hotel guests can only go up in the tower for free between the hours of 10 am to 2 pm, any other time it is $7. What a joke! The comps program is a joke! The Stratosphere is at the very end of the strip, I would rather stay off strip than stay there again. As a whole I was disappointed. I will never stay there again nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: witchiebunny
Reviews.Content: I've seen a lot of reviews that say that the Stratosphere is a horrible place to stay without any ameneties, or things to do, etc. Don't believe a word of it. I stayed at the Stratosphere from the 15th to the 20th of February in 2008 while getting married in Las Vegas, and I found it a wonderful place to stay. The rooms were spacious and clean with a beautiful view of the mountains (even facing the parking garage) and I had no problem with the thermostat in my room at all. Housekeeping was wonderful, came in when we wanted and stayed out when we asked them to. The staff were absolutely fantastic. I wouldn't even complain about the location. It's pretty easy to get to the center of the strip-if you have the time, you can ride the Deuce for $5 for 24 hours or you can ride the monorail for $9 for a full day's pass. Both will get you where you want to go very quickly. As I'm originally from Philadelphia PA, I found the area surrounding the Stratosphere to be no more dangerous than anywhere else in Vegas at night, and certainly quieter than further down on the strip. I didn't feel in danger once while I was there. If you're used to being pampered by the more expensive hotels further south on the strip, then skip the Stratosphere. But if your expectations are reasonable and you don't mind not having a mint on your pillow every morning, then the Stratosphere is a wonderful place to stay, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: love2cDworld
Reviews.Content: My husband booked our Vegas trip through Expedia and I guess this hotel came with the package. It was 'okay' but needed some serious renos (carpet, bedrooms, etc). I don't know if it's just the wing we stayed at but the hallways and room looked/felt old. It was also very far from the rest of the strip hotels. On the plus side there are some decent restaurants in the hotel and there are 'extreme' rides and attractions at the top of the hotel. I'd say it was decent to stay at but we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Grahamwarrior
Reviews.Content: We only paid $44 for the room, so cannot complain. Check in was a little long winded and slow and while service was efficient, it was never friendly. The rooms were pretty standard for the typr of property. It was clean though the carpet had some marks on it. We never ate in the restaurant. We stayed at the orleans last year, which is a much nicer property

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: gpaul89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere in Feb 2008. I had read a review on this website before we went and I'm glad I did. On the second night I noticed a bug in the bed and I looked carefully and there were not one but two bed bugs in the bed. We called to complain and were given an 'executive suite'. no apologies, no comps. The staff was pleasant, but not spectacular, also it was strange that they did not seem the least bit surprised that we found bugs in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: black_dobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strat, Feb5-9. Booked 2 seperate rooms, and they were both large and clean. The first nites in Vegas we stayed at Bellagio & Flamingo, so yes, we know how to compare rooms. We had no problem booking in @10am, because we upgraded to a Premiere Tower room, w/ spa tub. The tub was great, seats 2 people easily. Our room was cleaned promptly and well by friendly maid staff. The pool area was nice and clean, and although it isn't heated at this time of year, the heated jacuzzi tub was open. There were lots of lounges/towels available for suntanning. The temps were around 65F, but the area was protected by high walls, which keeps alot of the wind out. We ate at both Lucky's cafe and the Garden buffet, which are both ok. (We always rent a car, so we usually drive to South Point for their inexpensive but great buffets.) The casino wasn't as smoky as most, although it wasn't letting us win much on the slots. We find this casino a bit more relaxed and laid back compared to the busier casinos on the strip. As in all the casinos, bottled water is expensive. Note the store on the 2nd level sells water for 95cents a bottle! For some reason they were only using 1 elevator to get up to the top of the tower, so the wait was probably 20minutes. The view was great, and to see the faces of the people on the rides, was priceless!! We stayed at the Strat mostly so we wouldn't have to drive after dancing at their niteclub, Polly Esthers. We got in free before 11pm, because we were hotel guests. Wednesday nite it was almost empty, literally..Only 6 couples there, and by midnite, there was 1 couple left when we left. It was nice to have the whole dance floor to ourselves. Drinks are 5.00pop/water and 10.00booze. Friday nite was really busy, but the DJ wouldn't take any requests. Too bad, cause we finally got sick of the hip hop, rap stuff and left. It was nice that you could wear jeans/casual clothes. We would have stayed longer if the DJ just would have played a bit of rock music in his mix. We will stay at the Strat again, the price is very reasonable for a nice clean room and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...for the price.”
Reviews.Author: ZumaTripper
Reviews.Content: Just got back from las vegas and spent 2 nights here. Check in was a pain. Limited staffing for the amount of people checking in and out.. The room was ok, but I suggest asking for a room that is high up to avoid the constant parking garage noises (ie. car alarms). The beds seemed like hand-me-downs from other hotels and were a little hard. The location is at the north end of the strip, so be prepared to ride the bus a lot. It is fairly close to the old downtown area (Freemount St) and is a short bus ride there. The area in general is a little sketchy but bare in mind the price. We also stayed at Treasure Island (very clean and great beds!!!!) and the Golden Nugget (nice place too). I previously stayed at the Monte Carlo which was also a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A waste of time”
Reviews.Author: pdj300
Reviews.Content: We went to las Vegas on a quick weekend trip. We did not have to many choices available to us, so we decided to try stratosphere. We had never stayed there before but decided this would be the best time. We were very disappointed from the start.Checking in was a joke, our room was not available, the reservations agent was very rude, and dis-courteous. After we finally made it to the room after a 21/2 hour wait we were disappointed. The room was dirty, old and plain looking. Having stayed at Skylofts this place was a major down-shift. Being American Express Centurion members we are use to a higher level of service this resort has really missed the mark. A waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “was great”
Reviews.Author: Becky4849
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere in 2006, we only stayed for a few days but the hotel was great. my only down side to it wsa, whilst i was there i became ill, adn whilst i was on my own on i really could have done with some ice but the machine on our floor wasnt working and i couldnt get very far without having to sit down, i asked if they could do this but they said it would cost me £5. i wasnt impressed with that. but apart from that the hotel is amazing and we are planning to return next year

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: dangelovich
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere was by far the cheapest place I found in Vegas, at around $55 per night. For that kind of money, I really didn't expect much - but it delivered what I normally have to pay $150-200 per night for. The room was a decent size, and the shower was one of the few hotel showers I've used that wasn't built for the exclusive use of dwarves. The hotel itself is huge, and difficult to navigate. Getting from one part to the other took time... A laundry room is provided with free washer and dryer facilities. Location of the hotel was OK - it's a distance from where all the action is, but the monorail station at the Sahara (head toward the back of the casino) can get you anywhere you need to go. I recommend getting the unlimited ride pass for the duration of your stay. Restaurants within the hotel were a bit ordinary, but I found it was about the same at all the casinos. The tower was free for me as a hotel guest, as long as I got the ticket between 10am and 2pm. If I find myself in Vegas again, I'll be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Better Casino”
Reviews.Author: SNUSS29
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Stratosphere in October with a few friends . We have been to Las Vegas twice before . we stayed at the Mirage and the Aladdin and we loved them both . We read the reviews and decided to save some money and stay at the Stratosphere . The rooms are motel rooms but clean. The staff is very friendly and attentive . The 50's diner is great goo prices and food . The chinese place was awsome also . The casino is wonderfuly laid out with a great selection of slots and tables. Not over crowed waitress are very fast and friendly . Nice strong drinks . If you expect to be pampered this is not the place for you ,but if you have reasonable expectations you will be more than happy . Great hotel and casino for the money . the location is out of the way but the duece buss runs all day long , and only costs 5 dollars for twenty four hours. One last thing the comps at this place are very generous . I am a low roller tables only $5 min and i get free room offers in the mail from the Strat monthly . We are going back in March and staying at the Stratosphere free room or not. I absolutly love this place .

Reviews.Title: “Decent value option”
Reviews.Author: Toomy1234
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a decent budget option for the price. I would prefer to be further south down the strip but for the money we paid we could have absolutely no complaints about the clean well kept room we stayed in within the premier tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hiched
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on the Stratosphere, I almost regretted booking it, but the moment we arrived with our friends, we knew we'd LOVE this place. Upon arrival, the customer service folks at the front desk immediately upgraded us to the Premier Tower so we could be on the same floor as our friends. The hotel was booked, but they were able to accommodate our request without hesitation. Our room was located on the 14th floor and faced "Old Vegas". Our room was fairly plain, but very clean and the mountain view was lovely. We had problems with our air conditioner and they immediately offered to move us, but since we wanted to remain close to our friends room, we asked if they could try and service the air conditioner first. If they couldn't fit it, then we'd move. We went out for a few hours and came back to have a note in our room say "good to go". Everything was fixed and we didn't have to move. The service was awesome!! The hotel was fabulous - not too big (unlike the MGM or New York New Yokr) and we could always find our friends carrousing in the casino. The restaurants were very good and portions were generous. Las Vegas has changed over the years and eating is not as cheap as it used to be. Be prepared to spend $10.00 on lunch and $15.00 on dinner. We ate breakfast at IHOP (1/2 block from the hotel). Our favorite place to eat within the hotel was "Roxy's Dinner". It's a 50's style eatery with your servers singing, dancing and getting the patrons involved with the act. At one time, I think I had a feather boa between my legs while doing a gogo dance - this is before I took a sip of my marguarita!! The live entertaining in the casino was fabulous: For starters, the free nightly show in the casino was always entertaining and you could enjoy it while playing the slots or card tables. American Superstars, which is a great impersonation show of popular singers was also amazing. I had "Elvis" sitting next to me forcing me to rub his thigh; then he took my hand and wiped the sweat of his face (grrrrossss, but it was all apart of the show). We had a good laugh!! The "Top of the Tower" facility is breathtaking (by day or night). You must do both to get a full appreciation of the magnitude of Vegas. While we didn't have time to go on the 3 rides which are available at the top, they looked like they would be a ton of fun. The shopping on the 2nd floor of the Strat was very good. From large souvenire shops, oxygen bars (yes, you can actually pay for a burst of oxygen to give yourself more energy), jewerly stores, even a McDonalds (for the thrifty eater) and everything in between. You can get great deals in the mall. The Strat. is also fairly close to the Premier Outlet Mall ( cha ching cha ching...get your credit card ready - you can get A LOT of stuff at unbelievalbe prices!!!) RECOMMENDATIONS: - Try to get a room 10 floors or higher for the view - Tip the cleaning staff - they work REALLY hard - Tip to the waitresses (while playing slots/cards) - they come around more frequent and the drinks are free, so what's a $1 or two? - Buy souvenire pictures - they're great memories and reasonable priced - if you're into rides, you must try the rides at the top of the tower - Use the monorail (at the Sahara - 1 block away from the Strat.): You can get to all the major hotels on this "quickly" - definitely worth the $9.00 for a 24 hr. pass) - Visit the Premier Outlet Mall - take a cab for $8.00 I'm leaving this comment for the end because it's the only negative thing about the Stratosphere: LOCATION. A crackhouse community is behind the Strat. and you really don't want to be wandering the streets after dark. This is a drawback as Vegas is a place where the night lights are fantastic. Take a short walk to the Sahara and jump on the monorail and get yourself into a better area before you walk around. We loved the Stratosphere and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first destination choice”
Reviews.Author: Chillymama777
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were at the end of a long 10-day trip to visit his family in Las Vegas, but he had caught the flu and was quite ill. I wanted a place where we could just hole up and get well while still having internet access and television. He found that the Stratosphere had all the amenities and the price we wanted, so we booked 2 nights there. The bed was clean although the sheets were threadbare in spots. The room had a very small bathroom that was not very clean at all. At least they had the individually wrapped plastic cups rather than glassware. It took quite a while for the heater to warm the room, and it was extremely noisy while running. On the plus side, the shower was excellent in comparison to most I had used while on this trip. Because the hotel/casino is on the Strip, they charge as much as most of the bigger casinos for food and amenities. So while the room was a reasonable price, everything else was very expensive. The shopping leaves a bit to be desired as well; most of the shops carry tourist items and souvenirs. The staff was polite and very helpful, with the exception of the valets. When we arrived to check in, the valet said we could not stop at the place where the hotel's signs had directed us to go. At no time did he inform us that the hotel was going to charge us a $5 per day fee for things such as tower access and VALET PARKING. If he had told us that, we would have taken advantage of the valet service! As it was, my partner had to go park the car and walk back through the cold while I checked in to the hotel. He was quite sick at the time and was unnecessarily exposed to further illness by that young man's inability to communicate clearly with us. All in all, I was disappointed that a Strip casino/hotel would provide such a lackluster experience.

Reviews.Title: “Theiving Hotel Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ldsmomto4
Reviews.Content: I am very upset with myself for not reading the review posted from Dec. 2007 about their problem with theft. If I had, possibly I would not have stayed at the Stratosphere and maybe I would still have my stolen items. I would say think twice before you stay here.! They obviously have a problem with theft and could care less. I too had the same exact experience as the people in December. Left my room early Thursday am for a trade show and did not return to my room until 9 pm that evening. Got up Friday morn to return to the trade show and found my Coach perfume and Ralph Lauren top that I was going to wear were gone from my suitcase. Inside my suitcase was the envelope that you can leave a tip for the housekeeping people in. How did that get there? Have no clue. Made a report and received the same exact run around. They would review the tape and let me know. Called them on Monday from home and was told that they reviewed the tape of people going in and out of my room and did not see anyone removing the items that I alledged was missing. I was then told that unless they see something they cannot accuse anyone. Well, of course, they are not going to walk out of the room holding the items. They could put on the shirt under their clothes and pocket the perfume or wrap it up in towels. So the Stratosphere takes no responsibility and I have lost my things. Beware it is a problem and do not leave anything in your room that you would hate to have taken!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You must read!!”
Reviews.Author: headcoachB
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1/17-1/21. It is a great hotel for families. The employees were VERY friendly and helpful, from the front desk to housekeeping. Rooms, as well as the hotel itself were VERY clean. It is out of the action of the strip, but is only a short distance away. We rented a car and used Industrial Road (one block over) and Frank Sinatra Drive (intersects with Industrial) to bypass the Strip and use the back entranceways to all the Strip hotels. This saved at least 30 minutes every time we drove! The hotel itself isn't the most glamorous, but for the price, and the amenities, it's worth it. Plenty of casino action, very loose slots (won $150 with pennies), great sports book and good food choices. Speaking of food, do NOT eat at Roxy's Diner, as it is disgusting. You MUST eat at Fellini's in the hotel. It is a first class, but casual, Italian Restaurant and is THE BEST Italian food in Vegas! The rides atop the hotel are pretty good for a thrill (my 13 year old liked them, although not as thrilling as he would have liked) so check them out. Best view in Vegas. Caught American Superstars in the theater and it was a hoot. Very entertaining! If you stay at the Strat, make sure you ask for World 1 at the front desk. Parking is easy too. Other points of interest close by: Red Rock Canyon, and 2 blocks up is Tiffiny's Diner, a FABULOUS little throwback diner with the best omelettes and burgers in town. Just be careful if you go at night. All in all, a good hotel in a good location for a great price. If you rent a car, just make sure you have the back streets figured out before you go. It took me 5 minutes and saved hours in drive time over the 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs & Stinky Plumbing”
Reviews.Author: wbingha
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere is the Walmart of Vegas. We have stayed there on two occasions and the last time ended my cheapness. I will from now on pay more to get a decent room. In Aug. 2006 we went for a short weekend to see my nephew get married. We arrived late Friday night and went to bed, Saturday morning when I woke up, I noticed something crawling next to my face on the pillow. I jumped up and my husband squished it between the sheets. It was a bed bug. Luckily, neither of us had any bites. We did the "Dateline NBC" test and pulled the headboard off of the wall where we found many bed bugs. When we called guest services, they offered to move us to a new room, but tried to insist that we clean all of our clothing at a laundramat before moving. Since we had to be at a wedding in a few hours, and I really felt it unfair for them to ask me to go do my laundry as though I had brought the bugs in with me, I said they should do our laundry. They refused, we were moved to another room and took our luggage and clothing with us without washing it. No apologies, no comps, they just moved us. My sister stayed in a room just down the hall from us, her sink in her bathroom smelled like the sewer. It's safe to say, we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loosest Slots on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Webmiller
Reviews.Content: We have become regulars at the Strato due to the loose slots and our luck in the casino. In October and November of 2007 we won over $40,000 on slots. We are offered free suites and comps all the time and are treated well. Our rooms have been clean and service good. The surrounding area is much to be desired and a bit seedy, but we don't go out much at night. We are usually in the casino playing the slots. My wife hit $25,000 on a $5 slot in October, and in November she hit $12,500 on the very same machine, followed by $3700. While I won a few grand on $2 slots and quarter slots. We know the casino very well now and know where the best machines are. If you play slots, time spent in the Strato casino is well spent.

Reviews.Title: “First reviews True But Ignored And Not Posted”
Reviews.Author: GreatFoodLover
Reviews.Content: In October of this past year, ( The 1st through the 5th ) we traveled to Vegas after two years of planning. We were under no delusion of coming back with any great winnings but went to see shows and shop. On arrival at the Stratosphere we were told that our room was not ready and to check our luggage in at the Bell Desk which we did. A total of 8 bags including a laptop in its own carry bag were checked with a ticket issued stating the correct number of bags. Hours later when we were told that our room was finally ready the bags were delivered by a Bell person and it did not include the laptop bag. When we told him it was missing he checked our ticket and his copy both showing eight bags. He became very nervous and flustered stating, “are you sure you checked in eight bags?” He counted the bags with us again checking the claim tickets and told us he would return to the Bell Desk to look for our bag. We received a call from him a few minutes later asking, “Are you sure it’s not there?” We reminded him that he had counted the bags with us and that together we had also checked the claim tickets. His response, “well we don’t have any laptop down here.” This started a week long process of dealing with different levels of staff, security, administrative responses and after three days finally someone from risk management. An incident report was filled out the first day and when we asked if we needed to file a complaint with the police department the head of security told us, “if you want but it won’t do any good.” During the week we were treated as criminals ourselves, put off, had promised return calls not made to us. On Thursday we finally received a call from their Risk Management Department stating that they had found that the “hotel was negligent and we would receive a check for our property.” She further stated that the check “would be for $750 because that was all they were required to pay for lost property.” This did not cover the cost of the laptop ($1,800) nor the programs in it. It barely covered the cost of the bag, wireless equipment, and medication stuffed in one section and lost transportation vouchers. The sent us the $750 dollar check with a statement on the back stating that endorsement of the check releases them from further liability. We have not cashed that check. Calls and letters to the resort have gone unanswered; calls, consumer report forms and letters to the State Attorney’s Office have gone unanswered as well. Las Vegas attorneys have refused to get involved stating they would have to charge us more than it is worth to get our property replaced and fighting this in small claims would require more than the cost just in travel cost to come back to Vegas which is now a destination that we wouldn’t recommend to anyone. Who do we talk to about this lack of accountability and response from everyone; resort staff to the government level when clearly there was an admission of negligence.

Reviews.Title: “Better than last time. Still overated at 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: curtismapman
Reviews.Content: Checked in early and we were offered an upgrade for $10 per night because our lower priced rooms weren't ready yet. The extra $10 (in the World 1 Tower) gets a room worth much more than the difference in price. More room and better furnishings and the room isn't as beaten up by hormone driven youngsters. I've learned to accept the $5 "resort fee" and factor it into the room rate. Vegas is nothing but a hustle to me and this is just another of a long list of BS charges widespread throughout the city. Vegas has a way of getting into the pockets of everyone who visits. Stratosphere is Vegas' poor mans resort casino. The restaurants are not fine dining but generally OK expect for Lucky's. Stay away from Lucky's, the all-night cafe. Overpriced food served by overworked people. All in all, the lodging is still a value, by Vegas standards and it's near the Strip but without the extreme congestion.

Reviews.Title: “cleaner than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mid-MN-Tourist
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed at the strat on 1/3/08-1/6/08, it was cleaner than we expected and the rooms were good. i would try the strat again for a good value

Reviews.Title: “Way too Far- especially in the summer”
Reviews.Author: taralynn2772
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights there in late June (I know, a tad late for a review) and the hotel is definitely a good value. It is in pretty good condition and the rooms were more than you would expect for the price. You also can go to the top of the tower and see the Strip (but only from 10-12 in the morning for free.) The main complaint and the only reason I will not stay there again was it's location. Even though it is on the strip it is so far away. If you are staying on a weekend, it will take you a half hour easily to cab it down to the action, or if you take that ridiculous bus it can take an hour. It is not so pleasant to be sweating in the 113 degree heat and waiting for a cab or bus the entire time. I am going back in April and am willing to pay the extra money for a better location this time.

Reviews.Title: “Only okay”
Reviews.Author: sugarnspice76
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for at the Stratosphere. The location is inconvenient. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll be choosing a hotel that is in the middle of the Strip. Our room always had a strange (sometimes terrible) smell even though we were on a non smoking floor. Even though we didn't spend lots of time in our room, it was only okay when we were in it. Simple selection of restaurants, clubs, etc. Conceirge were friendly and tried their best to be helpful. It definately is a budget Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not terribly impressed”
Reviews.Author: EBella
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Strat for 4 nights over Christmas. Let me first say that there is a self serve check in, but it was only giving us a smoking room. We had booked through Expedia and specifically asked for a non smoking room. After waiting in line for about 10 minutes (9pm) we were told there were no non smoking rooms. Unfortunately after a LONG day of traveling, we didn't have much energy to put up a fight. We thought....how bad could it be. Oh my......bad. There are no windows to open in the room. Good thing I brought a scented candle. Went to bed and hoped we would get used to the smell. We never did, but we were hardly in the room anyway The casino floor plan is big and confusing. There seems to be restaurants around every corner. There is a "mall" and a food court on the second floor. We didn't get a chance to eat at any of the restaurants except the courtyard buffet. It was around 8am and not terribly busy. The selection was just ok. But it was pretty good. And they had champagne! The Strat is about 2 blocks from the monorail station. There is a Deuce stop right out front. The Strat also charges a 5$ a day "resort fee". If it wasn't for this fee I would recommend this hotel. But that was the deciding factor. 5$ for things we never used: laundry, pool, gym, coupon book (for in hotel things), observation tower, valet. Its just not worth it. And the tower was only open for 4 hours for the guest - after that there was a fee. How many guests are actually going to be there from 10am to 2pm? So....I would stay at a hotel closer to the strip next time. They are about the same price and most of them don't have the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations, Cleaner than I expected”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJC
Reviews.Content: Came the week after Xmas. Casino was backed, but had a good deal at $45 a night for upgraded room. The upgrade was standard of a Day's Inn, but view was good, and staff throughout the hotel were great towards my two year old. From having lived in LV, I know the neighborhood wasn't great, but it's only a few minutes to the main part of the strip or up to the newer areas of West Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: movinman
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here december 16th thru 20th 2007 and were pleasantly surprised. The casino is too big and not laid out all that well but with 5 dollar single deck blackjack and 5 roulette it is a cheap place to gamble. There players club is rewarding and luckys 24-hour diner is a good place to eat late at night. The rooms were clean and we had a nice view of the mountains. The were deffinetly worth the $40 a night we paid to stay there. You get to go up to the tower for free before 2 and after 4 the Romance Lounge opens and you can go up to the top for free as long as you buy drinks in the lounge which are $12 dollars or more but really strong. The view from there is awesome. It was too cold to swim but we went in the hot tub. The pool area was nice and was on the 8th floor. The biggest drawback is location but your 2 blocks from the monorail, cabs are always around and there is a bus stop right outside the casino. The neighborhood isn't that great but we still were out and about after dark and i never once felt threatened. Another plus is that this is the closest strip hotel to downtown, which is deffinetly worth seeing. So if your on a budget and don't mind being a little far from the action stay at the stratosphere its cheap and nicer than you'll think

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For the Money”
Reviews.Author: Stoyles83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratospher Hotel from Sept. 28/2007 to Oct. 03/2007. Booked through a local travel agent, which was the same price that Expedia.ca also quoted. Check in was easy, even though we had to wait a couple of hours for our room, the usual thing that happens when you arrive at a hotel earlier then the check in time. Had read some reviews that said to upgrade to a better room, which we did. It cost an extra $20.00/night. Was well worth the value as I peeked my head into normal rooms while they were being cleaned by housekeeping, those rooms looked outdated and run down. If you have never been to Vegas before, your room or hotel isn't the end all, be all. Since you spend very little time actually in it. Pool was nice and lots of room for many people, alos had a bar out there with reasonable priced drinks. Any other question, just ask!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice feeling here”
Reviews.Author: BrianMa
Reviews.Content: We were offered a Friday night room for $59. and as we wanted to go to the Santa Fe for a concert, we picked the Stratosphere. There were twenty five or thirty young people in the check-in line. Twenty somethings with all sorts of earrings and tattoos and breasts and parts of butts showing. For a moment I thought I must have mistakenly arrived at Circus Circus. I felt very out of place(being forty three years old and all), my face was red, I was wishing my wife was standing beside me instead of sitting down and resting at the sidelines, but I finally made it to the check-in desk Guess Who greeted me there. A barely 21 year old(if that) who had a lot if problems checking me in. I knew they had all sorts of different rooms at this place so I tried something for the first time. I slipped her a twenty and asked about the possibility of an upgrade to a room possibly with a whirlpool tub. Well, this girl was pretty green (as we say here in Canada) because after a whole bunch of searching, bringing over a more experienced staff member, taking at least ten minutes and finally getting me a room with a whirlpool which I think was at just the regular price, the two young women (whom I had a twenty each for) looked at me as if in a daze and said "what's this for" I guess not a lot of young people tip because they thought the money was for the casino to help pay for the upgrade. I found the whole ordeal quite amusing. The room was very average in everyway and had just a regular tub with a few jets. hah. hah. I hope those girls had fun with their twenty's. The free trip up the tower was great. What a view. My legs were shaky for a few minutes. We watched the rides for a few minutes and even thirty year old tough looking men were shrieking on them. I liked the feel of the casino. It was not at all packed in around the machines and I felt like I could relax without having several people within a few feet of me. The free buffet breakfast had lots of medium quality food. By the way- the John Anderson concert was the best ever. I'm not even a country music fan but this was awesome. When you park at the strat. there will be quite a walk to the check-in desk. From the front door though it would be quick. The drink service is not the quickest here unless you like dollar machines. It was a cheap place to stay which had quick access to the west side of town and the concert we wanted to go to. This place has a big reputation as a hangout for the younger crowd but you don't see many of them on the casino floor. I would stay here again if the price was great but it is so far from almost everything else in Vegas that its hard to recommend it. For the next three nights we stayed at the Flamingo where we usually stay. We kinda like it there.

Reviews.Title: “our stay at the stratoshere”
Reviews.Author: vegascalling
Reviews.Content: we got a great deal thru the hotel and got our room for 35$ a night and they waived the resort fee (which is usually 5 $ a day) we asked for my medical fridge and a sharps container-for my needles. they said they would send them right up--we checked in in less than 10 minutes but it was midnight! so up to our room >not sure what to expect for 35$ we were surprised that it was a good sized room--small living room area with love seat and chair-coffe table and end table and a small entertainment center with tv and a fridge underneath. in the next room was the king size bed and two night stands and a small dresser with a 2nd tv. the sink vanity area was in the living area and the bathroom was small with toilet and tub-but the tub was a nice semi deep one! i proceeded to call house keeping to confirm the sharps container and to get 2 more pillows and a few hangers. they said no problem-and hour later--we just wanted to go to bed- i called house keeping again and they said they would put a rush on it! ten minutes later they came up-grab the stuff and got ready for bed--go to pull back the covers and ......someones been sleeping in our bed!!!!!!!this totally grossed me out--hairs and such and very much not a bed that had its sheets changed!! i called down to the front desk and told them the issuses-- i told them i had been up for almost 24 hours now and all i want to do is go to bed--i inform them they have 10 minutes to have someone up to remake this bed or put me in another room! she said i will send someone right up--in the mean time i go to put the sharps away and i see someones used needles in there. i have never been given a used container before--someplaces we stay even give it to you still wrapped in the sterile wrap. so a few minutes later someone comes and changes the bed--i show her the container and she is grossed out --she says something to the other person with her -he then takes the container over to the cart and starts to put his hand in the container with the used needles and i freaked!! i told him he can't do that-he dosen't know what those people have and he is putting himself in danger--he didn't even have a glove on!! so after he put a glove on he proceeded to take the needles out and put them in the sharps container on the cart-then gave me back the other one now empty! i really was shocked. but now we could at least go to sleep!!!!!3am vegas time-and 6am ny time. the next morning i went down to the front desk to tell them what happened and they sent me to security to file a risk management report-the front desk wouldn't offer any compensation because that would imply they were liable!!! but i will say that when i jumped thru the hoops and spoke to the right people -they did comp the room for the first nite and also gave us a late check out on friday at 6pm as well!!we were happy! also the housekeeping manager was very nice and asked us every time she saw us if things were okay now.we thought that was very nice. the Stratosphere boast's that they have the fastest valets on the strip >>this is so true--these guys hustle and we only wait more than five minutes one time! Hats off to a young man named Romal Bell--after the second day he remembered our name and was very kind --when we told him we waited over 30 minutes for our car at the Wynn he couldn't believe it. we ate at the luckys cafe at 3 in the morning and got great breakfast special for like 4 $$-i left a bag with shopping goodies in it and the next day we were able to get it back--nice to see some honest people around. all things considered --we had a good stay at the Strat!! i don't know if we would ever stay there again --as there are sooo many choices--but if you need to go on a budget--and you have a car - i highly recomend the Stratoshere!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: JasonFSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 10 days towards the end of November. We payed $39 a night and for that price you can't expect to stay 5 Star but to be honest if your after somewhere cheap and value for money you can't go wrong. I checked in via automatic machine, just swipped my card and checked in within 5 mins. I did notice a long line of people not realising that you can check in via the 2 machines at reception. The gym is massive and outside weights and machines by the best in the business. The gym is free. The only set back is that its $15 from the main part of the strip, but who cares your paying $39 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay...”
Reviews.Author: CenPennTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Strat for 4 nights. We arrived in Vegas around 11pm local time and got the rental car and immediately hit the strip. After a few drinks, a few hours of gambling, we were off to check-in at the Stratosphere. We approached the front desk around 3:45am and had no troubles checking in at this early hour. The front desk attendants were very friendly and presented us keys in no time at all. The room was basic, but clean. Waking at 9am, feeling like 12am to us East Coasters, we headed downstairs to Lucky's for the breakfast buffet. I wouldn't say it was the awesome, but we were so hungry it was very tasty and filling. Definately take advantage of the free passes up the the Stratosphere Tower, awesome view. You can walk to The Sahara to get on the monorail. The area isn't really that bad during the day, but I wouldn't do it at night, alone. The monorail is the way to go. The Stratosphere is a great option for the budget traveler who wants to stay in a modern but basic hotel while in Vegas. A great place to regenerize for another fun filled day on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it...”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally at the end of the Strip and the rooms are large but very old! Service is really poor. Roomservice however is ok, but other restaurants are either under construction or very poor. Staff is unfriendly and I had to wait 30 minutes to check in. Although the rooms are cheap, next time I will stay at a hotel more on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Security issues with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikearnold16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel for the 2nd time in November 2007 and were happy to be returning. Although the hotel is at the very end of the strip and a little out of the way we had previously found it to be good value for money with comfortable clean rooms and a good choice of bars and restaurants. This was exactly the same this time and for a budget hotel we would have been quite happy to recommend this hotel until........on our 5th day we returned from a night out to find that a large number of clothes were missing from our room. We immediately reported this to the reception desk and were told that the maid had probably taken them for cleaning but that we should check with them again in the morning. The following morning we were advised by reception that nothing had been sent for cleaning and that we should report our loss to security. We did this and were told that the hotel may do video surveillance checks on the camera immediately outside our room but that was all they could do. We then asked them to contact the police so that we could make a report for our insurance company and were told by the security staff that they wouldn't contact the police but we could do so if we wished!! The following day we contacted the hotel risk manager who was supposed to have reviewed the video footage but to our surprise he had been to busy and as we were leaving town that day they would have to e-mail us with the results. We have since received an e-mail stating that we left the door open and so it was not the hotels problem but we know that the door was locked when we left as earlier in the week our friends had had a security issue with their room and so we always checked the door before leaving. I strongly believe that a member of staff was responsible for this theft but have no way of proving it so I would advise anyone who chooses to stay at the hotel to be very careful about what you leave in your room.....we only left clothes, no valuables and the fact that they stole our clothes was bad enough, I wouldn't like anyone to lose anything more valuable.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon trip”
Reviews.Author: marksim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. Overall we were impressed for our first stay in Vagas. We ate once a day at the buffet at the hotel and were impressed by the variety of food. We also had lunch at the top of the tower which was cool. We did goto the pool but found it a little to warm to stay outside too long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: johnrweb
Reviews.Content: Reading the negative reviews in here caused me to be concerned when my wife got a great deal on the Internet. . We were pleasantly suprised. The room was clean and tastefully decorated. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and had a whirpool bath. Maid service was excellent. No complaints. One thing not mentioned when we booked was that there is a $5 a day "resort fee". Not that bad since it also give us two free tickets to the top of the stratsophere where you'll look down on the strip. For the price, you can't really get a better deal in Vegas than this. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “At least it's Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Cortlandt20
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Stratosphere was not everything I expected from a Las Vegas strip hotel: NEGATIVES: 1) the location is far from the strip, so unless you have a car, I would not recommend it 2) there is not a coffee pot in the room... I need my caffeine first thing in the morning 3) The walls are thin and security had to tell us to lower the TV volume as they got complaints... the TV was loud since we were trying to hear it above the noisy air conditioning system 4) the casino is filled with "locals" 5) the sink would not drain 6) there is a $5 a day resort fee for pool use and tower access (if you do not use, too bad)... POSITIVES: I was looking for an affordable hotel, so I guess it fit the bill in that regard, and I will admit the room was large and clean... I suppose I would stay there again, but only for the cost savings... perhaps the Imperial Palace, about the same price is better, as it is right on the strip... As I had a car, I left after breakfast and returned after dinner... did sightseeing and gambling at all the other nicer hotels...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value!!! Loose slots too.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2585
