Reviews.Content: The Statosphere is at the far end of the strip so it's kind of a hike to get to ther middle of the strip where all the action is. We walked the entire length of the strip no problem and there's also the monorail for those who don't feel like walking in the heat. The hotel is also a short bus ride away from the Fremont Street experience. Even though the Stratosphere is far down the strip, it is a great value. We stayed here for half the price of some of the middle-strip hotels. The room was very basic... one king bed with a view of the adjacent garage. However, the housekeeping was great. Our bathroom was sparkling clean everyday and our linens were changed daily. I wouldn't have paid for an upgrade because really, when you're in Vegas you don't spend much time in your room!!! The pool area was very clean and spacious. The pool was never crowded and there were plenty of lounge chairs and towels. The casino was awesome! I found the slots to be very loose and it was not as crowded as other Vegas casinos. The waitresses came around often with complimentary drinks too. The restaurants were okay. I really liked Lucky's and found it to be a great deal. I was also happy that there was a McDonalds in the hotel. The view from the top is amazing, you gotta check it out! It's complimentary when you stay there. We didn't go on any of the rides because they seemed a bit overpriced but they did look like fun. Overall, our stay was pleasant. I'd stay there again when I'm looking for a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “hit or miss (this time miss)”
Reviews.Author: bp4559
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year while attending a race at Las Vegas Motor Speedway and although the hotel was unspectacular it also didn't have any glaring problems so I stayed here again for this year's race and this time I wasn't as fortunate. I got there at 1:40 in the morning and after checking in I noticed some voices coming from inside our room, upon further investigation it was the housekeeping staff. They were cleaning our room in the middle of the night and told us to wait out in the hall for 5 minutes. This did not get the Stratosphere off to a good start and then another night the electrical system in the bathroom shorted out and I ended up having to shower in the dark. Aside from these issues the room is okay the bed is okay (nowhere near as comfortable as beds at the Hilton or Marriott properties though). I would say the room itself is probably equal to what you find at a Quality Inn, or Best Western.The pool area is actually pretty good and one of the hotel's better features, but the pool is only open until 6pm. I did not gamble, see any shows or dine in the casino so I can't comment on those areas. The giftshop is extremely expensive as are all the shops in the Stratosphere. 2 ice creams at Ben & Jerry's was somewhere around $10. What normally costs me about $4 at my local Starbucks was $7 here. The rates are cheaper than the nicer hotels and if you're only staying there to sleep it probably isn't the worst place to stay but you're also not getting the true Vegas experience by staying here either. To sum it up, it's not going to be a positive experience everytime you stay here and it's not going to be a negative experience everytime you stay here either. If you don't want to break the bank and are only going to sleep here you might be fortunate to have a good experience, if you want to stay somewhere nice and don't want to take your chances with a room than look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price, IF you choose the right room”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGypsy
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas for a conference and as I run my own business, I needed to keep the costs down. I'd stayed at the Stratosphere before and found it clean, comfortable and not too noisy. This time we had two rooms booked for ten days through Expedia at a very good price. On arrival, we were put into a room in World Tower 1 and it was awful. Old, shabby, smelt horrible and I woke up to find a cockroach on the bedside table. I went straight to reception the next morning and asked to be moved to the Premier Tower which is where we were last time. I did wonder if we would have to pay more, but they moved us immediately with no fuss and the rooms were a million times better. No extra charge either. The breakfast buffet is great value, but it is more expensive on a Sunday as they serve a champagne brunch. The Venetian or Bellagio it's not, but if you're there for as long as we were, you can really save a lot on the room. We ate one night in the restaurant at the top of the Stratosphere tower. The restaurant has won awards and been voted the best restaurant in Vegas. It was our most expensive meal of the trip, but the 360 revolving view and the superb food were worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Running away from home”
Reviews.Author: chelibeli69
Reviews.Content: It all started when my girlfriend and I passed the airport in Milwaukee. We were both going through MAJOR stress in our lives and decided that it was a time for a change. We turned around went into the airport, and bought 2 RT tickets to Las Vegas. This is my 100th time in Las Vegas, however its my friends first trip to sin city. Since our plane wasn't leaving till 8:00 a.m. we had a lot of time to contact our families, jobs, and arrange for a hotel. Our hubby's weren't too pleased, and luckily we had vacation time. We reserved our room at the Stratosphere, through Hotels.com. 59.00 a night. Time to board the plane. Flight was on Midwest, and I can never say anything bad about there rides. There are smooth, service is friendly and I love the cookies. We landed around 10:30a. m. in Las Vegas. We are staying in sin city for a whole week. We needed a car and some clothes. Check in isn't till 3;00 p.m. we have plenty of time. We rented a PT cruiser Convertible through Payless car rental. CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP. It cost 250.00 for the whole week. Including all fee's, and taxes. We are off to get some clothes. We ended up at the 3 Goodwill clothing stores in Las Vegas and bought our wardrobe. Cheap Cheap. We spent less then 100.00 for a whole weeks wardrobe. For the record under garments were NOT purchased at the goodwill’s. We arrived at Stratosphere around noon. Check in was not too long. Once at the desk we were pressured BIG time to upgrade to suite for a extra 50.00 a night. Tired of listening to this man we decided to upgrade. Room was ready. Yippee. We went to the room to unwind and take nap (we have been up now for at least 24 hours). The room was awesome. Very large, clean and well decorated. The room had a separate living area from the bedroom. The bedroom had a king size bed, large closets, and adjoining bathroom. The only bathroom. So if you have use it while someone is sleeping in the bed you WILL disturb them. We called laundry and had them pick up our clothes for cleaning and pressing. This was a bit pricey, but hell we needed something to wear. Plus they did a awesome job, and had to clothes back in our room, the same day, by dinnertime. After our nap we are off to gamble and party. Our first stop was the bar at the Stratosphere. What a waste of money. We ended up spending about 150.00 for Jack and Cokes and never caught a buzz. The Gambling sucked too. Being that we don’t drink and drive our first night we stayed at the Stratosphere and partied between the 3 lounges. We did ended up switching to bottles of wine in order for us to get drunk. Which we successfully did. This is pretty much how our week went in Las Vegas. We had a BLAST that neither of us will ever forget in our lifetime. Oh yeah we left some secrets there too. Yes we both were in HUGE trouble with our spouses. In fact I am heading back out there in Feb with my hubby. I am paying for the entire trip. A little peace offering. I would recommend the Stratospere to someone. Keep in mind a couple things. Dont buy into the upgrade. It really isn't worth it. Drink from bottles if you wanna catch a buzz. Also if you are NOT renting a car. Please please becareful of the areas that surround this hotel. They are pretty rough at night. There is no coffee pot in the room, so buy a cheap one. It will save money then paying for a cup at starbucks. The rooms were clean, and service was good. The food at the buffet was good, and the cafe had awesome breakfast. The food court and shopping area was good too. I would recommend the spa as well. The spa is small. But the services make up for all that. Look for my next review in Feb on the Monte Carlo. This I shall title " I am Sorry"

Reviews.Title: “good value for teh money”
Reviews.Author: Thomasuy
Reviews.Content: With a price tag of $39 per day, plus some extras i think it was a grate deal, it is located a little far from the central action, but with a car its ok! In the night te serrounding area is not the best i have seen and it make you feel unsafe. The hotel is a little old, and the rooms are normal ( looks like the tipical super 8 motel but with a greate view to the strip or the desert ). The casino and the buffet are OK not the best in Vegas but not te worst ... just like everithing in this hotel .. is an average class

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: mamabacklund
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Stratosphere over Veteran's Day weekend. I took my husband on a surprise trip to Vegas for his birthday and two of our friends came along. We have all been to Vegas several times and stayed on the other end of the strip most of those vacations. We were just looking for an affordable place to stay and weren't too concerned with the location. We found a great deal through Southwest airlines. We didn't go in with any high expectations and we were really pleased considering how little we paid. When we checked in on Saturday they were really busy. The staff worked very quickly and were very helpful. They were able to get us rooms right across the hall from each other even with how busy it was. The rooms were older (kind of reminded me of a Motel 6 or something), but clean. My only complaint would be the pillows. That's an easy fix though. I'll be sure to bring my own next time. Our views were good too, especially at night. We could see the pool and the lights of the Sahara, Circus Circus, and many more. We really enjoyed the pool. Us girls only used the hottub, but the boys had fun playing basketball in the pool. There was also a volleyball net set up. I really wished it had been warmer because it would have been a lot of fun. The restaraunts were great too. We went to Roxy's which was a diner with live entertainment from the wait staff singing. It was fun. Don't order the long island ice teas though. They came in plastic bottles and they were like syrup! We had to keep adding water to them just to be able to drink them! We also went to Fellini's. They had great service and amazing food! Definitely reccommend it for a nice dinner. We also ventured up to the top. There is an awesome view of the city from up there. Two of us did the rides and they were serious adrenaline rushes. We did the Big shot (free fall) and the X Scream (hangs you off the edge of the Stratosphere). I am definitely glad I did it even though it was extremely scary! As far as the location, it was a bit more of a walk than we expected to get down towards Sahara, Circus Circus, Riviera, etc. It really wasn't too bad, but we were thinking they were a bit closer. It worked out great though. We needed to be walking off all those meals out and drinks! So we all agreed that if you are looking for a cheap way to do Vegas Stratosphere is definitely worth it! We had a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: pointpetre
Reviews.Content: I did not have high expectations for this hotel. I had stayed twice in the past at the Orleans and liked it. However, I was traveling with a friend who had wanted to stay at the Stratosphere since our last trip to Vegas four years ago. Two years ago, I stayed at the Orleans with my wife and son. Check in was very late, about midnight. There was a fairly long line, but it moved fast and the service was efficient, courteous and friendly. We had booked a Premier Tower room and were given a room on the fifthteenth floor. The best views are to the West and down the strip. Our view was of the Stratosphere tower and toward the east. There are no bad views, unless you are on a low floor. We had great sunrises and the large window was designed to take advantage of the lovely mountain views and the cityscape. We very much enjoyed the view and left the curtains open. The room was extremely quiet without exception. The room was very clean and of adequate size, although I'd liked to have had a sitting area that might have required a few extra feet in room length plus comfortable chairs. We had a desk with two chairs where we had cocktails in the evening. There was a clock, iron and ironing board, adequate closet space and drawer space and adequate hangers. The queen beds were very comfortable and the linen superior. The TV and channel selection and reception were okay. The bathroom was plain but of generous size. This was a simple bathroom, perhaps below average in that the floor was vinyl and the counter only an attractive formica. The tub-shower was of a fiberglass or plastic that looked like white china and tile, but wasn't. Nevertheless, this was an absolutely terrific bathroom. It was very clean. The shower was great and the tub was very comfortable. It even had built-in arm rests. Hot water was almost instant and easy to adjust. A lotion, an all in one shampoo-conditioner, and an all purpose soap were provided. Nothing fancy, but okay, especially for guys. The Gerber toilet was pressurized and used 1.6 gallons per flush. It was the best toilet I have ever had in a hotel room. My son lives in Japan with a Toto toilet with heated seat and bidet functions and on and on, which I like, but I've never seen a toilet flush better than this one. The maid service was friendly and top-noich. The hotel charges a $5 a day resort charge for which you get free tower access 10 to 2 and discount coupons and the swimming pool and fitness center. The fitness center is very modest compared to that at the Orleans, but the Orleans costs $10 per person per day after your one free day of use. The swimming pool is free form but quite long. I swam laps every morning, usually going out about 6:30 AM. This week of Nov 4-Nov 9 was quite warm for November, setting a couple of records. The hot spa by the pool has heated waterfalls coming down. It is a great social place and sitting in the flow of the larger waterfall itself is a delight. All and all the other guests we met were very nice people. There is a pool bar, whcih got very swinging a couple of times while I was out there. The pool area is situated to take advatage of the fabulous western mountain view, looking out over the green swath of Summerlin. In the clear morning air, the red stone in the mountains is breathtaking. I doubt any Vegas hotel pool area has a superior view. We ate at the buffet once. Nothing special, but okay. We went up the tower once. We'd done the rides before, but we did the big shot ride again. About 4 gees of excelleration followed by a negative gee fall. Quite exciting, but also quite a short, intense ride for the money. This tower visit is a must see in Las Vegas. We had bargain prime rib dinners in Lucky's Cafe three times, plus one breatfast there. It is a good cafe but not exceptional by Vegas standards. The service is good and very friendly. We have absolutely no complaints, only praise for this hotel and its service. There are lots of places to eat at the Stratosphere. There are two Starbucks. Good variety. The McDonalds is very good with normal McDonald prices. On their dollar menu, they even had a Sausage McMuffin with Egg. The shopping area is surprisingly large. I had bought a clock in the Venetian shops a few years ago. The same clock was much cheaper in the Stratosphere mall. I would suggest people shopping in Vegas visit this mall before making purchases in the beautiful shops down the strip. I did buy a Seiko Kinetic watch in a Stratosphere shop for $187.50. It was something I'd wanted for a long time and had priced many places. Dick and I took excursions in our rented car to St. George, Utah, a town with magnificent mesa landscapes. To get there, you pass through spectacular the Virgin River Gorge in the polygamous Arizona strip. Another day we drove up 95 to the Lee Canyon Road and took it up to the pine forests, reaching nearly 8500 feet. We then took the connector route south through the fabulous mountains to the Kyle Canyon road, visiting the visitor center and the lodge at the end of the road at about 7700 feet, where we had a late breakfast by a fireplace with unreal panoramic views. We could have eaten on the outside patio, and it was just warm enough to do so. There were people eating on the patio. From this lodge, set among the soaring cliffs of the nearly 12,000 foot Mt. Charleston and the vast forests with its magnificent Ponderosa Pines, back to Las Vegas city limits takes only 25 minutes by car. Now, Las Vegas sprawls over a gigantic area, so reaching the city limits still leaves you a long way to go back on 95 to I-15 and downtown. We could not believe how few people were out that day - last Wednesday - to take advantage of the wildness and the beauty. Our last day, we did the Laughlin trip, even dipping into California for a couple of minutes. We had lunch in Bull Head City, Arizona, looking out at the swift flowing Colorado River. During our stay, I walked the stip from the Stratosphere. It is true that the location of this hotel at the far north end of the strip in not ideal, but lots of construction is bringing new hotels and time shares and condos up the stip to the doorstep of this hotel. During our stay we saw The Phantom at the Venetian, A Holiday Celebration on Ice at the Orleans (which will be shown on NBC on Christmas Day), Mama Mia at the Mandalay Bay, Ka at the MGM Grand, and Spamalot at the Wynn. Mama Mia was our favorite. The performance, music, cast -- all terrific. I lusted in my old heart after Vicki Van Tassel, who played Tanya. I hope to see her on stage again. Dick admitted to me that her beauty intimated him and it reminded him of a teacher he loved and was awed by in fourth grade. But, we are old men. It made me think about a song from "New Faces of 1952," about being in love with one's teacher.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: draftingbatman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on a Monday night. The price was extremely cheap. Only $35. We have stayed there before and knew what to expect. Also we don't gamble so I don't have any reviews about that for you. The rooms are average. Average size, comfort, and decorations. They are however very clean. Depending where you stay you could be very far from your car. The World II Tower seemed like a mile from the car but near the entrance to go up the tower. When you stay there you get free passes to the tower from 10am-2pm. Its worth the time to go up there. We had a problem with the TV and the maintenance man was up within 5 minutes. We didn't eat there or go to any shows. There is a nice little mall you can walk through if you are bored too.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Confusedalways
Reviews.Content: Pros - cheap, friendly staff, nice pool, some good shows Cons-small bathroom,loud a/c machines,far from the strip, bums The hotel is average, the rooms are good for 2-3 ppl, we had a few problems (clogged sink). The maid service was good (unclogged sink fast). If you are with ppl that you cant change infront of expect to fall over the toilet in the bathroom. The hotel is far from the strip which cause alot of spending on taxis,monorail and sore feet. For some reason there are some homeless ppl in that area. Anyways, honestly spend the extra $$ and stay in a hotel on the strip. Vegas is ment to be big and flashy and an experience. If you really are short on cash then I guess this is ok for you. Although we spent alot on taxis. So I dunno. Also dont bother eating at that buffet in the hotel...nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: shoegirl80
Reviews.Content: The stratosphere was an okay experience. As first time Vegas goers we didn't know the best location to stay in. My husband was there for a convention and we chose the stratosphere, because it was close on the convention center on the map. It was still a long walk and too far from any action on the strip. He mostly road the convention shuttle anyways, I used the monorail to get around in the afternoons, however it was still a .25 mile walk from the nearest station. Next time we will pick a budget friendly hotel down the strip and in a slighty better neighborhood. There is so much contsruction between the stratosphere and the rest of the strip it is almost on the outskirts. Our room was ok, the facet dripped and the bathroom door didn't latch, but tolorable. I would skip the buffet in the hotel, just okay. Our buffet dinner we ate at the RIO and hilton was much better. Loved the monorail for transportation, but next time will stay at a hotel closer to it.

Reviews.Title: “10 things you need to know...”
Reviews.Author: sandj
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the 'Strat', paid £275 for the flight with Airtours from Manchester direct and $1000 for a king size room for a week direct with the hotel - weather superb every day - here's 10 handy hints and tips... 1. Watch out for the room upgrade, we were offered one for $20 a night extra and took it, Players room on the 23rd of 24 floors overlooking the strip. Agreed, tipped the clerk $50 then told to come back as the room wasn't ready (3.00pm). When we did so at 8.00pm the clerk was off duty, we were given a completely different room on the 11th floor, overlooking the car park and big ventilation system, smelling of smoke. We changed back to our original room. $50 down already... 2. The rooms are OK, the higher up the better. Maid service is good, 9-5pm. If you're at the back of the hotel you'll be woken by the train horn at all hours, and it's LOUD. Pool is good, gym is OK, music by the pool is good but far too loud... 3. Take some walking shoes as it's 2 miles to downtown and 6 miles to the Mandalay Bay at the end of the strip, altough you can get the train from the Sahara down the street. A cab is around $10+ tip. 4. If you do walk down the strip it's a bit like a building site at the moment with all the construction going on. Lots of touts and shameless Mexicans touting for whores, giving out calling cards - time the city cleaned this up... 5. If you walk to downtown, don't do it after dark as you're passing all kinds of dodgy bars, clubs and 'rent by the hour' motels - lots of pimps, pushers, hookers, panhandlers, bums etc hanging around. Called in 7-11 one evening for some gas and when I paid and got back to the car my partner was surrounded by them, like something out of that zombie movie 'Night of the Living Dead'. 6. The drinks in the hotel are pretty pricey, around $5 for a bottle of beer and they aren't as loose with the freebies as they used to be when it was Bob Stupak's Vegas World. 7. The Legends show is OK if you get the 2 for 1 tickets, ($42 pair) but the lounge acts are dire. 8. The Courtyard buffet is good, $11 a head from 7am-11am, all you can eat - even cheaper if you have a coupon. Never tried Roxys diner, the waitresses do karaoke as you eat, too expensive and too greasy. Luckys diner was good after 12.00 midnight, steak, eggs, hash browns and toast for $7.00 - excellent. 9. Use the coupons they give you when you check in to save money - $10 craps freeplay, $25 blackjack, food, gifts etc. 10. Watch out for the timeshare touts inside offering you a free dinner and show for attending a 90 minute 'presentation' of selected properties. Watch out if you go fly/drive as they'll try to sting you at the airport for an upgrade/insurance ($400+ extra!) Book a Mustang convertible online from one of the search engines before you go, around £180 all in, although you don't really need a car unless you're off to the Hoover Dam / Grand Canyon, as traffic is a nightmare on the strip and it's quicker to walk. All kinds of stuff to rent on the strip from Scooters to Harleys, Vipers to Ferraris, 57 Bel Airs and 68 GTO's - You can even rent a Lamborghini Gallardo for 5 hours, $1200 plus insurance, but you're only allowed 75 miles... Have a good time and try not to turn 'Las Vegas' into 'Lost Wages'...

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: kevshar
Reviews.Content: we stayed here mid oct,our rooms were very large and very clean with very comfortable king bed. bathroom were also clean with plenty of towels and shampoo/soaps ect. check in staff very nice ,however can not say the same for the check out person ,she was very rude,also in order to rent the movies in your room you had to go in person to front desk and show a credit card on which they wanted to put $150 charge to cover your movie use. location of hotel was ok considering we used the deuce buses which run up and down the strip for $5 for 24 hours would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “hmmmm”
Reviews.Author: louisef25
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what to say about this hotel...there were as many good points as there were bad. I'll start with the good - the pool area was great and had ample space for guests (well in october anyway, don't know about peak season) and a nice pool bar which wasn't too expensive. The water in the pool was a bit too col to get in but the hot tub was reat and the music played around the pool area was varied and bearable. The breakast buffet was quite good - the omellette station i found was completely addictive and generally good - however, some things would have been a bit better if they were cooked to order rather than left to congeal or go stale. The Top of The World restaurant was exquisite (sp?) and i cannot fault the 3 courses we had one bit - I can however, say that we felt really rushed out by the waiting staff who brought out our main course and dessert immediately after the course before. Because we had only just finished chewing our amazing fillet of beef, we had to leave our dessert - we needed maybe 15 minutes rest time instead of 1. Then when we had 'finished' our dessert our waiter said he wouldn't 'tell' of we sneaked out with our rinks to the upstairs observation level - just felt really rushed out of the place which is a shame when paid $200 for the pleasure of being there for just over an hour. Now, the not so good - our room had a bad smell to it the whole time we were there which we pin-pointed to the sink. Our sheets may/may not have been changed during our stay. The casino itself smelled musty and was really, really smokey at times. Dinner at the twice zagat rated Fellinis Italian restaurant would have been better if my carbonnara hadn't have had dried 'baco-bits' in rather than ham or real bacon - come on, how hard is it guys? Also, even though the breakfast bufet was good food, the choice never varies but on a friday and saturday you get charged more for exactly the same. And on sunday it goes up to something like $32 for 2 because they have a champagne breakfast - now, i'm no tee-total but what if i was? Sorry, but champagne isn't my regular morning tipple. Nothing else was different on the buffet - $10 extra to say 'no' to a glass of champage and stick to my regular apple juice and omellete. Booking our late check-out wasn't as easy as we had hoped - the lady at the counter, pleasant though she was, forgot to give us our late check out key which we were unaware we needed. Half an hour latere whilst we were in bed, our phone rings to let us know we need to pick it up. When we go down for it the next day (and it wasn't just dwn the corridor let me tell you!!) the unhelpful guy demanded to see our ID even though we'd given him our name and room number. We'd left our passports in the room so we had to go up and then back down again to get the key we'd already paid $30 for. The 'new members bonus club' promotion was not explained to us in the slightest, even when we asked it to be, we were met with a semi-vacant face who seemed to not understand that WE did not understand the system - therefor our '$200 in slot and comp went wasted. Having said all this, we didn't have a bad view from our room as long as you didn't look down onto the carpark and we won $40 on a 1 cent slot machine. I'd go back to the straosphere if i had to but to be perfectly honest, it's location and the above mentioned points would probably tempt me elsewhere - i'd rather pay a bit more money for better strip location and generally better service - although whether it's pool area can be beaten remains to be seen...

Reviews.Title: “Getting Worse......”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaVegasbaby
Reviews.Content: Been to the Strat every year since they opened. This last trip I had was not pleasant at all. The rooms were musty. Bed sheets may have been changed but not thoroughly dried and had that "wet towel" smell to it. The bathroom had hair on the floor and a dirty towel hanging on the shower curtain. My worse problem was with the valet. I brought my rental to the valet in excellent condition. When I picked it up the next morning, it had noticeable damage to it. The cameras at the valet can easily prove that it was dropped off in undamaged condition. Of course Statosphere is not obligated to release their tapes, especially if they are at fault and it would incriminate themselves! So they told me that I dropped off the car damaged! Now, it is a big dragging mess between the Strat, rental company, and my insurance. Yes, I should have purchased the insurance, but the price of the insurance was more than the rental itself and I didn't think about it at the time....Anyway, I can only hope this casino will change for the better. After the sale of the Strat at the end of the year, hopefully, they will clean up their act. The rooms are too small and dirty and the buffet is not spectacular. The meats were tough and the crab was too salty. Also at the Ultimate Rewards Center, even if you are a high level rewards player and have a special players card that allows you to stand in a special line for assistance at their counter, the workers do not help you. You are ignored and expected to stand in the regular line. Why even bother with having those special lines if they are not going to help those players with their special players cards?!!?

Reviews.Title: “Good moderate price Hotel / Casino”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelling_Kiwis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere over a longweeked period whilst the NHRA was on at Las Vegas Speedway. we stayed here for two reasons: first, the geographical location - being quite north up the strip it was easier for us to catch our buses up north to the track. (*TIP- This could be a negative for you if you are wanting to explore the strip everyday, as IDEALLY you`d be better off in a more "central" location) secondly: the moderate price over the weekend was great compared to other places we looked at on the strip. (*TIP- Most places on the strip in Vegas charge DOUBLE on weekend nights) Room was comfortable, well priced, clean, service was adequate. The tower is well worth a visit, the views of Vegas and the strip are AMAZING. Take a camera!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: NTextraveller
Reviews.Content: Stratosphere was what we expected. It is on the far north end of the strip, a little far for most people to walk to the more densely populated parts of the strip, but also more convenient to get to downtown Las Vegas, which has a little more reasonably priced shopping and (so I'm told, we're not gamblers) looser slots and better odds, in an attempt to attract people away from the strip. We spent a couple ($10?) on quarter slots on the strip and more than made it back downtown, but we're not gamblers. And it is actually a very pleasant walk under the sunscreen vaults. Check-in was the worst part. Check in is 3:00, but I'm told they'll let you at 1:00 if you press (we didn't). Checkout at 11:00, but you can pay $20 or $30 to check out at 6:00 PM. If you check in during the afternoon, expect at least a half-hour to an hour wait. When I checked in I told them that the room absolutely needed to be clean with absolutely no smoke smell. They shifted me to a higher floor than they originally offered, and it was as requested. Expect a $5 resort fee per night stay. The linens seemed very clean, even the thermal blanket looked brand new. A/C worked well. The faucet had a small leak when turned on high that dribbled onto the lavatory countertop. The whole room looked freshly painted, with relatively new tile in the shower. All the parts of the hotel we saw (although we didn't do much there) were very clean and in good shape. Buffet was very substandard. There are some thrill rides high atop the tower, not for those with high axiety. Tower access is free for guests, rides are not. Stratosphere's shows sounded well below average quality to us (we didn't go to them). Hotel staff was polite, but not very helpful. In general, they were far more congenial than your average Las Vegan though!!! I have never witnessed so many painfully impatient and dismissive people in my life as we endured in Las Vegas. Not the vacationers though! Almost all of the people on vacation that we met were great. We only met two Las Vegans who were remotely friendly in the course of their jobs, and most will give you made-up information just to not have to talk to you anymore. From our experience, do NOT trust that you were given the correct info. on times, events, or locations of ANYTHING unless it is specifically that person's job to give out information about, or sell tickets for, the specific activity that you are looking for!!! You may end up missing or not finding it, and half the "regular" activities, even ones advertised in the events magazines, were not actually open while we were there. Contrary to what we had heard, we didn't need to book shows in advance. Nothing was sold out while we were there, and you can get tickets 25%-50% off in the ticket stores to be found along the strip. If you absolutely have to have tickets to a certain, popular event, then get them ahead of time. They also sell vouchers for restaurants that can save money if you know where you want to eat ahead of time. (Typically not available for restaurants that do really booming business though.) You WILL be approached in practically every building and on the sidewalks of the strip to participate in high-pressure sales pitches (tours) for time-share properties. Ignore them, and they'll leave you alone. Or, if you don't mind giving up about 3 hours of your vacation time, you can get a cheap (sometimes free) show for enduring the standard schpiel. The "free gambling money" they offer is about worthless though, as it is credits for "promotional" slot machines that have about as much chance of paying out anything as winning a powerball lottery. Expect lots of construction. We felt very safe in the heavily populated areas of the strip, and at all the major resorts. But you don't have to go far from Stratosphere, Sahara, or Circus Circus to get to places you may not want to be walking at night. A lot of hype about the Treasure Island pirate show, is about that. A few neat fireworks, but it's about worth about what it costs (free). If you've not seen a Cirque Du Soleil show, they're pretty neat acrobatics, but typically very weird and with no plot (but, hey, it's French, so what do you expect?) Many comedy and magic shows to choose from also.

Reviews.Title: “We will never forget this vacation!”
Reviews.Author: SunSeeker20839
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to Las Vegas September 17th-20th. Our flight was actually delayed, so by the time we got to the Stratosphere Hotel it was actually early in the morning of the 18th. Vegas is the city that never sleeps so that was no big deal! Now we are not picky people at all, but we had problems the moment we arrived at the hotel. First we had to find parking, which was pretty full at that time being that we arrived so late. Then we had to find our way to the lobby to check in. I'm not sure if I'm the only one, but I found the hotel layout to be quite confusing. Our major dilemma of the trip occurred next. The hotel checkin staff informed us that they were very busy and that we were being upgraded for one night only because they didn't have any standard rooms available. So we were quite excited thinking that this was our lucky day, and then we went to our room. We opened the door and here this male voice "get out of here" and this lady comes out of the bedroom in a bathrobe!!! So back down we go to the lobby and get reassigned to a new room. This time it's a standard room so I'm not sure what all the song and dance was about not having any available. The hotel did give us free breakfast at the buffet restaurant (approx. $24 value) for our inconvenience. The buffet was good, I would eat there again if I go back. So we finally got checked in and settled into our room and we were starving, so we decided to get something to eat. We went to the IHOP just down the street and discovered exactly what kind of neighbourhood we were in. Not exactly the nicest part of town!! Our room in the Stratosphere was decent. It was also clean. The first night I did not sleep well because the roller coaster at the Sahara (hotel across the street) kept me awake. Other than that we had no problems with the room itself. The location of the Stratosphere (far end of the strip) was not really a problem for us. We walked the whole strip then took the Las Vegas Tram back to the hotel at the end of the day (mostly because I had blisters from so much walking, otherwise we would have walked!) I also enjoyed the slot machines at the Stratosphere, as that is where I won some $$ (on penny slots!!) And the view from the top of the tower is amazing. I was going to pay to go up at night, but we ran out of time. 3 nights is too short especially if you arrive later than expected on the first night. We also spent 1 day and drove to the Grand Canyon, so that took up a fair bit of time. I would definitely stay at the Stratosphere again. Despite the mixup at the beginning we had little other problems.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth the extra $ to be on the Strip instead”
Reviews.Author: Gravity2
Reviews.Content: This hotel wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't so isolated and far from everything. You still need to take a cab to the strip and downtown. Unless you have driven to Vegas and have your own car, this hotel is not very ideal if you want to be where the action is. By the time you pay for cabs or even rent a car, you might of as well stayed somewhere on the strip and paid more and just being able to walk everywhere. It also took forever to check in, the crowd is mix, so you do get some shady characters and the elevators are very slow. There are not a whole lot of restaurants in the hotel and our room still had the adult channel still running from the previous guest, glad we didn't have kids with us. The only distinguishing thing about this hotel is the view is pretty cool from the tower, however, as a guest, you can only go for free during the day for a couple of hours. You'd have to pay, if you went at night. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They did it again”
Reviews.Author: jbarr74
Reviews.Content: Well they did it again, what a great stay. We arrived the morning of the 29th of Sept and they had a room ready for us upon our arrival. After checking in which was no line and no hassle we went to the room and changed clothes and decided on the course of action for the day. Buffet, oh yes, crab legs, shrip and a variety of breakfast items and of course champagine, I dont know what all the fuss is about their buffet, we think it's great. Sure we are on a budget but when you think of how much you save by eating there it leaves more for the gambling budget. Won some money there playing Video Poker well enough to get a big screen TV and still put back in the bank more than I took. Let me sum up a 3 day trip like this, If you want a clean room and good food and fine service from friendly employees from the front desk to the cocktail waitresses and everyone else there then stay at the Strat. I don't think that you will be disappointed. The money you save can go a long way toward other fun things. Thanks Stratosphere

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: OurReviews
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere from October 5th through the 9th. We made our reservations directly with Stratosphere because they had the cheapest rates compared to other websites. First off, I would like to state the problems we had with this hotel. When we called Stratosphere to make our reservations, we made them for the Premiere Tower because it was only a few extra dollars and more recently renovated than the World Towers. Check in was easy and fast and after being in our room for about 5 minutes, my husband realized we weren't put in the Premiere Tower. We called down to the front desk and they told us this is the room we booked. After letting them go, we realized it wasn't right that we paid the extra money to be put in a more renovated room so we called again and they did eventually put is in the right tower. We felt like they were trying to rip us off. We were meeting friends from Canada that also booked the Premier Tower and were placed in World Tower instead (not a problem for them, I guess) The next day, we felt like we were trying to get ripped off again. We were at the front desk and noticed all the signs all over stating that you could get a late check out and during the week, you can stay till 6:00 pm for only 20 extra dollars. Since our flight wasn't leaving till after 6:00, we talked to the lady about getting a late check-out. She told us the price was $30.00 even though signs were posted all over saying $20.00. Needless to say, we decided not to do the late checkout at that time and waiting closer to our departure date. They did wind up charging us the $20.00, instead of $30.00 but we couldn't help but feel like they were trying to scam us out of money. But anyway, other than those two problems, we thought the hotel was pretty descent. We enjoyed the fact that it wasn't in the heart of the strip. It was nice to spend the day on the busy strip and come back to a hotel that was just far enough away from the hustle and bustle. Our room(s)...World Tower and Premier Tower were average rooms. Nothing fancy, nothing nasty, just okay...but that is what we were going for anyways. We had two double beds cause that was what was available. The beds were comfy and the room served its purpose, as we barely spent any time in it anyways. The casino at the Stratosphere is actually very nice. I was expecting something old and dingy from reading past reviews, but this was nice. Drinks came around quite and bit and we even won on some machines. The ate at Roxy's Diner and Lucky's which are both on site. Lucky's was nice cause it's open 24/7 and they're food is pretty good. Roxy's Diner was a blast and we thought it was so cute. All the workers sing and dance and it's just neat to watch. You could tell staff at Roxy's enjoy they're job and it makes dining there very enjoyable. Definitly check that out...oh, and they're food is great! We both had a BBQ Pork sandwich and it was the best we ever had! Simple pleasures, I guess! We didn't see any shows here but we did get the pass to ride the rides at the top of the Stratosphere Tower. The view up there is excellent! The rides are fun and super scary! I love amusement park rides but a couple of these scared me enough to only go on them once! So much fun though! There are plenty of gift shops on site and some have excellent prices too. There are other places to eat right in the building too so that was kinda nice. Checkout was easy and there are plenty of cabs and shuttles waiting out front to take you to the airport. All in all, even with the small problems, Stratosphere was a fine hotel and we would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: IsisTheCat
Reviews.Content: I had a birthday party in a gorgeous room on the 104th floor of this hotel. This is a fabulous place to have an event. The view is unparalleled, food was exquisite, and the price per person was a LOT cheaper than other hotels on the Strip. I was worried about the hotel rooms, having seen reviews here, but I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Given the prices of hotel rooms on the strip, we were happy with the room prices here. Of course, you don't get bells and whistles in your rooms for the price, but some of my party said they were not much different from much bigger named hotels on the strip that they had stayed in. Having said that I have one BIG complaint. I was in one of their signature suites. The hotel does not have non-smoking suites!!! In this day and age, this is unacceptable to me. They put in some sort of "ozone" cleaner for an hour or so, but that had no apparent effect. I had to go out and buy a room deodorizer which helped a little. (There were no other available suites, and even if there were, I wasn't about to go door-to-door to see whether other rooms reeked as badly of stale smoke like my suite did). This is NOT a problem with regular rooms, just the suites.

Reviews.Title: “West Coast Tour 2007”
Reviews.Author: Shrimper72
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the "Strat", lets fancy it in Vegas a clean room and comfy bed are all need as there is so much to do and the "Strat" has plenty of these. Queue at reception on the Sunday evening was very long but did seem to move at a reasonable rate. The guy checking in next to us got offered a suite for an extra $10 per night as it was his birthday during his stay, twigging an opportunity I asked if they would offer us the same, no luck but we did get an "upgraded room" for $10 a night giving us a room in the "new" tower, a slightly bigger room and TV, we took it and the room was nice. Tried eating at the buffet, Roxy's Diner, Luckys Cafe, all good and reasonablely priced. The Stratosphere has cheaper gambling tables, though at the bottom end of the strip is a good place to stay and bet if your budget is a bit limited.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful improvements”
Reviews.Author: Vegastravellerdude
Reviews.Content: They made wonderful improvements since I last stayed there, definetely the best value for your money, if this is your first time going to Vegas, going to the Strat's observation deck is definetely a must, you will get the very best view of Vegas from up there. Great restaurants and great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Place is OK but over priced in gift shops”
Reviews.Author: cynpowers
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate here and room was nice. Had a good time in The 50's style dinner there. Waitress's and waiters sing and preform 50's songs and they take requests....it was a good time. Bought a couple things in the gift shop then later stop at the worlds largest gift shop on The strip found the same items for 1/2 the price! So buy trinkets else where. No free Internet had to pay 9.95 for 24 hours. Had a smoking room but I couldn't tell that when we walked in. It smelled fresh and clean. Room over looked the parking lot and hotel check in below. Tour buses went though twice in the evening being very loud even on the 8th floor. we could see the hills off in the distance also.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay at the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: ditsy1
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very good stay at the Stratosphere. The hotel has a good range of restaurants - Lucky's diner does delicious breakfasts and burgers, and the buffet offers a really good range of food. We had a room on the 5th floor on the first night, which is the first floor above the casino and so was noisy. We asked to be moved and the helpful receptionist did so without hesitation, to the 21st floor where we had a fantastic view of the strip. The rooms here are on the large side, and was very clean with a incredibly comfortable king size bed. We went to see The American Superstars show at this hotel which was great fun, I would recommend it. The only downside to our stay was the distance from the main part of the strip - we gave up on the Deuce bus after day 2 as it was always late and crammed to capacity. We used the monorail for the rest of the holiday, which was at The Sahara and some walk away. For those people on a budget and who don't mind staying a bit out of the way, i would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: ntravellerUk
Reviews.Content: Couple of problems with room keys not working. moved rooms fine. both very nice. large, clean, good for the price. great pool area. nice casino and free access to the tower. location is a bit of a pain but strip is walkable / cheap taxis buses on doorstep. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: CityHall
Reviews.Content: Well we didn't pay that much for the rooms so weren't expecing much. And please do not do so. First when you arrive it's very confusing where to go because there are so many car lanes for the casino and valet parking and self parking but nothing for hotel guests. So we went to Valet Parling and asked where to go as a hotel guest and I guess they just didn't like that we weren't arriving in a Ferrari so they send us away to self parking which is REALLY far away from the actual occasion. We just took our handbaggage to go to the reception and thank god. We had to cross the whole casino which is about 10 minutes to walk to reach the reception desk. We felt like we were disturbing and then they told us they have no more non-smoking rooms (in a hotel with about 10.000 rooms ?!?) but they would give us "...a little nicer room. A mini suite with no extra charge." The mini suite was a terrible (but clean) smoking room with no window to open to let fresh air inside but it had 2 square meters more than the other rooms with a chair and a small table. There's no breakfast service (they were almost laughing when we asked for it, but it doesn't say anything about it when you book the room on their website. You might not bother when you're American but as a European I'm used to having a breakfast in the morning. Also: Do not book the rooms through their website. You can only choose a preferred room type so you never know in which kind of room they will put you in the end). Pool access from 7AM to 7PM. Nice pool. "Free Tower Access" only from 10AM to 2PM. So - for Vegas it's still cheap. If you stay there and you arrive: Take the Valet Parking Lane and ask for their baggage service. They'll park your car (for free) and tag your baggage with a number. When you get to your room you call them, say the number and they bring it up (it's for free too). There is also a reception desk when you enter the casino on the right side of the elevators but of course they won't announce it so you'll have to walk through the whole casino. I cannot evaluate the casino cause we weren't so into playing.

Reviews.Title: “It suited us!”
Reviews.Author: steddiguy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Stratosphere from 24-29 September and had a really good stay. This hotel provided the three main things we look for in a hotel-it was clean, the plumbing worked and the beds were comfortable. Being budget conscious we stayed in a World Tower room and the room was a good size and was cleaned and the towels changed everyday. We spent very little time in the room anyway as for us it's just a place to sleep, stow our luggage and have a shower. We don't understand previous comments about the staff being rude and unhelpful-everyone we spoke to (receptionists, restaurant staff, bar staff, casino staff etc etc) were friendly and helpful. My one gripe is some staff need to know more about the place they are working in-we needed to catch a tour coach from the West Lobby of the hotel, 2 seperate staff members told us it was the main entrance which is wrong and we missed it! Yes, you will have to wait in a queue to check in but it's a big hotel and there are always lots of guests arriving and departing and the receptionists work as fast as they can-deal with it! We ate at the Coutyard Restaurant several times for breakfast and dinner. It is the biggest buffet I have ever seen and the food is good. We also ate at Roxys Diner-friendly staff, a great atmosphere and good food. The hotel is at the northern end of the Strip. The airport shuttle will charge you as for a downtown hotel to get here but its still cheap ($8 per person). All the hotels look closer than they are because they are big but they aren't-be aware of this if you don't like walking. It will take you a day to explore one side of the strip on foot but it really is the best way to see it. You will be fine heading south towards the strip on foot but head north and you enter a poor area and you need to go through this if you want to reach downtown and Fremont Street,. In daylight you will be ok walking here as along as you are not alone. After dark or if alone is better to get a taxi if you need to pass through here. Don't let this put you off the Stratosphere as my partner and I always felt safe. Oh, and you have to do the Tower at least twice. Once by day and once by night-the views are amazing and it's the best place to see the sunset. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Stratosphere again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bathroom”
Reviews.Author: isabellesm
Reviews.Content: My two girlfriends and I stayed there for 2 nights. After waiting in line for a long time at the counter, we finally gor our non-smoking room that we requested and reconfirmed with the hotel clerck. When we opened the door of our room, we could definitly smell the smoke...disgusting. It was 2:00 am and were very tired so me got ready for bed anyway, to discover that the sink in the bathroom wasn't draining properly. The shower drain was also slow to drain and the toilet made a super loud noise when flushed. We called the front desk to request a new room and told us to call back in the afternoon the next day. When we went to the front desk to request the new room their key system was down and they couldn't issue a key!! So we stayed in that stinky room for the last night and moved to the excalibur the next day. The bathroom was very small with the toilet and shower in a seperate room (poor lighting, every time you open the light it flashed like a disco ball) and a separate sink with counter next to the toilet. The first morning there, we got woken up by a big noise on our window like someone was trying to break in. Being 3 girls, we got scared and jumped off our bed to discover that the window cleaning guy was doing is job at 6:45 am and was going down the floors with his ropes and big suction cups clinging to our window!!! Oh! and the electric outlet next to sink wasn't working....I will not stay there again, it is also very far from the central part of the strip where the action and beautiful hotels are. The stratosphere is located in a poor part of the strip, lots of itinerants and garbage...

Reviews.Title: “I'll take the Stratosphere anyday”
Reviews.Author: SaintSomewhere_7
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for the past three times and they treat you great. After our first stay they invited us back for New Years with a complimentary three day stay with party (no we are not high rollers). Just this past visit they were offering new card members $200 in comps which you won't find anywhere else. I'm very comfortable there wandering away from my husband with out fear that I won't find him for hours like at other huge casinos. Lucky's restaurant is great when the one meal you want the most is a decent breakfast. Side note to anyone looking for a coffee pot in any hotel room on the strip, so far none of the hotels I've stayed in have them and I've stayed in many. They need to get you out of your room ASAP. The staff is friendly and wait staff does NOT get lost getting you a drink. And finally the TOP is the greatest you can see the Strip and downtown both and the food up there is like being in heaven. Can you tell I really like this place which is rare cause I usually complain about everything. P.S. Forgot to mention the room , typical room for the price nothing fancy but very clean and probably a star higher than Imperial Palace, Flamingo regular room or Harrah's regular room if you're looking to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: 123J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Dad from 22-29 Sept and had a great time. We arrived at 5pm and waited about 5 mins to check in, the receptionist was really friendly and checked us in in 2 mins! Our room was on the 11th floor of the world tower and was a good size and spotless. We eat breakfast most mornings in the courtyard buffet. The selection of food is fantastic, everything is really fresh and they have a live omlette station where the chef makes your eggs to order which is georgous. There is a great atmosphere in the casino and all the hotel staff are really friendly and helpful. We also eat at Roxys diner which is really good fun as the waiting staff sing!! The food at Luckys cafe is also good. I would definatley recommend going up the tower as the views are amazing. We walked to the Sahara to catch the monorail most days and it comes every 6 mins so you dont have to wait too long, really convenient for visiting the other hotels on the strip. We did an evening coach tour and saw the masquerade show at the Rio which is on the ceiling and the fountains at Bellagio, would definatley reccomend going to see both. We had a great time and will definatley stay at the Strat again.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints, dont listen to the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: IrelandShaz
Reviews.Content: Despite the bad reviews of the stratosphere my husband and i stayed there for 8 nights from 10 - 18 september, We had a lovely room on the 11th floor halfway between the the 2 sets of elevators so it was very quiet. Our only fault is that there are no tea & coffee facilities in the rooms but we overcame that by bringing a travel kettle with us! We travelled all the time using the deuce bus just dont be in a hurry to get anywhere most journeys take an hour. Although you are not in the centre of the strip i would thoughly recommend this hotel to future Vegas visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel at northern end of Strip”
Reviews.Author: Yeegan
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere Tower is clearly visible from all over town. It clings right onto the northern end of the Strip though the taxi shuttle from the airport counted it as being downtown and charged me more! The main advantage of staying at the Stratosphere is the reasonable price for slightly above basic accommodation. For a single traveller like me, I would rather spend less on the hotel room (where I intend to spend as little time as possible) and put the savings towards a show, meal, etc. The view from the Premier Tower is quite nice but can also be quite rundown from lower rooms on other towers. Check in has always been slow with a long line. There's also a compulsory $5 per day 'resort charge', which gives free tower admission from 10am-1pm daily and a few other fringe benefits. The check in clerk tried to bully me with the fact that he didn't have any rooms in my class when I had pre-booked and paid for but I stuck to my guns and got an upgrade. The Stratosphere isn't anywhere as plush as some Strip hotels but I don't think you can expect that for the amount you pay. There are quite a few eating options though not all of them are open everyday. I enjoyed the buffet which fills you up. The overnight diner offers some very cheap meals with coupons readily available. There's an outdoor pool and spa bath on the 8th floor. Reasonable size with a volleyball net set up and basketball hoops and balls freely available. There's also a table tennis table and a bar in the pool area. The ride to the top of the tower is compulsory in my opinion, especially at night when the neon really brings the town to life. There are indoor and outdoor observation decks and yes, the thrill rides at the top of the tower do shake it, so don't worry - it's not an earthquake! There are also a lot of laughs to be had from watching the faces of the thrillseekers on the rides. I love roller coasters but even I was a bit worried at the look of X Scream and Insanity. They are certainly unique ride experiences because of the location. There are a couple of shows on - American Superstars, a tribute show which was entertaining and available cheap with coupons, and Bite which I didn't watch. There's a shopping mall with more down market but cheaper stalls than some of the lavish Strip hotels. I didn't find travelling along the Strip that bad - it's a 5 minute walk to the Sahara hotel and the monorail which has 7 stops along the Strip and takes 15 minutes to travel to the other end of the line at the MGM. There are Strip trolleys but these aren't as reliable due to the brutal Vegas Strip traffic in my experience. So I found the Stratosphere a reasonably priced base for exploring the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better”
Reviews.Author: WilderTraveler
Reviews.Content: The overall service of the staff was great. The room although in the Premier Tower had a very crappy view as I stayed on the 7th floor. The Courtyard buffet had no real selections and the hot food was cold! An upgraded room that looked like CRAP and very outdated. The pool was made of ice cold water of which now I've encountered the flu since I've returned home. The hotel rewards can only be redeemed on Sunday, but I was leaving on Wednesday, which meant anything won after Sunday would have to wait until next time? If any? I would definitely not recommend this hotel to others, nor will I stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “front desk could be more accomodating”
Reviews.Author: elliejr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stratosphere weekend from 9/14-9/18. Have been to Vegas approx. 10 times and have stayed at a variety of properties (mid-strip, south strip, and downtown) First time at the Stratosphere and at the north end of the strip. Location is good. Halfway to downtown and halfway to mid strip. We checked in Fri at approx. 9 p.m. The room we had reserved on line and paid a one night deposit for was not available (non-smoking king in premier tower). We were put in a double queen room on the 8th floor w/ a view of a concrete wall and satellite dishes. The room was a pit, lamps broken bathroom nasty and patched over holes in walls. Called the front desk and was advised we could be moved in the a.m. to a higher floor w/ a king bed. We moved to the 17th floor the next day at around noon to a perfect room. Around 1 a.m. that night we attempted to get back in our room but the keys did not work. Apparently the battery in the door lock had died. Security and maintenance had to break into our room. We then had to pack up all our stuff. All w/o closing the door which would not be able to be reopened. We were moved to a room on the 11th flr once again w/ a view of satellite dishes. I called the front desk and was advised they had no other room for us but could get a new room the next day at 11 a.m. Called the front desk at 11 a.m. and was told I could not a new room untl 3pm!! I then asked to speak to a manager and suggested that perhaps they should upgrade our room and move us or at least give us a credit for the buffet or something. Finally we were upgraded to a slightly better room on the 21st flr. Which was great (finally!!) Other than the room mix-ups, the Strat was great. Food was good at the buffet for breakfast, Top of the World for lunch and Roxy's. Atmosphere in the casino was great . The martinis at the C bar were awesome. Had a lovely facial at the spa, nothing extravagant but clean and pleasant. The aesthecian was late and the spa was savvy enough to offer me 10% off the facial. Pity the front desk wasn't so savvy. The adults only pool on the 25th floor was well worth the $10 for the guys. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: kaysee60
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights back in August and all I can say is that is was a great place to stay. So it was a bit far away from most of the other hotels on the strip but there are plenty of buses to take you down there (even if they are a bit crowded). The room was lovely, very clean and we had a great view from the 21st floor down the strip. Roxy's Diner was absolutely brilliant. My daughter was 16 when we were there and the night we had our meal there, one of the guys, Mickey, spotted her birthday badge and the next thing she was being sung to in the middle of the restaurant. What a great moment and such a wonderful memory for her! All in all I would go back to the Stratosphere if I went to Vegas again. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal, if you're into unexceptional motels”
Reviews.Author: Lobotrip
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere really had just one great thing going for it: the price. I paid about $30 a night during Superbowl weekend. Everything else in Stratosphere just hit the average mark. The room had a sort of motelish vibe to it. It was clean, and I could sleep on the bed without worry. They did have cable TV and their own channels showing how to gamble in different games. It was a comfortable room, however the maids were loud the next morning as they were cleaning other rooms down the hall. Maybe the hall itself amplified the noise. The casino was okay--it had a sort of party atmosphere and the machines (video Black Jack) seemed to payout decently. There is a Starbucks in there, for those who can't go through a day without caffeine. There are a few other restaurants inside as well. And of course, there's the tower and the rides that are on top of it. They do give you a pass to the top if you're a guest. The location of the Stratosphere is on the northern edge of the Strip. Like its rooms, it's not a great location, but you could do much worse. If you didn't bring your own transportation, then waiting in front of the hotel for a bus or taxi is one of the few other ways to get around the town. Or you can walk a few blocks south through a not-so-nice part of town to get on the monorail. Right now a 24-hour pass for it costs about $9, which is much cheaper than a taxi ride from one end of the strip to the other. It's also quite fast, taking about 20 minutes to get from one terminus to the other. The Deuce, the local bus running up and down the strip is the cheapest way, but don't take it if you're in a hurry--it's normally jam-packed and there's always people getting off or on at EACH and EVERY stop on the strip. There is a local private trolley bus service that stops in front of Stratosphere which has routes for passengers to downtown (Fremont Street) and the Strip. It costs, I think, about $3.50 per person to get around. The only problem with it is they don't seem to have a set schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carieellen
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed there over Labor Day 2007 weekend. The room was average...not unlike a typical Best Western room, as others have mentioned. Buffets were great, not the tops of Vegas, but fine. The "mall" section of the hotel is insanely cheesy and tacky...not worth your time. Lines were long for check-in, trips to the top, etc., but service at restaurants was quick. The walk to the main strip from the hotel is long, and goes through a rather sketchy section of street littered with closed buildings and construction. Not an ideal walk for the elderly or children, etc. The sidewalks and street were not clear. In general, a decent stay but nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: HSUgrad03
Reviews.Content: The room itself was no better than your typical Best Western, Super 8, Travelodge, etc. Hell even the last Travelodge I stayed at had a refrigerator and coffee maker, which this room lacked. The view from our room kinda sucked since we were not on the strip side, but hell not every room can have an exciting view. I was also a bit miffed that the windows did not open, but since the room had decent climate control I didn't mind too much. The casino was a standard casino... no different, really, from the Indian casinos I've been to here in Northern California. We went to a lot of the bigger hotels along the main part of the strip in our sightseeing and noticed that all their casinos were very themed and a bit more professional looking than back at the Strat. Although, the Strat did have the cheapest minimum Blackjack tables we found ($5) other than TI. So being Blackjack players, we did most our gambling back at our home base for the weekend. The layout was pretty confusing too. I usually got pretty turned around, but by the 4th day of our trip we knew generally where things were. I also appreciated that the shops were on the second floor and we weren't forced to go through them on our way to any attractions, unlike some of the larger hotels. A brief word on the pool... it's on the 8th floor, which to us was a bit deceiving. We assumed that it had to be an indoor pool since the hotel has about 24 floors. Not true... it's out on what I assume is the roof of the casino. Generally nice, decent bar, lots of family activities. There's a volleyball net set up with water polo type balls floating around and a few basketball hoops set up along the side. There was plenty of chairs, but not enough shade. Wasn't the best pool we saw in our sightseeing at the other hotels, but it was definitely a better pool than your average hotel. We did decide, however, that despite the price we would not stay there again. As I mentioned, the room was nothing special and it was so far away from the main part of the strip (like Janelle H said, it was way farther away from everything than we thought it would be) that cab rides to any of the other hotels ranged from $10 to $15. We didn't do any real calculations, but figured we'd probably spent enough to cab fees to cover the cost of staying at a nicer hotel closer to the heart of the strip. We walked into all the other hotels and casinos saying "wow look at that! this is great" and I don't remember any "wows" or "look check that out" going on when we walked into the Strat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel room and tower”
Reviews.Author: birby04
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was great. We went down there on vacation during Labor Day and the hotel you could spot anywhere in Vegas by the tower. Had a pleasant check-in and 4 nights in an amazing suite for under $200 night. I recommend that you eat at the "top of the world" because it is very good food and a beautiful view from about 800 ft above. I really dont have any flaws to the hotel everything worked out perfectly. There was a long line to wait to go up the the tower but the line moved smoothly. The elevator ride only took like 30 seconds to reach the top and there was an indoor and outdoor viewing deck. Also cant forget about the three rides on top of the tower. Looked like a thrill but never got on because my wife didnt want to ride it with me. Plenty of fun to do inside the hotel like the 25th floor that has an adult only swimming pool. On the 8th floor has all ages swimming pool and work out area. The 6th floor has the laundry room, and casino floor with some restaurants and the second floor has many other stores.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teepee26
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Las Vegas and we thought this hotel was excellent, when we checked in we only waited about 2 mins, our room was easy to find, it was well presented and very clean. The staff could not do enough to help. On one of the days that we had a lie in and put the do not disturb notice on the door housekeeping left a message for us at reception stating that when we were ready to have our room tidied they will only be too happy to pop up and do it at our convenience. The food was really nice at the hotel and you have to experience Roxys Diner. We went to the American Superstars show which was fab and included in the ticket was the chance to go to the Romance Lounge at the top of the tower it was breathtaking the views were unbeleivable and the lounge was really romantically decorated, the staff were good up there too it was a different world up there. My only one gripe with this hotel was the night club they have there Pollyesters you can get in for free but once you are in there all the seats were reserved so you had to stand all night and the drinks prices were so expensive it cost close to $20 for a bottle of beer and a diet coke which was more ice than drink. Overall I would recommend this hotel and should we visit vegas agian we will stay in the same place, we did go around all the other hotels on the strip and although some were obviously grand and posh we both thought that the Strat was one of the best. Deffo worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Long Lines”
Reviews.Author: maggiebr67
Reviews.Content: Every thing was great but the long line to check in (45 min)and at the card center. Great comps. Food was good, but long waits. Service at all the resturants was above average and really fast. All resturants are non-smoking. I will stay at this hotel again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kloedanser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strat for our honeymoon; we loved it. We had gotten a fabulous deal on the stay from our travel agent, and could not have been happier about a week long honeymoon trip for 450.00 US. After we paid for the trip however, we were concerned about staying there because we had read some not so nice reviews. However, when we got to our hotel and got checked in, we could not have been happier. Not only had we been upgraded to a honeymoon suite that featured all marble entry and bathroom (which was HUGE) but we had a couch, two TV's, and a massive jacuzzi bath in the center of the room which was the epitome of style and luxury. Sure, we were a little away from the "Strip", but who cares? I mean, you could stay at the MGM and want to visit the Venetian, and you are still going to either have to cab it or walk. Might as well save some room money for those cab rides! And its not like we really had to cab around that much as it was, we never wnated to leave the hotel. We won 970.00 dollars at the slots at the Strat and not only did it pay for our vacation, but afforded us the luxury of being able to eat at The Top of the World restaurant, which is at the top of the Strat. Great food, great service (which is rare in Vegas) and all in all just one hell of a good time. The only thing with which we were not entirely satisfied with was the check in time. It is at three, so if you are there early, you are stuck till then. The casino was lots of fun, the room service was FAST and HOT, the bathroom rocked, and there was a digital safe in the room for those of you who don't care to stroll around Las Vegas looking to get mugged. For the cheap, cheap, CHEAP price of this hotel, I would recommend it hands down. Excellent. Stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at the Strat”
Reviews.Author: ScottBanks
Reviews.Content: Another good stay at the Strat. Checked in on Saturday Sept 1st and was met with a long 45 minute wait. Should have got there before the rush at 3pm. My bad. Next time I know. People came by and offered us free bottled water while we were waiting in line. Line moved quickly. Buffet and shops are affordable and worth it! Food was great at buffet. Went to the top of the tower with free coupon at check-in. Great views and great picture opps! Dealers weren't overly friendly at the tables and some seemed down right bored to death. That's too bad. They should appear friendlier to get more tips. Just a observation. I didnt play blackjack or Texas Hold Em here because of this. I had a car so location was no big deal at all. Good stay, clean hotel room, and good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and smelly rooms but what do you expect from the price!”
Reviews.Author: GemsG
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas in July 2007 as part of a two week trip around the South West and California which started and ended in Vegas, so we decided that for the first 2 nights we should stay somewhere well known and not too expensive. The Stratosphere is indeed very cheap (even cheaper once we complained) but the service and cleanliness of the hotel did nothing to inspire a second visit. I suppose it started on booking, I didn't receive an email confirmation although they money had been taken and I had a confirmation code, I'm easily panicked though so I attempted to contact the hotel but they don't seem to be a bit fan of email only phone (and I'm not a big fan of phoning the US from the UK). After taking over half an hour to check in (felt longer because we'd just got off a 10hr flight) we were told that there were no more Non-smoking rooms available and we would have to take a Smoking room, not great when both of us are asthmatics! Apparently it says in the hotels T&Cs that Non-Smoking rooms are not guaranteed and that this is the normal process (never had this before anywhere else!) Hotel room smelt of an ashtray, I'm sure even a Smoker would have protested, not even a heavy dose of airfreshner did the trick. My partner complained to the front desk and was told they'd put a purifier in there to help. They didn't... we did the typical British thing and gave up the complaining as it obviously wasn't working! We did however notice that the cleaner had not bothered to actually dust the room and obviously hadn't bothered for quite a while and so there were various surfaces we just didn't put things on for fear of disturbing the well settled dust. We did in the end complain on check out, although they weren't too bothered about our health reasons for not wanting a smoking room they seemed to be more worried about the dust...a discount was given thankfully and although it didn't spoil my first impressions of Vegas I won't be going back to this hotel there are far nicer ones actually on the strip like Bill's Gambling Hall! Feel free to email me if you need any more info on the Strat!

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel, at 2 star rates”
Reviews.Author: anglo_canadian
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel based on the northern end of the 'strip' affording some rooms a view of such. The area isn't the best but it's not bad either. Finding the hotel is somewhat easy because of the huge tower that is on the property site. However because of its size it's a bit of a maze trying to find the guest parking. Like the hotel which basically has a 'World' and 'Premiere' part, the parking is divided accordingly. It's advisable to park in the right part depending on the side of the hotel you're booked. You'll probably only find this out after checking in, but just be aware. I paid to stay in the Premiere part of the hotel which is more modern. On arrival I was offered a room with a strip view for $10 a night extra, which I foolishly went for.
