I then discovered that this was in the older ' World' part of the hotel and the room stunk of smoke and was not as modern as I was expecting. The 'strip view' was not really up to much, seeing part of the strip but not the whole length. I managed to get moved to the Premiere part but they claimed that I'd only booked rooms in the older part so refused to refund the $10 per night. I had to later go down with my confirmation to demonstrate otherwise and the hotel then promptly adjusted my account. Checking into the hotel is a pain as you are forced to walk through a busy casino on your way to registration. Registration desks were plentiful and I only waited 10 minutes. However when I checked out the lines were at least 40 minutes or so, so I used the self checkout option Once settled, the hotel room was of a good standard with reasonable amenities, but no fridge. They appear to want to keep you there, which is a reasonable strategy. There's a load of restaurants and mall style boutique shops within the hotel at reasonable prices. You also get access to the tower included in the cost of the room (if you get the resort fee included). This is a must-do event, as you get breathtaking views from the viewing gallery. There's also some white knuckle rides to tempt you at the pinnacle of the tower. I didn't try any of these as they looked horrendous, mostly involving tipping you off a tower nearly 1,000 ft up, but probably best do this at night for the ultimate thrill. For the price I paid I think this was a reasonable hotel and probably one of the finest value in Vegas. The whole casino lark isn't for me so I probably wont' return, but if I did I'd consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere is okay!!”
Reviews.Author: cruise&travel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Stratosphere August 24. There were long lines for check in, but it went smoothly, and check in took about 15 minutes. We paid an extra $15 per night to upgrade to a suite. It was worth the extra $$. The hotel and casino was very clean, and all employees were polite. We ate at the buffet, Lucky's and Roxy's and were satisfied with food and service. We saw the American Superstars, and it was a great show!! I came home with $200 more than I took, even after meals, drinks, and souveniers. My friends came home with $4,000 more (they were very happy) The Strat is at the far end of the strip, but we got on the deuce and rode to the other casinos or downtown to Freemont Street. It wasn't an inconveniece, as we are frequent travelers and are use to this, especially in foreign countries. Overall the Stratosphere was a great place to stay for the price. Of course, you cannot compare it to the Bellagio or Venetican, but for the price, you can't go wrong! If you have any particular questions, email me and I will be glad to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Always good”
Reviews.Author: blondie777
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 4 different occasions. Never had a bad experience here. Prices are always good, rooms always clean. I've eaten at all their restaurants and like them all. I would recommend Roxy's and the buffet. They have good shopping upstairs, lots of different stores. The casino is fairly big, the staff is really friendly. The concierge people were very nice. They have a parking garage that is never full from level 6 on up and the elevators are fast. Its been a little dirty at times. I like the tower, the only bad thing is every time I've come back they have raised prices on the rides at the top and the elevator ride up. Its always a fast check-in. The hallways and rooms have always been clean. They leave the cutest pens on the desk in the room. Whenever we've called to have them bring more pillows or towels they're at the door in about a minute. The housekeepers were even friendly. I like the location of the hotel, its at the end of the strip so the traffic is still bad but its not the worst around there and its really easy to get back onto I-15.

Reviews.Title: “The Strat”
Reviews.Author: sandii54
Reviews.Content: Had the casino suite. Room needs to be updated just a little. The beds suck. The jetted tub was a blast. Was able to sleep on sucky bed because we were so relaxed after playing in tub. The buffet was average. Roxy's is a cool place. Really enjoy the atmostphere. Lucky's cafe had extremely rude waitress and food was horrible. Slots were so so. Overall, had a pretty good time!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay”
Reviews.Author: hlpepper
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed here and have never had any problems. Check-in is quick and check-out is super quick (you can check-out through the TV). The valet only takes a few minutes to get your car and everyone was pleasent. The room was clean and large. The only con that I see with the hotel is that it is at the very end of the Strip. If you want to walk up to any of the other hotels/casinos you better be in good shape and be carrying gallons of water with you! Otherwise you are going to have to drive or get a taxi. And check out the all you can eat brunch in the restaurant - it was surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Matt128
Reviews.Content: Really liked this place, I have stayed at many other more expensive places on the strip and the Stratosphere rates just as good as most of the them. The room was very basic but clean and efficient. The front desk wait was long but not to bad and they allowed an early check in to a no view room or wait to 3pm for an upper floor room with a view. I chose the the later, and was able to bypass the long line and go to the casino invited guest line. The pool is just about my favorite on the strip, it is not very plush or tropical but for some reason just felt great, not crowded and had areas of shade to lay in and had misters for when not in the pool. The pool deck also had a great open air feel and views of the strip and the tower above, they also had a great sound system and played music to cover up all the traffic noise. The only downside is the $5.00 resort fee and the coupon book they give you which was useless. Overall I will stay there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: picthis1
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here and we reserved the Casino Suites for about $120 per night. I have to say that the room was no where near worth that money. The walls are paper thin and the thermostat is locked and you cannot change it. The room had a nice jacuzzi and the view was good, just not worth the price though. Overall the property is all right. It is a long....long...LONG way to the part of the strip where the most action is. I rode the bus and a taxi but still I wasn't happy that much here. Each morning house cleaning gathered in the hallway and had a conference with each other that was rude and annoying,,,,we all could hear them at 7:00 am every morning. The gambling rewards/points cards here were a ruse and didn't deliver what they promised.

Reviews.Title: “Kiwi perspectative”
Reviews.Author: tyler00
Reviews.Content: Made it to the strat just after 1pm on Sunday afternoon and made it through the Queue of people to the counter in less than 30min. Which for me was ok as I had already spent the last 4hrs on a luxury coach from LA to Vegas. Checkout staff were good had no problems with checkin and were given keys to our romm on level 9. Trip in the elevator up to level 9 was an event in itself felt like the elevator had been taped together and didnt sound too safe! Rooms were clean and standard but we were expecting anything more. Had to admit the beds at the Stratosphere are awesome nice and comfortable and even though we had a veiw of the carpark and the mountains we werent too fussed. Made our way upstairs to the pools but is it me or are all the pools only 3.5m deep?? I found this to be the same at some of the other hotels and just was curious about the depth.... Didnt really do much at the Stratosphere other than drink at the centre bar but spent most of our trip down the strip at other hotels or at the outlet malls. All in all a good place to stay if your budget conscious did notice the smoke smell within the establishment but that was ok as I didnt spend to much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: PROOGY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the stratosphere for 5 nights and could not have been happier. Checked in on sunday night about 11 p. m. and only waited about 20 minutes, check in clerk was helpful and very pleasent. The rooms were a little small but very clean and had all the basics. The only drawback is the location, but we had rented a car so it was not a problem. Also the valet at the strat has to be the best on the strip. Overall a great place to stay for the price. This is not the bellagio, but then again neither are the prices. As long as you have a car you can't beat the stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “For a great trip stay here”
Reviews.Author: kelibundi
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest place to stay. We had a great trip, the room was clean and fresh. We went up in the tower for brunch and it was awesome. Then we saw both American Superstars and Bite. We loved American Superstars, but Bite was just ok. We also went to the night club Poly Ester's and it was too much like Pleasure Island at Disney. We did visit the Oasis Lounge often and received great service. We ate at the Asain restuarant and Lucky's Dinner, both were great. We would definetely stay here again...this is the best value for the dollar in Las Vegas. My only warning is that outside the casino is a little rough. I was approached by a homeless guy in the casino who asked for money to eat...so just be prepared not to venture outside alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayJayIowa
Reviews.Content: Friend and I stayed at the Stratosphere, we enjoyed the stay the beds were comfortable and the air worked great it was really cold in there. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The shopping was great lots of variety. Also had great shopping within walking distance, Huge store with lots of great priced souvenirs. We used to trolley a lot to get from place to place. Even though it was at the end of the strip the trolley made it easy to see the great sites. Although during rush hour it took a long time, So we planned around that. Going downtown to see the Fremont experience was a must see, also has great shopping and not far from the hotel. The rides at the top of the towers were scary but lots of fun. Great Hotel with great prices A++++++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill. You don't get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here once before in 2004, I was happy to book again. What a difference this time. Upon walking into the Casino the stench of smoke was overwhelming. The carpets looked and felt as if it had been a very long time since they were cleaned. My first impression was - it wasn't like this last time. We had just arrived in the States after a 10 hour flight from London and had arrived with my son and his girlfriend. They booked there on our recommendation. I hoped that things would look up after check in. WRONG. The line for check in was huge. We waited around 40 minutes whilst the 2 staff on duty worked the check-in desk. We had booked 2 non-smoking room but were immediately told that only smoking rooms were available. We pointd out that both our bookings were confirmed as non-smoking and were told that under no circumstances was that guaranteed. I asked where on their booking wesite this was made clear at the time of booking - see customer services was the response. We argured that as my son and his girlfriend are both on prescription medication for asthma, a smoking room was unsuitable. No change in her attitude. Clearly you DON'T GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR - they had already charged us for the room at the time of booking. Having spent 10 hours on a flight plus the check in time at the airport, plus queuing at immigration and car hire - we just wanted somewhere to rest. We took the rooms - the stench was really strong. The pillows and bedding were saturated with smoke. We went out for some air freshener. We tried to move room the next morning - the staff were not at all interested. We stayed at 8 more hotels this trip and all gave us exactly what we had booked. Customer Services at the Stratosphere clearly don't care. The room was reasonably clean. The view of the car park awful. I would not recommed this hotel to anyone anymore. It has really gone downhill since our last visit. On our return to Vegas at the end of the trip we stayed at the Excalibur where 10 check in staff were on duty and there was a queue of only 2. You DON'T get what you pay for here and they don't care. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stratasphere, WONDERFUL, BEST HOTEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Venus49
Reviews.Content: Stratasphere-LasVegas, NV July 3, 2007 First time Visitor to Vegas: We arrived earlier then planned and could not check into our room, however, the hotel offers a baggage check room with security, so you can leave your baggage there and go exploring while waiting, which is comforting to know. The bellman were gracious and very kind. the hotel is beautiful for the price. There were more expensive hotels that were more upscale, but with the hospitality that we received it was just as if we were in the most expensive hotel there, "Wonderfully unexpected." We stayed in a tower suite, which was very spacious, very clean, and had a spectacular view of the strip and of the Mountains, ooh so beautiful. The staff was very accommodating and the service was excelent, nothing to complain about. The Restauraunt "The Top of the World" we found to be an excellent choice, we had the dinner for two, we arrived around 7:40 to be seated, our reservations were for 7:45 pm, we were seated promptly. The Meal was succulent, the prime rib was perfect as was the rest of the meal. We were able to see the sun set over the Mountains as well as the Strip below us light up, as we viewed the entire city while the restuarant revolve a full 360 degrees during the hour and half that we were enjoying our meal. After our meal we wen to the Show at the Stratasphere titled "Bite" (not recommeded for children, adults only) The show was great for my Husband, as the girls danced around topless, The only regret was that the male preformers in the show did not entertain the women of the audience as well as the men were entertained, with one exception, the lead male singer, not bad looking, and he had a voice that made your heart go pitter patter. Overall Bite was an excellent choice for an after dinner show. My husband and I were so pleasantly suprised after reading some bad reviews, that our suggestion is to try it, and remember, don't believe every thing you read and don't try to go completely as if you were on a shoestring budget, let yourself enjoy your surroundings, You too will be as wonderfully surprised as we were. Stratsphere won our hearts. Hats off to them and to their employees. The only thing sad was that our Camera broke and we were unable to get the photos that we were hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere? No Problem!”
Reviews.Author: Bobadoochi
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I'm an average working man from Jersey who enjoys going away on vacation every year. When I book a vacation I normally choose the "middle of the road" package deal. A clean, comfortable room with a descent view, courteous hotel service and a pool is all I need. This is exactly what I got and then some when my Fiance and I stayed at the Stratosphere for 5 nights back in June. If you want first class? I suggest you pay the extra money and get a suite at the Stratosphere or stay at one of the 5 star hotels further down the strip. Dinner was good at the Courtyard Buffet with a very wide selection of food. No complaint on the quality of the cooking either. I tried the breakfast buffet at Lucky's it's very small but had all the basic breakfast food I enjoy eating. In the casino I played roulette for the first time. The dealers were very friendly and helpful and made me feel real comfortable about being a first timer. If you enjoy celebrity impersonators then go see the American Superstars show, it's very entertaining. If your an Elvis fan? Darren Lee A.K.A. Elvis will knock your socks off. He's the next best thing to being the real deal. Location! Location! Sure it's the last hotel on the north end of the strip , you know that when you book it. Face it, anywhere you go on a vacation there is going to be some degree of walking. You catch the "Deuce" bus right in front of the hotel, it costs $5.00 per person for 24 hours of service. When you want to get off and walk you do so, you get tired and want to cool off? get back on again. The bus will also take you Downtown to the Freemont Street Experience. Would I stay at the Stratosphere again? Absolutely! But, I liked Freemont Street so much I think the next time I vacation in Vegas I want to stay in a hotel Downtown. If you are thinking of booking the Stratosphere, relax your making a good decision. Believe me when I tell you you'll have a nice time. Good Luck! And don't forget to check out the pool. There's plenty of beach chairs and towels and an awesome speaker system that pumps out some good classic rock.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: merlymoo
Reviews.Content: having been to Vegas twice before we knew the stratosphere was located out of the way but chose it for one night to start our trip off purely because it had a car rental company in the building & we could make an easy getaway the next day. For the price we paid - about £30 for 2 queen beds I cant complain, but if you are staying in Vegas for more than a stopover choose a hotel more centrally located (at the end of our trip we stayed at Treasure Island for 3 nights - although the price was significantly different) Stratosphere check in was quick & easy & the room was clean, although a little on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere---Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: KCDoyon
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay at the Stratosphere through Jet Blue vacations for $70. We flew into LAS around 11 pm from Boston, so we were pretty tired and wanted to get settled in as soon as possible. The front desk staff is completely incompetent; we waited in line for about 30 minutes to check in and then the girl who checked us in was more concerned with properly loading paper into a printer than helping us. We had booked a two queen bed nonsmoking room and she told us we had a king bed nonsmoking which wouldn't work for us because we had our 2 children also. She told us all the other rooms were smoking and I told her that was unacceptable. She then checked us into a "handicapped accessible" room on the 9th floor; when we got to the room, it reeked of smoke. The hallways reeked of smoke also. I called the front desk three times to get a room change; was told we were in a nonsmoking room already, which was a lie. After another 40 minutes, we were given a nonsmoking room on a nonsmoking floor. We were also charged a $5 resort fee which we wouldn't use anyway because we were there for one night. Since it took so long to get a new room, they took off the resort fee (Ooooooo!!!). My husband was also ripped off $5 at the vending machine to get one bottle of water. My advice--we just wanted a decent bed to sleep in for one night; the staff is rude and could care less about about their customers; we felt completely ripped off. Don't go to the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “More than good enough”
Reviews.Author: Jarvi
Reviews.Content: First timers to Vegas, wanted an afforadable stay, and the Strat delivered! Friends tried to stray us away stating it was soooo farrrrr away at the end of the strip, rode the Duece all week long, cheap transportation 5.00/day!! There is a Circle-K about 1/2 block away--that was our second home for drinks/munchies! Not far by our standards. First disappointment was we were suppose to have a king bed but wound up only getting 2 queens...no biggie. Staff seemed average, no problems checking-in. Room was cleaned and cleaned throughly daily. Walls...not totally sound proof, however we were lucky relitively quiet nights, only was woken up once. Recommend paying for your room fully upon check-in in order to get away from the $50.00/per day 'incidental charge'. Food was great, the comps were okay we thought, got 3 free buffets and $30.00 between the 2 of us for giftshop spending, seemed fair enough for us. Casino was average, good games, seems fairly loose slots, drinks seemed quite strong to us! good service/coverage by bar staff in our opinion. For the amout of time a person will be spending in theire hotel rooms the Strat is a perfect pick! Definately will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok with the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: EmpireState39
Reviews.Content: You know after reading all the reviews on here when I was planning my trip I almost did not stay here. I am glad I did because it was literally you "get what you paid for". I got my trip off Expedia.com and this was the most reasonable rate for lodging I could find that was on the strip. After I got my baggage from McCarran airport I checked in without any hassle. They gave me two room keys and explained the rules. My room was located in elevator number one section which is actually behind the tower and staircase to the "r" level of shops. I stayed on the sixth floor. As with most casino's you have to walk through the gaming area to get to anywhere. I got into my room and it was clean and had all the basic necessities with an ironing board, iron, TV, a table and two chairs. There was a place to hang clothes which was nice. The decor is sort of strange I have to admit. There is a sort of olive color on the carpets with strange tans mixed in. It was not that big of a deal with me as with other reviewers. Being you are on a budget in the first place you should not complain because there are far worse places to stay. This is not the Bellagio. The staff was helpful and was accomodating if there was a problem. As far as eating the casino has the basic buffet for $7.50 all you can eat breakfast. The dinner was about $14.00. I could not comment on lunch because I was already out most of the time. You have to walk all through to the back of the casino to get there which is kind of a pain. There is a small lounge to the right called "Oasis" showing video's of major concerts and then major league sports on the weekend. I sat in there a couple of nights watching the Eagles and Eric Clapton. In the mornings they have a travel kiosk by "Lucky's" restaurant which is also next to the valet parking. They have a Japanese restaurant and an Italian restaurant called Pellegrini but I never got to eat at either one. There is a Karoke bar which is annoying kind of (most are) but it was really dead in there. On the "R" level is where the entrance to the main tower is. I think it is about 1579 feet tall. I never got up there. The lines were way to much of a wait to pay 8 dollars for and stand around. Because the city is open all the time the nights get crowded, especially for the attractions and restuarant at the top. I cannot say much but there is a $17.00 charge that includes the rides up there. I believe there is a roller coaster and a gravity ride plus a new tettor-totter type ride that is opening soon. At the "R" level there is a bunch of shops. Not major retailers but some interesting shops like those including Chinese gifts, Western wear, a massage machines kiosk, magic shop and rock and roll themed stores. There is a McDonald's, Haagen-Dazs Ice Cream place, sandwich place, pretzel stand, and a Pizza place. If you need internet access there is a gift shop with a couple of PC's there. You can pay $5.00 for 15 minutes. There are also some shops that just sell postcards, bottled soda and water,shot glasses and Las Vegas themed gear. As you know every little thing is to make money. I worked out in the open air weightroom on floor 8 that was a five dollar charge. $12.00 if I wanted three days worth. It is NOT included in the room charge because a separate company owns the gym area and runs it as well. The pool deck was busy so it was distracting a little lifting free-weights. You can go inside to use the treadmills and stair machines and it is air conditioned. My only mistake or oversight was that I did not realize the Stratosphere is located so far to the north of everything. I spent 11-15 dollars in cab rides to either the Bellagio, Venetian, Luxor or back from Ceaser's Palace. I had to hit the ATM in the casino more than once. Most of the action is down south on the strip, where all the major casinos are. One day I actually walked home from the Bellagio and that was a mistake because it is far and my feet were killing me and it get's hot there. The nearest casino to the Stratosphere is the Sahara I think. They are building a mid-sized casino or club the next block south of the Stratosphere on the same side of the street. I think the Hilton is going to be running it. Bring a lot of water because the Las Vegas water supply is nasty tasting, like salt. Bottled water is a big thing in Las Vegas. My advice is to go to Walgreen's and buy a six pack and chill it as you need it with ice from the machine on your floor. Bottled water and soda is in all the stores and Vending machines in most casinos. Bottom line this was not a bad place and just what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “a hell of a walk”
Reviews.Author: singletraveller07
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Las Vegas many times, but this was the first time at the stratosphere. I liked the hotel and the room was really good - huge bed and nicely furnished. The location is the problem - do not try and walk to the strip unless you take an oxygen tank! Neither should you use the strip buses - they are horribly slow - takes about an hour and there is always a mad-scramble for them at the bus stops. The breakfast in the diner was pretty mediocre and the service was generally not very friendly. Also, I previously used the casino at the stratosphere and won lots of money ,but this time I won nothing. They say the machines are really 'loose' but not in my experience!

Reviews.Title: “terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: DerbyCrew
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Stratosphere before (3 times in last year)...but this time (19/07 - 02/08) was the worst yet. Was recently told that the hotel had changed management.......this seemed obvious by the lack of good check in staff. This time round we found them very inneffcient and each one contradicted what the other one said!.....plus we have always paid by travellers cheques and never had a problem ..till now. Got a call one morning to ask for payment! The check in staff 'misplaced' our travellers cheques - they had to view security tapes to see that we actually did pay the amount....they never got back to us to tell us they found them and that everything was OK Room allocation was also a nightmare - beware!! Have always liked the Strat but will seek another hotel next time as the whole place has really gone down hill. Shame on you Strat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kenadie
Reviews.Content: The Stratosphere was a great hotel to stay in Las Vegas. We only paid $50/night. The rooms were clean and big enough for our needs. While walking through the halls one day we even saw them shampooing the carpets in the rooms! Yay! That was a relief to know that they do that. The Valet and Bellmen were very helpful. The only bad thing was we waited at least an hour in line at check-in. The lady that was working there said that the worst times to check in are between 3-6, so we'll be aware of that next time. We had rental car so it wasn't a hassle being at the end of the strip. I will definitly stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very old and dated”
Reviews.Author: TeeJay33
Reviews.Content: We were given the Stratosphere as part of our Multi Centre Honeymoon trip so really had no choice. I definately would not recommend this hotel. As soon as we walked in the old musty smell greeted us. The first room we were given was a basic room with 2 twin beds (not unlike a travelodge). We upgraded at USD 50.00 per night to a casino royale suite which was the best part of my experience at the Strat. The hotel is way off the strip and you will rely heavily on public transport and taxis to get about. The Strat is situated in a very unsavoury area which is apparent by the clientele. We did not feel safe in this casino. The staff at the casino were very unfriendly and the only time they spoke to you was to tell you you were doing something wrong. We will definately visit Vegas again but definately not the Strat. The Top of the World restaurant is worth a visit as the food and views are amazing, but you can book the restaurant and not be a resident. We would definately book elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money does exatly what it says on the label!”
Reviews.Author: delacourt
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas Tour 23-25 July 2007 Stratosphere Hotel 25-27 July 2007 Treasure Island Hotel 27-30 July 2007 Loews Hotel Lake Las Vegas We spent two nights at the Stratosphere hotel. Yes there was a 15 min queue to check in at about 18.30. Yes we were given smoking rooms even though we'd requested non-smoking rooms, but they actually didn't smell smokey and although we were told we could have a non-smoking the following day we declined the offer. The room itself was an average size with two double beds, a small seating area with chairs and table. It was all clean and room service was adequate. We were given two rooms next door to each other. There are two pool areas on 8th and 25th floor. We used the one on the 8th which was quite adequate, though not much sun shade, fine for me but not for fair skinned or people who don't like direct sun. There is also a gym with an outside weights section and some table tennis tables(under some shade). The bar is shaded and this is where you are supposed to smoke though people do still smoke by the loungers. If you ask at the bar for a glass of iced water it is from a gallon bottle and free, if you ask for a bottle of water you are given a small bottle and charged for it. Didn't try the 25th floor as it is free for women but men have to pay $10! Though I guess up there you get more of a breeze. The hotel has plenty of 1cent gambling machines which seem to get few and far between in the 'posher' hotels. The location for many is a down side but we chose the hotel as we wanted to be in 'downtown' vegas. We jumped a cab to Freemont street $8 (for four) evidently there is a bus that goes that way but didn't find out till later. We ate in Roxeys diner not bad food, not bad service beer is cheaper in here than in the bar, unless you are playing on the machines! There is a denny's under a 2 min walk away which does a good breakfast. We didn't go up the tower, we were given vouchers on check in, didn't read them properly, as it is only free to hotel guest between 10.00-14.00. I didn't think it was worth paying $10, when we'd seen it from a helicopter anyway. There are plenty of shops and take away food restaurants A simple, clean, value for money hotel with a nice atmosphere. YES I WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN. YES I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL BUT NOT FOR A ROMANTIC STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed on the strip”
Reviews.Author: TonyandVickyS
Reviews.Content: Desk staff initially put us in a room thet was nothing like the pictures shown on the net. Make sure you are getting what you are paying for. We had to pay extra for an upgrade to a better room. Had asked for a non smoking room, but the whole hotel smelt of smoke. Staff generally curt and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Unless Its a Free Trip Book elsewhere.Ok For the LOW Price”
Reviews.Author: Diana7Michigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 24th till 28 2007 Went for my husbands birthday.As stated check in is slow but not as bad as Circus Circus which the line is 2 blocks long. We booked a room on the 8th floor knowing that the pool is on the eight floor, it was a long long walk to the pool ok for us but not if you cannot walk far. The slots did not give back,free drinks came around pretty often. Luckys restrant had excellant food for the low cost. The Lunch Buffet at Country Buffet was good. The room smelled smokey I do not smoke my husband does. It was clean the best part was the shower plenty of water preasure and the tub was deep if a bath is needed. The maid service was excellant. The AC/Heater worked excellant. It is in a crappy neighborhood but we always rent a car and use valet. The Valet was excellant and fast. I joined the players club they are not giveing away anything. Will not stay here again was just not thrilled about anything. Good place for teenagers. The pool was ok but had a nasty black scum line around it, music was loud,drinks at pool side bar were outragiously priced for hotel guests, and the pool side store for a smal bag of potatoe chips they wanted $4.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more, save on cab and enjoy another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julyincuba
Reviews.Content: Me and husband were in Vegas for 4 days...I wanted to save a little on the Hotel since we were on a tight budget...and keep more money for the shows... So the Stratosphere were about 70$ less a night from others like MGM or TI...BAD decision... 1st its so far from the action you need to take a cab everytime you go out. The traffic is so bad you pay 16$ each way...and it so hot you can't walk really long, trust me we did the first day and were exausted after an hour...we spended a minimum of 30$ a day and sometimes more for cab so...do the calculation...stay closer to the TI or Paris... This is my review of the Stratosphere : Room: like a Holiday Inn (cheap one) ok clean not more... Restaurant : like a snack bar but expensive... Check in : no problem for us...except for the young man at the counter who asked my husband if he wanted to give me access to the room...(after asking me my name wich is different from my husband's because in Quebec we don't change our last name after getting married) let say it wasn't really polite...Hubby didn't appreciate the little tone and told the guy who appologized ... POOL: this was the most discusting thing I ever saw...the size of the pool is nice, the place also on the 8th floor but the water in the pool, oh my god...couldn't go in I was scared of catching cancer or something...weird object floading, brownish color, couldn't see the bottom of it... so I went to have a cold shower close to the pool (wich was nice) and then tryed to relax a little bit...but that was impossible also, music is so loud that the floor is vibrating. The Tower: didn't go..as a guest you can go for free between 10am and 2pm...we were never there between these hour and I didn't want to pay for something I thought was obvious I could do for free as a guest. The Casino : Dirty and lots of weird people... Budget rent a car: we rented a car on the second floor of the hotel at the Budget desk...cheap and the service was really good...It was good to get out of the city for the day. Check out : no problem, did it on the TV wich is nice . Yes they charge that 5$ I don't know what for... So the overall, pay 70$ more a night...you'll save on the cab and you'll get a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st time to Vegas, Stratosphere satisfied me!”
Reviews.Author: MNTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Friends reserved a block of rooms (note this does not mean you will get rooms anywhere near each other) for a friend's wedding @ top of Stratosphere 7/7/07. Was my 1st time in Vegas and what a weekend for 1st impressions! Brides EVERYWHERE. Check-in took about 30 minutes - long line and only about 4 people @ the desk. Check-in was smooth. Told the guy we wanted late check-out and he said just to call that day. We did call that day - they already had it in their systems we requested it (not happy I woke up early just to make that call unnecessarily). They de-programmed our key cards on the last day and we had to go down to get entrace into our room. Inconvenient and sounds like a common problem. They were nice though and helped us quickly. Room was basic but clean. King bed was comforable. View of parking lot sucked but we didn't care. TV had cable channels, clear reception. Maid service was not that great. Boyfriend thought we didn't need maid service our 2nd day so he hung the 'do not disturb' sign out for an hour til I realized it. I took it off. We left the room from noon til 9pm and when we came back the room had not been touched. I didn't call for more towels or anything - we were only there for 2 nights. I understand the hotel was packed and I am sure the maids were insanely busy. I will say that ALL of the staff were incredibly friendly - especially bartenders, cocktail waitresses, and bussers @ the buffet. I really liked that part of Vegas. They want you to be as happy as possible throwing your $ away! The buffet made me sick - went to the Friday night steak and crab leg one. It was good going down but later - ugh! I am not a big gambler but won $60 my 1st day. Played only penny, nickel, quarter slots and video poker. I was a little up and down all weekend - more up though - winnings paid for tips, food, extra things one needs in Vegas ; ) I felt like the $ I put in kept me playing long enough so my losses didn't hurt so bad. The main bar in front of the main escalators was great. The bar with the concert footage and stripper pole had the WEAKEST drinks of anywhere in Vegas I went. Was in the pool for about 10 minutes - not the European one since they charge men who are guests and my boyfriend wouldn't hear of paying $10 to get in. There were lots of kids in the 8th floor pool but seemed well behaved. We did express checkout and was billed appropriately. I would stay here again - but not at $100 a night. Unfortunately due to our partying we never made it to the top for the rides (which I am not sure I could have stomached anyways in the state I was in) nor for the view which is free to hotel guests 10am-2pm. Nor did we see Bite. There were many 'next time's!' No major complaints from our 15+ friends who also stayed there. For kareoke go to Ellis Island off the strip. Won the most $ @ Main Street Casino downtown. We didn't have that much $ to spend, are not hard to please, nor were we seeking luxury - just comfort and extreme fun. All in all the Stratosphere suited us just fine and we had a blast our 1st time in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Never come back”
Reviews.Author: Ronald_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: This year we want to experience a hotel at the other side from the Strip (we stayed in Luxor, MGM, Mandalay Bay) because it might be some more quiet. Checking in seems the be a very complicated action. I really don't know what kind of mysterious actions should be performed when people want to check in. Anyway it took a terrible amount of time. Of course you can't compare Stratosphere with Mandalay Bay but we didn't expect such a small room. Even a motel 6 room is bigger! The swimmingpool has a great location (6th or 8th floor) but it became a big disappointment. I really don't understand what's the company policy is to play the music so loud that it makes one sick. Is this a swimmingpool or a discotheque? Should quests as short as possible and swimm with earplugs? The night became also a nightmare. Although we stayed on the 23th floor the noise of a stupid train which crossed a road every 30 minutes was very clear. It seems to be a law in the States that trains crossing a road must claxon. This is a very irritating sounds which makes it very hard to sleep. The next day we would swop rooms to the other side of the building (Strip side) assuming that we could avoid he trainnoise. The frontdesk asked us to return at noon and placed us on the holdlist. So we did, but at noon no room available. We're asked to return later on the afternood. We did some shopping and returned at 6 PM and got our roomkeys for the 12th floor. This rooms was exact on the same side of the building with the small angle to the Stripside. This wouldn't solve the problem. In fact the problems increases because we were very close to big very noisy aircomachines places on the top of the roof. Again we've returned to the frontdesk and complained about this silly solution. They appoliged but couldn't do anything because the hotel was fully booked. So we decided to leave immidiately and check-out. But the nightmare wasn't still over. The frontdesk would charge us 20 USD for a late checkout! That wasn't our fault, if it was clear in the morning that we should get this room we should check-out at that time, but we didn't know because we're on the holdlist. After protesting the supervisor decided to skip the extra charges and we leave the building for ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spicy143
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel July 11-15th. We got a room in the Preimer Tower and it was really clean and nice. The pool on the 8th floor was nice as well. The hotel staff was realy friendly and we only waited about 15 minutes to check into the hotel. The restaurants are affordable and the serve decent food. I would recommend this hotel for those that are on a budget but want a nice good clean hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: gponto18
Reviews.Content: Below is a list of why I will never stay here again: 1. Rude Concierge - I had to wait in a 30 minute long line that extended into the main casino to check in. When I asked the Concierge about the line she said, "Thats how it is at every hotel in Vegas. If you want to Check-In I suggest you stand in line." 2. Resort Fee?!?! - You have to pay a $20 "Resort Fee" at Check-In that they mention no where when you book the room. They basically wait till you've booked and paid for the room and slam it down your throat after you've already committed. 3. Misrepresentation/False Advertising - I booked the Stratosphere specifically because they advertised how impressive and huge their sportsbook was. When I arrived I found a 12 seat racebook with 9, count them, 9 seats reserved for VIPs. 4. No Room Safe - Vegas can be a dangerous place to carry cash and, until now, I have never had a room without a safe. Upon request I was told that some rooms have room safes and some do not. After requesting one, I was told they don't offer them. 5. Nickeled and Dimed - My wife is not a morning person, so I went down to their cafe to place a to-go order. They wanted to charge me a $1/item fee for my to-go order. Also, at all the betting locations, they require you to make minimum bets (of $20) to recieve free drink orders. 6. Unaccomidating Service - At night I requested two extra pillows, one for me and one for my wife. They informed me that their policy is one pillow per room per night. They suggested that I call back the next night for the second pillow!?!?!? 7. Solicitation - You can't even enter or exit this place without getting solicited by timeshare salesmen. I didn't plan a vacation to have to beat salesmen off with a stick. People were literally having to run from the timeshare peddlers on the second floor near the shops. Conclusion - The Stratosphere was a nightmarish experience. I will never stay there again. Note: I stand by this review. If you wish to contact me directly email me at gponto18@gmail.com. The Stratosphere absolutely ruined my vacation and I would not wish my experience on anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: helenearth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The rooftop pool, gym and Jakuzzi is a must see. I didn't go on the rides at the top of the towers as the entry fee was a little steep and was not offered any discount even though I was a guest at the hotel. I didn't particulary rate the casino. I really enjoying playing Poker and found The Excalibur to have the best choice for gambling. The only real donside to this hotel is the location. It's about an hour and fourty mins walk to the other end of the strip where you'll find, The Luxor, The Excalibur ect. The Stratosphere is located in the rough and quite empty end of the strip. I found it to be too far from the places you would want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Strat- Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: KarenOK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Stratosphere on July 16-20th. We booked the room through a package deal from Worry-Free Vacations. Our original package included a room in the World Tower, but we were upgraded to a spa king room in the Premeir Tower. We contacted the Strat prior to traveling and let them know that we were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and asked if we could have an upgrade. Upon arrival we had the new upgrade as promised. The check-in line took about 10 minutes and moved rather quickly. We checked in on a Monday around 6:30 p.m. We have stayed at more expensive hotels in the past, but you truly get what you pay for here. Keeping that in mind, I think the Strat is a great place for those who are on a budget. We chose to stay here so we could spend our money in better places. For example, we saw two shows, "Spamalot" and "KA"-by Cirque du Soleil. These were great and come highly recommended. We also tried the Dan Marino's Steakhouse at Hooters. It was the best steak we have ever eaten. It is a must try place! Location seems to be a discouragement for most people. However, my husband and I rented a car from Dollar Rent A Car. If you are staying at the Strat, you should consider renting a car. You can get deals as cheap as $25 a day. There is always space in the parking garage or you can do free valet parking from the hotel. The hotel was clean and our room was taken care of daily by very efficient maids. The bed was comfortable and we slept really well while in this hotel. On occassion, you might hear the person next to you, but overall a somewhat quiet place. We ate at Roxy's the first night. You must try this 50's style restaurant. Great food and atmosphere for sure. We also ate at the Courtyard Buffet. It had a wide range of food options. I would have to say it was ok, but not great. You will have to pay a $5 a day resort fee. However, this includes access to the tower daily, laundry services, and pool access. We didn't take full advantage of all of these, but we highly recommend the Tower! Finally, I believe the Stratosphere is a good choice for those who don't mind being down the Strip away from the main action. We enjoyed our stay. You get what you pay for so keep that in mind. If we are in Vegas again, we will definitely consider staying at the Strat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: RandyT56
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a combined business/pleasure trip. Good value, average service. Rooms were clean, adequate. My only negative experience came when I tried to use their wifi to do some work. Although they advertised it, I could not get a sufficient signal to make a connection. When I called the desk, the concierge said something about the rooms on even-numbered (or odd-numbered - I forget which) had bad service (my floor). He put me in touch with their vendor (I guess he felt it wasn't the hotel's problem). The tech services guy had me open the door to the room, take my laptop into the hallway- and it worked!! Great!!!!!! All I have to do is get the hotel to move my desk into the hallway, and give me a long extension cord and someone to direct traffic around me!! I wound up using dial-up..... needless to say, I won't go there again on business. If you're there for pleasure, I think it's adequate... it's just that thing about refusing to take ownership for certain problems that bugs me...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for the price”
Reviews.Author: Brettyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel can not be faulted. Anyone who says anything against it has too high expectations for a cheap hotel. The room was beautiful, the service excellent and the location was great too, everything on the strip is within walking distance. The rides are brilliant, the tower has an amazing view. I cannot write highly enough of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “7-7-07 loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: HOLLI311
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay!! It was a big day for us OUR WEDDING!! We arrived at the Stratosphere on July 5th and from the time we got there to the time we left EVERYBODY there was so accommodating. The bellman greeted us with a great smile and helped us to check in and to our room. We got selected to be one of the featured couples for wedding 7-7-07 and was on Fox News Vegas and Splash TV. I had the ceremony on the indoor top deck and then again on the INSANITY ride for the news broadcast.THE RIDE REALLY was INSANE. We LOVED IT!!The manager and wedding coordinator was so great and so nice. The beds was comfortable and the maids did a excellent job. I will return next year for our 1st year Anniversary and I will stay here again. Thanks again to the Stratosphere for such a great and wonderful beginning for a wonderful life start for my husband and I...

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option on the strip”
Reviews.Author: yazzman13
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried from reading some of the reviews on here but it turns out the Strat is a perfectly good base to use for your Vegas trip. I managed to wangle a double room for $38 a night Mon-Thurs from their website by booking in advance. This is rediculously cheap for what you get. I would say the hotel is probably a 3 star european wise. You do get a mix of middle america here with a few odd balls who doubt were taken by the price. Unlikely Paris Hilton will be staying anytime in the future Casino is O.K. if a little characterless. Some low limits on the blackjack. Buffet is reasonable if nothing more and the rest of the eateries are O.K Shopping concourse is a bit on the tacky side...but hey 38$ people!!! Rooms were very clean, nice bathroom and we had a great view of the mountains. Rooftop pool are was surprisngly good with basketball, ping pong , towels, bar etc. The one and only drawback that I can see is that you are at the very end of the strip. Forget about walking it is way too far. The Deuce bus which in principal is a good idea..takes forever to go down the strip (stops +traffic) and you really don't want to be waiting in the heat in the middle of July for a bus...we ended up gettting taxis whcih never cost more then about 10$ which go the parallell roads. We ended up spending most of the evenings in the other amazing hotels on the strip which are nicer but much more expensive. Circqu de Soleils Love is awesome and worth checking if yu can get a ticket. The area outside the Hotel isn't the classiest in the world but it isn't too bad. It short I would recommend this for those in search of a bargain. If you want a really fancy hotel in the middle of the action stay at the Bellagio or Caesar's Palace and take out a loan with your bank manager.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel option for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Goldspink
Reviews.Content: As most places on the Strip are charging top prices for their accommodation, the Stratosphere gives you a good budget option. The rooms are pretty much standard but had nicer furniture than like minded places. The location of the hotel, be warned, is not actually on the Strip, but a 15 minute walk from the Mirage. The staff weren't very friendly, but as it's only a 5 minute relationship you'll have it's not something to spoil your opinion. The free laundry machines were a good extra, and the pool area was also quite nice. I stayed here, but didn't gamble, as I felt that should be done in one of the more established places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Stratosphere - Don't believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: VancouvertoVegas
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews before I stayed at the Stratosphere, I thought it only fair to add a little balance. Also, bear in mind that usually it's only people that had a bad experience that write reviews. There are hundreds of people that stay at this hotel every day, who probably had a wonderful time that don't say anything. Any way, my wife and I had just that! We had a great time staying at this hotel. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. We cheched in at 7:30pm and there was no line. Got a great room with a view of the strip at no extra cost. Room was clean. Express check out just drop your keys and go! The casino atmosphere is much more relaxed and easy going than at the other strip hotels. Unlimited access to the tower is included, so it's great place to sit and have your morning coffee while enjoying the best view in Vegas. The pool isn't over crowded, plus the bartender at the poolside bar is frickin' hilarious! Had breakfast at the Courtyard Buffet which was really nice. Sure it's on the north end of the strip, which kind of sucks. But here's my number one Vegas tip: rent a car! It's so fast getting around if you just drive on one of the roads parallel to the strip. We left the Strat. at 8pm and made it to Paris for an 8:20pm dinner reservation, and that includes parking and walking from the lot to the restaurant. Plus there's the satisfaction of cruising up the strip in your air-conditioned car while everyone else is sweating there [--] off on the sidewalk! All in all we had a great stay and would definitely come back to this hotel! And I'm not easy to please. If I had a bad experience i would definitely mention it.

Reviews.Title: “So-so, but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: I got a clean, mini-suite room with a king-sized bed for $45. That kind of says it all. If you are just looking for a clean room on The Strip (albeit, at the farthest northern end, and halfway to downtown), The Strat is tough to beat. If a bargain is what you're after, you have a car or are willing to take the bus, and if you don't mind putting up with some annoyances, book your room. First, the good stuff: Wait, I just said it all above. To expand, the room was impeccable, and very quiet. They also gave me a "fun book" for my $5 "resort fee" that included a ride to the top, which is the tallest structure west of the Mississippi. Now, the bad stuff: I didn't get in until about Midnight on a Sunday night, and was exhausted, and wanted nothing more than a shower and a bed. Instead, I was greeted by a line for check-in that weaved through all the "maze," and extended out into the casino. I signed and got in line, which moved at a sloth-like pace. At least one guest thought it would be helpful to start yelling at the clerks, which only soured the atmosphere in the stratosphere even more. To be fair, two of the clerks were really struggling with a really obnoxious couple who had enough paper to indicate they were buying the place, and took up about 30 minutes of time. Though the room was clean and offered a nice view, there was a cigarette burn in the comforter, and one of the light bulbs was burned out. The most bizarre thing about the room - I kid you not - was the toilet seat. I don't know if they only ever put women in this room or what, but there was no way that toilet seat would stay up short of duct tape or a piece of rope. And it didn't seem that the toilet seat was broken; rather, it seemed that the toilet water tank juts out too far to allow the seat to stay upright. I would love to have seen the face of the guy that decided to buy these toilets, especially if every room has the same problem. Finally, the buffet is crummy. Even with the $2 guest discount for a lunch buffet, you're better off going elsewhere. Think wilted salad greens and frozen pizza and you get the idea. That is about exactly what I had. Having said all that, The Strat is about the best deal you're ever going to get on The Strip. If you don't have your heart set on staying on The Strip, I'd suggest staying Downtown, which I find a much more satisfying experience overall, and for the same price. (See my review of The Four Queens). Also, keep in mind that walking The Strip from The Strat just isn't an option, given its location. Hey, what do you expect for such a bargain rate? At this price, lower your expectations and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One Big Hassle!!!”
Reviews.Author: problemtravler
Reviews.Content: As A ultimate rewards card holder "HIGH ROLLER" I understood we would have a nice room. As upgraded rooms are a perk in being a high roller. My friend came with me and I had made a quick trip back because of the free rooms and other offers. Prior to arrival I told my friend that the Stratosphere was a great place to stay! We were sent to a room in world tower ll and as we approached the room walking down the hall I could smell very rank garbage...that was not what I expected to incounter.A clear bag of old garbage beside my room door. With discuss I called to have it cleaned up. The room was a lot smaller and older than the first time I stayed at the hotel. So being a high roller was turning into a low class situation..hm......Management was great at trying to solve our problems. Nobody ever knew what was going on and the people at the rewards desk never knew what was going on ....not much knowledge of the rewards rules....We became so stressed out at one point my friend said lets just forget this and enjoy the trip..I encouraged her that she would be mailed out offers so gamble and make the points. As I did......I paid more for my room than everyone else that I asked...The hotel said thats because I booked with them not online... Big Deal when I booked I asked if I would receive the online rates and was told yes.. More problems...The tub and sink in the room would not drain properly as I had to shower in the soap scum from my friend ..yuck...A friendly asst manager did move us to a different room . This helped improve my stay.It was still a regular room too. I checked my Mastercard and found out the hotel charged 390.00 for my room .I had a free 3 nights stay ..Had to make another trip to the desk to straighten it all out..On our last day we had a late check out. We came back from shopping and the room keys would NOT work but lucky our luggage was still in the room... More hassle.My personal belief about the rewards cards is they controll your win I'm probably wrong but when I played without it I won. The first night I put 7 hundred dollars in a multi keno machine and won nothing. The rewards centre was totaly aware that I spent a lot of money yet I had not many points adding up on the card..They also said that they have no reason as to how the points add up on different games ..it was just whatever. I stayed in the hotel in April May and June wanting to become a regular customer. But now that I came home my offer is the same offer that everyone else gets. Nothing special... Maybe I will go to Circus Circus nest visit as the stratosphere only gives the special once...as in my case...Truly I was insulted to read the offer to be lower rates and 2 for 1 show tickets. big deal how many time can a person go to see Bite and American Superstars. This time I never even received a room or meals...Its all a gimic in my mind. But at the same time it only leaves a bad taste and makes a person wiser about free stuff... If it sounds to good to be true it is. I have recomended this hotel to many people and the rewards. In the future I'll probably say all the hotels are the same....They just want your money. Even if you get free stuff in the end you will pay the price...It just sucks when you get bad service and pay the price....Not a satisified customer.......

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Blackpool”
Reviews.Author: Dadamama
Reviews.Content: We left our house on the Thursday at 11-00 am, to catch a bus from Nottingham to Gatwick. This had broken down so we were running late when the replacement arrived. Got to the Hilton hotel at Gatwick for about 17-30. After booking in went to the Virgin twilight booking in, and had a couple of drinks in the terminal bars. Got back to the hotel and went for an evening meal, was charged £5-45 for a bottle of water, not amused. Next day went early to our boarding gate, even though we had in theory no need to, but due to increased security was advised to get there early. Should have flown at 11-30, but when we were all boarded advised that the pilot had gone sick so we had to wait for his replacement. This took 2 hours, then a 10-00 hour flight, then queing at the American airport for 2 hours for security checks. It really tested my tollerance. The Stratosphere is the cheap end of the hotels, but it is perfectly adequate. The only problem is that it is at the bottom of the strip, and took a good 25 minuites to walk to the next hotel on the strip, and with temperatures at 110 degrees, no thanks. Las vegas is really a place for stag, and hen parties, it is an eye opener, and one i am glad we have done. Especially the helicopter flight over, and in to the Grand canyon. But never again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere is not bad...”
Reviews.Author: Den-Bean
Reviews.Content: It is off the beaten path...neighborhood caused no problems...lot of pedestrians about, and at no time did my wife and I feel uncomfortable. Restaurants were fine...Gambling/casino all good. Had no problems...check in and check out is busy, cannot get into room prior to check-in time. Did get too drunk and couldn't find our room, called security on house phone and they helped us out...unadvertised topless pool also. Great price so would possbily stay again, tho we walked waaay too much. Trolley was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarahjb1229
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great. Location wasn't ideal but we had so much to do inside the hotel that we didn't have to go far to do anything. The tower was amazing, the 50's restaurant was fabulous and you can't beat the roller coasters on top of the tower! If you're afraid of heights, then the tower is not for you. I also got a free upgrade to a suite because they had no King beds available when I checked in for the first night. The second night I had a king suite!

Reviews.Title: “Some Good Some Not”
Reviews.Author: jimcr51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights. Check in took forever, Let alone getting to the check-in counter and then dragging our bags again across the casino to the elevators. The rest of the time went really well. More people helping at the check in would make it great.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: yamashitala
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through a package with Northwest Airlines. It was just okay for me however. We did get a good rate for the 3 nights we were staying there & our airfare combined. However the room was small, and the bathroom was smaller. For some reason the tub was very deep & I almost slipped & killed myself getting in/out. The room was in the World Tower II. It seemed like a regular motel room not some "Vegas Resort" as they would have you believe from the website. The staff was not "overly" friendly but the gambling was decent. However we did eat at Roxy's Diner inside the Stratosphere one night & the service there was great & we wound up having a good time. I would probably not stay here again unless it was for free or I had to for some reason unknown to me. I am not harsh usually on hotels but for Vegas I was expecting a little more.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has gone done hill”
Reviews.Author: LC76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas 4 times a year. We stayed at the Strat in Sept. of 2005 and we considered it average. We stayed again this past weekend and it was terrible. We were in town for the concerts at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino. The neighborhood is VERY dangerous at night. We stayed in a suite 6/21-6/24 and it was very worn. We had to call the front desk in the evening because we had a "special smell" coming from a room on our floor. Not a classy hotel at all. When we left I asked my husband if he would stay there for free and he said they would have to give him money to stay there, You don't even get what you pay for! We love The Orleans, Monte Carlo, TI, Bellagio, and Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Restuarant at the top of the Tower”
Reviews.Author: lillibell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Stratosphere. Its a comfortable hotel, the rooms were booked by our tour operator so only standard but for the average UK residence who expect less than the americans it was fine - in fact we were hardly ever in it!!!!!!!!!!! The hotel is a little out of the way from the larger hotels on the strip, but its only a £8 ride by taxi to downtown freemont street and a little more to the retail outlet nearby. The bonus are the views from the Tower both day and night, if your dining you do not have to pay to go up and have your own elevator. Try to book for sunset we ate there on June 16th and the sun was setting at 7.50 ish - so we had the best of both worlds, also the helicopters are coming past for night flights so you can get excellent pics. The meal was average but the price $190 for two included a bottle of wine and stunning views there is another lounge with great views where you can spend the rest of the evening plus an outside viewing platform. I have included on photo but it cannot do this sightseeing platform justice. Also don't try the Trolley bus, they are supplosed to run every 30 minutes we waited 1.5 hours frightended to leave the stop as we thought the bus would sail past as we left. The driver was funny but picked on people and was a bit personnel in some cases, we stuck to the monorail after this and it was excellent and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money for hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrip_Posse
Reviews.Content: We've just had 2 short stays in Stratosphere at either end of a 2 week California / Nevada roadtrip and stayed there about 5 years ago too. Budget dictated where we stayed 5 years ago and we saw no reason to search for another hotel for this trip. Consistently excellent value for money, we paid around £40 per night for a modern, spacious, clean comfortable room with 2 kingsize beds and generous bathroom. We had a "view" of the multistory carpark on our first stop but a better view towards Palace Station and the mountains on our second stop. The pool area is clean, modern and very private as its on the 8th floor (the pools are in extremely communal areas in some of the strip hotels). We waited 10 minutes or so at check in. The rest of the strip is easily accessible via the Monorail at Sahara (5 minutes walk) or both public transport and the tourist "trolley bus" leave from right outside the hotel. Lucky's Cafe on the casino floor serves great varied food at all hours. You get free tickets to go up the Tower where the view beats anything else in Vegas. In summary this hotel is perfect if you want to be on the strip without paying over the odds.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: ARDavid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Stratosphere for two nights in June 2007. The check in process was an ordeal. To get to the check in line we had to walk a long distance with our bags across an enormous casino located within the hotel, and then stand in line for literally 30 minutes to register! Quite an ordeal after spending the day traveling. And you don't check in at the registration desk, but at a separate check in desk in a different area, which makes no sense to me. Our room was very clean. One light bulb was burned out, and the window air conditioner was noisy when it cycled on and off. My wife pulled down the bedspread, and inadvertently touched the headboard. At that point, the headboard fell out of the wall to which it was attached with unanchored large screws. The bed was uncomfortable- the springs were too close to the surface. The pillow was uncomfortable- was made of foam rubber. They charged $1 each for local calls. The TV and iron worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with a high tower and high standards!”
Reviews.Author: orchidrose
Reviews.Content: This was our introduction into a 1000+ roomed hotel and we were not disappointed. The price was excellent value for money. The hotel room was roomy, clean, tidy and more than adequate. Check-in fast and effortless and check-out was the same. They have a good sized pool and a spa tub. Even though it was extremely busy in the pool, there was still room for all. It was really nice to sit in the hot tub with an ice cool bottle of tub conversing with people from around the world. Within the hotel they have a good selection of shops to suit everyone’s taste and enough eateries to suit everyone’s taste buds. We were impressed with the hotel efforts to help the environment with signs in the hotel room stating: “Please leave this card on the bed if you do not need the sheets changing and leave the towels on the floor if you wish them to be replaced”. It’s unnecessary to have the sheets changed everyday so we thought this was good. However, we were less than impressed we the hotel did not follow up on this and changed the sheets and towels anyway. The viva Las Vegas show was good and free! The view from the tower was outstanding day or night. All in all we had no problems with this hotel. We would book again however; on our return to Vegas this year we are going to try another hotel. Variety is the spice of life. Tip: For travelers from the UK. Don't buy attractions from the UK, use the desk in this hotel. Our flight over the canyon was far cheaper with booking with the hotel than if we bought it before in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Relley
Reviews.Content: This was my first and last stay at the Stratosphere. When we arrived in our first room we noticed the trash cans were never empty and the toilets were not cleaned. Let us just say stuff was floating inside. We called the front desk to report this and they decided to move us to a cleaner room. We are now in our second room. We had requested a roll-away and after waiting patiently for a half hour we called down to see what was taking so long to which they said they don't deliver them to the room we were in. No one bothered to tell us. I was steaming at that point so I called the front desk and asked to speak to a manager. After speaking with her we were moved to a third room. What did they offer for our troubles? A breakfast buffet not to exceed $40.00. For three people?? Mind you this is happening at 11:00 at night. We're tired. Finally we reach a decent room our bellhop called down to request again our roll-away and even waited till it arrived. Things were starting to look up but no, when turning on the faucet the water smelled so bad I had to buy bottled water to brush my teeth, house keeping refused to give towels when we saw them in the hall unless we called down to house keeping first for them first and when they did clean our room they did it half way. Beds were short sheeted, there were three women staying in one room and they would leave ONE set of towels. They only good thing was the bell desk. They were prompt and courteous. I will NEVER EVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the rate”
Reviews.Author: bayarea123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite which was roomy and clean. The bathroom was nice with marble floor and a whirlpool tub. The beds were okay - comfy enough but nothing great. The pool was also okay. If you're staying here, avoid the 8th floor. People have to walk down the hall all the way to the end to reach the pool. Also, the surrounding area is a bit sketchy so I suggest driving around (vs. walking around). We also had the buffet here which was okay. Nothing to write home and decent overall. Overall, the rate we got was decent for the room we got. So not a bad place to stay but not necessarily my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Trek13
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Stratosphere because of the price/value ratio. This time, I upgraded to a Tower Suite and was pleasantly surprised by the extra room and layout (you can check the hotel website for floorplan/pix). The pool was frigid, however, which was unexpected in June. Being only 4-ft. deep, I suppose they think the desert sun is enough to warm it up. They need to work on that. The suite was on a non-smoking floor, but nevertheless smelled of a cigar (cigarette stench would have been preferable). Rulebreakers make life hard, I suppose. Check-in was less than speedy, with a 35-minute wait, loads of cranky mid-westerners, and pushy Californians (myself included). Too few desk clerks and too-long sales pitches for upgrades made the wait a problem. Lucky's Cafe is a good diner-style place for grub. Their dollar sized pancakes are normal sized, and their regular ones are huge. Fellini's Italian restaurant is quaintly decorated with murals, dim lighting, and the usual white tablecloth. The food is well-served, pushing the pricier envelope and they have an okay wine-list with some good California wines to accompany your meal. If you're an Ultimate Rewards member, you might be disappointed that some of your comps are the almost the same (if not identical) to coupon deals you can get in any casino magazine. That's a major bummer. Otherwise, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS WENT CRAZY ON ME WITH NO COMPENSATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MamaMia916
Reviews.Content: This hotel has BED BUGS!!! Its been awhile since, but I need to let other people know that I was a victim of serious bed bugs. As a result of these bed bug bites, I was miserable for almost 3 weeks with serious itching and swollen red welts which was the most miserable time of my life. And what did the hotel do to mitigate this? I got a lousy buffet ticket to eat dinner and a change of room (2 doors from the bed bug room). We also have pictures of the bites on my legs, arms, face, back, and feet. Imagine you have hundreds of bites on your body and all I got was a dinner.. Do you think that the hotel did their share in compensating me?? I have not started the lawsuit yet and probably decided not to since I am not a sue happy person. Another thing is that one of the security officers asked if I ate one too. Do you think that that was appropriate thing to say to their hotel guests? I did not laugh....Any comments or requests for pictures, let me know. What a birthday party I had!! MY

Reviews.Title: “okay stay but won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: mjjmr
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a suite when we check in. The room was very large and mostly clean, very pretty. The bathroom was very nice, marble and bright. The problem with the room was the bed and the stand up shower. The bed was very old and hard, we could feel each spring coil and the body impressions of everyone who had ever slep in the room. The stand up shower was very lovely, except for the mold that covered the walls. No water pressure was found in this shower. After the first night in the bed I called housekeeping and asked if they had a foam mat for the bed. They said no but they sugested adding another blanket under the matress pad. They delivered the blanket in less than 5 min. It did help a little. The air conditioner worked well but made the louded noises, it would wake me up. We were on the 12th floor and had a strip and pool view that was nice. We ate at the courtyard buffet. Food was ok, nothing to exciting and paid 13 dollars a person for breakfeast. The meals were the same each day for each meal so this got really sickening. The slots were tight and the tables were good only to the dealer, we lost our money in no time and did not play long enough to enjoy it. We had better luck at other casinos. The players club was a disapointment to me, after almost 1,500 dollars and 3,000 points we did not get any comps. This gave us a coffee cup and tee shirt which the larges size was a XL. The texas hold em tables were ok, but we did not win. Lots of very serious texas hold em players that must play every day of their life. I was very surprised by the amount of children brought by their families to this casino and to vegas in general. This included babies to pre teen having nothing to do. So all in all the hotel was ok, nothing special, our luck was bad, but we won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “didn't honor our online booking, kicked us out at 2:00 am.was charged for 2 bbkin”
Reviews.Author: mamasme
Reviews.Content: We were assured our litle dog was welcomed. Checked in with him in my arms. Was charged for 2 rooms.Not refunded ! Went to eat and gamble ,in same hotel .Return ,and we're locked out of our room . Have to get security to let us in ,and they tell me I have to find another place for my service dog, or move to another lodging. Found another place down town no problem . DON'T TRUST HOTEL.COM !!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: sejece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere May 21-May 24th. We were trying to save money on the hotel to have more money to spend elsewhere. Check in line was very long, we waited for 45 minutes. This was annoying as they had 3 people checking people out and only 1 checking people in. We were offered a room upgrade for $15 in order to get a room that was immediately available. Should not have taken the offer. Zero view and the air conditioner would not go down at all past 69 degrees. Hot water was another big issue. There was no hot water for a shower for the first 10 minutes and then all the sudden it is scalding. I definitely felt ripped off and should have gone down to complain but by the end we had it with the hotel and just wanted to leave. We bought monorail tickets but found we should've spent $40 and got the unlimited pass. It was definitely a convenient way to travel. It was a block or two to the Sahara to get on the monorail which doesn't seem like much but by the end of our stay we were tired of it. The area the hotel is in isn't the nicest but there were always enough people around at night I never worried about it. Fellini's at the hotel was very good food. Roxy's was alright but way overpriced for the food. We did enjoy the casino here. As others have said the resort fee is ridiculous and the only benefit is the pass to the tower. It would be nicer if this pass allowed night entry as well. We saw the Bite show. Not worth the money in our opinion. The one thing that was nice is there were no pushy show/timeshare people here. We ran into them at almost all the other hotels and they were incredibly annoying and wouldn't leave you alone after you said no. Overall I guess you get what you paid for. Next time we'd pay more to stay somewhere else and save the money we spent on the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: downey713
Reviews.Content: This place was the worst place I could have stayed during my first trip to Las Vegas. I had no idea how far up the strip it was! The room was dull. The pool are is below the other hotel pools on the strip. The service sucked. The area is creepy. It was just not a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bamaakt
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the reviews on this site, I was a little nervous about staying at the Strat. Every fear I had was unjustified.
