We arrived around 1:30 am (4:30 am our time) -- we were tired and very cranky. There was no line for check in and the people were wonderful. We had requested a king, smoking room and we told all they had were king, non smoking but they could move us the next day. We called down the next day and were moved. We stayed in the Premier Tower and our room was basic, but clean. It did not have the glitz and glamour of other hotels, but was well worth the money we paid. The bathroom was very large and the bed was comfortable. Plus, we had a great view of the strip. The hotel is at the top end of the strip, but it is still not too far from any of the other hotels. We actually took cabs the first few days we were there and had a rental car for the last half. The valet is the fastest around. We ate the buffet a couple of times and even had our meal comped twice. The food was great for a buffet and always had a great selection. Plus, the food was hot and fresh. I also recommend seeing one of thier shows -- American Superstars. Very entertaining. I was hesitant at first, but 5 minutes in I was glad I went. The view from the top of the tower is like no other. The pictures we took were breath taking. I also HIGHLY recommend renting a car for a portion of your trip and discovering the areas around Vegas. Red Rock Canyon was beautiful -- we went there first. Vally of Fire was even more amazing. Simply amazing. Also, Hoover Dam and Lake Mead are musts. I will say I was disappointed in the Hoover Dam tour -- years ago when I went on the tour they let you go to the bottom on the Dam and take pictures. Breathtaking to say the least. This part of the tour is now gone due to 911. I have to say I don't understand the reasoning behind this. They still take you down 500+ feet and you can view the generators which create power for 100 million people. Plus, you go through a security station on the drive in and then go through security screening before going on the tour -- If you are going to do something stupid I would hope they would have caught it by then. Needless to say, I was disappointed. But, the drive out there is still worth the quick trip. Overall, we will being going back to Vegas within the year and I will be staying at the Strat. I can compare this to Green Valley Ranch where I stayed just a month ago on a business trip. While GVR was top notch and very nice, I just can't justify the cost difference if I am footing the bill. You will get all you want out of your Vegas experience staying the Strat -- Oh, the time share people are BAD everywhere. We were hounded everywhere we went - even at the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: vacationista78
Reviews.Content: We spent Sat & Sun night at the Stratosphere over Memorial weekend. (To save money we stayed 2 nights there and 2 nights at Mandalay Bay. We got the best of both worlds.) Check in was very smooth. We arrived around 10am and had no problems checking in early. The room as very clean - standard room w/ a king sized bed. The bathroom was recently renovated. The pool was clean and standard; nothing fancy like a waterfall or anything else. The Stratosphere is located on the strip but away from all the other attraction sites like the Venetian or Bellagio. However, you can catch the Duece (bus) for $2 ea way or $5 for 24hr pass right in front of the hotel, bus comes every 5min. I will say, the bus gets crowded and not recommended if you are in a hurry, otherwise it's the best way to get around. You can also choose to travel by monorail located about 1 block inside the Sahara but that's more expensive and stops are not as convinient. I read some reviews stating the area were the Stratosphere is located is considered questionable. Listen for the price you are paying its not so bad. Anyhow, you won't be walking around there since there's nothing really to see there. FYI don't bother to go to Fremont Street. Its a real waste of your time, instead spend it somewhere on the strip. Oh and one more tip - beware of people trying to sucker you into a timeshare presentation in exchange for tickets, money, meals etc. NOT WORTH YOUR TIME.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel for the $”
Reviews.Author: VVaive
Reviews.Content: For Valentines Day, I booked a plane, the Stratosphere Hotel and the Cirque Du Soleil show "Beetles Love" for Memorial Day weekend as a surprise for my husband. I picked this hotel because it was $500.00 cheaper than being on the strip and I figured we could have more fun with the money than spending it on a room. I started to check trip advisor just before we left, and I have to admit I was pretty scared of the reviews I read. But my husband kept triing to make me feel better and said everything would be ok. After all the worrying, when we got there, he was right!! It was a very nice hotel, clean, the food was good, we went to the top and looked around the city, and Friday we spent 5 hours by the pool. It was not crowed at all, unlike when we stayed in Vegas before at Treasure Island and could not even get a chair. The staff was friendly, and we even had better luck here on the slots than anywhere else including Fremont Street. They have a new bus system that runs 24-7 and is $5.00 a day which will take you anywhere on the strip or to old town. Or you can go across the street and catch the new monorail which was $9.00 one way, but is faster and only has 10 stops. We had a wonderful time in Vegas and the show is simply something everyone must see. It is incredible and well worth it. It is about 90 minutes non-stop entraining fun! We took the Hoover Dam express tour too, which was $70.00 for both of us and 4 hours (becasue of all the stops and 90 minutes at the dam) but once again well worth it, and our driver was very educated and well informed. He would tell you all about Vegas history, the casinos, and even where the best places to eat. He talked about the men that built the dam and showed us where they lived, ate and that they only made 50 cents an hour. It was awsume to see the mountains and read all about the history when we got there, and we left early enough in the day, so we were still back before 1:00 to enjoy other things. Don't be scared off by other bad reviews like I was, or the fact that this hotel is so far away from the strip. We loved the location, and the fact that it was great for the price! Why give someone else $500.00 more of you're money??

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_Sue
Reviews.Content: There are too many choices in Vegas to waste your money on the Stratosphere. Their website crashed once I put credit card in. I phoned, they then said their system locked up & call back later. Called back and was cut off. So went directly to hotel when arrived - massive line up barely moving - and 3 separate groups noticably complaining with raised voices about issues. There were several staff members at reception seeming to be doing nothing. I went to hotel phone to ring again & booked room as it hadn't gone through on website when it crashed. Was offered non-smoking room. 30 mins later (the line took that long) we were told there were only smoking rooms left. After saying this was not satisfactory & would we be charged if we cancelled, the guy offered to have a word to his manager to see if they could shuffle some things around. He came back offering us for an extra $75 we could have a non smoking suite. We did not want to pay the extra - and as was told the rooms are cleaned very well, and we may not smell smoke, took the room. It STANK. We rang housekeeping to ask if they could bring up air freshener spray. They wrongly sent up maintenance who thought he had to adjust the shower spray.. Luckily he was lovely (Ralph).. and rang housekeeping to tell them to bring a machine up which would clear the smell if we left room for an hour. When we returned the smoking smell had been neutralised. However it stank again in the morning - as did the hallway. The room was tired.. The bathroom was tiny (literally only a bath/shower & toilet & space about the size of the toilet to stand in).. Room rate was $130.. we'd have been better finding a motel off the strip. The hotel is looking tired and dated, and staff were surprisingly unhelpful and frazzled compared to even small busy motels we stayed in on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “trip report May 21st to 25th”
Reviews.Author: pam1h
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights, about a 30 minute wait to check-in but after being offered an up-grade for 15.00 a night, which I took my room was not ready, that was ok I was early for check-in however 8 hours later they finally found a room for me. They did apologize and told me they wouldn't charge me the upgrade fee. The room they gave me was a spa king it was small but clean. on check out I did see they did not take the upgrade charge off my bill. Had to go down stairs to check out and see about the bill. I did debate on going ahead and paying the upgrade charge because in the end I did get my King Smoking Room. They changed a non-smoking to a smoking room. But I thought no, If you say you not going to charge me then don't charge me. Buffet was good for breakfast. Not so great for dinner. Overall nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trying somewhere new next time!”
Reviews.Author: shilee3
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay at a different hotel this time, because last time the desk Manager was such a jerk and our key didn't work 3 times in a row, but after finding the room for 45$ per night on a different web site, for this room I called and asked for a price match. The first person that I got on the phone said that they couldn't match it for those dates, so I called back 5 minutes later and they matched it no problem. I don't know what it is about the Strat. but last time I got a great deal too and it seems that they give you the worst rooms that they can find because you got such a good deal. Last year 3 times i had to get a room change because my key didn't work, then this time they gave me a room that hadn't been cleaned at all and the sink had been backed up, and it must have got all over the floor because the floor was wet. There was some brown marked cloth on the sink and from what it smelled like, I wasen't about to find out what it was. Anyhow, with hesitation, the housekeeper said they fixed the sink and everything wil be cleaned. I thought I would try it, but in the middle of the night the sink must have backed up some because there was sink scum half way up the sink. Anyway they moved us to a much better room to my suprise. We really liked the Strat last time thats why we tried it again, next time I will try another spot.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: marivi90804
Reviews.Content: My sister was married over the weekend of April 28. We stayed at the Stratosphere for three nights. I have to confess that I was very hesitant about staying there after reading the reviews. My husband and I had just spent a few days in Vegas, staying at the Signature, which is perfect in our eyes. Ultimately, what convinced me to stay there was that it was close to the chapel where the wedding was held. I had reserved two rooms for our family. We checked in on Thursday, April 26 around dinner time. The process was smooth -- no lines, no confusion about the rooms with the clerk being attentive and polite. The rooms were nothing to rave about. Just a standard hotel room but it was clean. We rented a cabana at the pool for one of the days and found the attendents to be very helpful. We needed extra pillows and housekeeping responded promptly. We did eat in their cafeteria which at best serves an adequate but average meal. Overall, we had a pleasant stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: someday1
Reviews.Content: I would have given this Hotel a higher rating if it wasn't for the terrible that we had checking in. After traveling 9 hours we had to wait in a very long line. After all the wiating we found only that the staff was very rude! We asked how to get to our room, and he said "look at the signs" It was very easy for him to have just told us to turn right and then left instead of having us walking all over the place. they have a few fees which they do not tell you are going to be put on your CC when you arrive. when you call in person and pay the first night they do not subtract it from the balancce. So we had that fee, plus a $250.00 Incidental Fee, which we were not told about. I knew about the resort fee so I was ready for that one. We had to retrieve another CC because the one I was using did not have a high enough balance on it to put a hold on the room. We called personally and I feel that we should have been told about this 250.00 fee. So I had to get another CC from a purse that was with the bellman. After using the correct CC, the Clerk was still very rude. He was not helpful and did not answer any of out questions. Once we got to our rom which was absolutely beautiful It was the Grand Suite very happy with this room and the price except for one thing. when I called to reserve this room I specifically asked for a smoking room, I booked this room in Early March not last minute. Whe we arrived and got comfy, I realized there were no ashtrays, so I called the Front desk, and was told that it was not a smoking room and they apoloigized. Well we were staying for 5 days and did not want to pay for something we did not request. So I asked if we could be moved to the room that I had been told I was getting when I called to confirm just one week before my arrival. I was told that I would be called the minute that another Smoking suite was available. This was @ 11PM So we knew it would not be until the next day. a minute later they called up to our room and said it would be impossible to switch us because all of the"Grand Suite smoking rooms were going to be renovated the next day! I spoke with the manager, who was no help at all. He said I was not guaranteed what I asked for even though when I confirmed a few days before i was told I was getting what i requested. He told me I could not smoke, but what I did in the room was my business but he woulod not send up ash trays. needlesss to say I went to sleep being very upset about the Whole check in experience, and was afraid that the rest of our stay would be the same. the next morning I called down to the front desk to see if they were going to change our room. The Day time Desk clerk said that there was no reason to move. Becaue the suites were big enough to filter the smoke and it could be smoking or non smoking and she would send an ash tray right up!! What a difference a day makes. I cannot understand why the night desk clerk was such a jerk and she was so nice. but the problem was resolved. Our room was beautiful, we had a view of the mountains and the strip, the price for this suite was lower than a double when we bbooked it! The food at the Stratrosphrere is great in every restaurant great choice of restaurants. great gaming area, lots to chose from. I've heard that this Hotel is in a bad area. I did not see what was so bad about it. We had a car, so maybe that was the key we got to the other end of the strip by going down the back street, and there was nothing to be afraid of as far as I could see. and we traveled this road at all times of the day. I think that the Stratosphere is a very nice place, I would stay there again.....no doubt. Only thing I would recommend is to rent a car. but this goes for no matter where you stay. Cabs are expensive, and the busses take forever and the tram only picks up on one side of the strip in 99 degree weather, who wants to stand in the HOT sun!! As I said I would have rated this Hotel 5 stars if it wasn't for the hassle we went through at the desk and in our room. Maybe the stratosphere needs to train their staff on how to be more customer oriented. I would recommend this hotel, if you don't mind not being in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stratosphere!!”
Reviews.Author: VivaLV1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from May 9-12 for her 21st birthday. We had a blast once we settled into our room which we upgraded to a suite. This is a wonderful hotel and I do not understand the bad reviews. It was clean, the hotel staff was pleasant and the restaurants were great. The only problem was at Lucky's where we waited a long time for service but it was 2:00 a.m. and very busy for that early in the morning. They probably didn't expect that big of a crowd and wasn't prepared for it. I would advise that if you stay here be prepared as the deuce bus doesn't always pick you up at night heading north on the strip. My daughter and I walked one night from Mandalay Bay back to the Flamingo before we finally took a cab because we could not get a bus to pick us up. It wasn't the first time we had a long walk because of it. The next time I will rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: VSParra
Reviews.Content: The overall stay at the Stratosphere was pretty good. All of our friends and family were there and the location was never an issue (it was close to downtown and the freeway that took us into Henderson). I did have a few big probelms, though: 1. Check-in on Friday sucked. I got there at 3pm and my room wasn't ready. The guy pointed me to the wrong line to pick up my room key (an hour later), so I wasted time standing in it. Eventually they got me a room, but it was a long wait. There were a lot of people way more angry than me, though, so an hour must not have been too bad by comparison. 2. The pool was FREEZING. Like, painfully cold. Even my kids who will usually go in any kind of water wouldn't stay in it. 3. Someone decided to jump off the tower in the middle of our stay and the response from the hotel was atrocious. You'd think they'd have a communication and business recovery plan already in place, but nothing was done. No message to guests about what happened or how we would be inconvenienced because of it, no statement, no nothing. It could have been handled SO much better. As it was, they had to close down several tables and the service that night was absolutely terrible. I don't blame them for the tragedy itself, they're not responsible for that - but they do have a responsibility to respond and communicate to their patrons. It would have saved them a lot of face, too - you couldn't believe the different rumors I heard from different guests and staff alike. I will probably stay at the Sahara next time - the rates are just as cheap and it's practically the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: weddingmay2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas for our wedding. We stayed at the stratosphere because it seemed very economical and close to the chapel we were getting married at. We had a large group go down with us to Vegas, we had about 10 hotel rooms all together. My brothers and my in laws were both placed in rooms where the toilets did not flush and the sinks backed up. When my mother in law went to switch rooms they told her she would have to pay an extra $15 a day because they were moving her to a room with a view! We at Luckys cafe and my husband had a big chunk of a broken dish in his food. And the icing on top of the cake - after we were out partying for a night, we come home and crawl into our freshly made bed and fall asleep. We wake up in the morning to find - OLD RED NASTY stains all over our sheets and blanket! Neither one of us were bleeding! We asked for all of bedding to redone, it took hours for them to come and change the sheets. When we came back to our hotel room that night we pulled all of the covers off to inspect and what do you know??? Red stains still all over our blanket. Not once was anything done to make us feel like our stay was apperciated. As much money as we dumped into this hotel and casino, not once did we have a hotel manager apologize. The only pleasant experience we had was our lunch at the top of the world resteraunt. I would never stay there again, it is worth the money to stay somewhere else. DO NOT be fooled by the low prices. You really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: Randasue
Reviews.Content: We just returned from vegas had a great time but when we got to the hotel we asked for a King Bed but got 2 doubles so better make sure you specify what you want when you make a reservation. Rhonda J. Mount vernon Wash.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ruemonge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stratosphere recently and is pleased with the experience. Though checking in took quite a while and the casino is rather smokey, the room we got is spacious enough with a great view. The queen size twin beds are comfortable and the bathroom is clean but the pool/gym is quite a long walk away. Hotel guest gets free access to the Stratosphere tower from 10am to 2pm and there is a Starbucks up there offering a sip with excellent view which is pretty cool. The fun rides on the tower are very thrilling and the staff was nice enough to offer us a free ride on one of the rides when we encountered some ticketing issues. Location wise, travelling to the strip was not a problem as we drove and parking at the hotel is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for $50/night”
Reviews.Author: PrincessArlene
Reviews.Content: For $50/night could not go wrong. Rooms little dated, but spotless clean. Beds surprisingly comfortable with good pillows. Water pressure in showers very good, good towels, cheap little soaps OK for hands. Parking at north parking for World Tower II is a must - right next to the car (no weaving in and out of casino). BEWARE: air conditioning units in World Tower II is like sleeping beside airplane jet; if you shut the a/c off, you hear the next door neighbour snoring! (as stated, thin walls) and you suffocate from the heat. BEWARE: do NOT get a room right next to the elevator as you can hear the motor 24 hrs. a day. Recommend: earplugs unless you sleep like my husband (nothing bothers him)

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: cchambers97
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute inexpensive choice for myself and some friends, this was NBA All Star weekend so every hotel was outrageously priced. Overall the rooms were very well kept to be a low priced; We really werent in the room much but from what we did experience the showers were not great at all (could have been from so many taking showers at once) the beds to be queens were quite small. If you are going to Vegas and looking for something inexpensive this is great hotel. Even though it sits at the end of the strip this hotel has its own entertainment i.e. rides and inside shopping. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Strat”
Reviews.Author: mlukeman
Reviews.Content: I know there has been a lot written about the Stratosphere (distance from the strip, room quality etc) so I thought it might be worth adding my experience. We stayed at the Strat between 9th and 17th April '07. We're a mid-twenties couple from the UK who had never visited Vegas before... And we loved the Strat. The wait to check in was about half an hour (but we saw similar sized lines whilst wandering the major hotels on the strip (Paris and MGM to name two). Our room wasn't ready, so we checked our bags at the Bell Hop stand and had a great cocktail at the C bar until then. The C Bar is a great place to chill out and soak up the atmosphere, it plays great music and the service was always swift and helpful. When getting our room keys the Reception staff were courteous and pleasant, although a little harried (basically better than your average British service!). We were seen straight away by being ushered to the VIP checkin line on our second attempt. Our room was on 22nd Floor of the Premier Tower, and it was very large, with a great view (which we requested at checkin - no 'bribes' required). The bathroom was large and the 'Tower' shaped shower gels and shampoos were a nice touch. Everything was clean and well cared for. The bed very large and comfortable. The walls were thin (thank you weird 'whopping' gang of men in the room next door at 4am) but we only experienced this issue on one occasion, most people didn't seem to be shouting in the corridors. The Casino itself, whilst being less flashy than the main strip hotels, had a massive amount of waitresses who were always circling taking cocktail orders (we were at the Bellagio and MGM for an hour gambling in each one and never saw one waitress). The atmosphere in the casino reminded me of a british pub - it's loud, but incredibly friendly and not overwhelming (in fact it's where we did the vast majority of our gambling). We also found that we tended to win more at this casino (not sure if we were lucky or if the other hotel's slots are less loose!). The Band that plays Thursday through Sunday is basically a Cabaret show, but they sing well and will entertain for an hour max. The 'Bite' show is definitely worth a look, it's pretty amusing, although I'm not sure it intends to be. Basically if you like women pretending to be sexy vampires whilst dancing to 80's Soft rock you're in for a treat!! PollyEsthers, the Strat's new club is hilarious, although wear really flat shoes if you plan to go (there's only seats in the VIP areas). Each room is fabulously decorated in either 70's, 80's. 90's or 00's style (we're talking full models of Deloreans and Hummers on display). The flashing dancefloor in the 70's room is also pretty cool. It gets crowded, so we wished we'd arrived earlier, rather than stumbled in at midnight. The Strat is quite far from the main strip, but the Deuce is frequent, cheap ($5 for a 24 hour pass), but slow due to the traffic. The plus point is that, when you get on the Deuce you usually find a seat and then get to sit back and watch the world go by in air conditioned comfort. I preferred the Deuce to the Monorail, which is a bit of a rip off at $5 one way - but if you're in a hurry it's much quicker, go through the Sahara, rather than around it - we made that mistake and walked for about 2 miles before reaching the station (D'oh). I found it relaxing to travel back from the strip at night, it's like being on your own London Tour bus, and it gives you precious minutes to recouperate before hitting the bars in in the hotel. The restaurant at the top of the tower is fantastic. You may choose to get ripped of by the Photographer lady ($70 for two full size photos and 2 wallet sized ones - phew) but she is very talented and compliments you throughout so you feel a bit fab! The meal was excellent, although I felt the service was a little slow and wasn't on par with the other restaurants in the hotel. But then, who really worries about service with Vegas spread at your feet? The view was breathtaking and worth each cent we spent there. The other restaurants were great too, particularly Mr. Lucky's where you order, you are brought your food and then you are left to your own devices without being asked if you're ok every five minutes. Best coffee I have ever tasted! I think that's about it, hopefully this will reassure some people who worried (as I did) what they had let themselves in for by reading some of the less positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!! I would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: millerjcat
Reviews.Content: Compared to the rest of the hotels on the Strip, the Stratosphere offered rooms at a fraction of the price. I was pleasantly surprised upon arriving, the rooms are very comfortable and better than I expected. I guess the reason for the low price its that you are at the very north end of the strip and have to cross the street, but it wasn't a big deal at all. There is a double-decker bus that runs up and down the strip all day, including a stop in front of the Stratosphere. If you don't have a car, it will fill all your needs.
